name: Sunny Bunk Room with balcony - steps to Wrigley!
summary: Our 230 SqFt Bullpen Terrace Suite features a private 100 SqFt walk-out terrace where you can hear sounds of the vibrant Wrigley neighborhood, along with bespoke millwork and local art to add brightness to your stay. Get cozy in our plush queen bed and twin bunk bed outfitted with crisp white sheets and feel refreshed with our custom-tiled bathrooms complete with contemporary finishes.

Whether you’re in town for a baseball game or looking to explore the city on a more local level, let our luxe accommodations, unexpected surprises, attentive service, and delightful design be the backdrop to your Windy City stay.

host_about: Welcome to the Wheelhouse Hotel. Rooted in history, with an eye towards the future and an ever present atmosphere of playful celebration, our spunky hotel brings intimate, unpretentious, luxury lodging to Chicago’s spirited Wrigleyville neighborhood. Just steps away from all the action yet miles away from ordinary, you’ll have a front row seat to a hyper-local experience.

name: The heart of Logan Square! Entire Apartment
summary: Thank you for visiting my listing! I am leasing my spare room with private bathroom. The room is large with great light and aesthetic. Also included is access to a fully equipped office across the hall from the bedroom that should satisfy any business needs while in town. You are welcome to make yourself at home and utilize any of the common areas (living room, kitchen, deck, etc.). I am generally out and about and stay out of the way when people are visiting. Hope to see you soon!
space: Thank you for checking out this beautiful, recently renovated condo in the heart of Logan Square! Logan Square has a unique, creative culture with endless entertainment options. The aesthetic is clean and contemporary, with all of the amenities to ensure a comfortable stay. Open floor plan with 12' ceiling, large kitchen with commercial range, plenty of living and dining space with various technology accommodations, office several workstations, monitors and printer. There is also a great outdoor deck! The condo is (2) bedrooms, (2) bathrooms and an office. Please note, while the listing is to rent the space exclusively, I do not provide access to the master bedroom and bathroom since I do keep personal belongings in that space. The room that you will be staying in has a full size bed, dresser, lounge chair, and a large closet. neighborhood_overview: A quick search will show you that Logan Square is the hottest neighborhood in Chicago, home to the latest restaurants, boutiques, galleries, venues, bars, etc. Logan Square will ensure that your Chicago experience is unique.
notes: I live close to the train (half block away), which means you may be able to hear it running throughout the night. The rooms are set back from the street, so it is not a major concern.
transit: I live one block away from the California blue line stop, which is a direct route to downtown and other great neighborhoods along the way. It is also easy to access from O'Hare airport. This is the recommended way to travel, but you can also take the bus, bikes, or cabs.
access: Guests are welcome to use anything in the common areas, including the office, kitchen, living room, dining room and deck.
interaction: I will likely be around while you are in town and available to show you around if you would like. Alternatively, I leave keys in a lock box for access when I am not available. That being said, check-in time is very flexible.
house_rules: Be respectful and keep the space clean. I request you do not have any visitors other than those included on the booking.
host_about: Hey all! My name is Patrick, I work in the design and construction industry. I love creating new spaces, building (or deconstructing) things, being active, designing, coming up with new ideas (good or bad), family/friends, and so on and so forth. (Hidden by Airbnb) : @p_wils

Lots of parking and is FREE!!
space: The space is very large and has a lot of possibilities for privacy. The Airbnb co host lives one floor above you.

name: Unique & Spacious Corner Studio Loft
summary: Our place is close to Magnificent Mile, Water Tower Place, John Hancock Center, The Signature Room at the 95th, and The Signature Lounge at the 96th. You’ll love my place because of the location, the ambiance. My place is good for couples, families (with kids), and big groups.
space: For those who are as prolific off the court as they are on it, we present, our Corner Studio Loft Apartments, AKA The Chamberlain.  The suite (550 square feet) offers a Queen-size bed in a private sleeping nook and 3-Full-size beds betwixt a custom crafted elevated loft, all with plush mattresses and luxurious linens. These suites feature a clever+functional kitchen, sofa, dining table, oak flooring, a desk area and a modern private bathroom with a walk-in shower and deluxe fittings. Additional amenities include a large flat screen television with cable TV channels, custom furniture, original art, in-room safe, complimentary eco-friendly bath products, and free high-speed WiFi.

neighborhood_overview: Public Transportation: We’re about two blocks from the Chicago stop of the Brown Line.  It goes from the Loop to Albany Park.  It’s your go-to train to for getting you downtown fast.  But know that it does FieldHouse Jones is located in the River North neighborhood of Chicago.  Geographically speaking, it’s the area just north of the Chicago River, hence the name.  It’s home to most of Chicago’s heavy hitters like Magnificent Mile, Navy Pier, the John Hancock Building, Merchandise Mart, and the Museum of Contemporary Art to name a few.  Anyone that has come to Chicago to see its main tourist attractions has definitely come through this part of town.  But don’t let the high concentration of tourist destinations fool you.  With an incredible art scene, boisterous nightlife, and some of the most accoladed restaurants, River North has plenty of appeal for tourists and locals alike.
notes: At check-in, guests will be asked to put down a credit card for incidentals.  The card will only be charged in the case of damage to the property.
transit: Public Transportation: We’re about two blocks from the Chicago stop of the Brown Line.  It goes from the Loop to Albany Park.  It’s your go-to train to for getting you downtown fast.  But know that it does not run from 1am to 5am.  The Red Line is about four blocks away and basically runs up and down Lake Michigan.  Also, unlike, the Brown Line, it runs all the time. Parking: FieldHouse Jones has an on-site lot.  Spaces are available to guests for $25/car/night.  An advance reservation for one is advised as the number of spaces is finite.
access: The apartment is technically a suite located inside of a River North hotel called FieldHouse Jones.  As a guest of the hotel, guests of this listing will enjoy access to hotel amenities like 24/7 frontdesk and security, daily housekeeping, guest kitchen, lounge and washer & dryer.  The hotel also has a cafe and restaurant as well as two full-size slot car tracks which guests have access to. Reserved parking is available in our adjacent surface lot.  The rate for guests that book a room through Airbnb is $30/car/night.
interaction: Our frontdesk is staffed 24-hours a day to assist any of your needs at any time.  Additional, we offer guests daily housekeeping.
house_rules: Must be 21 years or older to book. At check-in, guests will be asked to provide a valid photo ID as well as a working credit card that will only be charged in case of damaged property.
host_about: FieldHouse Jones is a boutique hotel located in the River North neighborhood of Chicago.

name: Coach House in Lincoln Park near Diversey Station!
summary: Unwind and enjoy the city in our Cozy and Clean Guest Suite!  We're new hosts on Airbnb and super excited to begin having guests stay at our recently furnished guest space.  We live in the main, separable part of the property and are excited for you to use our space as a home base for which to decompress or explore the city!
space: Enjoy this cozy, recently decorated unit in the heart of Lincoln Park close to everything the area has to offer! It is located steps away from the entertaining/bustling Halsted Street with many shops, restaurants, bars and nightlife. While visiting, catch a ball game at Wrigley Field or visit Lakeview, both in walking distance. While in Lincoln Park, make sure to check out the Lincoln Park Zoo,  the beach, DePaul University and the many sights that the neighborhood has to offer! The nearby public transit makes it easy to explore the wonderful city of Chicago. It's a 5 minute walk to the Brown/Purple line (Diversey) and 10 minute walk to the Red line (Fullerton). A small kitchenette area is provided with a microwave and refrigerator to aid in food preparation. There is two full closets with hangers to store luggage and clothes as needed.

neighborhood_overview: WELCOME TO THE CITY THAT FEELS LIKE HOME! Chicago is a city unlike any other. We’ve got the architectural marvels, world-class museums, dynamic entertainment, and award-winning dining scene you’d expect from one of the world’s greatest cities. But we’re more than just another big city — our welcoming residents, inclusive neighborhoods, and Midwestern soul truly make Chicago the city that feels like home. We are happy to help provide more information about our neighborhood! Just drop us a quick note :)
notes: We live on the property and do our best to keep noise at a minimum, but you may hear some noise from time to time. We abide by the moderate cancellation policy for Airbnb. Unfortunately, we do not allow pets.
transit: Please feel free to reach out if you need some transportation tips or resources!
access: Access is available to the entire apartment.
interaction: We live in the main space of the property and respect your privacy. Should you have any questions, we are available to answer them! Please message us through Airbnb first.
host_about:
Stay where it counts. When you book a Loftium, you're contributing to the local community. Each Loftium is home to a local resident who hosts and lives right on-site, making sure your experience is a delightful one. All spaces are designed with your comfort in mind! We've made check-in and communication a breeze, and each home provides a beautiful and cozy place to rest your head during your travels. Every Loftium home and host is unique, and you'll always get a true neighborhood experience during your stay.

Visit a new community and book a Loftium in any of our cities: Seattle, Portland, Denver, San Diego, Phoenix, Chicago, Atlanta, Dallas, Charlotte, or Orlando. We can't wait for you to visit!

name: D4-Room Located Between Downtown Chicago & O’hare
summary: Welcome to this Vintage, safe Multicultural Neighborhood where you can find some of the Irish culture but also Polish and Eastern Europe. This is the perfect spot  conveniently located to those who go to or from O’hare Airport because the train close by is the one that takes you inside the Airport in about 25min. Also, straight Downtown Chicago in about 25min.We offer Wifi,coffee maker,microwave,iron, hair dryer,pretty much everything you might need. We have cameras in common areas and keypads!
space: You will have a full size bed in a private room! We want you feel very safe so your room is going to have its own padlock and there are cameras in common areas.  This is a private room in a shared place with other Airbnb guests and because of that we expect to keep the house  very quiet, specially after 9pm. There are free parking on the street easy to find before 5pm, plenty paid parking around the house.  *I only accept payments through Airbnb platform*

neighborhood_overview: This place is conveniently located becase it’s between O’hare Airport and Downtown Chicago and we use the blue line train which is close to the house (7 min by walk or 2 min by bus) that will take you straightforwardly both places ! We have a Home Dpt Store just 1 block away and a Family D in case you need to buy any emergency cloth or amenities or food!
notes: The room is private but you will share common areas ( kitchen , living room, and the bathroom/s) with other Airbnb guests. Usually none of this get crowd because most of Airbnb guests are most of the time outside the house knowing the city, in concerts, interviews, etc, and they don’t spend much time in the house. A private small apartment in the area usually cost over 120$ p/night plus taxes and fees which is in total almost 200$ p/night ! If you want save some money and being conveniently located, surrounding great public transportation and with free street parking this could be a great option for you!  This room is downstairs in the basement. The room has one full size bed. If you want to add 3 or 4 guests in the reservation I could add 1 extra air mattress with no extra fee if the reservation is set for 3. If the reservation is for 2 and you’d like to have an extra air mattress we charge $15p/night and we provide air mattress and linens for it. The room will become smaller for lugg
transit: There are few free street parking by kimball usually easy to find before 5pm. 152 bus is just 1/2 block away. Addison Blue Line is 8min walk or 5min by bus. 82 bus is 1 block away. . McCormick Place is 20min far by car/Uber . United Center is 17 min far by car. Illinois Medical District is 17min by car. Grant Park is 21min by car/35min by public transportation. The Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium and the Planetarium is 23min far by car. Private Uber / Lyft or Via are around 20$ to those places!
access: You can use the kitchen (please turn on the kitchen fan once you use it), oven, pan, pots, plates, coffee maker, etc! You can use living room, hair dryer, iron. You will have WiFi, clean towels (1 p/p) , sheets, comforter, Shampoo (2in1), hand’s soap, body’s soap, toilet paper.
interaction: If you text Alejandra she will be there for you most of the time she is going to give you quick responses! If you are a tourist she will love to share some places you can’t miss!
house_rules: 1. Prohibited: Video Shooting, bring people that is not in the reservation, Small gatherings, family reunions, birthdays parties or any kind of celebrations.  2. No smoke inside the house or building (any kind)  3. Respect other Airbnb guests, belongings, food and other rooms. 4. Be quiet in the house and in the building specially after 9pm.  5. Checkout from your room is by 10am and our checkout is firm becase our team schedule. Checkout from your room after this time will end in extra 30$. Checkout after 11am will end in extra 60$. Checkout after 12pm will end in an open  file in airbnb plus 60$ fee (2 hours paid for management team) and your belongings would have to be removed since another guest will be checking in. 6. If you use the kitchen, microwave, oven, plates, pans, pots, glasses, cups, kitchen table, living room table, coffee maker, fridge, etc.. you have to leave it clean 7. name: A hidden gem with free parking
summary: Tucked away in the back of our house, this cozy and relaxed apartment provides a peaceful stay for all. There is a queen-sized bed paired with a twin bed, along with a smart-TV. Also, we provide a small fridge, toaster, microwave, traditional coffeemaker, and dinner utensils for two. The apartment has a private entry and exit, so the area will be completely unbothered for guests. The apartment is located with a friendly neighborhood , 6 miles southwest from downtown. 15 minutes to MDW Airport.
space: Despite it being a small space, our apartment is big enough for two people. Pharmacies, grocery stores, restaurants, and bakeries are all within two blocks away. If you're driving, free parking on property is provided , so no worrying about parking on the streets.

neighborhood_overview: A family oriented neighborhood, a park is just down the street for kids, and you can walk and find basically anything you like blocks away.
transit: One block away is the bus stop, which would take you all the way to downtown Chicago. Six blocks away is the train station, and Uber and Lyfts are available everywhere for quicker transportation.

interaction: I'm a phone call away, so I'd prefer to be in contact through phone. Usually, I'm on the road driving, so texting/emailing is difficult. But I'm always free to respond to phone calls.
house_rules: Smoking of any kind is not allowed in our apartment. No party allowed,  If you drink, please drink responsibly. Only the people who reserved are allowed here, no outside visitors can be in the apartment, please. If you use the utensils or dishes, it'd be nice if you could clean them before you go. When checking out  please inform me in a message when you've left.
host_about: I'm originally from Mexico,  have been living in Chicago half of my life. I love my family. Love to go to my son's soccer games. We all love movies . We love Chicago. " Enjoy  the present".

name: Cozy 1-bed unit between O'hare & Dowtown Chicago
summary: Welcome to Chicago (the Windy City)! A cozy 1-bedroom apartment in Portage Park is great for both leisure and business travelers. It is conveniently located between O'hare airport and downtown (25 minutes each in Uber/taxi). Also the neighborhood is very safe and quiet, the bus stops are very near (5 minutes walk) and the near blue line stop is (10 minutes in bus)
space: It is an entire 1 bedroom apartment with a double bed and a small closet space, a living room with a sofa bed for another guest, a TV with Netflix and Roku to watch tv series, movies and the news, also a desk with chair if you need to read or work, while you are not enjoying the city.  The kitchen is alongside the living room with all you need to make breakfast or cook your favorite dishes and a nice and neat bathroom. Also we have a laundry room with coin machines and other common spaces: corridor, balcony, and backyard. Wifi internet connection available.
description: Welcome to Chicago (the Windy City)! A cozy 1-bedroom apartment in Portage Park is great for both leisure and business travelers. It is conveniently located between O'hare airport and downtown (25 minutes each in Uber/taxi). Also the neighborhood is very safe and quiet, the bus stops are very near (5 minutes walk) and the near blue line stop is (10 minutes in bus) It is an entire 1 bedroom apartment with a double bed and a small closet space, a living room with a sofa bed for another guest, a TV with Netflix and Roku to watch tv series, movies and the news, also a desk with chair if you need to read or work, while you are not enjoying the city.  The kitchen is alongside the living room with all you need to make breakfast or cook your favorite dishes and a nice and neat bathroom. Also we have a laundry room with coin machines and other common spaces: corridor, balcony, and backyard. Wifi internet connection available. You can get access to all that is described in the listing and also t
neighborhood_overview: The area is notable for its Six Corners outdoor shopping district, centered at the intersection of Irving Park Road, Cicero Avenue and the diagonal Milwaukee Avenue, the Portage Theater and for its namesake - Portage Park.
transit: Besides the park which is located a couple blocks from the house, you'll also find celebrated bakeries, flower shops and clothing boutiques in the area's three shopping districts, including a bustling European-inspired retail corridor on Six Corners. While Portage Park is primarily a residential neighborhood, the area still boasts a few must-see attractions, like the elegantly restored Portage Theater and The Patio. The Portage Theater is home to a fully-developed performing arts center that specializes in underground and silent films. Similarly, The Patio is another stylish restorations project, but this theater shows first-run movies. If you come in a car or rent one, you will find plenty of spaces to park around the house, the neighborhood is safe and residential.
access: You can get access to all that is described in the listing and also to the common areas: laundry room, hallway, stairs, and backyard.

If you need it another day you have to tell me first, so I can coordinate with the other guests. -PETS: are not allowed. -COMMON SPACES: use them freely, but don't block any door, corridor, or stairs. -NOISE: Please don't make noises or watch TV or listen music out loud, consider that there are other people who live in the building and they need to rest or work. -ILLEGAL ACTIVITIES: don't be involved in any illegal activity anywhere of the property.

name: Traveler's Dream - 1 bed in a shared bedroom
summary: Join us at Freehand Chicago Hotel for your travels in Chicago. Perfect for travelers here too long for a traditional hotel or for just 1 night. This listing is for one bunk for one person in a shared mixed/co-ed room with 4 bunks (up to 3 roommates). We have many options such as private standard rooms and private quad rooms. Please send us a message with any questions. $2 nightly resort fee plus tax paid at the property For long term stays, guests must move rooms about every 30 days.
space: Somewhere between a hostel and hotel, you'll find the amenities you need to get through anywhere from a week to a few months. This listing is for one twin bunk in a shared room with four total bunks, so you would have up to 3 roommates. The room has a private bathroom and lockers for storing valuables. Each bunk features a curtain for privacy, reading lamp, and power outlet. Linens and towels are included, as is regular housekeeping service. For the lockers, guests are welcome to use their own locks or the front desk sells combination padlocks for $5.  Please ask the front desk if you need complimentary extra towels, blankets, or toiletries.

neighborhood_overview: The Freehand Chicago is near the corner of Ohio and State st. It is downtown in the heart of River North, 1 block from the Magnificent Mile, 1 block across the River from The Loop, and a quick walk, bus, train, or taxi to anywhere you need to go.  We are also conveniently located across the street from Jewel, a major grocery store chain.
notes: To check-in, the hotel requires guests must be 18 or older with a government-issued photo ID. Your room and tax will be prepaid through Airbnb, but the hotel requires a $50 deposit for incidentals on a card at check-in per room, per stay. We do not accept gift cards, prepaid cards, or cash for incidentals. The deposit will be released back to your card at checkout provided you do not charge anything to your room. It takes most banks 3-7 business days to process the release. $2 nightly resort fee plus tax paid at the property For long term stays, guests must move rooms about every 30 days.
transit: The hotel offers parking to guests for $39 / night with free in and out privileges at a garage 1 block south of the hotel called The Grand Plaza. The address of the entrance is 18 W Grand Ave. If you park there, please just stop at the front desk for an exit ticket any time you'd like to take the car out.
access: You will have access to all public spaces and amenities at the hotel including the Broken Shaker cocktail bar. Coin-operated and valet laundry are available.
interaction: Our front desk is staffed 24-hours per day for check-in, check-out, and to assist you with other requests.
house_rules: Chicago residents are not allowed to reserve or stay in shared rooms.  If you are a Chicago resident, feel free to book one of our private room listings.
host_about:
Freehand Chicago is housed in a 1927 building in Chicago’s vibrant River North neighborhood – home to some of the city’s best art galleries, boutiques and restaurants.

Freehand is a collection of hotels that combine the social culture of a hostel with innovative design, award-winning food and beverage, and a community-driven atmosphere. Each Freehand takes its cues from the surrounding neighborhood, with spaces that are a microcosm of the best each city has to offer.

name: Warm Cozy Guest Suite, Private Bath
summary: This cozy guest room is 1 of 3 bedrooms in a rehabbed condo, in the  historic, culturally rich Bronzeville/Hyde Park community.  Enjoy a gourmet kitchen, fabulous art collection, gas fireplace and 2 outdoor spaces. Near 5 major transportation lines.
space: Charming, unique, cool,  fun, cozy, vintage, eclectic, and  warm,  are terms that have been used to describe YOUR "home away from home".   Weather you're an artist here for a show, a tourist, a professional on a temporary assignment, a graduate student, or just wanting to explore Chicago, this is the perfect  centrally located, affordable space for you.  This 2200 sq ft, 3 bedroom, 2.5 bath, rehabbed CONDO in the historic Bronzeville/Hyde Park community is the perfect spot for all adult travelers.   My home includes:  two outdoor spaces, a cozy living room with gas fireplace, a sun-drenched den off the living room, in unit laundry room, separate dining room, and a modern gourmet kitchen with stainless steel appliances, granite counter tops, and   counter stools. Your private guest suite is a beautifully decorated light filled bedroom with private bath, ample clothing space and artwork by locally renowned artists.  The private bath includes a relaxing whirlpool tub, and shower. All towe

neighborhood_overview: The city of Chicago is comprised of 77 "official" communities.  Bronzeville is the name given to a collection of communities located within the boundaries of the restrictive covenants from early to mid 1900.  These communities are primarily Washington Park, Grand Blvd., Oakland, Douglas and portions of neighboring communities.  Bronzeville is a vibrant, historic, culturally rich, and exciting community, that is said to be one of the most studied communities in the country, along with Harlem.  I was born in Bronzeville, and intentionally returned here as an adult because of it's enormous legacy.
notes: Welcome to Chicago!   I love this city and I hope you will also. Your "home away from home" , is close to all the Chicago sites,  and points of interests, including: Water Tower Place Magnificent Mile John Hancock Tower Art Institute  Millennium Park  Grant Park  Museum Campus  -  (Aquarium, Planetarium, Field Museum)    Theatre District  -  (Chicago Theatre, Cadillac, Goodman, Auditorium, Oriental theatre)  Harold Washington Library 20- Minutes to Loop university locations-   Columbia College, DePaul, UIC, Roosevelt, and Northwestern Interstate Highways:  I-55, and I-90/94 5-minutes away or less I-290 less than 10-minutes away  Lake Shore Drive 5-minutes away Airports:  Midway Airport 20-25 minutes away depending on traffic  O’Hare Airport 40-50 minutes away depending on traffic Local entertainment and dinning experiences to explore during you visit to  the Historic Bronzeville community: Harold Washington Cultural Center Theatre, concerts, Jazz  4701 S. King Drive  Room 43 - Jazz  10
transit: Transportation is easy and inexpensive: - DIVY bike share station 3 blocks away. - #3 King Drive Bus will take you downtown in 20 minutes, and McCormick Place in about 15 minutes.  - 55th st Train Stop by Red/Green line  will get you downtown in 20 minutes - #29 State Street Bus will take you to IIT, Chinatown, the Loop and Navy Pier in 15-45 minutes, depending on traffic. - Zip Car and I-Go Car Sharing locations nearby.
access: My goal is to make your stay in my home GREAT !! You are welcomed to enjoy the common areas of during your stay, including the gourmet kitchen, in unit laundry, sun filled den, extensive  book and music collections, front balcony, and rear deck.  Just be sure to clean up after yourself in the common areas.  I'm happy to answer any questions you have about restaurants, entertainment, art and culture, or anything else you need.  As I work from home, I am generally very accessible.   While you are here, you can.......... - Use all glasses, dinnerware cookware and appliances  as you dine in the fully equipped gourmet kitchen with stainless steel appliances, granite island and counter tops, and  three modern counter stools.  -Relax in the art-filled living room and sun drenched den in the front of the home.  There's a gas fireplace for chilly nights.    -Enjoy coffee, a snack , supper, or your favorite beverages on either of TWO outdoor spaces: a rear veranda (that's what we call it in the
interaction: I've been lovingly called "miss hospitality", so I truly want you to enjoy my home while you are here. I love my space and this exciting community, so I am happy to interact with you and do what I can to insure you have a PHENOMENAL experience, while  at the same time respecting your privacy.
house_rules: Here are a few house rules to insure an enjoyable stay: RELAX,  AND COME PREPARED TO ENJOY THIS FABULOUS CITY !! Check-in/out is flexible based on mutually agreed upon times. I will try my best to accommodate last minute scheduling changes, but communication is essential. Guests receive a set of keys upon arrival, to be returned upon departure.  A  $25.00 REPLACEMENT FEE WILL BE CHARGED for non-compliance with this request.   A $60.00 cleaning fee per 2-7 day stay will be charged. Cleaning fees for stays longer than one week may be increased  based on the length of your stay. Charges will be finalized prior to booking. Lots of free street parking is available, safe and easy. One space in a gated parking lot, accessible by remote opener may be available for an additional fee based on availability. Absolutely NO SMOKING in the guest room or any where in the house. Smoking must be confined to the outdoor spaces, and is limited to legal substances only.  NO FOOD permitted in the bedrooms.
host_about:
My life motto......."to thine own self be true".......and have fun doing it !!
I'm peaceful, energetic, fun-loving, active and love to be (Website hidden by Airbnb) the summer, spring, and fall!!  I LOVE travel (usually to someplace warm), art, food, entertaining, meeting new people and lively conversation.  I'm an avid art collector, jewelry designer, and art festival "junkie", that likes to experiment in the kitchen. Jewelry design is a newly discovered passion, and I sell my work at venues around the country.

Travel is in my blood !! I'm a native Chicagoan who was raised around the world as my father was in the Air Force.  I've lived in Germany, Paris, California and Texas.  As an adult, I've traveled throughout the U.S., Canada, and the Caribbean both for work and play.  I love meeting and hosting other travelers. 

I spent many years in the corporate and non-profit arenas, and have been self-employed in some form for as long as I can remember.

name: Modern Duplex-1 mile to downtown-4BR 2BA on 2 flrs
summary: Huge 4 bed 2 bath on 2 floors. Our place is ideal for groups who want to be very close to Downtown, West Loop and River North area. These are the places to go when visiting Chicago, and we are within 9 blocks. With over 2,000 sq ft, you will have room for kids, pets, adults and still be near the best attractions of Chicago. Also conveniently located near the United Center for any sports/concert events. It’s within 2 blocks of the “L” Blue Line, city bus lines, or a trip downtown.
space: This space is spread out on 2 floors. Upstairs we have cherrywood floors throughout top floor and 10' ceilings brings in a lot of natural light. Also included is a 55" tv with a Roku stick (Netflix included) as well as an HDMI cable for easy hookup to your laptop. Downstairs is ideal for people that may want their own space to relax. The largest bedroom downstairs at over 230 sq ft is set up with 3 beds and mini fridge. This is ideal for people that want their own space with children or people who just want their own area of the condo. We lived in this condo for 10 years and floors have been resurfaced and the whole place is newly painted with a very light grey. I know when you book you will fall in love with the condo, the neighborhood and people of Chicago as we did. Its really in the heart of everything so enjoy your stay! We are at your service.

neighborhood_overview: Many in Chicago call River West the most conveniently located neighborhood in Chicago. Over the past decade the trend for top restaurants, bars, clubs, things to do has shifted from up north to within 1 mile of downtown. People like convenience and this neighborhood offers exactly that being within 1 mile from “the loop” aka downtown, River North and West Loop. As you will see from my binder at the condo I am a big fan of great restaurants and bars. This stretch on Grand Ave between Halsted and Ogden has some of the best food I have had in Chicago. The Fulton River Market restaurants/bars at 6 blocks away (West Loop) have become the go to spot for restaurateurs, wine cellars (City Winery) and nightlife. Also easily walkable is the most popular area in Chicago the River North area at 8 blocks away. You will be in the heart of the best areas in Chicago with room to spread out.
transit: Very easy access: - Uber/Lift - this is my personal favorite as these rides to Downtown, River North, West Loop and the United Center are about $6-$8 - 2 blocks away - 90/94 aka "the Kennedy/Edens" - 2 blocks away - the blue line at Chicago ave - get downtown in 5 minutes and access other popular lines (red and brown) via free transfer. See the L map in the photos which is located in the condo butler pantry. - 1 block away - the Grand Bus - this will lead you directly to Navy pier and the beach its about 10 minutes on the bus. you can also get to River North in 7 minutes on this bus. - 1 block away - Divvy bike station - bikes under $5 to enjoy your ride while transporting
access: The entire condo with private laundry room.
interaction: I will be available via text or Airn BNB whenever needed. Everything is in a binder that I have prepared for my guests. It has everything you need to fully enjoy your stay in the condo.
house_rules: House rules so you have them on hand: - Do not park in the 2 spots in the rear of the building. You will be towed at your own expense. There are 4 very good free spots that are open (on Ogden Ave) which will be sent with your itinerary. - $50 charge for lost keys - $30 flat fee for items left behind, outside the us per mailing rate to your country plus $25 - Clean your own personal clutter  - Be accurate about the amount of guests staying -$300 additional charge for urine, vomit, poop or smoking inside  - Vacuum/Sweep/Freshen extra if you bring a pet. Pets are not allowed on furniture without a blanket laid across that furniture. - Be respectful of the neighbors and keep noise level down. - Pets Count As Guests You must also acknowledge Must climb stairs - 5 steps in front of entry way. Down stairs is 1 flight of stairs.  If you damage the home, you may be charged up to $500
host_about: I have been a Chicagoland resident my whole life and a mortgage loan officer by day. My wife works as a speech pathologist. We have 2 kids and love to do things as a family like traveling, experiencing new restaurants and going to beaches/parks. Chicago has always been a great place for us, the market is massive for jobs and I love meeting new people. It’s really the perfect place for our family. I’ve been raised to treat people the exact same way I would want to be treated if not better. Every time I meet someone new I almost look at as an event and my day job offers me to meet new people on a daily basis. I love what I do as does my wife. We want to share our experience that we had downtown with you. We have set up a concierge binder that is chalked full of things to do and places to eat. It’s an amazing place to experience and we will get you to the right places with no trial and error stage. Enjoy the city, as we have for over 3 decades!

name: Beautiful Three Bedroom Apartment near Loyola
summary: Welcome to our beautiful 3 bedroom apartment just blocks from Loyola University.  Fully furnished apartment with one queen bed, two full beds, and one pull-out futon.  Amenities include full kitchen, dining room, and 2 bathrooms.  WiFi, cable, 3 televisions throughout the apartment and sunroom and back yard too! Close to public transportation, the lake, and dozens of dining options within walking distance.
space: You'll walk into the apartment's kitchen, where you'll find (among everything else you'd expect in a kitchen!) plenty of welcome materials. Just beyond is the dining room, with seating for 6, and French doors to the sun room. Along the hallway are 3 bedrooms: 1 with a Full-sized bed, and 2 with Queen-sized beds, and 2 full baths. At the end of the hallway is our living room, with decorative fireplace, large TV, and plenty of seating (including an overstuffed chair in a large, sunny bay window.)

neighborhood_overview: We are on a beautiful, quiet residential street, with tons of amenities within walking distance.  Guest can be comfortable relaxing in the home, walking around the neighborhood, or using it as a home base to jump on public transportation downtown.
transit: We are within walking distance to the Loyola Red Line station, which will take you to Wrigley Field in 15 minutes or downtown in around 20 minutes.  Ideal for anyone with a car or traveling using public transportation.
access: Guests have access to the entire first floor of the building, back yard and patio.  Entry and exit is through the back door only.
house_rules: House Rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund. 1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable. 2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee. 3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance. 4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 5.) Pets are not allowed at the property. 6.) Lockouts will result in a $150 fee per occurrence. Additionally, lost keys will incur a $50 per key fee.

name: 4B2a Cozy Night's Stay - Comfy Bedroom in Chicago
summary: Welcome! Your booking includes a private bedroom and fantastic amenities such as Smart internet TV, free Disney+, Hulu, full kitchen, free washer/dryer, fast internet & more!  FREE PRIVATE PARKING INCLUDED! Great location: Very close to CTA Blue Line Kedzie Station and various bus stops. Less than 15 minutes CTA ride to downtown via Blue Line. 7 min drive to the United Center & Rush Hospital.  Very easy to get on Freeway way I-290.

By Bus #126: Start at Jackson & Albany (The intersection of Jackson Blvd and Albany Ave is 2 min walk away) take Bus #126 heading East. Get off at M
neighborhood_overview: Quiet neighborhood very close to public transit and major venues
transit: The Kedzie-Homan blue line CTA station is within 8 min walking distance.  To go to downtown Chicago: 1. By Bus #126: Start at Jackson & Albany (The intersection of Jackson Blvd and Albany Ave is 2 min walk away) take Bus #126 heading East. Get off at Michigan & Van Buren/Congress, 32 stops away and you would be in Downtown Chicago. The trip takes about 30 minutes, door to door.  2. By Bus #7: Take bus #7 heading east at Harrison & Albany (The intersection of W Harrison Street and S Albany Avenue is 7 min away by walk). Get off at Michigan & Van Buren/Congress after 30 stops. The trip takes about 45 minutes, door to door.  3. By Blue Line CTA: walk to the Kedzie-Homan station, about 8 minutes away. Take the blue  line heading East for 6 stops and get off at LaSalle Station.
host_about:
Bill is a retired professor. He has interest and expertise in various fields of scientific research.  His hobbies include history, civilization, and geography.  Bill travel overseas often.  

We greatly appreciate the support of our guests in the past many years.  Not only we have expanded our teams, we have also increased the number of hosting facilities. We have rooms ranging from more economic models for thrift travelers to luxurious rooms for exceptional experience. With the facilities we have, the guests have a greater choices of suitable locations and budget levels.  We have also re-designed some of our facilities so the entire suite or entire floor can be rented. With the large number of guests we served each year, we rely more on self check-in, and regrettably your host may not be able to meet you in person as in the past. 

All our facilities are located very convenient and safe neighborhood.  We may not have all the bell and whistle of hotel, but in some areas we actually provides more. All our facility include a full kitchen (for light cooking only, as a courtesy to other guests), microwave, coffee maker, refrigerator, washer and dryer.  Of course, we have wifi, cable or internet-ready TV, and printer. We would like you to feel that you are staying in a functional home and can stay for an extended period of time.

Stay where it counts. When you book a Loftium, you're contributing to the local community. Visit a new community and book a Loftium in any of our cities: Seattle, Portland, Denver, San Diego, Phoenix, Chicago, Atlanta, Dallas, Charlotte, or Orlando. We can't wait for you to visit!

name: Cozy bedroom in Chicago's Pilsen neighborhood
summary: Great fully furnished house in the Heart of Chicago. Across the street from CTA Pink Line train station, this house is in Pilsen, recently named top 12 coolest neighborhoods in the world. Be surrounded by Pilsen's  incredible variety of shopping, dining, and nightlife, or stay in and enjoy premium indoor/outdoor amenities. Less than a 10 minute drive to Magnificent Mile and the Loop. Book today!
space: Clean, comfortable, spacious and fully furnished space.  Enjoy wifi and cable TV including premium channels. Bedroom includes one queen size bed. Big screen TV, bluray player in living room. Washer and dryer are in unit. Big back yard for barbeques and hosting. Newly renovated bathroom. Stainless steel appliances, toaster oven and Kuring. For your convenience enjoy a cup of coffee at coffee shop, shop at convenience store or enjoy traditional mexican dinner or a drink at local bar all conveniently located across the street. Breakfast and other dinner options are within walking distance. The famous Mexican Fine Arts Museum is less than 5 minute walking distance.

notes: Located near express ways, not far from Midway and O'Hare Airports. Close to hospitals and pharmacies. Target and grocery stores are close to property.

name: NEW Apartment in Old Town!
summary: Stunning 3BR apartment in the heart of Old Town. You cannot beat this location! Situated behind the Wells Street entertainment and dining district, you're only a few steps from all the best restaurants, bars, venues and transportation. Old Town is home to famous Second City and Zanie's comedy clubs.  NOTE: these pictures reflect our upstairs unit. We will have updated pictures April 5th with the same layout and beds. Registration Number: R (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)
space: You'll feel right at home with our cozy living room, vaulted ceilings, fully stocked kitchen, Netflix, and memory foam mattresses. We cater to the needs of our business-savvy clients, so we have provided a laptop-friendly workspace and fast WiFi throughout the space. There are also two full-length mirrors, a washer/dryer on-site and a lockbox available. Leave your iron and hair dryer at home. We’ve got you covered.

name: Live like a local in this cozy 2 bedroom apartment
summary: This newly renovated apartment on the second floor will provide you with a cozy retreat from busy urban life. Here, you  can feel at home and relax. We  live nearby and would love to share tips and insights with you if you wish. The apartment is furnished with quality furniture, art work,  textiles and new appliances. We will gladly provide anything missing. we tried to create a space we ourselves would love to be in.
description: This newly renovated apartment on the second floor will provide you with a cozy retreat from busy urban life. Here, you  can feel at home and relax. We  live nearby and would love to share tips and insights with you if you wish. The apartment is furnished with quality furniture, art work,  textiles and new appliances. We will gladly provide anything missing. we tried to create a space we ourselves would love to be in. A key box at the main entrance door  will give you flexible access to the building and a code lock to the apartment itself. A small enclosed back porch provides further space to hang out. Logan Square is one of Chicago's hipster neighborhoods. Cool coffee shops, eclectic restaurants and ample  nightlife are only a few blocks away and can be easily  reached on foot. The area is safe and family-friendly.  We love living here and hope you will enjoy staying here as well. The Blue line subway serving O'Hare airport and downtown is a short walk from the apartment. Divvy rental
neighborhood_overview: Logan Square is one of Chicago's hipster neighborhoods. Cool coffee shops, eclectic restaurants and ample  nightlife are only a few blocks away and can be easily  reached on foot. The area is safe and family-friendly.  We love living here and hope you will enjoy staying here as well.
transit: The Blue line subway serving O'Hare airport and downtown is a short walk from the apartment. Divvy rental bikes are also close by. There is ample street parking but if parking at the building is desired, it can be negotiated for a small fee.
access: A key box at the main entrance door  will give you flexible access to the building and a code lock to the apartment itself. A small enclosed back porch provides further space to hang out.
house_rules: If you don’t mind, please wear slippers or socks in the apartment. Please leave it as you found it. Load dirty dishes in the dishwasher and run it before you leave ( you do not have to unload it) Leave used linens on the floor. Guests booking for more than 1 week must discuss a mutually agreed upon cleaning schedule.  No pets. No smoking. Heat and air condition should range between 68 and 72 degrees F Please be considerate of downstairs neighbors.
host_about:
Hello,
even though we immigrated from Germany and Russia, we are a true Logan Square family.  We love art, soccer,  rowing and are avid cross-country skiers. We also love our vibrant, artsy, eclectic neighborhood, and we hope you will, too. If you wish, we can provide a ton of tips to make your stay unique.

name: Luxury Modern home minutes from Downtown Chicago
summary: Newly rehabbed, historic workers' cottage in Chicago's popular Pilsen neighborhood. Close to transportation, 18th street restaurants, night life, and cultural venues, like Thalia Hall and National Museum of Mexican Art. 3 bedrooms and 2 full bathrooms. Entire space features brand-new furniture, mattresses, appliances, and fixtures. Guests have access to 1 parking spot and  laundry room. Space was thoughtfully designed to offer guests a relaxing stay in our hometown, Chicago!
space: Located in a residential part of Pilsen, the space is modern with traditional charm throughout.
description: Newly rehabbed, historic workers' cottage in Chicago's popular Pilsen neighborhood. Close to transportation, 18th street restaurants, night life, and cultural venues, like Thalia Hall and National Museum of Mexican Art. 3 bedrooms and 2 full bathrooms. Entire space features brand-new furniture, mattresses, appliances, and fixtures. Guests have access to 1 parking spot and  laundry room. Space was thoughtfully designed to offer guests a relaxing stay in our hometown, Chicago! Located in a residential part of Pilsen, the space is modern with traditional charm throughout. Guests will have access to the entire first floor, second floor, and the basement laundry area. Owner occupies a single apartment in the basement seasonally which has its own entrance separate from the guest portion of the home. The home is in a residential are so no parties allowed out of respect for the neighbors. Available for help by phone any time. Call and message asap if any emergencies arise or you need our help.
neighborhood_overview: Pilsen is one of Chicago's most colorful neighborhoods. Booming with culture and art, the neighborhood has a wonderful collection of murals (arguably the best in the city), making it a great place to explore Chicago. The neighborhood has a "Second Friday" event every month where galleries and businesses open their doors to the public and host events to put their work and the work of neighborhood artists on display and bring people together. For drinks, try Punch House or Simone's. For food, try Dusek's, SKY, or HaiSous. The property is located in a residential area of the neighborhood, no parties allowed out of respect for neighbors.
notes: No parties allowed
transit: Metra BNSF Train - Halsted CTA Pink Line Train - 18th Street CTA Buses: 60/Blue Island Avenue, 9/Ashland Avenue, 8/Halsted Avenue, 21/Cermak Avenue, 18/18th Street, 62/Archer Street - Closest Bus stop is the Loomis and Cullerton Stop for 60/Blue Island Avenue Bus. This bus can take you directly to Millenium Park and Michigan Ave & State St. shopping, theaters, and museums.
access: Guests will have access to the entire first floor, second floor, and the basement laundry area. Owner occupies a single apartment in the basement seasonally which has its own entrance separate from the guest portion of the home. The home is in a residential are so no parties allowed out of respect for the neighbors.
interaction: Available for help by phone any time. Call and message asap if any emergencies arise or you need our help. Please allow some time if reaching out during night hours, may not respond until the morning. Owner occupies the separate basement apartment seasonally.
house_rules: Absolutely no smoking in the house. No parties. No events.

name: PERFECT PLACE FOR 3 PEOPLE 5 MIN TO DOWNTOWN
summary: This private room features 3 separate beds perfect for 3 travelers and an EARLY check-in (12 pm)! The apartment is professionally designed and includes FREE PARKING. You will have your own door code and may arrive and as late as you wish, no-hassle check-in guaranteed. I allow LUGGAGE DROP OFF! You can store your luggage in the closet before check-in and after check-out times, you can drop it off and pick it up as early and as late as you would like. The neighborhood is safe, even at night!
space: Restaurants and bars are right round the corner, both upscale and casual. This room is 6 minutes away by car or uber to Chicago's famous Willis (Sears) tower. Uber costs about $7. If you are arriving by car, I am providing free resident parking passes for anywhere in the area. (Yes, that means you can drive a few blocks and still park anywhere you want!) The room will be ONLY yours for the time you'll stay in my Windy City. You will have a key to lock the door. > EARLY CHECK-IN! 12 pm! > VERY CLEAN room > Free parking provided: park BEFORE your check-in and stay parked AFTER your check-out if you would like > 3 different beds with sheets, blankets and towels. Memory foam GREEN TEA mattresses. > Apartment is NEWLY renovated and PROFESSIONALLY designed by an interior designer > 5 MIN to DOWNTOWN > Restaurants and bars are 5 MIN away walking distance > 5 MIN walk to PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION/METRO > 3 MIN walk to UIC (University of Illinois at Chicago) > No security deposit > Cancel up to 24

neighborhood_overview: 100% of guests love my location- it is the best of both worlds: 5 minutes from the very center of downtown, yet quiet enough to not hear the noise at night. If you are still not convinced, please read my reviews.
transit: "UIC Halsted" is the closest blue line train (metro) station, only 5 minutes away (walking).  -Downtown/Loop: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and get off at "LaSalle, Jackson, or Monroe," depending on where you are going :) FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC Halsted." About 5 minutes to downtown. -O’Hare Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare. O'Hare is the final stop. FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC Halsted." About 40 minutes to O’Hare. -Midway Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and transfer to orange line at "Clark/Lake," then take orange line to towards Midway airport. Midway is the final stop! FROM - take orange line towards Adams/Wabash; then, transfer to blue line at "Clark/Lake." Take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC-Halsted." About 45 minutes to Midway. -Union Station/Amtrak: Only 20 minutes away (walking), taxi or uber will take you to the apartment in less than 5 minutes for about $6 :)
house_rules: Please read your check-in instructions carefully
host_about:
Hello! My name is Marina, and I would like to welcome you to Chicago. I host with my sister, and we are originally from Saint Petersburg, Russia, but we spent our teenage years in Aix-en-Provence, France and therefore speak English, Russian and French fluently :) I work as an auditor downtown.  

Hotels can get very expensive, so we do our best to help tourists out. I really hope to host you! :)

name: Lakeview home close to Wrigley
summary: Great location, just .3 mile to the 'L,'  .5 mile to Lake Michigan and .7 mile to Wrigley Field, this single family home is a good base for enjoying the best Chicago has to offer.  There are nearby good restaurants and funky fun shopping.
space: This spacious room has a queen size bed and is a few steps from the bathroom.  The bath is not shared with anyone else and has a shower/tub combination.
description: Great location, just .3 mile to the 'L,'  .5 mile to Lake Michigan and .7 mile to Wrigley Field, this single family home is a good base for enjoying the best Chicago has to offer.  There are nearby good restaurants and funky fun shopping. This spacious room has a queen size bed and is a few steps from the bathroom.  The bath is not shared with anyone else and has a shower/tub combination. Because we live in the house and make almost all of our meals here, please coordinate any use of the kitchen with us in advance. Jeff and I live in the house, so we will be around to help you most of the time. We often have family dinner on Sunday, and you're more than welcome to join us if you would like! We are happy to respect your privacy, but we're more than happy to share tips on how to enjoy Chicago or chat over a cup of coffee. We are walking distance from Wrigley Field, Lake Michigan, and the 'L' where you can catch the brown, red, and purple lines. A short train ride from the Loop, Navy Pier
neighborhood_overview: We are walking distance from Wrigley Field, Lake Michigan, and the 'L' where you can catch the brown, red, and purple lines. A short train ride from the Loop, Navy Pier, and the Magnificent Mile. There is a wide variety of restaurants and bars nearby and tons of quirky shops!
notes: The guest rooms are on the third floor, so it might not be an ideal climb for people with bad knees or have difficulty climbing stairs. Please know that the lot next door is under construction.
transit: We are just off of Lake Shore Dr. at Belmont if you're driving, 1  1/2 blocks from the "L" and walking distance to Wrigley Field.
access: Because we live in the house and make almost all of our meals here, please coordinate any use of the kitchen with us in advance.
interaction: Jeff and I live in the house, so we will be around to help you most of the time. We often have family dinner on Sunday, and you're more than welcome to join us if you would like! We are happy to respect your privacy, but we're more than happy to share tips on how to enjoy Chicago or chat over a cup of coffee.
house_rules: Jeff and I work early in the morning, so we ask guests to be quiet after 10:00 p.m. Smoking is not permitted in the house, however you may smoke in the yard, let us know and we will put an ashtray outside for you. If the dogs follow you outside, please make sure they come in with you or if they start barking. We live in a very fun neighborhood, but if you are looking for a place to stay for a wild weekend, we ask that you stay somewhere else.

name: Sonder | The Plymouth | Pristine 4BR + Rooftop
summary: We want everyone to have a comfortable place to stay. Our digital check-in and the ability to manage your stay from our app, means you won't need to interact with anyone in person. Our staff has been trained in proper disinfection techniques and will deep clean your Sonder before and after your stay. We're here for you during this time of uncertainty and can be reached 24/7 via text or call. Named the most innovative travel company of 2019 by Fast Company, Sonder has hosted a million guests in 5,000+ spaces with an average rating of 4.6 stars. Each space is designed and run by us, so you’ll always know what to expect from your stay. At Sonder, we’ve combined the best parts of home and hotel.   - 24/7 support via text, email, or phone   - Coffee, fresh towels, and bathroom essentials provided   - Hotel-standard cleaning before you arrive   - Self check-in

neighborhood_overview: The South Loop is a vibrant blend of notable attractions, beautiful parks, and stunning Lake Michigan views. Picnic in the charming green space surrounding Museum Campus, or attend one of the many events at Grant Park such as The Taste of Chicago. Spend the day exploring the countless museums, or journey to the top of the 108-story Willis Tower for breathtaking views of the city.
notes: This is a central location and prone to noise. Two of the bedrooms have one wall that does not fully extend to the ceiling.
house_rules: House Rules 1. Reservations require a $400 security deposit that is not charged in advance. 2. Guests can cancel free of charge within 24 hours of booking (please contact us to process the refund). You’ll be charged 50% of the booking price (minus the service fee) if you cancel more than seven days before arrival, and 100% of the total price if you cancel within seven days of arrival. 3. Check-in is at 4 pm. Checkout is at 11 am. Early check-in or late checkout may be available upon request. Guests who stay beyond their designated checkout time or delay our housekeeping staff are liable for any associated costs and expenses. 4. Guests are not allowed to make a reservation in their city of residence. Please contact us if you're booking within your city. 5. Smoking, parties, and excessive noise are not allowed, including on balconies and in shared spaces. Smoking violations are subject to a $250 fine plus the cost to clean, deodorize, and repair damages. 6. Commercial photography/videogr
host_about: Sonder is reimagining the way people travel. Now in 20+ cities, we’ve been featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and named 2019’s most innovative hospitality brand by Fast Company. We’ve taken the best parts of home and hotel and combined them into an entirely new experience. All of our spaces are uniquely designed, have 24/7 guest support, and contain all the essentials you need for an impeccable stay. No matter what you’re looking for, there’s a Sonder for you.

name: Short Stay - Rosewood - Spacious 1BR Northside Gem
summary: Live like a local on Chicago's north side! Nestled in the trendy Ravenswood neighborhood, staying at ROSEWOOD gives you the best of a true Chicago neighborhood experience without the congestion and expenses of downtown!  Make this your home away from home with in-unit washer/dryer, rooftop lounge, and an outdoor rooftop terrace with gas grills for your enjoyment! Centrally located to award-winning restaurants, local boutiques, breweries, plenty of entertainment options, and easy street parking.
space: * Please note: these are BRAND NEW LISTINGS and we're so excited to host you! Professional photos of the sleek California boho-inspired design and decor coming soon! * Located right off the CTA brown line means a quick trip to Wrigley Field, downtown, and other excellent small neighborhoods all with their own unique flair. It's a super quick trip to the famous jazz clubs and concert venues in Uptown (The Aragon, The Riviera, and the Green Mill!) and other small unique areas of Lincoln Square, Andersonville, and North Center. Your home away from home is equipped with everything you need to relax, work, or play in the city whether it's for a quiet night in or exploring the exciting nightlife that the city has to offer!  The entire home is yours to enjoy. The only shared spaces are the rooftop lounge and rooftop terrace.

notes: Check In / Check Out Check in after 4pm CT Check out is 11am CT We do not offer early Check In or late Check Out.  Luggage Hold If your travel arrangements have you arriving earlier or leaving later than our designated check in / check out times, we recommend using a luggage holding and transport company called Wait Here Chicago. We have a partnership with them and they can offer you discounted rates on their luggage hold options throughout the city. The home is equipped with Wifi for your enjoyment and the television is set up with a ROKU where you can sign into your own Netflix or Hulu accounts during your stay.  The kitchen is fully equipped with pots, pans, utensils, silverware, plates, bowls, cups, knives, a cutting board, salt and pepper, olive oil, black tea and honey. There are great markets nearby if you feel some culinary inspiration! We also provide coffee, cream, and sugar to start your morning off right!  Pets This is a dog-friendly building with a 2 dog maximum per guest.
access: The entire home is yours to enjoy. The only shared spaces are the rooftop lounge and rooftop terrace.
interaction: We are off-site but available when needed. The best way to reach us is by sending a message through the app!  In case of maintenance emergency, the in-unit home guide will detail phone numbers of who to call immediately.
house_rules: General Rules -Please treat the home as if it is your own. -Do not engage in illegal activities anywhere on the property. -If you accidentally damage anything during your stay, please contact the host for your safety and the future safety of the next guest. -Please remember to sign out of any ROKU apps you utilized via your personal accounts before departing.  -This is a dog-friendly building with a 2 dog limit per reservation, $25 pet fee per animal. Quiet Hours Quiet hours are between 10p-8a. This is a residential building and ask that for the respect of permanent tenants basic courtesies of being mindful of your noise levels and not congregating in hallways outside of the unit be observed.  Receiving a noise complaint from the building can result in the forfeiture of your stay and a $1000 fine.  No Smoking The home (and entire building including outdoor common areas) is designated as a strictly smoke-free community. There will be a $500 fee imposed if you choose to smoke in the buil
host_about: Hello! Thanks for checking out our homes in beautiful Chicago! Livly Short Stay has a few hosts that will be communicating with you and we can’t wait to get to know you and welcome you to the city. Hosting as a team makes communicating with us even faster and we're looking forward to taking care of curating a perfect stay for you. Talk to you soon!

name: Spectacular Fulton Market Penthouse, Sleeps 24 in Style
summary: 2 side-by-side designer penthouse apartments comprising 5,000 square feet (the entire top floor) of a brick-and-timber loft building with 15 foot ceilings in the heart of the vibrant West Loop neighborhood. This recently renovated 6 bedroom / 4 bath space is perfect for large groups looking for a stylish city escape surrounded by Chicago's best dining and nightlife. This is a truly unique and special space. The central location is an ideal base for everything you want to see in Chicago!
space: Located on the top floor of a historic 1920’s building overlooking Fulton Market. Once inside, you’re greeted by a huge open living space with soaring windows, polished concrete floors, and exposed brick-and-timber details. The upscale furnishings and designer touches are sure to create an unforgettable stay. This property is comprised of 2 side-by-side penthouse apartments separated by a small stair landing (~6 feet wide). They are the only 2 units on the top floor of the building. Included in each apartment are a kitchen, living room, 3 bedrooms, and 2 bathrooms. The kitchen and living room is open and great for entertaining. The fully equipped kitchen is stocked with all the tools you need to stay in and cook a great meal. We have a 6 person dining table and a kitchen island with 4 counter stools -- plenty of room for all guests. In the living room, you’ll find comfortable furniture to lounge on and a smart TV with Roku.  Our beds have crisp linens and the bathrooms are stocked with

neighborhood_overview: You’re in the center of Fulton Market in the West Loop -- a lively neighborhood that is home to many of Chicago’s finest restaurants, coffee shops, breweries, cocktail bars, and outdoor patios. This former warehouse district has transformed in recent years and is now a favorite of locals and visitors alike. Within a 5 minute walk outside your door, you’ll find dozens of hangout spots and places to explore for all ages and budgets. You’re truly in the heart of one of Chicago’s coolest neighborhoods!
transit: Our place is very central for exploring all of Chicago -- less than 1 mile from the Loop and River North, and a 10-15 minute trip to other areas like the Magnificent Mile, Wicker Park, Lincoln Park, Old Town, Gold Coast, and McCormick Place.  You’re a 1 min walk from the Morgan train stop (Green/Pink Line) and a 10 min walk from the Grand train stop (Blue Line), allowing you to quickly access all areas of the city and O’Hare/Midway Airports. Uber and Lyft is also available 24/7. You’ll have no trouble getting around without a car. Parking: We do not have parking in our building, but there are very convenient options nearby. The nearest parking garage is the 1K Fulton Parking garage at 1029 W. Carroll Ave, one block from from the apartment. For 24 hours of parking, rates are $26 on the weekend and $50 during the week. We also recommend two parking apps/websites that allow you to book discounted parking in garages and neighborhood parking lots. You can typically find overnight parking fo
access: You will have complete and private access to our space.
interaction: We are always available to give recommendations and quickly address questions during your stay. We love sharing our city with visitors.
house_rules: 1. No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable and subject to a $250 fine. 2. Please ensure that you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to the designated location by the agreed upon check-out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out penalty. 3. Absolutely no smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any entrance. 4. Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily.  5. Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid. 6. Lockouts will result in a $150 fee per occurrence. Additionally, lost keys will incur a $150 per key fee.
host_about: Discover Chicago with a stay at one of our distinctive neighborhood properties. Staywell's concierge team is dedicated to ensuring that you have an exceptional and memorable experience. We love hosting guests and are available for questions about the city and anything else you might need during your stay!

name: Modern Vibe in the ♥ of Ravenswood's "Malt Row"
summary: This 3 level home is newly renovated.  In the heart of "Malt Row" you are near all the breweries & wedding venues of Ravenswood. There are 2 full family rooms with sofas, a fireplace, TV's with Roku, luxury memory foam mattresses, and EVEN FOOSBALL! The Metra train is steps away and the Brown line L is only a short walk. Whether you are in town just to visit, attend a wedding or for business, this place is sure to feel like home!

neighborhood_overview: The colorful Ravenswood corridor in Lincoln Square hugs the Metra right-of-away as it makes its way north through a clutch of North Side Chicago neighborhoods. Many of the former industrial buildings along this street now house a range of booming businesses (including craft breweries!), and spending an afternoon in these parts is quite pleasant. Why not take a short trip and visit a few of our favorite Ravenswood gems. Let's get started! Take the Brown Line to the Montrose stop and walk east under the Metra tracks to the Lillstreet Art Center to start.
transit: The Ravenswood Metra stop is right outside the door and the Damen stop of the Brown Line "L" (Chicago's Metro Train) is a 6 minute walk away.  The Brown line will  take you to Wrigley Field  and straight to the heart of downtown!
access: You will have the whole house to yourself!
interaction: I have a concierge service that helps guests when needed
house_rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund. 1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable. 2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to the designated location by the agreed upon check-out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out penalty. 3.) Absolutely no smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any entrance. 4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 5.) Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid.
host_about:
I am a 32 year old professional who has lived in Chicago her whole life.  I have lived in my current neighborhood for over 5 years with my long time boyfriend (native Cincinnatian) and 2 adorable kitties.  I LOVE to travel and spend the majority of my free time planning or on my next big adventure.  Some of my favorites include Turkey, the Czech Republic, Croatia, Ireland and Mexico.  I have traveled in all different types of style from back packing and hostels or luxury hotels and spas...I am an equal opportunity traveler and so long as there is something to do, eat and drink and I am not at work, I am happy as can be.

When I am not working and traveling, my boyfriend and I love exploring new restaurants and bars in Chicago.  

We love meeting new people and hope you will enjoy staying with us as much as we will enjoy having you as our guest.

name: Newly renovated Suite in prime West Town location!
summary: Unwind and enjoy the city in our Cozy and Clean Guest Suite! Located just minutes from the Loop (downtown), I-90, as well as the United Center, enjoy staying in a great location close to everything Chicago has to offer!  We're new hosts on Airbnb and super excited to begin having guests stay at our recently furnished guest space.  We live in the main, separable part of the property and are excited for you to use our space as a home base for which to decompress or explore the city!
space: Stay in a cozy Noble Square Master Suite located on the edge of West Town/West Loop with an exposed beam, bamboo floors, TV with 125 + channels of cable, Netflix, Amazon Prime TV, wifi, walk in closet, as well your own oversized mini fridge, microwave and much more!

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood itself is somewhat quiet for Chicago, especially being just minutes from downtown! If you venture several blocks in any direction, you'll find busy streets bustling with nightlife, shopping and much more! Centrally located and close to the United Center, Fulton Market, the West Loop and River North night life, come relax here while nearly all of Chicago is at your fingertips!
notes: We live on the property and do our best to keep noise at a minimum, but you may hear some noise from time to time. We abide by the moderate cancellation policy for Airbnb. Unfortunately, we do not allow pets.
transit: Uber would be my suggestion. But you have several Blue Line "EL" stations within walking distance

interaction: I am available by call or text (or a holler when I'm home), and would be happy to assist in anyway possible! If you like dogs, feel free to come meet my husky Jameson "Jamo" who will be your neighbor. If not, that's ok. He doesn't bark, so he won't bother you.
host_about:
Stay where it counts. When you book a Loftium, you're contributing to the local community. Each Loftium is home to a local resident who hosts and lives right on-site, making sure your experience is a delightful one. All spaces are designed with your comfort in mind! We've made check-in and communication a breeze, and each home provides a beautiful and cozy place to rest your head during your travels. Every Loftium home and host is unique, and you'll always get a true neighborhood experience during your stay.

Visit a new community and book a Loftium in any of our cities: Seattle, Portland, Denver, San Diego, Phoenix, Chicago, Atlanta, Dallas, Charlotte, or Orlando. We can't wait for you to visit!

name: Modern Suite just steps away from Blue Line!
summary: Unwind and enjoy the city in our Cozy and Clean Guest Suite!  West Town is a thriving Chicago neighborhood that includes East Village, Humboldt Park, Eckhart Park, and Ukrainian Village, sits north of the West Loop and west of River North. This neighborhood offers many entertainment and cultural opportunities, including a selection of eclectic boutiques, gourmet restaurants, and trendy bars.
space: The 1 bedroom guest suite is located in the lower level of the house. The private entrance is found in the back of of the house. THE LOWER LEVEL UNIT is separated by a door from the main part of the house. The living area comes furnished with a queen size bed & futon bed for extra guests. There’s a desk space/office provided with complimentary Wi-Fi. For your convenience there’s a smart TV with WiFi capability that links to any smart phone. Convenient access to 24/7 blue line Chicago L stop, just a 10 minute walk from the Airbnb.

neighborhood_overview: Conveniently located min. away from the bustling West Loop/Downtown area Near the Blue Line, near 90/94 Interstate. Short walk to the Grand & Chicago bus line. 15 minute walk to Fulton Market and Randolph street where you can find an array of eclectic restaurants & shops. Close to the loop, expressways and public transportation. Here are a few restaurants worth checking out: D'Amatos, Piccolo Sogno, Butterfly Sushi Bar, Starbucks, among many shops on Chicago & Grand Avenue. Short 15 min Walk to Fulton Market, where many choices for dining and entertainment on Randolph St. This AirBnb is near many popular attractions that makes adventuring quick and easy.
notes: The one bedroom Airbnb suite is located in the lower level of the house. There is a utility room with the furnace and water sump pump that makes a buzzing sound. I have provided ear plugs for your comfort and ease to sleep overnight.
transit: Getting around is easy whether you drive your car or choose to get around on foot. There’s a complimentary parking space included with your stay. If you’d rather explore the city on your feet, the 24/7 blue line is a 10 min walk and another 10 min commute into the loop downtown on the CTA blue line.
access: You have access to your own private entrance adjacent to the back of the house. You must enter via the side wooden door that leads to the back lot. Then you will find a staircase that leads to the lower level guest suite. The keys to enter are found inside a combo lockbox attached to the staircase railing. There’s free parking space available for Airbnb guests.  The unit has a private one bedroom and one bath. There’s a roomy living space with a seating area, a kitchenette (new mini fridge, microwave, and electric tea kettle) and a work space and an office chair. Also, there’s is a smart TV that links with any smart phone.  Enjoy complimentary earth friendly toiletries along with WiFi access during your entire stay.
interaction: I am dedicated to making your stay as comfortable and memorable as possible, whether you're staying in town for business or leisure. If anything should arise, I am dedicated to resolving or accommodating your needs to make your stay the best experience possible.

neighborhood_overview: What’s better than staying in the heart of Downtown Chicago? How about an apartment that gives you the best of both worlds: minutes from the most exciting attractions of the Magnificent Mile and Navy Pier, but far enough away that you can get a taste of authentic Chi-Town life like a local. Our place is a 10-minute walk from the Wellington L Station which can take you straight into Downtown. Our neighborhood itself, though, is best explored foot, so you can meander through the quaint boutiques and tasty eateries while enjoying the lush trees that line the streets. Walk just 10 minutes east and you’ll stumble upon the spectacular Lakefront Trail, which offers panoramic views of Lake Michigan and is a fantastic place to run, walk, and people watch. You’ll never go hungry in this ‘hood. Some of our favorite places to eat include Crisp, known for Korean-style fried chicken, Chilam Balam for Mexican small plates, and the delicious Mediterranean fare at Troy.
