notes: -All guest need to be attentive with the house rules during their stay as there are other tenants at the property. - Bath towels are provided per number of guest not per number of stay -Washcloths are not provided during your stay. You may send me a message though if you need them and I'll try my best to accommodate your request. -We have duvet covers on our bedding  (no top sheets). -Security Deposit maybe required on the following bookings: 1) Last minute bookings 2) Short weekend stays 3) Large groups  4) Guests with no reviews 5) Guests with incomplete profile 6) Instant Bookings  7) Some properties may not allow locals for short term reservations. -Please be aware that if you lose the key and/or entry fob which is your access to the unit, it cannot be replaced for you immediately and you may lose access to the apartment and all amenities until another one can be made. There is a $200 fee for lost keys. -If there's an issue during your stay, please report it real-time so we can add
transit: Why break the bank with a pricey rental car when you can take advantage of Chicago’s top-notch public transportation system? Our place is just a 10-minute walk from Wellington Station, where you can catch the Brown Line and the Purple/Red Line. Any line will take you to Downtown Chicago in just about 15 minutes, or you can head north to Uptown or Evanston on the Red Line, which later turns into the Purple Line. Flying into Chicago? We’re a 25-minute drive from O’Hare when there is no traffic, but if there is traffic you may be better off taking public transit (and saving some $$ on the taxi or Uber fare). Take the Blue Line from O’Hare to Clark/Lake, then transfer to the Brown Line to Wellington Station. Or, transfer from the Blue Line to the bus, depending on what time of day you’re traveling. In addition to public transit, ridesharing (Uber or Lyft) is also a great way to get around the Chicago metro. When you’re heading out with a group or want that extra little bit of luxury, just

interaction: We’re all about giving you plenty of privacy and personal space, so we’ll be available by phone (call or text) during your stay.

If you have a dog or a cat, an extra $50 pet cleaning fee will be added to your reservation.
host_about:
Hostly was established in 2017 to help hosts and property owners navigate the wonderful world of Airbnb and vacation rentals. 

Our team of expert hosts are here to ensure your guests’ — and your — experience is awesome, and take the hassle out of your Airbnb or other short-term property rental management.

The team at Hostly is made up of talented local and international staff with extensive property management and hosting experience and will create a customized plan that incorporates your objectives, goals, and budget with utmost  transparency and clarity to grow a mutual partnership.

As metro Chicago's premier property management company with its strong local connections, Hostly offers a full line of services to create the best vacation rental experience.

Our services include: marketing, booking and payments, guest vetting, enhanced pricing model, guest support, on-site staffing coordination, cleaning service, and key delivery and checking in and out. We also offer value add-ons such as design and staging, creating your listing, and basically sharing our industry knowledge with you.

Today, Hostly stands out in the crowded property management field as the boutique vacation rental and BnB super hosts because of our consistent track record, our team and our focus on impeccable service as reflected in its online reputation and reviews.

neighborhood_overview: Located in West Loop, this furnished rental invites you to explore the edges of downtown Chicago. From endless dining and bar options to art galleries and stylish shops, West Loop has emerged with so much to offer daily. During weekends, residents savor trips to the Chicago French Market and the vibrant strip of Randolph Street. The latter is known as “Restaurant Row” and is lined with some of the city’s best eateries. Fulton Market, one of the hippest and fastest-growing neighborhoods, is ideal for dinner and drinks. Union Station is only a 5 to 10 minute walk away.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

notes: Because we live directly above you, and the home was built in 1910, there can be foot traffic noise at times. We are up early and are usually quiet in the evening and settle down early. Our puppies may whine when we leave, but that lasts no more than 60 seconds.
transit: We encourage you to use public transportation. Parking can be painful and expensive in most of Chicago. (If you are a party of 4 or more, using uber or parking your car using SpotHero, can be more cost effective.) Parking: we have free street parking. A map in the unit highlights the areas to park. Please be aware of street sweeping Is April 1- November 1. Brightly colored orange signs wrapped on trees or poles indicate days you cannot park from 9am-2pm. The schedule changes regularly, so please keep an eye out. Please let us know if you have any questions.  Subway "L"- a 10-15 minute walk (0.8 miles) to the Addison Blue Line Stop. 18 minute walk (0.9 miles) to the Kimball Brown Line Stop. 18 minute ride on the Blue Line to Downtown. 22 minute ride to Ohare. Buy your Ventra card at the airport or at any local drug store. Register online and connect it to your bank to get a 5$ credit.  Bus- two major bus lines are within a 5 min walk from our house. You can use a Ventra card (same as su
access: The self-contained home is on the 1st floor, with our home above and my mother in the garden unit. We share a common front entrance into the home, your door labeled # 1, being on the right. Please enter and exit through the front door only. The back door is for emergencies only and dumping trash. Please potty your dogs out front with the provided dog bags. You may dump your trash in the can provided out the back door.
interaction: We are very easy going and social. We are just a call or text away.  We are happy to share our secrets on how to safely navigate the city and give you our opinion on special spots to visit.

However, we appreciate your courtesy to keep noise levels low throughout the day.
host_about: We are Southern California transplants now living in Chicago. We have our own bnb in the city and love it. David did all of the renovations and Andrea decorated it. We love hosting.

name: Amazing Wicker Park Spring Factory Conversion
summary: Create gourmet meals in an immaculate professional grade kitchen. Relax in a one-of-a-kind warehouse space with Chicago's trendiest neighborhood at your doorstep.   Sift through books and magazines in the sophistication of this eclectic, open-plan loft. Detox at the end of the day in a stainless Japanese soaking tub.
space: This is an early 1900's warehouse (formerly a Prohibition era distillery, then a spring factory for several decades) that was recently converted into a gorgeous, open loft space. The space is located just off of Division St in Wicker Park.  It contains 14' tall timber ceilings, exposed floor-to-ceiling brick walls, solid oak floors, and a unique decor mixing various Chinese, Japanese, and industrial elements. The kitchen was featured in Signature Kitchen & Bath's 2014 annual kitchen awards, winning 2nd prize in the contemporary class.  It includes a 10' long stainless steel island, a 22,000btu, 6-burner Thermador gas range, double ovens, a massive refrigerator and commercial exhaust hood, both by Thermador.  The cocktail bar comes fully stocked with a unique selection of whiskeys (mostly bourbon and Japanese whisky, rounded out with Scotch), not to mention a couple dozen bottles of wine and craft beers for your enjoyment. Further, we used to operate a whole-leaf tea business out of thi
description: Create gourmet meals in an immaculate professional grade kitchen. Relax in a one-of-a-kind warehouse space with Chicago's trendiest neighborhood at your doorstep.   Sift through books and magazines in the sophistication of this eclectic, open-plan loft. Detox at the end of the day in a stainless Japanese soaking tub. This is an early 1900's warehouse (formerly a Prohibition era distillery, then a spring factory for several decades) that was recently converted into a gorgeous, open loft space. The space is located just off of Division St in Wicker Park.  It contains 14' tall timber ceilings, exposed floor-to-ceiling brick walls, solid oak floors, and a unique decor mixing various Chinese, Japanese, and industrial elements. The kitchen was featured in Signature Kitchen & Bath's 2014 annual kitchen awards, winning 2nd prize in the contemporary class.  It includes a 10' long stainless steel island, a 22,000btu, 6-burner Thermador gas range, double ovens, a massive refrigerator and commerci
neighborhood_overview: The loft is in Wicker Park, a unique and very diverse area that has a lot of cool coffee shops, boutiques, cocktail bars, and restaurants. It has arguably the best patio scene in Chicago, with Division Street's wide sidewalks and sociable residents.
notes: The bed is king-sized, with Italian brushed sateen sheets, a thick downed comforter, featherbed topper, and a stack of plush, king-sized pillows.  For additional guests, queen-size and full-size aerobeds are available, along with accompanying linens and pillows.
transit: Getting around is super easy.  The space is just off of Division St, so you have access to the #70 bus, which runs both East and West every 10 minutes or so.    The blue line train is a few minute walk down the street, which you can take downtown, to Bucktown, Logan Square, or to/from O'Hare.  Of course, there are Uber and Lyfts everywhere at a moment's notice and the e-scooters are all over the neighborhood if you want to take that route.  Finally, there's a Divvy bike station just around the corner on Division if you want to get some exercise.  Parking on the street is FREE (except for Division).  Just be mindful of the school zone on Honore and the street cleaning days (2nd Tues and Wed of each month).
access: You have access to everything: - Samsung washer/dryer in unit - Netflix, Amazon Prime on a 65" Samsung 4K flatscreen with Wharfedale surround sound speaker system - Nest thermostat for easily adjustable climate control - Plus all cooking utensils, appliances, pots, pans, thick Turkish cotton towels, toiletries, etc...
interaction: I'm often traveling when I have guests in town but I'm always available via phone or text if you need anything.  That said, I will definitely have a close friend or neighbor standing by, in case something comes up that requires local attention.  Happy to provide restaurant ideas or logistical help too.  Wicker Park is awesome for walking, so I often suggest walking down Division, up Damen, and back on Milwaukee.
house_rules: - Please keep it clean! - Leave everything that was here when you take off - Absolutely NO smoking inside - The abundant wine/liquor selection is available for your personal enjoyment, but please be reasonable and NO parties - Generally, I'd prefer if you don't have people over Otherwise, make yourselves at home and enjoy your time here, THANK YOU!
host_about:
I grew up in the great steel town of Pittsburgh, PA.  I also lived for a summer in Hong Kong and then London for a couple months, and then I settled in Chicago!  I've been here for over 14 years now and I love it!

I'm big into food and beverage.  I've been to most restaurants in Chicago at least once, and I'm always on the scene sampling the latest.  Typically, I travel outside of the country 4-5 times per year.  At this point, I've been to more than 60 countries and my favorites are mostly in Asia and Central/South America.

I love soccer, health and fitness, photography, skiing, hiking, biking, scuba diving.  Most nights, I'll be cooking up some food and enjoying some tea.  I rarely watch TV but I listen to all types of music.  I transitioned from finance into real estate in 2015, so I'm often traveling to Nashville, Minneapolis, or Dallas-Fort Worth for projects that I'm working on.  During those times, I'll use Airbnb to host at my place in Chicago and oftentimes I'll book an Airbnb property in other cities while I'm away!

name: Heart of Lakeview One Bedroom Apt.
summary: Charming one bedroom apartment on the border of Lakeview and Lincoln Park. Tons of natural light and a quiet building. This spot is ideally located by a number of restaurants, bars, and shopping, and is also less than half a mile from Lake Michigan. Enjoy easy access to the beach, parks, and the Lakefront Trail as well as everything else that Chicago has to offer.
space: The apartment is about 800 square feet and features a bedroom with a full-size bed, a large living room, kitchen, dining room, and bathroom. Wi-Fi and a TV with an Amazon Fire stick are available. Coin operated washer and dryer are available in the basement. The kitchen does not have a dishwasher, but does have a small drying rack for dishes.
description: Charming one bedroom apartment on the border of Lakeview and Lincoln Park. Tons of natural light and a quiet building. This spot is ideally located by a number of restaurants, bars, and shopping, and is also less than half a mile from Lake Michigan. Enjoy easy access to the beach, parks, and the Lakefront Trail as well as everything else that Chicago has to offer. The apartment is about 800 square feet and features a bedroom with a full-size bed, a large living room, kitchen, dining room, and bathroom. Wi-Fi and a TV with an Amazon Fire stick are available. Coin operated washer and dryer are available in the basement. The kitchen does not have a dishwasher, but does have a small drying rack for dishes. You will have full run of the apartment. I will not be in the apartment during your stay, but do live there full time.  I will be available by phone and/or email throughout your stay for any issues that may arise, or if you have questions about the best spot to grab brunch. The keys to t
neighborhood_overview: This apartment is in the heart of to everything. Public transportation is incredibly close and easy to use, making your trip to Chicago that much easier. With the lake less than half a mile from the front door and Lincoln Park mere blocks away, the surrounding area couldn't be more beautiful. There are tons of bars and restaurants within walking distance that offer a range of dining experiences, from sushi to steak, coffee, beer, and more.  The Lincoln Park Zoo is about a mile walk away. This free zoo hosts a range of animals and activities, and is right next to South Pond which has beautiful trails on which to walk and enjoy some nature in the city. Additionally, the botanical garden is right next to the zoo. Mon Ami Gabi, a restaurant of the Lettuce Entertain You Enterprises, is right across the way and definitely worth a stop. Grab a Divy bike and head down along the Lakefront Trail to Navy Pier, the Michigan Mile, Museum Campus, the Bean, and more. This paved trail cuts right along
transit: .2 miles from (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) bus lines .1 miles from 22 &36 bus lines .6 miles from the Brown Line (connects to the Red Line one stop away for no transfer fee) There is free street parking available around the apartment but it may be difficult to find a spot. There is also a garage directly behind the building that has parking available for a fee.  If you like to walk or run, there's no better place to do so than on the Lakefront Trail. This running/walking/biking trail spans for 18 miles and gives you not only some beautiful views of the city itself, but also some of the best sights the city has to offer.
access: You will have full run of the apartment.
interaction: I will not be in the apartment during your stay, but do live there full time.  I will be available by phone and/or email throughout your stay for any issues that may arise, or if you have questions about the best spot to grab brunch. The keys to the apartment will be in a lock box at the front of the building.
house_rules: Please wash all dirty dishes before you leave. Thanks!

neighborhood_overview: Pilsen is a culturally rich neighborhood with many great food and drink options.  We are 2 miles west of the walkway bridge that leads directly to Soldier Field ($5 uber).  We are also right off of the I-90 expressway with direct access to I-90, I-94, I-55, I-290.  If you are looking to head downtown an uber will cost you $10-$17 depending on the time of day.
notes: Please note we do have dogs in our unit on the first floor and we allow guests to bring their own housetrained pets while staying in this unit.  We welcome house trained pets but do charge an additional fee of $25 per pet for their stay (3 night stay max, $10 each additional night).
transit: We are a 1 minute walk to a Divvy station (rental bikes provided by the city).  You will also find easy access to Blue/Pink and Orange lines.  We are easily accessible via car and offer free permit street parking during your entire stay.
access: You will have access to an entire apartment!  Enjoy a full living room, dining room, fully stocked kitchen and bath with a tub/shower combination.  The 55 inch television in the living room will have a Roku so you can log in to your Netflix, Hulu, etc.  Enjoy local channels as well.
interaction: We live on the first floor and are always accessible to our guests.  We would be happy to give you recommendations about our wondrous city!  Feel free to reach out to us!

name: Sonder | Greektown Suites | Chic 1BR + Rooftop
summary: We want everyone to have a comfortable place to stay. Our digital check-in and the ability to manage your stay from our app, means you won't need to interact with anyone in person. Our staff has been trained in proper disinfection techniques and will deep clean your Sonder before and after your stay. We're here for you during this time of uncertainty and can be reached 24/7 via text or call. Named the most innovative travel company of 2019 by Fast Company, Sonder has hosted a million guests in 5,000+ spaces with an average rating of 4.6 stars. Each space is designed and run by us, so you’ll always know what to expect from your stay. At Sonder, we’ve combined the best parts of home and hotel.   - 24/7 support via text, email, or phone   - Coffee, fresh towels, and bathroom essentials provided   - Hotel-standard cleaning before you arrive   - Self check-in

name: Ideal Location in Logan Square 1BR
summary: Clean, cozy, and stylish 1BR located in the heart of Chicago's vibrant Logan Square.  Just one block from the CTA California Blue Line stop.  Situated among scenic parks and boulevards, and just steps to fantastic dining and nightlife.
space: Unique 1BR with exposed brick and plenty of windows and light. An old school fire escape balcony provides the perfect perch for taking in the summer evening enjoying a frosty treat from the Italian ice stand around the corner. Wooden floors throughout with rugs and handsomely appointed furniture make each homecoming a pleasant one.  This is a hundred year old Chicago brick three flat though, so while many will love its vintage charm, the floors may squeak a bit and the bedroom is snug. A hermetically sealed, new construction condo this is not!    That being said, I keep the place clean and tidy. The bedding and towels are new, and the queen sized bed is damned comfy!  The kitchen should have everything you need in case you want to cook also.    Guests have access to everything in the apartment. There is a closet with a dresser for clothing, and an ironing board and iron.     I will most likely be staying with friends in the neighborhood, so I will be available to let guests in to the p

The nightlife is happening as well, with a ton of great bars within a few blocks.    The park around the corner is perfect for taking a walk or lounging on the grass with a book, and the boulevards surrounding the neighborhood are lined with historic mansions for any architecture buffs.
notes: Sometimes the door to the outside fire escape balcony is hard to lock after you close it. If you lift on the door knob while turning the deadbolt, it should lock easily.
transit: The apartment is right off the CTA blue line, so coming or going to downtown or the airport is a breeze!  Literally one block down from the California Blue Line. Also a short walk to Fullerton if you want to catch the bus to the lake.    There is plenty of permit-free street parking available around as well if you are driving. And a possible garage spot could be negotiated if need be.
access: Guests have access to everything in the apartment. There is a closet with a dresser for clothing, and an ironing board and iron.
interaction: I will most likely be staying in the neighborhood, so I will be available to let guests in to the place and answer any questions I can about the neighborhood and getting around.
house_rules: • Check-in time is 3PM. • No parties or events • Not suitable for pets • No smoking I ask that guests are respectful of the property and mindful of the other tenants in the building.  As I mentioned earlier, it is an old building, so sound does travel to the other units some, so all I ask is guests keep the noise to a reasonable level after normal waking hours.   While guests are permitted to have company stop by, I request that no more than 1 or 2 other people be in the apartment besides the people renting the unit.  The place is just not big enough for more than 3 or 4 people to be in the unit.  Smoking is strictly prohibited in the unit, but guests can smoke on the balcony and there is a container for butts.      Renters should leave the place in reasonably similar shape as it was when they first checked in.  I request that guests wash any dishes they may have used upon check out.
host_about: Born and raised in Chicago, but love to get out of the city and see new places (especially in the winter).  Love to explore a new city and get away from the tourist traps.  See the sights and neighborhoods where the locals go, and get a sense of what the town and people are really about.  Prefer the eclectic and random when I travel.  I'm a recording engineer, so love music and always try to find a nice local music dive with a decent beer selection to check out.

name: Quiet Oasis on the Lake
summary: Are you looking for a quiet place in a loud city? A  sanctuary on the sea where the gently breaking (or violently crashing) waves of Lake Michigan carry you off to sleep just blocks from where trains and buses carry you into the Loop? Are you also a good neighbor who will lock the gate behind you and respect the people who share this unique community with us? Then ask about renting our magical slice of Heaven on the shores of Lake Michigan.
space: The top floor has three bedrooms, but one will be an office from December on. You are, of course, free to use it.  NOTE: One or both of us occasionally crashes in the "English basement" (not pictured), which has a separate entrance but no kitchen. We have priced the unit accordingly, but you can also check with us before booking to see which dates we'll be there -- although we reserve the right to use the basement on other dates if our travel plans change. You can check reviews from our previous unit to see that we respect guests' privacy when there.

You can check reviews from our previous unit to see that we respect guests' privacy when there
neighborhood_overview: We're at the easternmost edge of Rogers Park, which is the northernmost neighborhood of the city before you get to Evanston. It feels more like a village than a neighborhood. If you walk south along the lake, you'll find a quiet and ethnically diverse working-class community. If you head southwest, towards the Jarvis El stop and beyond, you'll find the heart of Rogers Park -- a true hidden gem of this city. If you head west on Howard, you'll find an Afro-Caribbean community. As for places to go, the Lighthouse Tavern four blocks south is a wonderful neighborhood place. It's cash-only, but with a cash station inside.  The R Public House and Pointinstil are a bit more upscale and clustered around the Jarvis El stop. West on Howard, you've got a great Jamaican fast food place called Yamon, and four blocks past that you've got a great little brewpub called Peckish Pig. Half-way between them is our favorite place, Ethiopian Diamond 2.
notes: The main thing to note is that, while this is a house, it's a townhouse governed by a homeowners' association. We have close, friendly neighbors who are are kindly LETTING US rent our place out for short periods. They don't have to do this, and we won't tolerate anyone who violates their trust by being a shitty neighbor.
transit: For public transportation, you're a 40-second walk from the 147 Express bus and a five-minute walk from the Red, Purple, and Yellow lines of the El train system. The 147 takes you straight into the Loop, beginning at 4:30 am and running until 9:30 pm. It takes you out of the Loop until 10:30 pm. The El into and out of the Loop (the Red Line), by contrast, runs all night. The El into the suburbs (the Purple and Yellow lines) stop at a certain time.   The Red Line takes you to Wrigleyville (and Wrigley Field), Lakeview, Rush Street, the Loop, Comiskey Park, and beyond. The Purple takes you to Evanston. The Yellow takes you to Skokie. By car: you're a ten-second drive to Sheridan Road, which weaves through the North Shore if you head north and to Lake Shore Drive if you head south.  If you take the El back late at night, we recommend you get off at Jarvis instead of Howard. It's a wee bit closer, and it may be safer. (The Chicago Police Department reported 17 violent crimes at Howard last
access: You'll have exclusive use of the top floor, which is where the bedrooms are, and mostly exclusive use of the kitchen and dining areas (the exceptions being when one or both of us are in town, in which case you'll bump into us on the ground floor).  The compound also has a dock that you can use for quiet contemplation, but NO PARTIES.
interaction: If you're here while we're here, we'd love to hang out or show you the neighborhood, but only if that's your thing. We also do have friends over a lot and we encourage you to do the same. If you're unclear on the social use of the common areas, we can pin that down before you book
house_rules: You are responsible for taking out the garbage and keeping the back drain clear if you are occupying the whole place. The main rule is respect for neighbors: be quiet while on the sundeck: use only the LOWER deck, and keep the volume down. If you use common furniture, make sure to share with other residents. The homeowners' association has kindly extended to me the right to let my guests use the deck, but this right can be withdrawn if it is abused.
host_about: We've been hosting for years, and love meeting new and interesting people.

name: Magic Factory Lofts  - Not your typical Airbnb
summary: Our funky warehouse & former tavern turned costume factory turned fabulous Lincoln Park home can be your home away from home in Chicago.  Located in Chicago's newest neighborhood - 'SONO', at the crossroads of Lincoln Park - Old Town & River North -
space: Our fabulous 3 bedroom home in a converted warehouse on Halsted street between North Avenue and Division Street.  It’s roughly halfway between the highway and Lake Shore Drive, 2 blocks from the Red Line to downtown or the north side, 3 stops to Wrigley field and equal distance from the North and Division buses that run to Wicker Park and Bucktown. Why choose us? *Three Queen (double) beds    - 1 QUAD BEDROOM     - 1 TRIPLE BEDROOM     - 1 QUEEN BEDROOM *No need to turn the living room into a bedroom!* *Two full bathrooms (one with a shower/bath combo, the other a walk in shower) Amazing gourmet kitchen - seriously - this is an amazing kitchen - if you are a foodie or your vacation involves everyone gathering around the granite island making dinner together - there is no better space around than ours. *Free WiFi *Great restaurants & shopping nearby *Great transportation to everywhere *Friendly, experienced vacation rental owners  This part of Lincoln Park is a great location for those

neighborhood_overview: We are the center of the Chicago universe at the crossroads of: Lincoln Park  Old Town River North River West Wicker Park The West Loop Boystown There is no where you cannot get to easily from our Lincoln Park loft home.
notes: Basil and I have a pretty extensive online presence so you can get a great idea about past guest experiences by reading the reviews. Carole and Basil's Fabulous Acropolis View Penthouses in Athens  Athens Heritage House & Garden Suite Historic Center Luxury, Steps from the Parthenon And of course, our professional personna - Basil Kezios Greek Translations, Interpreting, Pliresousia Carole Heiman-Kezios, RealGreece travel planning services
transit: Red line Brown line Halsted bus  North Avenue bus Division Street bus
access: This is a private apartment booking.  You'll have exclusive use of the loft.  Indoor garage parking is also available for $20/night, booked directly with us, not available through airbnb.
interaction: Basil and I live in the building, though after 13 years in the vacation rental business, we know that guest privacy is important and we will never infringe upon yours. That said, if you want to have a glass of wine or a morning coffee with us, we'll never say no.  We are always available via phone and text and email and we're quick to reply if you have questions, concerns or issues.
house_rules: Our home is strictly a non smoking home.  Primary renter must be 25 years or older. No parties, no outside entertainers, no unregistered guests, no drugs or anything else that is illegal. IMPORTANT NOTE:  ***Upon confirmation of your booking we'll ask you to sign our reservation agreement which includes providing a list of the names  and and ages of those in your party who will be staying in the apartment & provide a major credit card in lieu of a security deposit - please do not request to book our home if you are not ok with doing this.***  IMPORTANT NOTE: Non-registered guests are not permitted in the apartment without prior written permission from the owners. The use of our loft for business purposes is strictly prohibited.   We love hosting guests in our vacation rental homes in Chicago and in Greece and we love sharing our two favorite cities - Athens & Chicago, with our guests. So, don't hesitate to knock on our door - we're always happy to help  with dining suggestions, touring
host_about:
Who would have thought when I boarded a plane for Greece more than 20 years ago, planning on backpacking through the mountains and then heading north through then Yugoslavia I'd end up making Greece my second home?
But here I am, 20 something years later, running a fabulous Greek vacation rental business with historic homes & penthouses in Athens, planning Greek travel itineraries and leading small group food & wine focused tours around my adopted homeland and loving the life that I am lucky enough to be living. Of course I did pick up an equally crazy, workaholic Greek husband along the way, as well as a stray Greek animal or two!

Update: End of November 2017 .... This year Basil and I celebrate 15 years opening our Greek vacation rentals to guests from around the world. All these years we've been hopping between Basil's home city, Athens and Carole's home city of Chicago.  Time and time again guests in Greece ask us if they can stay in our Chicago home while we're in Athens.... so we're finally doing it - we've just completed the renovation of a fab old factory with 3 vacation rentals called the Magic Factory Lofts. We've got 3 and 4 bedroom homes in the heart of the city with Big Shoulders -  in our hybrid warehouse (which in a previous life housed a bar and a dance hall, followed by a costume and magic card factory and then a photography studio where probably every Butterball turkey advertisement in the 1980s was shot .... the photos, not the turkeys!)

So come stay with us ... and then stay with us again. Whether we share an ouzo in Athens in our Acropolis View Alpha Plus penthouse or Sky Villa or a beer and a hot dog in Chicago, in our Magic Factory Lofts  we know that you won't be disappointed.

name: Everything you need-cozy/safe studio in Edgewater
summary: My studio is cozy and has everything you need for your stay in Chicago! It's in an extremely safe part of the city and has very accessible public transportation. Being on the North side of the city, there are plenty of more affordable bars, restaurants, and attractions that I would love to recommend! Please do not hesitate to contact me with any questions that you may have, I will answer promptly. :) I'll leave a flat iron, curling iron, and blow dryer for your use!  Btw the bed is super comfy!
space: Small studio apartment perfect for 2-3 people! I have a pull out single sofa bed and a full sized bed. The apartment building has a doorman which is a defining security feature. There is on-call maintenance 24-7 and the doorman will help with any questions that may arise during your stay.   There is one bathroom and one kitchen. In terms of appliances, I have a small blender, a microwave, stove, oven, fridge, freezer, keurig, and toaster oven. I also have a kettle and everything that you may need dish/silverware-wise. Shower towels, toilet paper, paper towels, soap, shampoo and conditioner will all be supplied. The unit has heat, an air conditioner, and a space heater is available as well.  Feel free to use my candles and essential oil diffuser to make things cozier :) There is a CVS, ALDI, and Whole Foods near. There is a small well-stocked food-mart across the street. There is a public gym with a pool attached to our building if you would like to purchase a pass. Its called "Edgewate

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is extremely safe. It is a block away from Loyola University Chicago, so there is a ton of campus security in the area. There is also neighborhood watch and even a Loyola campus security building across the street from here. This apartment is also one block away from the Chicago Red Line which is the 'L' train. This is VERY convenient and I use it to get everywhere. It is also a couple blocks away from major bus stops. Right across the street from here is a highly rated Chicago cafe called Metropolis (I have spend many hours doing homework here).  The restaurants here are super good and eclectic! I recommend the Ethiopian Diamond a few blocks away, Pete's Pizza on the corner of my street, Flaco's Tacos just under the 'L' train, and am willing to provide many other suggestions.  Another wonderful thing about the location, its just a block away from Lake Michigan! Right on the lake there is a cafe called The Waterfront Cafe that has a great view and great food. There are
transit: Like I said, I am a block away from the Chicago Red Line "Granville" 'L' stop.  This is the train line that runs North to South so the southbound train will take you straight to downtown without any transfers. It also takes you straight to Wrigley Field!  Distances: 15 min. to Wrigley Field 30 min. to Water Tower Place 35 min. to Millennium Park 45 min. to Navy Pier 45 min. to the Sky Deck Please let me know if you want information on the distances and directions to anywhere in the city and I can inform you of the best route!
access: You'll be able to access the entire apartment minus one closet, but I have racks and bins to store your clothes. You'll have access to laundry down the hall. You'll have access to the gym with the purchase of a pass.
interaction: I will be in Europe and the Middle East this summer for academic purposes, but my dad will be available in the area as needed. Otherwise, I will have international cellphone service and respond to my calls, texts, and emails promptly if you have any questions. I am more than happy to help explaining the public transportation system in detail, suggest restaurants or night life, and more.
host_about:
PhD student looking to rent my apartment out for the summer! I'll be in Europe and I could use the financial assistance. 
I love this city and I'm more than happy to answer any questions you may have about the listing or the city.

name: Stately Streeterville 2BR w/ Gym, Pool, W/D near Mag Mile, by Blueground
summary: Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this cozy Streeterville furnished two-bedroom apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and sophisticated living room with great balcony views. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Chicago has to offer! (#CHI67)
space: Thoughtfully designed with bespoke finishes, modern furnishings, and a fully-equipped kitchen, you’ll enjoy that “I’m home” feeling with this Blueground apartment. Whether you’re lounging in your lovely living room streaming the latest and greatest entertainment on the smart TV or premium wireless speaker, or getting some well-earned rest on the superior quality mattress with luxury linens, you’ll fall in love with everything this Streeterville apartment has to offer.  This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry. Amenities Building amenities unique to this two-bedroom apartment include an on-site:    - Doorman - Pet Friendly - Dog Park/Run - Swimming Pool - Gym - Indoor Parking - Garden - Elevator

neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is located in Streeterville, only a 5 minute walk from The Loop. One of the fastest-developing neighborhoods in Chicago, Streeterville extends out into Lake Michigan and attracts a blend of young professionals, students, and tourists. A plethora of amenities and activities exist for every lifestyle. From Navy Pier activities to luxury shopping on Michigan Avenue, it is a walkable community with easy access to entertainment.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions (including certain Bull Terriers and any related breeds). Wild animals and hybrids, including wolf and coyote hybrids, snakes, ferrets, rabbits, are all prohibited. Please contact us for precise breed restrictions. Please note that a one-off non refundable fee ($500) and a monthly rent ($25/mo/pet) is applicable upon reservation. Failing to notify us of any pets prior to check-in will incur a penalty, and may result in denied check-in. Supporting documents (ie. vaccinations) may be required - Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a $350 monthly fe
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

name: Clean, Garden Floor on Little Village Boulevard
summary: This is an old house that we are repairing. Our daughter lives in the top apartment, and there is a neighbor living in the first floor. We've lived in this neighborhood for over 20 years and would love to share our space with people traveling to Chicago. It is a basic set-up, with what you need for a comfortable and simple stay. The apartment is located in Little Village, one of Chicago's largest Mexican neighborhoods, and surrounded by local restaurants and cafes.
space: This is a three bedroom, garden-floor, apartment. There is one main room, with two individual rooms with single beds, and two convertible couches. The apartment is facing Marshall Boulevard, a historic boulevard in Chicago that provides grass and trees to relax under in the summer. It is located half a block away from the bus and two blocks from the pink line trainstation.

There is a door that leads to the back, but that will be kept locked, providing guests a key for emergenc
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in Little Village, one of Chicago's largest Mexican neighborhoods, and surrounded by local restaurants and cafes. There are local street vendors with tamales and fresh fruit just half a block during winter, as well as local restaurants. We are also two blocks away from Douglas Park, a large park where summer activities and concerts are held. The apartment is facing Marshall Boulevard, a historic boulevard in Chicago that provides grass and trees to relax under in the summer. It is located half a block away from the bus and two blocks from the pink line trainstation.
notes: Check-in is preferred any time after 3 pm to give us some time to get the apartment ready. Although somewhat flexible, we ask for an extra $20 for early check-in, particularly if it is before noon. There is an extra $30 per guest per night after 4 guests. Please make sure you mark the appropriate number of people who will be staying at the appartment.  Please note that some city noises can be heard from the apartment, including music from neighbors during summer time and a neighbor's dog once in a while. The apartment is one and a half blocks up the stairs.
transit: Parking is available on the street and side streets. Chicago Transit Authority has a bus that stops half a block away, and the train is two blocks away.
access: Guests will have access to the entire apartment. There is a door that leads to the back, but that will be kept locked, providing guests a key for emergencies.
interaction: I live two houses away, but like to give guests their independence.
house_rules: - Quiet hours after 11 pm

name: Sonder | Coeval | Lovely 2BR + Balcony
summary: We want everyone to have a comfortable place to stay. Our digital check-in and the ability to manage your stay from our app, means you won't need to interact with anyone in person. Our staff has been trained in proper disinfection techniques and will deep clean your Sonder before and after your stay. We're here for you during this time of uncertainty and can be reached 24/7 via text or call. Named the most innovative travel company of 2019 by Fast Company, Sonder has hosted a million guests in 5,000+ spaces with an average rating of 4.6 stars. Each space is designed and run by us, so you’ll always know what to expect from your stay. At Sonder, we’ve combined the best parts of home and hotel.   - 24/7 support via text, email, or phone   - Coffee, fresh towels, and bathroom essentials provided   - Hotel-standard cleaning before you arrive   - Self check-in

Picnic in the charming green space surrounding Museum Campus, or attend one of the many events at Grant Park such as The Taste of Chicago. Spend the day exploring the countless museums, or journey to the top of the 108-story Willis Tower for breathtaking views of the city.
notes: Exact views from the apartment are not guaranteed, the views could vary from the pictures listed. There’s no cable. We’ve provided a Chromecast for streaming.

Guests can cancel free of charge within 24 hours of booking (please contact us to process the refund). You’ll be charged 50% of the booking price (minus the service fee) if you cancel more than seven days before arrival, and 100% of the total price if you cancel within seven days of arrival. 3. Check-in is at 4 pm. Checkout is at 11 am. Early check-in or late checkout may be available upon request. Guests who stay beyond their designated checkout time or delay our housekeeping staff are liable for any associated costs and expenses. 4. Guests are not allowed to make a reservation in their city of residence. Please contact us if you're booking within your city. 5. Smoking, parties, and excessive noise are not allowed, including on balconies and in shared spaces. Smoking violations are subject to a $250 fine plus the cost to clean, deodorize, and repair damages. 6. Commercial photography/videogr

Now in 20+ cities, we’ve been featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and named 2019’s most innovative hospitality brand by Fast Company. We’ve taken the best parts of home and hotel and combined them into an entirely new experience. All of our spaces are uniquely designed, have 24/7 guest support, and contain all the essentials you need for an impeccable stay. No matter what you’re looking for, there’s a Sonder for you.

summary: Please make sure to review "Getting Around" details within the "Neighborhood" section. Nearest building intersection is 23rd St. & Leavitt St. to map transit options Newly remodeled three-bedroom apartment with modern finishes, smart tech & security, in a hip, central neighborhood minutes from downtown Chicago and part of all that trendy Pilsen has to offer. Managed by a seasoned team specializing in monthly furnished rentals. Per the City of Chicago ordinances, 31 night minimum on all stays
space: There is free street parking (unmetered) that is generally very available directly outside the building on Leavitt St. and for 3+ blocks both north and south on the same street, all of which is residential and not zoned/metered on both sides of the street :)  We’ve reliably found a spot within this during different times of day/evening/weekdays/weekends, but the majority of neighboring streets north of Cermak are also free and not zoned in the off chance that you can't find a parking space on the same block as the building :) Close to public transportation as well if you are not bringing a vehicle, please see "Getting Around" section. -Onsite indoor garage potentially available - please confirm availability prior to booking if you require this (as there are more apartments than there are garage spaces).  -Zinus 8" plush memory foam mattresses and pillows -High Efficiency LG Tromm washer/dryer - free for your use, (not coin-operated) within apartment -Lighting-quick wifi (250Mbps plan a

notes: Please note that the entire reservation amount is NOT due at the time of booking :) One month's rent is charged, and then the rest is charged by Airbnb in monthly installments. https://www.airbnb.com/help/article/245/how-do-i-pay-for-my-long-term-reservation The owners of this apartment building invested a significant amount of time, money, and resources into a complete renovation in the summer of 2017. That said, the building is over 75 years old and, though greatly cared for, shows its age in some places. Expect to find some loving wear, quaint aging and minor quirks that you might not find in a brand new high-rise :) We are a monthly stay company only and thus we do not apply a monthly discount on our Airbnb listings: our "nightly" rate reflects the pricing for 30 days or more. Any further discounts to our listed rate need to be approved by owners, and factors that they value include but aren't limited to: -potential stays longer than 3 months -potential guests with 2 or more positi

Sinai Hospital 7 minute commute via CTA to Planet Fitness, or 12 minute walk ~20-23 minute commute via CTA to Jesse Brown VA Hospital, John Stroger Cook County Hospital, Rush University Medical Center,  Jesse Brown VA Hospital, and UIC Hospital The nearest intersection to the apartment building is 23rd St. and Leavitt St. (exact address not disclosed prior to a confirmed booking so as to be sensitive to our curren
access: -Full, private access to everything pictured. -Viewing all the pictures, descriptions, and reviews of this listing as well as others in the area is a great way to familiarize yourself with the property, location, and living experience. -Link to other listings we manage -  (Website hidden by Airbnb)  Because most of our guests stay for more than 2 months, we likely have fewer reviews than other listings in our area. As many of our listings within the same buildings do offer a similar experience, we encourage potential guests to look at reviews from other of our listings as well get a better feel. The listings clustered close together as shown on the map are likely ones within the same building -Permission to enter – unless you request otherwise, please note that if any repair/fix is discovered and needs to be addressed, we will provide 24 hours notice that someone on our staff will be entering the unit address it. We will do our best to provide an accurate timeframe in these circumstanc

As a physical therapist and associate with a global logistics firm, we've experienced and understand the needs of traveling professionals & students and seek to minimize the worries that oftentimes accompany out of town stays.

name: Chicago Comfortable Room

neighborhood_overview: Just north of downtown Chicago, and nestled against the Lake Michigan shoreline, is the Gold Coast. As the name would imply, the area is one of the country's most affluent neighborhoods. With streets that are lined with historic mansions and specialty boutiques, the Gold Coast is an intensely popular area for residents and visitors. Branching off of The Magnificent Mile is Oak Street, an upscale shopper's dream. The retail revelry includes internationally recognized stores, swanky boutiques and rare, designer fashions.  A day of shopping becomes a night of revelry on the neighborhood's fabled Rush Street. Amongst the prestigious hotels and celebrated eateries, you will find a trove of booming nightlife hot spots and high-energy events. Treat yourself to the Gold Coast, you deserve it.
notes: A sofa bed for extra person.
transit: Taxis are always driving around,busses, uber,lift, Red line CTA train station few blocks away too. UBER: This is a personal-driver service that is approx 20% cheaper than a taxi. It's an easy-to-download app where you can enter the pick-up address and a driver will pick you up in 10 mins or less.

name: Drake of Avondale GARAGE PARKING INCLUDED
summary: Airbnb SuperHost! Garage parking! Gas forced air (heat) and a whole home humidifer! New rehab (new plumbing, electrical, central a/c, more)! This private 2 bed 1 bath (plus extra queen sleeper sofa) garden unit is as nice as it gets! Minutes from expressway and CTA! It has every amenity you could hope for! Washer/dryer in unit, all brand new stainless steel appliances, tankless water heater (endless hot water)...Flat screen with cable TV and Roku (Netflix, Hulu, more) and 50 mb/s internet!
space: When you're deciding between my Airbnb and one close-by just know there are probably big differences. This place has garage parking right on the property. That place has street parking (10 minutes of driving around searching for a spot that you may never find). This place is registered with the city. That place has "pending" registration and you risk losing your reservation when the city starts removing these listings from Airbnb. This place has gas forced air (heat) with a whole home humidifier. That place has radiators with cold spots and dry uncomfortable air. This place has a washer/dryer, dishwasher and garbage disposal. That place probably has none of those things. This place has a tankless water heater allowing your group to take an endless amount of consecutive showers without ever running out of hot water. That place probably has an undersized hot water tank causing the second person to lose hot water half-way into their shower and the next person will have to wait 30 minutes

neighborhood_overview: Avondale is a beautiful and tranquil neighborhood on the northwest side of Chicago. The only thing you can hear in the morning are birds chirping. Avondale along with its neighbor to the south Logan Square has quickly become one of the best destinations in Chicago for food from high end cuisine like Michelin rated Parachute to cheap eats like the highly regarded Taqueria Mazamitla. For those wanting to make use of the stocked kitchen there's an Aldi grocery store that's an 8-minute walk, Walgreens (5 minutes), and Jewel grocery store (5 minute drive). Wrigley Field is accessible by taking the Belmont bus (1/2 block north) directly east to Wrigleyville.
notes: Free garage parking available right behind the Airbnb (vehicles with a max height of 75" only). It's about a 50 foot walk from garage door to the backdoor of the Airbnb. The street parking in front of the building is permit and you will require a daily pass that I will provide free of charge if you have a second car. I will message you a day prior to your arrival to ask how many cars are in your group along with any pertinent information about your stay.
transit: Kennedy Expressway is a few minutes away Blue Line train (8 minute walk) will take you downtown in around 20 minutes and to/from O'Hare Airport in 25 minutes There's also a bike sharing service (Divvy) in Chicago and there's a station right across from the Blue Line (8 minute walk)
access: Feel free to roam around the ground level of the property.
interaction: All locks are electronic and you will be given a code to enter the premises. No keys to worry about. You don't have to meet me at any point but I live above your unit and I will be do my best to make everything right as quickly as possible. No reasonable request will be denied!
house_rules: -There is a maximum of 6 people allowed to occupy the unit according to the Chicago Shared Housing Ordinance. This is non-negotiable. -NO BACHELOR OR BACHELORETTE PARTIES ALLOWED (I have neighbors on both sides and excessive noise is unacceptable) -Loud noise coming from inside the unit can be heard by both neighbors so please be respectful. -Smoking isn't allowed inside the unit. Breaking this rule will result in a $600 additional fee. There is a table with an ashtray and chairs outside the backdoor where you can smoke. I'd prefer if you did not smoke out front either out of respect to the neighborhood. - Please respect the neighbors and be quiet while entering and leaving. If you are in the backyard after 8pm, please keep the volume of your voices to a minimum. No congregating anywhere outside after 10pm on weekdays and 11pm on weekends. -If you return to the Airbnb late at night, please be silent while entering the unit and close the gate quietly. The eight closest homes will all be
host_about: I'm a residential real estate developer that specializes in rehabbing, as opposed to tearing down, in order to preserve the architectural integrity of Chicago.

name: The GOAT at U. Chicago
summary: Our two story row-house with finished basement studio is the perfect option for large groups looking for a communal space to gather, while at the same time being able to enjoy privacy in your own spaces. The main floor offers an open concept living space, while the attached basement studio has its own self-sufficient living area. Steps away from the University of Chicago, easy access to downtown via public transportation, and a short walk to downtown Hyde Park. Make us your Chicago touring base!
space: FIRST FLOOR Living room -  Seating area for 6-7 with chaise lounge sofa, arm and rocking chairs. 55" TV equipped with (Hidden by Airbnb) Chromecast that includes local tv and streaming capabilities.  Kitchen-custom built reclaimed wood island with raised breakfast bar. Open access makes cooking and socializing easy.  Sun room- space with books and toys make for a comfy play space for the kiddos (or adults). From there, sliding doors open out onto a patio with charcoal BBQ, lawn and garden, serving as a wonderful oasis away from the city after a busy day!  Powder room- simple, classic design. SECOND FLOOR The second floor includes three  bedrooms, two bathrooms and a laundry room. BED AND BATH ONE Features large glass sliding doors opening onto a Juliet balcony,  a warm, fluffy area rug, and full closet for storage. Your bath features a large, open shower and reclaimed wood vanity with a huge sink, all features that are consistent with a relaxing, uplifting vibe. Your bed is a full and

neighborhood_overview: Parks galore in Hyde Park! Walk 15 minutes east and you hit the Lake Shore trail which can make for a very relaxing morning. Stroll over to historic Jackson Park, home of the 1896 World's Fair. There are also numerous coffee shops and a wide variety of restaurants. Enjoy close proximity to the University of Chicago and all of its unique cultural offerings including the Oriental Institute Museum, the Smart Museum of Art, the Renaissance Museum, and of course, the beautiful architecture in and around campus. Also within walking distance are the Museum of Science and Industry and the Dusables Museum of African American History.  Hyde Park is a great place for those who want to explore the city but step away from the chaos at night and see one of the few remaining diverse neighborhoods of Chicago.
transit: There is plenty of free parking in front of our house, so if you are renting a car or driving your own, our place is very convenient.  TO/FROM AIRPORTS:  From Midway Airport: Take the 55 bus straight west to University stop. From there, walk about 2 minutes north and you have arrived!  From O'Hare: Take the Blue Line to Jackson and transfer to the Red Line. Take Red Line south to the Garfield stop. Cross the street and catch the 55 bus eastbound. Get off at University Ave. Walk 2 minutes north and you are here!  OPTIONS FOR GETTING DOWNTOWN: 1) Walk 10 minutes east on 55th St. to catch the 6 express bus which will take you up to Michigan Avenue and Millenium Park, Art Museum, etc. 2) Walk 15 minutes to 53rd and Lake Park to catch the METRA running north to the Museum campus that includes the Aquarium, Planetarium, and Field Museum. GETTING TO FAR NORTH SIDE: Take 55th St. bus west to the Red Line to catch the Red Line north to the Zoo, Wrigley and all other subway connections.
interaction: We will be available by phone throughout your stay. In case of emergency, we have people in the area who can help.
house_rules: Quiet hours outside at 10 p.m.  No guests besides those listed in the reservation.  Take shoes off upon entering house.
host_about:
This is now our eighth year living in Chicago and we love it! My wife, Jolin and I originally met when I was living in Taiwan and now we are a family of four. I teach Mandarin Chinese in the Chicago Public Schools and my wife has the more daunting task of managing her own private tutoring along with raising our little ones, Baea and Kylin (6 years old and  3 years old respectfully). When we are able, we love to travel and have had the most wonderful experiences here on Airbnb. Can't wait to meet you!

We look forward to meeting you!

name: Luxurious King Suite w/ Sofa just steps to Wrigley
summary: Our 320 SqFt King Suite room features a dedicated seating area, local artwork, and bespoke millwork to add comfort and brightness to your stay. Get cozy in our plush king bed outfitted with crisp white sheets and feel refreshed with our custom-tiled bathroom complete with contemporary finishes. In room amenities include locally curated minibar, plush bathrobes, luxurious bedding, WiFi, in-room dining, 50” Smart TV, boutique bath products, garment steamer, and rooftop access.

neighborhood_overview: Nestled in between Chicago’s boisterous restaurants and lively bars, The Wheelhouse Hotel is walking distance from the Addison El stop on the red line and a quick one block walk from historic Wrigley Field. Whether you’re in town for a baseball game or looking to explore the city on a more local level, let our luxe accommodations, unexpected surprises, attentive service, and delightful design be the backdrop to your Windy City stay.
transit: The Wheelhouse Hotel is two blocks from the Addison stop of the CTA Red Line, three blocks from the Belmont stop of the CTA Brown Line and steps away from the Clark & Cornelia stop of the #22 Bus. If driving, your best parking options are the enclosed garage at 3511 N Clark ($45/night) the surface lot at 1013 W Roscoe ($30), and a handful of street parking spots.
interaction: 24 hour reception desk
host_about: Welcome to the Wheelhouse Hotel. Rooted in history, with an eye towards the future and an ever present atmosphere of playful celebration, our spunky hotel brings intimate, unpretentious, luxury lodging to Chicago’s spirited Wrigleyville neighborhood. Just steps away from all the action yet miles away from ordinary, you’ll have a front row seat to a hyper-local experience.

neighborhood_overview: Beautiful apartment, tree-lined streets, safe neighborhood with lots of single family houses, 30 second walk to the el or bus, east street parking available!
notes: Never tell any neighbors you are Airbnb guests. Please say that you are my friends. Or regular guests from out of town.  This is important.  We're not doing anything wrong, and I'm not disobeying my lease, it just keeps things simpler.
transit: Steps to Montrose Brown Line stop AND the #78 bus! Very cheap taxi from O'hare! The most I've ever paid, including tip, is $36. Usually it's $32. Uber/Lyft are about $8 cheaper.
access: Everything!  Just bring your own stuff so you don't need to look through my drawers/cabinets. There is literally no reason you need to open my cabinets and drawers. Everyone does it and it’s a real bummer.
interaction: I will not be here during your stay.  **This is not intended to be a party rental** Don't even think about it. My downstairs neighbor is sweet and kind so please don't be loud or he will tell me, and you will have to leave. I have never gotten a single complaint from him. Let's keep it that way :)
house_rules: -Take your shoes off. -Leave the place as you found it. (No dishes left out anywhere, no food left in fridge, make beds.) -Close the apartment door. Every time. Here are the basics, most of them are just common sense but need to be stated anyway :) ... 1. Quiet time is from 10:59pm – 8:00am. Please respect neighbors during these hours. (No loud music/talking/disturbance) NO  TALKING ON THE STAIRS ON THE WALK UP TO THE APARTMENT EVER. Once inside, you are free to talk as much as you want of course. 2. No guests are allowed in the apartment other than those who are listed in the initial Airbnb confirmation at any time during your stay. Not anyone, not for any reason. 3. No Pets, other than the host's, will be allowed inside premises during guest's stay. Unless otherwise agreed upon beforehand. 4. No drug use or smoking in the apartment or around the apartment (this includes the porch). 5. Premises are to be left in the same condition as they were found in upon check in. This means cleani
host_about:
I am a comedian who moved here from Seattle a couple years ago.
In Seattle I was actually a dog trainer and fitness boot camp instructor, and a comedian on the side-- so I decided to flip that script! I have a small well behaved dog (12 lbs) and I love to laugh!

name: 2 Bed, Spacious, Open, Bright, 5 min Walk 2 train!
summary: This huge, 2 bedroom private apartment is perfect for any traveler.   The CTA Green line is a short walk away.  The train takes you downtown in 10 minutes.  There is a large stocked kitchen and space to entertain.  You'll be comfortable weather you're here for a night or a month!
description: This huge, 2 bedroom private apartment is perfect for any traveler.   The CTA Green line is a short walk away.  The train takes you downtown in 10 minutes.  There is a large stocked kitchen and space to entertain.  You'll be comfortable weather you're here for a night or a month! house and yard As much or little as you like! We want to under promise and over deliver.  So we want to be clear that this property is on Chicago's West side in an amazing multicultural and ethnically diverse neighborhood.  It is, for sure in the inner city.  It's full of grime and glory.  You can't walk to a coffee shop but you can make eye contact and chit chat with a total stranger. Not many places in a big city where that happens anymore.  If you're not familiar with big cities, do a street view on a mapping service to make sure you'll feel comfortable with the area.  We absolutely love it here!! CTA green line stops at the Kedzie stop. Metra DIVY bike program Uber anywhere in a snap Free street parking us
neighborhood_overview: We want to under promise and over deliver.  So we want to be clear that this property is on Chicago's West side in an amazing multicultural and ethnically diverse neighborhood.  It is, for sure in the inner city.  It's full of grime and glory.  You can't walk to a coffee shop but you can make eye contact and chit chat with a total stranger. Not many places in a big city where that happens anymore.  If you're not familiar with big cities, do a street view on a mapping service to make sure you'll feel comfortable with the area.  We absolutely love it here!!
notes: Free street parking usually right out front.  We do allow pets but we ask that you treat them like a third person and add them to the booking.  This way we can afford to pay the extra cleaning that is required.
transit: CTA green line stops at the Kedzie stop. Metra DIVY bike program Uber anywhere in a snap
access: house and yard
interaction: As much or little as you like!
house_rules: Simple... No Fire (This includes smoking) No Vomit No Anger Absolutely no smoking even on the deck or backyard.  All guests in the unit must be on the booking regardless of weather they spend the night.  Out of respect to our wonderful neighbors,  please mind noise levels at all time!
host_about: Our quality of life depends on how well we deal with adversity!  Feel positive. Live positive.  I grew up in a small coastal town in Maine.  When I turned 19 I realized that I was a closet wanderer.  So I hit the road and covered much of the U.S. and all of Europe.  I taught skiing in the Rockies and rode my BMW R65-LS from coast to coast.  When I was in Europe I was amazed at how willing people were to open their homes to a total stranger.  I had one of my best experiences living with a family in Romania in the Carpathian Mountains.  Amazing!  I feel this is the best way possible to travel.  It's part of why I love Air B&B.  Hotel shmotel!  Live the life of the area.  That's an experience.  Now my wandering days are over.  I'm rooted in one of the coolest communities I know.  Rich with art and spirit. I have two amazing girls that help me garden, can, collect eggs and milk.  My partner is a fellow East Coast boy, avid hockey player and my right hand man. I also tour with an ABBA tribute band as well as a Pink Floyd tribute band but don't hold that against me.  I hope you like it here half as much as we do!!

name: Sunny + Spacious 2 BR Apt in Downtown Chicago
summary: This clean and spacious 2nd floor (about 40 stairs) walk up two bedroom apartment is located in the heart of Chicago. It's close to the best shopping, restaurants, art galleries & museums the city has to offer! +Have 4 listings in the same building- each accommodates 5  or 6 people. +Location: Oak Street and Orleans Street.  View on (Hidden by Airbnb) Maps before booking if you are unfamiliar with the area! +Located 1/2 block from L Train (passes through) please note if you're a light sleeper!
space: This sun drenched and spacious apartment overlooks the city skyline making the open kitchen and living room a great communal living space. The apartment has a front and back entrance, along with a patio area where guests can enjoy their morning coffee, get some fresh air and relax. This urban, modern and spacious apartment is a great place for big and small groups. There are two bedrooms (queen and full bed), a living area equipped for an extra guest, one bathroom, a washer/dryer (in unit), and fully equipped kitchen. Flat screen TV with Amazon Fire TV and complementary Wifi.  *PLEASE NOTE: We do not have cable but we do have AMAZON FIRE STICK (4,000 channels, apps and games)  + FREE STREET PARKING located in the back of the building on first come first serve basis OR paid metered parking per hour OR garage parking a few blocks away on Chesnut Street.  + Located 1/2 block from L Train so please note if you're a light sleeper! + 15 minute walk to Oak Street Beach or 7 minutes by car  +

There are two bedrooms (queen and full bed), a living area equipped for an extra guest, one bathroom, a washer/dryer (in unit), and f
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in Downtown, Chicago. It is near Cabrini Green (no longer existing) and Near North Side districts, and as seen on the map below, in the River North area. There is a very prestigious high school (Walter Payton College Prep) across the street, town homes with young families and popular cafes and restaurants (Big and Little's) in the neighborhood.  It's the place to be! Formerly home to many factories, it's modern mix of high-rises and historical buildings adds to the neighborhood's eccentric feel. You can find some of the most popular restaurants, dive bars, lounges (nightclubs), jazz clubs and art galleries here. The area is ideal for a traveller. The apartment is near all major shopping and nightlife streets, while also being walking distance from Lake Michigan. Places to see:  + Navy Pier  + Lookingglass Theatre  + Merchandise Mart  + Headquarters Beercade River North  + Museum of Contemporary Art  + House of Blues  + Blue Chicago  + Wateriders Kayak Tours  +
notes: Early check in fee of $30 between hours of 12am- 10am.
transit: Public transport is very accessible. 5 minute walk to the Red Line and 7 minute walk to the Brown Line CTA. There is a bus stop on the corner and many other lines (train, bus, city bikes) can be reached by foot in under seven minutes.
house_rules: + No parties or events. + No loud music.  + No shoes inside.   + No unaccounted for guests.  House Rules 1. All bookings require a security deposit of $500. You will not be charged for this in advance. 2. Strict Cancellation: For a full refund of accommodation fees, cancellation must be made within 48 hours of booking and at least 14 full days prior to listing’s local check-in time (or 3:00 PM if not specified) on the day of check-in. 3. Check-in time is any time after 3pm. Check-out time is any time before 11 am. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout, but this is not guaranteed and we can only confirm 24 hours in advance. 4. We do not allow smoking; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. 5. All of our locations do not allow pets. 6. Parties or excessive noise are not allowed in our locations. Quite hours art after 10pm. 7. If a location is left in an exceptionally messy state, we will charge $50 for every extra hour of cleaning required. 8. Guests take full
host_about:
Hello,

We're Eva + Mario, nice to meet you! 

Apart from hosting, we love to cook, travel and stay active. Eva's favorite destination is Taipei and Mario's is Croatia. Eva's favorite food is pizza (biggest Lou Malnati's out there!) and Mario's is the BLT sandwich at Publican Quality Meats. 

We're locals from Chicago so if you need anything at all during your stay, we're here to help. Our goal is to make your Airbnb experience as enjoyable as possible!

name: Beautiful Lincoln Park/ De Paul Complimentary Pkg
summary: A perfect place to unwind and relax after a long day of exploring Chicago. Nestled in quiet, tree lined streets tucked away from all the hustle and bustle is the best way to recharge. How about a glass of wine or beer and watch a movie on Netflix?
space: The newly renovated spacious apartment is furnished with brand new modern king bed in the bedroom to ensure restful nights.   In large living room, beautiful cherry dining table to enjoy morning coffee and comfortable L-shape leather sofa for watching your favorite movies from Netflix on 43" flat screen TV.   The brand new fully equipped kitchen has a granite countertops, stainless steel appliances.  The modern marble bathroom has a huge mirror over the sink, glass sliding shower doors, a full size bath tub and a hair dryer.
description: A perfect place to unwind and relax after a long day of exploring Chicago. Nestled in quiet, tree lined streets tucked away from all the hustle and bustle is the best way to recharge. How about a glass of wine or beer and watch a movie on Netflix?
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is super conveniently located in the Armitage/Sheffield. It's 2 1/2 blocks or 5 minutes walk to both Brown and Red line stations which make getting around Chicago fast and easy.  Visiting lake front Millennium Park takes less than 20 minutes from the apartment.  My neighborhood is surrounded by Old Town, full of local shops and restaurants, Wrigley Field, eclectic Bucktown shops, and the Lincoln Park Zoo. The 3 Michelin-starred restaurant, Alinea is 2-minute walk from the door.
notes: No smoking, no street shoes, no parties allowed.   The nightly rates are for 2 guests only and $25 guest fee applys for 3rd guest.  There is a $500.00 penalty for breaking the each rule.
transit: Take either Red ( North/Clybourn ) or Brown (Armitage/Sheffield ) line for exploring Rush st( 1 stop) Water Tower, Michigan Ave, Mag miles, Gold Coast( 2 stops ) The Navy Pier( 3 stops)  Millennium Park, Cloud Gate/ The Bean, Buckingham Fountain, Art Institute of Chicago,( 4stops).  Both stations are within 5 min walking distance from the apartment. It's also a short cab or Uber ride to Michigan Ave. Gold Coast.
access: Spacious 3 room apartment with all the amenities specified above is for guests use only and  free residential parking permits provided upon request.
interaction: I'm always available.   I live on the 2nd floor of the townhouse with my husband and work at  a bridal  boutique which I own  on west Armitage Ave.
house_rules: - Quiet hours begins at 10pm - No Shoes - No Smoking
host_about: Born and Raised in Seoul, South Korea, have been designing wedding dress for past 20 years. A curious wonderer, a gypsy at heart,a mostly outsider. See beauty in everything, everywhere.
