name: Vintage Apartment in the Heart of the Ukrainian Village
summary: Stand at the bay window, looking out on the tree-lined street. This apartment is filled with restored oak woodwork including a bookcase with leaded stained glass and oak pocket doors. An antique fireplace showcases original green subway tile details.
space: The flat is full of restored original oak woodwork, including a built-in bookcase with leaded stained glass, hardwood floors, 10 ft. ceilings, oak pocket doors, and bay windows on a tree lined street in the heart of the Ukrainian Village. We admire the work of Frank Lloyd Wright and you will see prairie style mission elements throughout the building. Ukrainian Village is a historic Chicago neighborhood located south of Wicker Park. Its boundaries are Division St. to the north, Chicago Ave. to the south, Western Ave. to the west, and Damen Ave.  to the east.  It was the first neighborhood to be designated an ‘official neighborhood’  in 1983.  A section of the neighborhood that we are in was designated as a Chicago Landmark District in 2002.
description: Stand at the bay window, looking out on the tree-lined street. This apartment is filled with restored oak woodwork including a bookcase with leaded stained glass and oak pocket doors. An antique fireplace showcases original green subway tile details.
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is in the Ukrainian Village, offering an eclectic mix of cafes, restaurants, boutiques, music venues, and dive bars. It’s a few blocks away from the action on Division, but still nestled in the shadow of several Orthodox churches.
notes: Infants under 2 years old  stay at no extra cost. Children 2 years and up considered extra person. Inquire if you need a crib, high chair, or toys.
transit: We are 2 blocks from both the Division Street and Chicago Avenue  bus lines. A ten minute trip will take you right into downtown.  A twenty minute Uber will take you to McCormick Place. If you are driving there is plenty of street parking and a parking lot in the rear of our building including Zip cars. We are also one block a way from Chicago's bike sharing program-Divvy where for a small fee you can pick up a bike and drop it off at one of hundreds of stations throughout the city. If your coming from the O'hare airport you can take a train to Damen Avenue stop and we are a few blocks walking distance from that stop. "This area is a walker’s paradise — daily errands do not require a car. It’s convenient to use a bike for most trips. Transit is excellent and convenient for most trips."
access: You are welcome to all the amenities the flat has to offer. We like to cook so you will find a kitchen  stocked with appliances, cookware, knives and plenty of spices and condiments all available to you. Please help yourself to complimentary coffee, tea, water and soft drinks during your stay. Please just provide your own food when cooking. The Living room has a LED flat panel TV,  and a DVD player. Feel free to browse and play out of our DVD library as well as our 300+ CD collection. You can also plug your I pod into the sound system. The flat is equipped with high speed wi-fi throughout, and the kitchen is equipped with a USB charging station for your peripherals.  The Master bathroom is full of amenities such as travertine tile floors, glass shower, a floating glass sink, and a Jacuzzi tub surrounded by glass block. You are welcome to use washer & dryer so you don't have to go home with dirty clothes, A clothes steamer is also available for the business travelers.  The flat is on th
interaction: We live in the building, and always will be  accessible by text or email. We will do everything we can to make your stay as comfortable as possible so if there is something specific that you require let us know and we will do our best to accommodate your request.
house_rules: No drugs No commercial activities No excessive noise after 10 p.m. Checkout time is 11:00 a.m. Please recycle and enjoy your visit :))
host_about:
Hi, I'm Jason! After spending 6 years in Prague and using Airbnb extensively, I have re-patriated back to Chicago and now host fellow travelers along their journeys. 

I have a passion for travel & cooking- 58 countries & counting. I am pleased and  very excited to be able to turn the tables and act as a host within the community. 

I'm pretty laid back, so looking to host the same type of travelers in our space.

Ciao 

Jason

Its a modern, warm, cozy home.   Lawrence train stop is 1/2 block away. Like a Hotel, everything is provided.  2 full bathrooms w showers and double vanities and a  1/2 bath on the 1st floor. space: We are and have been Airbnb "SUPER HOSTS" for over 7 years. That means Airbnb designates us as a host that does not cancel reservations, responds quickly to inquiries and questions, gets 5 star ratings at least 80% of the time from guests. We have never in 7 years cancelled a reservation that was made. We have had over 3000 guests in the home.  This is an entire home, not one of several shiny condos owned by a corporation or real estate agency with sparse furniture and unreliable airbeds. It is a house completely decorated with real beds. We have a king size $3000.00 Kluft mattress and a $2000.00 MiForma mattress among others,  All 11 beds have real mattresses. It's warm and cozy here.  It's a House. You will really feel like your at "home". There are 2 outdoor decks, backyard. There are 5 bedrooms. 6 queen size beds, one King size bed, one futon and there are 4 fold out mattress beds. neighborhood_overview: We are located  in an entertainment district with lots of restaurants like Agami Sushi, Caravan and Ethiopian Demera. There are lots of theaters and clubs 1/2 block away like the Riviera  and Aragon with live music. The most famous drag bar in the Midwest, the Baton Show lounge is one block away, very popular with Bachelorette parties. Carols is probably the most famous Country and Western bar in Chicago and within walking distance,  Agami a great bar for drinking and ordering Sushi, one block away. . There is a large rock climbing gym and work out space called First Ascent, one block away. Uptown Arcade is a bar with free Video games one block away. The world famous Green Mill Jazz club is one block away, next to the Green Mill  is a Blues Bar with food and drinks. 2 sports bars, Caravan and Fat Cat are around the corner. America's largest theater 5.000 seat Uptown Theater is next to the Green Mill and is currently under renovation. The neighborhood is very diverse . Everybody in the
notes: The 3rd floor shower control is reversed so turn to the right for hot water. Keep the 2nd floor shower door open after use as it's air tight and mold will grow if the door is shut.
transit: The Train to all parts of the city is only 1/2 block away and it runs 24/7.  We are  15 minutes from the city center by train. Wrigley Field  is about 8 minutes away by train, only 12 blocks and  the Beach is 8 blocks away. The Dock is a restaurant bar on the beach with live music 7 days a week. A city bike stand is literally across the street from the house.
access: The  home is open to the guests. There is an office area that  we would prefer guests don't enter. A basement apartment isolated from the house is occupied by the owners. Please make sure the gate is locked and closed when leaving. There is a bolt on the inside of the gate. When leaving, simply reach through the grate in the gate and push the bolt into the side wall. Do the same when entering, reach through the grate and push the bolt open.
interaction: We will not be present in the rented part of the house during your stay at anytime unless asked  to enter.
house_rules: No smoking inside, though it is permitted on the decks. There can be NO USING THE FIREPLACE! PLEASE! Be careful about using the garbage disposal. No food, sponges, paper towels, cloth can go in the garbage disposal. Put food scraps in the garbage can. We have had to call plumbing numerous times due to sponges and cloth clogging the pipes....Thanks! People coming from outside the home who are not staying  in the house must be ok'd prior to your stay and this is not permitted if they are not relatives or close. This is not a crazy party house.  Parties are allowed for the people who are staying (sleeping, renters) in the house. Parties with people not part of the up to 16 people staying at the house is not allowed. You cannot bring people in from the outside who are not staying in the house without permission. No stomping on the floors. No yelling and screaming on the outside decks. Please be respectful of the neighbors. Thanks! The huge upper deck is available for all but conversation m
host_about: We are easy going, relaxed, have a sense of humor and are helpful in many ways to all our guests.

name: A Sunny 2BR in Wicker Park - Perfect Location! ❤️
summary: Elegantly decorated and spacious 2-bedroom/1.5 bathroom apartment in Lakeview. ✔ Close to transit, dining, bars, shops, groceries, and Chicago landmarks. ✔ Free access to members-only club in the Willis Tower (details below). ✔ Experienced hosts with 2,000+ reviews on-call to answer your questions. ✔ Safe and vibrant neighborhood. ✔ Convenient parking options nearby. ✔ Easy self-check-in & keyless entry. ✔ 12-min train ride to downtown via the nearby Damen 'L' train stop.
space: "This apartment was perfect. Very clean, great location (walking distance to so many things), and big. It was beyond what I expected and I’ll definitely be booking it every time I come to Chicago." -Aly The perfect blend of modern styling and classic charm that can only be found in an updated vintage unit like this. This apartment comfortably sleeps four.  ￫ Room 1 (queen bed)  ￫ Room 2 (queen bed) APARTMENT HIGHLIGHTS ✔ High-speed internet ✔ Fully equipped kitchen ✔ Keyless entry ✔ In-unit washer/dryer ✔ 40" Smart TV w/ Netflix (no cable TV) ✔ Keurig coffee maker ️LOCATION️ Because of our central location, we recommend leaving your car at home. Any point of interest in Chicago can easily be reached by walking, public transit, or Uber. ￫ The Damen Blue line 'L' train station is a 4-minute walk away. ￫  O'Hare is 40 minutes away via public transit and 25-45 minutes away via Uber. ￫  Midway is 60 minutes away via public transit and 30-60 minutes away via Uber. PARKING Parking in Chicago

neighborhood_overview: We’re located on the north side of Chicago in Wicker Park, one of Chicago’s trendiest and safest neighborhoods. Our neighborhood is a wonderful mix of bustling streets packed with local restaurants and shops, as well as quiet tree-lined streets full of historic buildings. We’re also minutes away from many of Chicago’s most popular spots.
notes: ❓FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS❓ 1. “How do I get to ‘x’ from the apartment?/How far is the apartment from ‘x’?” Excellent public transit directions from our apartment to any point in the city are available via web search. Our building is just a short walk from the Damen “L” train station. Search for “Damen blue line station” in Maps, click the “Directions” button, then enter your point of interest. 2. “Is there parking nearby?” Parking in Chicago is always difficult, especially in the evening and during special events. We highly recommend using an app called SpotHero to reserve a nearby paid parking spot. We love SpotHero because it allows you to reserve a parking spot in advance so that you don’t have to worry about finding one when you arrive. 3. When is check-in/check-out? Check-in: Your reservation and access to the apartment both begin at 3 p.m. As a courtesy, you can stop by anytime after 11:30 a.m. to drop off your bags in the living room. Check-out: Your reservation and access to
transit: Because of our central location, we recommend leaving your car at home. Any point of interest in Chicago can easily be reached by walking, public transit, or Uber. ￫ The Damen Blue line 'L' train station is a 4-minute walk away. ￫  O'Hare is 40 minutes away via public transit and 25-45 minutes away via Uber. ￫  Midway is 60 minutes away via public transit and 30-60 minutes away via Uber.
access: The entire apartment is yours to use during your stay. The apartment includes: ✔ Two bedrooms with queen-size beds. ✔ One full bathroom. ✔ Sunny and spacious living room with smart TV (no cable). ✔ Dining area. ✔ Fully-stocked kitchen.
interaction: Need more towels? Deep dish pizza recommendations? We're always on call to answer your questions.
house_rules: 1) Only the reservation holder and guests added to the reservation via Airbnb may stay overnight.   2) As a courtesy to your neighbors, please keep noise to a minimum, especially between 9 pm - 9 am. 3) This is a non-smoking apartment. If smoke is detected, a cleaning fee of $150 will be charged. 4) No late check-outs. Check-out is at 11 am.  In order to compensate our cleaning assistants for lost time, additional charges will be sent if they're unable to begin their job at 11 am. One hour or less - $25 Each additional hour - $40 5) Damaged/stained/missing towels, bedding, and/or furnishings will incur additional fees. The per-item fees are as follows: Bedsheet- $12 Towel - $12 Pillow - $30 Pillowcase: $10 Comforter - $50 Clothes hangers - $3 Furnishings - Dependant on item

name: 6 Bed Home Near DT w/Parking & Panoramic Roof Deck
summary: Welcome to Old Town, one of Chicago's safest neighborhoods. Just a quick 5 minute drive to downtown and within walking distance to highly reviewed bars and restaurants which makes my home a prime location. My property has a full kitchen, comfortable living room with 2 futons, 2 bedrooms each equipped with 2 kings, 2 clean bathrooms and a half a bathroom. Perfect for long or short term stays and monthly discounts available. Event and bachelor/bachelorette parties are welcome upon approval by me .
space: My home is located in a 3 story building on the third floor. Each floor has it's own private individual unit which is accessed by at set of wooden stairs adjacent to the building. Recommended Old Town Restaurants-  Chicago Q 1160 North Dearborn Street- 1.2 Miles Chicago Q does barbecue like no one else in the Windy City. Using only the freshest, top-of-the-line ingredients smothered in delicious house-made rubs and sauces, the Chicago Q is one of the best restaurants in Chicago. This joint offers the best southern cooking you’ll get north of Kentucky. When you stop by, be sure to to check out the bacon cheddar hush puppies – they’re a game changer. Topo Gigio 1516 North Wells Street- 0.6 Miles Topo Gigio is a small piece of Italy located in the heart of Old Town Chicago. A local favorite for over 25 years, this homey hot-spot is easily one of best Italian restaurants in Chicago. This Chicago restaurant offers all of the classics and then some. notes: We have recently purchased this house and have made the appropriate renovations to ensure it's fully functional. name: Crisp River North 1BR w/ Gym, Pool, nr. Oak Street Beach, by Blueground
summary: Discover the best of Chicago, with this one-bedroom River North apartment with high floor views over the city. It’ll be easy to simply show up and start living in this beautifully Blueground furnished apartment with its fully-equipped kitchen, lovely living room, and our dedicated, on-the-ground support. (#CHI270)
space: Gorgeous furniture, fully-equipped kitchen, smart TV, and a premium wireless speaker are just a few of the amenities you’ll find inside this one-bedroom apartment. Ideally located in Chicago, you’ll find a lot to love outside as well. When you’re ready to relax, you’ll be happy to discover every Blueground bedroom comes with superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and cozy towels. We handle everything so you can simply show up and start living.  This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry. Amenities Building amenities unique to this one-bedroom apartment include an on-site:    - Doorman - Swimming Pool - Gym - Indoor Parking - Bike Storage - Elevator

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in River North, Chicago’s most trendy neighborhood. The bridges combined with the riverwalk offer incredible views. Nearby on Michigan Avenue is the city’s premier shopping area. One of the neighborhood’s biggest assets is the walk-to-work appeal. Young professionals, who live and work in the area, can quickly get to the office in the morning and just as easily enjoy an after-work drink, as the area is considered a premier entertainment center. Don’t miss a stroll on Kinzie and Hubbard streets. Merchandise Mart, the iconic building with showrooms, shops, and office space, is only a 5 minute walk. The Loop is just across the bridge and is about 5 minute walk.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property - Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a $275 monthly fee. Parking offered may be on or off-site, and may be covered or open. Spaces are designed for compact vehicles. Please provide us with your car details min. 1 business day in advance to avoid the chance of erroneous towing - Blueground has the right to enter and inspect the apartment or to show the apartment to a potential tenant any day of the week between 9am and 6pm as long as the tenant has been informed via email at least one day in advance - Please contact us for details
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

space: Just renovated! Clean architecturally interesting modern space with queen bed, modern kitchenette, private bath, washer/dryer, black out draperies, long work desk, cable TV and wifi.

name: Cheery Vintage Garden Apartment
summary: Garden apartment on tree-lined street in Chicago's Edgewater Glen neighborhood.  Our space offers vintage character with mid-century charm-- an excellent location for exploring the city, or unplugging from the rush.
space: Our garden apartment is in a classic vintage Chicago courtyard building, with a full kitchen, vintage dining booth, and spacious living and sleeping quarters. The bedroom has a queen size Sleep-Number bed, and the living room has a convertible sofa for additional sleeping space.   Hardwood floors throughout. The apartment is fairly high for a garden unit, really just 2 steps down.  Access would be fairly easy for many people.  Given the nature of the building and community, the space is not ideal for children.

Our space offers vintage character with mid-century charm-- an excellent location for exploring the city, or unplugging from the rush. Guests enter the building via the side gate, to the apartment's private entrance.  Storage closets and entrance to front vestibule will remain locked. We live in a different unit in the same building, and are available via
neighborhood_overview: We are located in Edgewater Glen, with a multitude of restaurants, bars, and  shopping within walking distance.  A brand new Whole Foods is 3 blocks away on Broadway, along with drug stores, international restaurants, and antique stores.  Andersonville, a great neighborhood for local dining and shopping, is just to the south.  We are across the street from a park, which includes a playground, track, and basketball and tennis courts.    Thorndale Avenue Beach is about 15 minute walk away.
notes: For peace of mind, the apartment is equipped with an alarm system.  Guests will receive a personalized access code upon arrival.   Guests will be provided with access to a secure WiFi network.  Although the apartment is on a fairly quiet street, the unit is not soundproof and located in a city.   You may hear neighbors in the upstairs unit, or a passing siren from time to time.
transit: The CTA Red-Line station (24 hr) at Thorndale Avenue is a 10 minute walk.  Easy access to Clark and Broadway Buses, or the 147 express bus to Michigan Avenue.  For motorists, there is plenty of legal street parking in the neighborhood.  There are bike-share (Divvy)  and car-share (zipcar) stations within a block of the apartment.
access: Guests have access to the entire apartment.  Guests enter the building via the side gate, to the apartment's private entrance.  Storage closets and entrance to front vestibule will remain locked.
interaction: We live in a different unit in the same building, and are available via phone, text, and email.  We will make every effort to personally be there to hand over keys and provide a tour of the apartment.  If we cannot be there, we will have a secure key box.  That said, we will certainly allow guest privacy, while being close by should needs arise.
house_rules: No smoking or vaping in the apartment or common areas of the building; smoking is permitted on the front sidewalk or in the alley .   No parties or additional guests beyond the agreed upon number.   We ask that you keep noise to a minimum out of respect to neighbors in the building.   No pets, no candles/open flame.   In lieu of a cleaning fee, guests are asked to leave the space clean and tidy.
host_about: We moved to Chicago 9 years ago and have loved it ever since.  We are both in arts education and enjoy exploring our neighborhood and city.

name: Spacious, Sunny, Plant Filled Chicago Condo
summary: Stay in my spacious, plant filled condo just outside of downtown Chicago. Your time here will place you right on the edge of Noble Square, Ukrainian Village, Wicker Park and just outside the West Loop. Conveniently close to many food options, a short walk from the Blue Line, and the side streets offer free street parking.  Hundreds of vinyl to enjoy! The guest room is spacious and I am only as social as you wish! Make this your home in Chicago!
space: The space is a modern day condo featuring large windows, exposed brick, central air, and a very clean bathroom. The apartment hosts over 55 plants all scattered around and I additionally try to always keep fresh flowers around as well. There is plenty of room in the fridge for you to store any and all food. The dishwasher, washer and dryer are always welcome to you for use.

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located on the third floor of the street that separates Ukrainian Village and Noble Square. Wicker Park is an easy walk away for a surplus of night life and culture.  This is a safe neighborhood that is well lit at night with a park only two blocks away that features an amazing view of the skyline and a public pool.
notes: I work in the evenings as a bartender so you may not see me much or at all.
transit: CTA accessible with the Blue Line in walking distance (Division stop) and a Bus stop (Chicago ave) two blocks down.
access: You will have access to all common areas including the porch.
interaction: I am easily accessible by phone and I always can connect you with my secondary contact, Sam, who checks in many of my guests.
house_rules: Please check with me about having guests over. 420 friendly.
host_about: Hello, I am a 31 year old male living in Chicago, IL. I toured in bands for 10 years and now work as a bartender at a lovely bar located close to the condo I am listing. I love to travel and experience all cultures. I sincerely enjoy the people from all over the world I now meet through airbnb. You’re not always guaranteed to meet me with my work schedule but someone will be scheduled to meet you for check in's.  I hope this finds you well!

name: Magnificent Mile Hotel King Bed - Prime Area
summary: $60 Parking extra Fee at Check in.  Home of the neon sign visitors and locals know so well, the historic Inn of Chicago Magnificent Mile hotel first opened in 1928 hosting celebs like Bob Hope, Judy Garland, Roy Rogers and showgirls from the Chez Paree supper club. This spacious room features a king sized bed, flat-screen TV and luxurious bath products. Price does not include parking, breakfast or fees + an Urban fee of $17.88 charged at check in. Parking and breakfast not included.
space: You need to describe both the room and the hotel. Try to write your Airbnb description as though you’re describing your property to a friend - you’ll capture an informal yet excited tone that will draw your reader in.  Just be sure to keep it consistent throughout. Aim to allure viewers with a carefully composed story of what their stay will be like at your property.  Try to be more informal and personalized.

name: Cozy Room in Recently Renovated Apartment
summary: A cozy bedroom in a friendly shared 3-bedroom apartment in a recently renovated building. The bedroom has two windows facing north, and is fully furnished with a double bed, a nightstand, a small dresser, and a walk-in closet. The apartment is conveniently located in the heart of the lovely Hyde Park neighborhood, between the University of Chicago campus, Lake Michigan (Promontory Point), and the commercial district on the 53rd Street.
space: The bedroom is fully furnished with a double bed, a nightstand, a small dresser, a walk-in closet, a nightstand and a bed lamp. Suitable for one person or a couple. The shared area of the apartment includes a living room with sofas, TV, and a fine collection of books (poetry, fiction, and philosophy), a beautiful dining room with a wooden table for 6 people, a kitchen with a refrigerator, a dish washer, and an oven, two bathrooms with shower and bathtub. Two sun rooms at the front and back of the apartment are perfect spot for sitting down and having a sip of coffee, chilling out or doing work. There is also a newly purchased treadmill which you are welcome to use for daily exercise.

The apartment is conveniently located in the heart of the lovely Hyde Park neighborhood, between the University of Chicago campus, Lake Michigan (Promontory Point), and the commercial district on the 53rd Street. The bedroom is fully furnished with a double bed, a nightstand, a small dresser, a walk-in closet, a nightstand and a bed lamp. Suitable for one person or a couple. The shared area of the apartment includes a living room with sofas, TV, and a fine collection of books (poetry, fiction, and philosophy), a beautiful dining room with a wooden table for 6 people, a kitchen with a refrigerator, a dish washer, and an oven, two bathrooms with shower and bathtub. Two sun rooms at the front and back of the apartment are perfect spot for sitting down and having a s
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is conveniently located in a recently renovated building in the heart of the Hyde Park neighborhood, close to the University of Chicago campus, Lake Michigan (Promontory Point), the commercial district on the 53rd Street (with shops and restaurants), and the famous Museum of Science and Industry. All of these within walking distance! There are two very nice bakery cafes (Fabiana's, Sip and Savor) on the same street one block away. Ten-minute walk to Target, Whole Foods Market and Hyde Park Shopping Center (with Walgreens, Office Depot, Elston Ace Hardware, and US Post Office). One block away from lake front, where you can swim in the summer and enjoy the view of the lake and the city!
transit: Convenient access to public transportation. The bus stop 54th St/S Hyde Park Blvd is right in front of the house. From there Bus 6 takes you to downtown Chicago (the Loop) in less than 30 minutes. Bus 171 takes you to the University of Chicago main campus in less than 10 minutes. The 51st/53rd Street Metra Station is located two blocks away.
access: All shared areas (all areas other than personal bedrooms, including kitchen, living room, and dining room) are accessible to you.
interaction: You can always reach me by mobile phone, email, and airbnb message function. In general, you will be sharing the apartment with three roommates (each has their own bedroom). We are friendly, sociable graduate students at the University of Chicago in various disciplines. We love hosting guests and are willing to help if there is anything you need.
host_about: Graduate student at the University of Chicago

neighborhood_overview: Welcome to Andersonville. A neighborhood on Chicago’s north side, Andersonville is known for its Swedish roots, historic architecture, and bustling urban main street, Clark Street. When you arrive in Andersonville, you feel you have arrived someplace special. While our roots are Swedish, we are also recognized as the “shop local capital of Chicago,” supporting the largest network of local and independent businesses in the area. Home to one of Chicago’s largest LGBTQ+ populations, Andersonville is a community full of pride and a commitment to equality. Andersonville is for everyone. (- from Andersonville Chamber of Commerce) Equally close to Andersonville and Uptown you can experience the best of two great Chicago neighborhoods. The Uptown entertainment district is a five minute walk from our home. The Green Mill, Riviera Theater, Aragon Ballroom, Chicago Magic Lounge, and soon the new Double Door are steps away. Have a great meal at the premier Argyle Street Asian food district with so
notes: .3 tenths of a mile to the Argyle Red Line el station, .7 to the beach, .4 to Andersonville shopping and dining, .5 to hop on Lake Shore Drive for 12min ride to downtown.
transit: Easy walking to beach, trains, buses, dining and shopping. Close to public transportation - Clark Street bus, Broadway bus, Argyle Red Line El stop and Berwyn Red Line El stop. Easy access to Lake Shore Drive for car share services which can have you downtown in as little as 12 minutes.
interaction: Available as you need us. We live upstairs and are happy to help if you need something, but invisible if you don't.

name: Charming Two-Story Getaway in Logan Square
summary: This stylish, modern two-story apartment is the perfect home base in Chicago's hottest neighborhood. It features an open living and dining area on the 1st floor and two spacious, sunny bedrooms upstairs. You'll be in walking distance of Logan Square's best restaurants & bars. Or if you'd rather stay in, the kitchen has been stunningly remodeled with marble counters and stainless appliances. And a 4-minute walk to the Blue Line makes for easy access to O'Hare, downtown, and the rest of Chicago.
space: Full of family art, plants and cozy touches, you'll feel instantly at home in our apartment. The unit has central air and heat, two full bathrooms (one shower, one clawfoot tub/shower combo), and two spacious bedrooms with queen beds. Linens and towels will be provided, as will coffee, tea and a few treats to welcome you to Chicago. This is an owner-occupied unit, so some doors will be locked, ensuring our things are out of your way.

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located on the border of Logan Square and Avondale.  There are tons of wonderful restaurants, parks, shops, galleries and bars within walking distance. Have a tiki drink at Lost Lake (named America's best bar in 2018!) or a neo-Indian feast at our favorite new spot, Superkhana International.
transit: The apartment is just two blocks from the Belmont stop of the Blue Line, and is close to several bus lines as well. Street parking is available and nightly permit passes will be provided upon request.
interaction: Owners will be available remotely throughout your stay, but will not be on site.
host_about: I love hosting almost as much as traveling and always look forward to sharing my favorite off-the-beaten-path things about Chicago with new friends.  I like to make sure people know everything that I would want to know about a new place. From local watering holes to the restaurants that are actually worth a splurge to outsider performance art and shows locals are buzzing about -- I love to connect interested people to interesting things.

name: Spacious Andersonville apt near train & beach!
summary: This spacious, sunny North Side apartment on a quaint side street is a chic and convenient home away from home for your Chicago visit. Two blocks from the Red Line 'L' to the downtown Loop, Wrigley Field, Boystown, Lincoln Park and more.  15 minute walk or 5 min Uber to the beach and lakefront park/trail. Little Vietnam restaurants, Uptown music venues, and Andersonville drinking/dining/shopping are all within blocks. Fantastic location!

Two blocks from the Red Line 'L' to the downtown Loop, Wrigley Field, Boystown, Lincoln Park and more.  15 minute walk or 5 min Uber to the beach and lakefront park/trail. Little Vietnam restaurants, Uptown music venues, and Andersonville drinking/dining/shopping are all within blocks. Fantastic location! This apartment is located at the dynamic intersection of Uptown, Andersonville, and Edgewater neighborhoods, adjacent to the Red Line and near the lake.  Uptown "Little Vietnam"/"New Chinatown" neighborhood is right out the door. Uptown music venues Green Mill, Aragon, and Riviera are four blocks south. Andersonville shopping and drinking (Hopleaf, Swedish American Museum, gay and/or dive bars, a dozen other restaurants) is four blocks west. Edgewater beaches and brunch spots are four blocks north. This Far North Side neighborhood is a fantastic mix of
neighborhood_overview: This apartment is located at the dynamic intersection of Uptown, Andersonville, and Edgewater neighborhoods, adjacent to the Red Line and near the lake.  Uptown "Little Vietnam"/"New Chinatown" neighborhood is right out the door. Uptown music venues Green Mill, Aragon, and Riviera are four blocks south. Andersonville shopping and drinking (Hopleaf, Swedish American Museum, gay and/or dive bars, a dozen other restaurants) is four blocks west. Edgewater beaches and brunch spots are four blocks north. This Far North Side neighborhood is a fantastic mix of old and new, longtime residents and transplants, quiet and nightlife, all with easy access to public transportation and the lakefront.
transit: Two blocks from Red Line 'L' (Argyle station) One block from Broadway bus (36), three blocks from Clark bus (22) Street parking without permit 1/2 block from parking structure with paid parking through ParqEx app
house_rules: BYO food and drink (do not eat or drink anything already in the apartment except espresso pods and tea). Remove shoes upon entry - the city is dirty :-/ Do not play the electric guitar or cello. Playing the keyboard and acoustic guitar is fine. And finally: This is my actual home and my neighbors are my neighbors, so I have to ask guests to abide by a strict policy of no parties, *no visitors in the apartment beyond those included in the reservation,* and a courteous noise level after 10pm. If this sounds like it might cramp your style and you'd rather find a more turn-up-friendly spot, please cancel the reservation with no hard feelings (I have "flexible" booking, so there is no financial penalty if you cancel at least 24 hours prior).
host_about: 33 y/o Midwestern traveler, musician, person. Chicago based, Iowa raised.

name: Historic Bronzeville Property
summary: Vintage unit in Chicago's historic Bronzeville neighborhood.  One mile south of McCormick place and Wintrust Arena, close to expressways, Lake Shore Drive, dining, downtown and the South Loop!
space: Relax in a vintage greystone and brick building in the historic Bronzeville neighborhood.  Quaint, quiet and close to all things awesome in Chicago!
description: Vintage unit in Chicago's historic Bronzeville neighborhood.  One mile south of McCormick place and Wintrust Arena, close to expressways, Lake Shore Drive, dining, downtown and the South Loop! Relax in a vintage greystone and brick building in the historic Bronzeville neighborhood.  Quaint, quiet and close to all things awesome in Chicago! We are available via phone or email during your stay! Bronzeville is a historic neighborhood on the near south side of Chicago.  Famous previous residents included civil rights activist Ida B. Wells, Pulitzer Prize winner Gwendolyn Brooks and legendary singer Louis Armstrong to name a few.  The area boasts trendy eateries, galleries, Victorian architecture and 19th-century mansions!  Our property was constructed in 1878! Public transportation is steps away from our residence.  Including several bus lines that will take you to the bustling south loop or beautiful downtown Chicago within minutes!

name: Logan Square 2BR 2BA Guest House at Haas Park
summary: COVID-19 Pandemic: Guest House is now open ONLY to first responders and healthcare works beginning April 6, 2020. Minimum stay 6 nights; fixed weekly rate of $200 includes comprehensive cleaning/disinfecting on a weekly basis only. Longer stays encouraged but manual reservations (instead of instant bookings) may be required due to platform limitations. Do not use instant booking feature if you are not a first responder or healthcare worker in the immediate Logan Square Chicago area.
space: This unique home is a modern urban oasis with easy access to rail, bus, and expressways. Logan Square offers tremendous culinary choices from hipster cafes to Michelin rated restaurants. Walk 3 blocks to the Blue Line, which travels between O'hare & Downtown Loop (as well as out to UIC and Forest Park). Enter on the first floor, where you'll find a bedroom with a queen-size memory foam mattress, comfortable seating, and a Samsung 40" TV. This floor offers a bathroom with dual shower heads and personal wall jets for a soothing and enjoyable shower.  Walk up to the second level and find a well appointed kitchen with treats from the host, including Keurig easy-to-brew single-cup coffee drinks. This floor offers a gathering place with lots of natural light and a queen-size sofa sleeper which can be opened to sleep two. A Bose SoundTouch sound system on this floor allows guests to play their own music from most Bluetooth mobile devices--you can stream from your favorite music sources. This

neighborhood_overview: Logan Boulevard is less than two short blocks down Washtenaw, where people walk, run, and gather all year long. Within two blocks of the Logan Square coach house is a concentration of restaurants at California Avenue and Logan Boulevard, offering Italian, Japanese, Korean, Thai, Mexican, and American cuisines. The Starbucks has a beautiful outdoor space and is a central meeting place for residents and guests alike. A two-plus block walk in a slightly different direction brings you to Milwaukee Avenue, which offers many more eating and drinking options, music stores, art studios and galleries, dry cleaners, clothiers, a combination first-run and art-house movie theatre, book stores, food markets (gourmet, co-operative, ethnic, and mainstream), and just-about everything you can imagine including eclectic retail with discount dollar stores and second-hand resale shops. If you like coffee and pastries, there are abundant cafes in the area. Chicago also offers many beer microbreweries, and
notes: This home is not equipped with child-safe protection for infants and toddlers.  Although it is not located within a business center, the train commute, including a three-block walk, to downtown or the O'hare business area is 20-30 minutes; business travelers find this access in a vibrant urban residential neighborhood appealing. A guest violating House Rules may be asked to leave without consideration of any refund. Security cameras record activity outside the Guest House.
transit: Within a three-block walk, the Chicago Transit Authority (CTA) Blue Line Elevated train stops at California Avenue. This is best transport between the downtown Loop and O'hare Airport. The Blue line also takes you to University of Illinois at Chicago, the Medical District, and suburban Forest Park at the western end. The Fullerton Avenue 74 bus, literally across the street, takes you to Lakeview and Lincoln Park, which includes DePaul University and a connection to the CTA Red Line Elevated train, about two miles east. The CTA Red Line is your transport to Wrigleyville (Home of the Cubs), Edgewater, and many neighborhoods along the lakefront.  With a car, you can gain access to I-90/94 (the Kennedy expressway) at either the Fullerton (if you're heading southeast) or California (if you're heading northwest) entrances. Among many local thoroughfares, the closest main intersection is California and Fullerton Avenues.
access: The Logan Square Coach House at Haas Park has a private entrance and is attached to a small garage. The front building on the property contains two apartments and an office, where host Clyde lives and works part of the week. Guests have complete privacy in this three level building. (If you do need to park a vehicle, there is generally ample street parking. Clyde provides daily residential parking permit stickers for overnights. If you request indoor parking in advance, special arrangements with a fee are usually possible.)
interaction: Clyde or one of his assistants are available should you need anything. Clyde is a long time Chicago resident and has a vast knowledge of city and neighborhood attractions. This unit offers complete privacy and is meant to give you that home away from home comfort, without interruption from the host or other residents.
house_rules: Treat Logan Square Guest House near Haas Park with respect--treat it like it is your own. No smoking in the house and no illegal drugs. Please tidy up after yourself. During the COVID-19 pandemic, special $200/week pricing for first responders and healthcare workers (including comprehensive cleaning) will override platform prices displayed, and availability requires 72 hours between guests. Longer stays encouraged and include weekly cleaning/maid service.
host_about: Avid cyclist with a geographically-diverse family.

name: Bright Loop 1BR w/ Gym, Roofdeck, near  Millennium Park, by Blueground
summary: Discover the best of Chicago, with this one-bedroom The Loop apartment with high floor views over the city. It’ll be easy to simply show up and start living in this beautifully Blueground furnished apartment with its fully-equipped kitchen, exquisite living room, and our dedicated, on-the-ground support. (#CHI249)
space: As with any Blueground apartment, you’ll find a thoughtfully designed space complete with beautiful furniture and a fully-equipped kitchen in this one-bedroom property. And, thanks to our superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and towels, you can relax knowing you’ll always feel comfortably at home. When you’re ready for some fun, you can take in the Chicago vibes or bring the entertainment to you with the premium wireless speaker or smart TV.  This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry. Amenities Building amenities unique to this one-bedroom apartment include an on-site:    - Doorman - Pet Friendly - Gym - Indoor Parking - Roof Deck - Media Room - Elevator

neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is situated in the most dynamic and convenient place to live in Chicago, The Loop. With its endless shopping, fine dining, stunning park, river and lake views, and entertainment opportunities, everything is possible at a moment’s notice. The area is a cultural getaway for professionals and students, who can combine work with pleasure. Discover landmark buildings like the Willis Tower and The Art Institute of Chicago. Millenium Park, near Lake Michigan, is always worth a visit. The Loop is within reach of accessible transportation, offering non-stop public transit, buses, and taxis. Union Station is approximately a 10 minute train ride.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions (including certain Bull Terriers and any related breeds). Wild animals and hybrids, including wolf and coyote hybrids, snakes, ferrets, rabbits, are all prohibited. Please contact us for precise breed restrictions. Please note that a one-off non refundable fee ($500) and a monthly rent ($25/mo/pet) is applicable upon reservation. Failing to notify us of any pets prior to check-in will incur a penalty, and may result in denied check-in. Supporting documents (ie. vaccinations) may be required - Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a $275 monthly fe
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

name: Lights! Camera! Action! Cool Space!
summary: Super Cool Loft Photo Studio located in the urban vibe of West Town! This room was just renovated to create a clean, mod space for the hip traveler.  Just blocks from everything: Downtown,Wicker Park/Bucktown,Randolph St.,United Center + free parking
space: Super Cool Loft Photo Studio located in the urban vibe of West Town! This room was recently renovated to create a clean, mod space for the hip traveler.  Just blocks from everything: Downtown,Wicker Park/Bucktown,Randolph St.,United Center + free parking This space is amazing with 3 enormous open concept levels to call your own.  We wanted to create a place that is really clean with great comforts, cable, Internet, and an overall chill factor.  This room can accommodate an individual or two guests traveling together.   This is not a shared space.    When you book, you and your guest will be the only people occupying the space!  By day, we are a cutting edge photo studio and by night, a chic space you can call your own in the heart of Chicago's industrial corridor.

By day, we are a cutting edge photo studio and by night, a chic space you can call your own in the heart of Chica
neighborhood_overview: West Town is a HOT neighborhood located in the industrial corridor minutes from Bucktown, Wicker Park, United Center, the Loop, Randolph Street, and Ukrainian Village.  There's tons of free street parking in front of the studio.  Ukrainian Village voted #1 Hottest Neighborhood 2016 in the US by Redfin!!!
notes: Hey There Smokers --- although there is NO SMOKING in the studio/loft, there is an awesome deck outside off the kitchen with an ashtray waiting for you!  Outside on the deck is the designated smoking area, this is the ONLY area we allow smoking. No kids and no pets :)  While both are adorable and we just love them, we are neither a kid friendly or pet friendly space.  If you sneak them in you will be asked to leave immediately...really.
transit: Super easy to access anywhere you want to go!  O'Hare? Midway?  Simple! The CTA 65 Grand Bus is a 2 minute walk out the door which can take you to the Blue Line (O'Hare Airport) or downtown or the CTA 50 is also a 5 minute walk out the door which can take you to the Orange Line (Midway Airport).  Cabs are always plentiful and we are located a quick cab ride away.
access: Besides the guestroom located on the third floor with a great view of United Center, please make yourself comfortable in our beautiful modern kitchen -- oven, stove, dishwasher, refrigerator, tableware.... all the amenities for any meal on the second floor with a private deck with seating for 4 should you want to eat, drink or hang out.   We also have an awesome office on the first floor,   where can easily spread out in this large workspace.
interaction: We will be available the entire length of the guest's stay.  We live next door if you need anything at all, we would be delighted to help. :)
house_rules: Feel free to "pop" on any of the many backdrops for a "selfie" as part of the fun of staying in this 3000 sq ft studio.  For our fellow professional photogs and artists, please note we will be creating a separate listing to rent the studio for commercial work.  However, for the time being, it is NOT available as a work space. :)   We are NOT currently available as an event space for parties.  This space is exclusively for our Airbnb traveling guests.  Additionally,  travelers who are approved guests of the studio, may NOT host parties, big or small, without written permission of The Studio.   This includes inviting anyone into the premise who was not part of the original reservation.

name: Rogers Park/Loyola beach townhouse - free parking!
summary: Whether to build snowmen, run the lakefront trail, swim or sunbathe at the beach, or to visit friends/family, you will enjoy the location and tranquility of this airbnb.  Bright and spacious townhouse is just 1 minute or a door away (40 steps!) from parks and sandy beaches, short walking distance to Loyola University and many local restaurant gems, and a short 'L' or CTA ride to Northwestern University. Public transportation accessible - Red 'L' (train), bus stops/routes and bike sharing sites.
space: Guests love the space for its location, coziness, tranquility and proximity to the beach! Set your alarm clock early, grab a cup of coffee from the kitchen, and walk 1 min to catch the sunrise at the beach. Head back and prepare breakfast, or walk to the end of the block to a trendy local brunch spot.  The space is a two-bedroom townhouse with living room and dining room/kitchenette. There is a king-size bed, and two twin beds. All linens are included, as well as shower basics (soap, shampoo, and conditioner).  In the kitchen, there is a Keurig with complimentary pods - variety of coffee/tea, a microwave, and a small fridge.  Wifi and Netflix are included.

Set your alarm clock early, grab a cup of coffee from the kitchen, and walk 1 min to catch the sunrise at the beach. Head back and prepare breakfast, or walk to the end of the block to a trendy local brunch spot.  The space is a two-bedroom townhouse with living room and dining room/kitchenette. There is a king-size bed, and two twin beds. All linens are included, as well as shower basics (soap, shampoo, an
neighborhood_overview: Welcome to Rogers Park, a wonderful, welcoming, vibrant and diverse neighborhood, home to over 120 restaurants, The Chicago Comedy Film Festival, The New 400 theaters, and to a community of artists and academics. There are bars, coffee shops, a local movie theater, stage productions for both kids and adults, as well as numerous summer festivals all within a short walk or train ride. Rogers Park is a tree-lined residential neighborhood, accessible by public transportation and very walkable. Convenience stores are within a couple blocks of the townhouse, and Morse Fresh Market is a 7 min walk, about 4 blocks away.
notes: Bring a sweater and sunglasses!  Also beach essentials if you fancy dipping into Lake Michigan. Please bring your own beach towels to the beach.  Chicago is the windy city, and our place is right by the beach. It tends to be cooler, be prepared as you’d want to take a walk through the park and enjoy magnificent views of Lake Michigan. There is no laundry on-site but Sudz Laundry is a short 3 min drive or 8 min walk (1425 W Morse Ave, Chicago, IL 60626). The front patio is also a walkway for our neighbors, please be mindful not to block or leave your personal belongings unattended.
transit: Free street parking and a reserved spot off alley (available on first come, first serve basis), CTA bus stop is a short block away and ‘L’ Morse stop is short 6 min walk.
access: The unit is completely private with it's own entrance. Only you and your fellow travelers will have access to the whole townhouse during your stay! You are steps away, only one minute walk through the walkway to Chicago Parks and sandy beaches.
interaction: Happy to help with anything you need, just give me a call or text.
house_rules: - Quiet Hours Daily 8 PM to 8 AM (Chicago City Noise Ordinance) - Keep all doors and windows closed when air conditioning or heat is running. - Trash cans must be emptied and trash bags must be deposited in cans in the alley.  - All furniture must be left in original position and location at check-out. - No wet swimsuits or clothes on any furniture. - No outside shoes to be worn in the house. - No food or drinks outside living and dining area(s). - Full check-out requirement list provided at time of booking. - Absolutely no pets or other animals allowed in our home or on our property. Violation will result in immediate, automatic charge of full security deposit. - Please respect our neighbors. Use only the front patio, and parking space, and leave the shared walkway unobstructed. - Our home and townhouse building is smoke-free. The Chicago Clean Indoor Air Ordinance (Chapter 7-32 of the Municipal Code of Chicago) prohibits smoking and the use of e-cigarettes in enclosed public places a
host_about: We’re Jay & Lis, a neat freak who is always on an adventure quest, and a super handy champ. Together, we are blessed with a brilliant-minded son and a very determined daughter.

name: Hermosa Homestead
summary: Here's your sunny 2 bedroom home in the Hermosa neighborhood. It’s right next to the 606 trail and close to fun bars (Scofflaw, Park&Field, and Sleeping Village) It’s right off Armitage, so it’s a quick bus ride or walk to the BlueLine, and 15mins to downtown Chicago, via Metra. There is also free parking on our street - just use the permits provided.  Lots of room in the open layout plus theres a porch and it's very quiet at night. It is just waiting for you to sleep in it!
space: Our house is a great location for a group of friends or a family to enjoy the feeling of a home while on vacation. We are just a short walk from all the great spots in Logan Square and easy train ride to the downtown for touristy things.

neighborhood_overview: We live in Hermosa, and are a couple blocks from the West end of the 606 Trail! There’s lots of families in our neighborhood but just a short distance to all the features offered in Logan Square.
notes: Our house is old, so that means old pipes. We ask that guests not flush anything but toilet paper down the toilets and instead please dispose of feminine items in the garbage cans in the bathrooms.
transit: You can easily hop on public transit here. Both Pulaski, and Armitage are a short block away and North Ave is just a few blocks away. Blue line is a bus ride away and the metra in just a few blocks away. Lyft and Uber are also easy to use in this neighborhood
access: When you stay in our home you have access to your bedrooms, the kitchen and living room, and the awesome deck/yard. It’s our personal home, so we ask that you treat it like you would our own home.
interaction: We are just a text, email, or AirBnB message away. If you need to talk over the phone we have them listed in a binder that’s on the kitchen table.
house_rules: - **Please make sure you read the listing in its entirety** - We expect you will respect our home.  - No eating meals in the bedroom - snacks/munchies are OK. - Absolutely NO unregistered guests without prior approval.  - Absolutely NO smoking in the house and if you do smoke outside, please be courteous and clean up your butts/ash.  - Please always lock the front door when you leave and be courteous to the neighbors.  - If anything breaks, spills, stains, etc. please let John or I know ASAP.  - Unreturned and/or lost house keys will be charged a $25 replacement fee.  - Any significant damage will result in the loss of security deposit.
host_about: I am a full on Chicagoan. I was born and raised in Chicago and have lots of family in the area. I run educational programming at a greenhouse for the city. Whenever I travel I make sure to check out whatever conservatories or botanical gardens the area has to offer. I love being in the outdoors and exercising by running or biking or swimming when I have the opportunity. Let me know if there are places to hike nearby and I will love you forever.

name: Gritty Chic River North --- ACME Hotel
summary: If you've never been one for convention, ACME is the right choice for you. Located 2 ½ blocks from the Magnificent Mile in the River North neighborhood, ACME is downtown Chicago's lifestyle boutique hotel alternative for the tragically hip. If you appreciate an eye for design and dig a high-tech vibe, you'll feel right at home in this trendy, but inviting hotel. We want your experience at ACME to blow your mind, not your budget, book a room, and be prepared to fall in love.
space: Voted number 4 in Conde Nast Top Chicago Hotels. ACME features Alexa's in all the guest rooms, mobile keys, and the very best local experts to help show you the best time in Chicago. We also feature our very own Morning Joe coffee service delivered to your room for free at the time you request it!

neighborhood_overview: We've done the math, and ACME is as central as you can get to Chicago's best stuff. Hit up the Magnificent Mile for rare finds at boutiques that scream style - the Avenue is literally blocks away. Craving sushi or Chicago deep dish? Give in to your inner foodie and pop in to some of River North's coolest eateries and restaurants. Grab a table at the House of Blues and let your ear drums sizzle with the smoothest sounds in Chicago. At the heart of River North, ACME's cornered the market on location!
notes: We offer parking next to the hotel for $39 per car per night. Must be 21 years old to check in.
transit: We're surrounded by everything you need and you won't even want to leave our area. However, if you must, we are around the corner from the Red Line.

name: Tuscan-inspired Living near the River and Lincoln Square
summary: Kick back in the hammock and make the most of the evening sun in the tranquil garden of this cozy suite. Snuggle up under a blanket in the classic, French-style armchair with a book, or hop in a cab for a short ride downtown for fine dining. My Home is a beautiful Tuscan-style house, ideal oasis for a couple visiting family, or just see the city.  A safe and quiet neighborhood close to Andersonville, Lincoln Square, North Park University and Northeastern University. Easy access to Evanston, Skokie, Lincolnwood and the North Shore.  Free PARKING in front of the House.
space: Lovely bedroom with ensuite bathroom in a private residence. This room overlooks a lovely backyard and garden and is comfortable for up to 2 guests, For additional guests or to have a bigger room the master bedroom could be available for extra money. Go to “Comfortable Master Bedroom by the Park” and check it out.    My guests are welcome to:  A continental breakfast - discuss your preference upon booking. Sharing my kitchen and fridge. Gourmet coffee and tea anytime. Relaxing in the garden's patio seating.   Free use of washer/dryer and iron and ironing board. This home is a perfect place to stay while visiting friends and family.  It also affords you the opportunity to work quietly from your own room. Best of both worlds!  Public transportation is only a few blocks away. Free street parking is plentiful if you have a car.  Longer occupancy considered on case by case basis. PERFECT FOR BUSINESS PEOPLE!
description: Kick back in the hammock and make the most of the evening sun in the tranquil garden of this cozy suite. A safe and quiet neighborhood close to Andersonville, Lincoln Square, North Park University and Northeastern University. Easy access to Evanston, Skokie, Lincolnwood and the North Shore.  Free PARKING in front of the House.
neighborhood_overview: Peterson Woods is a blend of old and new houses, parks, and tree-lined streets. The center of the neighborhood is only four blocks away, with a pharmacy, banks, and small stores. Downtown Chicago and the North Shore are just a short ride away.
notes: Continental Breakfast - discuss your preference upon booking. If you stay over the weekend, and you don't have a car, ask the host  to give you a ride  to the train station (CTA Brown Line), this service will be offered only if the host is AVAILABLE and before noon on weekends ONLY.    Great place if you have a car Free parking available in front the house.
transit: Public Transportation is a few blocks away CTA Bus #82 at Kimball to Lawrence and take  the CTA Brown Line train to the downtown Chicago or other locations. To the O'Hare Airport (ORD): CTA Bus #82 at Kimball to Foster, transfer to CTA Bus #92 at Foster then transfer to the CTA Blue Line train to ORD.  CTA Bus #82 from Kimball takes you to Belmont where you can transfer to the CTA Blue Line train. CTA Bus #92 from Foster takes you to the CTA Blue Line train as well.  You can take an Uber or Lyft for a few Dollars to the CTA Brown Line train at Lawrence and Kimball or Western Ave and Lawrence.  On Weekends ONLY, if available, the host offers 1 trip before noon to the CTA Brown Line train station. FREE parking available on the street. This is the perfect place if you have a car.
access: Bedroom (s), kitchen, finished basement, laundry room and outside patio.
interaction: The host will be available to offer suggestions and advice for activities and dining recommendation.
house_rules: - NO smoking IN or OUT.  No Drugs or unregistered guests. - ONLY TOILET PAPER ON THE TOILET BOWL - Guests should do their own dishes - No outdoor shoes in the house -only slippers or flip-flops. - The Living Room is OFF LIMITS - DO NOT ENTER.  Cameras are installed. -  Meals must be consumed in the kitchen - only snacks are permitted in the bedrooms. - I ask to respect my privacy and to respect my property.
host_about:
I'm a quiet, clean, non-smoking, trustworthy person friendly, but respectful of others.
I  love to travel to Europe, especially Italy and France because I have a passion for food and wine.
When I travel I like to stay with Airbnb host because make me feel like home.

name: Master Suite and Bathroom in Wicker Park
summary: Enjoy your home away from home in this spacious 3 bedroom 2 bath condo at the crossroads of Bucktown and Wicker Park. Close to bars, restaurants, boutiques, cafes, and grocery stores, as well as public transit, my condo is great for the visitor who just likes to wander the city by foot or by bus/subway.  Sleeping arrangements include 1 queen-sized bed in a master bedroom with private garden bath and separate shower.  I look forward to hosting you :o)
space: Your suite is at its own end of the house with a ton of space to lay out. Cook yourself a frenzy, take a long soak in the jacuzzi, or just relax on the rooftop deck with a drink and look upon the city skyline. You'll have access to everything in this neighborhood and my house without sacrificing price or privacy.

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is filled to the brim with bars, boutiques, artisan taco shops, ramen, and the latest styles that yuppies and hipsters have managed to glean and coalesce from the East and West coast.
notes: "Super-friendly" is an understatement for my dog, and he will 100% guarantee try to play with you. He rarely barks, never bites, and can be crated or easily deterred from bothering you if you let me know your preference.
transit: Transportation is easy, as the blue line is an 8 minute walk to the Western/Damen stop, and about a 15 minute subway ride downtown. The 72 bus is right outside, and will take you to historic Old Town, Lincoln Park, North Avenue beach, etc.  The 606 is a quick 10 minute walk away, as is the grocery store, and Uber/Lyft or parking in the gated lot is always an option.
access: Guests have public access to the:  -patio  -rooftop deck -garage And private access to the:  -kitchen -living room -dining room -laundry room
interaction: I have a pretty busy schedule, but my job allows me to work from home, so I'm happy to show you around the city, time-permitting. Cooking, reading, watching comedy, biking around the city, and late-night wine-induced conversations with good people are some of my favorite things.
house_rules: 1. Guests should be respectful of neighbors and keep noise levels to a minimum after 10pm on weekdays, and midnight on weekends. 2. Should you want to smoke, please do so on one of the many patios or outdoor areas.  3. Please take your shoes off before entering.  4. No overnight guests.  Otherwise, my house is open to you and everything else is pretty much common courtesy!
host_about:
Hi, I'm a single professional in Chicago who enjoys pets, people, and good conversation. I'm clean, organized, a non-smoker, and get along with generally everyone. I've been living with roommates since I was in high school, so I'm used to sharing my space. In my free time, I enjoy hanging out with friends over wine, reading, playing tennis, biking, and oil painting. 

Throughout my AirBnB experience, I've met many wonderful people who have been so kind as to offer their home to me throughout the world. I hope to do the same, so please feel free to contact me with any questions!

name: Spacious Old Town Condo - Steps to Wells Street
summary: Come relax in this newly-updated 4 bed/2 bath condo in the heart of Old Town! Just steps away from the train & the best dining & entertainment in the city. Enjoy living in luxury during your stay amid & designer decor & modern furnishings! You can enjoy the provided locally-roasted coffee on the patio in the mornings, take advantage of the in-unit washer/dryer, & prepare a stunning spread in the spacious, fully-stocked kitchen!
space: I want to ensure everyone who stays at my place feels like they are at home and can settle right in, so I provide the following amenities free of charge to all my guests!   - High speed wireless internet is always available - TV with Roku device - Fresh towels and linens which are professionally laundered in between guests. - Kitchen appliances including a microwave, coffee pot with a reusable filter, tea kettle, and toaster   - I provide artisanal coffee from a local roaster and a variety of gourmet teas. - My place is FULLY STOCKED with all the amenities of home like eco friendly shampoo, conditioner, and body wash, paper towels, toilet paper, tissue, sponges & Method brand hand soap and dish soap.  You name it, we provide it to make you feel at home! -The full sized kitchen is stocked with cookware, utensils, glasses, cutlery, sharp knives, cutting boards, baking sheets and all the basic tools like wine openers, cheese graters, vegetable peelers, pizza cutters, etc.   - Hair dryer -

neighborhood_overview: From artsy to affluent, this historic neighborhood has been home to immigrant families, gays, hippies and young professionals alike over the years. An incredibly popular neighborhood destination, largely because of its close proximity to the lake and downtown, Old Town keeps up a lively pace day and night. Victorian-era buildings, brick alleyways and narrow, tree-lined streets are charming backdrops to a busy main strip that runs along Wells Street between North Avenue and Division Street.
house_rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund. 1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable. 2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to the designated location by the agreed upon check-out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out penalty. 3.) Absolutely no smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any entrance. 4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 5.) Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid.
host_about:
New York based but a constant worldwide traveler splitting time between, New York, Chicago and the UK.

I enjoy spending time with family, friends, and supporting my favorite spots team the Chicago Cubs!

As a remote host your stay will be very smooth, with easy in/out access and support available 24/7

house_rules: We created Kasa to be your home on the road. We’re committed to being great neighbors, and we strictly enforce these rules to ensure the comfort and safety of our community. •NO Smoking: Smoking of any kind (including tobacco, marijuana, e-cigarettes, vape pens, and hookahs) is never allowed at this property.  This applies to the entire apartment, including the balcony or patio, as well as all common and outdoor areas of the building. Kasa apartments may be monitored with marijuana and tobacco sensors. •Noise: At all times, Kasa guests may not disturb their neighbors’ quiet enjoyment.  In addition, guests must observe quiet hours from 9 p.m. to 8 a.m. Parties and large gatherings are prohibited. Kasa apartments are proactively monitored with decibel sensors for compliance with this noise policy. •Occupancy: Each Kasa has a maximum occupancy limit.  There can be no more than the specified number of guests on the premises at any given time. Large gatherings are not permitted. •Lost and F
host_about: We are the team behind Kasa Living, a national flexible living brand that offers a dependable, high-quality living experience at a great value. We manage Kasas in modern buildings with the amenities and comforts that you want out of your own home. We aim to unleash the potential of livable space by giving you access to places that feel like your home on the road. Kasa Living is available in cities across the United States, with new locations opening frequently. We hope you enjoy your stay with us, and know that Kasa is your home on the road!

neighborhood_overview: WELCOME TO THE CITY THAT FEELS LIKE HOME! Chicago is a city unlike any other. We’ve got the architectural marvels, world-class museums, dynamic entertainment, and award-winning dining scene you’d expect from one of the world’s greatest cities. But we’re more than just another big city — our welcoming residents, inclusive neighborhoods, and Midwestern soul truly make Chicago the city that feels like home. We are happy to help provide more information about our neighborhood! Just drop us a quick note :)
notes: We live on the property and do our best to keep noise at a minimum, but you may hear some noise from time to time. We abide by the moderate cancellation policy for Airbnb. Unfortunately, we do not allow pets.

host_about:
Stay where it counts. When you book a Loftium, you're contributing to the local community. Each Loftium is home to a local resident who hosts and lives right on-site, making sure your experience is a delightful one. All spaces are designed with your comfort in mind! We've made check-in and communication a breeze, and each home provides a beautiful and cozy place to rest your head during your travels. Every Loftium home and host is unique, and you'll always get a true neighborhood experience during your stay.

Visit a new community and book a Loftium in any of our cities: Seattle, Portland, Denver, San Diego, Phoenix, Chicago, Atlanta, Dallas, Charlotte, or Orlando. We can't wait for you to visit!

name: Unbeatable Stay at Fulton Market Stunning Condo
summary: The first thing you notice stepping into my house are the sky high ceilings!  Enormous floor to ceiling windows allow light to stream into the the 2 floor home. The stylish and very large terrace are great for summer nights. Walk out the front door & you are in the heart of restaurant row with all the best bars and restaurant in the city. You name it, we provide it to make you feel at home! -The full sized kitchen is stocked with cookware, utensils, glasses, cutlery, sharp knives, cutting boards, baking sheets and all the basic tools like wine openers, cheese graters, vegetable peelers, pizza cutters, etc.   - Hair dryer

neighborhood_overview: The West Loop is a foodie mecca. An explosion of excellent eateries have taken over this former industrial area, turning the historic warehouses into some of the city’s hottest restaurants. A former meat-packing district, the West Loop has become one of the most dynamic dining destinations in the city. In particular, a stretch of Randolph Street known as Restaurant Row is where you’ll find many of the neighborhood’s most celebrated spots, from high-end tasting menus to hidden ramen joints to fourth-generation sandwich shops. The West Loop is also home to Greektown, a bustling enclave overflowing with traditional restaurants, bakeries, and delis, and the National Hellenic Museum — the second oldest American institution dedicated to Greek culture. Nearby Fulton Market has a cool industrial vibe that bursts with activity, thanks to tons of trendy restaurants and bars that have taken over the old warehouse spaces. Between meals, you can explore the West Loops’s art galleries, cool shops, a

Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to the designated location by the agreed upon check-out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out penalty. 3.) Absolutely no smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any entrance. 4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 5.) Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid. 6.) Parents must supervise all children at all times

name: 42nd-Floor Suite with View of Lake Michigan
summary: Play pinball, pool, and basketball in the building's games room, which also offers sauna and steam facilities, a pool, and state-of-the-art fitness room. The apartment itself has floor-to-ceiling windows, glossy wood floors, and granite countertops. Our pool is outdoor and is open seasonally from Memorial Day to Labor Day (weather permitting). You must be 25 or older to book this space. Parking is not included in the cost of your stay. There is parking in the garage on the bottom floor but guests are responsible for the cost. A parking pass will need to be purchased.
space: Whether you're coming to Chicago for business or pleasure, choosing this swanky 42nd-floor suite will enhance your experience with its luxurious amenities, like a shared pool, sauna and steam rooms, state-of-the-art fitness room, basketball court, green area with running track and grilling area, library, on-site market, and more! Revel in the city and peek at Lake Michigan views from your private balcony. This retreat is located in the Grand Plaza, one of Chicago's foremost high rises in the center of River North, right on the corner of State Street and Grand Avenue. Walk two blocks to the world-famous Magnificent Mile for all the upscale retail therapy you can handle, then head to Water Tower Place and Michigan Avenue and browse the shops. If you're here for a convention, chances are, you'll be able to walk to it, or if your event is at McCormick Place, it's a short cab or train ride away. No other animals are allowed without specific Vacasa approval. - The property shall not be used by more than the number of adults and children listed in your reservation. - All guests shall abide by Vacasa’s good neighbor policy and shall not engage in illegal activity. Quiet hours are from 10 p.m. to 8 a.m. - If early check-in is available for your reservation, you will be notified by 9am on the morning of your arrival by email. Late check-out is offered whenever possible for a small fee. - No smoking of any kind is permitted anywhere on the premises. - No commercial photography or filming is permitted on the property. Tents or other structures may not be erected. - Renter is liable for any damage to the property and agrees to accept charges to the card on file should damage occur
host_about: Hi, we’re Vacasa, North America’s largest vacation rental management company. Owners of vacation homes around the world trust us to deliver exceptional service throughout your entire vacation. Professional housekeepers clean and stock each home, and our customer care team is available around the clock—with a local property manager ready to show up and help out. We like to think we offer the best of both worlds: you can enjoy a one-of-a-kind vacation experience in a unique property, without compromising on service and convenience. Check out our listings, and get in touch if you have any questions. Your vacation is our full-time job, and we'd love to help you plan your perfect getaway.

name: West Loop Luxury Apt 5 min walk to Downtown
summary: Beautifully modern 800 sq ft apartment on 10th floor of new luxury apartment building in the Chicago’s trendy West Loop. A few blocks from the popular Randolph St, loaded with lively bars & restaurants. Plenty of recommendations upon request!! Also just a short walk from Downtown Chicago.  Apt comfortably sleeps 3 with room for 4 as the couch pulls into a Full. Renovated kitchen with white quartz countertops, stainless steel appliances. Gym in building, washer & dryer in unit.
space: This space honestly feels like a luxury hotel. The main room gets tons of natural light as it is surrounded by open windows. Pro tip: the balcony is a great place to sit for drinks weather permitting.
