neighborhood_overview: The West Loop is unbiasedly one of the most fun/popular areas in Chicago. You’ll find the most lively restaurants/bars, including some great spots for Saturday/Sunday brunch (Soho House and Parlor Pizza are some personal favs). Also some of the best craft beer around the area (check out Ballast Point Brewing Co.). If you’re feelin touristy, we’re a few blocks from Downtown Chicago’s Willis tower, a mile from the Bean, about 2.5 miles from Navy Pier
notes: I love to travel & Airbnb has been my go-to!! I like to pay the favor forward by hosting in my own city when I can!!

host_about: Nothing but love for this awesome city and happy to call this place my home! I love traveling and am grateful for opportunity to stay with hosts, so I’m happy to be paying the favor forward and really excited about getting to meet new people in the process (And most importantly, making sure that you leave with the best of memories and a promise to return!!)

name: RENOVATED AND CLEAN 3 BEDROOM APARTMENT
summary: Quiet, clean 3-bedroom apartment in the heart of Chicago with FREE PARKING. Very safe neighborhood. You will have your own personalized door code and may go in and out using a secure smart lock. Flexible check-in and check-out times. Nobody else will access your apartment during your stay there- unless you need something, and I have your permission.
space: Restaurants and bars are right round the corner, both upscale and casual. This room is 10 minutes away by car or uber to Chicago's famous Willis (Sears) tower. Uber costs about $7. If you are arriving by car, I am providing a free parking spot. The apartment will be ONLY yours for the time you'll stay in my Windy City. You will have a key to lock the bedroom door, if you wish.

neighborhood_overview: 100% of guests love my location- it is the best of both worlds: 10 minutes by car from the very center of downtown, yet quiet enough to not hear the noise at night. If you are still not convinced, please read my reviews.
transit: "Western" is the closest blue line train (metro) station, only 5 minutes away (walking).  -Downtown/Loop: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and get off at "LaSalle, Jackson, or Monroe," depending on where you are going :) FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "Western." About 7 minutes to downtown. -O’Hare Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare. O'Hare is the final stop. FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "Western." About 35 minutes to O’Hare. -Midway Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and transfer to orange line at "Clark/Lake," then take orange line to towards Midway airport. Midway is the final stop! FROM - take orange line towards Adams/Wabash; then, transfer to blue line at "Clark/Lake." Take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "Western." About 45 minutes to Midway. -Union Station/Amtrak:  taxi or Uber will take you to the apartment in less than 10 minutes for about $6 :)
host_about:
Hello! My name is Marina, and I would like to welcome you to Chicago. I host with my sister, and we are originally from Saint Petersburg, Russia, but we spent our teenage years in Aix-en-Provence, France and therefore speak English, Russian and French fluently :) I work as an auditor downtown.  

Hotels can get very expensive, so we do our best to help tourists out. I really hope to host you! :)

name: Stylish & Ample 1PBR STAYCATION SPACE For You
summary: Due to the Coronavirus we are taking extra care to clean & disinfect frequently touched surfaces so that you may stay safe during this time. The apartment is a wonderful WORK-FROM-HOME open space, with free & fast WiFi; or an amazing STAYCATION BREAK, with a large screen tv with multiple inputs. It is spacious and bright with soaring seven-foot windows that actually have an amazing view of downtown, particularly the John Hancock Building. The place is comfortable, tidy, and located in West Town.
space: It is an expansive, high ceiling, three bedroom apartment. Everything you need for a comfortable stay is provided - full size beds, pillows, blankets, towels, toiletries, hair dryer, kitchen, and tv & wifi are all accessible to enhance your stay.

It is spacious and bright with soaring seven-foot windows that actually have an amazing view of downtown, particularly the John Hancock Building. The place is comfortable, tidy, and located in West Town. It is an expansive, high ceiling, three bedroom apartment. Everything you need for a comfortable stay is provided - full size beds, pillows, blankets, towels, toiletries, hair dryer, kitchen, and tv & wifi are all accessible to enhance your stay. Your bedroom, bathroom, living room, dining room and kitchen are available for your stay. I, or my co-host, Nat, am/is available throughout your stay to answer questions that you may have; or recommend local attractions, dining, or nightlife. Wicker Pa
neighborhood_overview: Wicker Park is famous for live music and nightlife, chef-driven restaurants and countless art galleries — many housed within the Flat Iron Arts Building. If you have an acute knowledge of craft cocktails or an affinity for coffee, plus want to sift through records or thrifted threads, there's no better area to sip and shop in the country. The area has become a prevailing influence on Chicago's Michelin-rated, James Beard Award-winning dining scene, boasting some of the city's most sought after tables. Wicker Park and Bucktown are also known for their palate pleasing nightcaps, like renowned brewery Piece and mixology tour de force The Violet Hour. Along North, Division, Milwaukee and Damen Avenues, you will find an unbelievable blend of vintage shops amid independently-owned boutiques touting fashions for both men and women, and luxury home goods and beauty products. On the same blocks are nationally-recognized names in fashion, and a mix of major retail chains that have also set up sh
notes: Unfortunately, the apartment is not handicap accessible.
transit: The apartment is located just 0.4 mile from the Blue Line Damen Station (connecting to O’Hare airport) which travels through much of the city. The “9” Ashland Street Bus Stop is one block away - running north and south. Additionally, six blocks away is the Kennedy Expressway Division Street Exit. It is only three miles to downtown Chicago (10 minute Uber ride).
access: Your bedroom, bathroom, living room, dining room and kitchen are available for your stay.
interaction: I, or my co-host, Nat, am/is available throughout your stay to answer questions that you may have; or recommend local attractions, dining, or nightlife.
house_rules: No entering the back patio or backyard Quiet hours after 10pm on weekdays & Quiet hours after 11pm on weekends  Clean your dishes No lighting of candles
host_about: I'm a Chicagoan who enjoys the outdoors (biking, swimming, jogging, etc.), and who knows the city (well-known highlights and off-the-beaten-path) pretty well. I’ve done a fair amount of traveling in the Continental & Territorial Untied States, as well as Europe & Mexico; along with some varied international destinations. I’m always looking for another adventure...

name: Hip Chicago Apartment - FREE Parking Spot Included
summary: You’ll love this high-end, newly renovated 2 bedroom apartment located in Chicago’s iconic Logan Square. This bright and modern space has free parking, a fully equipped stainless-steel kitchen and an outdoor sitting area perfect for a sunny meal. Walking distance from a bike rental station and hip Armitage Street where you can find a wide selection of restaurants and bars to suit any palate. You’ll also be close by the 606 Trail, a lovely place to enjoy a walk, bike or go for a run
space: Feel the comforts of home while on vacation in this beautiful space. You’ll have access to a well-equipped kitchen that has everything you need in order to cook a fabulous dinner, including a dining table for 4 and dishwasher. The master bedroom features a king sized memory foam bed you won’t want to get out of. The second guest room is cozier and has a full sized bed and closet. The bathroom features a bathtub/shower and a hair-dryer as well as complimentary toiletries and clean hotel quality towels. If you just want to hang out and lounge, then the living room features a huge, comfortable sectional couch and a smart tv with free Netflix along with basic cable and Xfinity high speed internet. The cooling and heating system is equipped with humidifier control for additional comfort no matter the season. This apartment is very well kept, professionally cleaned and sanitized after each and every use.

neighborhood_overview: Recently singled-out in a list of the nation's 25 coolest neighborhoods, Logan Square has just about everything. That includes diversity, character, green spaces, and some of the best bars and restaurants in all of Chicago.
notes: No gatherings, large or small are allowed as we would like the noise level kept to a minimum for the guests in the attached unit (four guests total are allowed).  Further, because of the way  noise travels in this unit, no music should be played so as to not disturb other guests.  Security cameras monitor the noise level and common areas.
transit: The quickest and most inexpensive way to get around is via Uber or Lyft. If you have your own vehicle, take into consideration that parking in the city could cost more than an Uber, so think about leaving your car in the free spot we provide you.  If you would like to sightsee via bicycle, there is a Divy bike rental station just outside the apartment, on Armitage, you can buy a daily pass there. Public Transportation guide to the apartment: From Chicago O'Hare Int'l Airport: Take the Blue Train line to the Belmont Station and there transfer to the CTA #83 bus line on Kimball & Belmont. Additionally there is the Kimball & Armitage bus station nearby the unit, where there are a few bus lines that can be used along with the blue line, to get to downtown Chicago. Train and bus maps can be found and downloaded here:  (Website hidden by Airbnb)
access: When booking this unit you will have full and private access to the entire apartment except for one closet which will be locked. In addition you have a free parking spot and access to the backyard patio which is shared. If you need to do laundry, there is a coin operated laundry room in the basement. Please take into consideration that the unit is on the second floor and the only access is by using the stairs. If you'd like to drop off your bags before check in time or after check out time there is a secured room in the building which you can use. Our check-in and check-out process is automatic and seamless, once you book you will receive the entry code ahead of your stay. Check-in any time after three pm as late as you'd like, check-out on or before 11 am. Due to our cleaning schedule we cannot accommodate early check-ins or late check-outs.
interaction: We want to make sure you have the most convenient and easy check-in experience possible. There is no need to meet in person in order to enter the property, access is via self check-in. Once booked, you will be e-mailed detailed instructions for your seamless check-in process. We are readily available for questions or concerns via Airbnb messaging. Of course in case of emergency you can always reach us via phone call. Please do not text us, as we may not be able to see a text immediately.
house_rules: Please be considerate of the downstairs neighbors who live in the building year round by removing your shoes before entering the unit, keeping the noise levels down and avoiding playing loud music. Check-in is any time after 3 pm as late as you'd like, check-out on or before 11 am. Due to the cleaning schedule we cannot accommodate early check-ins or late check-outs. If necessary, we have arranged luggage drop-off/storage before and after your stay.

name: Historical Beauty Discounted for Long Term Stays
summary: Built in 1936, our loft has earned Chicago's highest landmark status & has a Walk Score of 100.  With 2 stories of stunning glass brick, full amenities, & perfectly located to everything in the city. If you love peace and quiet in this bustling city, this is THE place to stay!
space: Our loft is an icon of art modern architecture. Our historical art deco loft showcases two stories of stunning glass brick, tons of natural light, a fully-stocked kitchen with granite counter tops, water filter, and fridge.  Snuggle in with a luxurious down comforter on our brand new firm king size tempurpedic bed or read a book and relax on our comfy leather couch.  Step just outside to explore downtown Chicago- we are in the heart of the city!

notes: Hablamos español!
transit: Take advantage of Chicago's amazing public transportation.  We are only one block from the red-line. Our location is easy and convenient from both Midway and O'hare airports.  If you choose to drive there is rental parking next door. Our condo's location couldn't be located in a more convenient location to explore the city of Chicago.  We are 1 block from the beach, 2 blocks from Michicagn Avenue, & 1 block from the red-line!
access: Each guest will have full access to our comfortable 750 square foot loft.  Enjoy the peaceful quiet of our condo to escape the sounds of the city- or step outside to see the sights of Chicago at our front door!
interaction: Send a text and I will respond as soon as I can!
house_rules: 1) Maximum capacity is 2 people at all times.   2) Common areas (ex: courtyard) are for long-term tenants only.   3) Our building is kept EXTREMELY quiet and we expect a mutual respect for this from our guests. Please respect our home and our neighbors while walking through the building.     4) No partiers, no pets.  5) No smoking on premise(in condo or on the grounds).  This is a piece of Chicago's history & we encourage only those to stay who will appreciate it.   6) Use coasters.   Key loss and and breaking the rules will result in your immediate removal and loss of your deposit.
host_about: My husband and I are lucky enough to call Chicago and Austin home with our 2 rescue pups and 1 cat. We love to travel and are total foodies!

neighborhood_overview: Bridgeport is the quintessential Chicago neighborhood. notes: Please note that the entire reservation amount is NOT due at the time of booking :) One month's rent is charged, and then the rest is charged by Airbnb in monthly installments. https://www.airbnb.com/help/article/245/how-do-i-pay-for-my-long-term-reservation The owners of this apartment building invested a significant amount of time, money, and resources into a complete renovation in the fall of 2019. That said, the building is over 80 years old and, though greatly cared for, shows its age in some places. Expect to find some loving wear, quaint aging and minor quirks that you might not find in a brand new high-rise :) We are a monthly stay company only and thus we do not apply a monthly discount on our Airbnb listings: our "nightly" rate reflects the pricing for 30 days or more. Any further discounts to our listed rate need to be approved by owners, and factors that they value include but aren't limited to: -potential stays longer than 3 months -potential guests with 2 or more positive

name: The Hideout
summary: 3 Miles from Wrigley!!! Check out this private 2 bedroom garden apartment in the Irving Park neighborhood with FREE PARKING. Safe area! Separate entrance! 7 miles from downtown & 3 miles from Wrigley.
space: Things to consider prior to booking: I am a firm believer in the sharing economy. With that said understand this unit is not ran like a hotel which keep our rates low. However we have higher end amentities like plenty of fluffy towels and high thread count sheets. The garden apartment with many imperfections is our personal space that we gladly share with you at a rate lower then most other rentals in the area. Comfy and cozy with creaking floors and some exposed pipes this old style is the ambiance of the unit. Its a place to rest after exploring our beautiful neighborhood and city of Chicago. The residence has other apartments and other tenants that live there. There are pets on the premises (not in your apartment) that are very well trained however you may hear them from time-to-time. The ceilings are low but not uncommonly low for a garden apartment. In Chicago a basement apartment is considered a garden apartment. The unit is not close to downtown Chicago, the lake, or the Magnifi

neighborhood_overview: The area is very popular with restaurants and late night spots. It has a lot of style without all of the congestion. The apartment is close to Logan Square, Wicker Park, and Lincoln Park however they are not in walking distance. Approximately 7 miles from downtown and 3 miles from Wrigley Field. There is a Divvy Bike Station just down the street. Divvy is the Chicago Bike share Program in which you may rent a bike for a few hours or the entire day. We are off of Elston Street which is also a shared bike path to down town Chicago.
notes: Minimum 2 night stay preferred. In the past I've provided small breakfast items. I stopped this because almost all the time the items were left untouched. If you want me to have something in the fridge or pantry just shoot me a list, I'd love to be able to provide a few things for you to enjoy (within reason :). I do provide coffee and will replenish.
transit: Public transportation minutes away. I am a few blocks away from the Addison train station (CTA Blue Line). This train brings you to the Loop (25 minutes) and O'hare airport. The 152 Addison CTA bus stop is at the end of the block as well. Plenty of free parking on the block. Uber and Lyft area.
access: Apartment is equipped with everything you'll need for your stay -- It features a living room with a Smart TV and surround sound. The kitchen is stocked with the basics such as  plates, flatware, glasses and cookware. Plenty of space to eat in the Kitchen or dining room. If you need special items such as a blender or rice cooker give me a heads up and I can provide for you. Although I do not leave in the apartment, upon request, I can provide a Firestick or Blueray DVD player.  The master bedroom has a King bed, dresser, and closet. The second bedroom is smaller and has a Queen bed. You will find an iron/iron board and extra pillows and blankets in the closets as well. WIFI is available Apartment has a full bathroom and laundry facility.  **BACKYARD IS UNDER CONSTRUCTION AND IS NOT AVAILABLE** The laundry room is shared access. The unit has a backdoor with a lock that separates the apartment from the laundry room. You may lock your back door at anytime. However, access to the laundry ro
interaction: As host, I can help with any information you may need to make your stay in Chicago a memorable one. I have tenants that stay in the other apartments in the house that you may run into in the laundry room, as the laundry room is shared access by everyone in the house. As I stated elsewhere, if I am around I will come and say hi. However, if you need me for any reason I am always available. Once your settled in and you have any concerns or requests please let me know and I will help the best I can swiftly.
house_rules: ***NO LARGE PARTIES !!!!  I'm referring to those who reserve the space intending it to be a party room to have a "house party", play loud music, and are very loud late at night.  -Respect my neighbors and the neighborhood  -I encourage guests to remove shoes inside the apartment. -Please treat the property as your own.  -Check-in and check-out on time. If the unit is not reserved to another guest the day you are arriving or departing yes I can be very flexible with times. So check out the calendar and make a note if it looks like another guest is booked the day your coming or going. Or just ask.
host_about: I am a resourceful and detailed host who was born and raised in the city of Chicago. My passions include Chicago House music, street art, graphic design and tacos. Any destination with warm weather, clear water, and a beach is a place I want to be now.

name: Cute, clean 1 bedroom in shared apt (w cats!)
summary: Come stay in our cute turquoise and tan room! Good thing about our space? - Cute clean room, with closet, dressers, vanity, and double bed. - Feel free to use our kitchen. - 4 curious kitties! - Feel free to use our living room (with a 75’ tv with Netflix/Amazon prime, no cable tho). - WiFi included - Street parking is free/easy to find! But be aware: - If you’re allergic to cats, this isn’t for you. - It’s easy to hear noise from the highway. - We’re on the 2nd floor, one flight of stairs up.
space: You’ll love our kitties, and your own clean private room. You may also use our kitchen, bathroom, washer/dryer, and our living room (with 75” tv with Netflix and Amazon prime tv). Do be aware: while you will have your own private room, you will see my husband, Michael (our roommate) and I on occasion in the general shared areas of the apartment. :)

Like the kitchen, bedroom, washer/dryer and bathroom. You may use our appliances and our Wi
neighborhood_overview: We’re on the four corners of Chicago neighborhoods: East Pilsen, South Loop, UIC Village, and Chinatown. Our area is residential, but there is Thai and Mexican food places within 2 blocks, and many restaurants if you’re willing to walk 5+ blocks. The area is extremely safe.
notes: If you are allergic to cats or noise sensitive, you will not like our place, as we have 4 cats, and thin walls while live near the highway (lots of city noise), and the neighbors have a dog that sometimes barks during the day. Please note: there are locks to get in and out of the apartment, but there are no locks on the individual bedroom doors.
transit: Best way to quickly get downtown is to Uber.  There are also Divvy bikes 2 blocks away, and the 8 CTA bus stop 2.5 blocks away. Lots of free street parking for those who bring their own vehicles.
access: You may access any part of our apt that isn’t our bedroom. Like the kitchen, bedroom, washer/dryer and bathroom. You may use our appliances and our WiFi. Please note: there are locks to get in and out of the apartment, but there are no locks on the individual bedroom doors.
interaction: We are very friendly and sociable, however we know that most guest like their space. You may run into us in the shared spaces, however we’ll mostly keep to ourselves while you are here, unless you would like to hang out (we have a significant amount of board games that we love to play). Derrick is a writer and works from home, so he will be here and available for most the day, and will easy to reach over the phone and email.
house_rules: House rules: Nothing too strict.  - Please be very careful not to lose your keys.  - Lock the door when you leave.  - Pets are ok but be aware: we have 4 cats that hate other pets. So it’s ok to bring pets, but please not for an extended period of time (2 weeks or more). - Quiet after 11pm is appreciated.
host_about:
As a host:
My husband and I live in the second floor, 3 bedroom apartment (of which we AirBnB one room) of a two-flat in the East Pilsen neighborhood of Chicago! We hope you enjoy your stay in our fair city! We’re very available in case you need anything. :)


As a traveler:
I travel for both business and pleasure (although predominantly business).
As a guest, I am low-maintenance -  I will be happy if there are no bugs, if there is a bed, if there is wifi, and access to a bathroom I can flatiron my hair in. 
Being an ambivert, I swing between being social and talkative, or quiet and straight to bed. 
You will find I am clean and responsible and will be happy to treat you and your residence with respect.

Thanks!
Anna

summary: OneEleven - Loop.  Enjoy stunning views of the Chicago River from your apartment before walking to work from this centrally located loop apartment.  In your free time enjoy Michigan Avenue for shopping, as well as museums, restaurants and nightlife at your doorstep. The train, taxis, and buses are all accessible on the same block for even more convenience.

Enjoy stunning city and Chicago River views from floor to ceiling windows while having the luxury of premiere shopping, dining, and big city attractions at your doorstep. This 24-hour doorman building features an expansive two level outdoor sundeck including fire pits, private kitchens, lounge area, seating and grills, an expansive health club with towel service, stunning terrace, indoor pool and spa with retractable wall opening to sundeck, tech bar with free printing, screening room, billiards room with TV and custom music system, lounge with floor-to-ceiling windows and another outdoor terrace overlooking

neighborhood_overview: As Chicago's official downtown area, the Loop is one of the most important central business districts on the globe. In addition to its dynamic architecture and buzzing atmosphere, the area has an incredible concentration of cultural institutions, urban park spaces, award-winning restaurants and a shopper's paradise on State Street. Famous for its striking architecture, the Loop vaunts signature buildings by Ludwig Mies van der Rohe and Louis Henri Sullivan, as well as Aqua by modern day prodigy Jeanne Gang. The area hangout, Millennium Park, complements its surrounding with stunning architectural marvels of its own. The park's crown jewels include a Frank Gehry-designed amphitheater and Cloud Gate, the landmark "Bean" that's become an iconic symbol of Chicago. Nearby Maggie Daley Park and the Chicago Riverwalk are two new engaging outdoor spaces that embrace design — and fun! In addition to architectural marvels, Chicago's cultural attractions also have a prevailing presence in the dow

name: The Urban Bungalow, a Lovely Chicago Oasis
summary: Welcome to our cozy neighborhood oasis! Tucked off a lush, tree lined neighborhood street, our Bungalow is the perfect urban getaway. Stroll two minutes to the heart of Chicago’s Ukrainian Village,  where you can find charming shops, lively bars, and some of the city’s most sought after restaurants. If you want to roam a little further, downtown Chicago is just a 15-minute Uber ride away. Clean, modern, and comfortable – come make our Bungalow your home away from home
space: The Urban Bungalow is a charming, open concept apartment space in the quiet Ukrainian Village neighborhood of Chicago. Hang on the comfy couches in our living room, where you can play boardgames or watch Netflix on our flat screen TV (Gig speed Internet included). Cook yourself something delicious in our kitchen – it is stocked with all the cookware essentials. And enjoy a warm cup of joe on us at our complimentary coffee bar. If the weather is right, may we recommend you take that dinner or coffee out onto the Bungalow’s large patio space? Hang at the table under our hanging lights, stir up a drink at the outside bar, or recline in one of our hanging hammocks. 2 bedrooms, each with a Queen bed + 1 Queen pull-out Crate & Barrel couch in the living room. Iron and ironing board available for your convenience. Washer and dryer available at no additional cost. Leave your toiletries behind! We will have all-natural shampoo, conditioner, and body wash ready and waiting for you upon your arri

If the weather is right, may we recommend you take that dinner or coffee out onto the Bungalow’s
neighborhood_overview: Bask in the youthful, creative energy of West Town. You’ll pass colorful galleries and museums, independent theater companies, small-scale music venues and retail boutiques touting lines from local designers. The Bungalow is minutes away from some of the cities gratest restaurants and most delicious bars. Enjoy unbelievable French food at Café Mare Jeanne, Live music 7 nights a week at The California Clipper, artisanal coffee and quiet work space at C.C Ferns, and a farm to table dining experience at Rootstock Wine Bar. All mentioned are within a 5 minutes walk from The Bungalow.  Explore numerous farmers markets (West Humboldt Park, Logan Square, Wicker Park), all just a short bike ride away. Take off for an afternoon of exploring in the city’s most beautiful park, Humboldt Park, which features 207 acres of lakes, gardens, wildlife preserves, bike and running paths, and unobstructed green space.
transit: Explore the neighborhood by taking full advantage of the newly arrived Bird scooters conveniently located at various locations around the neighborhood. Furthermore, find Divvy bikes located within a 5-minute walk from The Bungalow (corner of Cortez and California St.) PARKING Complimentary street parking is offered directly in front of The Bungalow. Find your overnight parking pass in the kitchen underneath the coffee maker in the drawer all the way to the left. You will have a separate pass for each night you stay. GETTING IN Retrieve the key for your stay located in the lock box to the right of the front door. This key will gain you access to the front door and is not to leave the lock box. The 4 digit code to unlock The Bungalow will be sent to you separately. The Bungalow is the first door on the left as soon as you walk into the building. Please make sure the back-sliding door remains locked when it is not in use. CHECK-OUT Please leave the place how you found it. This is our home
access: The entire apartment and back patio is yours, enjoy!
interaction: We will be available throughout your stay to recommend the wonderful local attractions, dining, nightlife or any other fun things to do while you're in Chicago.

name: Sun filled mid-century modern home nestled on park
summary: Mid-century modern, ivy-covered three bedroom brick ranch located on a park in a northside neighborhood. 15 minutes to O'Hare airport and 20 minutes to downtown. Lots of green space, open living room/dining room with picture windows, funky retro and fully-equipped kitchen, blue bathroom, bedroom with big window out to infinity backyard that leads into a park. Secluded, cozy garden is home to birds at feeder, badminton/volleyball net, picnic table, fire pit, grill, hammocks.
space: Full amenities. Our family home. Neighborhood lore claims the original owner in the 50s was a bagman for the notorious mayor. Tucked into the park, it’s a real gem.
description: Mid-century modern, ivy-covered three bedroom brick ranch located on a park in a northside neighborhood. 15 minutes to O'Hare airport and 20 minutes to downtown. Lots of green space, open living room/dining room with picture windows, funky retro and fully-equipped kitchen, blue bathroom, bedroom with big window out to infinity backyard that leads into a park. House tucked up against Eugene Field Park, on a block that dead ends at the river. Park has activities at field house, native plant rain garden, paths, playground, etc. Short walk to grocery stores, new library, public pool, other parks, forest preserve bike path, divvy rental bikes, restaurants,
neighborhood_overview: House tucked up against Eugene Field Park, on a block that dead ends at the river. Park has activities at field house, native plant rain garden, paths, playground, etc. Short walk to grocery stores, new library, public pool, other parks, forest preserve bike path, divvy rental bikes, restaurants, shops, cafes, in ethnic Albany Park neighborhood and Swedish North Park neighborhood. Across the street from Northeastern University Gym (buy a day pass!). Safe and quiet family neighborhood.
notes: A few notes: The third bedroom, with the two twins beds, does not have a door on one side, and you need to walk through it to access another bedroom. Most people do not mind, but we want this to be super clear. Feel free to ask if you have questions about the layout.  Also, the second bathroom, which is in the basement, is used by a tenant who lives in the basement. He generally keeps it clean, but we can't guarantee it will always be in perfect order. I think this bathroom should be used/ reserved for when multiple people need to take a shower at the same time or situations like that..
transit: 15 minute walk from brown line CTA train, 20 minutes to Blue Line CTA on bus, minutes from Foster, Lawrence, Kimball, and Pulaski bus routes, 5 minutes to 94 highway and 15 minute drive to O'Hare Airport. Easy street parking right in front of house and nearby divvy bike rental.
interaction: I stay nearby and can easily help with anything you need!

name: Sunny Ravenswood Flat
summary: We've worked to create a bright and open space with vibrant colors and accents. Our style leans maximalist without becoming overbearing.  We like to collect original art and photography. Most pieces around the apartment were created by local artists, friends, and us. We are situated above the tree-line facing south which captures every last ray of sunshine. In addition to the light, the radiators keep the apartment nice and cozy during the harsh Chicago winters.
space: Our building has an historic aura about it, however, it has been kept in excellent condition. You can see the care that has been shown to this building and apartment, which is why we love it so much.
description: We've worked to create a bright and open space with vibrant colors and accents. Our style leans maximalist without becoming overbearing.  We like to collect original art and photography. Most pieces around the apartment were created by local artists, friends, and us. We are situated above the tree-line facing south which captures every last ray of sunshine. In addition to the light, the radiators keep the apartment nice and cozy during the harsh Chicago winters. Our building has an historic aura about it, however, it has been kept in excellent condition. You can see the care that has been shown to this building and apartment, which is why we love it so much. The entire apartment is available to guests. There are no shared spaces in the building other than a coin laundry room. We will be available at all times during your stay. We rent to guests when we are visiting family in the midwest area - so we will be in the same timezone. We are nestled right on the edge or Ravenswood, Lakeview,
neighborhood_overview: We are nestled right on the edge or Ravenswood, Lakeview, and North Center. Just a two block walk south and you hit Irving Park Road which is lined with great restaurants and bars. We particularly enjoy Coffee Joint and Madero near the Irving Park Brown Line stop.  Two blocks north on Montrose and Ashland, there is a terrific Asian Fusion restaurant called Bliss Restro (we highly recommend) and just next door is a nice liquor store in case you are hankering for a bottle of wine ;-) To the south east, there is Wrigleyville and Boystown with tons of fun things to do.  Lincoln Square up in Ravenswood is just a 15 minute walk north from our apartment. You can find excellent bars, restaurants, and shops for fun evening on the North side. And to the northeast is Andersonville which is lined with great breweries and brunch spots.
transit: We are within an 8 to 10 minute walk of the CTA Brown Line Irving Park and Montrose stops. The Brown Line will take you all the way to the River North and the Loop in just under 30 minutes. The line is completely elevated and never goes underground so you get an excellent view of the city as you weave through the different neighborhoods.  We are also a 6 minute bus ride away from the Irving Park and Sheridan Red Line stop.  There is plenty of free street parking around our apartment, however, we would recommend taking a cab, Uber, or the CTA around. Parking anywhere else in the city can be expensive and a time waster.
access: The entire apartment is available to guests. There are no shared spaces in the building other than a coin laundry room.
interaction: We will be available at all times during your stay. We rent to guests when we are visiting family in the midwest area - so we will be in the same timezone.

In addition to the shopping and bars, you are minutes from the beach, the Hancock and Water Tower. Trader Joe's and Whole Foods are both within a couple of blocks if you plan to stay for a longer period of time.
notes: Tempur-pedic mattress that assures a great night's sleep! There is also a blow up queen mattress that can be used for extra guests.  There are extra towels, sheets/bedding available. Kitchen is fully furnished with a dishwasher as well.
transit: The location is less than a 5 minute walk to the Chicago red line station. Uber, Taxi. Short cab ride to the Convention Center.
interaction: Available 24/7
house_rules: - Please leave it as you entered it (please clean up after yourself), no loud noises and no smoking. No smoking or pets allowed. Please remove your shoes when occupying the unit.

summary: Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this charming South Loop furnished one-bedroom apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and lovely living room with great high floor views. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Chicago has to offer! (#CHI53)
space: Thoughtfully designed with bespoke finishes, modern furnishings, and a fully-equipped kitchen, you’ll enjoy that “I’m home” feeling with this Blueground apartment. Whether you’re lounging in your comfortable living room streaming the latest and greatest entertainment on the smart TV or premium wireless speaker, or getting some well-earned rest on the superior quality mattress with luxury linens, you’ll fall in love with everything this South Loop apartment has to offer.  This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry. neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in South Loop. A dynamic neighborhood with a unique mix of attractions, shopping and history. Take a stroll along South Michigan Avenue and the nearby Prairie Avenue district to see "Millionaire's Row", an area lined with mansions belonging to Chicago's wealthiest elite. For shopping, visit the Roosevelt Collection, an open-air plaza, home to a cinema as well as premium local and national retailers. Along the southern edge, you will find Soldier Field, the Chicago Bears football stadium. Don’t miss the Shedd Aquarium, Field Museum and Grant Park, all adjacent to one another and huge attractions in South Loop.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions (including certain Bull Terriers and any related breeds). Wild animals and hybrids, including wolf and coyote hybrids, snakes, ferrets, rabbits, are all prohibited. Please contact us for precise breed restrictions. Please note that a one-off non refundable fee ($500) and a monthly rent ($25/mo/pet) is applicable upon reservation. Failing to notify us of any pets prior to check-in will incur a penalty, and may result in denied check-in. host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

name: Lakeview 2B/2BA Private Home with Deck - Sleeps 8!
summary: Enjoy living like a true Chicagoan in this 2 Bedroom 2 Bath Comfy Home in the heart of the city. Experience where true locals drink coffee, eat food or how they commute around the city. 2 Level home with a private deck ideal for cookouts. Many restaurants within walking distance including Chicago's Famous Gino's East Pizza which is across the street! Walk one block to the north and experience a  charming life-style café that nails healthy and flavorful eats for breakfast, lunch and dinner.
space: If you are thinking about staying in a Chicago Hotel....DON'T!! "ala" David Letterman....Here are the TOP REASONS why you should stay at our home.  1. COFFEE & RESTURANT DOWNSTAIRS: Who wants overpriced coffee and food when traveling. Coffee Lab & Roasters, Gino's East, and El Tequilas Bar & Grill are all neighborhood essentials. 2. LARGE SPACE: The place can accommodate 8 people. There are 2 queen beds in bedroom #1 in the upstairs level, 2 King Beds in bedroom #2 of the upstairs level. 3. COZY KITCHEN: Much larger than a hotel room kitchen if you even get one.  4. FREE WIFI: Chicago hotels can charge up to $20 a day just to stay connected. 5. PRIVATE DECK: Enjoy relaxing on our private deck during a sunny summer afternoon or grilling up some hot dogs while listing to the cubs play on our (Hidden by Airbnb) home.  6. NO Resort Fees, NO hidden Charges what so ever! 7. HOWEVER, THE VERY TOP REASON TO STAY IN OUR HOME and the reason why Airbnb even exists ) is: PRICE !! Our home provides

name: Cozy Prohibition Era Apartment
summary: This 900 square foot, 1920’s era one bedroom is a quiet retreat away from the big city bustle. It comfortably sleeps up to three people and is just steps away from Andersonville brunches, Lincoln Square, Empirical Brewery, Winnemac Park, Koval Distillery, Tony’s Groceries, and Mariano's grocery store. Free street parking, fully stocked kitchen, easy downtown access via the Ravenswood Metra commuter rail, a 15-minute bus ride to Wrigley Field, and many other nearby restaurant and transit options.
space: Please feel free to use all spaces of the apartment. Heads up, there is no hair dryer, so you will have to bring your own.  I do not have enough space/electrical outlets for a coffee pot, so the best I can provide in the way of coffee is a pour over chemex coffee make. It’s pretty easy and I can walk you through it if need be. As for the heat/cooling in the apartment, it is all radiator heat and cannot be adjusted; there is no thermostat. There is no air conditioning, but it is a first floor unit with fans. You are also more than welcome to open a window or two. The light in the main hallway sometimes does not go on until 9 at night, so you may need to use a flashlight when coming back i to the apartment. This is something I do not have any control over, unfortunately.

neighborhood_overview: Ravenswood is a quiet and peaceful upper middle class neighborhood on the far north side of Chicago. It's a family neighborhood with a lot of early Chicago charm, complete with courtyard buildings, prairie parks, breweries, distilleries, Victorian mansions, and a lot of influences from its early German and Swedish settlers.  If brunch is your thing, you will have no trouble finding a good brunch spot down the street or in Andersonville next door.
notes: Hello! I have noticed that some folks are making reservations for others to stay in my apartment. For better communication and a good stay experience for everyone, bookings should be made directly by the people who will be staying in my home.
transit: I’m a fan of the Metra. It’s a commuter train that gets you downtown quickly (15 minutes and only one stop in between) and drops you off in the West Loop at Ogilvie Transportation center, one of the main train stations in Chicago.  Second favorite is the 147 express bus, which takes you right down Lakeshore Drive to Michigan Avenue; no stops in between Foster and Delaware, just a smooth, 20-minute ride down LSD with  a stunning view of Lake Michigan and no Cubs foot traffic. To get to the 147, take the eastbound 92 Foster bus to Sheridan/Foster (after the Berwyn red line) and then transfer to the 147 at Sheridan/Foster. You can also ride the El if you need to get off between my apartment and downtown. The El ride either on the Brown Line or Red line will take you 35-40 minutes.
access: Guests can access the laundry room across the gangway using their front door key. If I am unable to meet you in time, I will leave your keys in my mailbox, which you can find on the right side of my building's vestibule in the mailbox marked “Pelletier.”
interaction: Please speak with me in person or call/text.
house_rules: - Check-in times: If you need to set your check-in time to an earlier time than I have posted in my listing, please contact me 72 hours ahead of your arrival to arrange for the keys. I'll need this much notice so I can be sure to have the apartment put together for you in a timely manner.  - Please do not wear shoes in my house; I like to keep my floors as clean as possible. - Please tidy up and lock all doors when you leave.
host_about: We are native Chicagoans with a passion for food, art, culture, and travel. Clean, quiet, positive, friendly; a bit of a hoot.

name: Sunnyside Getaway
summary: This beautiful apartment is thoughtfully decorated with inviting furniture and includes these wonderful amenities: • Designated parking spot inside gated parking area  • Fully equipped kitchen • In-unit washer/dryer • Wood burning fireplace  • Fast Wifi and Cable • 2 min walk to local coffee shops • 5 min walk to Montrose Beach • 5 min train ride to Wrigley Field • 8 min walk to el stop (Red and Purple Lines) • 15 min ride to downtown • Walking distance to Target and Jewel Grocery
space: If you're looking for a home away from home, look no further. This apartment is designed with all the comforts of home in mind.  The two bedrooms both have very comfortable queen size beds and two full bathrooms (including a jacuzzi tub)!  Both have walk-in closets and dressers for ample storage space. The living room is oh-so spacious and features a huge flat screen TV, a real wood burning fireplace, and the world's best couch. Whether you're working from home or binging on Netflix, you won't want to leave this couch! The kitchen is fully equipped for cooking and has a hightop dining room table.    The apartment also includes in-unit laundry!

Whether you're working from home or binging on Netflix, you won't want to leave t
neighborhood_overview: Uptown is a vibrant and diverse Chicago neighborhood that borders right on Lake Michigan. Currently one of the city's most up and coming neighborhoods, it features many local small businesses and coffee shops. It's also within walking distance of the historic Green Mill bar where Slam Poetry was first born (still going on every Sunday night!).
notes: Utilities, cable, and high-speed wifi are included. A minimum of 30 nights stay is required.
transit: The apartment is conveniently located right off Lake Shore drive making it a breeze to get downtown and other hot spots in the city.  There is a bus that picks up right at the corner of the street that will have you on Michigan Ave. in 15 minutes.  You're also an 8 minute walk from the Wilson el stop which has both Red and Purple Lines. In addition to public transit, Uber and Lyft are both great options to use.
access: Guests will have full access to the apartment and patio as well as have a designated parking space in the gated parking lot behind the building. The apartment is accessed through a gated and stunning courtyard that always boasts beautiful seasonal flowers.
interaction: We meet with every guest in person to give them a tour of the building and apartment. We also provide a local map we've created ourselves to highlight all the restaurants, bars, and grocery options nearby. While we will not be on-sight during your stay, we are always available by phone or text.
host_about: Hi friends! While I love my condo in Chicago dearly, I have an incredible opportunity to complete a theology degree for close to no cost on the west coast. I love music, reading, traveling, coffee and my couch (seriously, just wait, it's the best). I LOVE to travel (visiting Peru, Macedonia, Ireland, Israel and Haiti this year) and hope you'll enjoy staying at my place while I can't be there! Thankful my dear friend Kim is an airbnb expert - she'll make sure you're taken care of and enjoy your stay in Chicago! Enjoy!

name: Spectacular 3BR Penthouse in the Loop | Roof Deck
summary: Beautiful 1,400 square foot penthouse apartment with 13 foot high ceilings on the 23rd floor with city views in multiple directions. This bright and airy three bedroom, two bathroom space is perfect for travelers looking for a luxurious escape in the sky in the heart of downtown Chicago. The penthouse is adjacent to the building's amazing rooftop terrace with a hot tub and panoramic views of the skyline. This is the best location in the city within walking distance of all the sights!
space: Located in a secure, high-end building in the center of Chicago! Once inside, you're greeted by a light-filled apartment with oversize windows overlooking the city skyline. The views during the day are fantastic - but it's even more magical at night! Right out the window, you'll see a unique scene of diverse and famous Chicago architecture with the bustling city below.  Everything is top of line and interior design is a passion of ours - so the chic furnishing of the unit reflects that! There is fast internet, a smart TV with Roku, and comfortable modern furniture to lounge on.  The kitchen and living room are open. The kitchen is stocked with cookware and all the tools you need to cook a great meal. We have 5 counter stools for the granite kitchen island. Plenty of room to dine comfortably or to use as a workspace.  For each guest, the comfortable beds have crisp, clean linens and the bathrooms are stocked with fresh towels and bath products. neighborhood_overview: The Loop is the heart of Chicago and the most central location in the entire city! You are surrounded by world-class architecture, shopping, theaters, parks, and other sites. You can quickly walk to Millennium Park, the lakefront, the Chicago River, the Magnificent Mile, the Art Institute, and so much more. The Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium, and Soldier Field are just a 5 minute ride. Oak Street for luxury shopping and the West Loop restaurant row for world class dining are only 5 minutes away as well!
transit: Our place is surrounded by trains and buses that will take you anywhere in the city you want to go! Uber and Lyft is also available 24/7. You'll have no trouble getting around without a car. Parking is not included with our listing, but there are many nearby parking garages close to our building (within a couple blocks). We also suggest using SpotHero or ParkWhiz to find and book discounted parking. You can usually find reasonable overnight parking for $15 to $25.
access: You'll have complete and private access to our penthouse. You will also have access to all of the building's shared amenities (rooftop deck, gym, etc).
interaction: We're always available to answer questions and provide recommendations!
house_rules: 1.No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable and subject to a $250 fine. 2.Please ensure that you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to the designated location by the agreed upon check-out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out penalty. 3.Absolutely no smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any entrance. 4.Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily.  5.Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid. 6.Lockouts will result in a $150 fee per occurrence. Additionally, lost keys will incur a $150 per key fee.
host_about: Discover Chicago with a stay at one of our distinctive neighborhood properties. Staywell's concierge team is dedicated to ensuring that you have an exceptional and memorable experience. We love hosting guests and are available for questions about the city and anything else you might need during your stay!

name: Spacious home 5BR/2BH, 10 min downtown w/parking
summary: Gleaming hardwood floors create a warm, welcoming foundation in this modern house. Stroll a friendly neighborhood, shop at Mariano grocery, and cook in a kitchen with stone countertops.
space: This beautiful home is extremely spacious and comfortable.  5 bedroom/3.5 bathroom.  Grand entry living room with stone walls.   The kitchen is a warm and inviting space with lots of natural sunlight.  Vaulted ceiling and skylights throughout the house.  3 bedrooms all on one floor, marble bathrooms.  One bedroom on the first floor. Separate shower and jetted jacuzzi tub, ample closet space.  Huge basement, family room, laundry room and 5th bedroom.  Oak floors on the first floor, stainless steel appliances, nearly all brick, detached 2-car garage,  The garage has a roof top deck. BBQ grill avail in the summer time in back yard, walking distance to CTA public transportation.  10 min to downtown, Bucktown/Wicker park, Westloop, highway access.    Restaurants and parks are nearby.  This is your best option for you to explore the city and come home to a simple, clean, comfortable house.   Wii game system, Netflix and Hulu are avail to be connected to your Apple device.

name: Charming Coach House in Roscoe Village, Chicago
summary: Your private retreat in lovely Roscoe Village! Comfortable and stylishly decorated with family and friends in mind. Ideal for inlaws, families and couples. Renovated in early 2018, with new kitchen, carpet, furniture and washer/dryer.  We are in a safe, quiet, and family-friendly neighborhood known as the “Village Within The City”. We are close to downtown, Wrigley Field, restaurants and shops. About 20 minutes on Blue Line train to O'Hare.
space: First floor of a coach house.  Two bedrooms, with a queen bed in bedroom #1 and a bunk bed in #2.  New pull out couch added in the living room in early 2018.  Nicely appointed and quiet with TV (Hulu and Netflix), wireless internet, and laundry. Private outdoor patio with table and chairs.

We are close to downtown, Wrigley Field, restaurants and shops. About 20 minutes on Blue Line train to O'Hare. First floor of a coach house.  Two bedrooms, with a queen bed in bedroom #1 and a bunk bed in #2.  New pull out couch added in the living room in early 2018.  Nicely appointed and quiet with TV (Hulu and Netflix), wireless internet, and laundry. Private outdoor patio with table and chairs. Entire first floor of the property, with front access through the gate in the front yard, or back door access through the alley. We live in the yellow house next door. So, feel free to call, email, or knock on our door. We have lived in Chicago for over 18 years a
neighborhood_overview: Two blocks to charming and quaint Roscoe Street, with its restaurants, shops, and entertainment.  Five minute walk to Mariano's grocery store, numerous parks, 1.5 miles West of Wrigley Field, 15 min to downtown and the Lakefront. This is a very popular/trendy neighborhood for families and is known as "The Village Within The City".
notes: If you are traveling with a baby, we have a pack n play, car seat, high chairs and toys available. If you are wondering if we have something, just ask! Street parking is free and easy to find. Just be sure to look out for street cleaning signs on occasion.  Monthly rental is available if you are in transition while buying a home or if you want to try out the neighborhood as a potential buyer! (We LOVE living in Roscoe Village).
transit: Ten to fifteen minute walk to the Paulina Brown Line, or take the Belmont bus East to the Red Line. You can also take the Western Bus to the Blue Line if you are going south or Addison Blue Line to O'Hare. Street parking readily available. You can also download the Lyft or Uber apps as an alternative to public transportation. UberX will cost approximately $12 to get downtown. Citymapper is a great app for getting around.
access: Entire first floor of the property, with front access through the gate in the front yard, or back door access through the alley.
interaction: We live in the yellow house next door. So, feel free to call, email, or knock on our door. We have lived in Chicago for over 18 years and love to offer recommendations on what to do and where to go.
house_rules: Our coach house is nestled between single family homes, so please limit outside noise after 10:00 PM.  Also, no smoking inside the unit and no pets.
host_about: Hi! We are a friendly family of five. We love Roscoe Village- it's a special neighborhood and a hidden gem on the northside of Chicago. The guest quarters are in the coach house next door to our home, so we use it for our own inlaws and friends as well. We have thought of everything we can to make sure our guests are comfortable. We will be delighted to meet you!

name: Bed 3, The six corners of Tri-Taylor
summary: Modest, traditional Chicago style apartment built in 1902. Located at the western end of the Tri-Taylor neighborhood. It is walking distance to UIC, Rush, County, and Mount Sinai Medical centers- and situated between Taylor and Roosevelt. This makes it Easy to drive into the city (2 miles to Willis tower) or hop onto CTA bus (stops in front of the building). Also there are a number of bars and restaurants along both streets that are easily walkable to, w/the first bar across the street from here

Located in the living room.  To note; The kitchen is actually big enough to have the air mattress in as well, leaving ample space to access the fridge/stove/ bathroom. notes: This area is heavily patrolled by Chicago police department and by UIC campus police making it safer than most areas of Chicago.  *Remember* Chicago has a reputation for a reason. Use common sense when traveling/walking/interacting with people no matter what part of Chicago you are in.

description: Inspired by the incredible architecture amidst Chicago (Frank Lloyd Wright, right?), this bold loft is designed for the discerning eye. Bundling urban charm with expansive views and even more expansive windows, this suite boasts a fully stocked kitchen, a cozy queen-sized bed, and a perfect lounge area to relax after a long day—or to dream up your next adventure. Access is available to the entire apartment. We will be available throughout your stay to recommend local attractions, dining, nightlife, or any other concierge services that interest you. Hyde Park, home to the prestigious University of Chicago and the Museum of Science and Industry, is a culturally rich neighborhood full of eclectic shops, restaurants, and small businesses. Enjoy a stroll in one of the area’s many parks—or explore Chicago by bike when you hop on the Lakefront Trail and cruise for miles.
notes: For the safety and comfort of all our guests, Zencity is following CDC guidance to ensure every guest has a clean place to stay. Some of the steps we are taking include (Website hidden by Airbnb)   (Website hidden by Airbnb) Thoroughly disinfecting each suite between stays including counter tops, door knobs, faucets, light switches, among other (Website hidden by Airbnb) Stocking-up on extra supplies such as soaps and cleaning products in case you need it (yes, including toilet paper (Website hidden by Airbnb) Minimizing in-person contact with our guests whenever possible by using smart tools like our digital check-in proces (Website hidden by Airbnb)   (Website hidden by Airbnb) We are not responsible for packages if they are unable to be delivered. If anything is not to your liking, please notify us, and we will correct the situation as soon as possible.
transit: Cab/Uber service is readily available in this location and is our preferred method of transportation downtown. The unit is close to the Metra that takes you directly to the Loop and is also near several major bus routes.
access: Access is available to the entire apartment.
interaction: We will be available throughout your stay to recommend local attractions, dining, nightlife, or any other concierge services that interest you.
house_rules: 1. No onsite parking 2. No late checkout past 11am 3. Quiet time after 10pm 4. ONLY guests included on the reservation are permitted on the premises 5. Lost or misplaced keys will be charged at cost (up to $100) 6. We are not responsible for packages if they are unable to be delivered We look forward to hosting you!  If you are unable to abide by house rules, please consider another listing as we reserve the right to end your stay early for serious violations.  We take pride in our home and are excited to welcome you, but please respect the space and others who live in the building.
host_about: Modern travel means you deserve the most out of your stay – complete with amenities that matter to you. Zencity offers every guest convenient locations, kitchen essentials, and several great entertainment options for you to enjoy. All coupled with insider knowledge and access to the best the city has to offer.

name: Sunny Urban Loft
summary: New! Located by Pilsen, the unit is fully equipped with everything you need for a short-term stay. Snuggle into a comfy bed with high end linens looking into a beautifully landscaped courtyard that makes you feel like you've discovered a private oasis in the middle of the city. Have questions? Send me a message!
description: New! Located by Pilsen, the unit is fully equipped with everything you need for a short-term stay. Snuggle into a comfy bed with high end linens looking into a beautifully landscaped courtyard that makes you feel like you've discovered a private oasis in the middle of the city. Have questions? Send me a message! Rich in Latino culture, Pilsen is a neighborhood that overflows with music, art, culinary tradition, and nightlife. It’s home to award-winning restaurants, iconic music venues, and sensational murals as far as the eye can see. Maybe that’s why it was named one of the “12 Coolest Neighborhoods Around the World” by Forbes. The 8 Halsted Bus stops a few steps away and can take you directly to the loop. Uber/lyft is also very affordable to take from this location to anywhere you would like in the city.

name: ⭐️Luxury Suite w free parking by Northeastern Univ⭐️
summary: - 1000 square foot private apartment. - Private entrance with free laundry on site   - Private big Backyard and Grill. - Free easy street parking with great Parks nearby.  - Fully equipped and stocked kitchen. - Self Check-In and Out with Smart-Lock. - High Speed internet 500 MB + 55” smart tv  - 5 mins drive to groceries (Whole Foods) and Malls - 5 mins walk to Northeastern University - 20 mins drive to O’Hare Airport.  - 25 mins drive to Dtw Chicago.  - 10 mins drive to Cubs Stadium.
space: Located in a very safe, quiet, family-friendly neighborhood, this garden apartment is well lit and comfortable. We are very close to Peterson Park, which features a playground for children, tennis courts and a beautiful walking path through the North Park Nature preserve. (Deer and other small wildlife are not rare to see.) We are also very close to Northeastern and North Park Universities, as well as Swedish Covenant Hospital. We are located about halfway between O'Hare airport and downtown Chicago. Only a 30-minute walk or 10-minute bus ride to the Kimball brown line train stop. Lincolnwood Mall and several grocery stores are a very short drive or bus ride away.  The unit is newly rehabbed to condo standard with brand-new Stainless-Steel appliances and amenities.  The spacious garden apartment features a large living + dining area, full kitchen with a dishwasher, two bedrooms with queen size beds in each, one bathroom with shower, and access to the shared laundry area. The kitchen is

neighborhood_overview: This is a prime area of North Chicago. It is centrally located near Downtown,  O'Hare Airport and nearby suburbs. This entire apartment is a few minutes from restaurants, parks, cafés, and universities. Easy access to O'Hare Airport. The apartment comes with its own entrance for you to come and go as you please. For international guests, languages spoken include English, French, and Spanish. North Park is a safe and quiet neighborhood. It is a combination of single-family homes and apartments/condos. It is bordered by Lawrence on the south, Petersen on the north, Kedzie and the river on the east and Pulaski on the west. Some lovely river parks. We have Swedish Covenant Hospital, Northeastern Illinois University, Telshe Yeshiva Chicago, Petersen Elementary and Northside Preparatory College High School, a magnet school. North Park is a very family-oriented neighborhood with lots of parks and small family-owned businesses. This is a diverse ethnic neighborhood. You will find parking on ou
notes: Nearby Restaurants suggestion for Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner and Take Out: - Two Asian Brothers, Pan-Asian - Dai Paeng Yi Korean Noodles & snacks - Corner Market, 3 blocks (Arcadia Food Wine & Spirits) 7-11, 2 blocks - Brazilian Bowl - Noon O Kebab - Mexican (authentic) Extec on Lawrence (BYOB also) - Libanais (Amazing !!!!)  - Yes Thai our favorite Thai restaurant. They delivered - Tre Kronor (great Swedish breakfasts and lunches) - Kronor (great Swedish breakfasts and lunches) - Chipotle - Potbelly  - McDonald (Our kids love it) - Panda Express - Burger King Nearby Gas Station suggestion - Citgo Gas station, 4 blocks, east - Shell gas station, 5 blocks south Nearby DYI Suggestion  - Home Depot  Nearby Universities suggestion - Northeastern Illinois University  - North Park University  - Loyola University (18 mins Drive or 3.9 miles) - Northwestern University (25 mins Drive or 6.8 miles) Nearby Hospital suggestion  - Swedish Covenant Hospital - North Park Pediatrics  - Saint Francis Hea
transit: Get Around Chicago!!! - O'Hare: To reach O’Hare International Airport via public transportation: Take the Kimball bus south to Lawrence (#81), get on the Blue line train costs $2.25 per ride. - The CTA:  (Chicago Transit Authority) might seem daunting, but it's actually very easy to understand, and well-planned out - Downtown Chicago: The brown line is the safest train in Chicago. At Lawrence and Kimball, the train is on the ground, but as you go south into the City it becomes elevated! Hence the nickname for the train, "The L." It's great and easy way to see the city. (During the week it stops running around midnight—sometimes a little before, sometimes a little after—and on the weekend it goes until about 2 am). - If you’re cooking and need a grocery store, there’s a Jewel Supermarket on the corner of Foster and Pulaski and a great grocery store called “Harvestime" on Lawrence and Western.
interaction: My spouse and I will be available to answer all your questions if needed. We both working but we can be reached via texts, emails or a phone call.
house_rules: Self check-in with keypad No smoking, parties, or events Check-in is anytime after 3PM and check out by 11AM No shoes inside.  Potential for noise - This is a basement unit and in a vintage bungalow. You may hear our children or feet walking from time to time. No loud music Only registered guests allowed to stay and visit the apartment Apartment not to be used for commercial purposes Free parking on the Street
host_about: I go by Bart, raised all over the world (Paris, Cape Town, Geneva to name a few). My spouse and I both work in IT and we love to host and travel. We have two beautiful children: four and  two.

neighborhood_overview: We’re located on the north side of Chicago in Lincoln Park, one of Chicago’s trendiest and safest neighborhoods. Our neighborhood is a wonderful mix of bustling streets packed with local restaurants and shops, as well as quiet tree-lined streets full of historic buildings. We’re also minutes away from many of Chicago’s most popular spots.
notes: FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS 1. “How do I get to ‘x’ from the apartment?/How far is the apartment from ‘x’?” Directions from our apartment to any point in the city are available via web search. We're a 10-minute walk from the Diversey Brown Line "L" train station. Search for “Diversey Brown Line Station Chicago” in Maps, click the “Directions” button, then enter your point of interest. 2. When is check-in/check-out? Check-in is 3 p.m. or later but you're welcome to stop by anytime after 11:30 a.m. to drop off your bags in the living room. Check-out is at 11 a.m. Our cleaning staff will need access to the apartment at 11 a.m., but you’re welcome to leave your bags in the living room and pick them up by 2:30 p.m. at the latest.
transit: Because of our central location, we recommend leaving your car at home. Any point of interest in Chicago can easily be reached by walking, public transit, or Uber. ￫ The Diversey Brown Line 'L' train station is a 10-minute walk away. ￫ O'Hare is 55 minutes away via public transit and 30-45 minutes away via Uber. ￫ Midway is 60 minutes away via public transit and 35-50minutes away via Uber
interaction: WHY STAY WITH TROVE? ⭐ Fast Communication We’re always on call to answer your questions, typically within 30 minutes. ⭐ Experienced Hosts We’ve hosted thousands of guests over five years. ⭐ Easy Self-Check-In Keyless access means no keys for you manage during your stay! ⭐ Central Location You’ll never be far from local spots to check out, sights to see, and public transit.

In order to compensate our cleaning assistants for lost time, additional charges will be sent if they're unable to begin their job at 11 am. One hour or less - $25 Each additional hour - $40 5) Damaged/stained/missing towels, bedding, and/or furnishings will incur additional fees. name: Mapletree Suites 2BA+2BA | Chicago West Loop
summary: Our stylish, clean, and fully furnished 2 bed+2 bath suites are located in a boutique building in Chicago’s booming West Loop neighborhood. Walk to the United Center, world-class Randolph Row/Fulton Market restaurants, corporate offices incl. (Hidden by Airbnb) and McDonald’s, UIC, and the expansive Illinois Medical District.  Rest well knowing that your hosts--Darsh & Bina--are very responsive, live in the building, and are ready to answer your questions or assist with your special requests at any time!
space: ***COVID-19 update: access to our suite is fully keyless, and our professional cleaners are using special COVID-19 cleaning protocols*** Our suite is in a friendly, impeccably maintained building, and up one flight of stairs or a quick ride in the elevator. You'll walk into a brightly lit living/dining space, open to the kitchen. In the kitchen, you’ll find all of the appliances, cooking and serving ware you’ll need to prepare in-home meals, and adjacent is the closet containing the in-unit washer and dryer. The living room has a Queen-sized sleeper sofa with a memory foam mattress and provides direct access through the sliding glass doors out to the large private balcony with patio furniture. Just off the living room is one of two bedrooms with a Queen-sized bed, and across from that, one of the two full baths. At the rear of the suite is the master bedroom, with a Queen-sized bed and en suite bathroom. The master bedroom has access to another private balcony.

In the kitchen, you’ll find all of the appliances, cooking and serving ware you’ll need to prepare in-home meals, and adjacent is the closet containing the in
neighborhood_overview: From a gritty, partially abandoned manufacturing corridor to a burgeoning neighborhood flush with must-visit spots for foodies, eclectic art galleries and shops, and numerous acres of redeveloped park space, West Loop is now one of the hottest downtown areas in the entire country.  The famed restaurant and bar scene, close proximity to public transit and three major expressways, and downright cool, industrial atmosphere makes the West Loop a desirable location to stay, live and work. Innovative tech giants like (Hidden by Airbnb) , (Hidden by Airbnb) , and Uber have turned old warehouses into their new headquarters. A slew of openings centered around Randolph Street and Fulton Market make restaurant- and bar-hopping in untrodden territory a nightly possibility. You can go from taqueria to futuristic cocktail lounge, sushi bar to secret underground speakeasy, whole-animal butcher shop to wine tasting, burger bar to champagne salon—and the neighborhood’s evolution is far from finished. T
notes: Our past guests have enjoyed the following amenities to make their stay very comfortable and worthy of a 5-star experience:  * Keyless entry: no need to pick up or carry around keys during your stay; just enter your host-assigned 4-digit code on the keypad * On-site luggage storage: for day of check-in or check-out, let us know and we’ll make it happen! * Target store: only two blocks away for all home/personal essentials, grocery, pharmacy, and even a Starbucks Coffee store * Café L’Appetito: located right downstairs, offers fresh and authentic Italian sandwiches, coffee and gelato! * Skinner Park: one block away, this beautiful park has a large children’s playground, basketball/tennis courts, a running track and open grass fields * Chicago Police Academy: located across the street, you’ll see friendly police recruits and faculty training and teaching almost every day.
transit: It's easy to get around here without a car. The Blue Line is a convenient and cost-effective way to access Chicago’s O’Hare International Airport; the Racine stop is only a five-minute walk from our building!  The 126/Jackson bus stop is right across the street and can take you straight into the loop or to the lakefront within a few minutes. Ride-sharing services (Uber, Lyft, etc.) are plentiful in our area. If you do bring a car, there's plenty of street parking in the neighborhood, and you’ll have quick access to the highway network (I-290, I-90/94 and I-55) to get you to the further parts of the Chicagoland metropolitan area.
access: You'll have full access to my 2 bedroom, 2 bath condo (over 1,000 sq ft), as well as the private patio and balcony.
interaction: I live with my family in another unit in the building so please be sure to say "hi" if you see me!
house_rules: - Not to exceed no. of guests confirmed in booking.   - No smoking (of any substance) includes balconies, common area and building premises. - Cleaning fee does not cover excessive wear & tear such as permanently soiled towels/linens and litter/food residue left behind on furniture/equipment. - Residential building maintains quiet hours from 10pm to 8am, daily.  Host lives in building.
host_about:
We were both born and raised in Toronto, Canada (our home away from home) and we've spent the last 15+ years loving our lives together and building our young family in this amazing City of Chicago.  While many of our friends have moved to the suburbs, we’ve discovered a vibrant and highly engaged community right here in Chicago's booming West Loop neighborhood, and never tire of checking out all of the world-class restaurants and events our city has to offer (indeed, our babysitting costs are sky-high!).  

We consider it an honor to host guests from all over the United States and all across the world and to give them a chance to enjoy this area as much as we do.  And we do it because we know how great it feels to stay in a clean and cozy place in the heart of an inviting and exciting city when it's our turn to travel the globe!  It's good karma, and that's what we're all about!

Wishing you a happy stay,
Darsh + Bina

notes: The room is private but you will share common areas ( kitchen , living room, and the bathroom/s) with other Airbnb guests. Usually none of this get crowd because most of Airbnb guests are most of the time outside the house knowing the city, in concerts, interviews, etc, and they don’t spend much time in the house. A private apartment in the area usually cost over 120$ p/night plus taxes and fees which is in total almost 200$ p/night ! If you want save some money and being close to downtown, surrounding great public transportation and with free street parking this could be a great option for you!  The room has one full size bed. neighborhood_overview: 100% of guests love my location- it is the best of both worlds: 5 minutes from the very center of downtown, yet quiet enough to not hear the noise at night. If you are still not convinced, please read my reviews.
transit: "UIC Halsted" is the closest blue line train (metro) station, only 5 minutes away (walking).  -Downtown/Loop: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and get off at "LaSalle, Jackson, or Monroe," depending on where you are going :) FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC Halsted." About 5 minutes to downtown. -O’Hare Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare. O'Hare is the final stop. FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC Halsted." About 40 minutes to O’Hare. -Midway Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and transfer to orange line at "Clark/Lake," then take orange line to towards Midway airport. Midway is the final stop! FROM - take orange line towards Adams/Wabash; then, transfer to blue line at "Clark/Lake." Take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC-Halsted." About 45 minutes to Midway. -Union Station/Amtrak: Only 20 minutes away (walking), taxi or uber will take you to the apartment in less than 5 minutes for about $6 :)
house_rules: Please read your check-in instructions carefully Please no overstaying past your checkout time
host_about:
Hello! My name is Natalia, and I would like to welcome you to Chicago. I host with my sister, Marina, and we are originally from Saint Petersburg, Russia, but we spent our teenage years in Aix-en-Provence, France and therefore speak English, Russian and French fluently :) I work as an investment banker in the loop. 

Hotels can get very expensive, so we do our best to help tourists out. I really hope to host you! :)
