name: Steps to Bars, Lake, Eats | Easy Access | Zencity
summary: This vintage-chic walk-up is a quick jaunt from all of Lincoln Park’s hotspots, but sits on a lively, tree-lined street, and what better way to take in the neighborhood’s natural flourishes than by standing on your very own Juliet balcony? This space offers up a full kitchen, spacious bedrooms, and—with that balcony—potential for rewriting the greatest love story ever told. Anything can happen!
space: When you choose Zencity, you can say farewell to renting “rooms” in someone else’s dusty basement or running into your host on the way back from a shower. Instead, say hello to a clean room, the freshest of towels, 24-hour entry, and a customer service agent always happy to answer any and all questions. Romantic stories, however, are not guaranteed.
description: This vintage-chic walk-up is a quick jaunt from all of Lincoln Park’s hotspots, but sits on a lively, tree-lined street, and what better way to take in the neighborhood’s natural flourishes than by standing on your very own Juliet balcony? This space offers up a full kitchen, spacious bedrooms, and—with that balcony—potential for rewriting the greatest love story ever told. Anything can happen! When you choose Zencity, you can say farewell to renting “rooms” in someone else’s dusty basement or running into your host on the way back from a shower. Instead, say hello to a clean room, the freshest of towels, 24-hour entry, and a customer service agent always happy to answer any and all questions. Romantic stories, however, are not guaranteed. Access is available to the entire apartment. We will be available throughout your stay to recommend local attractions, dining, nightlife, or any other concierge services that interest you. Lincoln Park is a haven for young families and professionals,
neighborhood_overview: Lincoln Park is a haven for young families and professionals, with spectacular restaurants, world-class entertainment, and plenty of fun shops along walkable street. Take advantage of the world-class zoo or the 1,200+ acres of Lincoln Park, or meet the love of your life (meet cute not guaranteed).
notes: For the safety and comfort of all our guests, Zencity is following CDC guidance to ensure every guest has a clean place to stay. Some of the steps we are taking include (Website hidden by Airbnb)   (Website hidden by Airbnb) Thoroughly disinfecting each suite between stays including counter tops, door knobs, faucets, light switches, among other (Website hidden by Airbnb) Stocking-up on extra supplies such as soaps and cleaning products in case you need it (yes, including toilet paper (Website hidden by Airbnb) Minimizing in-person contact with our guests whenever possible by using smart tools like our digital check-in proces (Website hidden by Airbnb)   (Website hidden by Airbnb) We are not responsible for packages if they are unable to be delivered. If anything is not to your liking, please notify us, and we will correct the situation as soon as possible.
transit: Cab/Uber service is easily available in this location and is our recommended method of transportation to nearby hotspots such as Old Town to the south and Wicker Park/Bucktown to the west. The apartment is also near several major bus routes.
access: Access is available to the entire apartment.
interaction: We will be available throughout your stay to recommend local attractions, dining, nightlife, or any other concierge services that interest you.
house_rules: 1. No onsite parking 2. No late checkout past 11am 3. Quiet time after 10pm 4. ONLY guests included on the reservation are permitted on the premises 5. Lost or misplaced keys will be charged at cost (up to $100) 6. We are not responsible for packages if they are unable to be delivered We look forward to hosting you!  If you are unable to abide by house rules, please consider another listing as we reserve the right to end your stay early for serious violations.  We take pride in our home and are excited to welcome you, but please respect the space and others who live in the building.
host_about: Modern travel means you deserve the most out of your stay – complete with amenities that matter to you. Zencity offers every guest convenient locations, kitchen essentials, and several great entertainment options for you to enjoy. All coupled with insider knowledge and access to the best the city has to offer.

name: 2-Need a room? Spacious, near trains, great price!
summary: Are you looking for a five-star hotel? Unfortunately this isn't it. If you are looking for a simple/spacious place to sleep as you explore Chicago with easy access to the bus/train, you've found the place! 20 min Uber/Lyft/cab from O'Hare. Quick 81 Lawrence bus to the Blue Line train to access downtown or O'Hare airport. 8 min walk to the Brown Line train. 35 mins from the Loop during rush hour to see the world famous Chicago Bean, Sears Tower and all types of restaurants. Book today!
space: Is this room all booked for your dates? Book one of our other rooms in the same apartment by clicking on my photo (above "Warren" by the title of this listing) and looking at our availability in one of the other bedrooms! This listing is for bedroom 2 (queen bed) in a 5 bedroom apartment. Easy access to transportation, easy check in. Chicago is a terrific place for all types of restaurants, great food, easy transportation. 10 min Uber/Lyft/bus/train rides in any direction will take you to Indian, Japanese, Ethiopian, Mexican and any other type of food you can think of. Don't want to go to far? We have all of those great restaurants in our Albany Park neighborhood as our neighborhood is SUPER diverse and I absolutely love it. You can easily get to our place by 81 Lawrence bus which takes you directly to the Jefferson Park Blue Line (easy access to O'Hare airport). You can also take a quick Brown Line train downtown from Kimball and see all types of touristy destinations our great city h

notes: Hello!  We'd absolutely love to have you stay with us! We've been blessed in our short time to have travelers from all over the world stay with us from France, to Malaysia to the U.S. We've had casual travelers to people here on work trips. The happiest stays guests have had here are the people that understand what we're offering. You're basically in a hostel / shared space. A very low priced room with a lock, on average from $19-$24 USD per night depending on demand, that gives you a simple place to sleep and amenities to use. It is our guests that understand that this is NOT the Hilton or Marriott that have enjoyed this extremely low priced stay. This is my parents home, and we come through and clean often but ultimately there's daily wear and tear as on any given day our five rooms can be occupied with around 1-2 people each that you might see in passing. Our bathrooms will often look used, our floors will often be scuffed, our kitchen will look like someone actually uses it because
transit: Blue Line Brown Line 81 Lawrence Bus 82 Kimball Bus
interaction: Message us on the app for questions! We're working folks so obviously if we don't respond we're probably in a meeting, but once we get the chance to reply we will!
house_rules: Please wash your dishes after each use. Please keep relatively quiet throughout your stay, especially after 10 p.m. We have long-term tenants that rent downstairs (and of course us upstairs) but they also would love to interact with you if you see them! Feel free to say hi! They're all working folks/grad school students. Please help us save on the electric bill by turning off the air-conditioning / bedroom lights whenever you leave the apartment. We'd really appreciate it.

name: Two Bedrooms Available in Cozy Townhouse
summary: Mr. Aughty’s Townhouse is located on a quiet south side street, 7 minutes away from public transportation & 2 minutes from the expressway. O'Hare International Airport is 1 hour 20 minutes away by Blue Line to Red Line, then a 7 minute walk to home. The home has comfy beds. Cook and eat-in vegan/vegetarian kitchen. Outdoors area has space for sitting or relaxing amongst the many gardens.  The home overall is good for accompanying groups of people, couples, solo adventures and business travelers.
space: Upon entering the townhouse you will notice many pictures on the walls and a cozy environment for sitting and relaxing in the front room gallery.  Their are two eat-in kitchens at the townhouse. The kitchens are supplied with: Range/oven, microwave oven, refrigerator and other small appliances.  Cooking and eating supplies: frying pans, pots and pans, utensils, food-storage containers, plates, glasses, mugs, knifes and forks. What you don't find in one kitchen the other one has it.  Bathrooms: There are 4 bathrooms at the home, two with tub and shower. Towels, soap, tooth brush, shampoo and body wash are supplied upon your arrival to home. You will also find larger containers of amenities in the full baths.  The bedrooms are located upstairs and downstairs in the townhouse (if a downstairs room is required please let me know during your booking). The beds in the rooms are comfortable and supplied with fresh clean linen. Clean towels and amenities are in the room for your convenience up
description: Mr. Aughty’s Townhouse is located on a quiet south side street, 7 minutes away from public transportation & 2 minutes from the expressway. O'Hare International Airport is 1 hour 20 minutes away by Blue Line to Red Line, then a 7 minute walk to home. The home has comfy beds. Cook and eat-in vegan/vegetarian kitchen. Outdoors area has space for sitting or relaxing amongst the many gardens.  The home overall is good for accompanying groups of people, couples, solo adventures and business travelers. Upon entering the townhouse you will notice many pictures on the walls and a cozy environment for sitting and relaxing in the front room gallery.  Their are two eat-in kitchens at the townhouse. The kitchens are supplied with: Range/oven, microwave oven, refrigerator and other small appliances.  Cooking and eating supplies: frying pans, pots and pans, utensils, food-storage containers, plates, glasses, mugs, knifes and forks. What you don't find in one kitchen the other one has it.  Bathrooms:
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood gets a bad wrap for it's location in the city. I have been an owner in the neighborhood for 40 years and think it's getting better not worse. The house is on a busy street during the day and quiet during the night. Not much in the way of Pedestrians day or night because of the shortage of businesses along the route. The homes occupied by the residents are well kept. Most of these residents have lived there for years.
notes: Vegan/Vegetarian Kitchen Rules You are allow to consume meat in the kitchen. Cooking meat is not allowed on stovetop or in oven. You are also allow to warm up carryouts containing meat products in the microwave oven. Hot and cold cereal for breakfast no charge. No charge for doing your laundry.
transit: There is public transportation nearby to Chinatown and White Sox Park by way of the 24 Wentworth bus. The number 24 bus also will take you downtown and the Chicago River Walk.  The Red Line transit is 7 to 10 minutes away from home. Private parking on premise is available.  Street parking in front of townhouse is normally available. When traveling late at night take Uber or Lyft back to townhouse. You can arrange for a Pick Up or Drop Off at Midway for $20 or at O'Hare for $30.00. Drop off or pick up around Chicago available also for fee, ask Host for details.
access: The townhouse has a friendly environment for everyone to enjoy.  The guest have use of front yard. There is a bench in the yard for sitting. The back yard can be used for sitting, eating, socializing and even sleeping.  Guest has full access to internet, a PC and printer are available for use 24/7/365.  Cable TV is available in the kitchen areas only.  Guest has full use of kitchens. No cooking of meats on Range or in Oven. Use Microwave Oven for any meats to be cooked or warmed for consumption.
interaction: I am flexible with my guest. But always available if called upon.  If you are arriving later than expected we can get you in without doing a tour of home and do the tour in morning.
host_about:
Hello
My guests call me “Mr. Aughty”. I hope to be your host when you visit Chicago. My cozy townhouse with clean rooms and comfortable beds is located on the south side of the city. It’s just a 5 minute walk to Public Transportation trains (Red Line) and a 3 minute drive to the Dan Ryan Expressway.
I am a devoted vegan who enjoys cooking. I have lived all my life in Chicago, and I attended Columbia College here where I got my BA in Film & Video. Now that I am a senior citizen and retired for the most part, I spend most of my leisure time photographing and gardening. I have done some traveling to Jamaica, Mexico, Puerto Rico, South Africa, France, Ireland and England.
Wishing you and yours safe travels to Chicago or wherever your adventures lead you.

name: 747 The Gate
summary: The Triple Studio can sleep a total of 3 guests with one queen bed and a love seat sleeper. Like all our apartments, the Three Passenger Studio comes fully furnished and a kitchen equipped with silverware, dinnerware, cookware and basic appliances like a coffee maker. TV set, and free, high-speed Wi-Fi are always available. Enjoy the rich diversity of food and art in the city or stay home and dine in, the choice is yours. This is a pet-friendly apartment, so if your pet insists on joining you on your trip, for a small fee you’re welcome to bring them along! You'll feel like you're flying first class when you stay at the Ginosi 747 Apartel in Chicago.

name: Beautiful South Shore Bungalow - 2
summary: My place is close to Jackson Park Hospital, Hyde Park, Museum of Science and Industry, South Shore Cultural Center, Rainbow Beach, Obama Presidential Library (coming soon).  You’ll love my place because it's very cozy and clean.  Quick Uber to anyplace in the city. My place is good for students, residents, solo adventurers, and business travelers. I have a little dog named Christopher. He's friendly, quiet and doesn't bite. I also have a permanent roommate named Crystal. She's super sweet!
space: I own a four-bedroom house. I live in the basement with my dog. If you are afraid or allergic, I can keep him downstairs with me.  Crystal, my permanent roommate lives on the 2nd Floor. She's very sweet and also available to answer your questions. I have 2 private bedrooms that I use to host Airbnb. They are fully furnished with locks so that you keep all of your personal items secure.

They are fully furnished with locks so that you keep all of your personal items secure. Your private room comes fully furnished, including linens and bath towels.  You'll have full access to a bathroom (s
neighborhood_overview: I live in South Shore. It's a diverse community with a rich history. My block is typically very quiet; most of my neighbors are elderly and have been living here a very long time. While Chicago is renowned (unfortunately) for having high crime, I have never been personally impacted. I am very cautious, I do not go for long walks late at night (regardless of the area), and I keep my doors locked. I also have a security system to keep us all safe.
transit: I live about 2 blocks from an express-bus (CTA) that takes you downtown. I am also within a mile of the commuter train (Metra).
access: Your private room comes fully furnished, including linens and bath towels.  You'll have full access to a bathroom (shared), fully-stocked kitchen (access to pots, pans, refrigerator, microwave, etc),  living/dining room (table, desk, couch, TV w/Hulu, Netflix, HBOgo).  I also have a small backyard, if you'd like to relax and get some fresh air.
interaction: I am a full-time Ph.D. student and I mostly work from home. I am available to answer any questions you have about the space, the city of Chicago, and where to obtain great deep-dish pizza.
house_rules: No shoes inside, please (Bring a pair of houseshoes or socks)  Please wash your own dishes each night (Dishwasher works great!)

name: Humboldt Park Private Room in Modern Condo
summary: Enjoy this modern bedroom nestled in a quiet residential Chicago neighborhood across the street from beautiful Humboldt Park. The apartment is centrally located near everything Chicago has to offer!
space: The space is a fully furnished large 3 bedroom, 2 full bath condo with modern finishes located on the 2nd floor. The bedroom includes a full-size bed, laptop-friendly desk, nightstand, and closet. Your shared bathroom includes a shower with a spa rain showerhead with slate and travertine stone tiles throughout.  Shared spaces include an open layout kitchen, dining room, and living room. The modern kitchen will be equipped with all the basic cooking essentials. The furnished dining and living rooms are anchored by a large-sized balcony. Wood floors throughout the condo. There are 2 other bedrooms being occupied by extended stay rental tenants with their own private spaces. We welcome everyone from those looking for weekend getaways, on extended working trips, traveling medical students, health care professionals, entertainment, and other industry professionals that want to experience Chicago in a comfortable, cozy setting. You have access to an in-unit washer and dryer if you stay for m

neighborhood_overview: Humboldt Park a trendy neighborhood in West Town minutes away from Logan Square, Wicker Park, Ukrainian Village, and Bucktown. Very easy access to downtown. Everything is easily accessible by public transportation, car, and Uber/Lyft. Plenty of shops, restaurants, cafes, and nightlife to satisfy all tastes.
notes: All house guests must be added to your listing. Only registered house guests are allowed. We ask that guests remove their shoes when they enter. The kitchen is for your use and has been provided with basic cooking needs. The condo is being rented by other short-term tenants. So please be courteous and clean up after yourself to help keep all shared spaces tidy. You have access to the in-unit washer and dryer if you stay more than 1 week. There is NO smoking of any kind inside the condo. Feel free to smoke on the balcony off of the living/dining room or on your private balcony. Make sure your butts are properly extinguished and disposed of in the garbage. Please DO NOT throw the butts over the balconies. Smoking indoors will result in an additional cleaning fee of $150. Pets are not allowed anywhere inside the condo. Bringing pets indoors will result in an additional cleaning fee. Hair dying is not allowed anywhere inside the property.  Check out my Guidebook to Chicago for more info on
transit: The condo is conveniently close to public transportation. Steps away from the 65 Grand bus stop, and a short walk from the 52 Chicago, and 66 Chicago bus stops. Commute to Downtown Chicago: Car: 10-15 min Transit: approx 25 min
access: Shared spaces include an open layout kitchen, dining room, bathroom, and living room.
interaction: I am always available via messaging or a phone call for any questions or needs. I may not be home during your check-in, but if you need anything just message or call me. You will enter the condo via lockbox.
house_rules: Only registered guests are allowed in the Airbnb.  Quiet hours: 9pm to 6am We kindly request guests to temove their shoes in the home. As you will be sharing the condo with other short term rental guests, we ask that everyone helps keep the shared spaces tidy and cleans up after themselves. There is NO smoking of any kind inside the condo. Feel free to smoke on the balcony off of the living/dining room. Make sure your butts are properly extinguished and disposed of in the garbage. Please DO NOT throw the butts over the balconies. Hair dying is not allowed anywhere in the condo.
host_about: Hi, my name is Lotta and I'm excited to offer my space to you! I was raised in Chicago and am happy to help you get to know our great city during your stay. Scroll down to see all of my listings!

name: Premier Boystown Wrigleyville Lakeview Flat, 2A
summary: NOTE: If you are looking for a shelter-in-place option during the months of April or May, you are welcome here. We are taking extra precautions to help protect our guests during the current global pandemic.  This two-bedroom flat boasts beautiful, well-curated living spaces and is located on Halsted St., in the heart of the Boystown Wrigleyville Lakeview district, just blocks from Wrigley Field and the Addison Red Line stop. Downtown is only twenty minutes by train.
space: There's no question—folks who stay here really will get an authentic Chicago-style experience. The apartment is located in a century old building but has been fully upgraded with modern amenities. Please note that the location is GLORIOUS (like, seriously amazing) and is in the middle of all the excitement of Boystown and Halsted. The front windows overlook bustling Halsted Street— a draw back for some but a huge plus for others. City energy really does fill the space, making it great for a person / friend / family on holiday.  The front bedroom is on the street, making it the most prone to noise...the back bedroom (with the twin beds) is substantially more quiet and relaxing though it does not get as much sunlight, and picks up noise from the restaurant and bar directly beneath it. NOTE: If you are looking for a shelter-in-place option in the months of April or May, noise will be much less of an issue. The dining rooms of all restaurants in the Chicago area, including the one directly
description: NOTE: If you are looking for a shelter-in-place option during the months of April or May, you are welcome here. We are taking extra precautions to help protect our guests during the current global pandemic.  This two-bedroom flat boasts beautiful, well-curated living spaces and is located on Halsted St., in the heart of the Boystown Wrigleyville Lakeview district, just blocks from Wrigley Field and the Addison Red Line stop. Downtown is only twenty minutes by train. There's no question—folks who stay here really will get an authentic Chicago-style experience. The apartment is located in a century old building but has been fully upgraded with modern amenities. Please note that the location is GLORIOUS (like, seriously amazing) and is in the middle of all the excitement of Boystown and Halsted. The front windows overlook bustling Halsted Street— a draw back for some but a huge plus for others. City energy really does fill the space, making it great for a person / friend / family on holid
notes: If you happen to be traveling with kids or those who might be ill at ease with gay (Website hidden by Airbnb) aware that this is in the heart of Boystown.  Often you will see entitled yuppies, gay couples, kind of scary gay leather daddies, moms with strollers, a lot of folks walking dogs, and random inebriated folks...all on the street, all at the same time.  We live here so we don't find it weird or intimidating...but we don't want anyone to feel uncomfortable who is staying here.
transit: we are a 3-5 minute walk from the red line addison stop (which is the main CTA subway train), literally on the Halsted street bus route, and a short walk form all of the express buses that go direct down to Michigan avenue.  Also easy to find are Uber cars and Taxi cabs (literally out front at all times) and we also have a Divvy bike station just around the corner from the flat.  There is a bike / jogging path that runs along the lakefront to downtown and it is a glorious 30 minute ride along the lake to get form our place to Navy Pier.  It is one of the most connected areas of the city.
access: This is a private apartment. You'll have the run of it.  If you'll be in need of laundry facilities during your stay, that's available just around the corner. We recommend Coachlight Laundromat at 3475 N. Broadway. The hours of operation are 7 AM to 9 PM, 7 days a week.
interaction: Odds are good we won't see you...but worked our tushes off to try and put together a guide book, written from our perspective, that will share our opinion of the best bars, food, and other things the neighborhood and city have to offer. We are also always available for any questions or concerns. Just send a message via the Airbnb app and one of us will respond right away.
house_rules: - This is not intended to be a party household. Please respect our property and our neighbors.  - This is also a well-curated environment, so we don't anticipate that the furniture or art in the apartment will be moved. - Please let us know if you are bringing children and we will store breakables for you.
host_about:
David is a quirky but hardworking, well adjusted gay man. His many carefully cultivated affectations lead many people to mistake him for a Canadian. Though his work as a high end residential designer is stunning and has won him some pretty impressive accolades, he owns several pairs of Crocs.  Amy is a laid back gal with a gift for words, a solid fashion sense, and keen eye. She's found her calling in the publishing industry and loves playing bartender.

Like Batman and Catwoman, Amy and David share a great friendship, mutual admiration for one another, and more common interests than one might expect. Both are natural hosts, love Chicago and look forward to sharing their city with you.

name: Domio | Navy Pier | Bright 2 BR + Balcony and Pool
summary: Please note that pictures are of a model Domio unit in Chicago. Your unit will have similar furnishings, but the layout and design will differ. Pair your Chicago experience with the perfect place to stay. Surrounded by Chicago's popular landmarks and best activities, this stunning, luxurious, and hip space was elegantly designed to show our dedication to style and comfort and make you feel at home. Whether traveling solo, with friends, or with family, see the best of art, culture, and cuisine that Chicago has to offer and have an unforgettable experience staying at this Domio.

summary: Lay back in the hammock and gaze out across the spectacular Chicago skyline from the sophisticated rooftop terrace. Return to this cheerful, lovingly decorated, modern gray private  bedroom to take a soothing steam shower in the private ensuite.
space: Our home is a beautiful and clean modern space.  Everything is top of the line. Guests will love the custom rooftop and the amazing city view and napping on the hammock. Our home is close to the center of the city and other trendy neighborhoods but situated in a quiet street.
description: Lay back in the hammock and gaze out across the spectacular Chicago skyline from the sophisticated rooftop terrace. Return to this cheerful, lovingly decorated, modern gray private  bedroom to take a soothing steam shower in the private ensuite.
neighborhood_overview: Chicago’s West Town is considered one of the best places to live in Illinois. The Magnificent Mile and Navy Pier are just a short bus journey away. The house is also close to great restaurants, cocktail bars, and coffee shops.
notes: Please note that this is a private bedroom and bathroom in our home. Free street parking is available (no permit needed).
transit: Chicago blue line is less than a 10 minute walk. 2 blocks to Chicago and Grand bus stops and 4 blocks to Ashland. Easy bus ride to the magnificent mile and Navy Pier and close to bucktown/wicker park. Easy walk to Opart Thai, Bella Notte, and Coalfire pizza for dining. Mahoney's, Five Star bar, The Irish Nobleman, and Beauty Bar are an easy walk for cocktails. For all the coffee lovers, there is a Starbucks and Dunkin Donuts within walking distance as well.
access: Guests will have full access to their private bedroom and bathroom as well the shared spaces such as the kitchen, living room, deck, and rooftop.  Washer/dryer are available for $5/load

Please wash everything after use.  - washer/dryer is available for $5 per load (cash payment) - if you use the rooftop, please bring the furniture cushions back inside and follow the rooftop rules posted on the door. - upon your departure, please strip the sheets from the bed and leave them in a pile with the used towels.

name: Cozy Wicker Park, Chicago Apartment
summary: Enjoy your stay set in the heart of Chicago’s Wicker Park neighborhood. Coffee bars, restaurants, nightlife, and shopping galore! Perfectly situated with easy access to/from O’Hare and downtown via CTA blue line el/subway  (just a few-minutes walk.) You are surrounded by taxis, Uber/Lyfts, buses, and subway train. All modes of transportation are at your fingertips – even bicycles if you’d like! Do yourself a favor... check out our neighborhood and explore our city!
space: Our beautiful 3-flat IS Chicago! You will have your own lovely one-bedroom apartment equipped with all the amenities/necessities you’ll need during your visit. The bedroom has a queen-sized bed, and the bathroom and kitchen are fully equipped. Our building is setback from the street with a beautiful front yard – nice, cozy, and private. Welcome to Chicago!

name: Artsy Bucktown Home - Sleeps 8!
summary: Artsy Bucktown home with retro industrial decor,  and memory foam beds. Only 2 blocks from Chicago's renowned 606 trail and 5 blocks from one of the  hippest corners/neighborhoods in the United States.   8 guests can fit comfortably in a private basement with a pull out couch, a sectional, fireplace, and a big screen TV, a first floor bedroom with a single bed, and an upstairs queen bedroom with an adjacent lit-up lounge. Owner stays upstairs in the master suite.
space: I've never met a person who did not love our house.  It was built in 1904 in what was then a predominantly polish Neighborhood, giving this style its nickname Chicago home "Polish two flat".  Friends have said the energy of the place mirrors our work as choreographers.

neighborhood_overview: You are just half a mile walk away from the center of Bucktown/Wicker Park and the Damen blue line! There is a plethora of good restaurants, bars, and shops nearby.  You are two blocks from an iconic bar called Map room.  They serve coffee in the morning and provide free newspapers.  Starbucks is across the street from Map room.  Izakaya Mita Japanese restaurant  is one of my favorites and only four blocks away.  You can sit at the bar, drink sake and eat yummy food while watching Godzilla movies.  Chicago's renowned 3 mile elevated 606 trail is three blocks away.  Jogging, biking and biking with a unique view of Chicago.
notes: Free, non-permit parking is available right in front of the house and in the surrounding blocks.
transit: Ample free, non-permit parking on our street.  Easy access to Armitage bus ( 2 blocks ) and Damen and Western Blue line train stops ( 5 blocks) that lead directly to downtown and O'Hare airport. Chicago’s famous 606 trail is two blocks away. You can run walk or bike several miles through four Chicago neighborhoods.
access: Guests will have access to the full home, including kitchen and kitchen amenities, a comfortable living room with a record player and extensive record collection, an upstairs lounge, and two bathrooms.
interaction: I stay in the master bedroom upstairs. It is down the hall from the bedroom and lounge and out of the way. During the day, I am typically in the area if you need anything, and will respond quickly to phone calls or texts. I know all the good restaurants, sights, and bars.
house_rules: - Please replace security bar on patio door - Please turn front room radio anytime you are leaving the home (even if just for 5 minutes) and there is no one else there
host_about: I grew up in Chicago with Irish and British born parents.  I work in the performing arts and have been enjoying the AirBnb experience.

name: Historic Gold Coast Rowhouse with Garage Parking!
summary: Our historic rowhome - right in the middle of the Gold Coast's bustle! - was renovated just a few years ago and has modern amenities for peak comfort. The layout is ideal for traveling with family, colleagues or friends, and it's an easy walk to many of Chicago's most popular sights. There's beautiful outdoor space here, and best of all - free garage parking. Book today!
space: Just inside the door is a foyer, off which is a Queen-sized bedroom, and next to that, a full bath. On this level is a family room with a TV & wet bar. There's a door that leads directly out to the garden here. Upstairs, the living room has 2 couches, and a TV with Roku streaming. The kitchen has comfortable dining for 8, and a sliding door out to the rear deck. On the top level, there are 3 bedrooms: the master suite, with Queen sized bed and ensuite bathroom, the front bedroom with Queen bed, and a bedroom with Twin bunk beds. There's another full bath on this level as well, and a washer and dryer.

neighborhood_overview: Just north of downtown Chicago, and nestled against the Lake Michigan shoreline, is the Gold Coast. As the name would imply, the area is one of the country's most affluent neighborhoods. With streets that are lined with historic mansions and specialty boutiques, the Gold Coast is an intensely popular area for residents and visitors.
notes: In addition to easy access to and from Union Station, we're also close to Oak Street Beach, the John Hancock Building, and Second City, and conveniently located a mile north of the Merchandise Mart. The Museum of Contemporary Art (MCA) is a 15 minute walk southeast, River North is the next neighborhood south, so the infamous nightlife is just a 15 minute walk south. Northwestern University Hospital and Lurie Childrens Hospital are a mile or so southeast - between a 15 and 20 minute walk. And, if work brings you to town, since we're so close to the Loop, there's a good chance you can walk to your meetings, too!
transit: The Clark / Division Red Line stop is just on the next block north - it should only take you a minute or so to walk there! The 22/Clark bus is just at the end of the block, too, so it's easy to get around here without a car. If you do bring a car, however, we offer 1 garage spot in the building just behind the house.
access: You'll have full access to my 5 bedroom, 3.5 bath home, as well as the private back yard, deck, and a parking space in the secure garage behind the rowhome.
house_rules: House Rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.  1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable.  2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee.  3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance.  4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily.  5.) Pets are not allowed at the property.  6.) Lockouts will result in a $150 fee per occurrence. Additionally, lost keys will incur a $50 per key
host_about: I've been in Chicago for over ten years, and although it is an AMAZING city, I still can't get used to the cold and snow after having grown up in Florida.  I miss the the sun and warmth, so I take every opportunity to travel to tropical locations to sit by the ocean, dive, and be warm.

neighborhood_overview: The Lakeview neighborhood and Wrigleyville area have so much within walking distance, you won't want to leave! There are numerous bakeries, boutique stores, theaters, and lively bars and restaurants. If you do feel like venturing out of the neighborhood, Lakeview is very centrally located. Head south to visit Lincoln Park, River North, and the Loop, or west to visit Buck Town or Logan square. Within minutes in a cab, you can be in any of these places.
notes: COURTESY We request noise be kept to a reasonable level from 10pm-8am. ENTRY Check-in is at 4pm or later and check-out is by 10am. We provide detailed check-in notes with photos. CENTRAL HEAT/AC The unit has radiator heat in the common rooms (can be adjusted between 65-72) and baseboard heat in the bedrooms. LAUNDRY The building has a washer and dryer in the basement that's shared by all apartments. Each costs $1.50 and accepts quarters. PUBLIC TRANSIT The closet train stop is the Addison red line. There are also many bus stops. We provide additional info about public transit upon booking. PARKING Free, public street parking is available in the area. Some streets require a permit, and others do not. We offer permits at the unit for a small fee. Please note you may have to circle the block a few times to find a spot. If you prefer paid parking with a designated spot, we can offer additional guidance upon booking. PACK N PLAY Pack N Play may be rented for $5/night. It will be inside the
transit: PARKING Free, public street parking is available in the area. Some streets require a permit, and others do not. We offer permits at the unit for a small fee. Please note you may have to circle the block a few times to find a spot. If you prefer paid parking with a designated spot, I recommend using Spot-Hero to find nearby options that work for you. Once you're here, public transportation and/or Uber are the easiest ways to get around the city. CLOSEST STOPS o Addison red train: .3 mi, trains go uptown/downtown o Belmont purple/brown train stop: .6 mi, trains go uptown/downtown o 77, 8, 36 bus and more to go up/downtown or east/west Stations all have machines that sell Ventra passes (name of provider). You can also purchase Ventra cards at Walgreens. You can either purchase a single ride ticket, a re-loadable Ventra card, or an unlimited pass (1, 3, or 7 days). Multiple people may share a re-loadable card and fares will be deducted for each person; however, the unlimited passes can not
access: You will have the entire unit to yourself: 3 bedrooms, kitchen, dining room, living room, and 2 bathroom. You also have access to the building's laundry room, which is located in the basement and shared by 3 units. Machines cost $1.50 each and take quarters.
interaction: My goal is to ensure you have the most enjoyable and comfortable stay in Chicago. I have a detailed guest guidebook (emailed in advance and printed in unit) that includes info about the apt, neighborhood, and city to help maximize your time in the city. If you'd like additional assistance with anything, I'm more than happy to help! Depending on my work travel schedule, I may or may not be in town; however, I'm always accessible via phone or email for any questions that arise.
house_rules: REQUESTS: 1) Please treat the home with respect. 2) Please be courteous of others in building and neighbors. All socializing must be kept indoors after 9pm, and we request quiet time from 9pm-8am.  3) The only guests allowed in the unit are those on the reservation. Special events will be considered on a case-by-case basis.  4) We welcome children, but we are not child-proof. If you have specific questions/concerns, please ask before booking. 5) No smoking inside - violations may result in a $500 smoke removal fee CHECK IN/OUT:  Standard check-in time is 4pm (or later). You will be given a custom key code to enter the unit, then keys will be inside waiting for you. Standard check-out time is by 10am. If scheduling permits, we will work with you on alternate arrangements, so please inquire. If unit is not vacated by check-out time or notes are not followed, additional cleaning charges may apply. For check out, I ask that you: - turn off lights/heat/AC - place used kitchen items in dishw
host_about:
I began using Airbnb as a traveler in the fall of 2013, and I'm hooked! Staying in someone's home allows you to experience the area in a truly authentic way - no more hotels for me! As of May 2014, I began hosting in Chicago and have since hosted thousands of guests from around the world. I love helping others make the most of their visits. 

As a host, I am personable, responsive, and detail-oriented. I take great pride in the comfort and cleanliness of each apartment. You can trust that when staying in any one of our properties, you will feel at home.

name: THERE IS NO PLACE LIKE OUR HOME!!!
summary: THERE IS NO PLACE LIKE OUR HOME!!! We offer a newly-renovated 2 Bedroom modern, minimalistic Apartment with Private Full Bath and Full kitchen on a quiet, residential street in Chicago. This is an ideal location: close to Logan Square, Wrigley Field & the nature and tranquility of Lake Michigan. Your ideal Haven in the city awaits!  The L is a walking distance away, so you can literally get anywhere with or without a car quite quickly! We will always be available throughout your stay!!!

The second bedroom features a full-sized bed as well as a full closet for your use and a dresser. Fresh Sheets, pillows/pillow sheets, blankets are always provided. Bathroom: The bathroom features a full bathtub, with shower, and a vanity for any storage needs. We always provide plenty of soft, cozy towels for you. Toilet paper, soap and shampoo provided as well. The Kitchen: The contemporary kitchen features all-new stainless steel appliances, a large refrigerator, a Keurig Coffee maker, a full oven and stovetop, microwave, dining table and more. It’s a fun, affordable and convenient way to get around.

name: See a Game at Wrigley Field from a Sophisticated Condominium
summary: Light an inviting fire in the fireplace and curl up on the sectional sofa or plush purple armchair. This elegant condo full of luxurious touches, plush fabrics, and metallic accents. There will also be two friendly House cats here during your stay.
description: Light an inviting fire in the fireplace and curl up on the sectional sofa or plush purple armchair. This elegant condo full of luxurious touches, plush fabrics, and metallic accents. There will also be two friendly House cats here during your stay.
neighborhood_overview: Two famous Chicago neighborhoods, Wrigleyville and Boystown, lie within short walks of the house. Southport Corridor, just west of Wrigleyville, offers varied dining and shopping. The lake, beaches and Belmont harbor are just a few blocks east.
notes: While close to all the bars and night life my home is on a quiet residential street so the noise from the bars is minimal.
transit: The Addison Redline stop is just a short walk away which will take you right downtown to the museums, parks, theatres and more.
access: When staying here you'll have access to the entire home except for the master closet (this is where the cat's set up shop when guests are here.) Full sized washer and dryer are in the unit and available for use as well.
interaction: If you're renting the whole place I won't be home but I'm always available via text or phone if you have any questions.
house_rules: -I ask all guests to go through the process to verify their identity through air bnb before booking.  -No smoking in the house -Guests must be quiet and respectful of neighbors (this is not the place to rent if you're coming to Chicago to party) -Guests should remove shoes while in the home to keep the place clean and to avoid noise for my downstairs neighbors. -There is a $25 fee for each set of keys that are not returned
host_about: I'm a single gay man originally from the Chicago Area.  I've lived in my current home for 5 years.  I love traveling and seeing new cities, but for me nothing beats Chicago.  From the amazing architecture, to the world class museums Chicago has everything you could want.  And every neighborhood has a unique character giving you endless options to explore.  I live on a quiet side street steps away from the centers of both Wrigleyville and Boystown.  I love this city and my neighborhood and I love helping people explore them.  I share my home with my 3 adorably rotten four legged kids so anyone who stays here should love animals (because they won't give you any other option.)

name: $2020 DEALS! Homey & Comfy 2BR Near Wrigley
summary: A fully furnished home for your longer stay, complete with WiFi and everything you need to live. AFFORDABLE MONTHLY RATES ARE AVAILABLE!!! APRIL - $2020 MAY - $2550 Welcome to Chicago! Home of the World Series Champs, the Cubs. Our 2-bedroom/1-bathroom condo is the perfect place to stay in Chicago, whether traveling for business or vacation. It's professionally designed with modern furniture and a full kitchen.
space: In the heart of trendy Lakeview Chicago, our sophisticated 2 bedroom/1 bathroom apartment is the perfect launchpad for Windy City adventures or clinching that important business deal. Whatever brings you to town, you’ll rest easy in our charming, quiet neighborhood with easy access to the Red Line train. Street parking and meter parking is available nearby. But as it gets more difficult to park at night we recommend parking your car and take the train for your entire stay. The apartment is a 13-minute walk to the Addison train station.

You may send me a message though if you need them and I'll try my best to accommodate your request. -We have duvet covers on our bedding  (no top sheets). -Security Deposit maybe required on the following bookings: 1) Last minute bookings 2) Short weekend stays 3) Large groups  4) Guests with no reviews 5) Guests with incomplete profile 6) Instant Bookings  7) Some properties may not allow locals for short term reservations. -Please be aware that if you lose the key and/or entry fob which is your access to the unit, it cannot b

interaction: We’re all about giving you plenty of privacy and personal space, so we’ll be available by phone (call or text) during your stay.
house_rules: HOUSE RULES Please review and adhere to the following to avoid penalties and/or cancellation of booking: -No Drugs; Do not engage in any ILLEGAL activities anywhere on the property; ONLY guests included on the reservation are permitted on the premises. Fines will be issued for breaking these rules (Fine $100-$250). -If you break or damage something, please let me know and arrange for its replacement or repair. - The cleaning fee outlined in the profile is included to clean the place after your stay, however, if you leave the place excessively dirty, we may charge up to $100 additionally for the extra work incurred. -Quiet hours must be observed between 10pm-8am. -Lost key fee - $300 -Unsalvageable stained linens - $15/pc. -Unsalvageable stained towels - $10/pc. -Smoking - $300 -Unauthorized bringing of pets - $300 **-No pets, except dogs & cats. If you have a dog or a cat,  an extra $50 pet cleaning fee will be added to your reservation.
host_about:
Hostly was established in 2017 to help hosts and property owners navigate the wonderful world of Airbnb and vacation rentals. 

Our team of expert hosts are here to ensure your guests’ — and your — experience is awesome, and take the hassle out of your Airbnb or other short-term property rental management.

The team at Hostly is made up of talented local and international staff with extensive property management and hosting experience and will create a customized plan that incorporates your objectives, goals, and budget with utmost  transparency and clarity to grow a mutual partnership.

As metro Chicago's premier property management company with its strong local connections, Hostly offers a full line of services to create the best vacation rental experience.

Our services include: marketing, booking and payments, guest vetting, enhanced pricing model, guest support, on-site staffing coordination, cleaning service, and key delivery and checking in and out. We also offer value add-ons such as design and staging, creating your listing, and basically sharing our industry knowledge with you.

Today, Hostly stands out in the crowded property management field as the boutique vacation rental and BnB super hosts because of our consistent track record, our team and our focus on impeccable service as reflected in its online reputation and reviews.

name: Spacious 3BR Bridgeport Apt#2 Close to Downtown
summary: This 2nd floor newly renovated apartment is part of a 2-flat building in Bridgeport. Close to Downtown and great for traveling families and guests. Conveniently located by grocery and convenience stores, local restaurants. 3min walk from the 8 bus takes you to the Halsted Orange train line and to Downtown. 3 bedrooms each with queen size bed. Spacious living room, dining room, bathroom and kitchen. High-Speed WiFi included. Free street parking. We look forward to hosting you!

Transportation 3min walk to 8 bus which takes you to Halsted Orange line to downtown. 20min drive to McCormick Place. 10min drive to Chinatown. Kitchen The kitchen comes included with basic cookware, silverware, knife set, utensils, plates, bowls, cups for those that like to cook. Stainless steel appliances and refrigerator. Palmisano Nature Park, McGuane Park, and Humbert Park. Bridgeport Coffeehouse is just an 8min walk/2min drive away. Jackalope Coffee & Tea House is also another sweet spot on Halsted. Nana's is a great restaurant that is a 3min walk away from my place. Ace Bakery is also on Halsted along with Taqueria San Jose and Buffalo Wings & Rings. I spend most of my spare time crossfitting, exploring, and doing activities with my Rotties.

name: Beautiful Art Deco Apt in  Lake View
summary: Beautiful art deco apt. 2 bedrooms sleeping four comfortably. 2 full bathrooms. Well equipped kitchen. Full bar cart. Wifi. Netflix, HBO, Showtime, Hulu, Amazon Video. Aircon. Secure entrance. Close to shops, bars, restaurants, public transport and gym.
space: This beautiful Art Deco apartment overlooks Belmont Harbor and Lake Michigan on one side and Wrigley Field in the other direction. In the summer take the elevator to the shared rooftop and enjoy views over the lake and downtown. Take a coffee up there and watch the sunrise or a beer and enjoy the sunset!

I've fallen in love with the city and the people here and I love being a host to people visiting the city. I also love travelling and I use Airbnb wherever I go so I know what a difference a local can make to a business trip or vacation. I'll give you as much help as you want and will happily provide directions and suggestions, or I'm happy just to let you discover the city for yourself.

name: Cozy 2 Bedroom Garden Apartment
summary: 2 Bedroom, 1 Bath garden level apartment. Great location on the border of Bucktown and Logan Square. The apartment has laminate floors, central A/C and heat, free laundry, WI-FI and local TV with Netflix and Amazon Video. Quick walk to CTA buses and train. Quick access to expressway.
space: Secure and comfortable 2 bedroom, 1 bathroom in the trendy Logan Square neighborhood.  Walk to your choice of hot new restaurants, lounges and bars.  Plenty of entertainment options and outdoor spaces in the area to keep you busy.  Or relax in the comfort of the secluded garden outside your door. The apartment was recently renovated in 2011 and features 2 bedrooms (1 King and 2 twins), 1 full bath, fully equipped kitchen, living room, dinning area, laundry area, laminate floors throughout, central A/C and heat.  This 900 square foot garden apartment has a private secured entry with access to a landscaped side-yard. Within the unit you’ll find a 50” LCD TV with Premium Comcast cable, Blu-Ray/DVD player, huge leather sectional couch, and comfortable finishes and decorations throughout.  Linens and finishes have been chosen for the highest quality.  Laundry area is in the common area of the basement and free to use.  There is a a cozy garden area to hang out in outside. This rental is com

The apartment has laminate floors, central A/C and heat, free laundry, WI-FI and local TV with Netflix and Amazon Video. Quick walk to CTA buses and train. Quick access to expressway. This 900 square foot garden apartment has a private secured entry with access to a landscaped side-yard. Within the unit you’ll find a 50” LCD TV with Premium Comcast cable, Blu-Ray/DVD player, hug
neighborhood_overview: The rental is located within minutes of some of Chicago’s best parks.  Holstein Park is a 5 minute walk away which features a soft surface play area, water feature, huge fenced play field, and in the summer months an outdoor pool and wading pool.  Haas Park is another quick 5 minute walk from the property which features another soft surface play lot with water features.  A field turf soccer field is also part of the park for those looking for a pickup game!  The 606 Trail is about 15 minutes south of the rental which features a linear running/walking/biking trail for great East-West access to the Humboldt Park-Logan Square-Bucktown areas.
notes: Due to the size of the beds (twins) in the 2nd bedroom, this rental is ideal for 2 adults and up to 2 kids.  Adults can fit on the twin beds.
transit: The apartment is centrally located between Fullerton Avenue to the north, Western Avenue to the east, and Milwaukee Avenue to the south.  Either one of these streets has CTA bus access.  The CTA Blue Line elevated train is a quick 5 block walk to the Western Avenue station to get you in/out of O’Hare Airport or downtown.  Cabs and Uber drivers are prevalent in the neighborhood as well.  A Divvy bicycle rental station is 2 block away for those inclined to use pedal power.
access: We live in the main house and will meet you with the key.  If we are not available, we will arrange for a lock-box and code for you to retrieve the key when you arrive at the property.  Access through a private gate and entrance.
interaction: We live above the apartment in the main house.  Interaction is as much or as little as you need.
house_rules: The apartment is in the basement of our 2 flat home. The garden level keeps it nice and cool in the summer. We will provide plenty of heat to keep it warm in the winter. The ceilings are around 7' high- unless you are an NBA center, you should have no problem with ceiling heights. We do live upstairs above the apartment. We try to keep things quiet for our guests, but with a school age child, you may hear us occasionally above you.  The house was built in the 1890s so you might hear a creaky stair or floor occasionally from above. No parties/social functions in the apartment please. Please be respectful to our neighborhood/neighbors.
host_about:
I grew up in the Chicago suburbs and have lived in the city for the last 20 years, the last nine in Bucktown & Logan Square.  We've always enjoyed the Bucktown and Logan Square neighborhoods and enjoy being an active part of the neighborhood.

I work 10 minutes from the house so I'm always close by.  I'm a trained carpenter and now General Contractor.  You'll probably find me working on the house and property.

I love to spend time with my family and enjoy the neighborhood and Chicago in general.  I'm an avid home cook and look forward to preparing and eating with friends and family.

We live above the garden apartment in the main house.  We like to be hands off and let our guests explore on their own.  I have a lot of information and recommendations on local places to go/see/do.  I'll be more than happy to share this info with you to make your stay as enjoyable as possible.

name: VERY CLEAN, CENTRALLY LOCATED, PERFECT FOR TOURIST
summary: Private, CLEAN, professionally designed room in the heart of Chicago with FREE PARKING & an EARLY check-in! (11 am) You will have your own door code and may arrive at ANY time and as late as you wish, EASY self check-in guaranteed! I allow LUGGAGE DROP OFF! You can store your luggage in the closet before check-in and after check-out times, you can drop it off and pick it up as early and as late as you would like. The neighborhood is extremely safe even at night :)
space: Restaurants and bars are right round the corner, both upscale and casual. This room is 6 minutes away by car or uber to Chicago's famous Willis (Sears) tower. Uber costs about $7. If you are arriving by car, I am providing free resident parking passes for anywhere in the area. (Yes, that means you can drive a few blocks and still park anywhere you want!) The room will be ONLY yours for the time you'll stay in my Windy City. You will have a key to lock the door. > EARLY CHECK-IN TIME! neighborhood_overview: 100% of guests love my location- it is the best of both worlds: 5 minutes from the very center of downtown, yet quiet enough to not hear the noise at night. If you are still not convinced, please read my reviews.
transit: "UIC Halsted" is the closest blue line train (metro) station, only 5 minutes away (walking).  -Downtown/Loop: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and get off at "LaSalle, Jackson, or Monroe," depending on where you are going :) FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC Halsted." About 5 minutes to downtown. -O’Hare Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare. O'Hare is the final stop. FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC Halsted." About 40 minutes to O’Hare. -Midway Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and transfer to orange line at "Clark/Lake," then take orange line to towards Midway airport. Midway is the final stop! FROM - take orange line towards Adams/Wabash; then, transfer to blue line at "Clark/Lake." Take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC-Halsted." About 45 minutes to Midway. -Union Station/Amtrak: Only 20 minutes away (walking), taxi or uber will take you to the apartment in less than 5 minutes for about $6 :)
house_rules: Please read your check-in instructions carefully
host_about:
Hello! My name is Marina, and I would like to welcome you to Chicago. I host with my sister, and we are originally from Saint Petersburg, Russia, but we spent our teenage years in Aix-en-Provence, France and therefore speak English, Russian and French fluently :) I work as an auditor downtown.  

Hotels can get very expensive, so we do our best to help tourists out. I really hope to host you! :)

space: Illuminated by sunny natural light, our studio features Queen-size bed, premium linens, and plenty of closet space so you can unpack and forget about your suitcase for a while. Enjoy the privacy of your own room, with doors that close and independently controlled air-conditioning units. The apartment includes one full bathroom, with a shower, sink, and toilet. We’re all about helping you look (and smell) your best, so we provide shampoo, conditioner, and body wash in addition to hand soap and fluffy towels. Trust us when we say there’s no better way to warm up after a Windy City walk than a hot shower! There’s ample space for guests to relax on the sofa and watch on a large flat-screen TV. neighborhood_overview: Logan Square is one of the city's vibrant neighborhoods, balancing family-friendly activities and a thriving community of Chicago's aspiring artists, musicians independent spirited folks. The vintage charm of Logan Theater hosts the annual Chicago Underground Film Festival for those cinephiles. It is also the home of the historical Illinois Centennial Memorial that commemorates Illinois statehood designed by the same architect who created the Lincoln Memorial in Washington DC.restored arcade machines. Make your afternoon stroll or even a bike tour at Humboldt Park and Logan Square , as the community is graced with tree line boulevard and parks. After the strolling, satisfy your taste buds in Logan Square's top dining destinations. A "must try" is a visit to Dos Urban Cantina, Diana Dávila's authentic Mexican fare at Mi Tocaya Antojería to Abe Conlon's Macanese-influenced menu at Fat Rice and make that reservation ASAP at GIANT, Nightwood chef Jason Vincent's Logan Square restaurant. notes: -There are many units inside this building. -Please be aware If you lose the key and entry fob, which is your access to the entire building, it cannot be replaced for you immediately and you may lose access to the apartment unit and all amenities until another one can be made. There is a $300 fee for losing key and entry fob. -All guests need to be attentive to the house rules during their stay as there are other tenants at the property. -Bath towels are provided per number of guest not per number of stay -Washcloths are not provided during your stay. You may send me a message though if you need them and I'll try my best to accommodate your request. -We have duvet covers on our bedding (no top sheets). -If there's an issue during your stay, please report it real time so we can address it right away. -Security Deposit maybe required on the following bookings: 1) Last minute bookings 2) Short weekend stays 3) Large groups 4) Guests with no reviews 5) Guests with incomplete profile 6) Ins
transit: This area is very walkable — most errands can be accomplished on foot. Transit is good, with many nearby public transportation options. The best way to get around is with the CTA train and Bus. You can Uber/Lyft.  It's convenient to use a bike for most trips.
access: Ever dreamed about jetting off to your own Chicago apartment? Well, now’s your chance to bring that fantasy to life. During your stay, the whole apartment is yours and only yours.
interaction: We’re all about giving you plenty of privacy and personal space, so we’ll be available by phone (call or text) during your stay.
house_rules: Please review and adhere to the following to avoid penalties and/or cancellation of booking: -No Drugs; Do not engage in any ILLEGAL activities anywhere on the property; ONLY guests included on the reservation are permitted on the premises. Fines will be issued for breaking these rules (Fine $100-$250). -If you break or damage something, please let me know and arrange for its replacement or repair. - The cleaning fee outlined in the profile is included to clean the place after your stay, however, if you leave the place excessively dirty, we may charge up to $100 additionally for the extra work incurred. -Quiet hours must be observed between 10pm-8am. -Lost key fee - $300 -Unsalvageable stained linens - $15/pc. -Unsalvageable stained towels - $10/pc. -Smoking - $300 -Unauthorized bringing of pets - $300 -If you have a dog or a cat, an extra $50 pet cleaning fee will be added to your reservation.

name: Whole Townhouse with 4 Cozy Bedrooms & 1.5 Bathes
summary: Mr. Aughty’s Townhouse is located on a quiet south side street, 7 minutes away from public transportation & 2 minutes from the expressway. O'Hare International Airport is 1 hour 20 minutes away by Blue Line to Red Line, then a 7 minute walk to home. The home has comfy beds. Cook and eat-in vegan/vegetarian kitchen. Outdoors area has space for sitting or relaxing amongst the many gardens.  The home overall is good for accompanying groups of people, couples, solo adventures and business travelers.
space: Upon entering the townhouse you will notice many pictures on the walls and a cozy environment for sitting and relaxing in the front room gallery.  Their are two eat-in kitchens at the townhouse. The kitchens are supplied with: Range/oven, microwave oven, refrigerator and other small appliances.  Cooking and eating supplies: frying pans, pots and pans, utensils, food-storage containers, plates, glasses, mugs, knifes and forks. What you don't find in one kitchen the other one has it.  Bathrooms: There are 4 bathrooms at the home, two with tub and shower. Towels, soap, tooth brush, shampoo and body wash are supplied upon your arrival to home. You will also find larger containers of amenities in the full baths.  The bedrooms are located upstairs and downstairs in the townhouse (if a downstairs room is required please let me know during your booking). The beds in the rooms are comfortable and supplied with fresh clean linen. Clean towels and amenities are in the room for your convenience up

Bathrooms:
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood gets a bad wrap for it's location in the city. I have been an owner in the neighborhood for 40 years and think it's getting better not worse. The house is on a busy street during the day and quiet during the night. Not much in the way of Pedestrians day or night because of the shortage of businesses along the route. The homes occupied by the residents are well kept. Most of these residents have lived there for years.
notes: Vegan/Vegetarian Kitchen Rules You are allow to consume meat in the kitchen. Cooking meat is not allowed on stovetop or in oven. You are also allow to warm up carryouts containing meat products in the microwave oven. Hot and cold cereal for breakfast no charge. No charge for doing your laundry.
transit: There is public transportation nearby to Chinatown and White Sox Park by way of the 24 Wentworth bus. The number 24 bus also will take you downtown and the Chicago River Walk.  The Red Line transit is 7 to 10 minutes away from home. Private parking on premise is available.  Street parking in front of townhouse is normally available. When traveling late at night take Uber or Lyft back to townhouse. Drop off or pick up around Chicago available for fee, ask Host for details.
access: The townhouse has a friendly environment for everyone to enjoy.  The guest have use of front yard. There is a bench in the yard for sitting. The back yard can be used for sitting, eating, socializing and even sleeping.  Guest has full access to internet, a PC and printer are available for use 24/7/365.  Cable TV is available in the kitchen areas only.  Guest has full use of kitchens. No cooking of meats on Range or in Oven. Use Microwave Oven for any meats to be cooked or warmed for consumption.
interaction: I am flexible with my guest. But always available if called upon.  If you are arriving later than expected we can get you in without doing a tour of home and do the tour in morning.
house_rules: - No smoking inside the house, yard or premise - No pets allowed  - No loud music or parties in the room and house - No additional guest allowed - Cannot conduct any illegal business from the room - No drugs or use of illegal substance - - Any property damage will have to be paid in full  - Keep the place clean - Vegetarian and vegan cooking allowed in kitchens only - If you break the house rules, you will be asked to leave and no refund will be issued - Be respectful of other guests, and keep voice level low when talking on phone or Internet.  - Small receptions allowed with prior approval on outdoor patio
host_about:
Hello
My guests call me “Mr. Aughty”. I hope to be your host when you visit Chicago. My cozy townhouse with clean rooms and comfortable beds is located on the south side of the city. It’s just a 5 minute walk to Public Transportation trains (Red Line) and a 3 minute drive to the Dan Ryan Expressway.
I am a devoted vegan who enjoys cooking. I have lived all my life in Chicago, and I attended Columbia College here where I got my BA in Film & Video. Now that I am a senior citizen and retired for the most part, I spend most of my leisure time photographing and gardening. I have done some traveling to Jamaica, Mexico, Puerto Rico, South Africa, France, Ireland and England.
Wishing you and yours safe travels to Chicago or wherever your adventures lead you.

space: What’s better than an apartment smack-dab in the middle of the Windy City? How about your own place that’s just minutes outside of the downtown hustle and bustle so you can enjoy the best that Chicago has to offer AND get a good night’s sleep? Welcome to our sunny oasis in Edgewater, a charming neighborhood slightly north of Downtown Chicago, and just a few stops from Loyola University, Evanston, the Magnificent Mile, and Grant Park via the Red Line train. Edgewater is blocks from Lake Michigan, which you can enjoy via numerous nearby beaches and the scenic Lakefront Trail. Our one-bedroom apartment features two plush Queen-size beds, complete with premium linens and plenty of pillows. The private bedroom has a large window and ample closet space so you can unpack and make yourself at home. And in the living room, our couch unfolds into a Queen-size sofa bed to accommodate additional guests. It’s no normal sofa bed - it’s actually really comfortable! Our one full bathroom is complete w

Edgewater is blocks from Lake Michigan, whic
neighborhood_overview: lgbt · diverse · multicultural · green space · international cuisine · condos Sonia & Syed’s home is located in Chicago, Illinois, United States. One of our favorite things about Chicago is the proximity to the azure waters of Lake Michigan, and if you like being near the water’s edge, you’ll love our charming Edgewater neighborhood. Just north of the hustle and bustle of Downtown Chicago, Edgewater is a breath of fresh, lakeside air, with great restaurants, beach access, and the scenic Lakefront Trail.
notes: Our unit is on the 4th floor of a building full of other apartments, and you can access it via the elevator. The front doors are locked at all times and access is granted with a key fob. We highly recommend keeping your key fob in a safe place, because if you lose it, you’ll lose access to the entire building. Not fun. It takes time to replace it, which means you might be locked out of the building and the apartment for a while, and any fob replacement will incur a fee of $300. That’s probably not what you have in mind for a “memorable” trip to Chicago, so let’s just keep track of the fob. Our apartment includes lots of awesome amenities, but it does NOT include a parking space. If you need to park a vehicle, there is some metered street parking nearby. We recommend using the Spot Hero app to claim a street parking space. The city is easily accessible with public transit and ride sharing, so having your own set of wheels isn’t necessary unless you plan on exploring far outside the city
transit: If you prefer to not worry about a possible run-in with a meter maid or an overpriced parking garage, we recommend utilizing Chicago’s awesome public transportation system (the CTA train and bus) to get around the city.  The Windy City is also extremely walkable, and when you stroll down the Lakefront Trail, you just might find your own two legs taking you all the way to the South Side. Or, take a spin on two wheels using one of Chicago’s bike-sharing programs, like Divvy. Our place is a quick 4-minute walk to Bryn Mawr Station, where you can hop on the Red Line, which will take you all the way north to Loyola and south to Wrigley Field and Downtown Chicago. At Howard Station (a 10-minute ride north), the Red Line turns into the Purple Line, which continues to Evanston and Northwestern University. Ridesharing is also an option, and both Uber and Lyft are available throughout the Chicago metro. During morning and evening rush hours - and during popular events - remember that Downtown Ch
access: Condo Access is through the front entrance or side door entrances. Guests will access to the condominium amenities such as the lobby, laundry, and court yard patio.
interaction: In addition to full access to the apartment, you’ll also enjoy the building’s amenities. Feel free to use the laundry room (just BYO detergent and quarters), lobby lounge area, and the sunny patio.  Our secure building’s doors are only accessible with a key fob, so make sure to bring the key fob with you anytime you leave the apartment.
house_rules: HOUSE RULES Please review and adhere to the following to avoid penalties and/or cancellation of booking: -No Drugs; Do not engage in any ILLEGAL activities anywhere on the property; ONLY guests included on the reservation are permitted on the premises. Fines will be issued for breaking these rules (Fine $100-$250). -If you break or damage something, please let me know and arrange for its replacement or repair. - The cleaning fee outlined in the profile is included to clean the place after your stay, however, if you leave the place excessively dirty, we may charge up to $100 additionally for the extra work incurred. -Quiet hours must be observed between 10pm-8am. -Lost key fee - $300 -Unsalvageable stained linens - $15/pc. -Unsalvageable stained towels - $10/pc. -Smoking - $300 -Unauthorized bringing of pets - $300 **-No pets, except dogs & cats. If you have a dog or a cat,  an extra $50 pet cleaning fee will be added to your reservation.
host_about: Sonia & Syed are Chicago Natives. We can give you recommendations for food and fun! Mother to my beautiful baby Sofia

neighborhood_overview: In Lincoln Park, Chicago’s natural landscape rises up to meet its urban vitality. Yes, you have all the makings of a big city – history, dining, shopping and entertainment – but you’re also treated to sprawling green spaces and lush parks. Stroll down tree-lined streets past historical homes to several of the city’s best attractions. A block away you’ll find Oz Park, where you can pose with statues of the Tin Man, Scarecrow, Cowardly Lion and Dorothy and Toto or embark on a fragrant stroll through the flowers of Emerald Gardens. Just a few blocks east on the shores of Lake Michigan is Lincoln Park, home to a rowing canal, The Chicago History Museum and the famous Lincoln Park Zoo, open year-round with free admission. And if you’re visiting campus, DePaul University is just a 10-minute walk away. For up-to-the-minute fashion, both Armitage & Halsted and the Magnificent Mile are within walking distance of our inviting rental. Take a break from the fitting rooms to enjoy the area’s best d
host_about: I have been hosting Airbnb travelers from all over the world for over 7 years. I am dedicated to an exceptional guest experience.  If you have any questions, don't hesitate to ask!
