name: Charming 2 Bedroom Apartment in Logan Square
summary: Large 2-bedroom garden apartment in Logan Square, a quick walk to some of the best restaurants and cocktail bars in the city, and outdoor spaces including nearby Palmer Square Park. The apartment is recently renovated and furnished with an open floor plan mid-century modern living/dining set-up. Owner-occupied building, looking forward to making your stay in Chicago comfortable as you explore the city.
space: The space is an inviting garden apartment in a Chicago 2-flat.  The apartment was recently renovated--new kitchen, paint, bathroom updates.
description: Large 2-bedroom garden apartment in Logan Square, a quick walk to some of the best restaurants and cocktail bars in the city, and outdoor spaces including nearby Palmer Square Park. The apartment is recently renovated and furnished with an open floor plan mid-century modern living/dining set-up. Owner-occupied building, looking forward to making your stay in Chicago comfortable as you explore the city. The space is an inviting garden apartment in a Chicago 2-flat.  The apartment was recently renovated--new kitchen, paint, bathroom updates. The garden apartment is almost the entire length of the building--it's a pretty big space ~1,000 square feet.  To enter, the building door is around back--you can see the pathway from the sidewalk along the left side of the building.  This entry is used by myself and the 1st floor tenants, although more often than not we're using the front door so you may not bump into us. Once inside, you'll head downstairs and take the door on the left: this is you
neighborhood_overview: I absolutely love this part of Logan Square.  It's a bit off the beaten path (about a 10-15 minute walk to the Square itself) but offers some great dining, cocktail bars and outdoor activity access.  Just off of Armitage and Kedzie, you are a short walk to the strip of Armitage shops between Kedzie and Kimball.  This area is up and coming, part of its charm and intrigue, and includes: -Amazing restaurants + cocktail lounges:  >>Scofflaw (gin bar, interesting selection of beer, amazing food and cocktails),  >>Giant (recently opened restauarant, hard to get a reservation, rave reviews),  >>Sink Swim (seafood + cocktails),  >>La Bomba (traditional puerto rican fare),  >>Best Intentions (another amazing cocktail bar + restaurant, good patio for summer) >>Ground Control (vegetarian/vegan fare that is some of the best in Chicago, good beer selection) -There is one coffee shop that is new and pretty great: Damn Fine Coffee Bar.  It has a real neighborhood feel, coffee is good, people watching
notes: The building was built in 1912, and while it's in great shape, there's a few things to note:  -Like many garden apartments in Chicago (half below/half above ground), the height of the ceilings is lower than typical: about 6'6". Please take this into consideration when deciding when to rent the space. -The 1st floor apartment (right above the unit) has original hard wood floors, so you can hear when people are moving around.  Typically this is not disruptive but if you are concerned about noise, this may not be the place for you. -Because this is a garden unit/an older building you will see the occasional spider or house centipede. Harmless but sometimes they're around.
transit: -Right off of the Armitage Bus (#73 running East/West) from early morning to early evening -10-15 minute walk to the Blue Line train (either Logan Square stop or California stop--both are nice walks through the neighborhood -This is a popular destination for folks, so Uber, Lyft, other ride-share programs and cabs are pretty easy to find or call to the area -Parking can be a challenge during certain times of the day/evening.  The area is not zoned, so you can park wherever.
access: The garden apartment is almost the entire length of the building--it's a pretty big space ~1,000 square feet.  To enter, the building door is around back--you can see the pathway from the sidewalk along the left side of the building.  This entry is used by myself and the 1st floor tenants, although more often than not we're using the front door so you may not bump into us. Once inside, you'll head downstairs and take the door on the left: this is your entry way into the apartment and is also where building storage units and the laundry washing/drying machines are located.  You may use the laundry room, please note that the 1st floor tenants and myself also use this space.
house_rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund. 1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable. 2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to the designated location by the agreed upon check-out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out penalty. 3.) Absolutely no smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any entrance. 4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 5.) Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid.
host_about:
Arkansas-born but Chicago is our home and we wouldn't have it any other way! 

Our space offers fellow travelers a little southern hospitality in the city we can't live without. Other things we can't live without - Dark Matter coffee, good wine, good friends (and the just okay ones, too), good beer, and laughing a lot from all of the above. 

We hope our own experiences have created the perfect space that ensures you have a wonderful local experience in a global city, if there's anything we can do to help, it's against our constitution not to try so just ask! 

When we're not traveling as much and as far as possible, a few other things we enjoy are live music (seriously, a LOT of live music and we met at a music festival), camping, golfing, reading (Tom Robbins is a fave), meeting new people and exploring one of the greatest foodie cities in the world (hope our guidebook helps!) If requested, we're more than happy to offer recommendations and advice that only locals could know. 

"One's destination is never a place, but a new way of seeing things."

name: Private Room in Wrigley/Boystown
summary: Come get the full Chicago experience! Steps away from Wrigley Field, Boystown, and the Red Line which goes right into downtown. Lots of food nearby. Easy access to all things Chicago in a fun and exciting neighborhood.
space: Your private room comes with a very comfortable full-sized bed, complete with extra blankets/bedding/pillows for colder weather. You also get 2 towel sets, toiletries, shampoo/body wash, and even some mints! A personalized greeting on the white-board in the room, which you can also use to provide messages of your own/advice and critiques. Also storage for your clothes, and a hamper for any dirty laundry you might want to wash (I can happily provide detergent).

Easy access to all things Chicago in a fun and exciting neighborhood. Your private room comes with a very comfortable full-sized bed, complete with extra blankets/bedding/pillows for colder weather. You also get 2 towel sets, toiletries, shampoo/body wash, and even some mints! A personalized greeting on the white-board in the room, which you can also use to provide messages of your own/advice and critiques. Also storage for your clothes, and a hamper for any dirty laundry you might want to wash (I can happily provide detergent). You are allowed access to the entire house, save my private room. This includes the bathroom (obviously), the living room complete with a TV and X-Box, the kitchen, with all the appropriate cooking and food storage devices you can imagine, plus a dishwasher! Laundry is downstairs, and only $0.75 a machine. I'm usua
neighborhood_overview: We're at the cusp of Wrigleyville (the very active and exciting area near Wrigley Field) and Boystown (a friendly and safe neighborhood with plenty of shops and restaurants). You are mere SECONDS away from Wrigley Field, if you wanna watch a baseball game, and plenty of nightlife just around the corner. However, if you need to just stay in for a night, the building is pretty sound-proof, and far away enough that you are able to get a good night's sleep without being disturbed.
transit: STEPS AWAY FROM THE CTA RED LINE!! This train is one of the essential ones in Chicago, allowing you to reach downtown in less than 20 minutes! Also near the 8 bus (also headed downtown) and the 152 (headed west on Addison). You are also just a few blocks away from the water's edge if you want a great view of the lake :-) I recommend traveling exclusively via CTA here, just because parking can be tricky when so close to Wrigley Field. It's cheap, and so close-by. There are also taxis everywhere, and you usually don't have to wait more than 5 minutes for an Uber or Lyft driver. It's a very popular area, so it's a breeze getting to and from here.
access: You are allowed access to the entire house, save my private room. This includes the bathroom (obviously), the living room complete with a TV and X-Box, the kitchen, with all the appropriate cooking and food storage devices you can imagine, plus a dishwasher! Laundry is downstairs, and only $0.75 a machine.
interaction: I'm usually pretty busy with work/rehearsals/performances, so I will mostly be out of your hair. However, I am always available via call or text to answer any questions or for any recommendations for your travels! When I am home, if you need anything, don't hesitate to ask.
house_rules: ***SORRY, NO SAME-DAY BOOKINGS*** Only a few house-keeping rules: - No Smoking - No other guests aside from who is on the reservation (subject to fine for unauthorized guests) - No breaking things - No stealing things - Please clean up after yourself in common areas (kitchen, living room, bathroom) And that's it!
host_about:
I moved to Chicago to be in a place full of life, art, culture, and history. This is a place where anything can be happening at any time of year and I love being a part of it!
I'm a huge fan of music, especially classic rock and vocal music. I'm a singer, so I love to listen to music that I can recreate myself. If you love making/experiencing music, I think we'll get along fine.
Theater and acting is my main passion, and I enjoy watching it as much as doing it. Thank the Lord for Netflix! But nothing compares to watching live theater, and Chicago has some of the best.

If you like your privacy, I can fully appreciate that, but just say the word and I can also be good company. There may even be breakfast/a cold drink involved. Your choice, I'm happy to provide.

The newly redecorated apartment is located on a quiet street in the up-and-coming Avondale neighborhood with free street parking (parking permit will be provided). Only a few minutes away from Logan Square, amazing restaurants, nightlife, and entertainment are easy to find.

name: Amadeus Stay - Hip Central 3bdrm Apt +Free Parking
summary: Our newly renovated Scandinavian inspired apartment is on the 2nd floor of a classic Chicago greystone from 1899. Bright, modern, minimal & eco-conscious, it features 2 queen beds, 1 twin bed, a travel crib & 1 elevated twin air-bed. Outdoor deck overlooks a beautiful café patio. Plush bedding, washer/dryer, soaking tub w/ high pressure shower, garage parking and only a 5 min walk from CTA train makes your stay easy & enjoyable.
space: Amadeus Stay is a laid-back, stylish, and clean apartment central to all Chicago has to offer.  Sunlight floods the living and dining room making it cheery and bright throughout the day while the warm glow from the lighting creates a mood perfect for playing some music and pouring a drink from the bar cart, or cozying up on the sofa and watching Netflix at night.  From a bowl of cereal to cooking up a farmers market feast... the kitchen is perfect for your needs. High-end appliances include a dishwasher, 5-burner range/oven, microwave, washer/dryer combo, toaster, blender and of course lets not forget the coffee maker, chemex and other pour over gadgets for my fellow coffee lovers : ) For the earth and your health, being green is as important to us as your comfort... and this apartment doesn't lack either! We've selected all organic or oeko-tek certified high-end bedding and towels from Brooklinen, Unison and Bloom. You'll be getting your beauty sleep on a dreamy 100% natural latex rub

neighborhood_overview: North Center is a vibrant and convenient neighborhood located a mile or so from the lakefront and an easy commute downtown. Influenced by the early European immigrants that settled here, the community has retained it's charm in architecture while becoming more diverse and dynamic. Stroll the quiet residential areas and you'll find well-kept brick homes, tree-lined streets and large picturesque parks. This safe neighborhood also boasts a wide-ranging mix of unique boutiques, restaurants, craft breweries, pubs, bakeries and coffee shops. You don't even have to leave the "hood" to experience a selection of summer festivals, music venues, live theater, bowling alleys, and plenty of family-friendly fun. A leisure walk or 7min Uber ride to Wrigley Field, home of the Chicago Cubs!   A short walk from two local coffee shops and a Starbucks across the street. A variety of restaurants inculding must have Chicago style pizza at Lou Malnalti's or Giordano's (both just a 10 min walk). 3 amazing mic
notes: Please note that the All-In-One washer/dryer, does not dry as quickly as a stand-alone dryer. Plan accordingly and try to keep your loads small. We also have a drying rack.
transit: • Get Downtown (or checkout other awesome neighborhoods) by hopping on the super close Irving Park Brown line "El" train (5 min walk) • Damen, Irving, & Lincoln CTA bus stops are all practically outside your door as well.  • Nearest Divy rentable bike station is located across the street, outside CVS.
interaction: We provide an easy and secure way for your to pick up your key from our lockbox at your leisure so their is never any rush to check in by a certain time. We can be reached by text or phone but are also in the neighborhood and would be happy to meet you and answer any question about your stay in person (schedules permitting).
house_rules: -Guest must have a profile and a REAL photo of themselves for us to accept booking (It’s nice to know who we’ll be welcoming into our home).  -Check in is after 3:00 pm and check out is before 11:00 am. On occasion we are able to accommodate a slightly earlier check-in depending on our guest bookings. If you would like to inquire about an early check in please do so in advance. We kindly ask that you not show up early as the cleaning crew or myself will be preparing the place for your STAY.  - No Smoking, No Vaping & No Drug Use anywhere in the building or on back deck. This is our home and everything in it is new + recently remodeled. We ask that you leave it all as you find it and help us keep it fresh for your next STAY!  -We thank you in advance for removing your shoes. We try to keep our place as clean as possible for all our guest, so we kindly ask that you place your shoes in the shoe trays under bench in entryway and refrain from wearing any shoes in our home. -We have a 'no pe
host_about:
Hi there! I'm Michelle and I live in Chicago with my husband Jared and 3 children. I was born and raised in this city and even though I moved away with my family in my "tweens", I returned to finish college here and I'm still loving all this amazing city has to offer! We are just a short drive away and if available, we'd be happy to meet you and tell you about our favorite spots if you'd like personal suggestions. 

5 things i can't live without: specialty coffee + coffee shops, spotify premium (i listen to music most of the day), city life, art/design and sunshine. also my family which is most important : )

food: i love to eat good food and try new places from foodie restaurants and gastro pubs, to food trucks. i also enjoy cooking.

favorite films: the royal tenenbaums (anything by wes anderson) lost in translation, the diving bell and the butterfly, breathless, annie hall, garden state...

my style of traveling is: checking out as many fun and unique things as possible. exploring neighborhoods, people watching and being in a highly walkable area are key. i also enjoy biking, outdoor markets, festivals, concerts, scuba + snorkeling, hiking, and family friendly places. oh, and did i mention coffee shops ; )

words i live by: 
"love God, love people"
"the greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall" - nelson mandela
"there is no beauty without some strangeness" - edgar allan poe
"be happy for this moment, this moment is your life" - omar khayyam

name: Bucktown Hip Haven
summary: Beautiful Bucktown Condo with Large Bedroom and Private Bathroom.  Perfectly situation 10 mins away from Heart of Bucktown/Wicker Park/Six Corners.   Very Sunny 2nd Floor Unit featuring In-Unit Laundry, Dishwasher, and Stainless-Steel Appliances.  Large outdoor deck.
space: This unit is located on historic Cortland Street, one block north of the popular 606,  the elevated trail for bikers and runners, art installations, and landscape design. The space has been completely rehabbed to modern standards, from the stainless steel appliances to the granite countertop. Dishwasher, In-Unit Laundry, Basic Kitchen Appliances all accessible.

Neighborhood veteran with a vast knowledge of the best Bucktown/Wicker/Logan Square have to offer including restaurants, shops, and nightlife.  I'm an a
neighborhood_overview: Bucktown and Wicker Park are located just a few miles from downtown.  The area is considered one of the best neighborhoods for dining, entertaining, and shopping.  There are countless places to explore along Damen Ave, North Ave, and Milwaukee Ave.
notes: My storage office is located upstairs, but you will have private access to your entire level.  My office has its own entrance, so you'll have absolute privacy during your stay. To pay homage to Chicago artists, the home is adorned in local artwork.
transit: Public Transportation 2 min walk to Armitage Bus (East / West to lakefront or Blue Line train to O'Hare) 3 min walk to Damen Bus (North / South to United Center / Downtown) 5 min walk to Metra Commuter Train (Clybourn Station to Downtown or North Shore) 10 min walk to Blue Line station at North, Milwaukee, and Damen (To downtown or O'Hare) Bikes There is a Chicago Divvy (shared bike) station just 3 blocks away at Cortland and Damen Cars Easy, no zone, street parking, and Interstate 90/94 entrance is just 1/2 mile East on Armitage Uber / Cabs Rarely more than a few minutes away from your front door Cortland Street is famous for its beautiful trees and gorgeous homes.  The street is often used in TV shows including Chicago Fire.
access: You'll have your own private level.  The main floor is the primary living space with kitchen, dining area, living room and bathroom. You'll have immediate access to the in-unit laundry and guest storage for luggage.
interaction: Neighborhood veteran with a vast knowledge of the best Bucktown/Wicker/Logan Square have to offer including restaurants, shops, and nightlife.  I'm an amiable hosts. Happy to show you around the neighborhood or just let you be.

summary: A fully furnished home for your longer stay, complete with WiFi and everything you need to live. AFFORDABLE MONTHLY RATES ARE AVAILABLE!!! MARCH - $2350 APRIL - $2350 A True Gem In South Loop! Walking distance to the best dining, leisure, and shopping establishments that the town has to offer, our apartment’s complete amenities and proximity is the perfect jump off whether you’re in the city for a quick vacay or here to seal a business deal.

neighborhood_overview: Living up to Chicago's vibe, you will definitely not want to miss this side.  It's accessible and bordered by the lake and gorgeous parks and top museums like the Chicago Museum Campus that has the view of Lake Michigan and the skyline on the other. You can explore by taking the water taxi lake route that takes you to Shedd Aquarium, Adler Planetarium and the monumental Field Museum that is home to Maximo The Titanosaur, SUE T.rex and more 40 million other artifacts. For most, this is a place where adventurous travellers flock to fine dining restaurants to the best of South Loop's good eats like Acadia, Cafecito, Devil Dogs South. Diverse nightlife choices from dive bars, cocktails, blues joints and cafe bars and hole in the wall finds. Retails shops and parks conveniently situated and fast becoming a neighborhood fave spots. Truly at South Loop, there is always something for everyone worth exploring.
notes: -All guest need to be attentive with the house rules during their stay as there are other tenants at the property. - Bath towels are provided per number of guest not per number of stay -Washcloths are not provided during your stay. You may send me a message though if you need them and I'll try my best to accommodate your request. -We have duvet covers on our bedding  (no top sheets). -Security Deposit maybe required on the following bookings: 1) Last minute bookings 2) Short weekend stays 3) Large groups  4) Guests with no reviews 5) Guests with incomplete profile 6) Instant Bookings  7) Some properties may not allow locals for short term reservations. -Please be aware that if you lose the key and/or entry fob which is your access to the unit, it cannot be replaced for you immediately and you may lose access to the apartment and all amenities until another one can be made. There is a $200 fee for lost keys. -If there's an issue during your stay, please report it real-time so we can add
transit: Sitting between Cermark and 18th Street, and just a few steps away from both the Red and Green train lines, our Michigan property is your perfect gateway to Windy City adventures.  Explore the fancy Millionaire’s Row at Prairie Avenue District, bask in the glory of the city skyline by Lake Michigan, and marvel at the gorgeous Chicago Museum Campus. Sucker for Science? Make sure to not miss the Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium and Adler Planetarium! If you’re in for your dose of art and culture, the Motor Row District is the hottest spot for international grub, local brews, and immersive theatre. For music aficionados, drop by Buddy Guy’s Legends and Chess Records to experience the town’s blues music scene.
access: Ever dreamed about jetting off to your own Chicago apartment? Well, now’s your chance to bring that fantasy to life. During your stay, the whole apartment is yours and only yours.
interaction: We’re all about giving you plenty of privacy and personal space, so we’ll be available by phone (call or text) during your stay.
house_rules: -No Drugs; Do not engage in any ILLEGAL activities anywhere on the property; ONLY guests included on the reservation are permitted on the premises. Fines will be issued for breaking these rules (Fine $100-$250). -If you break or damage something, please let me know and arrange for its replacement or repair. - The cleaning fee outlined in the profile is included to clean the place after your stay, however, if you leave the place excessively dirty, we may charge up to $100 additionally for the extra work incurred. -Quiet hours must be observed between 10pm-8am. -Lost key fee - $300 -Unsalvageable stained linens - $15/pc. -Unsalvageable stained towels - $10/pc. -Smoking - $300 -Unauthorized bringing of pets - $300 **-No pets except cats. If you have a cat, an extra $50 pet cleaning fee will be added to your reservation.
host_about:
We are a young couple, both seniors at DePaul University and we love traveling around the world.

We very much enjoy meeting new people and making friends as we travel and love helping guests get the most out of their stay as we have been on our own travels.

Our apartments are very special homes that offer comfort and convenient locations. 

We hope to welcome you here!

house_rules: Absolutely NO photoshoots + filming! ALL guest must me registered with us. We do not allow anyone to use our house for their own personal gain/profit. If you do you, are subject to fines and a lawsuit! this is our house, not yours! CLEANING FEE The cleaning fee is for linens and switch outs, NOT to do your DISHES! That attracts bugs + rodents so you are responsible for leaving the house clean and respectful. If you leave the house dirty/filthy you will be charged an extra fee. HOUSE RULES No Smoking or candles in any of our apartments. Quiet after 11pm weeknights and 12am weekends. No broken or damaged items. Only use the front entrance to enter the house. Side gate to get to the backyard. DO NOT use center stairwell and side door to backyard. Other than that, we are very chill landlords. Shoes off at the door. Have fun, but try and consider other renters.
host_about:

name: Michigan Ave Downtown Private Room + ensuite Bath
summary: Downtown South Loop is a vibrant area featuring eclectic eateries, shops, museums, theaters and parks. It’s home to the Willis Tower and the iconic “Cloud Gate” sculpture. Grant Park features the large, rococo-style Buckingham Fountain and the renowned Art Institute of Chicago, and hosts annual events like The Taste of Chicago and Lollapalooza. Breathtaking view of Lake Michigan. Unlimited access to Sling TV featuring live sports like EPL, NFL, NBA;  CNN and BBC; Netflix, Hulu, Roku and YouTube.
space: This is a two bedroom, two bathroom loft apartment. You'll get a private bedroom and private/ensuite bathroom. The living room and the kitchen will be shared with other guests. And since it's a loft styled apartment, in addition to the wide-open feel of the apartment, it's also characterized by high ceilings, exposed piping, ventilator tubes, support beams and poles, etc. Please note that the bedroom door can only be locked from inside of the room.
description: Downtown South Loop is a vibrant area featuring eclectic eateries, shops, museums, theaters and parks. It’s home to the Willis Tower and the iconic “Cloud Gate” sculpture. Grant Park features the large, rococo-style Buckingham Fountain and the renowned Art Institute of Chicago, and hosts annual events like The Taste of Chicago and Lollapalooza. Breathtaking view of Lake Michigan. Unlimited access to Sling TV featuring live sports like EPL, NFL, NBA;  CNN and BBC; Netflix, Hulu, Roku and YouTube. neighborhood_overview: This place is right adjacent to the popular Chicago Millennium Park and Art Institute. It is also situated on Michigan avenue at the heart of downtown where all the action happens. You'll also enjoy the amazing view of the Lake Michigan when you take the elevator to the deck.
transit: Transportation is a breeze at this location. You have direct access to all buses and trains that connect to all parts of the beautiful city of Chicago. Most things like restaurants, grocery stores, boutiques, coffee shops, and night life are within a walking distance.

name: Spacious Condo, Fully Equipped Kitchen, Near CTA
summary: This condo is home to our family of four and we list it only while we are away on vacation. Because we love food and cooking, our kitchen has all the essential equipment that you need to cook just about anything. There is only one bed (king size) but the couch can comfortably sleep a third person. Street parking only, but a CTA redline station is a 500 yard walk away. We also have WiFi and in-unit washer and dryer. Three blocks from the beach!
space: We've got a lot of space but not a lot of beds. We're happy to accommodate additional guests if you'd like to bring extra bedding arrangements (cots, sleeping bags, etc.), but otherwise you'll have access just to a king-size hide-a-bed in our family room.

name: Rena’s Temple: beautiful, clean, and relaxed.
summary: My studio is bright, clean, spacious, calm, artsy, and just enough for 1 person or a couple. The neighborhood is safe and it’s very easy to get anywhere, as the train station is right across the street. There are grocery stores, pharmacies, and city bikes all nearby. Plus, you’ll find that the Logan Square neighborhood is just a quick 12 minute stroll with a movie theater, delicious restaurants/bars, bakeries, bookstores, and the farmers market on Sunday. It’s a beautiful space that I call home.
space: This studio has a full kitchen with a dishwasher included, laundry in the basement, bright light, spaces to move and walk around, and a yoga mat (if you practice). There is a small fire-escape that can easily double as a communal patio space (perfect for the summer) out of the back doorway.

There is a small fire-escape that can easily double as a communal patio space (perfect for the summer) out of the back doorway. Laundry machines in the basement of the building (it’s a short building), so not so many stairs. Please call, message, email me if you have ANY questions or concerns. The neighborhood is very safe-lots of fa
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is very safe-lots of families and young professionals are in the area. Stores nearby are Walgreens Pharmacy, Aldi’s grocery store, Best Buy, a famous Korean supermarket, a Mexican bakery, a gas station, and a few fast food places. You can find It’s very close to the Blue Line CTA Belmont train station, as well as a few bus stops (right across the street—-you can also rent city bikes). The train to O’Hare International Airport (30 min ride) and to downtown in Chicago (15 min ride to the Loop) is here also. You can also walk to Logan Square (about 1 mile southwest-a 10/12 minute), or take the train 1 stop to Logan Square (about a 2 min ride).  Logan Square has amazing brunch spots and incredible restaurants and bars. There are bookstores, French bakeries, The Logan Square Farmers Market on Sundays, a movie theater, yoga studios, gardens, a gym, boutiques, and fresh food co-ops.
notes: Please take great care of my home, my space, and bring your new, great energy into it.
transit: You can take the train, bus, a city bike, or call an Uber or a Lyft to go anywhere-it’s fast because it’s all just across the street. Parking is available on the street, but not always easy to find.
access: Laundry machines in the basement of the building (it’s a short building), so not so many stairs.
interaction: Please call, message, email me if you have ANY questions or concerns.
house_rules: Please, no outside shoes in the apartment.  Please be mindful about the central heat/air you use. Turn it off when you leave during the day AND when you check out. I like to keep a clean and green space. Plus, it can get quite expensive, and I am only an artist :) Please wash whatever dishes you use, flush the toilet (you’d be surprised that many people do not), AND throw away the trash before you checkout. To throw away the garbage: the trash cans are outside through the back patio exit in the alleyway. There are 2 cans to recycle and 2 cans for trash. Take the key with you to enter/exit after you throw away the trash. Ultimately, leave the place as you found it, and respect the space you’re in-my home :) Thank you!
host_about:
Hello!
I am an artist and a contemporary ballet dancer with Hubbard Street Dance Chicago. I travel a lot for work, so I am always looking for good people to keep the energy flowing beautifully in my cozy home. I tour both nationally and internationally with the company.

I'm a huge fan of travel, so even when I'm not working, I'm off jet-setting somewhere. So far, I've traveled to 26 countries. Some of my favorite places are Taiwan, Indonesia, Nicaragua, France, Thailand, Singapore, Jourdan, Italy, Spain, and right here in Chicago. I just moved from New York, after having lived there for 10 years, so being back in Chicago is wonderful!  I love new experiences and exchanges and good, positive energy.

I'm very friendly, calm, artsy, and outgoing. I dance, make dances, make art, and teach. When I'm not doing that I'm cooking, reading, being in nature, out with friends, being poetic, living life!

My home is me. After traveling so much, I love to come home to something that centers me. My place is quiet, open, cozy, comforting, bright, and relaxing--the perfect place to recharge.

*Also, please feel free to ask me about the cancelled Airbnb stay listed in the review column below, should you be interested.

name: Domio | Loop | Bright 2BR + Gym and Indoor Pool
summary: Please note that photos are from a Domio unit in Chicago. Your Domio will have similar design, but the layout will be different from the pictures.  Upgrade your Chicago experience and stay in this beautiful apartment. Centrally located in the heart of Chicago, this sleek and upscale space was beautifully designed to create a relaxing environment and make you feel at home.
space: All Domios are designed with style and comfort in mind and this space is no different. This 2 bedroom and 2 bath home boasts an exceptional living room, high-end furniture, and bright finishes. In addition to a fully-stocked kitchen with state-of-the-art appliances, guests will be pleased to find local decor and artwork throughout the home.    Bedroom 1:  Queen Bed    Bedroom 2:  Queen Bed    Living Room:  Sofa Bed Cleanliness is always our top priority. Domio cleans and sanitizes every property between each reservation—following a 100 point checklist. We clean and disinfect all hard surfaces and high touch areas using products approved by public health authorities.

Easily walk to many restaurants and be situated close to many of Chicago's attractions.  Nearby attractions include: Chicago Riverwalk (.2 miles) Tribune Tower (.6 miles) Millennium Park (.9 miles) Navy Pier (1.3 miles) Museum Campus (2 miles)
notes: Chicago Registration: PendingPlease note that we do not allow bookings from residents of Chicago and surrounding areas. For stays over 30 days, we require additional personal information and a signed License Agreement in order to accommodate the stay. All guests will be required to verify their information which includes a 3rd-party background check. This is to ensure your safety as well as the safety and well being of our neighbors and our homes. All information is confidential and will not be shared with anyone for any purposes outside of your reservation. Once all information is verified, we will be able to confirm your reservation. However, we reserve the right to cancel a reservation if you fail to comply or there is a failed background check. Please be aware that an additional deposit of $100 per reservation will be held during the period of your stay and released back within 7 days after check-out to cover any incidentals that may occur at the property. Please reach out to our t
transit: Easily traverse Chicago via the popular subway system. The Clark/Lake station is a 3 minute walk from this Domio and you can access the Blue/Brown/Green/Orange/Pink/Purple lines. You can take the Blue Line to ORD airport and the Brown Line to MDW airport. Additionally, Uber and Lyfts are readily available in Chicago.
access: Guests have exclusive access to the apartment. Additionally, guests have access to the following building amenities: Indoor Pool Gym  Two levels of sun decks Billiards Room Yoga Room Clubroom
interaction: We do our best to tailor each experience to our guests preferences. Want advice, suggestions, or a shoulder to lean on? We are always available at your disposal. Need a place to stay but don't feel like chatting? That's okay too, we won't be offended.

name: Spacious condo, trendy neighborhood
summary: Stay in one of Chicago's most vibrant neighborhoods in a condo that combines luxury and comfort. In this fully furnished, nearly 1400 sq ft apartment enjoy hardwood floors, spa bathrooms, and the convenience of in unit washer and dryer. North and south exposures provide tons of natural light. Two balconies and a rooftop offer ample outdoor leisure space. Step outside and walk to bars, restaurants, entertainment, shopping, and more. Explore Chicago with easy access to train/bus lines.
space: Get a taste of Chicago condo living and come into a space that is spacious yet cozy, luxurious but comfortable, and lively yet peaceful. North and south facing exposure bathes the apartment in tons of natural light. The unit has four rooms (living/dining, kitchen, and two bedrooms) + 2 full bathrooms with bathtubs, and two furnished outdoor balconies (one off the living room, the other off the master). Bright, unique decor abounds through the apartment, from the wall colors to the vintage touches. Curl up in a leather club chair and relive your youth with a Cynthia Voigt novel or break out your laptop and take care of work obligations in the home office space. If the weather is on your side have your breakfast on one of the outdoor patios. And if mother nature forces you indoors then lounge by the fireplace. For breathtaking 360 views of the city head up to the shared rooftop. The living/dining room has a large sofa, 2 chairs, a 46" TV, fireplace, dining table and 4 chairs.  There are

neighborhood_overview: Located right in between Wicker Park (to the north) and the West Loop (to the south), West Town is a lively neighborhood that boasts some of Chicago's best restaurants, trendiest shops, and most fun bars. Walk to Bella Notte, Ruxpin, Butterfly Sushi, Shaman or one of the many other neighborhood eateries for a delicious meal. Head to Chicago Avenue and browse the racks of Tarnish for that perfect thrift store find or visit Permanent Records for some new albums to add to your vinyl collection. Grab a drink at Grandview Tavern & Beer Garden then hit up the salon-themed club Beauty Bar to dance your a$$ off.  If you feel like purchasing groceries there is a Green Grocers 2 blocks away at Grand and Noble. Mariano's supermarket is less than a mile away at Chicago and Damen. The Chicago Public Library is also nearby on Chicago Ave just west of Ashland.  If you're looking to dine in Chinese, Thai, pizza, burgers, sushi and more are available via delivery.
notes: The area rug and throw in the living room are prone to shedding when used. There's a hand held vacuum in the utility closet to get rid of any errant dust bunnies the shedding may cause.
transit: West Town is a great neighborhood but if you have a hankering to see more of Chicago it's easy to get out and about. The Grand Avenue bus (#65) runs east/west. The westbound stop is about 100 feet to the right of the building and the eastbound stop is across the street. Hop on and catch a ride to the shops along the Magnificent Mile or to Navy Pier. The Ashland Avenue bus (#9) runs north/south. The bus stops are right at the corner of Ashland and Grand (just steps from the building). CTA trains are just a few blocks away. Catch the green or pink lines at Lake and Ashland (9 minute walk, head south on Ashland) and get to the West Loop and Loop in minutes. If you prefer to be active rent a Divvy bike from the station right out front. The building is located 3 miles from downtown, a 10 minute drive with no traffic. Uber and Lyft are readily available and pick up in less than 5 minutes. If you rented a car or brought your own there is free 24 hour street parking in front of the building an
access: You will be able to access the entire apartment. There is a private elevator you can use to go down to the lobby, but you will not be able to access it to go up to the apartment as it requires a code and a key. No worries! The unit is accessible by the stairs near the elevator and is an easy jaunt up to the 2nd floor. There are 2 separate bedrooms, one with a king size bed and the other with a queen size sofa bed. There is also an 8 foot sofa in the living room. Between these accommodations the condo comfortably sleeps 5 people. I also have a queen size air mattress if additional sleep space is needed.  There is an unfinished rooftop accessible via the back staircase. It is shared space with 6 other units in the building, but it tends to be pretty private. I will provide labeled keys to the front gate, lobby door, and the condo unit.  Feel free to use the kitchen. I have provided an empty shelf in the refrigerator to accommodate your groceries. If you want to enjoy a night in I have ma
interaction: I will not be home during your stay. However, you can reach me via email or phone if you need to. The keys will be in a lockbox on the front gate. I will give you the code once you book.
house_rules: I hope you enjoy the condo while you are in Chicago. While I am happy to open my home to guests there are a few rules that I must insist on. 1. Absolutely no smoking or tobacco use of any kind in the condo or on the building property. If you break this rule I will keep your deposit.  2. Be mindful of my neighbors in the building and the buildings next door. Keep the noise down before 8 a.m. and after 10 p.m.   3. I don't mind small gatherings of a few people, but no parties in the condo. Please ensure any guests adhere to all house rules. Ultimately you are responsible for maintaining the space. Please, no additional overnight guests. 4. Enjoy the kitchen, but please clean and put away any and all dishes, pots, pans, appliances, etc. that you use and empty any garbage in the outside trash bins. Discard or take with you any leftovers. Also please only consume food and beverages you've purchased (although if you need to use a few items from the spice cabinet here or there feel free, but
host_about:
Once or twice a year I like to get out and see the world.  Sometimes I go to one country for a week, other times I spend 2-3 weeks traveling through different countries. I love to explore new places and take in the food, architecture, hot spots, and sights.  The one item that always comes with me wherever I travel are my running sneakers. I've done 6 marathons and plan to do more.  

I am a considerate guest and will leave any room or apartment the way I found it.  I tend to travel light so that it's easy to move from place to place. I like to enjoy a city for a few days before going some place else. 

Je parle francais aussi.  Je ne parle pas francais tout les jours, mais je peux tenir une conversation decent. Petit a petit mon francais est amelioration.

name: Victorian greystone near Loyola U!
summary: Private, spacious 2 BR apartment in interesting, diverse neighborhood with great restaurants and beaches! Walk to several different bus lines and train lines to go downtown and other nearby Northside neighborhoods.
space: This listing is for an entire private 2-bedroom apartment in the Rogers Park neighborhood of Chicago.The apartment is over 1200 square feet (111 sq meters) and has tall 9.5' ceilings (2.9 meters), a marble bath, and hardwood floors throughout. There is also a charmingly retro yet fully functional kitchen in the apartment. The apartment comprises the entire first floor of the 2 unit building and in addition to the apartment, There is a TV, a DVD player with a USB port, and a Roku for watching Netflix and Pandora. The apartment also has free wifi. There is a full sized bed in the smaller bedroom, a queen sized bed and a twin bed in the larger bedroom, and the sofa folds out into a full sized bed.
description: Private, spacious 2 BR apartment in interesting, diverse neighborhood with great restaurants and beaches! Walk to several different bus lines and train lines to go downtown and other nearby Northside neighborhoods. This listing is for an entire private 2-bedroom apartment in the Rogers Park neighborhood of Chicago.The apartment is over 1200 square feet (111 sq meters) and has tall 9.5' ceilings (2.9 meters), a marble bath, and hardwood floors throughout. There is also a charmingly retro yet fully functional kitchen in the apartment. The apartment also has free wifi. There is a full sized bed in the smaller bedroom, a queen sized bed and a twin bed in the larger bedroom, and the sofa folds out into a full sized bed. The apartment is private, and we live in the apartment above.  There is a washer
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is on the far north side of Chicago and borders Lake Michigan to the east, Evanston to the north, and the Edgewater neighborhood to the south. We love Rogers Park's diversity and its neighborhood feel. Shops and amenities are all easy to walk to. The apartment is also within walking distance to the lake and to Loyola university. There are numerous restaurants and bars within walking distance as well. In addition, the apartment is also easily accessible to Evanston and northside Chicago neighborhoods such as Andersonville (10 minute bus ride) and Lakeview (15 min train ride+15 min walk to the train). You can get downtown via public transportation in about 45 minutes or 15 minutes via car or taxi.
notes: We make the beds in the European style, with a fitted sheet, a duvet and a duvet cover.  We find this to be cleaner than American comforters, but flat sheets are available in the linen closet if you need them.  There are no animals in the apartment. Children are welcome in the apartment, as are pets who like to travel, but the space is also great for a couple, or for friends. We have had lots of babies stay, and they are always welcome, but it is not baby-proof and there are window blind cords and non-covered outlets.  We love Chicago and love hosting visitors in our extra apartment, so if you have any questions about public transit or the city, just ask and we will be glad to answer them.
transit: The apartment is very well connected with public transit.  Our street is on a bus route, and three other main busses stop a block away.  The Red Line el train, The Metra commuter train, and an express bus are all also within walking distance.
access: The apartment is private, and we live in the apartment above.  There is a washer and dryer in the basement that you can use free of charge. You are also welcome to hang out in the yard or on the stone patio, which has a grill that you are welcome to use. We have new porches and you are welcome to use the one off your kitchen.  Street parking is free and easy to find.
interaction: Because the apartment is completely separate, sometimes we don't meet guests, though we always like to say hi and see how your stay is going. We do live in the apartment upstairs, so we are available if there's a problem. It is a very old building and sometimes it has a mind of its own! We try and reply to texts and airbnb messages in a very prompt fashion.
house_rules: -No smoking inside of apartment, if you are a smoker you may smoke outside but please do not throw cigarette butts in the yard -If you're staying longer than 4 days, please water the plants. -We have two trash cans in the kitchen- please separate your recyclables.  -The thermostat controls both units, so please don't turn it off when you leave. It's programmable and you are welcome to adjust it to your comfort.
host_about:
Lisa, Caitlin, and our son Lars live in Chicago, IL, USA. We loved traveling in Airbnbs so much we decided to welcome visitors in our spare room. When we were ready to stop sharing a bathroom with guests, we found an opportunity to offer our guests a full apartment. We love meeting people from all around the world and giving them a place to live in our corner of Chicago. Lars was born in 2016 and has given us the chance to provide family-friendly amenities to guests traveling with babies. 
 I speak a little German, and Lisa speaks a little Turkish, but neither of us speak well enough to try and answer your questions about Chicago!

name: Bedroom in gorgeous Chicago home
summary: This is a very unique, artsy third floor bedroom. Old home, 1898, in Edgewater near beaches, red line, restaurants, etc. Guests have access to kitchen, dining room, living room, outdoor patio, porch, etc. Guest shared bathroom, shower are on first floor. Has two beds, 1 queen-size, 1 twin.
space: Guests in the third floor room have an interesting, eclectic space with plenty of sunlight. Has two beds (one queen, one regular) plus a large closet. Also room if need be for a sleeping bag on the floor. Sofa, chairs. It's a very artistic room.
description: This is a very unique, artsy third floor bedroom. Old home, 1898, in Edgewater near beaches, red line, restaurants, etc. Guests have access to kitchen, dining room, living room, outdoor patio, porch, etc. Guest shared bathroom, shower are on first floor. Has two beds, 1 queen-size, 1 twin. Guests in the third floor room have an interesting, eclectic space with plenty of sunlight. Has two beds (one queen, one regular) plus a large closet. Also room if need be for a sleeping bag on the floor. Sofa, chairs. It's a very artistic room. Large, spaceous home. Third floor guests have access to entire first floor - which includes the living room, dining room, kitchen, and guest bathroom (located on first floor). Guests are also welcome to use yard and back patio in warmer months. We try to be as available as possible for guests (to help with suggestions for local activities, how to get around town, etc.) but without intruding! Edgewater is a very diverse neighborhood on the far north side of Ch
neighborhood_overview: Edgewater is a very diverse neighborhood on the far north side of Chicago, bordering the lake. It has great restaurants and coffee shops. Loyola and Northwestern campuses are nearby, as are numerous stage theaters and restaurants and cafes on Clark Street in Andersonville. We are several blocks from either the Thorndale or Granville red line stops. Great beaches are very close by too.
notes: We have a cat, Galia. She has a great temperament though she does consider herself something of a super model.
transit: We are located between the Granville and Thorndale red line stops. The Broadway bus is a block away. We are just a few minutes from Sheridan Road, which includes numerous bus lines, including the 147 express downtown. There is generally plenty of street parking on our block. The local bike share, Divvy, has a stop nearby; it's great to grab a bike and hit the lakefront bike paths.
access: Large, spaceous home. Third floor guests have access to entire first floor - which includes the living room, dining room, kitchen, and guest bathroom (located on first floor). Guests are also welcome to use yard and back patio in warmer months.
interaction: We try to be as available as possible for guests (to help with suggestions for local activities, how to get around town, etc.) but without intruding!
house_rules: We expect basic consideration and respect from guests, and try to return the same on our part. We appreciate guests being quiet when coming and going during late hours. The home is no smoking, so guests need to step outside for that.
host_about: My name is Mark and I live in Chicago with my wife and two teenage kids. I have worked in journalism, in the field of philanthropy, and am now at a state humanities council. I am an avid photographer and have lived in Mexico, Norway and Spain for a combined seven years. I speak Spanish and Portuguese.

name: Sonder | Coeval | Sunny Studio + Fitness Room
summary: We want everyone to have a comfortable place to stay. Our digital check-in and the ability to manage your stay from our app, means you won't need to interact with anyone in person. Our staff has been trained in proper disinfection techniques and will deep clean your Sonder before and after your stay. We're here for you during this time of uncertainty and can be reached 24/7 via text or call. Named the most innovative travel company of 2019 by Fast Company, Sonder has hosted a million guests in 5,000+ spaces with an average rating of 4.6 stars. Each space is designed and run by us, so you’ll always know what to expect from your stay. neighborhood_overview: The Tri-Taylor neighborhood, whose name combines the triangular shape of its boundaries and its main thoroughfare, Taylor Street, is located about a mile west of Chicago's Little Italy. The community served as one of Chicago's gateways to Italian immigration beginning in the late 1800s, with "the largest waves of Italian population growth occurred between 1880 and the start of the First World War, and these immigration patterns created an Italian-American social fabric that would remain until the 1940s." Construction began on the Illinois Medical Center in 1941, which effectively cut Tri-Taylor off from Little Italy, and "in the early 1960s, ground was broken on the Eisenhower Expressway, which borders the neighborhood to the north, further disrupting the community." Residents feared that the neighborhood would be sacrificed by the "ever-expanding medical district and the expressway," but a "turning point came in 1983, when the National Register accepted the application of neighborhood
notes: Street parking is very easy and permit free. Always available within the block. PLEASE NOTE: We do not allow split payments through AirBnB. This blocks our calendar for 72 hours regardless if you make payment or not. We require initial deposit/payment to be made to block our calendar. Thanks for understanding!

summary: This apartment is most comfortable for students . If you're looking for a home base for a stay in Chicago it will be great for you. It's not in a walkable or touristy neighborhood, but it's very close to downtown and there is a bus right outside my door that runs right into the west loop and downtown. There is a large grocery store on my intersection so your necessities can be taken care of easily.  Close to hospitals for medical students and rotations.
space: This is a 3 bedroom and 2 bathroom apartment. All rooms are subject to Airbnb. 2 bedrooms are standard Chicago size with closets, and they share a  bathroom that is located near the kitchen. The middle room is a master bedroom, and it has its own bathroom inside.  All guests are welcome to use the kitchen and living room mindfully. Be mindful of your own cleaningness in the common areas as this is something I am unable to control on an hourly basis or daily basis. You will have to do your own dishes as the condo does not have a dishwasher.

neighborhood_overview: The Near West Side , one of the 77 community areas of Chicago, is on the West Side, west of the Chicago River and adjacent to the Loop and West Loop. The history of the Near West Side of Chicago includes the founding of Hull House, a prominent settlement house. The Great Chicago Fire started in the Near West Side. The area is home to the University of Illinois at Chicago (UIC), the United Center and the Illinois Medical (URL HIDDEN) not a very walkable neighborhood, but bigger streets such as Madison and Western are more interesting to walk through.
notes: Please keep it clean in the common areas.  Personal belongings should be kept in your room and not left on common sofas, dining tables etc.
transit: My listings are very close to public transportation. The bus stop is right on the intersection and my house is 5th from a major intersection with 2 buses.  The way chicago works is that each bus goes in a straight line. Madison bus goes to downtown, loop, Sears (Willis) tower and Millennium Park, and Western bus goes to different neighborhoods such as Bucktown and Wicker Park.  Blue line is about 8 minute walk, and also goes to downtown, loop and the airport.  Also if you get Uber and use UberPool, its only about $2.50-3$ to get around which is not that much different from public transportation prices ($2-$2.25).
access: You are able to use the kitchen and living room. Laundry room  is located through the back door and stairs on the first floor near the garage.
interaction: I am available to help most of the time and I tend to respond quickly if I am not in a mid flight.
house_rules: - Please do not wear shoes in the house. - Please do your own dishes. - Please lock the doors after getting in the house, and leaving the house. Locking only the bottom lock is fine.  - Please volunteer to take the trash out if its too full in the kitchen.  - Only booked guests are allowed on the property unless you’ve agreed with me otherwise. - Please keep your belongings in your room and not spread around  in the common areas. - Please if you are a smoker, find a container/jar for your cigarette butts and keep it outside where you routinely go smoke(front of the building or the back of the building). Please do not attempt to smoke from your bedroom window.  - Please respect another guests privacy.. (don't go knocking on their door) *Thanks for reading!
host_about:
I love to travel, so I am home very little. Hopefully it stays this way:)
I am originally from Lithuania, but moved to the states in 1998. I usually keep to myself and mind my own business in the apartment. 

Thanks for reading:)

neighborhood_overview: Everything you need is right outside your doorstep! Downtown Chicago is a city with an appetite—for food, of course, but also for design, history, and culture. Come here to marvel at the cutting-edge architecture or take in the gorgeous views of Lake Michigan; to spend a day cheering with baseball fans and a night laughing at a comedy show; to shop; to visit renowned institutions like the Field Museum, The Art Institute and the Adler Planetarium, and to experience the legendary blues scene. To do all this, you'll need nourishment: taste deep-dish pizza, piled-high hot dogs, Italian beef sandwiches, and more.

name: Private Bucktown Ranch Steps to Everything Chicago
summary: The Bucktown Ranch is back! Our amazing urban homestead is CENTRALLY LOCATED in the heart of BUCKTOWN. This newly renovated single family home is located on a quiet street, nestled in the bustle of one of Chicago’s hippest neighborhoods. A short walk to some of the hottest restaurants/bars, boutiques, & super close to the 606 trail & public transportation to literally anywhere in the City. This is definitely the house for you- business, family, couples- whatever your style, find your space here.
space: The private single family residence features 3 bedrooms and can comfortably sleep 6 in 2 queen beds and 2 twin beds. The front door opens up to the family and living area, equipped with ample seating, 55'' tv, and desk for the working traveller. The bathroom is tiled with style featuring a large shower and beautiful lighting and fixtures. The trendy modern kitchen provides all you need to be the chef and eat-in at the kitchen table set for 6. If grilling is more your style, step outside and fire up the barbie (summer months) while enjoying backyard games on the private grassy lawn. Other fantastic amenities include wifi, washer/dryer, dishwasher, towels, bed linens, blankets, necessary toiletries (shampoo, conditioner, soap, hair dryer), all provided for your convenience and comfort. Anything else you might need? Let us know!

neighborhood_overview: This home is set on a quiet street, nestled in the heart of one of Chicago’s hippest neighborhoods. Take an easy walk to trendy restaurants and bars, while boutiques, the 606 trail, and public transportation to anywhere in the city are also near.
notes: Our house is a single story home with all living spaces above grade. Guests will have to climb 6 steps from street level to access the first floor.  For security purposes there are 2 surveilance cameras located near the front and rear entry doors on the outside of the property.  There are no security cameras located inside of the house.  The laundry facilities are located in the basement below the living spaces.
transit: WALKING - Amazing restaurants, bars, & shops are within walking distance. PARKING - Street parking is easy and no permit required.  PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION (walking times) -  Damen Blue Line L stop - 11 minutes Western Blue Line L stop - 10 minutes Armitage #73 bus (this will take you to Lincoln Park & stops at the Chicago History Museum at North Ave & Clark) - 2 minutes Damen #50 bus - 4 minutes Clybourn Metra Station - 13 minutes
access: Our guests will have full access to the on-site washer and dryer located in the basement.  Additionally in the summer months (April 15-Sept 15), guests have access to the fenced private yard with gas grill & dining table with seating for 6.
interaction: I live nearby in Wicker Park with my wife and 3 little children. I’m usually available to accommodate any needs, or a quick text or call away if you have any questions or requests. I also know the neighborhood quite well and can help you feel like a local during your stay!
house_rules: 1. Please respect our house, treat it like your own, and leave it how you found it. 2.Upon arrival, inspect the premises and report any preexisting damages or issues. 3.Please respect our neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. 4.Parties and/or excessive noise are NOT allowed. 5.Additional overnight guests are NOT allowed without prior approval 6.Smoking is NOT permitted inside of the building 7.Pets are NOT allowed on the premises. 8.Check-out time is 11AM. 9.If you notice anything that presents a danger that can result in damage to the house or to any individual, let us know immediately. 10.Guests & visitors take full responsibility for any accidents, injuries, or illness that occur while on the premises.  By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises. Guests recognize that they may personally purchase insurance to protect themselves in such events.
host_about: I'm Mike & Chicago is my City.  I love it here and am always exploring new restaurants, bars, and neighborhood hang-outs.  When I'm not here, I love traveling the world with my 3 kids (ages 7,5,2).

name: Sunny,Comfortable,CleanTop Location at Lake,Beach
summary: Comfortable, large, sunny bedroom. Perfect for relaxation, work, study.  Many amenities: wifi, desk, tv, coffee maker, small refrigerator.  Private bathroom with shower/tub.  Friendly hosts will welcome you.  Fabulous location, fifteen minutes from downtown Chicago.  Within 1/2 block of public transportation, Lake Michigan, beach, park, tennis courts.   Six blocks to Loyola University.  3.5 miles to Northwestern U. Wonderful neighborhood, stores, restaurants, theaters, coffee shops, grocery.
space: Lovely 1903 Victorian home encourages relaxation. A beautiful park and Lake Michigan are steps from your room!  Lounge in the comfy chair in your sunny private room, work/study at your desk, read a book from extensive collection in the room , enjoy supplied playing cards, puzzles and board games.  Sleep well in queen bed and shut out sun for sleeping with black out curtains.  Plenty of space in dresser and large closet.
description: Comfortable, large, sunny bedroom. Perfect for relaxation, work, study.  Many amenities: wifi, desk, tv, coffee maker, small refrigerator.  Private bathroom with shower/tub.  Friendly hosts will welcome you.  Fabulous location, fifteen minutes from downtown Chicago.  Within 1/2 block of public transportation, Lake Michigan, beach, park, tennis courts.   Six blocks to Loyola University.  3.5 miles to Northwestern U. Wonderful neighborhood, stores, restaurants, theaters, coffee shops, grocery. Lovely 1903 Victorian home encourages relaxation. A beautiful park and Lake Michigan are steps from your room!  Lounge in the comfy chair in your sunny private room, work/study at your desk, read a book from extensive collection in the room , enjoy supplied playing cards, puzzles and board games.  Sleep well in queen bed and shut out sun for sleeping with black out curtains.  Plenty of space in dresser and large closet. You are welcome to share our living room along with your private room. We want
neighborhood_overview: Perfect Chicago location.   Enjoy strolling through our beautiful large park, using the tennis courts or exercise equipment,  picnicking at the beach and wading into Lake Michigan, all at end of our cul-de-sac.  In summer, enjoy swimming, fishing, kayaking. Take your own or rent divvy bikes in the neighborhood and leave from our home on the continuous bicycle path that hugs the lake and goes to downtown Chicago. Walk three blocks to the movie theater, the live theater and the jazz club.  Wide variety of ethnic food choices. Easily tour Chicago's many attractions and neighborhoods using convenient public transportation.  Wrigley Field and the Cubs are just a few train stops away. Downtown Evanston is 10 minutes away.    The CTA train station and bus stop are within two blocks. Walk six blocks to Loyola University.  Northwestern University is ten minutes away.
transit: Parking is included at our home with additional free street parking available. We are a fifteen minute drive from downtown along beautiful Lake Shore Drive.  The Red Line Train stop is two blocks from our home and leads downtown, going south, or to Evanston and Skokie heading north.   Transfers to other CTA train lines ensures the whole metropolitan area is accessible.  The CTA bus, too, gets you all over Chicago and can be boarded at the end of our block.  The Metra train, which leads throughout Illinois and into Wisconsin, is also within walking distance, less than a mile away.  Chicago is a bike friendly city.  Bike paths lead in every direction from the house.  It's a great way to explore Chicago.  You can bike, jog or stroll along Lake Michigan from our home to Downtown Chicago.
access: You are welcome to share our living room along with your private room.
interaction: We want you to feel at home and comfortable.  We look forward to getting to know you.  We're very happy to assist with any questions and planning while visiting and touring Chicago.  Both of us  work from home offices and will be easily available - while also respecting your privacy.
house_rules: Please observe quiet hours after 10 pm. Please remove muddy boots or shoes. No guests allowed who are not included in your reservation. Please keep outside doors closed and locked.  Use assigned parking space only (except, of course, if you use free parking on our street). Please maintain the room's cleanliness. Place unused food in your refrigerator and clean out prior to check out.  We require strict observation of our fireplace safety rules. Firearms may not be brought into our home.
host_about:
I am from Chicago and founder of Just Ventures, a consulting firm that provides strategic and technical assistance to social justice non-profit organizations.   I am also a lecturer and field coordinator for the University of Chicago, School of Social Service Administration and someone who loves hiking, animals of all kinds, photography, art, sports, meeting new people and hearing their stories.  My husband, Lewis Rice and partner in all things including our Airbnb hosting, is from Paul's Valley, Oklahoma and is an artist and interior house painter.  Our four grown children, their partners and our five grandchildren are a wonderful part of our lives .  We have hosted many exchange students and overseas volunteers through the years which has enriched our lives.   In that same spirit, we look forward to hosting and meeting you! 

 I listed Spanish as a language I speak- which is true and welcome guests who are Spanish language only.  However, I must also share that my Spanish is halting.  But, we can get by and we'd love to have Spanish language only guests among our guests.  We also travel yearly to China with the ExLAC  (Experience Liberal Arts Colleges) program where Jane teaches high school students "Cross Cultural Awareness" and Lewis teaches painting.  We have apps that help us communicate with Mandarin only speakers so we welcome Mandarin only speakers as well.

name: Modern studio in River North good for longer stays
description: We are available to assist you with absolutely anything you need through midnight, 7 days a week Cozy and modern apartment units situated along Chicago's River North District. A few minutes away from the Chicago Riverwalk, the Puerto Convention Center and the Shedd Aquarium, along with hundreds of art galleries and local museums. The brown and the purple lines are the main mode of transportation in the city. Amenities include a 24Hr fitness center, a business center with wifi hot spots, hospitable accommodation and a rooftop swimming pool. All units include a modern kitchen, floor to ceiling windows, in-unit washer/dryers and flat screen TV's. Free fast wifi, kitchen/cookware and bathroom amenities are also provided. For any concerns, our amazing customer support team is available to assist. We offer rewards and complimentary upgrades to our regular repeat guests

neighborhood_overview: Pilsen is situated on Chicago's lower west side and is full of culture and entertainment! There are many family-owned restaurants and businesses but the area is ever evolving and now you can find now find numerous boutiques, hip bars, cafes and vintage shops!  The food scene is not to be missed! Some of the best Mexican restaurants in the city can be found in here. There are also some newer establishments that are must eats, such as Dusek's.  Culturally, there are numerous art museums and Thalia Hall, the area's landmark music venue hosts concerts by well known musical-acts.
notes: Check In & Check Out  Check in starts at 4 PM  Check out time is 11 AM We do not offer early Check In or late Check Out.  Luggage Hold If your travel arrangements have you arriving earlier or leaving later than our designated check in / check out times, we recommend using Wait Here Chicago. We have a partnership with them and can offer you discounted rates on their luggage hold options throughout the city. Pets There is a $25/pet per booking fee.  We know that all dogs are good dogs but the building's breed restrictions are listed below. There are no weight restrictions, but if your buddy falls under one of these categories unfortunately we wouldn't be able to host them: Pit Bull, American Pit Bull Terrier, American Staffordshire Terrier, Shaffordshire Bull Terrier, Rottweiler, Doberman Pinscher, Chow Chow, Akita, Presa Canario and /or Wolf Hybrids. While we trust that your pet plays well with others, we know that accidents happen. In the event of an issue involving your pet, you will
transit: Whether you got a set a wheels or you're using public transportation, the neighborhood works for any transportation needs. There is easily accessible "Pay to Park" street parking. We also recommend using SpotHero to find affordable parking near the home. Additionally, there is public transportation! Just a 15 minute walk from the pink line for getting in and out of the loop/downtown. There are also buses nearby as well. We also recommend using Uber / Lyft for extra easy access to Chicago's hot spots.
access: The entire home is yours to enjoy for the duration of your stay. You will also have access to all of the building's beautiful and unique amenities. All of which include a gorgeous gym and beautiful outdoor area.
interaction: We are off-site but available when needed. The best way to reach us is by emailing (Email hidden by Airbnb)  In case of maintenance emergency, the in-unit home guide will detail phone numbers of who to call immediately.
house_rules: General Rules -Please treat the home as if it is your own. -Please respect our guest limit capacity of 10 people. -Do not engage in illegal activities anywhere on the property. -If you accidentally damage anything during your stay, please contact the host for your safety and the future safety of the next guest. -We pride ourselves on being green and would appreciate you turning off the TV and lights when you check-out. -Please remember to sign out of any ROKU apps you utilized via your personal accounts before departing. Quiet Hours Quiet hours are between 10p-8a. This is a residential building and ask that for the respect of permanent tenants basic courtesies of being mindful of your noise levels and not congregating in hallways outside of the unit be observed. Please be advised that this home is equipped with NoiseAware. NoiseAware works like a smoke detector, but for noise. The sensor tracks the decibel levels in this home, evaluates other risk factors and will send an alert if ther
host_about: Hello! Thanks for checking out our homes in beautiful Chicago! Livly Short Stay has a few hosts that will be communicating with you and we can’t wait to get to know you and welcome you to the city. Hosting as a team makes communicating with us even faster and we're looking forward to taking care of curating a perfect stay for you. Talk to you soon!

name: Quaint River North 1BR w/ Gym + W/D near Mag Mile by Blueground
summary: Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this stylish River North furnished one-bedroom apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and lovely living room with great high floor views. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Chicago has to offer! (#CHI86)
space: Thoughtfully designed with bespoke finishes, modern furnishings, and a fully-equipped kitchen, you’ll enjoy that “I’m home” feeling with this Blueground apartment. Whether you’re lounging in your spacious living room streaming the latest and greatest entertainment on the smart TV or premium wireless speaker, or getting some well-earned rest on the superior quality mattress with luxury linens, you’ll fall in love with everything this River North apartment has to offer.  This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry. Amenities Building amenities unique to this one-bedroom apartment include an on-site:    - Doorman - Swimming Pool - Gym - Indoor Parking - Bike Storage - Elevator

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in River North, Chicago’s most trendy neighborhood. The bridges combined with the riverwalk offer incredible views. Nearby on Michigan Avenue is the city’s premier shopping area. One of the neighborhood’s biggest assets is the walk-to-work appeal. Young professionals, who live and work in the area, can quickly get to the office in the morning and just as easily enjoy an after-work drink, as the area is considered a premier entertainment center. Don’t miss a stroll on Kinzie and Hubbard streets. Merchandise Mart, the iconic building with showrooms, shops, and office space, is only a 5 minute walk. The Loop is just across the bridge and is about 5 minute walk.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property - Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a $275 monthly fee. Parking offered may be on or off-site, and may be covered or open. Spaces are designed for compact vehicles. Please provide us with your car details min. 1 business day in advance to avoid the chance of erroneous towing - Blueground has the right to enter and inspect the apartment or to show the apartment to a potential tenant any day of the week between 9am and 6pm as long as the tenant has been informed via email at least one day in advance - Please contact us for details
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

name: 3 Bedroom Charming Vintage Hideaway
summary: Our space honors the original Vintage charm of the historic landmark neighborhood of Little Italy. The light filled space has 3 bedrooms and can sleep up to 6 guests. With close proximity to downtown(10 min) as well as the West Loop/ Fulton Market(10min) one of the fastest growing restaurant corridors in Chicago, boasting the newest and hottest bars and restaurants in the city. This quiet neighborhood is perfect for restful nights but close enough to all the busyness the city has to offer.
space: Hello and welcome to our listing! We hope you stay with us!  We were recently awarded ********Airbnb20x SUPER HOSTS********* We strive to take the best care of our guests!  -Our Place- 3 bedroom, 1 bath private apartment, which is the entire 2nd floor of our two-flat.  The apartment comfortably sleeps six, with two queen beds and two twin beds, but there is only one bathroom.  The kitchen is stocked with cooking essentials, and there is also a washer/dryer in the unit.  We have central heat and A/C. Wireless internet is included. Built in 1880, the original Italian charm is seen in the beautiful arch separating the living and dining rooms.  The original tin ceiling in the kitchen is another feature that makes this space so unique.   -The Neighborhood- We are located in the quieter side of Little Italy, within the Illinois Medical District.  It is a small residential neighborhood. Listed in the National Register of Historical Places, our area is home to many Italianate style homes, row-
