The apartment comfortably sleeps six, with two queen beds and two twin beds, but there is only one bathroom.  The kitchen is stocked with cooking essentials, and there is also a washer/dryer in the unit.  We have central heat and A/C.
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is in a quiet, residential area.  There are a few fast food type places to eat, some small restaurants, but not any bars or nightlife within walking distance.  Located within the Illinois Medical District, there are multiple hospitals (UIC, Rush, Cook County, VA) nearby, and lots of medical buildings in the area.  Getting around the city is fairly easy as we are close to downtown by public transit or car.
notes: Parking permits will be provided for one car.  There are other parking options a block away if you have more than one car. Please use the parking permits as instructed.  Park at your own risk, we are not responsible for any parking violations.
transit: Street parking is available, there are usually spots in front of the apartment or very close by.  Driving to downtown is only 10 minutes.  Since parking can be expensive downtown we like to take an Uber or Lyft (taxi alternatives) to get around.  If taking the bus, the #157 is good for the weekdays as it does not run on the weekends, but goes through many downtown areas.  The blue line train is a 10 minute walk from the apartment, and is a 15 minute ride to downtown.
access: The entire second floor apartment along with the back deck is yours to enjoy.
interaction: We are always available through message, text, call, or in person to answer any questions or to offer advise to help guests enjoy their stay.  Even small questions are important to us, we like to help!
house_rules: The property shall not be used by more than the number of adults and children listed in your reservation, please list the correct number of guests when making the reservation, children over the age of 2 are considered guests.  We do not allow our guests to have guests unless agreed upon prior to check-in. We do not allow parties or special events at the apartment. All guests shall abide by local/federal laws and not engage in illegal activity. The responsible renter must be at least 21 years of age. Guests under 21 years of age are welcome, but must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian.  No smoking is permitted anywhere on the premises, including the back deck.  Please enjoy the deck, but respect the neighbors and limit the noise after 10 pm.  Renter is liable for any damage to the property should damage occur during occupancy.
host_about: We have lived in the Chicago area our whole lives.  We are a family of 4, with two young boys.  We love to travel, our favorite places are the Hawaiian Island of Kauai and the Riviera Maya region of Mexico. We enjoy good food; we love to barbeque and picnic.

name: Amazing Lincoln Park Rowhouse!!
summary: Our home was built in 1891 and underwent a full renovation in 2014 to both modernize and maintain the elaborate construction features of this Victorian era McCormick Rowhouse.  Our home is located in the heart of Lincoln Park.  1 Block from the CTA Fullerton Stop and Whole Foods.  Within walking distance and/or 5 min train ride to Wrigley Field and within 15 mins from Downtown.
space: Our home was built in 1891 and underwent a full renovation in 2014 to both modernize and maintain the elaborate construction features of this Victorian era McCormick Rowhouse.  Anyone traveling to Chicago with family for a wedding at DePaul Catholic church or a DePaul University function will greatly add to their trip by staying at our on campus home that sleeps eight (plus nursery).  The Fullerton CTA stop is a short walk away and opens up the City for easy car free access.  Wrigley Field is a short trip on the CTA redline and is only two stops away; alternatively taking the Red Line south can get you to Cellular Field for the White Sox or thousands of other options in the City.  Located in the heart of Lincoln Park this location has many dining and entertainment options within walking distance and there is easy street parking and access to the DePaul parking garages.  A Whole Foods Grocery is located a block away.

name: #2 The King of Clubs Master Elegance Room
summary: The Greenleaf House, built in 1915, is our 3600ft² home with 6 bedrooms, 2.5 baths, & an open floor plan—perfect for gatherings of any kind. We're in the heart of the Rogers Park neighborhood, walking distance from many restaurants & 1 block from Loyola Beach Park. Breakfast is self-serve & included in the cost of the room. In the kitchen you will find bagels, cream cheese, eggs, yogurt, cereal & fresh fruit. The home is run by friendly local folks who are happy to help during your stay.
space: This private room is the most spacious in the house. It has a comfortable king sized bed, is attached to a semi-private bathroom (door through closet), and has a 60” flatscreen television equipped with Netflix. It has three large windows that overlook the street, an Amazon Alexa Plus with great sound quality, as well as a closet and dresser for storing items during your stay. Room accommodates 3 because there is pull out mattress (twin size) under the king bed.  Also available in the Greenleaf House are rooms with king, queen, or single sized beds. There are two rooms with loft beds, which are suitable for adults or perfect for children. All rooms are private, have their own closet and dresser, and are equipped with front-door-style locks, for which you will be provided a key. Whole house rentals are also available. Here are links to all our listings:  https://www.airbnb.com/users/5468317/listings

neighborhood_overview: The Greenleaf House has become a hub in the Glenwood Avenue Art District of Roger’s Park, where all flavors of creative artists have lived and collaborated for several decades. The Mile of Murals—a community-based public art initiative—begins half a block from our front door. Within easy walking distance you will find a bustling nightlife, small theaters and music venues, several locally-owned eateries, and Loyola Park, which has a great playground and arguably the best sand beach in the city. Here are a few links about our neighborhood:  (Website hidden by Airbnb)   (Website hidden by Airbnb)   (Website hidden by Airbnb)
notes: Checking out: Check-out time is 12pm noon. Please leave your keys in the door.  Checking Out late: You may checkout late till 3pm, but must be out of your room by 12pm. Feel free to hang out on the first floor, or stow your luggage and explore. If you would like to stay later than 3pm, we are happy to accommodate you so long as it doesn’t interfere with a house rental or special event.  Luggage Storage: There is a storage space in the TV room. It is first come, first serve and has a lock and key. If the key is in the lock, it is free to use. Please use only if your room is unavailable. Laundry: Feel free to use the laundry any time except 12pm - 3pm. That is when we wash sheets and towels used by our guests. Detergent and dryer sheets are provided.  Security cameras: For your safety, there are security cameras inside the common areas and outside the property. We don’t actively monitor them unless something happens. Please do not tamper with the security cameras.  Shared Space: The firs
transit: The Greenleaf House is conveniently located near two major public trains—we are one block from the El (CTA Red Line at Morse Avenue) and three blocks (5-8 minute walk) from the Roger’s Park Metra Station. There are several bus stops within walking distance, including express buses to downtown. It is also never difficult to hail a cab, and Uber/Lyft rides generally arrive in 1-5 minutes after placing a request. For your convenience, we have included links to public transit information below.  CTA Morse Red Line Station:  (Website hidden by Airbnb)  Metra Rogers Park Station:  (Website hidden by Airbnb)
access: The entire first floor is shared space (all the bedrooms are upstairs). You will have access to: a modern kitchen stocked with complimentary breakfast items; a sound insulated theater equipped with Netflix, Showtime and an Xbox; a spacious living room with comfortable seating, a record player and a fine selection of vinyl; a dining room that seats 12-16 people; washer and dryer with free detergent/dryer sheets, and a picnic table and firepit in our big backyard which is fenced-in and dog-friendly.
interaction: There are often guests socializing with other guests or the staff in the communal areas on the first floor. Many guests enjoy using the living or dining rooms as a pseudo-cafe where they can drink coffee or tea and work on their laptops. We encourage our guests to interact and use the shared spaces as they would their own homes. However, no one will shame you for hanging out in your room. We want everyone to feel safe and comfortable.
house_rules: - Quiet Hours 11pm-7am
host_about: I am a frequent traveller and an Air B&B host. I love to meet other global citizens.

space: One of the few Three - story townhouses in the desirable Logan Square neighborhood. The other two bedrooms each both have a queen bed. There are two full baths and one half bath. There is free laundry in the townhouse.

host_about:
Hi, we're Bob and Liz Biddle, long time Chicagoans and your hosts. We started At Home Inn Chicago in 2000 as a reservation service for bed and breakfasts in Chicago, and have since evolved into one of the city's most-respected sources for vacation rentals, corporate housing, and weekend getaways. 

We provide fully furnished vacation rentals and corporate housing throughout the city in or near Old Town and Lincoln Park.

We are here to answer all of your questions about Chicago, whether you need a restaurant recommendation, public transit tips, or insider tips on how to experience the Chicago that locals know and love. 

We love this city, especially getting ribs at Twin Anchors in Old Town before a show at Second City.  Topo Gigio is a great local Italian Restaurant and The Gemini Bistro is an excellent choice for fine dining. And Velvet Taco, casual with its own unique style on Lincoln is fabulous!

The free concerts at Pritzker Pavilion in Millenium Park can't be matched by any city in the world. 

We'd love to help you experience all of this with us and so much more!

name: Private room in Art Gallery ((:
summary: This is a beautiful private room  located within a working arts collective in the heart of Wicker Park, we offer a thriving, supportive community right outside your door!
description: This is a beautiful private room  located within a working arts collective in the heart of Wicker Park, we offer a thriving, supportive community right outside your door!
host_about:
Hello! My name is William.

I am a self-employed artist living & directing a gallery in Wicker Park. Last year I completed a Masters degree in Fine Arts at the School Of The Art Institute of Chicago where I studied Video, Performance, Photography and Film.

Important things to me are dream recording, writing, correspondence art, experimental film, movement practices, reading & traveling. I try to travel as often as possible, even if it's just a driving trip of two hours to camp somewhere for a night or two.

I want to provide an environment for artists & other creative, passionate individuals to have a voice & present their work. Sharing stories, ideas, experiences & realities are what we're in it for. We at the gallery are holding the torch in the neighborhood to provide a space for what might be unsayable elsewhere. We are daily developing our intentional space here to create an inspiring atmosphere for all who step foot inside, whether it's for a project proposal or a short visit. It's an older building, lovingly-worn, rooms with character surrounding an open gallery space.

As an airbnb guest, you can expect that we'll be curious about you. Our roommates & us all get along really well: It is an easy going dynamic here at the house. We are an eclectic variety!

Looking forward to meeting you)

name: Lyra Spark - Chic Wicker Park Studio by Short Stay
summary: Welcome to LYRA SPARK, your home away from home! Tons of living space, private balcony, in-unit w/d, glazed concrete floors, rooftop deck and grilling area, and a view over one of the hottest neighborhoods in town. Full of eclectic art, famous music joints, live theatre, and dining, Wicker Park is the epitome of the Chicago neighborhood experience. The entire home is yours to enjoy for your next weekend getaway with friends, business trip, special occasion, or "just because" visit to the city!
space: Sleeping Arrangements Studio with one queen bed and one pull out sleeper sofa (queen). Kitchen   The kitchen is fully equipped with pots, pants, utensils, silverware, plates, bowls, cups, knives, a cutting board, salt and pepper, a coffee maker, and cream and sugar – for however you take it.     Cleaning Supplies   You’re supplied with dish soap, a sponge, dish detergent and paper towels. Washer/Dryer  There is a washer/dryer in unit. We provide you with detergent for your stay! TV The Roku guide is posted next to the TV. There is also a digital antenna for local channels. Please remember to sign out of any of any Roku apps you’ve utilize duringyour stay.  Non-Smoking  The home and entire building is designated as a smoke-free community. There will be a $500 fee imposed if you choose to smoke in unit or the building. Please respect our policy and step outside. Deck Enjoy access to the spacious roof-top lounge & deck complete with seating area, grills, and views of the skyline! Parking
description: Welcome to LYRA SPARK, your home away from home! Tons of living space, private balcony, in-unit w/d, glazed concrete floors, rooftop deck and grilling area, and a view over one of the hottest neighborhoods in town. Full of eclectic art, famous music joints, live theatre, and dining, Wicker Park is the epitome of the Chicago neighborhood experience. The entire home is yours to enjoy for your next weekend getaway with friends, business trip, special occasion, or "just because" visit to the city! Sleeping Arrangements Studio with one queen bed and one pull out sleeper sofa (queen). Kitchen   The kitchen is fully equipped with pots, pants, utensils, silverware, plates, bowls, cups, knives, a cutting board, salt and pepper, a coffee maker, and cream and sugar – for however you take it.     Cleaning Supplies   You’re supplied with dish soap, a sponge, dish detergent and paper towels. Washer/Dryer  There is a washer/dryer in unit. We provide you with detergent for your stay! TV The Roku guide
neighborhood_overview: A not-so-hidden gem just outside of the downtown area, Wicker Park is a neighborhood famous for live music, nightlife, countless art galleries (check out the Flat Iron Arts Building!), and unique shopping experiences.  If you're a fan of craft cocktails or a coffee connoisseur, this is definitely the place to be. For an unforgettable speak-easy experience, check out The Violet Hour, or hang out at the renowned brewery, Piece. You'll never be bored with the Emporium Arcade Bar just down the street, or hop over to The Den for several choices of live theatre happening all weekend long.  Enjoy alfresco dining at one of the most unique taco joints in the city, Big Star (with people watching galore) or take a walk along the elevated green space which use to be a train line, the 606.  There's so much to explore in this neighborhood–we hope you'll come and see for yourself!
notes: Check In / Check Out Check in starts at 4 PM CT Check out time is 11 AM CT We do not offer early Check In or late Check Out.  Luggage Hold  If your travel arrangements have you arriving earlier or leaving later than our designated check in / check out times, we recommend using Wait Here Chicago. We have a partnership with them and can offer you discounted rates on their luggage hold options throughout the city.
transit: This neighborhood has one of the highest walking-scores in the city. Tons to do and see right outside the door and stretching several city blocks in both directions.  If you do choose to have a car, there is paid street parking during the day and free between the hours of 10p-7a. We suggest downloading the app SpotHero to find discounted spots in the area.  The home is less than a block away from the Division street CTA blue line which will bring you straight into downtown where you can hop off an do some exploring or transfer to another train line at other clearly marked stops along the way.
access: You will have full access to all of the home and the shared roof deck!
interaction: We are off-site but available when needed. The best way to reach us is by emailing (Email hidden by Airbnb)  In case of maintenance emergency, the in-unit home guide will detail phone numbers of who to call immediately.
house_rules: General Rules -Please treat the home as if it is your own. -Please respect our guest limit capacity of 4 people. -Do not engage in illegal activities anywhere on the property. -If you accidentally damage anything during your stay, please contact the host for your safety and the future safety of the next guest. -We pride ourselves on being green and would appreciate you turning off the TV and lights when you check-out. -Please remember to sign out of any ROKU apps you utilized via your personal accounts before departing. Quiet Hours Quiet hours are between 10p-8a. This is a residential building and ask that for the respect of permanent tenants basic courtesies of being mindful of your noise levels and not congregating in hallways outside of the unit be observed. Receiving a noise complaint from the building or the device can result in the forfeiture of your stay and a $1000 fine.  No Smoking The home (and entire building including outdoor common areas) is designated as a strictly smoke-
host_about: Hello! Thanks for checking out our homes in beautiful Chicago! Livly Short Stay has a few hosts that will be communicating with you and we can’t wait to get to know you and welcome you to the city. Hosting as a team makes communicating with us even faster and we're looking forward to taking care of curating a perfect stay for you. Talk to you soon!

name: Bridgeport Beauty
summary: Bridgeport is a unique & safe Chicago neighborhood, and this cute apartment offers great access to the neighborhood. A great place for a couple's get away with their pet, a sanctuary for post-work focus, or a crash pad for after the game or conference (close to Sox Park and McCormick Place). Perfect for Restaurant Show attendees, Sox fans, Riotfest goers, and more.
space: This is a 5-room garden "mother-in-law" apartment that we recently converted to a neat, comfy space for your get away. The five rooms include: - A main bedroom has a queen sized Tempurpedic mattress and an open closet. - A second private room can be used as a second bedroom or office and includes a desk and a convertible sofa.  - A living room/common area with a sofa that becomes a queen sized bed and a flat screen TV with Apple TV (Netflix) and Bose sound system. - A kitchen that is fully equipped for your cooking needs, whether that's just brewing coffee (coffee included!) & toasting bread or preparing a whole meal with a gas stove, fridge, and tons of cooking supplies. There is a dining table in the kitchen with seating for 4.   - A cute tiled bathroom with shampoo, conditioner, and body wash. The owners are chefs who own a catering company and live in the unit upstairs, so if you need anything from the farmer's market, to restaurant recommendations, to a mandolin or a terrine pan,

summary: Charming spacious 3rd Floor apartment with 2 bedrooms.  Gets plenty of sunlight and in a great location! It comfortably fits 4 and is in walking distance to the heart of trendy Bucktown/Wicker Park, Blue Line L and North Ave bus.
space: I LOVE my apartment! It is spacious, yet homey. I don't smoke and have no pets, so keep it very clean. This 3rd floor apartment also captures plenty of sunlight throughout the day. Both bedrooms have a queen bed. If needed, a 5th guest can sleep on the couch.
description: Charming spacious 3rd Floor apartment with 2 bedrooms.  Gets plenty of sunlight and in a great location! It comfortably fits 4 and is in walking distance to the heart of trendy Bucktown/Wicker Park, Blue Line L and North Ave bus. I LOVE my apartment! It is spacious, yet homey. I don't smoke and have no pets, so keep it very clean. This 3rd floor apartment also captures plenty of sunlight throughout the day. Both bedrooms have a queen bed. If needed, a 5th guest can sleep on the couch. You will have access to the entire 2 bedroom apartment. Cable tv and wireless internet is included. Bathroom will be stocked with towels, toliet paper, shampoo and a hair dryer. Kitchen includes a microwave, stove, oven and dishwasher. Full kitchen cookware, utensils & dishwashing liquid are provided. Awesome location! Close to the heart of Wicker Park/Bucktown (10-15 min walk), but far enough to get a good nights rest/enjoy privacy. I walk everywhere :) Then jump on the L or bus if exploring other areas

Less then a block to North Ave bus (straight 4 mile bus ride to North Ave beach/lake!) Free street parking, I always find a spot within a 2 block radius. Close to Interstate 94/90.

APARTMENT This is a PRIVATE ROOM rental in a professionally-run airbnb apartment on the 2nd floor of a 3 story building. Each space is fully dedicated to our guests. Our cleaning team will have everything ready to go for you, and we provide lots of amenities to make your stay comfortable. Please see below for more info! neighborhood_overview: The Lakeview neighborhood and Wrigleyville / Boystown areas have so much within walking distance, you won't want to leave! There are numerous bakeries, boutique stores, theaters, and lively bars and restaurants. If you do feel like venturing out of the neighborhood, Lakeview is very centrally located. Head south to visit Lincoln Park, River North, and the Loop, or west to visit Buck Town or Logan square. Both public transit and Uber/Lyft are great ways to get around.
notes: GUESTS Only those on the reservation are permitted in the unit/room. BEDROOM LOCKS All 3 bedrooms may be locked from the inside but do not have keys to be locked from the outside. We do provide combination locks for your bedroom closet and you'll be given the code at check-in to securely store your belongings. COURTESY  Please note this unit is on a quiet residential street. We respect our neighbors, and for that reason the building's outdoor space is not for socializing, and instead we request guests socialize indoors only. We request quiet hours from 9pm-8am. CLEANING  We expect guests to clean up after themselves in shared spaces. For example, throw away any trash, rinse coffee maker after use, wipe down bathroom sink/kitchen counter after use, etc. We also request that personal bathroom items are kept in your bedroom when not in use. This keeps the shared spaces clean for all guests.
transit: PARKING Free, public street parking is available in the area. Some streets require a permit, and others do not. We offer permits at the unit for a small fee. Please note you may have to circle the block a few times to find a spot. If you prefer paid parking with a designated spot, I recommend using Spot-Hero to find nearby options that work for you. Once you're here, public transportation and/or Uber are the easiest ways to get around the city. CLOSEST STOPS o Addison red train: .3 mi, trains go uptown/downtown o Belmont purple/brown train stop: .6 mi, trains go uptown/downtown o 77, 8, 36 bus and more to go up/downtown or east/west Stations all have machines that sell Ventra passes (name of provider). You can also purchase Ventra cards at Walgreens. You can either purchase a single ride ticket, a re-loadable Ventra card, or an unlimited pass (1, 3, or 7 days). Multiple people may share a re-loadable card and fares will be deducted for each person; however, the unlimited passes can not
access: In addition to your PRIVATE ROOM, you have use of the kitchen, living room, dining room, bathroom, and building's basement laundry room (all SHARED spaces). KEYS  There is self-entry with key pad anytime from 4pm on.  A set of keys will be in your room. CENTRAL HEAT/AC The unit has central heat/AC with a thermostat within the unit. The temperature is kept between 65-70 degrees for the comfort of all guests. (Website hidden by Airbnb) LAUNDRY The building has a washer and dryer in the basement that's shared by all apartments. Each costs $1.50 and accepts quarters. PUBLIC TRANSIT The closet train stop is the Addison red line. There are also many bus stops. We provide additional info about public transit upon booking. PARKING Free, public street parking is available in the area. Some streets require a permit, and others do not. We offer permits at the unit for a small fee. Please note you may have to circle the block a few times to find a spot. If you prefer paid parking with a designated
interaction: My goal is to ensure you have the most enjoyable and comfortable stay in Chicago. I have a detailed guest guidebook (emailed in advance and printed in unit) that includes info about the apt, neighborhood, and city to help maximize your time in the city. If you'd like additional assistance with anything, I'm more than happy to help! Depending on my work travel schedule, I may or may not be in town; however, I'm always accessible via phone or email for any questions that arise.
house_rules: - - REQUESTS:  1) Please treat the home with respect.   2) Please be courteous of others in building and neighbors. All socializing must be kept indoors after 9pm, and we request quiet time indoors from 9pm-8am.   3) The only guests allowed in the building are those on the reservation.   4) Personal bathroom items must be kept in your room. If you use common spaces, we request you tidy up after yourself to keep the spaces clean for everyone (for example, kitchen items in dishwasher, wipe counters, throw out trash, etc).   CHECK IN/OUT: Standard check-in time is 4pm (or later). Standard check-out time is by 10am. If unit is not vacated by check-out time or notes are not followed, additional cleaning charges may apply.   For check out, I ask that you:  - turn off lights in your room/common spaces  - ensure your used kitchen items are in dishwasher - dispose of any of your food/drink from fridge and any of your trash from room/common spaces. If it's more than what fits in the trash can, p
host_about:
I began using Airbnb as a traveler in the fall of 2013, and I'm hooked! Staying in someone's home allows you to experience the area in a truly authentic way - no more hotels for me! As of May 2014, I began hosting in Chicago and have since hosted thousands of guests from around the world. I love helping others make the most of their visits. 

As a host, I am personable, responsive, and detail-oriented. I take great pride in the comfort and cleanliness of each apartment. You can trust that when staying in any one of our properties, you will feel at home.

summary: Discover the best of Chicago, with this one-bedroom River North apartment with balcony views over the city. It’ll be easy to simply show up and start living in this beautifully Blueground furnished apartment with its fully-equipped kitchen, cozy living room, and our dedicated, on-the-ground support. neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in River North, Chicago’s most trendy neighborhood. The bridges combined with the riverwalk offer incredible views. Nearby on Michigan Avenue is the city’s premier shopping area. One of the neighborhood’s biggest assets is the walk-to-work appeal. Young professionals, who live and work in the area, can quickly get to the office in the morning and just as easily enjoy an after-work drink, as the area is considered a premier entertainment center. Don’t miss a stroll on Kinzie and Hubbard streets. Merchandise Mart, the iconic building with showrooms, shops, and office space, is only a 5 minute walk. The Loop is just across the bridge and is about 5 minute walk.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions (including certain Bull Terriers and any related breeds). Wild animals and hybrids, including wolf and coyote hybrids, snakes, ferrets, rabbits, are all prohibited. Please contact us for precise breed restrictions. Please note that a one-off non refundable fee ($500) and a monthly rent ($25/mo/pet) is applicable upon reservation. Failing to notify us of any pets prior to check-in will incur a penalty, and may result in denied check-in. Supporting documents (ie. vaccinations) may be required - Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a $275 monthly fe
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

neighborhood_overview: It's an up and coming neighborhood that is in close proximity to downtown, yet not very crowded.  Very strategic location so close to downtown and the major highways! We are not as lively as West Loop (i.e. not very many restaurants within walking distance), however the United Center and the west loop neighborhood is very close and accessible. You'll find all the hip, trendy shops, cafes and restaurants in West Loop!
notes: There is a security alarm for the entire unit for added peace while staying in the property. We advise to use the alarm system when leaving or staying in the unit.  There is cable TV, it is a SMART TV so you can access your NetFLix, Amazon, HULU, etc. Parking space included.
transit: Bus Stop is steps away from the unit.  Blue line is about 10 min walk.  Uber or Lyft rides are $8-10 to downtown.  Walking distance to United Center.
access: We provide lock box  for easy key access for gate.  Main doors are keyless. All entry doors are smart locks. We will provide detailed instructions and  codes a day before arrival.
interaction: We are accessible by AirBNB messaging, email, text or phone.
house_rules: •	No illegal activity •	No smoking inside the house. There will be $300 fine breaking this rule. •	We love pets, however no pets are allowed. There will be $300 fine breaking this rule. •	CHECK IN is any time after 3 pm. CHECK OUT is any time before 12 noon. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout, but this is not guaranteed and we can only confirm 24 hours in advance. •	No guest allowed more than the maximum capacity of (8). •	No parties or excessive noise allowed.  Please respect our neighbors by observing sleeping hours. No overnight guests who are not part of the advanced, Airbnb reservation without permission from us, please. •	Please leave no damage to the whole unit being occupied.  •	Guests take full responsibility for any accidents, injuries, or illnesses that occur while on the premises.  By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises.
host_about: Avid traveler, food lover Chicagoan! Happy to connect with the broader traveler communities.

name: Calming Edgewater Glen Sanctuary
summary: This cozy 2 bedroom apartment is bathed with bright warm light in every room. It feels like your own private sanctuary. A true getaway! The location is great. Lake Michigan is only about ten minutes by bike or five minutes by car. Loyola university is just up the street. The red line train is only about six blocks walking distance. Andersonville, which is a great little neighborhood with restaurants, coffee shops and boutiques is just a few minutes drive away. Free street parking available.
space: We have a Koi pond and meditation bench in front of our building, which happens to be a unique gem in a bustling city. A place to pause and take a moment. We also have a trampoline in the back yard if you want to shift gears to get some exercise. There is a convertible table for four with four chairs for eating or working.

Traveling is one of my favorite ways to find inspiration in work and life. Anything that involves nature and being outdoors makes me happy. I love tennis, yoga, cycling, hiking and swimming.

name: Private Space in Center of Boystown
summary: 2 Bedroom (Queen Beds), 2 Bath, Kitchen and Back Patio in the dynamic artery of East Lakeview/Boystown neighborhood. Just 4-5 blocks from all Halsted/Broadway bars/clubs, Belmont Red Line Station and Lake Michigan. Endless food and entertainment options.
space: Living Room is open and very spacious. Kitchen is open into the living room. There are dining areas both in the dining section of the living room as well as a brunch high-top table at the turret with great views onto the bubbling street scene below.
description: 2 Bedroom (Queen Beds), 2 Bath, Kitchen and Back Patio in the dynamic artery of East Lakeview/Boystown neighborhood. Just 4-5 blocks from all Halsted/Broadway bars/clubs, Belmont Red Line Station and Lake Michigan. Endless food and entertainment options. Living Room is open and very spacious. Kitchen is open into the living room. There are dining areas both in the dining section of the living room as well as a brunch high-top table at the turret with great views onto the bubbling street scene below. Access is controlled from within. Separate keys are needed both to get into the building and to get into the apartment. We live in the thriving, nervous center of Boystown. You'll find a dozen restaurants within a block either way on Broadway (many quick eats) but also great dine-in options like Wilde (American), Ping Pong (Upscale Chinese), Maison Marcel (French), and Eggsperience (Breakfast/Brunch) Just 4 blocks over on Halsted St. are all the entertainment options including countless bar
neighborhood_overview: We live in the thriving, nervous center of Boystown. You'll find a dozen restaurants within a block either way on Broadway (many quick eats) but also great dine-in options like Wilde (American), Ping Pong (Upscale Chinese), Maison Marcel (French), and Eggsperience (Breakfast/Brunch) Just 4 blocks over on Halsted St. are all the entertainment options including countless bars, clubs, stores and restaurants. Just under a 15 minute walk to Wrigley Field and Wrigleyville.
transit: Our corner (literally right outside the door) has stops for: 77 Bus (East to the Lake, West towards the Belmont El Stop) 36 Bus (North towards Andersonville, South towards the Loop) Just 4 blocks west is the CTA Red, Brown and Purple Lines that can take you down into the Loop (12-15 min) or anywhere else in the city.  If you're driving, there is a daily parking facility right down the block (to the South - look for the giant yellow "PARK" sign). Easy Access to and from Airports O'Hare (ORD): Blue Line to Belmont (Blue) Station. Pick up 77 Bus (East towards Lakeshore). Exit at Belmont and Broadway. 45min-1hr. total commute time. Midway (MDW): Orange Line to Roosevelt Station. Transfer to Red Line train towards Howard. Exit Red Line train at Belmont Station. Use 77 East Bus or walk 4 blocks to Belmont and Broadway.  50-70 minutes total commute time.
access: Access is controlled from within. Separate keys are needed both to get into the building and to get into the apartment.
house_rules: No smoking inside and no pets, please.  Feel free to use the in-unit washer and dryer (located in the back bedroom), but please be respectful of all existing property.  Kitchen is available for use as well if you feel like making something to eat for yourself.  We expect that all the guests staying at our property will be named on the reservation.
host_about: Two mid-30s professionals living in the heart of Boystown, Lakeview, Chicago.

name: Beautiful 7Br Custom Built Single-Family Home
summary: Sun-filled, 7 bed/4.5 bath custom built single-family home in the heart of Chicago’s Bridgeport neighborhood. Designed with large groups in mind, the house is ready to accommodate up to 16 guests and offers 2 kitchens, a game room, as well as multiple living rooms and dining areas. Close to McCormick Place (10 min drive), Guaranteed Rate Field (7 min drive), and Halstead Orange Line Stop (2 min drive). Approximately 20 minute drive to/from Midway Airport. Free street parking is available.
space: All three upstairs bedrooms have en-suite bathrooms. Both the main floor and lower level have full kitchens with stove top ranges, ovens, and full-size refrigerators. The master suite has a steam shower and sunken soaking tub. The basement-level game room includes a pool-table, foosball table, dart board, air hockey table, and plenty of fun board games.

summary: Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this cozy West Loop furnished two-bedroom apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and exquisite living room with great  views. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Chicago has to offer! (#CHI235)
space: Gorgeous furniture, fully-equipped kitchen, smart TV, and a premium wireless speaker are just a few of the amenities you’ll find inside this two-bedroom apartment. Ideally located in Chicago, you’ll find a lot to love outside as well. When you’re ready to relax, you’ll be happy to discover every Blueground bedroom comes with superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and cozy towels. We handle everything so you can simply show up and start living.  This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry. neighborhood_overview: Located in West Loop, this furnished rental invites you to explore the edges of downtown Chicago. From endless dining and bar options to art galleries and stylish shops, West Loop has emerged with so much to offer daily. During weekends, residents savor trips to the Chicago French Market and the vibrant strip of Randolph Street. The latter is known as “Restaurant Row” and is lined with some of the city’s best eateries. Fulton Market, one of the hippest and fastest-growing neighborhoods, is ideal for dinner and drinks. Union Station is only a 5 to 10 minute walk away.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions (including certain Bull Terriers and any related breeds). Wild animals and hybrids, including wolf and coyote hybrids, snakes, ferrets, rabbits, are all prohibited. Please contact us for precise breed restrictions. Please note that a one-off non refundable fee ($500) and a monthly rent ($25/mo/pet) is applicable upon reservation. Failing to notify us of any pets prior to check-in will incur a penalty, and may result in denied check-in. Supporting documents (ie. vaccinations) may be required - Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a $250 monthly fe
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

name: Close to Mag Mile 2 Double Beds in Boutique Hotel
summary: You'll have a view of the city lights right outside your window when you stay in our space. This historic property was a beacon to celebrities throughout Chicago's Jazz Age. It has many amenities that we know you’ll love, including: • 2 Double beds with down comforters, pillows, and imported 300 thread count linens • Flatscreen 42” LCD HD TV with cable • Customized minibar • In-room safe • Daily housekeeping service • 24-hour fitness center • 24-hour front desk makes late arrivals a breeze!
space: Visit the Windy City and book a stay in our stunning room! Rooted in Chicago’s Jazz Age, this iconic location offers convenient access to Chicago’s main shopping boulevard, Michigan Avenue -- also known as the Magnificent Mile. Our space features a large work area with custom lighting and a customized minibar. You can keep up with work by stopping by the on-site business center, or kick-start your morning with a workout at the 24-hour fitness center. Our glamorous space has 2 Double beds with down comforters and imported 300 thread count linens. Each morning, you’ll wake up to a wonderful view of the city, and before heading out, you can lock up your valuables in the in-room safe. Get ready for the day in the 1 bathroom, which has a bathtub and a marble mosaic floor. We provide you with bathrobes, a hairdryer, towels, and complimentary toiletries. neighborhood_overview: Historic Bronzeville where homes date back to the 1800s, known for high ceilings, large  & spacious living quarters, and architecture that will never be repeated. Up and coming area, the properties are well-maintained and conveniently located near everything in the City whether you travel by bus, train, Uber or your own vehicle, it is but a short distance away.
notes: 1. TVs are RoKu equipped! 2. You can sleep on top of the two couches in the living room.  3. The $1,000.00 security only applies if you damage or steal anything during your stay. Even then, it’s up to that amount after the claim is filed. Your card does not get debited period (not prior to and not after if no claims are filed).
transit: Within walking distance, about .5 - 4 blocks to public transportation, 10mins to beautiful downtown Chicago, 10mins to Soldier Field, 10mins to United Center, 10mins from US Cellular Field, President Obama's house 5 minutes away, Museum of Science and Industry 10mins, Shedd Aquarium 10mins, Ms. Biscuit 3mins, Chicago Chicken & Waffles 10mins, Harold Washington Cultural Center 6mins, Chinatown 6mins, and much more.
access: A lockbox has been set up so guests can feel free to come at their leisure anytime after the 3p check-in. You'll have access to the entire apartment and there’s free street parking.
interaction: I’m usually not present for every check-in, but at some point I will come up and introduce myself and welcome you aboard.  However, I’m always available to answer questions and address missing items, concerns or comments.
house_rules: Be respectful of tenants living in the building- LOCK ALL ENTRY DOORS AT ALL TIMES.  No loud music, No parties, No incense or candle burning, No running or stomping down the hallway.  Please treat the place better than your own. Also, be mindful that tenants live beneath you, so your most respectful behavior would be much appreciated. Towels should only be used for bathing. *Only number of guests on reservation are allowed in the unit!
host_about: Nice, friendly, very welcoming, love to travel and explore new things!

name: Sonder | 943 Crosby | Lovely 1BR
summary: We want everyone to have a comfortable place to stay. Our digital check-in and the ability to manage your stay from our app, means you won't need to interact with anyone in person. Our staff has been trained in proper disinfection techniques and will deep clean your Sonder before and after your stay. We're here for you during this time of uncertainty and can be reached 24/7 via text or call. Named the most innovative travel company of 2019 by Fast Company, Sonder has hosted a million guests in 5,000+ spaces with an average rating of 4.6 stars. Each space is designed and run by us, so you’ll always know what to expect from your stay. At Sonder, we’ve combined the best parts of home and hotel.   - 24/7 support via text, email, or phone   - Coffee, fresh towels, and bathroom essentials provided   - Hotel-standard cleaning before you arrive

neighborhood_overview: Known as one of Chicago’s most livable and walkable neighborhoods, Near North is the place to be for endless shopping, dining, and entertainment. Fill your day by wandering along the famous Magnificent Mile, admiring the city skyline at the Chicago River, or simply enjoying a drink on one of the many rooftops. From sun up to sun down, the lively streets of this neighborhood are bustling with people.
notes: There’s no cable. We’ve provided an HDMI cord for streaming. This apartment is available for stays of 30 nights or more. If this Sonder isn't open for your dates, please contact us to see what else we have available.
house_rules: House Rules 1. Reservations require a $500 security deposit that is not charged in advance. 2. Guests can cancel free of charge within 24 hours of booking (please contact us to process the refund). You’ll be charged 50% of the booking price (minus the service fee) if you cancel more than seven days before arrival, and 100% of the total price if you cancel within seven days of arrival. 3. Check-in is at 4 pm. Checkout is at 11 am. Early check-in or late checkout may be available upon request. Guests who stay beyond their designated checkout time or delay our housekeeping staff are liable for any associated costs and expenses. 4. Guests are not allowed to make a reservation in their city of residence. Please contact us if you're booking within your city. 5. Smoking, parties, and excessive noise are not allowed, including on balconies and in shared spaces. Smoking violations are subject to a $250 fine plus the cost to clean, deodorize, and repair damages. 6. Commercial photography/videogr
host_about: Sonder is reimagining the way people travel. Now in 20+ cities, we’ve been featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and named 2019’s most innovative hospitality brand by Fast Company. We’ve taken the best parts of home and hotel and combined them into an entirely new experience. All of our spaces are uniquely designed, have 24/7 guest support, and contain all the essentials you need for an impeccable stay. No matter what you’re looking for, there’s a Sonder for you.

name: Logan Sq. Room for Singles/Couples
summary: Family home located a block away from the California Blue Line Subway stop (30 minutes to O'Hare & 15 minutes to downtown) in the heart of Logan Square, a neighborhood packed with restaurants & bars. Breakfast included!
space: We are Spanish-American family that has traveled extensively and loves meeting people from around the world. We've rented the extra rooms in our single-family home to international students studying in Chicago for over two decades, so we are no strangers to sharing our home with a diverse group of people. We love all things cultural, and would be happy to orient you during your stay and recommend places to visit, sites to see and places to eat.
description: Family home located a block away from the California Blue Line Subway stop (30 minutes to O'Hare & 15 minutes to downtown) in the heart of Logan Square, a neighborhood packed with restaurants & bars. We've rented the extra rooms in our single-family home to international students studying in Chicago for over two decades, so we are no strangers to sharing our home with a diverse group of people. We love all things cultural, and would be happy to orient you during your stay and recommend places to visit, sites to see and places to eat. neighborhood_overview: Logan Square is a vibrant neighborhood teaming with young people and lots of restaurants, bars and cafes. Walk five minutes in any direction, at any time of day and you are bound to find something interesting. Plus we're two train stops from the equally trendy Wicker Park neighborhood and a 15 minute ride from downtown Chicago.
notes: We have two very friendly and inquisitive cats. You can keep them from entering your room, but know that you will be sharing the common areas with them.
transit: We're located just one block from the California "EL" Station on the Blue Line. This subway line takes you directly to O'Hare Airport (30 minutes) and Downtown Chicago (15 minutes). We're also next to the California Ave., Milwaukee Ave. and Fullerton Ave. bus lines.
access: Guests are welcome to spend time in their rooms and all of the home's common areas, including a large living room and kitchen.
house_rules: 1. Be kind to our pets. This is their home too. 2. Feel free to use the kitchen, but please clean up after yourself.  3. Keep noise at a minimum in the late evening and early morning.
host_about: I am a person who lives for travel and culture.  I work as both an arts journalist and an artist manager / agent.  I am also studying a Masters in Cultural Management aka Arts Administration.  I travel regularly for both work and play!

neighborhood_overview: Located in West Loop, this furnished rental invites you to explore the edges of downtown Chicago. From endless dining and bar options to art galleries and stylish shops, West Loop has emerged with so much to offer daily. During weekends, residents savor trips to the Chicago French Market and the vibrant strip of Randolph Street. The latter is known as “Restaurant Row” and is lined with some of the city’s best eateries. Fulton Market, one of the hippest and fastest-growing neighborhoods, is ideal for dinner and drinks. Union Station is only a 5 to 10 minute walk away.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions (including certain Bull Terriers and any related breeds). Wild animals and hybrids, including wolf and coyote hybrids, snakes, ferrets, rabbits, are all prohibited. Please contact us for precise breed restrictions. Please note that a one-off non refundable fee ($500) and a monthly rent ($25/mo/pet) is applicable upon reservation. Failing to notify us of any pets prior to check-in will incur a penalty, and may result in denied check-in. Supporting documents (ie. vaccinations) may be required - Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a $250 monthly fe

host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

You will find an endless amount of culture, amazing restaurants, bars, nightlife and shopping. Stay in Ukrainian Village and walk north on Damen to Division Street or continue on a little further to North Ave in Wicker Park. Scroll down to the bottom of the profile page to see an interactive map with some of our favorite spots!
transit: 12 min walk from both the Damen and Division Blue Line 'L' stops that will easily take you to O'Hare Airport or Downtown. Blocks from the Damen (#50), Division (#70), Western (#49) or Chicago (#66) buses. There is also a Divvy station 2 blocks away - Chicago's bike sharing program which is a great way for getting around the city. Just a quick 10 minute drive to United Center or a straight shot south on the Damen Bus (#50).
access: You will have complete and private access to our condo!

Southern gal who met a northern boy and made a life (and a baby boy) in the Midwest! Lover of travel, food, books, running and a nice glass of bourbon.

We love Chicago and naturally, we'd love to host you in Chicago!

neighborhood_overview: Restaurants, bars, museums, free parking, shopping malls, grocery stores, close to 5 bus routes that takes you to the loop and two metro lines.
notes: The address is 1115 W 19th PLACE and not 1115 W 19th STREET. 19th STREET is one block from 19th PLACE. Free WiFi, Free parking, Netflix
transit: Number 8 bus (to Broadway-5 minute walk away), number 18 bus (to Michigan Avenue-1 minute walk away), and the pink line train are a few blocks away. The Chicago Transit Authority (i.e CTA) bus routes 9, 21 and 60 are also 5 minutes away.
access: You'll have access to a private bedroom. Bathroom, kitchen, living room, dining area, and porch are shared with other airbnb guests. We carefully select our guests for hosting, 98% of our guests are graduate students and young professionals who are in town for conferences. There is free WiFi, free Netflix, and a refrigerator stocked with bottled water and beverages. Parking is free and is street parking in front of the apartment. Check in is any time after 5 pm, early check in is possible Checkout is before 12 noon, late check-out is possible
house_rules: Only the number of guests on the reservation can come to the house. If your reservation says 2 people then only 2 people can come to the house.  No smoking inside the house. You can smoke outside.
host_about:
We are clean and neat freaks that have hosted over 2000 different sets of Airbnb guests from all over the world in our Chicago apartments!. Our apartments are in the south and west loop of downtown Chicago. The museums, stadiums (United Center, Soldier Field, etc.), and McCormick Place, Thalia hall, China town, University of Illinois, University of Chicago,  Rush university, Medical district are all close and easily accessible. The magnificent mile is: 9 minutes by bus and 5 minutes by taxi or Uber. 
 
We are friendly people who enjoy meeting new friends and traveling. We have lived in the Caribbean, London, and New York before moving to Chicago. Came to Chicago primarily for school but then we loved it and decided to stay. Yes, we love Chicago, and even the winter is GREAT! Good food options are unbelievably amazing in Chicago.

I have multiple apartments on this website. Some of the apartments are  3 bedrooms, bathroom, living room, dining room, and kitchen. Some are two bedrooms, bathroom, living, and kitchen and the others are 1 bedroom, kitchen, bathroom, and living room. We provide additional airbeds if needed. The airbeds are extremely comfortable and are queen size and 18 inches high. 

All the apartments have free WiFi, guestbooks, and basic amenities such as TV, iron, iron board, refrigerator, hair dryer, with water, pop, and juice, microwave, coffee maker, cups, plates, pots, pans, bathroom towels, shower items, etc.

Airbnb is extremely fun for us since we are also international.  We have traveled to most of the states in the US, London, Milan,  Italy, Turkey. I have also attended Universities on both sides of the Atlantic (London and Chicago). 

Favorite music are Reggae, R&B, hip hop, Latin music, country music. I love to eat and my favorite food are fish, fruits, and vegetables. My favorite sports are rock climbing, archery, diving, soccer, and basketball. 

These days if I am not out with friends, I am with family, or spending time on the computer. My life motto is working hard and taking care of health!!!!!

name: Chic Penthouse Corner 3BR Loft In Fulton Market
summary: Stunning 2,500 square foot brick-and-timber luxury penthouse with 15 foot ceilings located in the heart of the vibrant West Loop neighborhood. This designer 3 bedroom / 2 bath corner unit was just completely renovated and is ideal for groups looking for a luxurious city escape in the middle of Chicago's best dining and nightlife. Abundant natural light and views of the streetscape below make this a truly special space. The central location is ideal for everything you want to see in the city!
space: Located on the top floor corner of a historic 1920’s building overlooking Fulton Market. Once inside, you’re greeted by a huge open living space with 2 walls of soaring windows, polished concrete floors, and exposed brick-and-timber details. Every room is filled with beautiful natural light and the upscale furnishings and designer touches are sure to create an unforgettable stay. The kitchen, dining, and living room are open and great for entertaining. The fully equipped kitchen is stocked with all the tools you need to stay in and cook a great meal. We have a 6 person dining table and a kitchen island with 4 counter stools -- plenty of room for all guests. In the living room, you’ll find comfortable furniture to lounge on and a smart TV with Roku.  Every bedroom has 7 foot tall windows facing west - ideal for capturing magical sunsets over the Fulton Market skyline. Our beds have crisp linens and the bathrooms are stocked with fresh towels and bath products. We also provide essentials

neighborhood_overview: You’re in the center of Fulton Market in the West Loop -- a lively neighborhood that is home to many of Chicago’s finest restaurants, coffee shops, breweries, cocktail bars, and outdoor patios. This former warehouse district has transformed in recent years and is now a favorite of locals and visitors alike. Within a 5 minute walk outside your door, you’ll find dozens of hangout spots and places to explore for all ages and budgets. You’re truly in the heart of one of Chicago’s coolest neighborhoods!
transit: Our place is very central for exploring all of Chicago -- less than 1 mile from the Loop and River North, and a 10-15 minute trip to other areas like the Magnificent Mile, Wicker Park, Lincoln Park, Old Town, Gold Coast, and McCormick Place.  You’re a 1 min walk from the Morgan train stop (Green/Pink Line) and a 10 min walk from the Grand train stop (Blue Line), allowing you to quickly access all areas of the city and O’Hare/Midway Airports. Uber and Lyft is also available 24/7. You’ll have no trouble getting around without a car. Parking: We do not have parking in our building, but there are very convenient options nearby. The nearest parking garage is the 1K Fulton Parking garage at 1029 W. Carroll Ave, one block from from the apartment. For 24 hours of parking, rates are $26 on the weekend and $50 during the week. We also recommend two parking apps/websites that allow you to book discounted parking in garages and neighborhood parking lots. You can typically find overnight parking fo

interaction: We are always available to give recommendations and address questions during your stay. We love  sharing our city with visitors.

name: Condo ON Point in Logan Square (entire home)
summary: A quiet, clean modern condo in beautiful Logan Square, just steps from the Blue Line, the 606, Palmer Square, and dozens of the hottest restaurants, breweries, bars, and coffee shops Chicago has to offer.  Featured in Bon Appetit magazine's "Restaurant City of the Year" article on Chicago, Logan Square is THE place to be!
space: This condo is ON POINT (literally!). Situated on a quiet, tree-lined, one-way street, the Condo on Point is the perfect place to enjoy a quiet night's rest before setting out to explore the great city of Chicago. A few steps to California Avenue and you're in the middle of the action! Your Room and Bathroom: Enjoy a quiet night's rest in your own private, large room with a comfortable queen bed. The room is decorated in a minimalist style with black and white decor. For your belongings, there's a chest of drawers, a spacious closet, and a long floating shelf/desk with ottoman/seat.  Enjoy a Visio 32" Smart TV complete with Netflix, Hulu, and local channels. The room is off a small separate hallway which also leads to your bathroom, complete with all necessary toiletries.  An additional guest can sleep on the massive, super comfortable couch in the living room (described below!). Extra sheets, blankets, and pillows provided for this space. description: A quiet, clean modern condo in beautiful Logan Square, just steps from the Blue Line, the 606, Palmer Square, and dozens of the hottest restaurants, breweries, bars, and coffee shops Chicago has to offer.  Featured in Bon Appetit magazine's "Restaurant City of the Year" article on Chicago, Logan Square is THE place to be! This condo is ON POINT (literally!). Situated on a quiet, tree-lined, one-way street, the Condo on Point is the perfect place to enjoy a quiet night's rest before setting out to explore the great city of Chicago. A few steps to California Avenue and you're in the middle of the action! Your Room and Bathroom: Enjoy a quiet night's rest in your own private, large room with a comfortable queen bed. The room is decorated in a minimalist style with black and white decor. For your belongings, there's a chest of drawers, a spacious closet, and a long floating shelf/desk with ottoman/seat.  Enjoy a Visio 32" Smart TV complete with Netflix, Hulu, and local channels. The room i
neighborhood_overview: The Best Side is the West Side! Restaurants, bars, coffee shops....well, there are too many to name! But rest assured you will be provided with a complete guest guide upon arrival to hit up the best spots. I used to own an event company, so I know the best stuff! If exercise or relaxing outdoors is your thing, look no further. We're just a quick walk to the 606, Palmer Square, and Humboldt Park, or a short bus ride directly to the lake.  As mentioned above, I couldn't possibly name all the hotspots you have access to - but here's a start: Parson's Chicken & Fish, Osteria Langhe, The Freeze, Katherine Anne Confections, Bang Bang Pie, Dos Urban Cantina, Ugo's, Scofflaw, 90 Miles Cuban Cafe, Revolution Brewing, Estereo...etc...etc... If running on the 606 or the treadmill isn't your thing, you also have access to a bicycle, and there's a Divvy (bike share) station nearby. There are also plenty of nearby gyms that offer daily passes, including Planet Fitness, X-sport, and Midtown Athletic
transit: Free parking is generally available on nearby streets. For extra parking options, check out ParqEx, Spothero, and Parkwhiz for more options. Public transportation couldn't be easier - steps from the Blue Line (to O'hare airport or downtown/the Loop), and buses right outside the door (California bus goes north/south, Armitage goes East to Lincoln Park, the lake, etc.). Uber/Lyft/Via are readily available, along with Car2Go and Getaround.
access: For coming/going, you will be given your own private access code for the back door entrance for the duration of your stay. You'll be able to access the entire space with exception of the (my) master bedroom.
interaction: See "Guest Access" for my schedule. I am more than happy to provide suggestions, and I will always be available via email/text throughout your stay.
house_rules: Absolutely no outside guests allowed in the condo.  Please carefully review the house manual with instructions on getting here, house rules, and neighborhood amenities:  (Website hidden by Airbnb)
host_about:
I love to travel to new places! My favorite things to do in a new city are check out the dining and nightlife scenes along with learning the local history. 

As a guest, I'm a clean, neat professional and will treat your home as if it were my own! I am also an AirBnB host, so I will have the utmost respect for your property. 

More things I love: dancing, karaoke, craft beer, craft cocktails, outdoor dining, and TV. Yay!

name: New 3BR Residence Adjacent to Wrigley Field
summary: Everything about this residence is top of the line, first class and immaculately clean. This is a designer decorated three bedroom residence adjacent to Wrigley Field. Major League comfort and convenience awaits you at the closest lodging to Wrigley Field.  We are conveniently located across from one of the entrances to Wrigley Field, within one of the iconic Wrigley Rooftop buildings.
space: We rent only to responsible guests who want the best of Wrigley Ville in a quality environment. Accordingly, we do ask our guests to provide a description of themselves and their party in terms of profession and backgrounds..

This property features an incredible outdoor patio with 120 feet of frontage along Waveland Ave.  No other residential property features such frontage along Wrigley Field's outfield.  You may even see a fly balls enter the property's outdoor patio.  The patio also features a high end Weber Genesis gas grill and a large picnic table.
neighborhood_overview: This residence offers an experience second to none. You will be able to immerse yourself in the surrounding Wrigleyville festivities while relaxing comfortably in your fully furnished private apartment. Step out of the residence and you're privy to all that Wrigleyville has to offer: theater, fine dining, shopping and the world famous Wrigley Field is next door. It's a Wrigleyville dream, right at your doorstep. * Dine at one of the countless surrounding restaurants located in the Lakeview/Wrigleyville neighborhoods * Indulge in first-class shopping downtown at The Magnificent Mile on Michigan Avenue, or at the nearby boutiques of the Southport Corridor. * Visit the Lincoln Park Zoo which is not only nearby and open 365 days a year, but it is FREE to a * Visit one of the many Chicago beaches located along Lake Michigan where you can ride bikes along Lake Shore drive, kayak, play volleyball, etc. * Rent bikes from the nearby Divvy Bikes location and explore all that Chicago has to offer
notes: We do not have parking.  Check SPOT HERO for parking spaces. Bedroom Bed Configuration - Bedroom 1 has a King bed - Bedroom 2 has two double beds (double over double bunk) - Bedroom 3 has a double bed - There are two additional twin folding beds in this residence. Only the exit cleaning is included in the price of your booking. If you would like additional cleanings during your stay, there is an additional $150 charge  per cleaning. The cleaners change all the linens on each cleaning visit. Please let us know at least 24 hours in advance to schedule additional cleanings.
transit: This location has a Walk Score of 98 out of 100 and is a walker’s paradise. Daily errands do not require a car. Transportation is a breeze with the "L" Train Red Line stop just around the corner, plenty of available pay parking lots, and a limitless amount of taxis just outside your door. Uber is also excellent. Parking We do not have parking.  Spot hero is great site to check for parking spaces.

This is an amazing place to people watch and enjoy the festivities on cubs game days. The residence was completely renovated in 2018.  This residence includes new designer linens and towels. Beds and mattresses are new as is all furniture, floor coverings and accessories. Kitchen is all new with high end appliances, perfect for private dining or entertaining.
interaction: You can contact me real time 24 hours a day by phone or email
house_rules: Absolutely no parties allowed, I live in the building and will call the police.
host_about: I  enjoying traveling all around the world. Meanwhile, I am happy to host travelers which provides a perfect starting point to explore the city. My goal is to show people all around the world the internal culture of the city. If you are given the chance to skip all the `for tourists` things, you can start your real trip straightaway without any unnecessary delays. Travel like a local and after hours, rest in an awe inspiring place.

name: Loft Suite in Boutique Hotel Near Mag Mile
summary: A blend of style and space make our Chicago room the perfect place to stay on your next trip to the Windy City. This historic property was a beacon to celebrities throughout Chicago's Jazz Age. It has many amenities including: • King bed in a cozy curtained Sleeping Area • Sleeper sofa for additional guests • Custom lighting • Flatscreen 42” LCD HD TV with cable • In-room safe • Daily housekeeping service • 24-hour fitness center  • 24-hour front desk makes late arrivals a breeze!
space: Stretch out in style by booking a stay in our open-plan and stylish suite! Rooted in Chicago’s Jazz Age, this iconic location offers convenient access to Chicago’s main shopping boulevard, Michigan Avenue. Our open-plan space features a large work area with custom lighting and a customized minibar. You can keep up with work by stopping by the on-site business center, or kick-start your morning with a workout at the 24-hour fitness center. Our glamorous space features a curtained SLEEPING AREA with a King bed. Enjoy the down comforters and imported 300 thread count linens! The Sleeper sofa in the main living space can accommodate additional guests. Before heading out, you can lock up your valuables in the in-room safe. Get ready for the day in the 1 BATHROOM, which has a bathtub and a marble mosaic floor. We provide you with bathrobes, a hairdryer, towels, and complimentary toiletries. When you’re not exploring Chicago, relax on the custom furniture in the ample LIVING AREA and pour you

host_about: Located in the heart of the Gold Coast, the iconic property has hosted the who’s who of the 20th and 21st centuries, having served as a local beacon to countless celebrities. Ambassador Chicago is nestled among stunning mansions in a quiet, gilded neighborhood tucked into the center of the Windy City offering incredible views of Lake Michigan, and with easy access to Chicago’s main shopping boulevard, Michigan Avenue.

name: The Roscoe & Halsted (Boystown)
summary: Be close to all of the action in Chicago’s Lakeview neighborhood! You will be steps from Boystown, Wrigleyville, Lake Michigan, Belmont Theater District, Addison Station, Belmont Station, and much more.  Nightlife, retail shopping, coffee shops, and liquor stores all walking distance. This home is an excellent location for people eager to visit one of the most diverse, cultured, and popular late-night neighborhoods in Chicago.
space: Reliable and effortless check-in as the apartment is equipped with a lockbox. The apartment occupies the second floor of a historic Chicago building - as you walk up the private stairwell, you'll enter the kitchen which opens into the airy living room, to the left you'll see the large dining area. Down the hall to the right are the three bedrooms and two bathrooms and through the back door is the back porch. You will love my home because of the A+ location, amenities, and accessibility with a bus Stop right outside of the front door, Divvy Bike station directly across the street, and Belmont or Addison Red Line stops within 10 minutes walking distance.  Great for families, couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and groups. This 2nd floor property is beautifully located in the heart of Boystown’s historic nightlife. This property is perfect for entertaining because of its open layout. You will also have access to the bar (provide your own booze), board games, and beer pong. (Dur

Located In a lively entertainment district that is surrounded by restaurants and bars. Bars close at 2:00am and 3:00 am Saturdays.  Spacious apartment with great views and a great location. Great place for Cub’s games, Pride, Market Days, Lollapalooza, St. Patrick's, and Chicago Marathon. You will literally be able to watch the pride parade, pride festival, and Market Days festival from the living room.
notes: This property has cameras for the outside view of the entrances for your safety and to protect the home. Please inquire about any questions regarding minimum and maximum length bookings, I am open to working on durations! Lock-Out Service is not guaranteed.

access: Once your booking is confirmed you will receive check in instructions before arrival in your itinerary. Nearby lockboxes with keys allow convenient check-in. In & out driveway access for guests who purchase parking.
