name: Rustic Waltz - River North Studio by Short Stay
summary: Lift weights in the fitness center, refreshing afterwards in the double-head rain shower. Cook in a kitchen with Smeg refrigerator and custom cabinetry before working in the lobby lounge. Then spread out on the mansard roof deck's sectional seating.
space: This home features original bay windows and architecture with all of the conveniences of a fully renovated contemporary space. Hardwood flooring throughout, in unit washer/dryer combo & spa like bathroom with glass-enclosed rain shower. Brand new kitchen with SMEG refrigerator & custom cabinetry open into a spacious bright living room.  The kitchen is fully equipped with pots, pans, utensils, silverware, plates, bowls, cups, knives, a cutting board, salt and pepper, olive oil, black tea and honey. There are great markets nearby if you feel the culinary inspiration.  Lightly caffeinated seltzer is also in the fridge for you to enjoy. Every room is supplied with a french press coffee maker, coffee, and cream and sugar – for however you take it.  The comfy queen sized bed is the perfect place to relax and watch the smart TV, complete with basic cable and ROKU for you to sign into your own Netflix or Hulu accounts during your stay. Sit among the Mansards on the rooftop terrace and stargaze
description: Lift weights in the fitness center, refreshing afterwards in the double-head rain shower. Cook in a kitchen with Smeg refrigerator and custom cabinetry before working in the lobby lounge. Then spread out on the mansard roof deck's sectional seating.
neighborhood_overview: River North is an urban neighborhood bordering the Magnificent Mile and over the bridge from The Loop, Millennium Park, and the downtown theater district. Slip into sleek new clubs, upscale winebars, and craft cocktail lounges just a stroll away.
notes: Check In / Check Out Check in starts at 3 PM Check out time is 11 AM This is an elevator building with someone at the front desk between the hours of 7am-7pm. They are there to assist permanent residents, but we ask that you check in with them when you arrive both for security and so that they are able to reach you should you order food or have any visitors during your stay. Any questions should be directed to us via the Airbnb app. Luggage Hold If your travel arrangements have you arriving earlier or leaving later than our designated check in / check out times, we can offer a luggage hold at the building for a flat fee of $25.  Early Check In Luggage Holds begin at 12pm. Late Check Out Luggage Holds end at 2:45pm. This time has the possibility of being extended to 8pm if there is not another check in in the home. We will not be able to confirm an 8pm luggage hold until 24hrs prior to your departure. Pets There is a $25/pet per booking fee.  We know that all dogs are good dogs but the
transit: There is no dedicated parking space for the home. We recommend using apps like SpotHero to locate discounted street or garage spots nearby.  The home is a 4 minute walk from the CTA brown line train at the "Chicago" stop. This train line will take you all over the city, including into the neighborhoods further north and south for exploring or down into the loop to catch a show or transfer to another train line.
access: As our guest you'll have full access to the entire home including all of the building's amenities.
interaction: We are off-site but available when needed. The best way to reach us is by emailing (Email hidden by Airbnb)  In case of maintenance emergency, the in-unit home guide will detail phone numbers of who to call immediately.
house_rules: -Please treat the home as if it is your own. -Please respect our guest limit capacity of 2 people. -Do not engage in illegal activities anywhere on the property. -If you accidentally damage anything during your stay, please contact the host for your safety and the future safety of the next guest. -We pride ourselves on being green and would appreciate you turning off the TV and lights when you check-out. -Please remember to sign out of any ROKU apps you utilized via your personal accounts before departing. Quiet Hours Quiet hours are between 10p-8a. This is a residential building and ask that for the respect of permanent tenants basic courtesies of being mindful of your noise levels and not congregating in hallways outside of the unit be observed. Receiving a noise complaint from the building or the device can result in the forfeiture of your stay and a $1000 fine.  No Smoking The home (and entire building including outdoor common areas) is designated as a strictly smoke-free community
host_about: Hello! Thanks for checking out our homes in beautiful Chicago! Livly Short Stay has a few hosts that will be communicating with you and we can’t wait to get to know you and welcome you to the city. Hosting as a team makes communicating with us even faster and we're looking forward to taking care of curating a perfect stay for you. Talk to you soon!

name: Charming Wrigley Walk-up Steps From Everything
summary: Clean, comfortable, and homey apartment with a stellar bathroom featuring a huge bathtub. You're steps from the red line el train, from Wrigley, and from all that Chicago has to offer.
description: Clean, comfortable, and homey apartment with a stellar bathroom featuring a huge bathtub. You're steps from the red line el train, from Wrigley, and from all that Chicago has to offer. Either I, myself, or an assistant will be available to help you at any time during your stay. Wrigleyville has exploded with growth in recent years.  You name it, Wrigleyville has it. Looking to site see?  Try iconic Wrigley Field or hop the el to Millennium Park. Need coffee? Try the Starbucks Reserve, have a Dunkin, or I can recommend a half dozen local coffee shops within blocks. Looking for a bar? We have at least thirty to choose from. Looking for food--okay, you'll have to be more specific then I can help! Less than a block from the red line el train downtown.  Two blocks to the Halsted bus.  Very short ride to Lake Shore Drive.

name: Hip Homebase to Explore Chicago
summary: 2 Bedroom centrally located in the great neighborhood of Wicker Park. Easy to get all over the city of Chicago to explore! The apartment is very roomy and comfortable even with up to 7 guests! Enjoy a newly renovated bathroom! 420 friendly accomodations with HighSocietyBnB.
space: This hip and centrally located 2nd floor apartment has 2 bedrooms, and 1 newly updated bathroom with full kitchen and living room. The apartment is located in the hip neighborhood of Wicker Park. There are 5 beds (1 Queen bed in bedroom 1, 1 Queen bed in bedroom #2, 2 twin beds in the living room and a pull out couch) and can accommodate up to 7 people! Please keep in mind older Chicago buildings have character, but they may also appear less clean. The unit is thoroughly cleaned between each guest and all bedding and towels are provided and cleaned prior to each new guest.  This 2nd floor apartment is centrally located in Wicker Park with less than a 10 min cab ride to to Downtown, Lincoln Park, Wrigleyville and close easy access to the freeway, public transportation and nightlife. This is a 2 bedroom apartment with 5 mattresses total (1 queens and 2 Twins plus a pull out couch in the living room). There is a large walk in closet that is wide open for your things so you can unpack and

neighborhood_overview: One of Chicago's creative epicenters lies just west of downtown Chicago in Wicker Park and Bucktown. These synonymous neighborhoods are famous for unparalleled boutique shopping, esoteric book stores and their countless art galleries — many housed within the Flat Iron Arts Building. If you have an acute knowledge of craft cocktails and an affinity for independent clothing designers, there's no better area to sip and shop in the country.
notes: If you are traveling with a baby or young children, we have a pack and play available for use. Please let us know prior to arrival so we can have it available for you.
transit: The North Avenue and also the Ashland  buses run about every 10 Minutes and are less than a block away.  The Blue line El stop at Damen is a 10 min walk away, the El stop at Milwaukee is also 10 min walk but not down as nice of a street. Taxi downtown is $10/10 min, taxi to Lincoln Park/Wrigleyville is $10/10 min. Taxi to Ohare or Midway is $40 and can range from 30 minutes without traffic to 1 hour with bumper to bumper traffic. There is free parking on the street, but be careful, around the corner from the house is a ZONED parking area which requires a permit, do not park on Bosworth.  DIVY Bikes are the public bike rental service with parking locations all over the place in Chicago. It is $7 for a 24 hour pass.  This is a great way to get around the city.  There is a station at Marshfield and Cortland which is 1 block north and 1 block West,  or you can go to Ashland & Blackhawk which is 3 blocks South.
access: Guests have private access to the unit.
house_rules: We do NOT allow parties at the house. Only the registered guests may be at the unit.  Please smoke cigarettes outside the unit. Cannabis use is permitted in the building.  •	Quiet Hours are 10 PM-8 AM •	No smoking of cigarettes in the unit. This is a cannabis friendly accommodations.  •	No parties, gatherings, or guests are allowed beyond those registered on your booking •	No pets without prior approval •	Any incidents of Lock outs will be charged an $80 fee.  •	Please treat my home like you would if you were staying at your Grandmother’s house. I appreciate your kindness to the furniture, neighbors and the accommodations.  ***PLEASE NOTE: The washing machine can not handle towels or sheets. Please do not wash towels or sheets in the washer. You may leave them out for housekeeping to pick up.*** ***PLEASE NOTE: The washing machine can not handle towels or sheets. Please do not wash towels or sheets in the washer. You may leave them out for housekeeping to pick up.*** The wash machine i
host_about: I have lived all over the country, but have presently landed in Chicago the last 14 years. I live with (and usually always travel with) my newly married husband (aka partner of 15 years) who I live with in Chicago as well as on our Farm in Michigan.   We love traveling with our toddler and also enjoying the city of chicago and the open space in Michigan. We have traveled to every continent except Antartica together and enjoy unique experiences, off the beaten path/road/mountain/boat/building adventures and always try to avoid the masses of tourists.  We own a multi-unit building so we are also landlords and AirBnb hosts. We are therefore very  respectful of people's property and hope you will respect ours as well.  We are very active (I also am a group fitness instructor) and love natural/local foods. We have a farm in Southwest Michigan where we practice permaculture techniques and grow naturally organic food.

name: Best Lincoln Square location. Spacious 2 bedroom
summary: Charming apartment in an updated 1800's beautiful brick building. Located in the heart of Chicago's Lincoln Square neighborhood. 2 blocks to the El train. Walk to movies, restaurants, bars, parks. Lovely family neighborhood with luxury homes all around. Bike to the beach and downtown. Conveniently located within a 20 minute train ride or drive to local universities Northwestern, Northeastern, Loyola and DePaul. BUSINESS TRAVELERS: Inquire about weeknight specials available Sept-May.
space: Approximately 1400 square feet, flooded with natural light, high ceilings and hardwood floors throughout. There is a lovely front porch for people watching. Common areas offer a separate living room and dining room. The dining room includes a baby grand piano which guests who play are welcome to use. The eat-in kitchen has a table for four, plenty of counter space for cooking and meal prep, and stainless appliances. Adjacent to the kitchen and separated by sliding doors, is an additional family room that includes a full sized futon bed along with a set of bunk beds. Keep the doors open for larger, open space or close for additional bedroom / sleeping area.

neighborhood_overview: Lincoln Square is one of Chicago's best kept secrets  and ranked one of the  most livable neighborhoods. Within four blocks of Wilson Manor, you'll find top restaurants and bars, music venues, Starbucks, grocery stores, retail shopping, a large park.  This is a very walkable, safe, family-oriented neighborhood.
notes: If your plans allow for it, we would like to offer a free pizza at our nearby pizzeria three blocks away. With our free game room, wine and beer on tap and welcoming atmosphere, it might just be your favorite experience in Chicago.
transit: Public transportation is only two blocks away and will give you access to the entire city of Chicago.  Cars are not needed.
access: You will have full private access to the unit, front porch and front yard. Note that our dogs are often in the back yard and must be kept contained in the yard.
interaction: You can access the apartment by lockbox and arrive at your leisure.

house_rules: We created Kasa to be your home on the road. We’re committed to being great neighbors, and we strictly enforce these rules to ensure the comfort and safety of our community. •NO Smoking: Smoking of any kind (including tobacco, marijuana, e-cigarettes, vape pens, and hookahs) is never allowed at this property.  This applies to the entire apartment, including the balcony or patio, as well as all common and outdoor areas of the building. Kasa apartments may be monitored with marijuana and tobacco sensors. •Noise: At all times, Kasa guests may not disturb their neighbors’ quiet enjoyment.  In addition, guests must observe quiet hours from 9 p.m. to 8 a.m. Parties and large gatherings are prohibited. Kasa apartments are proactively monitored with decibel sensors for compliance with this noise policy. •Occupancy: Each Kasa has a maximum occupancy limit.  There can be no more than the specified number of guests on the premises at any given time. Large gatherings are not permitted. •Lost and F
host_about: We are the team behind Kasa Living, a national flexible living brand that offers a dependable, high-quality living experience at a great value. We manage Kasas in modern buildings with the amenities and comforts that you want out of your own home. We aim to unleash the potential of livable space by giving you access to places that feel like your home on the road. Kasa Living is available in cities across the United States, with new locations opening frequently. We hope you enjoy your stay with us, and know that Kasa is your home on the road!

name: Cozy lofted bed nestled in a home office
summary: Our 2nd floor condo is tucked behind the business of Irving Park Road in Lakeview. Close to parks, restaurants/bars, comedy clubs, and an easy walk to Wrigley Field! A 10 minute walk to the Red line, 7 minutes to the Brown line, and steps from the bus stop, it is easy to get wherever you’re trying to go in the city. Too tired to venture out? Enjoy a drink and some fresh air on our back deck. Our dog will give you as much love as possible if you’re home, and you are welcome in our space!
space: Our home office has a lofted queen bed above it (with stairs, not a ladder), creating a cozy and separate space. The room will be yours during your stay. Guests also have a private bathroom across the hall from the bedroom. Kitchen, living room, and back deck are shared spaces.  Over some holidays, we rent out our entire place! Link to our full condo listing here: https://www.airbnb.com/h/lakeviewwrigleycondo

Link to our full condo listing here: https://www.airbnb.com/h/lakeviewwrigleycondo Feel free to use our kitchen if so desired. The second bathroom is across from the guest room,
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is amazing! You can start off your day at a local coffee shop or the Starbucks around the corner. Some of our favorite breakfast and brunch places are within walking distance or a short drive. A big draw of the neighborhood is Wrigley Field and the surrounding shops and restaurants. The area is quite bustling since the Cubs won the World Series. If you like to shop but don’t want to go all the way to the Mile, the Southport Corridor has tons of places from Gap, J. Crew, and Anthropology, to Amazon Books, Paper Source, and Lush Cosmetics. Stop between shops for a drink or bite to eat at the several eateries on the street. There are endless things to enjoy!
notes: Our dog is house trained and crate trained, but is allowed on all of our furniture. She is small/medium (33 lbs) but a little ball of energy. Please let us know if you don’t like a dog to be in close proximity and we will do our best to keep her out of your way. For an additional price, we can have her in daycare during the day (7am-5pm).
transit: We have permitted street parking so that it’s still possible to park near our place during Cubs games and Concerts at Wrigley. Let us know if you need a guest pass! 7 minute walk to the Brown Line, 10 minute walk to the Red Line, and steps from the East/Westbound bus stop.
access: Feel free to use our kitchen if so desired. The second bathroom is across from the guest room, so mostly used by our guests. We have a laundry closet in the back entrance that leads to our outdoor deck. The deck also has a table and chairs if you’d like to enjoy a meal or a drink outside.
interaction: We will help plan activities for your stay or stay out of your way! We will be in and out of the house taking care of our dog, but can avoid interaction with you if you’d enjoy more privacy.  If you want your space to yourself, we do recommend closing the doors to your bedroom and bathroom. Our dog happily walks into any space that is open to her. She loves to chill in the loft!
house_rules: Must love dogs! We have a sweet but energetic dog who loves to snuggle with anyone she meets. She will even join you in the loft if you allow her to.  Our grand piano is a prized family possession. Please do not play or have any food or drinks nearby.  Quiet hours are from 10pm-8am
host_about: We are musicians and love to travel. We would love to share our beautiful apartment with other fellow travelers!

neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is located in Streeterville, only a 5 minute walk from The Loop. One of the fastest-developing neighborhoods in Chicago, Streeterville extends out into Lake Michigan and attracts a blend of young professionals, students, and tourists. A plethora of amenities and activities exist for every lifestyle. From Navy Pier activities to luxury shopping on Michigan Avenue, it is a walkable community with easy access to entertainment.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions (including certain Bull Terriers and any related breeds). Wild animals and hybrids, including wolf and coyote hybrids, snakes, ferrets, rabbits, are all prohibited. Please contact us for precise breed restrictions. Please note that a one-off non refundable fee ($500) and a monthly rent ($25/mo/pet) is applicable upon reservation. Failing to notify us of any pets prior to check-in will incur a penalty, and may result in denied check-in. Supporting documents (ie. vaccinations) may be required - Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a $300 monthly fe
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

summary: Stylish and sophisticated, this remodeled 3 bedroom,  2 bath private apartment is in a prime location,  3 blocks from Hartigan Beach, and 2 blocks to the Loyola Red Line "L" station to take you to Wrigley Field, downtown & many locations in between.  We are 2 blocks from Loyola University & about 4 miles to Northwestern University.  Located on a quiet, residential tree-lined street, we are a 2 block walk from all manner of restaurants & conveniences associated with our proximity to Loyola.
space: Please note:  Our cleaning fee reflects a temporary surcharge to go above and beyond in sanitizing frequently touched surfaces between reservations. You are invited to stay in this modern, spacious, and luxuriously furnished 3 bedroom 2 bath private city apartment.  Unit includes fully equipped kitchen, dining room, heated/enclosed back porch, and large front balcony.  We feature high-thread count cotton linens,  beautiful furnishings, original artwork, 55 inch Samsung smart TV with streaming capability and basic Dish Network,  wireless internet , in-unit wash and dryer, quartz counter tops, custom cabinetry, stainless steel appliances, dishwasher, and much more.  We are only 2 blocks from Loyola University, The Loyola stop on the train (Elevated Subway) to take you downtown, and Hartigan Beach Park, and there is plenty of dining nearby to suit every taste. Aitor is a fluent Spanish speaker if that's of any help.

transit: 1 block to Metra station - 12 minutes to McCormick Place - stop by Metra.  We can help you with transfers from and to the airport.  We can also drive you around the city.   We provide transportation from the airport for your safety and convenience for only $69.00 and someone will even meet and greet you at the airport baggage area to help you carry your bags.  We want you to fully enjoy your stay with us, worry free.
access: You will receive wishbox link to your personal guest area where you will be able to see all the information related to your stay with us and requests early check-in, late check-out, see discounts and fun activities. Once you upload your id or passport and sign our house rules,  wishbox system will send you door codes. All our locks digital so you would not need keys. You will have the entire apartment all to yourself  -  3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms , living room with TV ( Netflix, Amazon Prime and more ) kitchen and working space + FREE private parking in the back of the building.  We also offer 50% discounted tickets to nearby [MUST SEE] Science and Industry Museum, and 3D movies.
interaction: We love to help visitors!  We take care of each guest like family.  We want your experience in Chicago to be AWESOME.  Please see our guest’s feedback & testimonies; actual clients who stayed with us.  We assist students, faculty and visitors with many other services as well ... like helping  you to find long term rentals if you are relocating, room rentals for functions, meetings and study rooms, airport pick up & drop off services, storage space, moving, renting or buying furniture,  shopping, driving lessons, opening bank accounts and much more!  Please contact us for complete details.  We are here to help you to focus on studying, working or to simply have a great time doing what you love to do best!  We also offer 50% off on special tickets to the Science and Industry Museum + FREE parking and even 3D movies for your entertainment.  We sincerely hope you will have a truly pleasant stay with us. Thank you, Ran & Family

host_about:

We're looking forward to hosting you, my friend.

Fridman Properties Family -  Please check the latest discounts and promotions and fun activities we offer for our guests. )

name: Private Lincoln Square one bed+bath studio apt.
summary: Clean, bright studio apartment in Lincoln Square. Private entrance, queen bed, private bath and small kitchenette in one of Chicago's premier neighborhoods. Small twin futon also available if needed. Beautiful home and garden with plenty of free street parking. Easy walk to public transportation, incredible restaurants, music venues,  and shopping. Winnemac Park is steps away and Lake Michigan beaches, Wrigley Field and many other attractions are a short bike or train ride. Enjoy all of Chicago!
space: Our house is a turn of the century classic Chicago four square. It has been renovated and has a beautiful garden. Our block is quiet but our neighborhood is loaded with things to do.
description: Clean, bright studio apartment in Lincoln Square. Private entrance, queen bed, private bath and small kitchenette in one of Chicago's premier neighborhoods. Small twin futon also available if needed. Beautiful home and garden with plenty of free street parking. Easy walk to public transportation, incredible restaurants, music venues,  and shopping. Winnemac Park is steps away and Lake Michigan beaches, Wrigley Field and many other attractions are a short bike or train ride. Enjoy all of Chicago! Our house is a turn of the century classic Chicago four square. It has been renovated and has a beautiful garden. Our block is quiet but our neighborhood is loaded with things to do. We have a lovely garden with a wonderful dining and lounging space. The kitchenette is equipped with a small table and chairs, refrigerator, toaster, coffeemaker, electric kettle and a microwave for your convenience. The bathroom has heated floors and a walk in shower. We offer a hair dryer and clothes iron and iro
neighborhood_overview: Lincoln Square is one of Chicago's premier neighborhoods. Home to the Old Town School of Folk Music and many wonderful restaurants. Lots of unique watering holes and shopping, a newly renovated movie theater and outdoor plaza with music throughout the summer. Lots to do and easy transportation to all parts of the city.
notes: We have a dog that loves people. She is not allowed in the studio apartment, however, but will be happy to meet you if she gets the chance!
transit: Train, El, bus, bike, Uber, Lyft all easily accessible.
access: We have a lovely garden with a wonderful dining and lounging space. The kitchenette is equipped with a small table and chairs, refrigerator, toaster, coffeemaker, electric kettle and a microwave for your convenience. The bathroom has heated floors and a walk in shower. We offer a hair dryer and clothes iron and ironing board for your convenience. We also offer local cable tv and high speed wifi.
interaction: We love to meet new people and are avid travelers but respect your privacy. Interact as much or as little as you like but please let us know if there is any thing you need.

host_about: I am a 56 year old photographer/ artist.  I sell my work in art fairs and interior design boutiques.  I also work commercially as a photographer shooting interiors.  I am a vegetarian and like to practice yoga and run.  I love travel and enjoy meeting all kinds of people.  I love going out and hearing live music and experiencing local culture.

notes: There is free street parking (no permit required) on Crystal and the East side of Noble.  Crystal Street winds around to the left and basically becomes a parking lot.  Toward the end of Crystal on the West side of the street, there is a school zone, so just make sure you notice the signs and don't park there during school hours.  Parking is generally easier during the day and gets a bit more difficult at night after 7pm. Just watch out for street cleaning signs so you don't get ticketed.  There's also a block party for a weekend in the summer that takes up a lot of the parking spots.
transit: .3 miles (6 min walk) from the Division Blue Line, which services O'Hare and goes downtown to the Loop.  Half a block from the Division bus and 90/94 expressway. There is free and easy street parking on the East side of Noble Street and on all of  Crystal Street neither of which requires a parking permit.
access: The whole place.  I have a Roku box with Netflix, Amazon Prime and Hulu+.  There is no regular "live" TV at this time.  There is a dining table as well as tray tables for eating/working in the dining room or living room areas.  24/7 check-in since the house is on a lockbox.  See the location/directions section after you've confirmed your booking for detailed info on getting in. No guests are allowed in the unit during your reservation aside from those that are part of the reservation and will be staying overnight.  You will be charged $50/person per night for any guests that enter the unit that are not on the reservation. Please share planned arrival and departure times. We cannot accommodate luggage drop off but could recommend a service for luggage storage in case you arrive early. Please just ask.
interaction: The space is all yours while you're here, no sharing anything. Once you're confirmed, see the House Manual & Wifi section for details. Contact me with any questions/concerns.  If I'm out of town, my cleaning lady (Araceli) is usually in town and can help. She also responds to many of the messages via the app.
house_rules: No extra guests--only those on the reservation may enter the unit for any reason. Do not move furniture & put things back where you found them.    Wash your dishes or rinse them and put them in the dishwasher.  Do not leave dirty dishes out.  Do not leave food on the table or counters. Please don't wear any make-up to bed as it will stain and can be hard to remove.  All of these items will incur extra cleaning fees based on the time it takes to clean them up.  This will be billed at arate of $35/hr. No loud noise after 10pm Sunday-Thursday and 12am (midnight) Fri & Sat.  There is a $100 fee for noise violations. No glitter or confetti (clean-up issues) in the house.  This incurs an extra $50 cleaning fee. No illegal activities.  There is a $100 fee for any violations of the law.    Please just generally respect the space and treat it as if it were your own, which I'm sure you will : )
host_about: I am an entrepreneur running Lotus Center, a Chicago based holistic mental health clinic and Lotus Lofts, my AirBnB business.   In my free time, I love karaoke, dancing, great weather, beaches, yoga, travel (of course!), learning and spending time with awesome people.

name: 4C3a Cozy Night's Stay - Small Room in Chicago
summary: Welcome! Your booking includes a private bedroom and fantastic amenities such as Smart internet TV, free Disney+, Hulu, full kitchen, free washer/dryer, fast internet & more!  FREE PRIVATE PARKING INCLUDED! Great location: Very close to CTA Blue Line Kedzie Station and various bus stops. Less than 15 minutes CTA ride to downtown via Blue Line. 7 min drive to the United Center & Rush Hospital.  Very easy to get on Freeway way I-290.
space: Everything is designed with your comfort and experience in mind. We provide budget room options for our guests but try to focus on everything that matters to you: convenience, comfort, entertainment options right in your bedroom and 24/7 customer service.

By Bus #126: Start at Jackson & Albany (The intersection of Jackson Blvd and Albany Ave is 2 min walk away) take Bus #126 heading East. Get
neighborhood_overview: Quiet neighborhood very close to public transit and major venues
transit: The Kedzie-Homan blue line CTA station is within 8 min walking distance.  To go to downtown Chicago: 1. By Bus #126: Start at Jackson & Albany (The intersection of Jackson Blvd and Albany Ave is 2 min walk away) take Bus #126 heading East. Get off at Michigan & Van Buren/Congress, 32 stops away and you would be in Downtown Chicago. The trip takes about 30 minutes, door to door.  2. By Bus #7: Take bus #7 heading east at Harrison & Albany (The intersection of W Harrison Street and S Albany Avenue is 7 min away by walk). Get off at Michigan & Van Buren/Congress after 30 stops. The trip takes about 45 minutes, door to door.  3. By Blue Line CTA: walk to the Kedzie-Homan station, about 8 minutes away. Take the blue  line heading East for 6 stops and get off at LaSalle Station.
host_about:
Bill is a retired professor. He has interest and expertise in various fields of scientific research.  His hobbies include history, civilization, and geography.  Bill travel overseas often.  

We greatly appreciate the support of our guests in the past many years.  Not only we have expanded our teams, we have also increased the number of hosting facilities. We have rooms ranging from more economic models for thrift travelers to luxurious rooms for exceptional experience. With the facilities we have, the guests have a greater choices of suitable locations and budget levels.  We have also re-designed some of our facilities so the entire suite or entire floor can be rented. With the large number of guests we served each year, we rely more on self check-in, and regrettably your host may not be able to meet you in person as in the past. 

All our facilities are located very convenient and safe neighborhood.  We may not have all the bell and whistle of hotel, but in some areas we actually provides more. All our facility include a full kitchen (for light cooking only, as a courtesy to other guests), microwave, coffee maker, refrigerator, washer and dryer.  Of course, we have wifi, cable or internet-ready TV, and printer. We would like you to feel that you are staying in a functional home and can stay for an extended period of time.

name: Sonder | Wrigley Field | Modern 3BR + Terrace
summary: We want everyone to have a comfortable place to stay. Our digital check-in and the ability to manage your stay from our app, means you won't need to interact with anyone in person. Our staff has been trained in proper disinfection techniques and will deep clean your Sonder before and after your stay. We're here for you during this time of uncertainty and can be reached 24/7 via text or call. Named the most innovative travel company of 2019 by Fast Company, Sonder has hosted a million guests in 5,000+ spaces with an average rating of 4.6 stars. Each space is designed and run by us, so you’ll always know what to expect from your stay. At Sonder, we’ve combined the best parts of home and hotel.   - 24/7 support via text, email, or phone   - Coffee, fresh towels, and bathroom essentials provided   - Hotel-standard cleaning before you arrive   - Self check-in
space: - In-suite laundry - Fully-equipped kitchen  - Private terrace Building amenities - Rooftop lounge  - Communal grilling space Lakeview highlights - Walkability score: 96 - 4 minute walk to Lowcountry Lakeview (southern seafood boils) - 10 minute walk to DMK Burger Bar (creative burgers and craft cocktails) Getting around - 1 block to Belmont train station  - 30 minute drive to downtown - 50 minute drive to ORD Airport

neighborhood_overview: Booming with art and culture, Lakeview offers endless entertainment and food options, and some of the city's best Lake Michigan views. Cubs fans can catch a game at Wrigley field, outdoor-enthusiasts can take a stroll along Lakefront Trail, and food-lovers can enjoy everything from global-inspired dishes to Chicago-style pizza. With a perfect mix of old and new, locals and travelers alike flock to this neighborhood to soak up all that Chicago has to offer.
notes: There’s no cable. We’ve provided an HDMI cord for streaming. Vacation Rental License No.: (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)

Guests can cancel free of charge within 24 hours of booking (please contact us to process the refund). You’ll be charged 50% of the booking price (minus the service fee) if you cancel more than seven days before arrival, and 100% of the total price if you cancel within seven days of arrival. 3. Check-in is at 4 pm. Checkout is at 11 am. Early check-in or late checkout may be available upon request. Guests who stay beyond their designated checkout time or delay our housekeeping staff are liable for any associated costs and expenses. 4. Guests are not allowed to make a reservation in their city of residence. Please contact us if you're booking within your city. 5. Smoking, parties, and excessive noise are not allowed, including on balconies and in shared spaces. Smoking violations are subject to a $250 fine plus the cost to clean, deodorize, and repair damages. 6. Commercial photography/videogr

All of our spaces are uniquely designed, have 24/7 guest support, and contain all the essentials you need for an impeccable stay. No matter what you’re looking for, there’s a Sonder for you.

name: Cozy Logan Sq Spot - 10 mins from Blue Line stop
summary: Welcome to Logan Square, the best neighborhood in Chicago [ imo ]  Come home to a cozy spot to chill and unwind in the middle of one of Chicago's most vibrant neighborhoods. The unit is a recently renovated garden unit with two bedrooms.  I live in the floor above of the Airbnb and are excited for you to use the space as a home base for you to decompress or explore the city! POC & LGBTQIA+ friendly No pets allowed Not wheelchair accessible No smoking allowed No parties allowed
space: In general, the space is intended to be a spot to come back to after a long day and unwind.  What does that look like? Well, this is how I'd use the space:  ▪︎ Brew a pot of tea, curl up with a book, blanket, and lose myself in the complexities of the narrative.  ▪︎ Roll out a yoga mat and cycle through a vinyasa flow, digging deep into each pose and feel grounded with the earth.   ▪︎ Throw on some bops, treat myself with a face mask, and dance while my Caviar order is on its way.  Basically, I want you to enjoy the space, relax, and give yourself the environment to take care of yourself.

neighborhood_overview: Logan Square is great!  Basically, it's one of the leading culinary, cocktail, and community epicenters of the city. It's a distinctly beautiful neighborhood with Chicago's historic boulevards and two incredible parks.  Being a Blue Line stop, Logan Square has become a prime location for innovative new bars and restaurants to thrive! I highly recommend checking out my Guest Book during your stay.
notes: ▪︎ POC & LGBTQIA+ friendly ▪︎ No pets allowed ▪︎ Not wheelchair accessible ▪︎ No smoking allowed ▪︎ No parties allowed ▪︎ No additional guests allowed
transit: To get to O'hare Airport [ ORD ] or The Loop [ downtown ], all you have to do is hop on the Blue Line!  The spot is a quick 10 min walk away from two different Blue Line stops: Logan Square and California. From there you can head straight to O'hare or downtown and be there in 20 mins.  If you are headed to Lincoln Park, Lake View Boystown, or Wrigleyville and don't want to call an Uber, the Fullerton Bus [ 74 ] and Diversey Bus [ 76 ] are great ways to get east.  You can generally find free parking on Fullerton, but [ Pro Tip: ] find parking off of Fullerton if it's going to snow.
access: The entire unit is yours to hang out in including the back entrance by the stairs outside.   However, there are two grey areas that should be considered when staying at the spot: ▪︎ The Laundry Room: this is shared with the rest of the building. You can do your laundry, but please keep it clean and don't leave personal belongings there.  ▪︎ The Living Room Stairs: these are the stairs to get to my unit [ and for me to get to the Airbnb unit ]. i'll never come down without talking with you first, and I appreciate you not knocking on our door or trying to get in.
interaction: I'll be available to reply to messages via the Airbnb app.  If you do have any questions though, please reach out anytime and I'll get back to you as soon as I can. As I mentioned, I live in the unit above, so I'm available to offer help.
host_about:
Stay where it counts. When you book a Loftium, you're contributing to the local community. Each Loftium is home to a local resident who hosts and lives right on-site, making sure your experience is a delightful one. All spaces are designed with your comfort in mind! We've made check-in and communication a breeze, and each home provides a beautiful and cozy place to rest your head during your travels. Every Loftium home and host is unique, and you'll always get a true neighborhood experience during your stay.

Visit a new community and book a Loftium in any of our cities: Seattle, Portland, Denver, San Diego, Phoenix, Chicago, Atlanta, Dallas, Charlotte, or Orlando. We can't wait for you to visit!

neighborhood_overview: Logan Square is a popular Chicago neighborhood just 7 miles Northwest of downtown Chicago. The apartment is a short walk to the bustling area of activity which includes a variety of restaurants, coffee shops, boutiques, bars and a movie theater. You can walk to the train and take it downtown to explore Millennium Park, museums and shopping.
transit: The apartment is located in a quiet residential neighborhood of Logan Square. A bus stop that takes you to the Blue Line station is a 3 minute walk and runs every 10 minutes. The Blue Line station will take you downtown. There are also multiple restaurants and bars located within walking distance.
access: Shared laundry is in the basement. The backyard is also a shared space!

transit: There is a train stop at Belmont and another located on Southport.  They are both about the same distance apart.

host_about:
I've own this building for almost 20 years.  This past fall I renovated it and decided to rent it on airbnb.  This what I do for a living and I take it very seriously.  This isn't a side job for me.  I will do my best to make sure you have a good experience renting my place.

I'm from Wisconsin so I'm a big Packer/Badger fan.  
I've a got great yellow lab named Bubba.
I'm hooked on too many series from HBO and Showtime.
I enjoy cooking.

summary: Luxurious home in the heart of Historic Old town triangle. Fantastic location! Steps to restaurants, shops, Lincoln park Zoo, Lake Michigan, Brown line. Pristine craftsmanship throughout, with no expenses spared.  Sleeps 4 people. Essential baby gear.  Key-less self-check-in. Two bicycles with locks for the guests to explore the city. space: Experience a luxurious home in the heart of Historic Old town triangle. The home is situated on a quiet, tree-lined and secluded street. Just 2 blocks from the Brown Line! Two blocks to Lincoln Park, the Zoo and Lake Michigan running/biking path. A quick uber ride or a 30 min pleasant walk through the park and Gold Coast to Downtown. This 3 bdr/2bath apartment is located on the 1st floor of a free standing house. Pristine craftsmanship throughout with no expenses spared. neighborhood_overview: Situated on a quiet, tree-lined and secluded street. The location is truly ideal. Private but just steps from Wells St. where many restaurants and fun things like the Second City comedy club, coffee shops, fine dining, workout facilities are located.
transit: Walkable to many attractions in the city. Public transportation (brown line and buses) are within 2 block walk. Uber/Lyft are plentiful and quick. If you are driving your own car, we provide complimentary guest parking permits upon request. Bikes are a great option as well to explore the city.
interaction: We will always be available via message or phone. The property manager and housekeeper are available on a short notice.
house_rules: We do not allow parties and loud gatherings. This is a completely smoke free home. Guests with prior 5 star reviews from other hosts may book on instant booking. No security deposit needed. Guests new to Airbnb with no prior reviews will be required to leave a refundable $300 security deposit for incidentals and/or excessive cleaning. This security deposit will be refunded promptly after checkout through Airbnb payments.
host_about:
Hi, we are Adrian and Veronica. Together with my dad, Gennady, we would like to welcome you to our properties. As your hosts, we will do our best to accommodate your needs, and make your stay as enjoyable as possible. We take great pride in providing a clean, comfortable and functional environment for your travels. We invite you to relax and become a local for your stay in Chicago and Fort Lauderdale.

We would like your trip to run smoothly. I will be your point of contact throughout your stay via phone, email or text message, whichever you prefer. We provide the self check in option making it easy for you to enter on your own. We strive to treat every guest as if they were family, so don't hesitate to ask our advice or recommendations that might make your trip a bit more enjoyable.

Communication is the key so feel free to contact either of us directly with any questions or concerns.
-Veronica

name: Unique 3BR Townhouse w/ Roof Deck & Parking
summary: Lincoln Park townhome close to DePaul, the Loop, and the Lake! Walking distance to a wealth of bakeries, restaurants, boutiques, and parks, and the Brown/Purple line. Our 3 bedrooms - and 2.5 baths! - make it an ideal layout for groups of friends, colleagues, or families traveling together. Everything you might want to do or see in the city is at your fingertips - book today!
space: You'll walk into the foyer, which separates the main floor - on one side, our living room, and on the other, our kitchen with dining set. Upstairs, we have two bedrooms, each with a Queen-sized bed and attached bath. The master also has access to the roof deck. On the lower level, there's an additional bedroom with a Queen-sized bed, desk, and half-bath. The washer and dryer is on the lower level as well.
description: Lincoln Park townhome close to DePaul, the Loop, and the Lake! Walking distance to a wealth of bakeries, restaurants, boutiques, and parks, and the Brown/Purple line. Our 3 bedrooms - and 2.5 baths! - make it an ideal layout for groups of friends, colleagues, or families traveling together. Everything you might want to do or see in the city is at your fingertips - book today! You'll walk into the foyer, which separates the main floor - on one side, our living room, and on the other, our kitchen with dining set. Upstairs, we have two bedrooms, each with a Queen-sized bed and attached bath. The master also has access to the roof deck. On the lower level, there's an additional bedroom with a Queen-sized bed, desk, and half-bath. The washer and dryer is on the lower level as well. You'll have full access to my townhome, including (1) parking space behind the building, and the roof deck. Anchored by the university, this corner of Lincoln Park is humming with energy, coffee houses, and book
neighborhood_overview: Anchored by the university, this corner of Lincoln Park is humming with energy, coffee houses, and book stores. Thanks to a diverse population that includes professors, students, and people who appreciate beautiful architecture (many of the neighborhood's homes date to just after Chicago's fire) you'll find sandwich shops next to upscale eateries, and residential streets lined with many elegant aging trees, wrought iron fences and intricate landscaped patios.
notes: In addition to easy access to and from the Loop and DePaul, we're also close to the Steppenwolf Theatre and the Lincoln Park Zoo, and conveniently located near renowned restaurants like Boka and Alinea.
transit: My place is 2 minutes' walk away from the Armitage Brown/Purple line train station, and equally convenient to the Halsted and Armitage buses - it's almost more convenient to not have a car here!
access: You'll have full access to my townhome, including (1) parking space behind the building, and the roof deck.
house_rules: House Rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.   1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable.  2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee.  3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance.  4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily.  5.) Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid. 6.) Lockouts will result in a $150 fee per occurrence. Addi
host_about:
I grew up in a small town in rural Iowa; and although I'm still an Iowan at heart, Chicago is--and will always be--home. I love the Cubs (and sports in general), live music, good beer, documentaries, beach vacations, farm sanctuaries, and watching my daughter play soccer. 

Visitors to Chicago shouldn't miss: Wrigley Field, Montrose dog beach, the Riverwalk, the Art Museum, Lincoln Park Zoo, dinner at Sunda, brunch at Summer House, drinks at J. Parker or London House, and shopping on Armitage, Michigan, or Damen Aves.

neighborhood_overview: Historic Pullman was built in the (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) s by George Pullman as workers' housing for employees of his eponymous railroad car company, the Pullman Palace Car Company. He established behavioral standards that workers had to meet to live in the area and charged them rent. Pullman's architect, Solon Spencer Beman, was said to be extremely proud that he had met all the workers' needs within the neighborhood he designed. The distinctive rowhouses were comfortable by standards of the day, and contained such amenities as indoor plumbing, gas, and sewers. Pullman has been featured in several major motion pictures. Road to Perdition (starring Tom Hanks and Paul Newman) was filmed in historic Pullman, with scenes featuring the factory and how it "once was" with workers, as well as many other scenes of the neighborhood. The (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) film The Fugitive had several key scenes in Pullman. Harrison Ford was featured in a local bar, next running down an al
transit: Transportation : Car / Uber / Taxi to :  1.  McCormick Place - 18 min  2.  Hyde Park / University of Chicago  - 20 min 3. Chicago downtown - 25 min  Pullman is served by two Metra Electric Line stations; Kensington/115th Street station and Pullman/111th Street station. Most Metra suburban express trains passing through the area stop at the 115th Street station, and only local trains stop at the 111th Street station.

name: Enjoy Chicago’s Nightlife from Studio Apartment
summary: Keep updated on work demands at a vintage-style wooden desk in the working corner of this gorgeous studio apartment. The combination of metals, velvet and wood in the interior make this a beautiful apartment and a contemporary dream. Please note that this unit is located above a late night bar, which may add to the charm of it for some but may also pose to be a noise nuisance for light sleepers. We encourage you to read the reviews of past guests to make an informed decision.
space: Enjoy this gorgeous studio apartment that features a queen sized bed you won't ever want to leave! The combination of metals, velvet and wood make this a beautiful apartment and a contemporary dream. There is a Keurig coffee machine to help you start your day after a long night as well as basic cooking utensils and supplies. The full kitchen is complete with a stove top and oven which are perfect for cooking a light dinner. If you must get some work done, use the vintage style wooden desk at the working corner and access the free hi-speed wifi. You can also nurse a hangover in bed all day and catch up on your favorite episodes courtesy of the free Netflix provided or sleep in and block out the world using the white noise machine. At the end of the day, treat yourself to a hot shower and clean fresh towels provided by our professional cleaning team who sanitize the apartment after every use.

neighborhood_overview: Located in Uptown Chicago, the apartment is walking distance to beautiful Lake Michigan. It’s only 1.5 miles away from Wrigley Field, just 2 stops away on the red line train. For world cuisine, walk less than a mile to Argyle Street.
transit: The quickest and most inexpensive way to get around is via Uber or Lyft. To get downtown, It’s just a straight ride on Lakeshore Dr and you're there. With the Wilson train station just by the apartment, Public transportation is also a convenient option.  Public Transportation guide to the apartment:  To Wrigley Field: Two stops away on the red line from the Wilson Station not far from the apartment. To the Chicago Loop: Catch either the red or purple lines from the Wilson Station just a minute walk away from the apartment. Train and bus maps can be found and downloaded here:  (Website hidden by Airbnb)
access: When booking this unit you will have full and private access to the entire studio apartment. The check-in and check-out process is automatic and seamless. Check-in any time after 3 pm as late as you'd like, check-out on or before 11 am. Due to our cleaning schedule we cannot accommodate early check-ins or late check-outs. Should you like to store your baggage before or after your stay, we can recommend a useful app which offers affordable luggage storage around Chicago.
interaction: We want to make sure you have the most convenient experience possible. There is no need to meet in person in order to enter the property, access is via self check-in. Once booked, you will be e-mailed detailed instructions for your seamless check-in process. We are readily available for questions or concerns via Airbnb messaging. Of course in case of emergency you can always reach us via phone call. Please do not text us, as we may not be able to see a text immediately.

name: The Hamlin In Logan Square 4BR/2BA w/Parking!
summary: Welcome to The Hamlin in Logan Square!  Enjoy four bedrooms, two full bathrooms and complimentary two-car garage parking during your stay. This home is perfect for both family and group vacations in Chicago.  Logan Square is a thriving neighborhood filled with amazing art, restaurants and architecture. The neighborhood provides easy access to downtown while avoiding downtown hotel pricing for larger groups.
space: Upon entering the home you will walk into the sun-filled family room and front seating area. The interior design of the home was built around its mid century modern architecture.  The dining room is in an open layout alongside the newly remodeled kitchen for sharing meals with family and friends. During your stay we recommend heading over to “the square” and experiencing one of the best farmer’s markets around.  Each of the four bedrooms includes high comfort mattresses and ample closet space for your stay. The two full bathrooms include a cast iron tub and shower on the upstairs level and a large shower in the downstairs suite level.  The home also contains three flat screen HD TV’s for your viewing enjoyment. Cable TV available in the upstairs family room. Netflix and streaming included downstairs and upstairs master bedroom. WiFi included.  •Bedroom 1: King Bed  •Bedroom 2: Queen Bed  •Bedroom 3: Two Twin Beds  •Bedroom 4: Lower Level Suite with Queen Bed  •Air mattresses: 2 Queen

Each of the four bedrooms includes high comfort mattresses and ample closet space for your stay. The two full bathrooms include a cast iron tub and shower on the upstairs le
neighborhood_overview: Logan Square is consistently ranked one of the Top 25 hottest neighborhoods in the country. We have included some of our favorite spots on the site as well. Cubs fans you are only five miles from Wrigley Field. Park and Uber/Lyft to the game. The strong neighborly connection is evident all around-community gardens and a locally-run farmers market. "Local" being the key word when describing many aspects of the scene: ingredients are sourced locally at their buzz-worthy restaurants; corner taps tout local, craft brews; galleries showcase local artists; and concerts and street fests promote local, upstart bands. At the heart of this community is the actual "square" in Logan Square.  The boulevards themselves are widened thoroughfares that are set apart by grassy, landscaped medians and tall, stately trees that border both its sides. The neighborhood boasts four of them in total and these link together to form Chicago's "Emerald Necklace," an expansive system of interconnected parks and st
notes: Keyless entry WiFi included  Nest temperature controlled  Home Security system Garage parking  Backyard 2 full bathrooms *Important note: We ask all guests to please treat our home and neighbors with care and respect during your stay.  **NO SMOKING** Absolutely NO SMOKING. Smoking will result in automatic loss of security deposit. No exceptions.
transit: Location: The home is located on a quiet tree-lined street. You are within walking distance to public transportation or a short drive via Uber/Lyft/personal vehicle away form all that the Logan Square neighborhood has to offer. The actual "square" and center of the neighborhood is approximately a 10-15 minute walk from the home, or 1-2 minute car ride away. The best way to get to the square is walking through the neighborhood and enjoying the historic Logan Square architecture. Heading downtown? You have all of the above options available. *Travel Tip: dependent on group size Uber or Lyft may be most cost effective-even over public transportation.
access: The entire home (excluding utility rooms) is available for your enjoyment during your stay.
interaction: We are available anytime during your stay to assist and answer any questions you may have during your trip.
house_rules: We strive to make each and every guests trip to our home a special one. Please allow us to continue to do so by following a few basic house rules below- 1. Absolutely NO SMOKING. Smoking inside of the house will result in an automatic loss of security deposit.  2. Please respect our neighbors. We ask that you keep noise levels at a reasonable volume.  3. Please treat our home as you would your own. We love hosting and want to make sure we are able to provide a consistent and exceptional experience for all current and future guests.
host_about:
Welcome to Elevated Property Management and Vacation Rentals! 

My name is Garrett and along with my wife Kaylin we appreciate the amazing opportunity to host guests from all around the the world.

We are passionate about hosting and providing our guests with the best possible experience during their stay.

My background includes over 15 years in the health wellness and hospitality industries along with a 12 year career in the Army and Army Reserves. My wonderful wife Kaylin has been in real estate for over 12 years and is an amazing doggy Mom to our two best buds, Lolly & Louie. 

Thank you for taking the time to look at our homes and we look forward to hosting you soon!

neighborhood_overview: We’re located on the north side of Chicago in Lincoln Park, one of Chicago’s trendiest and safest neighborhoods. Our neighborhood is a wonderful mix of bustling streets packed with local restaurants and shops, as well as quiet tree-lined streets full of historic buildings. We’re also minutes away from many of Chicago’s most popular spots.
notes: FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS 1. “How do I get to ‘x’ from the apartment?/How far is the apartment from ‘x’?” Directions from our apartment to any point in the city are available via web search. We're around the corner from the Wrightwood 659 art gallery. Search for “Wrightwood 659 Gallery Chicago” in Maps, click the “Directions” button, then enter your point of interest. 2. When is check-in/check-out? Check-in is 3 p.m. or later but you're welcome to stop by anytime after 11:30 a.m. to drop off your bags in the living room. Check-out is at 11 a.m. Our cleaning staff will need access to the apartment at 11 a.m., but you’re welcome to leave your bags in the living room and pick them up by 2:30 p.m. at the latest. 3. “Can a third person stay in the room with me?” We allow a maximum of two guests per room. We have additional rooms available if you need accommodations for more than two people. Send us a message for more info. 4. Will I have my own private bathroom? The apartment has two share
transit: Because of our central location, we recommend leaving your car at home. Any point of interest in Chicago can easily be reached by walking, public transit, or Uber. ￫ The Fullerton Red/Brown/Purple Line 'L' train station is a 10-minute walk away. ￫ O'Hare is 55 minutes away via public transit and 30-45 minutes away via Uber. ￫ Midway is 60 minutes away via public transit and 35-50minutes away via Uber.
access: In addition to your room, you'll have shared access to the kitchen, living room, dining room, bathrooms, and washer/dryer.
host_about: I'm excited to host you for your next trip to Chicago!

name: Sunny and Funky Logan Square Garden Apartment
summary: Welcome to this charming, sun-filled garden apartment in hip Logan Square. Walk to nearby bars and restaurants, grocery stores, the 606 trail, coffee shops and beautiful parks. Come stay with us and enjoy all that Logan Square has to offer!
space: Garden unit with funky, urban appeal.  Slightly lower ceilings (about 7 1/2 feet), but you'll barely notice as it has a very spacious feel and FANTASTIC bright, natural light throughout the day.  We have a fully-stocked game shelf and a bookshelf with tons of great reads, plus a TV with Chromecast so you can watch shows from your Netflix/Amazon/Hulu/YouTube etc.  There is a very comfortable queen-sized bed, a futon couch, and a lovely chaise lounge (not pictured) for lounging.  Two bar stool chairs and a small dining table or sit at the kitchen bar to eat.  We have a fully-stocked kitchen with stove, refrigerator, microwave, toaster oven, coffee maker and plenty of pots and pans and cooking utensils, and you will have access to our grill for BBQing.  Feel free to relax in our yard - we have a deck with a large table and chairs and plenty of places to sit among the garden boxes boasting fresh veggies all summer long!
description: Welcome to this charming, sun-filled garden apartment in hip Logan Square. Walk to nearby bars and restaurants, grocery stores, the 606 trail, coffee shops and beautiful parks. Come stay with us and enjoy all that Logan Square has to offer! Garden unit with funky, urban appeal.  Slightly lower ceilings (about 7 1/2 feet), but you'll barely notice as it has a very spacious feel and FANTASTIC bright, natural light throughout the day.  We have a fully-stocked game shelf and a bookshelf with tons of great reads, plus a TV with Chromecast so you can watch shows from your Netflix/Amazon/Hulu/YouTube etc.  There is a very comfortable queen-sized bed, a futon couch, and a lovely chaise lounge (not pictured) for lounging.  Two bar stool chairs and a small dining table or sit at the kitchen bar to eat.  We have a fully-stocked kitchen with stove, refrigerator, microwave, toaster oven, coffee maker and plenty of pots and pans and cooking utensils, and you will have access to our grill for BBQing.
neighborhood_overview: We love our quiet, residential corner of Logan Square, especially because there are so many restaurants, bars, and shops within walking distance! Some of our favorites just within a few blocks are: Wyler Road (great craft beer and gourmet sandwiches), Weegees (speakeasy bar, with a shuffleboard table and outdoor garden), Ground Control (the BEST vegan/vegetarian food ever), Best Intentions (hip yet laid-back bar with a great cocktails, hip snacks, and a huge beer garden), Rico Fresh taqueria (small neighborhood taqueria tucked inside one of the grocery stores within walking distance - the huevos rancheros for breakfast are amazing if you can handle spicy!), Damn Fine Coffee (local roaster, great coffee and pastries), L'Patron tacos (there are no words to describe how much we love this place - unique, delicious tacos, etc), and so, so, so much more! Two great grocery stores within walking distance (Tony's and Rico Fresh), and tons more restaurants, bars, and one-of-a-kind shops just a 2
transit: Easy street parking if you're bringing a car.  If you're taking public transportation here is a city bus route 1.5 blocks away and we are a short 7 minute car ride from the 'L' train (Logan Square blue line stop).
access: Guests will have access to the entire private apartment, plus our yard.
interaction: We are available by phone, text and email at any time.
host_about: Hi! I'm a social worker by day, bluegrass singer by night. I love to dance, laugh, and meet new people and learn about their lives.

name: Beautiful 1BDRM + patio, walk2food&fun + parking
summary: Bright, lovely & modern private 1 bdrm, 1 bath apartment in a two unit house. Our place is perfectly located between popular Wicker Park and Logan Square, and off Humboldt Park. Easy walking or quick public transportation to the best bars, restaurants, or city attractions.  Private entrance to your apartment, through a secure gate and off of a quite tree lined street in Humboldt Park. Outdoor access to front patio with cute cafe table and chairs for your morning coffee while you plan your day.
space: Access to our spacious front yard between the house and our gate, lots of plants and a cafe table for morning coffee or evening drinks. The entire first floor, one bedroom, apartment is yours! Space includes living room with sectional couch and a side chair; Apple TV with Netflix, HBOgo, Showtime, Hulu and Amazon Prime TV; a desk for working at; dinning room for entertaining and eating; full kitchen with pots, pans, dishes and cups, cutting board, chef knives, spices and oils, and a coffee station with Dark Matter beans from us for you to enjoy; a full bathroom with claw foot tub and dreamy rain shower head, extra towels too! The bedroom has a queen bed with cozy down-alternative comforter, new fluffy pillows and a Dohm sound machine to help lull you to sleep amongst the city’s soundtrack of sirens, dog barks, and car horns. Parking is free on surrounding streets. Ours is residential permit, however the free areas are about 40 feet from our place. We can offer guests parking passes for
description: Bright, lovely & modern private 1 bdrm, 1 bath apartment in a two unit house. Our place is perfectly located between popular Wicker Park and Logan Square, and off Humboldt Park. Easy walking or quick public transportation to the best bars, restaurants, or city attractions.  Private entrance to your apartment, through a secure gate and off of a quite tree lined street in Humboldt Park. Outdoor access to front patio with cute cafe table and chairs for your morning coffee while you plan your day. Access to our spacious front yard between the house and our gate, lots of plants and a cafe table for morning coffee or evening drinks. The entire first floor, one bedroom, apartment is yours! Space includes living room with sectional couch and a side chair; Apple TV with Netflix, HBOgo, Showtime, Hulu and Amazon Prime TV; a desk for working at; dinning room for entertaining and eating; full kitchen with pots, pans, dishes and cups, cutting board, chef knives, spices and oils, and a coffee statio
neighborhood_overview: We are close to so much incredible stuff! Gorgeous and huge Humboldt Park (with swan boat rides summer-fall in the lagoon) is just down the block. Coffee and incredible pastries are available at Spinning J’s a block away. Head to Rootstock on the corner for specialty wines and the best burger you’ve ever had. Vegan brunch eats is a two block walk at Flying Saucer. Or late night burlesque and cocktails in around the corner at California Clipper. Or venture a mile out to Logan Square or Wicker Park for unlimited nightlife, restaurants, bars, art galleries, DJ sets and dance parties, theater and cinema.
transit: We have plenty of free and super easy parking around our place. We’ll tell you all about it after booking! The CTA Blue line is in walking distance, CTA busses are half a block away in all directions, and car ride companies (Lyft, Uber) are a plenty in this city!
access: The spacious front patio with cafe table and chairs is yours to use anytime. The entire first floor one bedroom, one bath, is also completely private and all yours. We will have WiFi password and security gate combination for guests after booking.
interaction: We live in the apartment above yours and have two dogs and an 11yo. We are fairly quite and have sturdy and insulated floors, so our everyday living noises aren’t heard too much by our guests. But our pups can get very excited to potty in the morning omg and prance about on the hardwood. We have a wonderful sound machine in the bnb to help this. We will give guests both our cell numbers for quick communication. We both work close to home, so if any issues arrive, we are only minutes away. We provide a small booklet in our guest home filled with attractions, museums, fantastic restaurants and bars based on type of food, atmosphere and price.
house_rules: Our place is your place, but treat it like your mom’s coming over for dinner.  -Clean any dishes or pots used; we’d prefer you do not use dishwasher unless it’s a full load.  -If using extra blankets, please leave on couch so we know to wash them for next guest. -Please place used towels in hamper. -Please put all garbage and recycling in their appropriate bins. We love Mother Earth! -**Please tie up trash upon leaving if you’ve thrown any sanitary napkins, tampons, and/or contraceptives in bin.**  -Please turn off majority of lights when leaving. -No extra guests (we are flexible on guests) or parties without informing us.  We’ll take care of the rest!

I'm an educated professional single guy, born & raised in Bombay and Chicago veteran for 22 years now. I come from a very hospitality oriented culture and family, so love hosting, entertaining, and meeting new people from all over the world and learning about them and their culture. I love traveling and make friends wherever I go.

I like good meals, dining out, craft beers, coffee, music, love cooking, dancing, culinary trips and traveling in general.  I recently took a year off to travel and covered 19 countries, which makes it 34 & counting. Occasional home brewer. My friends consider me a roaming Chicago GPS & guide to food & bar scene.

I look forward to hosting you in my humble abode.

name: Long Term Stay Across from Lincoln Park
summary: Newly renovated, high-end 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom condo across from Lincoln Park Zoo and Lake Michigan.  Full East and West views with huge balcony and great rooftoop deck.
space: Living Room - Nice open space with plenty of seating and a 78 inch TV to keep you entertained.  The space looks out over Lincoln Park and Lake Michigan.   Kitchen - Fully stocked with pots, pans, and dinnerware for you and your family or friends.  It includes Viking Appliances, 2 Drawer Dishwasher, Induction Cooktop, a large built-in Refrigerator and a Nespresso Machine.   Dining Room - Enjoy dinner in the dining room with a water feature and seating for 6.   Master Bedroom and Bathroom - You are bound to get a good nights sleep in the King Size Sleep Number bed with Egyptian Cotton Sheets.  You can fall asleep watching television on the 62 Inch TV.  The bathroom has a shower with an 8 head Electronic Kohler Shower System, Heated Towel Rack and a 12 Function Kohler toilet/bidet.   2nd Bedroom - Queen Sized Bed looking West 3rd Bedroom - Is currently a Pilates/storage room but it can be switched out to a queen sized bed if you would like.   The cost of the extra room is $25 per night.
