name: $2070 mAY SPECIALS! Clean &  Stylish 1BR
summary: A fully furnished home for your longer stay, complete with WiFi and everything you need to live. AFFORDABLE MONTHLY RATES ARE AVAILABLE!!! MAY - $2070 Cub fans, deep-dish fans, and history fans unite! Chicago is a fabulous getaway city for any interest, and our spacious studio apartment is the ideal place to stay while you’re here. Featuring modern decor, a full kitchen, and access to a 24/7 gym, your time in Chi-Town will be comfortable and convenient.
space: In the heart of trendy Uptown Chicago, our sophisticated studio apartment is the perfect launchpad for Windy City adventures or clinching that important business deal. Whatever brings you to town, you’ll rest easy in our charming, quiet neighborhood with easy access to the Red Line train to take you south to Downtown or north to Loyola and Evanston. Illuminated by sunny natural light, our 1-bedroom features a Queen-size bed, premium linens, and plenty of closet space so you can unpack and forget about your suitcase for a while. Enjoy the privacy of your own room, with doors that close and independently controlled air-conditioning units. In the living room, our couch unfolds into a Queen-size sofa bed - though it’s a lot more comfortable than your average pull-out! The apartment includes one full bathroom, with a shower, sink, and toilet. We’re all about helping you look (and smell) your best, so we provide shampoo, conditioner, and body wash in addition to hand soap and fluffy towels.
description: A fully furnished home for your longer stay, complete with WiFi and everything you need to live. AFFORDABLE MONTHLY RATES ARE AVAILABLE!!! MAY - $2070 Cub fans, deep-dish fans, and history fans unite! Chicago is a fabulous getaway city for any interest, and our spacious studio apartment is the ideal place to stay while you’re here. Featuring modern decor, a full kitchen, and access to a 24/7 gym, your time in Chi-Town will be comfortable and convenient. In the heart of trendy Uptown Chicago, our sophisticated studio apartment is the perfect launchpad for Windy City adventures or clinching that important business deal. Whatever brings you to town, you’ll rest easy in our charming, quiet neighborhood with easy access to the Red Line train to take you south to Downtown or north to Loyola and Evanston. Illuminated by sunny natural light, our 1-bedroom features a Queen-size bed, premium linens, and plenty of closet space so you can unpack and forget about your suitcase for a while. Enjoy th
neighborhood_overview: If you’re searching for Chicago history and culture, but you also want to get a good night’s sleep without the non-stop noise of Downtown, Uptown is your ‘hood. Uptown is slightly north of Downtown, and just a mile west of Montrose Beach and Lake Shore Drive. It’s safe, a little historic, a little trendy, and a perfect home base for any Chi-Town getaway. Our apartment is within walking distance of coffee shops (including a Starbucks), banks, and grocery stores. More information This hip neighborhood features old-school Chicago gems like the famed Riviera Theatre, the much-loved Fat Cat Restaurant & Bar, and easy access to Wrigley Field and Downtown via the Red Line from Lawrence Station. With plenty of good restaurants, vibrant bars, and exciting venues, you might find yourself not even wanting to venture downtown! Some of our favorite nearby restaurants include Fat Cat, where you can indulge in tasty pub grub over a game of pool, and Demera, an Ethiopian restaurant serving top-notch c
notes: ***WIFI service is an open connection  provided by the building management and is in the works of upgrading it. Outages may be experienced from time to time while the upgrade is on going. As of this moment, the service is NOT SUITABLE for remote work and can only cater mobile/portable devices. -All guest need to be attentive with the house rules during their stay as there are other tenants at the property. -Bath towels are provided per number of guest not per number of stay -Washcloths are not provided during your stay. You may send me a message though if you need them and I'll try my best to accommodate your request. -We have duvet covers on our bedding  (no top sheets). -Security Deposit maybe required on the following bookings: 1) Last minute bookings 2) Short weekend stays 3) Large groups  4) Guests with no reviews 5) Guests with incomplete profile 6) Instant Bookings  7) Some properties may not allow locals for short term reservations. -Please be aware that if you lose the key and
transit: Unless you’re really into parallel parking or overpriced meters, we recommend using public transportation to explore Chi-town. Our place is just a 5-minute walk to both the Argyle and Lawrence stations, where you can catch the Red Line. The Red Line will take you straight to Wrigley Field (7 minutes), or keep on riding for about 15 more minutes to access the best of Downtown. Grant/State Station is most convenient to the tasty restaurants of River North, and Lake Station puts you just 3 blocks from the Bean. P.S. Locals call the subway the “L.” Public transit is also an easy way to get to our place from O’Hare Airport, especially during rush hour. Hop on the Blue Line at the airport, and switch to the #51 bus at the Jefferson Park Transit Center. You’ll go from baggage claim to beautiful condo in only an hour! If ridesharing is more your style, Uber and Lyft are available throughout the Chicago metro. Keep in mind that traffic can pile up Downtown during major events or rush hour, whic
access: Ever dreamed about jetting off to your own Chicago apartment? Well, now’s your chance to bring that fantasy to life. During your stay, the whole apartment is yours and only yours.  But that’s not all! You’ll also have access to the building’s gym (open 24/7 and stocked with cardio machines and weights) and lobby lounge area. The building’s common spaces and your unit are accessible via elevator.
interaction: We’re all about giving you plenty of privacy and personal space, so we’ll be available by phone (call or text) during your stay.
house_rules: HOUSE RULES Please review and adhere to the following to avoid penalties and/or cancellation of booking: -No Drugs; Do not engage in any ILLEGAL activities anywhere on the property; ONLY guests included on the reservation are permitted on the premises. Fines will be issued for breaking these rules (Fine $100-$250). -If you break or damage something, please let me know and arrange for its replacement or repair. - The cleaning fee outlined in the profile is included to clean the place after your stay, however, if you leave the place excessively dirty, we may charge up to $100 additionally for the extra work incurred. -Quiet hours must be observed between 10pm-8am. -Lost key fee - $300 -Unsalvageable stained linens - $15/pc. -Unsalvageable stained towels - $10/pc. -Smoking - $300 -Unauthorized bringing of pets - $300 **-No pets, except dogs & cats. If you have a dog or a cat,  an extra $50 pet cleaning fee will be added to your reservation.
host_about:
Hostly was established in 2017 to help hosts and property owners navigate the wonderful world of Airbnb and vacation rentals. 

Our team of expert hosts are here to ensure your guests’ — and your — experience is awesome, and take the hassle out of your Airbnb or other short-term property rental management.

The team at Hostly is made up of talented local and international staff with extensive property management and hosting experience and will create a customized plan that incorporates your objectives, goals, and budget with utmost  transparency and clarity to grow a mutual partnership.

As metro Chicago's premier property management company with its strong local connections, Hostly offers a full line of services to create the best vacation rental experience.

Our services include: marketing, booking and payments, guest vetting, enhanced pricing model, guest support, on-site staffing coordination, cleaning service, and key delivery and checking in and out. We also offer value add-ons such as design and staging, creating your listing, and basically sharing our industry knowledge with you.

Today, Hostly stands out in the crowded property management field as the boutique vacation rental and BnB super hosts because of our consistent track record, our team and our focus on impeccable service as reflected in its online reputation and reviews.

name: Traveler's Dream - 1 bed in a shared bedroom
summary: Join us at Freehand Chicago Hotel for your travels in Chicago. Perfect for travelers here too long for a traditional hotel or for just 1 night; make us your home away from home. This listing is for one bunk for one person in a shared mixed/co-ed room with 4 bunks (up to 3 roommates). We have many options such as private standard rooms and private quad rooms. Please send us a message with any questions. $2 nightly resort fee plus tax paid at the property
space: Somewhere between a hostel and hotel, you'll find the amenities you need to get through anywhere from a night to a few months. This listing is for one twin bunk in a shared room with four total bunks, so you would have up to 3 roommates. The room has a private bathroom and lockers for storing valuables. You're welcome to use your own lock or the front desk sells combination padlocks for $5. Each bunk features a curtain for privacy, reading lamp, and power outlet. Linens and towels are included, as is regular housekeeping service. One piece of luggage, one personal item (such as a book bag), and 3-4 hanging items of clothing permitted. Please ask the front desk if you need complimentary extra towels, blankets, or toiletries.
description: Join us at Freehand Chicago Hotel for your travels in Chicago. Perfect for travelers here too long for a traditional hotel or for just 1 night; make us your home away from home. This listing is for one bunk for one person in a shared mixed/co-ed room with 4 bunks (up to 3 roommates). We have many options such as private standard rooms and private quad rooms. Please send us a message with any questions. $2 nightly resort fee plus tax paid at the property Somewhere between a hostel and hotel, you'll find the amenities you need to get through anywhere from a night to a few months. This listing is for one twin bunk in a shared room with four total bunks, so you would have up to 3 roommates. The room has a private bathroom and lockers for storing valuables. You're welcome to use your own lock or the front desk sells combination padlocks for $5. Each bunk features a curtain for privacy, reading lamp, and power outlet. Linens and towels are included, as is regular housekeeping service. One pi
neighborhood_overview: The Freehand Chicago is near the corner of Ohio and State st. It is downtown in the heart of River North, 1 block from the Magnificent Mile, 1 block across the River from The Loop, and a quick walk, bus, train, or taxi to anywhere you need to go.  We are also conveniently located across the street from Jewel, a major grocery store chain.
notes: To check-in, the hotel requires guests must be 18 or older with a government-issued photo ID. Your room and tax will be prepaid through Airbnb, but the hotel requires a $50 deposit for incidentals on a card at check-in per room, per stay. We do not accept gift cards, prepaid cards, or cash for incidentals. The deposit will be released back to your card at checkout provided you do not charge anything to your room. It takes most banks 3-7 business days to process the release. $2 nightly resort fee plus tax paid at the property For long term stays, guests must move rooms about every 30 days.
transit: The hotel offers parking to guests for $39 / night with free in and out privileges at a garage 1 block south of the hotel called The Grand Plaza. The address of the entrance is 18 W Grand Ave. If you park there, please just stop at the front desk for an exit ticket any time you'd like to take the car out.
access: Besides your bunk, you will also have access to all public spaces and amenities at the hotel including the Broken Shaker cocktail bar. Coin-operated and valet laundry are available.
interaction: Our front desk is staffed 24-hours per day for check-in, check-out, and to assist you with other requests.
house_rules: Chicago residents are not allowed to reserve or stay in shared rooms.  If you are a Chicago resident, feel free to book one of our private room listings.
host_about:
Freehand Chicago is housed in a 1927 building in Chicago’s vibrant River North neighborhood – home to some of the city’s best art galleries, boutiques and restaurants.

Freehand is a collection of hotels that combine the social culture of a hostel with innovative design, award-winning food and beverage, and a community-driven atmosphere. Each Freehand takes its cues from the surrounding neighborhood, with spaces that are a microcosm of the best each city has to offer.

space: An open, airy three-level modern home away from home is clean and comfortable. Three separate floors: an ideal retreat with plenty of space, and privacy should you prefer to close your bedroom. Perfect for a relaxing vacation, business meeting, or a special occasion. MAIN FLOOR SLEEPS 3: Futon sofa + Queen air mattress.  An unusually wide + long Chicago open floor concept. The entire space is bright featuring a living room+ 1/2 bath, Italian travertine stone fireplace, powder room, fully equipped chef’s kitchen +wet bar, and family room leading to 2 outdoor decks with Weber grill and seating, and 2 car garage.  SECOND FLOOR SLEEPS 11: Room#1  King+ queen+ fold-out twin. Room#2 Queen + twin size trundle. Room#3 Queen+full+fold-out twin. Vaulted ceilings, washer+dryer, 2 full bathrooms. Private spa-like Master Bath, Italian travertine stone, Zero-entry Steam Shower, oversized jetted Jacuzzi tub for two, double sink vanities. Plush beds, cozy linens, large walk-in closets+storage. neighborhood_overview: One of Chicago's creative epicenters lies just outside downtown Chicago in Wicker Park and Bucktown. These synonymous neighborhoods are famous for live music and nightlife, chef-driven restaurants and countless art galleries. The area has become a prevailing influence on Chicago's Michelin-rated, James Beard Award-winning dining scene, boasting some of the city's most sought-after tables. Wicker Park and Bucktown are also known for their palate pleasing nightcaps. Along North, Division, Milwaukee and Damen Avenues, you will find an unbelievable blend of vintage shops amid independently-owned boutiques touting fashions for both men and women, and luxury home goods and beauty products. On the same blocks are nationally-recognized names in fashion, and a mix of major retail chains that have also set up shop to satisfy the on-trend crowds.
notes: $75 per person per night beyond 16 guests.
transit: 10 min walking distance to a Blue-line station (Bucktown “Western” stop). If you are taking at Uber/Lyft/driving, 90/94 highway takes you to downtown Chicago in 15 min. North Avenue has a DIVVY bike rental stand, and the 72 North Avenue CTA bus travels east to the lakefront’s North Avenue Beach in 30 minutes.
access: Entire property

Sorry smokers, but 2nd & 3rd-hand smoke lingers for days, attaches to linens, towels and furniture-- I am an asthma sufferer. Smoking will result in an automatic loss of security deposit and you will be asked to leave.  -The person making the booking must be the same person checking in. -Please remove your shoes inside the home.  -Please respect our neighbors. Be mindful of noise levels, especially during "quiet" hours:  Rooftop use until 11 pm on weeknights; until 12am on Friday and Saturday. -If additional guests stay at this property other than the number stated in initial booking, the security deposit will be charged in full. -Please turn off the lights when leaving the home. -Pet Policy. Although I'm an animal lover, only non-shedding dogs are permitted.  Pet must be house-broken and cannot be left unattended. Please wal

host_about: I've lived in Chicago for most of my life. I love to travel, especially to remote, non-cliché parts of the world. Places that are rich in cultures and histories that shape our globalized world. One of my most memorable trips has been to the country of Myanmar (formerly known as Burma). Welcome to my home. I hope you have a wonderful stay.

summary: This is a private room in a two-bedroom apartment located in the heart of Wicker Park. Steps away from trendy shops, restaurants, and bars! We’re around the corner from the Damen “L” train Blue Line stop, so getting to and from O’Hare and downtown couldn’t be easier. Trove guests have exclusive FREE access to The Metropolitan, a members-only club located on the 66th and 67th floors of the Willis Tower. Check "Exclusive Trove Perks" in the listing description for details.
space: Thanks so much for your interest in staying at my place! My friends at Trove take care of your guest experience. I ask that you read through the entire listing to make sure that we're the right hosts for you. THIS TROVE HAS • Coffee maker • Fully-stocked kitchen • Iron and ironing board • Hair dryer • Body wash and shampoo • 40" HDTV with Netflix (no cable TV) EXCLUSIVE TROVE PERKS During your stay as a Trove guest, you receive a free membership to The Metropolitan, a members-only club located on the 66th and 67th floors of the Willis Tower.  Included with your membership: ✔ Upscale co-working space, dining, and bars ✔ Stunning views of Chicago and Lake Michigan ✔ Discounted express tickets to the Willis Tower Skydeck Metropolitan Club Hours: Monday–Friday: 7am – 10pm Saturday: 5pm – 10pm Sunday: Closed HAVE A QUESTION? Check out the “Other Things to Note” section of this listing for the answers to my most frequently asked questions.

neighborhood_overview: We’re located on the north side of Chicago in Wicker Park, one of Chicago’s trendiest and safest neighborhoods. Our neighborhood is a wonderful mix of bustling streets packed with local restaurants and shops, as well as quiet tree-lined streets full of historic buildings. We’re also minutes away from many of Chicago’s most popular spots.
notes: FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS 1. “How do I get to ‘x’ from the apartment?/How far is the apartment from ‘x’?” Excellent public transit directions from our apartment to any point in the city are available via web search. Our building is just a short walk from the Damen “L” train station. Search for “Damen blue line station” in Maps, click the “Directions” button, then enter your point of interest. 2. “Is there parking nearby?” Parking in Chicago is always difficult and even more so in the evening and during special events. We recommend using an app called SpotHero to reserve a nearby paid parking spot. We love SpotHero because it allows you to reserve a parking spot in advance so that you don’t have to worry about finding one the day you arrive. 3. When is check-in/check-out? Check-in is 3pm or later but you're welcome to stop by anytime after 11:30am to drop off your bags in the living room (just note that our staff will have your room ready by 3pm). Check-out is at 11am. Our cleaning sta
transit: Because of our central location, we recommend leaving your car at home. Any point of interest in Chicago can easily be reached by walking, public transit, or Uber. ￫ The Damen Blue line 'L' train station is a 4-minute walk away. ￫  O'Hare is 40 minutes away via public transit and 25-45 minutes away via Uber. ￫  Midway is 60 minutes away via public transit and 30-60 minutes away via Uber.
interaction: WHY STAY WITH TROVE? ⭐ Fast Communication We’re always on call to answer your questions, typically within 30 minutes. ⭐ Experienced Hosts We’ve hosted thousands of guests over five years. ⭐ Exclusive Perks Trove Guests have access to the Metropolitan Club, located in the Willis Tower. ⭐ Easy Self-Check-In Keyless access means no keys for you manage during your stay! ⭐ Central Location You’ll never be far from local spots to check out, sights to see, and public transit.
house_rules: 1) Only the reservation holder and guests added to the reservation via Airbnb may have access to the apartment.   2) As a courtesy to any other guests who you might be sharing the apartment with, please clean up after yourself immediately in the common areas. 3) As a courtesy to your fellow guests and to your neighbors, please keep noise to a minimum, especially between 9 pm - 9 am. 4) This is a non-smoking apartment. If smoke is detected, a cleaning fee of $150 will be charged. 5) No late check-outs. Check-out is at 11 am.  In order to compensate our cleaning assistants for lost time, additional charges will be sent if they're unable to begin their job at 11 am. One hour or less - $25 Each additional hour - $40 6) Damaged/stained/missing towels, bedding, and/or furnishings will incur additional fees. The per-item fees are as follows: Bedsheet- $12 Towel - $12 Pillow - $30 Pillowcase: $10 Comforter - $50 Clothes hangers - $3 Furnishings - Dependant on item

space: Please come enjoy a stay in our beautiful, comfortable condo in a quiet residential area. Our unit is located on the 4th floor of a walk-up building housing approximately 9 condo units. It is a 3 bedroom, 2 1/2 bathrooms unit with 20+ ft ceilings nestled in the heart of Chicago’s historic Lincoln Park community. You will have access to a private room with private bathroom in a uniquely different & beautiful 3 bedroom and 2 bathroom penthouse unit.  This is not your typical 3 bedroom layout. All the vintage charm like exposed brick, wide hallways, oversized windows, hardware floors mixed with todays modern necessities. Living room with great lofted ceilings leads to chef's kitchen.  Incredible rooftop deck with entry from unit. Best location, very close to red line, brown line, bookstores, restaurants, cafes, movie theater and Du Paul University. name: Lux Glass Palace W/ PARKING@Division Blue Line
summary: Sleep in a luxurious glass palace condo on the downtown leaning edge of Chicago's ultra hip Wicker Park neighborhood! Step around the corner from the Blue Line L train - 10 minutes to downtown. Enjoy more square feet, a glass rain shower, high end appliances, custom cabinetry, granite counters, Brazilian cherry floors and needed from detergent to coffee and cream stocked! Skip the cheap apartments with good photos and fake finishes; this ultra luxurious glass palace of a condo is the real deal!
space: Flooded with natural light and ceilings that soar to 11 feet, the feeling is airy, spacious, modern, ultra luxury.   Not just a bathtub, but a giant soaking tub.  Not just a shower, but a custom glass rain shower large enough to spin around.  Enjoy a private patio with actual privacy, blazingly fast WiFi, a wealth of coffee options/equipment, Q-tips, cotton balls, detergent, and more all stocked! This space goes so far above and beyond what you'll find in a hotel - prepare to be shocked, then amazed, and then just happy.   Want advice?  Looking for that local knowledge? We've got a guidebook telling you all the secrets! We're from Chicago. We live here. We know the place, and we have an opinion! neighborhood_overview: WICKER PARK!  The apartment is located in the center of Chicago's hipster haven! This awesome neighborhood has so many bars, restaurants, independent coffee joints and quirky shops you'll have no idea where to start - until you check out our curated guidebook! We'll give you a taste for starters. CHEESIES, a casual bar up Milwaukee Avenue, has killer grilled cheese. The Popper is the best choice on the menu. We've only been after a few drinks, but we see people there all day. Good sign.  EMPORIUM ARCADE BAR WICKER PARK is great for games and drinks. The cocktails are a little pricey, but you can play pinball for hours.   PIECE PIZZA AND BREWERY has the best New Haven style pizza outside of Connecticut, and even better, it's not from New York! Their Hefeweizen is top notch, and they have live music all the time. And at PODHALANKA you'll experience a Polish grandmother's welcome by stuffing you with blintzes, pierogies, and roast beef - and not taking 'please, no more' for an answer.  We
notes: Unit may be accessed by maintenance for repairs during stays. We do not accept instant bookings from residents of the Chicago metropolitan area as identified by profile city or phone number area code. If you live near Chicago and would like to book a stay, please send us a message with a little more information about your plans Immediately after booking, we will send you a few questions about your arrival time, contact info, number of guests/visitors, and to name our favorite restaurant, which is listed at the bottom of the house rules. Guests will not be allowed to check in without providing complete answers
transit: There's no need for a car here! - You're a 1 minute walk from the Division Blue Line L train!  7 minutes to downtown! - INSTANTLY get an Uber or Lyft! This neighborhood has no waiting. Take the CTA and go from front door to Chicago's...  SELFIE SPOTS - Millennium Park, the Bean (Cloud Gate), Maggie Daley Park: 18 min - Riverwalk: 18 min - Sears Tower / Willis Tower (Skydeck Chicago): 20 min - Magnificent Mile / Michigan Avenue shopping, Hancock Center (360 Chicago), Water Tower: 29 min - Lake Michigan, Oak Street Beach (terrific skyline view): 20 min WORLD-CLASS CULTURAL INSTITUTIONS - Art Institute of Chicago: 17 min - Grant Park, Buckingham Fountain, Chicago Marathon start: 23 min - Lincoln Park Zoo: 28 min (best free zoo in the world!) - Museum Campus, Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium, Adler Planetarium: 31 min - Chicago Symphony Orchestra: 17 min - Gene Siskel Film Center: 10 min - Museum of Contemporary Art: 18 min - Museum of Science and Industry (MSI): 20 min Uber BIGGEST THEATER SC
access: The entire apartment is yours during your stay!  Book for one person or seven, it doesn't matter - you WILL NOT share this apartment with anyone outside of your own group!  The building does not offer any common amenities. There is one free parking space on site included with the unit.
interaction: We love our guests! We are available to our guests!  We text our guests most of what they need!  ...WE NEED A NUMBER TO REACH YOU AT!  Please confirm your phone number and email address upon booking. IF YOU WILL NOT HAVE A US PHONE NUMBER, please download the Whats App phone texting app! We also have We Chat - please provide your ID!
house_rules: 1) Vaping only is allowed on your private balcony, with the balcony door shut. The rest of the property is smoke and vapor free. We have marijuana and tobacco chemical sensors on the property. They know it's not cooking smoke, They react to airborne particulate, not the smell on your clothes. The PolySens® technology works, so exit the building if you want to smoke/vape or you'll be fined $1000 and asked to leave. 2) Your reservation has paid for a specific number of guests on it. Anyone over this number, whether visiting or sleeping, you must have written permission from us. We have a hallway camera to verify. We're going to be totally fine with 95% of requests, but we do require you to clear it with us first. 3) Quiet hours are 10PM-8AM. Noise should not be heard coming from your apartment. This is a quiet residential building. 95% of our guests have no issues, and never hear from us. We will be sure to send you at least 2 warnings prior to asking anyone to leave, but one way or anot
host_about:
Rent Local Homes.  Real Homes; made for living with great kitchens, big living rooms, in awesome neighborhoods! We are Chicago locals with a passion for elevating the guest experience.

Everything you need is already stocked.  Cream and sweeteners for your coffee,  body wash and shampoo for the shower, and the right type of detergent for dishwashers and washing machines; we think of and stock ahead of time everything you need so you don’t have to.

A team of professionals are at your service before, during, and after your stay; we are always here if you have any questions.  Read our reviews.   Browse our photos.  Rent a local home with us.

name: Nice Private Room in Heart of Wicker Park
summary: Welcome to the coolest penthouse in Wicker Park, perfect for any trip to Chicago. This 3 bedroom exposed brick loft with high wood ceilings and a wonderful open floor plan is your perfect homebase in Chicago's most exciting neighborhood. Highlights include a bath tub equipped with jacuzzi jets, an in-unit washer and dryer, a Nespresso and coffee machines, and a high-end Bluetooth soundsystem. Find the city's best nightlife next door. This private room has a queen size bed, a TV, and a closet.
space: This loft receives tons of natural light from skylights and the bedroom's windows facing the bustling Milwaukee Avenue, the city's home of thrift stores and vintage shopping, as well as nightlife and restaurants. The main bathroom is very spacious, with a bathtub, a shower, two-sinks, and an in-unit washer and dryer. There is a smaller second bathroom. The apartment is filled with plants. Challenge your friends to a game of pool or enjoy the 65inch TV and soundsystem. All three bedrooms feature queen size beds with storage space for all your belongings.

ABOUT ROGERS PARK CHICAGO’S MOST DIVERSE NEIGHBORHOOD BY THE LAKE  For some it’s the abundance of beaches, for some it’s the great values in vintage apartments, for some it’s the diversity and culture that comes from its location
neighborhood_overview: ABOUT ROGERS PARK CHICAGO’S MOST DIVERSE NEIGHBORHOOD BY THE LAKE  For some it’s the abundance of beaches, for some it’s the great values in vintage apartments, for some it’s the diversity and culture that comes from its location between two universities. No one can say quite for sure what it is that makes Rogers Park uniquely Rogers Park. Rogers Park is one of the most culturally and economically diverse neighborhoods in Chicago and the nation. Located in the far northeast corner of the city, more than 80 languages are spoken among the community’s 63,000 residents. In Rogers Park, people celebrate diversity and value harmonious living. Residents of differing incomes and ages live side-by-side and work together to build a community where everyone, can live, work and succeed.  Its a diverse neighborhood with many small independent stores bar theaters and  restaurants. Close to public transportation for easy access to the Downtown Chicago and Evanston . Both Loyola and Northwestern Unive
transit: Both buses and Trains are conveniently close. Redline  and buses 3 blocks. Metra 10 blocks. 147 is the express bus for downtown

name: Magical Elf Quarters, parking $10, near blue line
summary: We recently moved into this house and heard rumors about strange happenings in and around it, but ignored them. The garden apartment was sealed shut and no matter how hard we tried, we could not open it. One day the door was mysteriously ajar. We entered what looks like house elf quarters! We’re muggles, but the family before us must not have been. Elves are very small, so be warned, the ceilings are very low. Anyone 6’ or taller may want to book elsewhere, or be ready to slouch.
space: The space has 2 bedrooms. One with a queen bed and one with a full size bed. Both bedrooms have closets. The living room has a couch and a 50” Netflix enabled (amazon fire stick) television. The bathroom has a stand up shower, no tub. The dining rooms seats 4-5. The kitchen includes a coffee maker, toaster, microwave, refrigerator, and stove. The entire apartment is yours. It is below another apartment so there may be some noise/footsteps, but we do our best to keep it down at night and early in the morning. The ceilings are about 6’ tall and lower in some places, so please consider this before booking. Please let us know if you’re interested in purchasing parking passes PRIOR to your arrival, each pass is an additional $10 for 24 hours of street parking. We may have last minute passes available, so don’t hesitate to ask, but requesting parking while booking is the best way to ensure that we’re able to provide you with as many passes as you’ll need. neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is quiet and safe with a residential feel to it. There is a bar at the end of the street and other nearby places to eat and drink up Belmont if you want to escape the quiet neighborhood. We’re very close to public transportation as well.
notes: Quiet hours: Sun-Thurs 9pm-6am Fri-Sat 2am-8am WARNING: Low ceilings, around 6’ high and lower in some areas.  This is a garden apartment so it’s below another apartment. Some noise/footsteps should be expected. I can not guarantee an early check-in time. I can usually make it happen, but it depends on when the previous guests check out and how much of a mess is left behind. For this reason, I can never guarantee an exact time when guests request early check-in. Please let me know if you would like to check in early and I  do my best to get the place ready for you ASAP! I will send you a message as soon as it is available for check-in. I do not offer luggage drop off prior to check-in time or late check-outs. R (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)
transit: We are a 6 minute walk from the Belmont blue line stop which will take you just about anywhere in the city. We offer $10/day parking passes if you wish to drive yourself around and need a safe place to park your car at night, just inquire when booking. Uber and Lyft drivers are always in the area and offer safe affordable transportation options.
access: Guests have a private entrance and are welcome to enjoy the entire apartment.
interaction: The space is entirely private so we rarely see guests face to face. Please let me know what time you plan on checking in and out prior to your arrival. Please also mark yourself checked in or send me a message when you arrive, as well as when you check out so that I can have the space available for the next guest as soon as possible. Thank you! We live in the same building but travel quite frequently . Ideally, I will be around to assist with anything you need. If we will be out of town, I will definitely let you know beforehand and make sure you have everything you need to make the stay comfortable.

neighborhood_overview: The South Loop is a dynamic mix of attractions and histories that the neighborhood tends to be seen as many different things to many different people. Consider the assorted areas that comprise the South Loop: Much of its eastern edge is encompassed by the Museum Campus, an impressive collection of cultural treasures that includes the Field Museum, Adler Planetarium and Shedd Aquarium. This campus sits on scenic lakefront parklands that are an extension of Grant Park. With 319 acres of green space and recreational fields, Grant Park is known as "Chicago's front yard" to locals and also plays host to major city events such as Taste of Chicago, Chicago Blues Festival and Lollapalooza.  Jutting out further into Lake Michigan is Northerly Island, a peninsula sought out by nature lovers, while along the southern edge the sports fans know Soldier Field as the stadium for the beloved Chicago Bears football team. Meeting attendees are most familiar with McCormick Place, the largest convention c

summary: Hottest neighborhood in Chicago, Wicker Park/Ukrainian Village. Steps from best bars and restaurants on Division Street (Parlor, Dove's Luncheonette, Machine, Black Bull, Smoke Daddy, Boundary, FatPour, and more). Walking distance to Milwaukee avenue and North Avenue, home to the hottest bars (including uber famous Rainbow Club). The unit has 2 bedrooms, in-unit laundry, Mini Bar, full kitchen with dishwasher, hardwood floors, private decks and super fast Wifi. Amazing view of the City Skyline.
space: If this is your first booking on Airbnb? Use this link to receive $40 off your stay: www.airbnb.com/c/nilsag46 This is a very spacious modern apartment with 10-foot ceilings and plenty of natural sunlight. Two private bedrooms furnished with queen-sized beds. Common space features a queen size sofa . Towels, sheets, soap, shampoo, conditioner, and hair dryer/iron, are provided and the place is cleaned thoroughly before guest arrival.  The unit has an in-unit hotel laundry, cozy nook for eating, mini bar, full kitchen and patio.

neighborhood_overview: Location, location, location. According to a popular city neighborhood guide, "Chicago's triumvirate of coolness is comprised of Wicker Park, Bucktown, and Ukrainian Village." Well, we are right here in the middle! - East Ukrainian Village/ Wicker Park - a vibrant, safe and fun, extremely walkable neighborhood that entices Chicagoans and tourists alike to visit and explore our great dining, culture and nightlife entertainment options. With its abundance of cafes and coffee shops, modern boutiques and classic vintage resellers, record stores and live music venues, dive bars and fancy lounges, fine gourmet restaurants and street food vendors, our area has something for everyone to enjoy and explore. Only three blocks away from busy Damen, Division and Chicago Avenue, Wood is a quiet and quaint side street, serene, and lined with century-old trees. Your sleep will not be disturbed.
notes: Lively & safe walkable neighborhood with tons of bars and restaurants (fit for foodies!). Walking distance to the 606 Bloomingdale Trail. Shopping includes upscale stores, small boutiques, thrift stores and everything in between. We are a super pet-friendly building, we do charge a $49 pet fee. Plenty of free street parking available, we do rent out our garage please inquire for details.
transit: Getting around METRO "L"  BLUE LINE TRAIN: 10 minute walk to either Damen or Division stops of Blue Line that connects O'Hare to downtown/ Loop and many other great neighborhoods in the city. BUS: Bus is a great way to get around in Chicago and you can use the same Ventra card you use for the metro train 5 blocks to the Chicago Avenue Bus --- gets you downtown in 15 minutes!4 blocks to the Damen Bus 1 block to the Augusta Bus3 blocks to the Division Bus TAXI/ UBER: You'll have a very easy time hailing a cab a few blocks from the apartment on Division, Damen or Chicago Ave. Cab ride downtown is 5-10 minutes and $9-15. Try Uber or Lyft much cheaper for door to door service. DIVVY Bikes: Chicago has an awesome bike sharing system --- it's $7/ day for unlimited number of rides – there are stations all around a few blocks away from the apartment.  Divvy is a great and fun way to explore the city like a local and to connect to Damen/ Division train from the apartment in just a 5 minute walk.
access: Make yourself comfortable! Guests are welcome to use the fully-equipped kitchen as they would at home.  There is a full-size washer/dryer in the unit - feel free to use it. Wifi is free.
interaction: You will have the entire apartment to yourselves, but I'm happy to share my love of Chicago should you have any questions!
house_rules: Smoking allowed on Patio and outside areas.Extra fees for additional guests not on the booking  49$ Fee per each guest/per day after 4 guests

neighborhood_overview: Historic Pullman was built in the (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) s by George Pullman as workers' housing for employees of his eponymous railroad car company, the Pullman Palace Car Company. He established behavioral standards that workers had to meet to live in the area and charged them rent. Pullman's architect, Solon Spencer Beman, was said to be extremely proud that he had met all the workers' needs within the neighborhood he designed. The distinctive rowhouses were comfortable by standards of the day, and contained such amenities as indoor plumbing, gas, and sewers. Pullman has been featured in several major motion pictures. Road to Perdition (starring Tom Hanks and Paul Newman) was filmed in historic Pullman, with scenes featuring the factory and how it "once was" with workers, as well as many other scenes of the neighborhood. The (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) film The Fugitive had several key scenes in Pullman. Harrison Ford was featured in a local bar, next running down an al
transit: Transportation : Car / Uber / Taxi to :  1.  McCormick Place - 18 min  2.  Hyde Park / University of Chicago  - 20 min 3. Chicago downtown - 25 min  Pullman is served by two Metra Electric Line stations; Kensington/115th Street station and Pullman/111th Street station. Most Metra suburban express trains passing through the area stop at the 115th Street station, and only local trains stop at the 111th Street station.

name: private room front (K2)
summary: Welcome to Chicago! We are opening up our two spaces like a hostel. You will have weekly cleaning provided for free.   We have a huge well-lit space in a very safe neighborhood.  Everything included: sheets, towels, shampoo, conditioner, lotion, paper towels, toilet paper, garbage bags, detergent for w/d and dishwasher, snacks, coffee/tea, cups, plates, bowls, flatware, and much much more. Weekly cleaning included.
space: This is a super upgraded century old building. It has all wood floors throughout, a brand new modern kitchen, (complete with top of the line dishwasher, washer/dryer), a tankless water heater, and a brand new furnace. It's as deluxe as you will find. And because it's old and has hardwood floors it's important to be mindful of the sound of clomping feet! It is a walkup, one flight (no elevator). There is loads of sunlight and in the spring we just leave the windows open to let in cool air and the sounds of spring. At dusk you will be introduced to a cacophony of cicadas. So prepare for that. It's amazing when they are in season.  We have cardinal and blue breast robin, that nest nearby so they will wake you up naturally if you have the windows open. It's magical! Another great feature if you dig nature. Or just close the windows and use a yucky alarm clock. We have a lovely front yard and an awesome backyard with furniture.

neighborhood_overview: Lovely, friendly, with kids and dogs and old people (and some new families too). It's not a trendy/hip neighborhood (just yet) so there is a lack of a huge amount of walking to restaurants and marketing shopping. However there are a few nice places that you can walk, and which I will recommend. There are loads of grocery stores about a mile away in every direction. We especially like the 24 hour hamburger stand (Suzie's) in the summer time, for shakes and grilled goodies. A Peruvian place is one block away. Kalbi is on Lawrence and is one of the best Korean BBQ in the US (and a dive). Trust me. A greasy spoon for breakfast is Golden Nugget. New to the hood is the amazing Old Irving Brewing brewpub which many guests frequent several times per week because it's so good and so close. Other stuff: I prefer Sarapino's or Lou Malnati's  for pizza, #1 Chop Suey for Chinese, and PotBelly for sandwiches. We have a couple Starbucks as well as two awesome independent coffee shops (Cafe Urbano and
notes: You will have neighbors above (me!) and below (long term regular tenants). We have never had an issue. As long as you don't have a lot of guests partying all night, we will all get along perfectly.
transit: Really easy actually. It's about a 10  minute walk, with luggage,  to the Blue Line which goes to the Loop in 25 min or outbound to O'Hare in about 20.  We can provide detailed instructions on how to get here from either airport using the L. You can park on the street if you are traveling by car. If you prefer to use taxis  from the airport you can do that in their taxi line. Once you are here, taxis and  Uber cars are available to pick you up within a few minutes. Most likely you will want to use the Blue Line to go into and out of the city, You can stop at any of the great urban neighborhoods on the way in (Irving Park, Logan Square,  Bucktown/Wicker Park at the North & Damen stop, for example). You can take the Blue Line straight in to Clark and Lake to transfer to Orange, Brown, Purple, Pink and Greeen lines, or on to the Jackson stop and walk three blocks over to Michigan Avenue and you will be at the Chicago Architecture Foundation about a block from the Art Institute. Buses and
access: You can use the entire place.
interaction: You can always call or text me. I am available for anything related to the apartment or the community. Just reach out. This is a self contained flat and you will have full access to it for your stay. I live in the building and am available if you want to chat about things to do, places to see, or how to get around.  Or you can be entirely on your own. You will find a guide to our favorite things to do and places to go inside the "book" box on the  coffee table and part of it is included in the neighobrhood description below.
house_rules: We completely renovated the nearly 100 year old building in 2014. All new plumbing, water service, mechanicals, floors, new bath rooms with huge walk in shower and fully appointed kitchen with new appliances, Kuerig coffee maker (a wide selection of k coup coffee and tea bags), toaster (we provide the bread and muffins)  etc. So everything works.   Regarding our old building: You will hear the tenants downstairs moving around and they will hear you if you have the TV or music turned up or if you have loud voices or stomp around. Please moderate your sound, including your footsteps, so that we minimize disturbing the neighbors, especially after 10pm. We welcome families with children, however we do not rent to individuals or groups under the age of 21.   No drugs, no smoking.  If you smoke, there is a $500 cleaning fee. If you do drugs? We will ask you to leave.  Pets may be allowed if we discuss it beforehand.  If you bring a pet, we require a $250 security deposit for the pet, in addi
host_about:
I am a divorced father of four. That's my three youngest kids in the scooter sidecar with me. My oldest is all grown up and just graduated from law school in Texas. 
I worked for Apple. I currently consult with companies about technology/internet/social media/marketing/branding. We own the entire building and I work and live (some of the time) on the third floor with tenants on first floor. We use AirBnB for the Garden Apartment (totally private), the second floor is a hostel style AirBnB, and upstairs on the 3rd floor we have up to three bedrooms that are available most days and every other weekend (when my kids are not staying with me).
I enjoy going on bike rides to the beach with my kids, and my girlfriend and her kids. I love to read and I am a tech geek. I am a coffee OR tea drinker and after drinking both black for almost forty years, I have started using cream in them — a habit I picked up in Nairobi, Kenya a couple years ago when I was doing some missionary work (plus my girlfriend uses cream and so I have no choice). 
If I had to pick some things I can't live without: my girlfriend (and her boys); my kids; my technology; my morning coffee; my fellowship; and my friends. And I love to watch movies. Old. New. Comedy. Mystery. Action. It doesn't matter. I like them all. 
I enjoy working out — lifting weights and riding a bike, plus I am a life-long swimmer. I also just started playing hockey! At age 52! Crazy. 
We have been hosting guests for three years now. We have over 141 reviews. We are a SuperHost. We love this. And we are really good at it.
I am a pretty laid back guy. I like things to be neat and tidy, but it's hard to do without motivation. AirBnB has been the motivation to get our place all tricked out and we are very proud of it. We hope you will enjoy staying here. All of our units are in a great neighborhood—in a great city. We have lots of suggestions for fun stuff to do, not the typical touristy stuff, but cool Chicago things that Chicagoans like to do/see.

name: Borders Wicker Park / 10 min walk to Damen subway
summary: Great place 1.5 blocks to both Bucktown and Wicker Park. Looking at the map airbnb displays I am 1 block south of North Ave and 1 block west of Westnern Ave. Stay close to some of the most fun and exciting neighborhoods in Chicago in addition to having easy access to the main tourist attractions: 20 - 30 minutes away by public transportation.  My place is a 5 to 10 minute walk to many restaurants, bars, parks and 2 blue line subway stops (Damen or Western). The 606 Trail just a 1/4 mile away!
space: It's a modern two bedroom apartment with central ac, good size bedroom and comfy bed. The place borders Bucktown and Wicker Park and very close to Logan Square. All are walkable.

neighborhood_overview: My place is the perfect place to base yourself to explore Wicker Park, Bucktown, Logan Square and Ukrainian village. My place is close to many cafes, restaurants, bars, parks and 2 blue line subway stops. Great restaurants in the area: Hash, Rangoli, Handlebar (Vegetarian!),  Thai Lagoon, Runa Japanese in addition to Big Star, Dove's Luncheonette, Piece Pizza and my favorite - Sultan's Market! My place borders Wicker Park / Bucktown and is a 10 to 15 minute walk to Ukrainian Village. Logan Square is a 10 - 15 minute walk north or a 1 to 2 stop el ride away from the Western blue line stop.
notes: Please note that the bed is a "full size futon" with a thick futon mattress on top of the old futon mattress. There have been plenty of couples and friends who have shared the bed with comfort. I usually have coffee available for those that like coffee in the morning. If there are fruits in the fruit bowl in the kitchen, feel free to grab some! I moved May 1, so please see bottom of listing for the other 147 reviews of my old place.
transit: The apartment is easily accessible to downtown and other neighborhoods via public transportation. SUBWAY: Both the Damen & Western Blue Subway stops are 10 minutes walking. Great for getting to/from the airport via the Western stop or heading downtown via Damen or Western Ave stops. BUS: -72 (North Ave bus) - 24 hour bus one block north of my apartment. Take this bus and you'll be at the Damen blue line in 3 - 4 minutes. Take it all the way to the lake and you'll be hanging out in Old Town / North Ave beach in no time! -49 (Western bus) - 24 hr bus 1.5 blocks east of my apartment. Take it north for 3 minutes to be at the Western blue line subway. -70 (Division bus) - Walk about 8 minutes south and you'll catch the Division bus. Easy access to the Gold Coast / Old Town. Runs till around 11 pm Overall, getting downtown/Loop (door to door) takes about 20-30 minutes.
access: You are renting a private room in an apartment in which I live full time. You'll definitely have access to the whole apartment. Welcome!
interaction: I give my guests space but am available when needed I understand most guests rather do their own thing, so that is the approach I mostly go with. However, I'm open to interacting with guests if they are open to that.  I'm a friendly host who has traveled the world and loves to help and host fellow travelers. I'll definitely give you detailed info on the neighborhood and how to get around via public transportation. I can provide you a lot of great information about the area and city in general.
house_rules: - Shoes off please at the entrance. - No guests allowed. - No parties or gatherings at the apartment.
host_about:
I love traveling to other countries, learning about other cultures and seeing live music.  My favorite countries so far are Brazil, Ethiopia, Turkey, Nepal and so many others!  I left the corporate world and started a job that allows me to do that.  Overall, I am an easy going guy who enjoys meeting new people and eating good food! 

I'm a very active person, so I can definitely give you tips and information on places to eat, concerts, non-touristy things to do in Chicago and anything else you might want to know to make your trip to Chicago more enjoyable.  I love telling people about all the great things you can do in Chicago as well as providing information that makes their trip a lot easier.

There are several nearby restaurants, coffee shops, and a brand new, full service Mariano's grocery store just 3 blocks away.  You will hear fireworks during baseball season as we are a stones throw away from The White Sox stadium as well as Soldier Field, Mc Cormick Convention Center and the Chicago Museum campus.  There are also several nearby cultural, entertainment & nightlife venues.
transit: We are 2 miles away from Mc Cormick Convention Center, 3 miles away from downtown Chicago and a 1/2 Block walk away from the King Drive bus, that will get you to both in a flash.  We are 3 blocks away from the Greenline train station that will take you to downtown Chicago in 15 minutes and has connections to both Midway & O'Hare airports. We are a few blocks away from both Lake Shore Drive & 90/94 expressway and a quick Uber/Lyft ride away from everything else.

name: The Bee Room
summary: Come enjoy a stay in a four-poster bed in a big, sunny private room and bathroom (!) in a new condo in what Wikipedia calls one of the most ethnically diverse neighborhoods in the US. And couldn't be closer to public transit if you tried.
space: The Bee Room is private room with an adjacent private bathroom. I've got a bathroom in my room that I'll use during your stay so you can feel free to spread out.  The neighborhood is vibrant and active round the clock, but the space is quite quiet and comfortable.

And couldn't be closer to public transit if you tried. The Bee Room is private room with an adjacent private bathroom. I've got a bathroom in my room that I'll use during your stay so you can feel free to spread out.  The neighborhood is vibrant and active round the clock, but the space is quite quiet and comfortable. In addition to the Bee Room, closet, and bathroom, the kitchen, dining room, and living room/TV are all available to you, as well as a deck out back when the weather's nice. I have laundry in unit, just let me know if you intend to use it and I'll make sure it's empty. I am happy to help you navigate your way around and provide recommendations for your stay but I'm also more than happy to leave you to your own devices. My schedule puts me out and about most of the day, but I'm always availab
neighborhood_overview: Albany Park is an incredibly diverse, vibrant, eclectic neighborhood with something for everyone. While we're not known as a big "bar/nightlife" neighborhood, our excellent position on the public transit grid will get you around the city in no time. AP is a great example of a true "Chicago neighborhood": you can spend the day out and about and after, come retreat to the relative quiet of the Bee Room.
transit: With three major transit lines converging at my intersection, you can really get anywhere and anything that Chicago has to offer. Of the four transit lines that converge in Albany Park, one runs until late evening, two run well into the night and the third runs 24 hours. You can take the Brown line to downtown Chicago in about 45 minutes or connect to the Orange line to Midway Airport. The #81 Lawrence bus runs 24 hours and  connects to the Blue line for easy O'Hare transport. Cabs and Ubers are plentiful around the clock. Street parking isn't the best, but it's manageable. Watch out for side streets with permit parking. Most all major Chicago attractions and landmarks (performance venues, stadiums, universities, museums) are accessible via a $2.25 'L' train ride with easy and usually free transfers between lines. Street parking isn't terribly easy, but it is possible (I do it every day without a special permit). If you're planning to drive in Chicago, let me know and I will make sure
access: In addition to the Bee Room, closet, and bathroom, the kitchen, dining room, and living room/TV are all available to you, as well as a deck out back when the weather's nice. I have laundry in unit, just let me know if you intend to use it and I'll make sure it's empty.
interaction: I am happy to help you navigate your way around and provide recommendations for your stay but I'm also more than happy to leave you to your own devices. My schedule puts me out and about most of the day, but I'm always available via text message, email, or phone call. I'm a night owl with evening hours so unless I'm headed out the door to work, I'm most likely going to sleep through the morning. I don't mind if you're up and about in the morning, just so long as it's not too loud!
house_rules: As long as you generally leave the place how you find it, then I'm a pretty happy camper. Smokers welcome on the back deck.

name: Cozy 2 BDRMs Apt in Chinatown & Close to McCormick
summary: Located in the heart of Chinatown and close to McCormick Place, with easy access to public transportation into the city. Chinatown is the largest Asian neighborhood in the city with food choices such as Chinese Cuisine, Dim Sum, Asian Fusion, and Szechwan cooking . You don't want to miss the bubble tea, Thai ice cream, and crepes.
space: Space Our condo apartment is conveniently situated inside a fairly new complex building.  The interior is very simple, clean, and cozy. There are 2 bedrooms: one with 1 Queen Bed and one with 2 twin beds. This space is perfect for a family who prefers to live in an apartment with kitchen and laundry. ~Please Note~ For 5-6 person group, there are 2 futon sofas in the living room. The Home Essentials Wifi internet connection, Smart TV with local channels. The Amenities Towels, Shampoo/Conditioner, Body Wash, Hand Soap, Hair Dryer, Slippers The Kitchen Cookware, Microwave, Stove, Pots/Pans, Knife Set, Silverware, Dishes, Bowls, Plates, Linens, and Cups Parking Free, on premises, designated parking space right by the entrance of the building.

neighborhood_overview: Located right outside of Chinatown, one of the biggest cultural spaces in the country. There are many restaurants, grocery stores, pharmacy, banks, gift shops, beauty shops within walking distance. Many downtown Chicago attractions are also easily accessible through public transportation, such as the CTA Red Line.
notes: There are neighbors in this complex. Please be gentle with your voice. Please contact me immediately if you encounter any issues with the neighbors and I will address it right away. Noise Warning - Because our building is centrally located near railways and near the Chinatown Fire Station, you can sometimes hear the hustle of the City. Common areas are maintained by homeowners association and standards varies at times.
transit: This unit is conveniently located near major highways such as I-90/94 Kennedy, I-55 Stevenson. The "L' red line station is a few minutes walk, providing easy access to all major attractions: Millennium Park-Cloud Gate (the BEAN) Soldier Field Museum Campus Willis (Sears) Tower  In the morning you can enjoy a breeze of fresh air around the corner at Ping Tom Memorial Park. Then you can hop on the water taxi stationed in the park that takes you up the Chicago River to the heart of the beautiful Chicago downtown. Along the ride, you can relax and enjoy the famous Chicago Architecture.   Uber,  Lyft or train are conveniently available. Street parking is also available.

Extra fee will be assessed for intensive cleaning. 11) My place is not equipped for infant, child, or handicap. Your decision to book will be your own discretion and extra charge may apply. 12) Towels should be use for shower only and not for cleaning makeups or any other soiled objects. Misused towel will be charge $10 each.

summary: Unbelievable location in Old Town with tons of space, 2 bedrooms, 2 full bathrooms, and outdoor patio space. 2 queen beds, 2 sofa beds, a huge (and very comfortable) L couch, and 3 air mattresses are provided. space: This is a single floor unit with the absolute best location. It is less than a 2 minute walk from the Sedgwick Brown Line, which makes visiting the city quick and affordable. The thing that I enjoy most about this location is the proximity to the restaurants and entertainment in Old Town. My favorite Italian restaurant in the city, Topo Gigio, is located on Wells Street. If Italian isn't your thing, there are many other very popular restaurants and bars located on Wells Street. Also, the world famous Second City Comedy Club is right down the street. Check out the people who got their start at Second City! I highly recommend checking out a show. There is 1 oversized master bedroom with en suite full bathroom. There is also a twin bed, sofa bed, and 2 air mattresses in the den portion of the master bedroom. The second bedroom is simple but offers a queen bed as well. If Italian isn't your thing, there are many other very popular restaurants and bars located on Wells Street. Also, the world famous Second City Comedy Club is right down the street. neighborhood_overview: This apartment is one block from the University of Chicago.  The post office is located right at the corner.  A brand new Jewels Osco grocery store is located at the corner along with  new diners and shopping on the next block.
notes: There is no tv in the apartment since most guests are students.  However, there is free wifi.  Also, check-in is after 5 p.m.  If you wish to come earlier, you will be directed to our sister location for which you can arrive as early as 7 a.m.  Afterwards, our concierge service will bring you to our location for check in.  YOU MUST contact us prior to arrival or you will not get in past the gate.
transit: The cottage grove block is located at the corner.  The green line 'Cottage Grove' train stop is located within walking distance from  just 2 blocks away.
access: Feel free to make yourself at home! Guests have access to the kitchen, bathroom, back deck, and our basement laundry units (payment required to use machines). We're located right next to Jewels grocery store, so if you're planning on a longer stay, stock up. Our apartment is located on the 2nd floor so if you're a smoker, feel free to use our back deck. Just be mindful of our neighbors. They use the space too! If you are interested in arriving earlier than 5p.m., we have another location in which you may arrive to hold your luggage for free or wait for a small fee...until your check-in time of arrival
interaction: The apartment is primarily used by guests.  However, the host is on premise.
house_rules: No smoking inside and no shoes in house No smoking Inside and no shoes in the house
host_about:
Love Travelers,  traveling and everything in between.  Born and raised in Chicago, we became avid travellers and barter enthusiasts. With over 20 years of travelling we could easily write our own book on travelling on a budget.  We PRIDE ourselves on the deals we obtain.  A week in Ireland, rental of two 3 bedroom entire homes for $45! FOUR Chicago Bull playoff games during the Michael Jordan Era included 4th row floor seats, box seats...$100 total!  Travelled europe thru 15 countries for $500 including accommodations and food...for a 3 month period!  And this was BEFORE Airbnb. We can go on.  We are geeked when we find a deal and become just plain silly with happiness at an unbelievable deal.  Even upon confirmation, our website for our guests are filled with free and things to do for CRAZY CHEAP.  'Spend like a spencer, but live like a king!'  

We feel everyone should open their minds to new things, cultural experiences and diversity.  Only then can you understand people thru their eyes and not some narrow minded media coverage.  By letting their experience be your experience will help you better understand people in a true and raw sense.  That's why we simply love Airbnb.  It places you in parts of the world where you probably wouldn't have gone but always wanted to go to get that 'local' feel with a local and trusted host.   

Since we don't travel as much as I used to....Let your experience be our experience!

We look forward to meeting you.

name: 1-Need a room? Spacious, near trains, great price!
summary: Are you looking for a five-star hotel? Unfortunately this isn't it. If you are looking for a simple/spacious place to sleep as you explore Chicago with easy access to the bus/train, you've found the place!  20 min Uber/Lyft/cab from O'Hare.  Quick 81 Lawrence bus to the Blue Line train to access downtown or O'Hare airport. 8 min walk to the Brown Line train.  35 mins from the Loop during rush hour to see the world famous Chicago Bean, Sears Tower and all types of restaurants.  Book today!
space: Is this room all booked for your dates? Book one of our other rooms in the same apartment by clicking on my photo (above "Warren" by the title of this listing) and looking at our availability in one of the other bedrooms! This listing is for bedroom 1 (twin bed) in a 5 bedroom apartment. The bed can fit two people but if you need more room / a bigger bed, feel free to book one of our other rooms which have queen beds. Easy access to transportation, easy check in.  Chicago is a terrific place for all types of restaurants, great food, easy transportation. 10 min Uber/Lyft/bus/train rides in any direction will take you to Indian, Japanese, Ethiopian, Mexican and any other type of food you can think of. Don't want to go to far? We have all of those great restaurants in our Albany Park neighborhood as our neighborhood is SUPER diverse and I absolutely love it. You can easily get to our place by 81 Lawrence bus which takes you directly to the Jefferson Park Blue Line (easy access to O'Hare a

notes: Hello!  We'd absolutely love to have you stay with us! We've been blessed in our short time to have travelers from all over the world stay with us from France, to Malaysia to the U.S. We've had casual travelers to people here on work trips. The happiest stays guests have had here are the people that understand what we're offering. You're basically in a hostel / shared space. A very low priced room with a lock, on average from $19-$24 USD per night depending on demand, that gives you a simple place to sleep and amenities to use. It is our guests that understand that this is NOT the Hilton or Marriott that have enjoyed this extremely low priced stay. This is my parents home, and we come through and clean often but ultimately there's daily wear and tear as on any given day our five rooms can be occupied with around 1-2 people each that you might see in passing. Our bathrooms will often look used, our floors will often be scuffed, our kitchen will look like someone actually uses it because
transit: Blue Line Brown Line 81 Lawrence Bus 82 Kimball Bus
access: All common areas on the second floor (living room, kitchen, bathroom) as well as your own room. The back porch is not included in the experience and thus has not been fixed up. While we certainly have the back area for emergency exiting in the case of fire, please ONLY exit regularly through the front door. You won't be able to lock the back apartment door but you CAN automatically lock the front apartment door by pressing the Yale logo while holding the door shut.
interaction: Message us on the app for questions! We're working folks so obviously if we don't respond we're probably in a meeting, but once we get the chance to reply we will!
house_rules: Please wash your dishes after each use. Please keep relatively quiet throughout your stay, especially after 10 p.m. We have long-term tenants that rent downstairs (and of course us upstairs) but they also would love to interact with you if you see them! Feel free to say hi! They're all working folks/grad school students. Please help us save on the electric bill by turning off the air-conditioning / bedroom lights whenever you leave the apartment. We'd really appreciate it.

neighborhood_overview: Anchored by a beautiful stretch of shoreline to the east and dotted with train stops from two ‘L' lines, Lakeview is one of Chicago's liveliest and most accessible neighborhoods. Several distinct areas — East Lakeview, Central Lakeview, Boystown and Wrigleyville — meld together to form a lakefront community that celebrates diversity and boasts something for every type of visitor. Hit the bustling commercial districts along Belmont Avenue, Lincoln Avenue, Southport Avenue, Clark Street, Halsted Street and Broadway Street to shop — be it for vintage frocks, designer jeans or leather biker gear — or live it up with the locals at the seemingly endless options for bars and pubs, and the dozens of celebrated restaurants in between. Arts and culture come in the form of live music venues, several summer street festivals and a thriving scene for theater, dance and comedy (Belmont Theater District is a stellar collection of nearly 20 independent companies). Not to be outdone by its extraordinary
transit: Easy access (7 minute walk!) to the Red/Brown/Purple line trains with transit all over the city, as well as many bus lines. 15 minute walk to Wrigley Field.
access: You'll have the whole house, as well as the pleasant back patio. We have a large table & chairs to bring out if you'd like to dine al fresco!

Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check out-out fee.  3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the house or on the premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance.  4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily.  5.) Pets are not allowed at the property. 6.) Please do not use the fireplace. 7.) No food or shoes upstairs, please. This house is best suited to a visiting fa

name: Your three bedroom home away from home
summary: This is a three bedroom apartment. One of the bedrooms has a full sized bed, a desk, and a dresser. The second bedroom is my sewing room and has a queen sized air mattress. The third bedroom is the master bedroom and has a queen sized bed and ensuite bath.  The living room is huge. There is a couch that turns into a full sized bed, another couch with 100% goose down feathers, and can also have a full sized air mattress. There is a fully equipped kitchen, and a separate dinning room. There is one parking spot available behind the apartment.
space: When we're away our home can be your home while you're away. There is space for 10 people to sleep so it is great for a large group. No more than 12 people are allowed in the house at a time (no big parties) and please be respectful of the neighbors and keep the noise levels down especially at night.

summary: **Common spaces professionally-cleaned twice/week** **April/May - big weekly and monthly discounts!** Clean, professionally-run airbnb apartment with 3 private rooms. Apt is a 1st floor/basement duplex in a 3-story building and features Chicago vintage charm with great natural lighting, built-in shelving, new granite counters in kitchen / bathroom & hardwood floors. Prime location with easy access to Wrigley, theaters, restaurants/bars, as well as lots of public transportation options.

neighborhood_overview: The Lakeview neighborhood and Wrigleyville / Boystown areas have so much within walking distance, you won't want to leave! There are numerous bakeries, boutique stores, theaters, and lively bars and restaurants. If you do feel like venturing out of the neighborhood, Lakeview is very centrally located. Head south to visit Lincoln Park, River North, and the Loop, or west to visit Buck Town or Logan square.
notes: GUESTS Only those on the reservation are permitted in the unit/room. BEDROOM LOCKS All 3 bedrooms may be locked from the inside but do not have keys to be locked from the outside. We do provide combination locks for your bedroom closet and you'll be given the code at check-in to securely store your belongings. COURTESY  Please note this unit is on a quiet residential street. We respect our neighbors, and for that reason the building's outdoor space is not for socializing, and instead we request guests socialize indoors only. We request quiet hours from 9pm-8am. CLEANING  We expect guests to clean up after themselves in shared spaces. For example, throw away any trash, rinse coffee maker after use, wipe down bathroom sink/kitchen counter after use, etc. We also request that personal bathroom items are kept in your bedroom when not in use. This keeps the shared spaces clean for all guests.
transit: PARKING Free, public street parking is available in the area. Some streets require a permit, and others do not. We offer permits at the unit for a small fee. Please note you may have to circle the block a few times to find a spot. If you prefer paid parking with a designated spot, I recommend using Spot-Hero to find nearby options that work for you. Once you're here, public transportation and/or Uber are the easiest ways to get around the city. CLOSEST STOPS o Addison red train: .3 mi, trains go uptown/downtown o Belmont purple/brown train stop: .6 mi, trains go uptown/downtown o 77, 8, 36 bus and more to go up/downtown or east/west Stations all have machines that sell Ventra passes (name of provider). You can also purchase Ventra cards at Walgreens. You can either purchase a single ride ticket, a re-loadable Ventra card, or an unlimited pass (1, 3, or 7 days). Multiple people may share a re-loadable card and fares will be deducted for each person; however, the unlimited passes can not
access: In addition to your PRIVATE ROOM, you have use of the kitchen, living room, dining room, bathroom, and building's basement laundry room (all SHARED spaces). KEYS  There is self-entry with key pad anytime from 4pm on.  A set of keys will be in your room. CENTRAL HEAT/AC The unit has central heat/AC with a thermostat within the unit. The temperature is kept between 65-70 degrees for the comfort of all guests. Each bedroom also electric baseboard heat so guests can control within the bedroom. LAUNDRY The building has a washer and dryer in the basement that's shared by all apartments. Each costs $1.50 and accepts quarters. PUBLIC TRANSIT The closet train stop is the Addison red line. There are also many bus stops. We provide additional info about public transit upon booking. PARKING Free, public street parking is available in the area. Some streets require a permit, and others do not. We offer permits at the unit for a small fee. Please note you may have to circle the block a few times to
interaction: My goal is to ensure you have the most enjoyable and comfortable stay in Chicago. I have a detailed guest guidebook (emailed in advance and printed in unit) that includes info about the apt, neighborhood, and city to help maximize your time in the city. If you'd like additional assistance with anything, I'm more than happy to help! Depending on my work travel schedule, I may or may not be in town; however, I'm always accessible via phone or email for any questions that arise.
house_rules: - - REQUESTS:  1) Please treat the home with respect.   2) Please be courteous of others in building and neighbors. All socializing must be kept indoors after 9pm, and we request quiet time indoors from 9pm-8am.   3) The only guests allowed in the building are those on the reservation.   4) Personal bathroom items must be kept in your room. If you use common spaces, we request you tidy up after yourself to keep the spaces clean for everyone (for example, kitchen items in dishwasher, wipe counters, throw out trash, etc).   CHECK IN/OUT: Standard check-in time is 4pm (or later). Standard check-out time is by 10am. If unit is not vacated by check-out time or notes are not followed, additional cleaning charges may apply.   For check out, I ask that you:  - turn off lights in your room/common spaces  - ensure your used kitchen items are in dishwasher - dispose of any of your food/drink from fridge and any of your trash from room/common spaces. If it's more than what fits in the trash can, p
host_about:
I began using Airbnb as a traveler in the fall of 2013, and I'm hooked! Staying in someone's home allows you to experience the area in a truly authentic way - no more hotels for me! As of May 2014, I began hosting in Chicago and have since hosted thousands of guests from around the world. I love helping others make the most of their visits. 

As a host, I am personable, responsive, and detail-oriented. I take great pride in the comfort and cleanliness of each apartment. You can trust that when staying in any one of our properties, you will feel at home.

name: Huge, Pet Friendly East Albany Park Apartment
summary: Stay in a classic Chicago 2-flat with vintage charm and modern amenities. This sunny top floor space has an updated kitchen & bath with everything you need including in-unit laundry & Central AC.  Experience life on the border of two great neighborhoods, Albany Park & Ravenswood Manor. Walk west to Kedzie or north to Lawrence for delicious, culturally-diverse cuisine or walk east to Lincoln Square shops & restaurants. Take the Kedzie Brown Line east to the Lakeview & Lincoln Park neighborhoods.
space: Large 2 bedroom apartment on the top floor of an updated Chicago 2 flat. Walking distance to Kedzie Brown Line train station, buses, restaurants and bars. Free Street Parking.

Attractions include:  McCormick place, Soldiers Field, Museum Campus, The Chicago Symphony Orchestra, The Art Institute, Millennium Park, Grant Park, The Magnificent Mile, , White Sox Park, Chinatown, and much more!  Transportation is outside the front door and only steps away from the train.

neighborhood_overview: Historic Pullman was built in the (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) s by George Pullman as workers' housing for employees of his eponymous railroad car company, the Pullman Palace Car Company. He established behavioral standards that workers had to meet to live in the area and charged them rent. Pullman's architect, Solon Spencer Beman, was said to be extremely proud that he had met all the workers' needs within the neighborhood he designed. The distinctive rowhouses were comfortable by standards of the day, and contained such amenities as indoor plumbing, gas, and sewers. Pullman has been featured in several major motion pictures. Road to Perdition (starring Tom Hanks and Paul Newman) was filmed in historic Pullman, with scenes featuring the factory and how it "once was" with workers, as well as many other scenes of the neighborhood. The (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) film The Fugitive had several key scenes in Pullman. Harrison Ford was featured in a local bar, next running down an al
transit: Transportation : Car / Uber / Taxi to :  1.  McCormick Place - 18 min  2.  Hyde Park / University of Chicago  - 20 min 3. Chicago downtown - 25 min  Pullman is served by two Metra Electric Line stations; Kensington/115th Street station and Pullman/111th Street station. Most Metra suburban express trains passing through the area stop at the 115th Street station, and only local trains stop at the 111th Street station.
