name: ✪ 30% Monthly Discount for Cozy 1 Bedroom ✪
summary: Great location in Chicago's Wicker Park/Bucktown community only two blocks from the Blue Line (Division), that takes you in the city in 5 min as well as directly to Chicago O'Hare International Airport. ✔ FREE Ultra High-Speed WiFi ✔ FREE Street Parking ✔ 1 Bottle of Wine with your stay ✔ Direct Transit to O'Hare Airport ✔ 2 Blocks to Restaurants, Shopping and Bars on Division ✔ Streaming Services (Netflix, Hulu, etc. no cable) ✔ Washer & Dryer ✔ Car available if needed
space: Our space is everything you could want on your city getaway! A minimal, modern design and a space to unwind at the end of an adventurous day! Tucked in the most convenient spot, you feel like you're at home. Just a short walk to the 'Blue Line' that takes you to downtown and the airport, to Mott St (awesome asian fusion kitchen) or our coffee favorite, The Den (you can't beat their vibe!). Enjoy the city or relax on the beach, this condo offers everything you need on a real getaway. A fully stocked kitchen offers you the opportunity to cook, extra freebies like toiletries in the bathroom, a nespresso coffee machine and a steamer for your clothes make sure you're all set for a great time. If you are in need of a car in Chicago, we are renting our vehicle a 'Mercedes C300' as an add on to your stay. If you are interested in renting the vehicle or would like more information, please ask us about it and we will guide you in the right direction.

name: Beautiful 2 bed room apartment
summary: very nice place, close to public transportation and great dining spots
space: If you are looking for a private, cozy, and comfortable place then this is just right for you. Here you can relax and lay back in a newly renovated unit with a private entrance for your convenience. Let the travel stress behind you and enjoy your stay in that great City we call HOME, Chicago We are located on the north side in the Avondale neighborhood. It's very easy to get anywhere in the city as CTA bus and train connections are great and the expressways (I90/94) are just a Minute from the location. The blue line stop near Kimball and Belmont will take you right in the heart of the city and also to O’Hare. host_about:
I moved to Chicago in 2002 and live here with my lovely husband in the Avondale neighborhood. We love flowers and growing our own vegetables like you can see in our pics and also make our own honey. For that we do have 2 beehives in our backyard.
We love to have people from all over the world in our house and treat them as we would treat our own family. Often we do have a BBQ or a meal together and also share  a breakfast. I love to bake and so you will find all the time a treat and can stop for a good cup of European coffee. We also love animals and have our self 3  cats and 2 birds. If you wish to bring your pet also, please let us know and we do our Best to make it possible.
We are both strong believers in the christian faith and love to travel to places like the library of Billy Graham in NC or the Bill Gaither studios in Alexandria, IN. We love to watch Seinfeld and anything else what is funny and we consider our self as very outgoing and easy to live with people.

name: Private Beautiful 1 Bedroom Condo
summary: Your own private beautiful 1 bedroom condo with new living room and dining room furniture.  Includes full kitchen and dining area.  You also have access to the front porch.  [[ This location may require a user to have prior review(s) in order to book ]]
space: The best way to relax is in your own personal space.  Here you will have your own beautiful space with new living room and dining room furniture and a large sized room .  It is a one bedroom but there is plenty of room for 4 people total.  One bed in the bedroom sleeps 2 and there is a Futon couch as well in the living room.   The kitchen is ENORMOUS!  Pictures do not do it justice. There is also a smart  TV with free WiFi  If you have a login to Netflix, Hulu, Vudu, Amazon..you will be able to catch up on your shows if you choose to.  The apartment is minutes from Chicago's Blue Line Subway ("L") system.  The train will take you downtown or to O'Hare Airport in minutes. You are also 2 minutes away from I-90 which will also take you into downtown or to O'Hare.  Uber pickup is always 5 minutes or less.   [[This listing requires potential guest(s) to have and meet a minimum number of reviews in order to book]]

You are also 2 minutes away from I-90 which will also take you int
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in the Norwood Park neighborhood of Chicago. Rated one of Chicago's safest neighborhoods.  The neighborhood has a mix of young couples, Chicago Policeman, Chicago Firemen, Chicago city workers,  teachers, construction workers, labor union workers, engineers and other blue collar workers. Norwood Park is known especially for its abundance of green lawns, parks, churchyards, and trees are its visual hallmarks.  The street is extremely quite and you can easily enjoy a nice night on the front porch.  Plenty of restaurants in the area as well as your choice of local bars.  Rosemont is 15 minutes away which has places such as Toby Keith's I love this bar, Fogo de Chao, Gibson's Steak House, Morton's Steak House, Giordano's, Hofbräuhaus Chicago, Harry Caray's...this is Chicago and we love to eat...I can keep going on.  Just ask me for recommendations.
notes: The neighborhood has lots of restaurants and neighborhood bars should you choose to stay local.  I can provide a list for you during your stay.
transit: You hit the jackpot when it comes to easy transportation.  You are a short walk to Chicago's subway system.  The line by the apartment is called the Blue Line and has a direct connection to Downtown Chicago on one end and O'Hare Airport on the other.  If you fly in you can catch the blue line inside O'Hare airport and take it right to the Apartment.  It is literally a 10 minute walk.  Interstate 90 is also 2 minutes away.  It also gives you access to downtown and O'Hare.  Uber has always picked me up in 5 minutes or less
access: You have will have access to the entire apartment as well as access to the huge front porch.  You will also have access to the grill in the back yard and patio weather permitting.
interaction: I will be available 95% of the time should you need help with anything.  Just call me or shoot me a text
house_rules: No smoking in the condo. and obviously no parties.  No loud Music after 11:00 PM and before 8:00 AM  Please be courteous to our neighbors and other people that live in the building.  No shoes in the Condo. Please let me know before you use the grill or Patio in the back yard.   Please treat the space as if it were your own.  If you are not home please turn off the lights. Please note that Kung Fu fighting is definitely NOT allowed. You cannot use the place to host your own personal events You cannot use the place to host your parties or reunions of any kind You cannot use the place to host your own out of town guests (for example if you are from Chicago you cannot use my place as your listing) Only authorized guest will be allowed to stay in the listing If a party is being held you will be asked to leave immediately and the police will be called if necessary (Chicago has an epidemic of parties being held at Aribnb's) [[This listing may require potential guest(s) to meet a minimum numbe

name: Domio | Loop | Luxury 3 Floor Townhouse + Pool and Fitness Center
summary: Complete your Chicago experience by staying in this stunning three floor townhouse in one of Chicago's most luxurious buildings. Conveniently situated in the Loop, this luxurious space was designed to make you feel at home. Whether traveling solo, with friends, or with family, see the best of art, culture, and food that Chicago has to offer and have an unforgettable stay at this Domio with incredible amenities.
space: Safety is our top priority.  To maintain a safe community for our guests, neighbors, and team members, we do conduct a background screening check for all reservations prior to your stay.  This screening includes checking the National Criminal & OFAC Database for felonies and the National Sex Offender Registry.  If you have any questions about this process, please contact us.Chicago Registration Number: PendingWe do not allow bookings from residents of Chicago and surrounding areas.Due to space limitations, there are only wristbands for two guests to access the pool For stays over 30 days, we require additional personal information and a signed License Agreement in order to accommodate the stay. All guests will be required to verify their information which includes a 3rd-party background check. This is to ensure your safety as well as the safety and well being of our neighbors and our homes. All information is confidential and will not be shared with anyone for any purposes outside of y

name: Private room, shared apartment, easy city access.
summary: This 2 story home is too much space for us, so we chose to turn the  2nd floor over to Airbnb;  This is an affordable way for folks to visit Chicago and for us to meet interesting people.  Edgewater is a beautiful, quiet,  safe  northside neighborhood with  beaches, theaters, grocery, shopping, restaurants, lake access, bike paths,  and Loyola University.  Heading downtown?  The CTA Red Line is just a 7 minute walk.  Be downtown in 40 minutes.  Have a car?  Street parking is always available.
space: This is our home and we take our responsibility to you seriously.  Your accommodations will always be clean, quiet, and comfortable.  The entire apartment has fresh paint and new mattresses.  I have two queen-sized  rooms listed on Airbnb, so please be aware that there may be up to4 guests sharing this space on any given night.  This is a 2nd floor apartment, so stairs are involved.  If you require assistance with luggage, please let us know.  We are happy to help.  I work throughout the neighborhood, have a flexible schedule and am usually no more than 10 minutes from home if any problems or needs arise during your stay.  Allergy sufferers or those phobic of dogs, please note that we have an adopted Italian Mastiff named Storm.  He's big (120+ lbs)  and while he may look intimidating,  he's very shy around guests, very quiet, and non-aggressive.
description: This 2 story home is too much space for us, so we chose to turn the  2nd floor over to Airbnb;  This is an affordable way for folks to visit Chicago and for us to meet interesting people.  Edgewater is a beautiful, quiet,  safe  northside neighborhood with  beaches, theaters, grocery, shopping, restaurants, lake access, bike paths,  and Loyola University.  Heading downtown?  The CTA Red Line is just a 7 minute walk.  Be downtown in 40 minutes.  Have a car?  Street parking is always available. This is our home and we take our responsibility to you seriously.  Your accommodations will always be clean, quiet, and comfortable.  The entire apartment has fresh paint and new mattresses.  I have two queen-sized  rooms listed on Airbnb, so please be aware that there may be up to4 guests sharing this space on any given night.  This is a 2nd floor apartment, so stairs are involved.  If you require assistance with luggage, please let us know.  We are happy to help.  I work throughout the neighborh
neighborhood_overview: Edgewater has been a great neighborhood for us.  So many of the things that guests and ourselves want access to are located right here -  restaurants, grocery stores, specialty shops, arts, entertainment, beaches, transportation - all located along a few major streets.  You get a safe, quiet, peaceful place to stay within walking distance of all these things,  but without the crowded sidewalks.  You can visit all of the downtown museums, galleries, stores, restaurants, beaches, and bike trails by taking a 30 minute ride on the Red LIne train while avoiding the expense and hassle of downtown parking.
notes: One of us is always there to greet you and orient you to the space.  If you have any special needs, please advise me in advance so I have ample time to make those accomodations.  If you will have a car, please advise me in advance so I can have a sufficient number of City of Chicago parking permits available upon arrival.
transit: Leave your car here (we provide overnight permits), take a 10 minute walk to the CTA Red Line (Granville Station), and you can be in the heart of downtown in 30 minutes.
access: You have shared access to the entire apartment, including Wi-Fi, kitchen, bathroom, dining room, living room, laundry room, yard and hot tub..  Kitchen access includes use of the refrigerator, microwave, Keurig, toaster, cookware and dishes.  Guests provide their own food.  Bathroom access includes shower, toilet, sink, towels, iron, ironing board and hairdryer.  Dining room access includes a dining table that can seat four.  Living room access includes two couches, basic cable television Netflix and YouTube.  Laundry room access includes one washer and one dryer.  Yard access includes outside seating, garden and hot tub.
interaction: This is our home, so we are  available  most any hour.  We welcome your company, but also respect your privacy.  We want your stay to be comfortable for both of us, so we openly invite you to let us know how much interaction you prefer.  We rent out two of the three rooms on this 2nd floor.  During the summer, almost always both rooms are full, but it is amazing to us just how well everyone gets along from places all around the world.
host_about: In 2015, I hit the reset button on my life; or maybe it was life's hand on the button.   I was in the 26th year of a high paying but dissatisfying job that I was afraid to leave.  I was in the 25th year of a mutually unhappy relationship to which I felt some moral obligation to stay.  I had few friends. little energy and few interests outside of work.  In retrospect, I was depressed.  First, she found someone new.  Then, I was let go due to budget cuts.  Although that year was filled with uncertainty, all of the sudden I felt so much lighter.  My previously miserable existence was not brimming with opportunities (the opportunities had been there, I had just grown to not recognize them).  My mantra became a sort of "why not".  I gave up my car, most of my possessions. and moved to the home of a friend in Chicago.  I had a hobby rock and mineral shop located in The Chicago Mosaic School.  I started spending long hours there every day.  I started becoming helpful... cleaning up, organizing, locating materials, running errands.  Soon the school hired me on as their Operations Officer.  I started becoming sociable too...accepting and extending invitations to dinner, concerts, movies, evenings spent just hanging out.  Soon I had more friends than I'd known in the last 25 years.  Good friends.  The kind who will speak to your face the same way they speak of you when you are not present.  Now, thanks to one of those friends, I am in this fantastic apartment, close to The Chicago Mosaic School.  I'm back to doing the things I enjoy... listening to alternative music, rock and fossil collecting, camping, bird watching, gardening, and spending quality time with those friends.  Many of my guests are friends and artists who come to Chicago throughout the year in order to take classes at The Chicago Mosaic School.  I enjoy hosting them and spending entertaining evenings together. In a world made up of so much conflict and competition, I personally find it very encouraging to see people of different ages, genders, education, vocation and experience come together cooperatively under one roof and connect with one another for an evening or a few days.  I hope everyone who elects to stay here departs with a smile.

Consequently, you will have the same attention to detail in this home. Newly rehabbed charming two-bedroom apartment in historic (c. 1886) building located on West Eugenie Street, one of the most beautiful residential streets in Chicago’s Old Town. name: Bottle Top -  2B/1BA Band Apt above Empty Bottle
summary: Sure, you can sit front row or stand side stage at a concert, but how about spending the night one full floor above the stage? That's right, you can rest your tired eyes and weary head on top of one of Chicago's most legendary venues: The Empty Bottle.  While the music may echo through the night and shake up the floorboards 'til the wee hours, we're sure it won't be a bother. You'll be too busy being a part of it all (Tickets are included during your stay + music is audible in the apartment).
space: The Bottle Top apartment above The Empty Bottle is quite literally above the stage and the music is very much a part of the experience during your stay including soundcheck in the afternoon, house music between sets, and bands playing at full volume until the early morning hours. There are quiet hours with plenty of time to get some good quality sleep (typically between 2am-11am). If you're seeking a restful, leisurely, call it an early night stay during your visit to Chicago, this is not the place for you. If you love music, enjoy a lively neighborhood bar atmosphere, and want to know what your favorite drummer's bass drum sounds like during soundcheck (over... and over... and over again), you'll have a blast.  The apartment is set up primarily for touring bands performing at Empty Bottle. It has an open layout - Both bedrooms are semi-private with curtains between rooms rather than doors. Access to the second bedroom (2 Queen Beds) is through the first bedroom (1 Queen Bed) which is

neighborhood_overview: Located northwest of the Loop between I-90 and I-290 and with quick access to public transportation, Chicago's Ukrainian Village is an easygoing residential neighborhood with many walkable restaurants, bars, cafes, coffee shops,  retail, and ample street parking. Wicker Park, Humboldt Park, West Town and the Loop are all close by as well. Bite Cafe (open morning through late night) is around the corner on Western, Amish Healthy Foods is directly across the street, and a 24 hour laundromat is within walking distance on Western Ave.
transit: Free and paid street parking is available on surrounding streets and throughout the neighborhood (Be mindful of permit-only parking on several surrounding streets). Bus stops are frequent along Western Ave and Blue Line CTA train stops are within one mile of the apartment. Ride-sharing services and taxis are quick to service the area.
interaction: Self check-in/out with keypad. Sarah (co-host) is local and is quick to respond via Airbnb message and in person (if necessary - your stay will be private unless you have a need for Sarah to visit in person).
house_rules: Be respectful of neighbors, neighborhood, and Empty Bottle patrons, artists and staff No additional visitors to the apartment without written approval from host Absolutely no parties or events. The party is downstairs and ends at last call.

name: Nice and cozy-McKinley apartment
summary: The apartment is big and modern. It’s great for a (all backgrounds) family who wants to skip the hotel to relax and be comfortable. The neighborhood, McKinley Park, is safe.  The apartment is near the train station (35th/Archer; Orange Line, .5 miles ), to the Guaranteed Field-home of the White Sox (2.3 miles), to the downtown attractions such as the Museum Campus (5.5 miles) and to the Millennium Park-the Bean (7.2 miles).

notes: I do not have a gas stove, but do have an electric range and other appliances. See pictures.  There are 38 steps to get to the apartment. Cardio morning exercise.

There are other floors occupied by current tenants and due to the security and liability purposes, the following rule is applied:   Guests & Visitors:  Only the specific guests noted in the booking are allowed on premises.  A violation of this Airbnb house rule will result in the immediate removal of all guests ( and any visitors) from the property without refund if there is a disturbance with more than the occupants specified in the listing, a $25 per guest fine will be charged .
host_about: I come from an Mexican American family and live with my husband, 3 beautiful girls and our pet Rex (German Shepherd).  We love spending time with friends and family with great food and drinks.  We're a sporty family, always busy with our girls with soccer and softball games.  Our life motto: family comes first no matter what. There is always time for family. Other things come second.

name: 1 Block from Subway, Heart of Walkable Lakeview!
summary: Unwind and enjoy the city in our Cozy and Clean Separated Guest Suite!  We live in the main, separable part of the unit across the hall from the suite. The guest suite is entirely separated from the main unit (you have you're own private entrance!). It is not a full unit, it is just two separate bedrooms with a private entrance. It is located in a 3rd floor walk up. The space is minimalist and is best used as a home base to return to at night after a day of exploring!
space: The apartment is two bedrooms, one large that includes a kitchenette and another, smaller, bedroom that has a private bathroom. It is important to note that the bathroom is only accessible by going through the bedroom first. The bedrooms in the unit are separate from the main unit and have their own door. THERE IS NO TV OR COMMON SPACE! The hallway is NOT part of the AirBnB space. Please be mindful of this.  This beautiful space in Lakeview has huge windows that overlook one of the most exciting streets in Lakeview! Enjoy easy access to all of the dining and cultural amenities that Lakeview has to offer. Only a 15-minute walk to both Wrigley Field and the lake. Please remember that this is my home and I live in the other unit. Particularly on weeknights, please do not be loud and be respectful. Also be aware that it is an old, creeky, Chicago apartment building and as such it can be chilly at night. But I do my best to keep my guests as warm as possible!
description: Unwind and enjoy the city in our Cozy and Clean Separated Guest Suite!  We live in the main, separable part of the unit across the hall from the suite. The guest suite is entirely separated from the main unit (you have you're own private entrance!). It is not a full unit, it is just two separate bedrooms with a private entrance. It is located in a 3rd floor walk up. The space is minimalist and is best used as a home base to return to at night after a day of exploring! The apartment is two bedrooms, one large that includes a kitchenette and another, smaller, bedroom that has a private bathroom. It is important to note that the bathroom is only accessible by going through the bedroom first. The bedrooms in the unit are separate from the main unit and have their own door. THERE IS NO TV OR COMMON SPACE! The hallway is NOT part of the AirBnB space. Please be mindful of this.  This beautiful space in Lakeview has huge windows that overlook one of the most exciting streets in Lakeview! Enjoy
neighborhood_overview: Lakeview is a charming, tree-lined, historic neighborhood in Chicago. With hundreds of restaurants, shops, and theatres, you'll never run out of things to do. Wrigley Field, Lake Michigan, Lincoln Park, and the shopping on Clark & Diversey are all within walking distance!
notes: There is not a full kitchen in this unit. There is only a kitchenette in the large bedroom that includes a mini-fridge, microwave, electric kettle, and dinnerware. The bathroom can only be accessed through one of the bedrooms. PLEASE do not unlock the other bathroom door and access through my hallway. AND THERE IS NO TV! And there is no parking.
transit: The apartment is immediately next to Belmont Station which includes the Red, Brown and Purple Lines. There is also a bus line on Belmont and another on Clark. The unit does not have parking but there are several lots in the area that can be reserved for days at a time. I highly suggest using SpotHero to easily reserve spots for discounted rates! There is also metered street parking on Belmont. However, I suggest getting around on public transportation as it is extremely affordable and accessible and you'll feel like a local!
access: Guests will have access to the two bedrooms and one bathroom that have their own private entrance. There is a roof deck that can be accessed upon request. The hallway and the main space are not part of the guests space. The hallway is strictly for entering the airBnB unit, not for accessing the other bathroom door or the main unit.
interaction: We live in the main space of the property and respect your privacy. Should you have any questions, we are available to answer them! Please message us through Airbnb first.
house_rules: Quiet after 10PM on weekdays. Do not use the hallway inbetween the guest suite and the main unit other than to come in and leave (it is not part of the unit).
host_about:
Stay where it counts. When you book a Loftium, you're contributing to the local community. Each Loftium is home to a local resident who hosts and lives right on-site, making sure your experience is a delightful one. All spaces are designed with your comfort in mind! We've made check-in and communication a breeze, and each home provides a beautiful and cozy place to rest your head during your travels. Every Loftium home and host is unique, and you'll always get a true neighborhood experience during your stay.

Visit a new community and book a Loftium in any of our cities: Seattle, Portland, Denver, San Diego, Phoenix, Chicago, Atlanta, Dallas, Charlotte, or Orlando. We can't wait for you to visit!

name: Penthouse Near Wrigley Field
summary: This beautifully furnished and spacious penthouse unit has tall windows and ceilings letting in loads of gorgeous light. It is perfectly located just a short walk to Wrigley Field, two train stations, and tons of bars and restaurants. (Just a 10 min train ride to Michigan Avenue!)  FREE street parking and 24-hour check-in!
space: Located on the top floor of a 3-flat, this stunning apartment provides lots of natural light and great views of the neighborhood. The apartment has two bedrooms with incredibly comfortable queen beds, a large bathroom, and one twin air mattress for a fifth guest. The back porch has chairs for relaxing outside and enjoying your morning coffee. Large and fully equipped kitchen ready to be enjoyed.
description: This beautifully furnished and spacious penthouse unit has tall windows and ceilings letting in loads of gorgeous light. It is perfectly located just a short walk to Wrigley Field, two train stations, and tons of bars and restaurants. (Just a 10 min train ride to Michigan Avenue!)  FREE street parking and 24-hour check-in! Located on the top floor of a 3-flat, this stunning apartment provides lots of natural light and great views of the neighborhood. The apartment has two bedrooms with incredibly comfortable queen beds, a large bathroom, and one twin air mattress for a fifth guest. The back porch has chairs for relaxing outside and enjoying your morning coffee. Large and fully equipped kitchen ready to be enjoyed. You will have full access to the entire apartment and back patio! I live just down the street and am always available by call or text to answer any questions you have or provide recommendations.  I am a self-proclaimed foodie and know all the best spots in the city. Just ask!
neighborhood_overview: Lakeview is a fun and vibrant area with beautiful town homes and tree lined streets and is a quick train ride to Michigan Ave. and the Loop. There is a great bar just around the corner from me...the kind where everybody knows you're name and they'll make you feel at home.  While you are within walking distance of shops, restaurants, and bars, the apartment is peaceful and quiet.
transit: Getting around is so easy!  The apartment is a 7 minute walk from both the Belmont and Wellington El stops offering a 10 minute train ride right into the city and Michigan Ave. There is free street parking available.  No need for a permit.
access: You will have full access to the entire apartment and back patio!
interaction: I live just down the street and am always available by call or text to answer any questions you have or provide recommendations.  I am a self-proclaimed foodie and know all the best spots in the city. Just ask!
house_rules: Enjoy yourself!  Get out and see the city or relax and enjoy the apartment.   You are welcome to have guests, but absolutely no parties. Dogs under 40lbs who are house trained and well mannered are permitted for a $100 pet fee per pup. If you break something, accidents happen, please be honest and tell me. Smoking is permitted outside on the back porch. There is a $250 security deposit listed but this is not charged to you when making the reservation. It is just the max amount a host can request if something is damaged.
host_about:
Hi, I'm Kim- lover of life and great experiences! I am a full-time Airbnb Consultant and Superhost.  I help people list their spaces on Airbnb while delighting travelers with personalized experiences. I am an avid traveler and used to live in Paris.  I wish AirBnB had been around when I was traveling Europe as it would have offered me a much more affordable way to travel.  Having wished it for myself, I like the idea of offering people a beautiful place to stay and great tips for enjoying this incredible city.  I am a self-proclaimed foodie and pride myself on knowing the best places to try in Chicago.  
My friends nicknamed me Martha Stewart years ago for my hosting skills, decorating, and cooking abilities.  I love hosting people and have even considered the idea of opening a B&B some day.

name: One Bedroom Apt w/ Private Terrace in West Loop
summary: This one bedroom apartment is modern, tastefully decorated, and spacious. The apartment includes washer / dryer, a full bath, king sized bed in separate full bedroom (not a studio!), living room and dining space. Kitchen is fully equipped with a coffee maker, Vitamix, fridge, stove, microwave and anything you need for cooking. The apartment also includes a 300 sqft private terrace with an outdoor fireplace and outdoor bench seating.
space: Guests can use the entire apartment. This home is not shared. All aspects of the apartment are available for guests to use including the outdoor terrace, private laundry, etc.
description: This one bedroom apartment is modern, tastefully decorated, and spacious. The apartment includes washer / dryer, a full bath, king sized bed in separate full bedroom (not a studio!), living room and dining space. Kitchen is fully equipped with a coffee maker, Vitamix, fridge, stove, microwave and anything you need for cooking. The apartment also includes a 300 sqft private terrace with an outdoor fireplace and outdoor bench seating. Guests can use the entire apartment. This home is not shared. All aspects of the apartment are available for guests to use including the outdoor terrace, private laundry, etc. Guests will have access to the entire apartment + private terrace, the building gym, and community spaces such as a theatre room. Someone from our team will be available to speak to you and answer any questions from 7am to midnight each day. Guests will be able to check into the home on their own. The apartment is located in West Loop and is walking distance from the best restaurants,
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in West Loop and is walking distance from the best restaurants, coffee shops and bars the city has to offer! You don’t need a cab - simply walk!  Also easy access for business travelers to get to / from the Loop. A lovely 15 minute walk, a short bus ride (on the 20), or a quick cab (Lyft / Uber) will get you to the business district in minutes!
transit: Guests can walk everywhere in / around West Loop and Fulton Market. Easy access to the Loop for business travelers. A short cab ride will get you to Gold Coast or Michigan Ave for world class shopping and sight seeing.  There are also many Divvy stations around for bike rentals. The cost is typically $10/day for a Divvy. They can be picked up at any Divvy station, parked at another station, and picked up again somewhere else. It’s an awesome way to go green, get in a workout and see the city as the weather starts to pick up!
access: Guests will have access to the entire apartment + private terrace, the building gym, and community spaces such as a theatre room.
interaction: Someone from our team will be available to speak to you and answer any questions from 7am to midnight each day. Guests will be able to check into the home on their own.
house_rules: Thank you for staying at our apartment. To help us out with organization, we ask all guests to help with the following items: Load the dishwasher with all dishes,  Put away anything that was removed from its place Strip all sheets off the bed (pillows, sheets, duvet covers) and start a load of laundry (laundry pods are on top of the dryer) Put all linens / towels, etc. in the hamper.

name: 2 story 1 bedroom loft in East Lakeview!
summary: Fun and modern two level one bedroom in East Lakeview.  Walk to the lake, Wrigley Field, the red/brown/purple line and a ton of great restaurants, shops and bars.
space: 2 level 1 bedroom loft in East Lakeview. Close to the lake, grocery stories, the cubs, and a billion restaurants and bars. The loop is a quick uber, bus or el ride away.
description: Fun and modern two level one bedroom in East Lakeview.  Walk to the lake, Wrigley Field, the red/brown/purple line and a ton of great restaurants, shops and bars. 2 level 1 bedroom loft in East Lakeview. Close to the lake, grocery stories, the cubs, and a billion restaurants and bars. The loop is a quick uber, bus or el ride away. The place is yours! I will be out of town during your stay but have my phone glued to me at all times - feel free to text, call or email - no matter the time or situation! I also have a few close friends that will be on call that live very close and stop by if needed. My street and the ones surrounding it are perfect for grabbing a drink on a patio and dog watching! Wilde Bar has a little of everything. Dry Hop is great if you for beer, cocktails and good food. Yellowtail sushi is amazing and only a few blocks away. I also love to grab some wine, cheese or something from the deli at Marianos - grocery store basically connected to building - and then venture d
neighborhood_overview: My street and the ones surrounding it are perfect for grabbing a drink on a patio and dog watching! Wilde Bar has a little of everything. Dry Hop is great if you for beer, cocktails and good food. Yellowtail sushi is amazing and only a few blocks away. I also love to grab some wine, cheese or something from the deli at Marianos - grocery store basically connected to building - and then venture down to the park to eat on a park bench or blanket or by the lake.
notes: Tucker the cat will be with you in the apartment!  Just be careful - the top and bottom locks take different keys. If you lock the bottom lock you can open door from inside but will be locked out from the outside.
transit: I am a fan of lyft and uber but the El and bus makes getting around very easy as well. There is an El stop less than 10 minutes away (walking) that services the red, brown and purple lines.  You can also sign up for a divvy membership - this allows you to check out the blue bikes you are bound to see on every other corner of the city. You just check one out and then return it to a divvy check-in center once you have made it to your destination.  If you are planning a longer adventure and need a car for an hour or even a day or two - I would recommend checking out the app “Getaround”.
access: The place is yours!
interaction: I will be out of town during your stay but have my phone glued to me at all times - feel free to text, call or email - no matter the time or situation! I also have a few close friends that will be on call that live very close and stop by if needed.
house_rules: Before checking out, please: - place any used towels in the bathtub  - takeout trash  - place any used dishes in dishwasher
host_about: Grew up in the southwest and now call Chicago home! Love the lake, design and exploring new neighborhood restaurants and bars.

name: Vintage Home by Wrigley Field
summary: Spacious separate suite by Wrigley Field in top two floors of vintage coach house.  Please reach out if you have any questions about this unique space!   Note: We’re new to AirBnB — low introductory rates in case there are any growing pains.
space: Note: This listing is your own private self-contained suite, but it is NOT an entire building/property. A coach house is a second house built behind the main house; from the street, guests will walk past the main house to reach the coach house. Exterior deck is shared with the main house.

name: Stylish  & spacious 2 bedroom - Great location!
summary: This newly renovated unit has been styled with unique decor, original artwork, and high-quality furniture. This unit comfortably fits 5 and can accommodate up to 6 people.   In the Edgewater/Andersonville area there are plenty of restaurants and shops to explore. Wrigleyville, Boystown, Evanston, Magnificent Mile and other parts of the city are just a short drive (street parking available) or a few stops away (CTA stops within walking distance).  Read more below or email us with any questions!
space: The layout and decor of this space has been designed knowing that traveling takes up space - enjoy the extra dresser space and raised bed frames (14” from the floor) that easily fit suitcases underneath them. There are hardwood floors throughout, central heating and ac, and fans in all rooms.   A private entrance and in-unit safe (bring your own padlock) brings extra security to you and your belongings. The unit is equipped with complimentary WIFI access and the living room and both bedrooms are set up with Roku TVs (no cable but we have a hulu subscription and you can enjoy free media through the Roku channel, connect your phones or computers and watch whatever you’d like, or sign into your own netflix, or amazon prime accounts). Otherwise, feel free to enjoy the complimentary books and games available to you. neighborhood_overview: This charming unit is in a great location to explore Chicago.  Located on the edges of Andersonville, Edgewater and Rogers Park, this space is surrounded by diverse restaurants, resale shops and a growing creative scene. Wrigleyville (Cubs games!) and the lively Boystown are only a few minutes away. This is a perfect location for those visiting Loyola University - and its also close to Northwestern and DePaul.   You are just a mile away from Lake Michigan where you can spend the day soaking up the sun or biking/jogging along the lakefront trails. A short ride on the red line or the bus gets you to the heart of Chicago, Magnificent Mile, and Grant Park.
transit: The location has a "Walkers Paradise" walk score of 91/100 and a "Excellent Transit" transit score of 70.  Granville Red Line stop .6 miles Multiple bus stops within a few blocks of the unit
interaction: We want to make sure you have the best stay in Chicago - we are happy to recommend activities and restaurants before or during your trip. We are at your service by phone or email (and can be on the premises when necessary) to assist with any questions or needs.
house_rules: There are other people living in the building, so please be considerate of noise levels - especially between 10pm and 9am every day of the week.  We have a safe installed in the unit but you need to bring your own padlock to secure it. We can offer a padlock for an additional $5 fee. Note to parents traveling with small children: we have a couple planters with rocks/pebbles in the base.
host_about: We are a mother-daughter duo working hard to make sure you have the best experience in Chicago! We love to travel and have used our experiences in hotels, hostels, and other airBnBs to inform the design of our airBnB units. When we aren't exploring the world, we love adventuring throughout Chicago - so we are happy to offer ideas for places to eat and explore.

name: Wrigleyville/Boystown/Entire Private Floor!
summary: 1000 sq ft-entire private floor & door access. The perfect Wrigleyville/Boystown/Lake location. Zip to downtown Chicago in minutes via cab or public transportation options. Our friendly neighborhood is packed with fun bars, fabulous restaurants, unique boutiques & great music venues. Enjoy pool, ping pong and pinball and our 65" 4K flat screen TV or a seat at the bar. A Queen bed, 2 single beds in the main room, steam shower and bathroom. We have a mini fridge, microwave, coffee and home gym.

neighborhood_overview: Our place sits between Wrigleyville and Lakeview neighborhoods. Sports and spirits are the backbone of one of Chicago’s more unique neighborhoods: Wrigleyville. Lakeview features restuarants, shopping and all the benefits of the amazing Chicago lakefront: bike path, tennis courts, golf course and nature preserves. The architecture is charming brownstones with large windows and interesting details, shaded by trees. (URL HIDDEN) (URL HIDDEN)
notes: You will enjoy walking in our historic, friendly neighborhood and the beautiful lakefront path. Explore Wrigleyville & Boystown's restaurants, diners, music venues, sports bars. Quick options to zip to downtown and any neighborhood. Uber, Lyft & Taxis in an instant. Buses & speedy El train are steps away.
transit: We are steps aways from numerous bus routes and the famous el transportation. Uber, Lyft and cabs always quick to respond in this area.
access: There is a lockbox on your private entrance for your convenience.
interaction: We enjoy meeting travelers and will gladly help you navigate the city, and give you dining tips as well as several public transportation options. If you prefer to explore on your own, that is fine as well.

name: Awesome 4-BR/2-Bath House in Heart of Wrigley
summary: Welcome to Chicago! Enjoy a wonderful stay in this 4-BR/2 bath coach house that's just a 5 min walk to Wrigley. Located on a serene, residential side street, the unit has everything you need to make your visit seamless and comfortable. Plus, it's in a prime location with easy access to Wrigley, Boystown, Southport, parks/beaches, theaters, restaurants/bars, as well as multiple public transportation options.
space: This is a private couch house at the back of a property, and you'll have the whole thing to yourselves. 1ST FLOOR: Note the house's front door, which brings you to 1st floor, is about 9 steps up from ground level. Renovated kitchen with stainless steel appliances. Includes cookware, diningware, coffee pot/coffee. 11' x 10' Living room with pull-out sofa bed (sleeps 1), 43" Roku TV (guests log into own accounts) and 750MB wifi. 15.5' x 12.5' Bedroom #3 with queen bed, 1 nightstand, dresser, closet. 13' x 9.75' Full bathroom off kitchen with shower, tub, vanity 2ND FLOOR: A full staircase separates the 1st and 2nd floor. neighborhood_overview: The Lakeview neighborhood and Wrigleyville / Boystown areas have so much within walking distance, you won't want to leave! There are numerous bakeries, boutique stores, theaters, and lively bars and restaurants. If you do feel like venturing out of the neighborhood, Lakeview is very centrally located. Head south to visit Lincoln Park, River North, and the Loop, or west to visit Buck Town or Logan square. Both public transit and Uber/Lyft are great ways to get around.
notes: COURTESY All socializing must take place indoors. We request noise be kept to a reasonable level from midnight-8am. ENTRY Check-in is at 4pm or later and check-out is by 10am. We provide detailed check-in notes with photos. 30+ DAY STAYS The unit will be fully cleaned and stocked with paper / bathroom products for your arrival. After these initial products, monthly guests are responsible for providing their own bathroom products and paper products. For 30+ day stays, we also include a monthly complimentary cleaning. All utilities are included, up to $100/month for electric and $75/mo for gas. Overage is the guests' responsibility, and charges will be sent through the resolution center. PACK N PLAY Pack N Play may be rented for $5/night. It will be inside the unit waiting for you in its carrying case, and we request you fold it up back into its carrying case prior to departure. Note that linens are not included for the crib.
transit: PARKING Free, public street parking is available in the area. Some streets require a permit, and others do not. We offer permits at the unit for a small courtesy fee. Please note you may have to circle the block a few times to find a spot. If you prefer paid parking with a designated spot, I recommend using Spot-Hero to find nearby options that work for you. Once you're here, public transportation and/or Uber are the easiest ways to get around the city. CLOSEST STOPS o Addison red train: .3 mi, trains go uptown/downtown o Belmont purple/brown train stop: .6 mi, trains go uptown/downtown o 77, 8, 36 bus and more to go up/downtown or east/west Stations all have machines that sell Ventra passes (name of provider). You can also purchase Ventra cards at Walgreens. You can either purchase a single ride ticket, a re-loadable Ventra card, or an unlimited pass (1, 3, or 7 days). Multiple people may share a re-loadable card and fares will be deducted for each person; however, the unlimited passe
access: You have the entire house to yourselves. This includes living room, kitchen, 4 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms. You also have shared access to a laundry room in the front building. It's behind a 3-story building, which we also manage.
interaction: My goal is to ensure you have the most enjoyable and comfortable stay in Chicago. I have a detailed guest guidebook (emailed in advance and printed in unit) that includes info about the apt, neighborhood, and city to help maximize your time in the city. If you'd like additional assistance with anything, I'm more than happy to help! Depending on my work travel schedule, I may or may not be in town; however, I'm always accessible via phone or email for any questions that arise.
house_rules: REQUESTS: 1) Please treat the home with respect.  2) Please be courteous of neighbors. All socializing must be kept indoors after 9pm, and we request quiet time from 11p-8am.  3) The only guests allowed in the unit are those on the reservation. Special events will be considered on a case-by-case basis.  4) We welcome children, but we are not child-proof. If you have specific questions/concerns, please ask before booking. CHECK IN/OUT:  Standard check-in time is 4pm (or later). You will be sent written instructions and photos for entry. Standard check-out time is by 10am. If scheduling permits, we will work with you on alternate arrangements, so please inquire. If unit is not vacated by check-out time or notes are not followed, additional cleaning charges may apply. For check out, I ask that you: - turn off lights / appliances - place used kitchen items in dishwasher and begun cycle - bag any trash and dispose in bins behind building -  Lock front door via keypad
host_about:
I began using Airbnb as a traveler in the fall of 2013, and I'm hooked! Staying in someone's home allows you to experience the area in a truly authentic way - no more hotels for me! As of May 2014, I began hosting in Chicago and have since hosted thousands of guests from around the world. I love helping others make the most of their visits. 

As a host, I am personable, responsive, and detail-oriented. I take great pride in the comfort and cleanliness of each apartment. You can trust that when staying in any one of our properties, you will feel at home.

name: Cozy Room in Spacious Apt - Perfect Location!
summary: This is a private room in a shared 4BR apartment (all 4 rooms are available on Airbnb). Restaurants, shops, bars, and public transit are all within walking distance. Downtown is a 10-minute train ride away via the nearby Fullerton Red/Brown/Purple Line 'L' train station. Trove guests have exclusive FREE access to The Metropolitan, a members-only club located on the 66th and 67th floors of the Willis Tower. Check "Exclusive Trove Perks" in the listing description for details.
space: Thanks so much for your interest in staying with us! We ask that you read through our entire listing to make sure that we're the right hosts for you. This is a private room in a shared 4BR apartment (all 4 rooms are available on Airbnb).  THIS TROVE HAS ✔ Twin-size bed ✔ Turkish cotton bath and hand towels ✔ 55" HDTV w/ Netflix (no cable TV) ✔ Keurig coffee maker ✔ Body wash and shampoo ✔ Iron and ironing board ✔ Hair dryer ✔ Keyless Entry --and more! EXCLUSIVE TROVE PERKS During your stay as a Trove guest, you rec
neighborhood_overview: We’re located on the north side of Chicago in Lincoln Park, one of Chicago’s trendiest and safest neighborhoods. Our neighborhood is a wonderful mix of bustling streets packed with local restaurants and shops, as well as quiet tree-lined streets full of historic buildings. We’re also minutes away from many of Chicago’s most popular spots.
notes: FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS 1. “How do I get to ‘x’ from the apartment?/How far is the apartment from ‘x’?” Directions from our apartment to any point in the city are available via web search. We're around the corner from the Wrightwood 659 art gallery. Search for “Wrightwood 659 Gallery Chicago” in Maps, click the “Directions” button, then enter your point of interest. 2. When is check-in/check-out? Check-in is 3 p.m. or later but you're welcome to stop by anytime after 11:30 a.m. to drop off your bags in the living room. Check-out is at 11 a.m. Our cleaning staff will need access to the apartment at 11 a.m., but you’re welcome to leave your bags in the living room and pick them up by 2:30 p.m. at the latest. 3. “Can a third person stay in the room with me?” We allow a maximum of one guest in this room. We have additional rooms available if you need accommodations for more than two people. Send us a message for more info. 4. Will I have my own private bathroom? The apartment has two sh
transit: Because of our central location, we recommend leaving your car at home. Any point of interest in Chicago can easily be reached by walking, public transit, or Uber. ￫ The Fullerton Red/Brown/Purple Line 'L' train station is a 10-minute walk away. ￫ O'Hare is 55 minutes away via public transit and 30-45 minutes away via Uber. ￫ Midway is 60 minutes away via public transit and 35-50minutes away via Uber.
access: In addition to your room, you'll have shared access to the kitchen, living room, dining room, bathrooms, and washer/dryer.
house_rules: 1) Only the reservation holder and guests added to the reservation via Airbnb may have access to the apartment.   2) As a courtesy to any other guests who you might be sharing the apartment with, please clean up after yourself immediately in the common areas. 3) As a courtesy to your fellow guests and to your neighbors, please keep noise to a minimum, especially between 9 pm - 9 am. 4) This is a non-smoking apartment. If smoke is detected, a cleaning fee of $150 will be charged. 5) No late check-outs. Check-out is at 11 am.  In order to compensate our cleaning assistants for lost time, additional charges will be sent if they're unable to begin their job at 11 am. One hour or less - $25 Each additional hour - $40 6) Damaged/stained/missing towels, bedding, and/or furnishings will incur additional fees. The per-item fees are as follows: Bedsheet- $12 Towel - $12 Pillow - $30 Pillowcase: $10 Comforter - $50 Clothes hangers - $3 Furnishings - Dependant on item
host_about: I'm excited to host you for your next trip to Chicago!

neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is located in Streeterville, only a 5 minute walk from The Loop. One of the fastest-developing neighborhoods in Chicago, Streeterville extends out into Lake Michigan and attracts a blend of young professionals, students, and tourists. A plethora of amenities and activities exist for every lifestyle. From Navy Pier activities to luxury shopping on Michigan Avenue, it is a walkable community with easy access to entertainment.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions (including certain Bull Terriers and any related breeds). Wild animals and hybrids, including wolf and coyote hybrids, snakes, ferrets, rabbits, are all prohibited. Please contact us for precise breed restrictions. Please note that a one-off non refundable fee ($500) and a monthly rent ($25/mo/pet) is applicable upon reservation. Failing to notify us of any pets prior to check-in will incur a penalty, and may result in denied check-in. Supporting documents (ie. vaccinations) may be required - Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a $350 monthly fe
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

name: Magical, edgy, suite in Lincoln Square home.
summary: Beautiful spacious suite in our edgy, artsy vintage home in the heart of gorgeous Lincoln Square, one of Chicago's trendiest north side neighborhoods. Walking distance to restaurants, bars, coffee shops, movie theater, park, library, trains, groceries, and more. You'll have access to our kitchen, garden deck, beech tree lounge, and one of the most spectacular rooftop decks in Chicago!
space: You will be able to enjoy a private 1st floor suite, with a beautiful large, very comfortable  living room, and private front door entrance. Wonderfully decorated, like a Restoration Hardware showroom, and furnished with a new, top of the line memory foam mattress, you'll sleep like a baby, in our quiet, safe neighborhood, when you take a break from exploring one of the most exciting cities on the planet! There are multiple outdoor sitting spaces, depending on the season, and the roof deck is world class. We are happy to offer some extras, as available, such as a yoga space and photo studio. The bathroom can be set up either with a shower, or as a deep soaking tub, complete with (battery powered) candles. (sorry, one person at a time). Your suite is equipped with Sonos speakers, so you can program your own music right from your own phone. This is really a magical place, perfect for a couple to relax, recharge, reconnect, and have a blast!

The bathroom
neighborhood_overview: Considering the fact that there was nothing to do when I moved here in 1991, Lincoln Square has exploded into one of the best neighborhood you'll find anywhere. You could easily stay within walking distance of our house and have a fabulous, quintessentially Chicago neighborhood experience without ever getting in a car.  On a typical Saturday morning Kris and I often walk to La Boulangerie for coffee and the best crepes this side of Paris, and to buy our bread for the week. Otherwise, there are a dozen other choices for coffee and/or breakfast you can walk to. The food scene here is ridiculous. Thai? Probably a dozen choices. Burgers? Everywhere. Sushi? Of course. Chicago pizza? The famous Lou Malnati's is about 200 feet away. Korean? Best in Chicago, walking distance. All night diner? Just across the park. Awesome Jewish Deli? Super close. Traditional Southern? Don't dare miss Luella's Southern Kitchen, two blocks away. "Little India", on Devon Avenue, the most diverse street in Americ
transit: We are very centrally located, with great neighborhoods in every direction that are a short drive or an inexpensive Uber/Lyft away.  If we were to go downtown, for museums, the Riverwalk, Millenium Park, or, say Lollapalooza, we would probably take the El train. We are surrounded by three train stations within a few blocks, and for $2.50 you can't beat it, and it's a beautiful ride. You can also rent a bicycle just steps from our door and ride a mile to Montrose Harbor and pick up the lakefront bike path, for one of the most beautiful rides you'll ever have. Feeling ambitious? It's 6 miles from Montrose Harbor to the Magnificent Mile. You could drop your bike off and enjoy the best shopping in the midwest! Grab lunch and catch the train (or an Uber) home.
interaction: My wife Kris and I live upstairs, and use the first floor kitchen and dining room. During the week she will be gone most of the day at work, but I will be available throughout the day to make sure you have everything you need. I'm usually out on a photo shoot, running errands, doing yoga, riding my bike, or flying my drone,  so you'll have total privacy in your suite.  I shot television news in Chicago for 30 years, and know the city like the back of my hand, so I am happy to make suggestions and point you toward some of our favorite spots, and make sure you have a perfect Chicago visit. We love meeting new people, and making new friends.
house_rules: 11pm - 8am
host_about: My wife Kris and I love living in Lincoln Square, in Chicago. Kris has worked at a community college for 25 years and loves working with students. I have been a news cameraman for a local news station and have a photography business on the side. We love to travel both domestically and internationally. Our favorite things to do in the city involve going out to the many fabulous restaurants, enjoying live music at any of the wonderful venues, and doing yoga and exercising.. A major reason that we have signed up to host on Airbnb is that we love meeting new people and look forward to expanding our circle of friends!

name: 3 GUESTS, CLEAN COZY DOWNTOWN APARTMENT + PARKING!
summary: Cleanliness is most important here! Private, professionally designed room in the heart of Chicago with 2 separate beds, FREE PARKING & an EARLY check-in (12 pm!) You will have your own door code and may arrive as late as you wish, EASY self check-in guaranteed!  I allow LUGGAGE DROP OFF! You can store your luggage in the closet before check-in and after check-out times, you can drop it off and pick it up as early and as late as you would like. The area is very QUIET & SAFE, even at night!
space: Restaurants and bars are right round the corner, both upscale and casual. This room is 6 minutes away by car or uber to Chicago's famous Willis (Sears) tower. Uber costs about $7. If you are arriving by car, I am providing free resident parking passes for anywhere in the area. (Yes, that means you can drive a few blocks and still park anywhere you want!) The room will be ONLY yours for the time you'll stay in my Windy City. You will have a key to lock your door.  > EARLY CHECK-IN! 12 pm! > 2 beds, 1 queen-sized and 1 single-sized, perfect for 3 travellers staying together > Free parking provided: park BEFORE your check-in and stay parked AFTER your check-out if you would like > The back deck has a beautiful view of the Willis Tower > Restaurants and bars are 2 MIN away walking distance  > 7 MIN to Chicago's BEAN > 5 MIN walk to PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION/METRO  > 5 MIN walk to UIC (University of Illinois at Chicago)  > 15 MIN walk to Rush University  > No security deposit > Cancel up to 24

neighborhood_overview: 100% of guests love my location- it is the best of both worlds: 5 minutes from the very center of downtown, yet quiet enough to not hear the noise at night. If you are still not convinced, please read my reviews.
transit: "Racine" blue line is the closest blue line train (metro) station, only 5 minutes away (walking).  -Downtown/Loop: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and get off at "LaSalle, Jackson, or Monroe," depending on where you are going :) FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "Racine" About 5 minutes to downtown. -O'Hare Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare. O'Hare is the final stop. FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "Racine" About 40 minutes to O’Hare. Midway Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and transfer to orange line at "Clark/Lake," then take orange line to towards Midway airport. Midway is the final stop! FROM - take orange line towards Adams/Wabash; then, transfer to blue line at "Clark/Lake." Take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "Racine" About 45 minutes to Midway. -Union Station/Amtrak: Only 20 minutes away (walking), taxi or uber will take you to the apartment in less than 5 minutes for about $6 :)
house_rules: Please read your check-in instructions carefully Please no overstaying past your checkout time
host_about:
Hello! My name is Natalia, and I would like to welcome you to Chicago. I host with my sister, Marina, and we are originally from Saint Petersburg, Russia, but we spent our teenage years in Aix-en-Provence, France and therefore speak English, Russian and French fluently :) I work as an investment banker in the loop. 

Hotels can get very expensive, so we do our best to help tourists out. I really hope to host you! :)

space: NEW!  1GB wifi mesh network for great connectivity throughout apt plus Roku TV. APARTMENT This is a PRIVATE ROOM rental in a professionally-run airbnb house. Our cleaning team will have everything ready to go for you, and we provide lots of amenities to make your stay comfortable. Please see below for more info! neighborhood_overview: The Lakeview neighborhood and Wrigleyville / Boystown areas have so much within walking distance, you won't want to leave! There are numerous bakeries, boutique stores, theaters, and lively bars and restaurants. If you do feel like venturing out of the neighborhood, Lakeview is very centrally located. Head south to visit Lincoln Park, River North, and the Loop, or west to visit Buck Town or Logan square. Both public transit and Uber/Lyft are great ways to get around.
notes: GUESTS Only those on the reservation are permitted in the unit/room. BEDROOM LOCKS All 4 bedrooms may be locked from the inside but do not have keys to be locked from the outside. We do provide combination locks for your bedroom closet and you'll be given the code at check-in to securely store your belongings. COURTESY  Please note this unit is on a quiet residential street. We respect our neighbors, and for that reason the building's outdoor space is not for socializing, and instead we request guests socialize indoors only. We request quiet hours from 9pm-8am. CLEANING  We expect guests to clean up after themselves in shared spaces. For example, throw away any trash, rinse coffee maker after use, wipe down bathroom sink/kitchen counter after use, etc. We also request that personal bathroom items are kept in your bedroom when not in use. This keeps the shared spaces clean for all guests.
transit: PARKING Free, public street parking is available in the area. Some streets require a permit, and others do not. We offer permits at the unit for a small fee. Please note you may have to circle the block a few times to find a spot. If you prefer paid parking with a designated spot, I recommend using Spot-Hero to find nearby options that work for you. Once you're here, public transportation and/or Uber are the easiest ways to get around the city. CLOSEST STOPS o Addison red train: .3 mi, trains go uptown/downtown o Belmont purple/brown train stop: .6 mi, trains go uptown/downtown o 77, 8, 36 bus and more to go up/downtown or east/west Stations all have machines that sell Ventra passes (name of provider). You can also purchase Ventra cards at Walgreens. You can either purchase a single ride ticket, a re-loadable Ventra card, or an unlimited pass (1, 3, or 7 days). Multiple people may share a re-loadable card and fares will be deducted for each person; however, the unlimited passes can not
access: In addition to your PRIVATE ROOM, you have use of the kitchen, living room,  bathroom, and front building's basement laundry room (all SHARED spaces). KEYS  There is self-entry with key pad anytime from 4pm on. There are no keys. CENTRAL HEAT/AC The unit has central heat/AC with a thermostat within the unit. The temperature is kept between 65-70 degrees for the comfort of all guests. LAUNDRY The building has a washer and dryer in the basement that's shared by all apartments. Each costs $1.50 and accepts quarters. PUBLIC TRANSIT The closet train stop is the Addison red line. There are also many bus stops. We provide additional info about public transit upon booking. PARKING Free, public street parking is available in the area. Some streets require a permit, and others do not. We offer permits at the unit for a small fee. Please note you may have to circle the block a few times to find a spot. If you prefer paid parking with a designated spot, we can offer additional guidance upon bookin
interaction: My goal is to ensure you have the most enjoyable and comfortable stay in Chicago. I have a detailed guest guidebook (emailed in advance and printed in unit) that includes info about the apt, neighborhood, and city to help maximize your time in the city. If you'd like additional assistance with anything, I'm more than happy to help! Depending on my work travel schedule, I may or may not be in town; however, I'm always accessible via phone or email for any questions that arise.
house_rules: REQUESTS:  1) Please treat the home with respect.  There is a $250 fee for smoking, and the reservation will be terminated at your expense. 2) Please be courteous of others in building and neighbors. All socializing must be kept indoors after 9pm, and we request quiet time indoors from 9pm-8am.  3) The only guests allowed in the building are those on the reservation.   4) Personal bathroom items must be kept in your room. If you use common spaces, we request you tidy up after yourself to keep the spaces clean for everyone (for example, kitchen items in dishwasher, wipe counters, throw out trash, etc).   CHECK IN/OUT: Standard check-in time is 4pm (or later). Standard check-out time is by 10am. If unit is not vacated by check-out time or notes are not followed, additional cleaning charges may apply.   For check out, I ask that you:   - turn off lights in your room/common spaces   - ensure your used kitchen items are in dishwasher  - dispose of any of your food/drink from fridge and any
host_about:
I began using Airbnb as a traveler in the fall of 2013, and I'm hooked! Staying in someone's home allows you to experience the area in a truly authentic way - no more hotels for me! As of May 2014, I began hosting in Chicago and have since hosted thousands of guests from around the world. I love helping others make the most of their visits. 

As a host, I am personable, responsive, and detail-oriented. I take great pride in the comfort and cleanliness of each apartment. You can trust that when staying in any one of our properties, you will feel at home.

description: Discover the best of Chicago, with this one-bedroom West Loop apartment with high floor views over the city. It’ll be easy to simply show up and start living in this beautifully Blueground furnished apartment with its fully-equipped kitchen, exquisite living room, and our dedicated, on-the-ground support. (#CHI163) Thoughtfully designed with bespoke finishes, modern furnishings, and a fully-equipped kitchen, you’ll enjoy that “I’m home” feeling with this Blueground apartment. Whether you’re lounging in your spacious living room streaming the latest and greatest entertainment on the smart TV or premium wireless speaker, or getting some well-earned rest on the superior quality mattress with luxury linens, you’ll fall in love with everything this West Loop apartment has to offer.  This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry. Amenities Building amenities unique to this one-bedroom apartment include an on-site:    - Doorman - 24/7 Security - Pet Friendly - Indoor Parking - Elevator The
neighborhood_overview: Located in West Loop, this furnished rental invites you to explore the edges of downtown Chicago. From endless dining and bar options to art galleries and stylish shops, West Loop has emerged with so much to offer daily. During weekends, residents savor trips to the Chicago French Market and the vibrant strip of Randolph Street. The latter is known as “Restaurant Row” and is lined with some of the city’s best eateries. Fulton Market, one of the hippest and fastest-growing neighborhoods, is ideal for dinner and drinks. Union Station is only a 5 to 10 minute walk away.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions (including certain Bull Terriers and any related breeds). Wild animals and hybrids, including wolf and coyote hybrids, snakes, ferrets, rabbits, are all prohibited. Please contact us for precise breed restrictions. Please note that a one-off non refundable fee ($500) and a monthly rent ($25/mo/pet) is applicable upon reservation. Failing to notify us of any pets prior to check-in will incur a penalty, and may result in denied check-in. Supporting documents (ie. vaccinations) may be required - Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a $250 monthly fe
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

name: Wicker Park Beauty- Brand New 3 BDR Condo
summary: Welcome to this newly remodeled 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom garden level condo in Wicker Park! This condo has a wonderful layout and is perfect for families and groups looking to stay in one of the best neighborhoods Chicago has to offer! The entire condo has been updated and beautifully decorated. The kitchen is amazing and the neighborhood can't be beat! There are two train stops within a mile of the condo and plenty of restaurants, bars, and shops within a 20 minute walk or short Uber/Lyft ride!
space: **Need to stay long term? Inquire for great discounts by messaging us!** This three bedroom, two bathroom condo is tastefully remodeled and a perfect spot for families and groups of friends. Upon entering the garden level condo you will find a living room and kitchen that share an open concept floor plan. The living room has a flat screen TV and a large, comfortable sectional sofa. The kitchen is completely remodeled with quartz countertops, stainless steel appliances, and a large island with seating for four. The kitchen is fully stocked and has plenty of space for the cooks in your group to prepare a meal.  There are a total of three bedrooms in the condo. The master bedroom has a queen size bed, flat screen TV, and an en suite bathroom with a large walk-in shower. The second bedroom has a queen bed and the third bedroom has a full size bed. The second bathroom has a shower/tub and is located in the hallway that connects the kitchen and bedrooms. All of the bedrooms have plenty of cl

neighborhood_overview: Wicker Park and Bucktown are one of Chicago's creative epicenters and they lie just outside of downtown. These synonymous neighborhoods are famous for live music, nightlife, chef-driven restaurants and countless art galleries — many housed within the Flat Iron Arts Building. If you have an acute knowledge of craft cocktails, an affinity for coffee, enjoy sifting through records or thrifted threads, there's no better area than Bucktown and Wicker Park! The area has become a prevailing influence on Chicago's Michelin-rated, James Beard Award-winning dining scene, and boasts some of the city's most sought after tables. Wicker Park and Bucktown are also known for their palate pleasing nightcaps, like renowned brewery Piece and mixology tour de force The Violet Hour. Along North, Division, Milwaukee and Damen Avenues you will find an unbelievable blend of vintage shops and independently-owned boutiques touting fashions for both men and women, and luxury home goods and beauty products. On th
notes: Please provide an accurate guest count prior to booking. Rates vary throughout the week and season and by number of guests. It's important that your guest count is accurate so we can be sure the home is adequately prepared and stocked for your stay. For guests bringing a car, please note that this condo does not include parking and we recommend using SpotHero to find a parking spot!
transit: This home has a great location and you are a 10-20 minute walk from most of the attractions in the neighborhood. If you want to venture beyond Wicker Park and Bucktown the most convenient way is the train. The Damen and Division stops on the Blue Line train are a 15-18 minute walk from the home. The Blue Line runs from O'Hare International Airport to downtown. There are also plenty of Uber/Lyfts and taxis if needed!
access: You have access to the entire condo.
interaction: We give our guests space but available if needed. Please message us through the platform if you need anything!
house_rules: PLEASE NOTE THAT WE CHARGE PER GUEST AFTER A SET NUMBER. PLEASE PROVIDE THE ENTIRE GROUP COUNT IN YOUR RESERVATION REQUEST. IF AN UPDATE TO THE GROUP COUNT IS NEEDED AFTER CONFIRMING THE RESERVATION, THE RESERVATION COST MAY INCREASE Quiet hours from 10pm to 8am -$500 penalty if damage is found
host_about:
Hi, Thanks for taking a look at our special homes.

My name is Noah. A few years ago, my family and I got together to create an amazing experience for tourists and guests like you.

We are Chicagoans who love sharing our city with the world and strive to make your stay as comfortable as possible so you can enjoy the city like a local. 

We're passionate about travel. As experienced travelers, we've learned what creates a top notch experience and we're committed to sharing that experience with you. It's something we call "Sweet Home Chicago" and we hope you carry it back with you to where ever you call home! :)

You can find us hanging by the lake, catching a game at Wrigley, grabbing a drink in Wicker Park, enjoying the many concerts going on on any given night, or at any of the amazing local coffee shops across the city.
