name: Apartment w/ Cool Kitchen for 8 on the North Side
summary: My apartment has 3 bedrooms and enough room for 8 people to hang out.  The newly renovated kitchen has ample space to whip up quick breakfasts or a tasty lunch before going to explore the city.
description: My apartment has 3 bedrooms and enough room for 8 people to hang out.  The newly renovated kitchen has ample space to whip up quick breakfasts or a tasty lunch before going to explore the city. Guests will have private access to the entire apartment.  There is also a shared backyard for guests on the property. Stress Free 24 Hour Check-In!  Extra free street parking is available in the neighborhood as well as some metered parking. The history of Irving Park and Logan Square is probably the first thing that stands out to me. Noted by many for its historic homes, I love strolling the streets of Irving Park/Logan Square to admire its architecture. As a lover of bungalow-style houses and all things historic, I have a soft spot for Irving Park.  The area also has loads of transportation, which makes it easy to come here for the day or commute in/out if you make this your home. I love the peaceful tree lined streets, and also the easy access to every restaurant and bar in Chicago.  Great acc
neighborhood_overview: The history of Irving Park and Logan Square is probably the first thing that stands out to me. Noted by many for its historic homes, I love strolling the streets of Irving Park/Logan Square to admire its architecture. As a lover of bungalow-style houses and all things historic, I have a soft spot for Irving Park.  The area also has loads of transportation, which makes it easy to come here for the day or commute in/out if you make this your home. I love the peaceful tree lined streets, and also the easy access to every restaurant and bar in Chicago.  Great access to Wrigley Field and all that Chicago has to offer! Check out the Kilbourn Park Organic Greenhouse! The first-ever public fruit tree orchard in a major metropolitan city was planted in Kilbourn Park at the Greenhouse in fall 2008!  It is a wonderful resource for the community and visitors alike.
notes: Please note - that while the home is beautifully situated for indoor use - we have strict guidelines regarding noise, in accordance with City of Chicago and neighborhood laws. We respect our neighbors greatly, and simply ask that you do the same. We do penalize aggressively for violations of this - including reporting by neighbors or ticketing by police.
transit: Free street parking is available along with some metered parking. Also, Chicago has a citywide, year round BIKE sharing system called 'Divvy'. There is a Divvy Bike Station 2 blocks away!  This is a great way to explore the neighborhoods of Chicago and you can drop bikes off at any other Stations! Home to Belmont Blue Line Station (0.9 Miles) Belmont Blue Line to/from O'hare Airport (16 min) The #77 Bus takes you straight across Belmont to the Station and back home! #56 Bus 2 blocks away on Milwaukee Ave will bring you into Logan Square, Wicker Park, Bucktown, and River West in Minutes! Easy to Grab Uber/Lyft...about 15 Minutes to the Loop! 15 Minutes to O'hare Airport Via Car! Also, Chicago has a citywide, year round bike share system called 'Divvy'. There is a Divvy Bike Station 2 blocks away!
access: Guests will have private access to the entire apartment.  There is also a shared backyard for guests on the property. Stress Free 24 Hour Check-In!  Extra free street parking is available in the neighborhood as well as some metered parking.
house_rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund. 1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable. 2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to the designated location by the agreed upon check-out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out penalty. 3.) Absolutely no smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any entrance. 4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 5.) Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid.
host_about: Hi I'm Lara, and I am very proud to be an Airbnb Superhost! I am a Chicago native, and studied hospitality management at Boston University, and decided to follow my passion in trying to provide an amazing travel experience through AirBnB!  My husband and I love trying new places to eat, and have a real passion for traveling to exciting parts of the world.  I put a lot of work into getting my spaces ready, and I know you will enjoy your stay with me! Welcome to Chicago!

name: Heart Of Wicker Park 1Br Walk To The Train!
summary: Wonderful Wicker Park 1 Bedroom, Walk To The Train. Chicago's #1 Neighborhood 5 Years Running!
space: This cozy top floor unit overlooks the hottest neighborhood in Chicago.  Wicker Park has been voted the top neighborhood in Chicago for 5 years running!
description: Wonderful Wicker Park 1 Bedroom, Walk To The Train. Chicago's #1 Neighborhood 5 Years Running! This cozy top floor unit overlooks the hottest neighborhood in Chicago.  Wicker Park has been voted the top neighborhood in Chicago for 5 years running! We are available for whatever you need but will respect your privacy too! Anything and everything Chicago offers is right out the front door.  Wicker Park is home to the best dinning, shopping and nightlife in the City! Public transportation is only three blocks to the Division Stop on the Blue Line.

house_rules: - All quiet after 11pm please. - Absolutely no smoking.
host_about: Our quality of life depends on how well we deal with adversity!  Feel positive. Live positive.  I grew up in a small coastal town in Maine.  When I turned 19 I realized that I was a closet wanderer.  So I hit the road and covered much of the U.S. and all of Europe.  I taught skiing in the Rockies and rode my BMW R65-LS from coast to coast.  When I was in Europe I was amazed at how willing people were to open their homes to a total stranger.  I had one of my best experiences living with a family in Romania in the Carpathian Mountains.  Amazing!  I feel this is the best way possible to travel.  It's part of why I love Air B&B.  Hotel shmotel!  Live the life of the area.  That's an experience.  Now my wandering days are over.  I'm rooted in one of the coolest communities I know.  Rich with art and spirit. I have two amazing girls that help me garden, can, collect eggs and milk.  My partner is a fellow East Coast boy, avid hockey player and my right hand man. I also tour with an ABBA tribute band as well as a Pink Floyd tribute band but don't hold that against me.  I hope you like it here half as much as we do!!

name: Stylish Penthouse w/Private Rooftop
summary: This unique, bright and tastefully furnished top floor unit includes two private balconies and roof top deck with stunning views of the Chicago skyline. A lofted second level features three sleeping areas, a master bath with Jacuzzi tub and plenty of closet and dresser space.  With a spacious and modern living room and fully equipped kitchen, it is the perfect destination for a friends' weekend or romantic getaway. 24-hour check-in available.  Please review unit rules prior to booking.
space: The skyline view of the city from the rooftop cannot be beat.  The upstairs loft area is super unique and a great setup for a casual family trip or girls’ weekend. Two of the bedroom areas are fully open to the loft and do not have doors or curtains. Please make note of this in case privacy is something you’re looking for. The master bedroom can be made fully private with doors that close on both sides and a private back stairwell.  The kitchen is fully equipped for cooking. Parking is street parking and there are no reserved spots. You can park anywhere in front of the house or neighboring streets. Layout:  All three sleeping areas are on the 2nd floor.  There are two loft spaces, on this level, that are open to the living room below. The private master bedroom has an en-suite bathroom with access to a back stairwell that accesses the kitchen on the 1st floor.   The 1st-floor space consists of the living room/dining area, kitchen, bathroom and laundry space.

neighborhood_overview: The unit is located just a few minutes walk from tons of great bars and restaurants on Wells St. in Old Town as well as the shops at North Ave. (JCrew, Banana Republic, Nordstrom Rack, Patagonia, Crate and Barrel, Whole Foods, and more!)
notes: We are self-proclaimed foodies and know all the best spots in the city for great food and cocktails. If you're celebrating a special occasion or want to do something cool for your group, let us know and we can help with ideas on how to take your trip to the next level. Penthouse Rules to consider prior to booking this space: - Enjoy yourselves! - Unit capacity is 6 guests at any time.  - Please be respectful of our full-time residents below.  We ask that you honor quiet hours after 10:30 pm weekdays and 11:00 pm on the weekends. - This is a 120 year old building, smoking is not permitted in the building or on the porch space.  This includes the smoking a marijuana even if you hold a card.  This rule is heavily enforced. -  Enjoy the Mini Bar - we'll send you a tab through Airbnb after checkout for anything you've taken.
transit: Just a 4 minute walk to the Sedgewick El stop and a quick 10 minute train ride to downtown.  Uber and Lyft are also great ways to get around quickly and inexpensively in the city.  A divvy bike rental station is available 3 blocks away.
access: Guests will have full access to the top floor unit, balconies, and rooftop.  *Free parking pass stickers for one car are included with every reservation. Additional parking passes are available for $10/day per car.  Parking is on the street right in front of the apartment.
interaction: We love to give our guests privacy to enjoy the unit but are always available by call or text to answer questions or provide recommendations.
house_rules: -Please remove shoes while in the apartment. -No smoking of any kind allowed in the unit.  -Be respectful of our downstairs neighbors - honor quiet hours after 10:30pm during the week and 11:30pm on weekends. -Enjoy the Mini Bar! - take whatever you like and we’ll send you a money request after your stay for the total amount due. Coffee and tea are always complimentary. -We understand accidents happen. If you break something, please be honest and let us know.  -The $500 security deposit is not charged to you when making the reservation. It is just the amount a host can request if something is damaged.

summary: Rose is well appointed. It's a Lippincott 30 sailboat. The Lippincott 30 is a classic sloop that offers comfortable accommodations.  It's a lot like camping with running water and electricity aboard.  Sleeps 4 comfortably.
space: It's a catalina 27 sail boat. Thanks for your interest.  This listing is for sleeping on my Catalina 27 sailboat, Lone Wolf.  While there is a toilet onboard the boat, the bathroom and showers are accessed by code off the dock, on land.  The boat is located next in DuSable harbor.  I will supply washroom shower code. I live in an apartment at Michiagn and Lake, and I will be using the boat to sail during your stay. I've slept many nights onboard the boat. You can stand in the cabin and the v berth in the forward cabin is 6 feet, feet forward.   Let me know if your are still interested and if you have questions.

neighborhood_overview: This is a residential mostly African American neighborhood. We know each other. There is a feeling of spaciousness and real life here. Plenty of families, children, and old folks in this area. People say hello on the sidewalks when they pass each other!  It is easy to walk around here. Plenty to walk to and do. We are close to the large Douglas Park. It has a cultural center with lots to do including in the summer a large outdoor swimming pool. It is easy to catch a bus one block away and go to Chinatown and have fun looking around. It is easy to catch the train 2 blocks away and go downtown where there are million things to do- many are free! The park has a lagoon and fishing and bird watching are free! United Center for games and events is extremely close. We have a lot of trees in the neighborhood. it borders a Latino neighborhood so walking distance to lots of great Mexican food and art!
notes: 4 bedrooms, 3 on 2nd floor with sitting room, full kitchen, full bathroom, outside deck. One bedroom is on first floor. The Even Cowgirls Get the Blues bedroom is one of 3 bedrooms on the 2nd floor. It is the only single bedroom, sometimes rented out along with the sitting room, it is attached to.
transit: We are just 2 blocks west of the pink line train stop at Kedzie. Also several buses within 2 blocks.
access: Guests have key for their room, and keys to the house. They can come and go as they like, and keep any hours they wish.
interaction: I am mostly in office. When I am not seen, I am retreating to my room with my dogs to relax. I am mostly in the background. If you need me, you can go to the open office doorway. Or push the button on the caretaker buzzer.
house_rules: Respect privacy of others, clean up after yourself, once a week each resident staying for longer than one month does a major cleaning of a chore. Attend periodic house mtg.s  Don't come in drunk and knocking thing over!  We have written house rules.
host_about: artist dog lover!

name: Just Rosy Room in Boho Artist Home
summary: Welcome to my home. I offer a clean place to rest your head, and bathe, in an alternative to a sterile expensive hotel. There are four guest rooms total. You get a Private Room in a  Victorian 2 flat. Trees and gardens surround this urban diverse neighborhood. Free street parking, CTA bus at the front door. Real bed, shared full bath, individual air con unit, or heat unit as well as central heat. West of downtown by 10 minutes drive, 3 miles, or 20 min by public transit. By United Center.
space: The building stands alone with community gardens all around. Light comes in from all directions here on the second floor. I have the whole floor! Warm homey Victorian 2 flat, dark wood floors and clean new fixtures. Free street parking. I have three other guest rooms. I mentioned "smoking allowed" but only outdoors please, the apartment is smoke free.

Coffee or tea anytime, self serve. I have hair dryer, shampoo, razors a
neighborhood_overview: When choosing and rating my location, please understand this about my neighborhood: it is not a suburb, not an upscale neighborhood, but my street is very nice with a few run down looking places in the mix. I see myself as part of the solution. I love it here because it is not crowded, and it is so close to downtown. I walk around at night, but I am sensible about it. The train station area is crummy looking, let's admit it. Don't judge me or my street by that! most train stations are a little run down. My area is adjacent to so much. Garfield Park Conservatory is near, United Center, Humboldt Park, Ukrainian Village are about a mile or so away. There are great spots to eat all along Chicago Avenue, California and Division both have lots of neighborhood eateries and bars, funky boutiques. Logan Square is a short ride away, with all it's hot spots. And of course access to downtown with all it's high end shopping, attractions, and the Lake! is just east of me easily accessible by train.
notes: Our neighborhood is on the edge of what used to be an industrial corridor, now transitioning to being used for artsy offices and band practice lofts, breweries and artsy places to have weddings and such. Houses up and down the street are being cleaned up fixed up daily. Whereas it is not a POSH upscale neighborhood, a new private school across the street a couple years ago gave the whole area an upswing, but we can still park free!
transit: CTA Route 94 South California stops at the front door.  Southward, (towards 95th and Damen) 2 stops, it goes right to the Green Line train, at the California station.  Northward (toward Kedzie) 2 stops, it connects to CTA Bus Route 66 Chicago Ave bus and the 52 North California bus route. Very easy.  Uber and Lyft both come here happily, and I have a good relationship with the drivers that I get often.  There is a bike rental (Divvy) right by the California train stop, and one a block north of me at a green center. I have my own bike so I haven't used Divvy, but there are racks all over the city to rent it or return it. You can also take a bike on the bus, loaded on the front rack, or on the train if it is not rush hour.
access: First of all, Welcome! Feel free to use the living room in front of the bedroom. Coffee or tea anytime, self serve. I have hair dryer, shampoo, razors and tooth brushes if you need. Use the kitchen if you like, but tidy up after. PLEASE DON'T COOK MEAT HERE.
interaction: I can help you find stuff if you like, navigate transportation if needed. We can chat or not, whatever your style is.
house_rules: Smoking section is out on the porch.  Responsible enjoyment of alcohol. No other pets please.  Please lock the doors behind you when entering and exiting. If I am not home when you check out, you may leave the keys in the mailbox on the front gate. Do not leave the air conditioning on in your room when you are not home. Please respect our neighbors and keep it down some.  Do not cook meat here. Eat it if you want, but cook it elsewhere. Please leave things tidy. If your shoes are wet or muddy please take them off. Otherwise, do as you would at home.
host_about:
I am an artist in textile, costume, theater and fashion. I do much of my work at home;  in my studio.
 I spend as much time out on the porch as possible, doing writing and some stitching, tending flowers and a veggie garden out in the surrounding yards. I have my own little happy zone right here in the middle of a major metropolitan city, including friendly neighbors.
My little rat terrier Mayzee is my constant companion. 
Things I like to do...  Indie Films usually turn out to be my faves.  I go to some live theater, as well as help make it here in town. Books, got to have books always. And Bike Riding!.  I probably would love yoga if I would think to do it more Ha! 
Veggie food for me, sometimes I like to cook. Former foodie, did my time in the restaurant biz. 
If you would stay over here with me, you are welcome to make yourself at home.  Have your privacy or hang out, I leave it to you. My dog may like to have a cuddle, if you are up for that. You might want to hang by the electric fireplace heh, very mod, and toasty. I have lots of books to peruse for such an evening.
I know in traveling I look for the food of the people! I can tell you my spots or help you find what you might be looking for. Or bring take out, eat in the living room, or back porch if you like al fresco. 
But maybe you just want to  crash someplace tidy and less sterile than a hotel, that's cool. The building is old, maybe a hundred years? but it has all new plumbing and such, so I feel it is the best of both worlds. 
I don't know that I have a life motto, but I firmly believe in doing what makes me happy!
I look forward to meeting interesting people on their travels; feeds the brain!

neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is situated in the most dynamic and convenient place to live in Chicago, The Loop. With its endless shopping, fine dining, stunning park, river and lake views, and entertainment opportunities, everything is possible at a moment’s notice. The area is a cultural getaway for professionals and students, who can combine work with pleasure. Discover landmark buildings like the Willis Tower and The Art Institute of Chicago. Millenium Park, near Lake Michigan, is always worth a visit. The Loop is within reach of accessible transportation, offering non-stop public transit, buses, and taxis. Union Station is approximately a 10 minute train ride.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions (including certain Bull Terriers and any related breeds). Wild animals and hybrids, including wolf and coyote hybrids, snakes, ferrets, rabbits, are all prohibited. Please contact us for precise breed restrictions. host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

name: Charming streets, sidewalk cafes, shops and bars
summary: Our comfortable and spacious 2 bedroom, first floor apartment is located in Ukrainian Village, steps away from great restaurants, clubs and shops. The neighborhood includes many architectural charms including, Holy Trinity Russian Orthodox Church designed by Louis Sullivan located right behind our place. Wicker Park and Bucktown, the 606 Trail, sidewalk cafes, shops, and bars surround us. We are 10 mins from downtown Chicago.
space: You'll walk into an open space with large rooms, 10' ceilings, tall windows and a vintage look. The front room, parlor, dining room are all original to the house. name: Art Filled Logan Square Apt w/ Outdoor Green Space
summary: Nestled on a quite tree lined street in an amazing Chicago neighborhood.  Free street parking three houses to the north and within minutes walking distance to the heart of Logan Square.   Enjoy the entire garden level apartment with everything you need including outdoor space and a patio.  Experience some of the best Chicago has to offer in culture, art, restaurants, cafes, bars and nightlife.  Live like a local in this unique neighbor and still have easy access to Chicago's Downtown Loop.
space: You will have your own private access on the left (north) side of the house to the entire garden level apartment in our home. Apartment includes all the essentials and amenities, plus more, without any clutter so you will have space to spread out and be comfortable and feel cozy and at home here.  Open studio-like floor plan, with living and television sitting area, full kitchen, dining area and reading nook combined area.  Full bathroom and master bedroom with office area, including plenty of closet space. Relax in the sun on the backyard patio, with a green grass yard and small garden.  Pets are allowed and welcome and love the option to roam free in the front and back yard since there is a fence all the way around the property.

neighborhood_overview: Chicago is a city of unique neighborhoods.  The Logan Square neighborhood area is characterized by the prominent historical boulevards, lined with trees, parks, churches, stately greystones and large bungalow-style homes.  It is a fantastic place because of it's artistic vibe, cultural spirit and buzzing nightlife containing some of the best bars, restaurants, shops and cafes the city has to offer.  Logan Square is ranked of the "Nation's Coolest Neighborhoods."
notes: Please enjoy the photography on the walls, as it is all personal projects and for sale, just ask!
transit: Steet parking is free and usually plentiful on the east/west street of Wellington just three houses north (if you can't find a spot, let us know, as we have a limited number for free guest passes for parking on Troy St.) Most things are within a 10 minute walking distance including the center of Logan Square and two CTA's L, blue line train stops for easy, quick and cheap access to the airports and Chicago's downtown Loop area. Catch the Kedzie bus (82) north to the Addison bus (152) east to travel to Wrigleyville, home of the cubs. Uber is always very quick, easy and affordable as well, and being near to the highway means trips to downtown or the airport are very cheap especially when doing Uber pool.
access: Guests will have access to the entire garden level apartment with amenities and access including: *Free and convenient street parking *WIFI *Free breakfast (coffee, tea and oatmeal) *Living room and TV (Apple TV/Netflix/HBO) *Private master bedroom with queen sized bed and ample closet space *Separated office area with desk in master bedroom  *Queen sized air mattresses with pillows and linens for extra guests *Full bathroom (towels, soap and hairdryer included) *Fully equipped kitchen *Backyard *Free Laundry
interaction: As little or as much as you would like!  We are here to help, answer any questions, give recommendations or share a drink and a story.  We live upstairs, so feel free to say hello anytime!
house_rules: No loud noise after 11pm, thanks!
host_about:
I like to ride bikes, run, ski, surf, take photos and travel.

I work as a design engineer and photographer in Chicago.  Chicago is a huge and vibrant city with so many unique neighborhoods that there is something for everyone.  From true big city life in the loop, to tons of smaller neighborhoods like Logan Square where to feel at home, you can explore for years.  I am always up for good conversation and enjoy giving references around town.  I try to live by giving everyone the benefit of the doubt, because at the end of the day, we are all human!

neighborhood_overview: Nestled just north of the Magnificent Mile and right by Lake Michigan, Chicago's Gold Coast neighborhood is an extension of the glitz & glamour of a city rich with history. The Gold Coast is full of upscale restaurants, high-end lofts, niche boutiques, and award-winning architecture that will make your jaw drop.  Located in the heart of the Gold Coast along the Magnificent Mile known for its shopping, the Old Chicago Water Tower is the second oldest water tower in the United States — it was built in 1869.  Nearby Skyscrapers, such as the Hancock Building, dwarf this building, which is just over 150 Feet.  Not only does the 96th floor of the John Hancock offer wonderful views of the city, but the Signature Lounge offers a choice of more than 700 wines and specialty cocktails.  The Signature Room at the 95th floor is known for its romantic atmosphere and has been voted one of America’s Top Tables by Gourmet Magazine.  Across the street from the Chicago Water Tower, is 758,000 square feet
notes: Chicago Registration Number: Please note that we do not allow bookings from residents of Chicago and surrounding areas.

We offer luggage storage for an additional $20 fee, there is a storage locker on the Mezzanine floor. Luggage storage is not allowed in the unit and is also not allowed at the front desk under any circumstances!

neighborhood_overview: Bucktown is one of Chicago’s trendiest neighborhoods, located in the Logan Square community, just west of Chicago’s Lincoln Park and to the north of another popular neighborhood – Wicker Park.If you love food – eating out or in – you’ll have no shortage of places in the area to patronize. If you like a wide selection of beers to go with your burger then Floyd’s is the place to go. Want a great French bistro, but not interested in flying to Paris? Well, Le Bouchon is for you. Something more American? Then try the gastronomic delights at The Bristol. If instead you want to curl up and cook at home, then the finest grocery store in the city is right across the river from Bucktown – Treasure Island Foods, or “TI” as the locals call it. And there’s Olivia’s in the heart of Bucktown – inspired by the specialty food stores and corner groceries of New York City. There’s a great selection of live music, art exhibits, live theater, and themed bars, from Map Room, WhirelyBall, and Quencher’s Salo
transit: The Blue Line is under a 10 minute walk away, and the Metra is about 15 minutes -- the whole city is within reach. And since the Kennedy Expressway (I-90 / I-94) is only a 3 minute drive away -- commuting is a breeze, no matter how you travel!
interaction: I will greet you at the house during check in or send you a code via message to let you in the house. I live in the area so if you have any questions, problems or simply need recommendations for dinner, please don't hesitate to call.
host_about: I love hosting people. Chicago is one of the most fascinating cities in the world and I am happy I can contribute to your experience of it. I love to travel myself and learn new languages and new cultures. I like to give extra service to my guests to make their stay special. I love to travel and discover new places...

name: Entire place, only 15 min away from Downtown!
summary: Welcome to our lovely home! We have recently bought this property and we could not be happier with our decision. It is located just 15 minutes away from the city.  There is a bus stop conveniently located that takes you directly to the city center. There are dozens of restaurants you can walk to. Laundry facility at the end of the street. The home itself is cozy and very secure. There are cameras on the outside of the home and a alarm system which is optional.
space: The home is 2 units (2 floors with separate entrance). You will have your own entrance and keys for your unit. You have access to everything in the unit. The kitchen is fully equipt. We have a dining table and living room with cable TV and WiFi.  Please, ABSOLUTELY NO drugs, alcohol or smoking permitted in the premises. This includes VAPING. A $250.00 will be charged if this rule is broken. The smell will go around the whole house and we will find out so please do not break this rule. Go to the Alley if you need too. Just not in our home.

neighborhood_overview: the street where our home is located is very quiet. We rarely hear any major noise on the outside.
notes: You will enjoy this home. A few houses from ours, there is a great Mexican restaurant that we love. If not, we are just 2 blocks away from 26th street which is full of restaurants options. There is a bodega style store for you to do a small grocery shopping. There is also an Aldi store if you prefer that. While we do not offer any washer and dryer, at the end of the street there is a laundry mat you can walk to. You do not even need to leave the house at all since everything is within grasp. Although you may want to go out and enjoy our beautiful city, the options are there just in case.
transit: If you are driving, you can park in the street. Parking is usually available but, after 6:00 PM, it becomes a bit more difficult and you may have to park further.  As I mentioned above, bus stops right by our home and it can take you to downtown. You can also take an uber/lyft to the pink line, which takes you straight to downtown.  If all else fails, uber/lyft is around $10.00 to downtown or less depending on traffic. Make sure you check before ordering one.
access: Guests have access to everything in their unit which is located on the first floor. You can also relax in the yard or hang out in the front of the house.
interaction: If you have any questions please feel free to text, or email me. My parents are always home in the upper level so we are always available for you!

This includes VAPING. A $250.00 will be charged if this rule is broken. The smell will go around the whole house and we will find out so please do not break this rule. Go to the Alley if you need too. Just not in our home.  - Please make sure that doors are locked when you leave. - Ask if you have a question or issue: We are almost always here, just ask if you need something or want to know something. We appreciate the opportunity to make things more comfortable for you. If we aren't h

We would love to host you as our guest. I’m available at any time to answer any questions or concerns you may have. Thank you and welcome!

Most visited places in Down Town  such as the museums, Grant Park, Navy Pear, are only 15  to 20minutes distance from the building.

summary: We are doing our part to help Airbnb guests stay safe by cleaning and disinfecting all frequently touched surfaces before you check in.   Gorgeous, historic building renovated to host your next extended stay. From the charming brick exterior to the tailored flooring, cheerful color scheme, and eat-in kitchen, this is urban living at its best. Located a block from bustling Division Street. We have stocked kitchen with when you need for cooking and baking. The Washer & Dryer is a nice bonus!
space: Well-styled living!  This is an apartment in the Lincoln Street Bathhouse - an original piece of Chicago's history!  Walk into a newly renovated, urban oasis made magical by unique FLOR tiles.  The surround is color and vintage rock posters along with an edited selection of local photographers. Live like locals and enjoy Wicker Park/Buck Town & Ukranian Village! The kitchen is modern, spacious and ideal for making magic happen!  It is equipped with the basics and a large pantry accommodates needs for a longer stay.  We provide:  Keurig & pods, washer/dryer, full sets of pans, plates and silverware, full-size refrigerator, toaster, toaster oven, dish washer Both bedrooms are large.  The master is en suite with a huge master closet (it'll make your home closet envious!)  The second bedroom and bath are just as large, but across the hall from one another.

Please remove shoes at all times when in the house.  Please notify me of any additional guests so I can provide you with the proper amount of linens and towels. host_about:
I'm an avid traveler who loves to explore and get as close to culture as possible.  I live in the city of Chicago, work in the business of building brands and love sharing time relaxing with my superstar husband.

We enjoy seeing live music, seeking out the most amazing food, and walking through new neighborhoods. 

We believe in leaving things as we find them - better in some cases!   Our travels with Airbnb have taken us far and wide from SFO to Barcelona, Iceland, Berlin, Mexico - we can't wait to see and experience more of the world!

All guests will be required to verify their information which includes a 3rd-party background check. This is to ensure your safety as well as the safety and well being of our neighbors and our homes. All information is confidential and will not be shared with anyone for any purposes outside of your reservation. Once all information is verified, we will be able to confirm your reservation. name: The Biddle House (WHOLE HOUSE)
summary: A wonderful house for families or large get-togethers in historic old town! Near Second City, Lincoln Park, the Lincoln Park Zoo, Lakefront Path, and amazing shopping and restaurants. Close to the El and bus lines as well! This four bedroom, two bathroom two story guest house is totally charming and couldn't be on a prettier street. Come see for yourself and live like a Chicago native for a few days!
space: The Biddle House is located in Historic Old Town on a quiet tree lined street, walking distance to many wonderful restaurants, shops and the lakefront. We can accommodate up to 9 guests comfortably at this location!  Public transportation is terrific; you can take the train (brown line) downtown in just 10 minutes! There are two fully furnished apartments available at the Biddle House. Each has two bedrooms, one bathroom, a fully equipped kitchen, dining room and living room.  The apartments include the following amenities: High speed internet (wi-fi) cable tv, complimentary washer and dryer in the building. The 2nd floor apartment has one queen size bed in each bedroom and a twin size sleeper sofa in the living room. There is a single Jacuzzi tub and shower in the bathroom.  The 1st floor apartment has a queen size bed in one bedroom and a full size bed in the other bedroom. The bathroom has a bathtub and shower.  Closest major intersection is North Avenue and Sedgwick Street. It's ha

neighborhood_overview: Old Town is the Historic District of Chicago. The neighborhood is beyond charming, located just north of the Gold Coast, filled with countless restaurants and boutiques, walking distance to the History Museum, Michigan Ave (15 min walk), DePaul University, Armitage Street and the Lincoln Park Zoo! A wonderful location to experience Chicago!
transit: The Brown Line "L" is just 3 blocks away and takes you downtown in 10-15 minutes! Several Bus stops are near by as well.
interaction: We are available 24/7 During Your Stay! Call us anytime!
host_about:
Hi, we're Bob and Liz Biddle, long time Chicagoans and your hosts. We started At Home Inn Chicago in 2000 as a reservation service for bed and breakfasts in Chicago, and have since evolved into one of the city's most-respected sources for vacation rentals, corporate housing, and weekend getaways. 

We provide fully furnished vacation rentals and corporate housing throughout the city in or near Old Town and Lincoln Park.

We are here to answer all of your questions about Chicago, whether you need a restaurant recommendation, public transit tips, or insider tips on how to experience the Chicago that locals know and love. 

We love this city, especially getting ribs at Twin Anchors in Old Town before a show at Second City.  Topo Gigio is a great local Italian Restaurant and The Gemini Bistro is an excellent choice for fine dining. And Velvet Taco, casual with its own unique style on Lincoln is fabulous!

The free concerts at Pritzker Pavilion in Millenium Park can't be matched by any city in the world. 

We'd love to help you experience all of this with us and so much more!

name: Clean & bright Noble Square guest suite
summary: Unwind and enjoy the city in our cozy and clean guest suite!  We're new hosts on AirBnB and excited to begin having guests stay at our recently furnished guest space.  We are a married couple who live in the main part of the unit with our dog and cat (separate from your space) and are excited for you to use our guest suite as a home base for which to decompress or explore the city!
space: Your guest suite is attached to our apartment by a door in our hallway which always remains closed and locked. You have a separate entrance for the guest suite in the back of the building which has a keyless deadbolt and keyed door handle. You'll have a completely private bedroom and bathroom with an entryway which houses all the extra linens, dishes, etc.
description: Unwind and enjoy the city in our cozy and clean guest suite!  We're new hosts on AirBnB and excited to begin having guests stay at our recently furnished guest space.  We are a married couple who live in the main part of the unit with our dog and cat (separate from your space) and are excited for you to use our guest suite as a home base for which to decompress or explore the city! Your guest suite is attached to our apartment by a door in our hallway which always remains closed and locked. You have a separate entrance for the guest suite in the back of the building which has a keyless deadbolt and keyed door handle. You'll have a completely private bedroom and bathroom with an entryway which houses all the extra linens, dishes, etc. Our building has several apartments; yours is behind the garden unit. You'll use a lockbox to get the keys and will walk to the back of the building to find your private entrance to the Airbnb. We live in the front part of the garden unit and both work dur
neighborhood_overview: We've lived in this neighborhood for over 5 years and love it! There are plenty of restaurants, bars and vintage shops to keep you busy. Check out our Guidebook for a few recommendations and favorite places.
notes: We have a dog and cat in our section of the home. They've never been in your part of the house but we do the Airbnb laundry in our unit. We do our best to keep their hair off of anything that goes into the Airbnb but want you to be aware in case of severe allergies. There is a unit located directly above ours. While our neighbors are generally quiet and respectful of others in the property, you may hear some noise from their unit from time to time. We love to cook so you may smell what we're making for dinner from time to time. The Airbnb bedroom and hallway can get chilly in the winter, so we've provided a space heater that you can use to warm up the space if needed. We've found that keeping the bedroom door closed will help keep the room warmer.
transit: You'll be one block away from the #66 Chicago and #9 Ashland buses, and about half a mile away from the Chicago and Division Blue Line stops.  There is also free parking on the street immediately outside of our apartment, however, it’s first come, first served so it may or may not be available. Please pay attention to street signs to ensure you don't accidentally park in a zoned area requiring permits.
access: Our building has several apartments; yours is behind the garden unit. You'll use a lockbox to get the keys and will walk to the back of the building to find your private entrance to the Airbnb.
interaction: We live in the front part of the garden unit and both work during the days, but are usually available should you need anything. Even if we aren't there in person, you can always contact us through the Airbnb app.
host_about:
Stay where it counts. When you book a Loftium, you're contributing to the local community. Each Loftium is home to a local resident who hosts and lives right on-site, making sure your experience is a delightful one. All spaces are designed with your comfort in mind! We've made check-in and communication a breeze, and each home provides a beautiful and cozy place to rest your head during your travels. Every Loftium home and host is unique, and you'll always get a true neighborhood experience during your stay.

Visit a new community and book a Loftium in any of our cities: Seattle, Portland, Denver, San Diego, Phoenix, Chicago, Atlanta, Dallas, Charlotte, or Orlando. We can't wait for you to visit!

host_about: We are a family of four, my husband Vince is a teacher and I am an artist, our two daughters are in college.  Our house is on the North side of Chicago, easy 20 minute trip by bus or train into downtown.  Between our house and downtown is Wrigley Field, Lincoln Park Zoo and several beaches.  In our neighborhood you will find great restaurants both award winning and ethnic (or both!), theaters, music venues and shopping within 5-15 minutes walking.  We love to eat out, hang out at the beach, go to see music in the local clubs and visit art shows around town.

name: Room On Quiet, Convenient Street in Wicker/Buck
summary: Wicker/Buck stands for the Wicker Park/Bucktown border where the apartments sits.  Five minute walk from Blue Line trains (transfer-free travel to downtown and O'Hare Airport), nationally-acclaimed drinking/dining, The 606 bike/walk trail, and interesting boutiques.  Street parking is permitted (I have day passes for your use) and plentiful. Queen-sized Leesa mattress, organic linens, an open bar, and Baxter shower products provided for your use.
space: Two bed room apartment with tall ceilings, loads of light, and my bizarre collection of trinkets from travels across the globe.  One bedroom is for my use, the other bedroom is for you.  There is a deck out back with a loveseat and other seating and a table that is a great way to spend the golden hour.  The apartment has central heating and A/C controlled via a Nest Thermostat and feel free to use the WiFi.  I have a large collection of books, magazines, records for you to peruse during your time at what my friends affectionately call Hambone Manor. Your room features a full length mirror, plush towels, a full closet, and underbed storage. Other in-room amenities are a hair dryer, a white noise machine, and a fire extinguisher. Best of all, you may have the whole place to yourself.  I travel for work often, and am occasionally called away at the last moment.  While I'm certain you will enjoy having the place to yourself, should you have any questions I remain available and I have forme

neighborhood_overview: Bucktown/Wicker Park is a pretty happening spot.  All spots listed are less than a ten minute walk from the apartment unless otherwise noted: For food and drink many of Eater's 38 essential restaurants are within walking distance and there are countless others that get lots of food press love (Paul Kahan's Big Star/Dove's Luncheonette/Cafe Cancale, Pub Royale, Piece Brewery and Pizzeria, Antique Taco, Stan's Doughnuts, The Delta, Small Cheval, Umami Burger, Le Bouchon, Craft Pizza, Furious Spoon, The Bristol).   Beloved cocktail bar The Violet Hour is a short stumble away and iconic Chicago beer bar The Map Room is five minutes out by Divvy bike.  Stop by the Emporium Arcade Bar for a quality draft list and quality gaming.  For coffee check out the The Wormhole, Ipsento,  and La Colombe (The Wormhole has an entire Delorean inside of its relaxed environs and seriously impressive latte art). Music venues within a five minute walk include The Subterranean and The Double Door. Shop at the
notes: There is permitted street parking that is well-lit, safe, and generally close to the apartment.  There is a Divvy bike-share stations one, four, and six blocks away (Divvy is my primary form of transportation), the # 72 bus to Red Line trains runs every ten minutes just down the street on North Avenue, the CTA's Damen stop for Blue Line trains is a five minute walk away, the Metra commuter rail is a 10 minute walk, and there are cabs on North Avenue throughout the day (Uber/Lyft users can expect to have a car at the doorstep within five minutes 24 hours a day).  Download the Transit app to see the cost, directions, and time commitment for all the different modes of transit in one place. I have a very early checkout to allow myself the time necessary to turn the room around and get to work on-time.  I'm totally flexible if there are no other guests arriving the day of your departure, and stashing bags in the living room (no matter if you're arriving early or departing late) is not a pro
transit: There is free street parking that is well-lit, safe, and all around the apartment (I've never had to park more than two blocks away).  There is a Divvy bike-share station on the corner (Divvy is my primary form of transportation), the # 72 bus runs every ten minutes, the CTA's Blue Line is a five minute walk away, the Metra commuter rail is a 10 minute walk ), and there are cabs on North Avenue throughout the day (Uber/Lyft users can expect to have a car at the doorstep within five minutes 24 hours a day).  The apartment's close proximity to the highway means most fares to River North, Millennium Park or the Art Institute will run less than $15 on via ridesharing outside of rush hour traffic.
access: You have free reign to almost  anything in the place (my only request is for you to leave be the wine on the rack), mi casa es su casa.  Enjoy the fully stocked bar with numerous rare spirits and a few cocktail books to try your hand at making a superlative night cap.  There's a large hi-fi in the main room if you want to peruse the record collection or bump some jams via bluetooth.  Tired from your day running around town?  Kick back and relax while watching some flicks using the projector on the 101" screen.   Feel free to fiddle with the Nest Thermostat if you need to get the temperature indoors just right.
interaction: I'm available for questions 24/7 via phone but I tend to lead a pretty active lifestyle, the result of which is I'm not home much.   I'm also a big coffee (though come summer it is mostly iced coffee) and matcha drinker and will be happy to make a cup or two for you if you let me know the night prior. See the note in "The Space" section regarding how I may have to delegate some issues you encounter to my siblings or pals.
house_rules: Please try to pick up after yourselves by placing cups and dishes in the sink so I can clean them.   If you plan on bringing friends old or new by, that's a-okay if you ask in advance.  Smokers please use the patio. Leave the keys on the table where you found them on the way out (don't worry about bolting the door).  Please leave the door to your room slightly ajar when you're not around to let the airflow in and so I know I do not have to tiptoe around to avoid disturbing you.
host_about:
5th Generation Chicagoan with a deep knowledge of all the great attractions that makes the City of Big Shoulders great. I'm a consummate traveler having hit 30+ countries across all seven continents who is eager to swap stories of adventure.  Great hospitality is something I've received so much of and I am always excited to pay it forward.  

I love cooking, coffee, culture, and being as active as I possibly can.

neighborhood_overview: The South Loop is such a dynamic mix of attractions and histories that the neighborhood tends to be seen as many different things to many different people. Consider the assorted areas that comprise the South Loop: Much of its eastern edge is encompassed by the Museum Campus, an impressive collection of cultural treasures that includes the Field Museum, Adler Planetarium and Shedd Aquarium. This campus sits on scenic lakefront parklands that are an extension of Grant Park. With 319 acres of green space and recreational fields, Grant Park is known as "Chicago's front yard" to locals and also plays host to major city events such as Taste of Chicago, Chicago Blues Festival and Lollapalooza.  Jutting out further into Lake Michigan is Northerly Island, a peninsula sought out by nature lovers, while along the southern edge the sports fans know Soldier Field as the stadium for the beloved Chicago Bears football team. Meeting attendees are most familiar with McCormick Place, the largest convent

name: Charming 2-BR/1-bath near Wrigley
summary: Welcome to Chicago! Enjoy a wonderful stay in this 2-BR/1 bath unit located on a serene, residential side street. The unit has everything you need to make your visit seamless and comfortable. Plus, it's in a prime location with easy access to Wrigley, Southport, parks/beaches, theaters, restaurants/bars, as well as multiple public transportation options. ** TO READ MORE, please expand the section below.**

neighborhood_overview: The Southport Corridor of Lakeview’s neighborhood has so much within walking distance, you won't want to leave! There are numerous bakeries, boutique stores, theaters, and lively bars and restaurants. If you do feel like venturing out of the neighborhood, Lakeview is very centrally located. Head south to visit Lincoln Park, River North, and the Loop, or west to visit Buck Town or Logan square. Within minutes in a cab, you can be in any of these places.
notes: COURTESY Please note this unit is on a quiet residential street. We respect our neighbors and keep quiet hours from 9pm-8am. Similarly, the building's outdoor space is not for socializing, and instead we request guests socialize indoors only. Therefore, if your group is looking for more of a party environment, please allow us to recommend another unit that would be better suited for that noise level. ENTRY Check-in is at 4pm or later and check-out is by 10am. We provide detailed entry notes and photos to help this process go smoothly. If needed, we can provide bag storage before check-in or after check-out. PACK N PLAY Pack N Play may be rented for $5/night. It will be inside the unit waiting for you in its carrying case, and we request you fold it up back into its carrying case prior to departure. Note that linens are not included for the crib.
transit: PARKING Free, public street parking is available in the area with no permit required. Please note that this means you may have to circle the block a few times to find a spot. There is also metered parking on a nearby street, and that becomes free from 6pm-9am daily. If you prefer paid parking for your additional vehicles, I recommend using Spot-Hero to find nearby options that work for you. Once you're here, public transportation and/or Uber are the easiest ways to get around the city.  CLOSEST STOPS o Southport brown train stop: .4 mi, trains go uptown/downtown o Belmont red/purple/brown trains: .7 mi, trains go uptown/downtown o 77 bus: goes east/west  Train stations all have machines that sell Ventra passes (name of provider). You can also purchase Ventra cards at Walgreens. You can either purchase a single ride ticket or a re-loadable Ventra card (one-time $5 fee). Multiple people may share a Ventra card and fares will be deducted for each person; however, the 1, 3, and 7 day passe
access: You will have the full unit to yourself. KEYS We provide 3 sets of keys for you.  If keys are lost, there is a $15 replacement fee. CENTRAL HEAT/AC The unit has central heat/AC for your convenience with a thermostat within the unit.
interaction: My goal is to ensure you have the most enjoyable and comfortable stay in Chicago. I have a detailed guest guidebook (emailed in advance and printed in unit) that includes info about the apt, neighborhood, and city to help maximize your time in the city. If you'd like additional assistance with anything, I'm more than happy to help! Depending on my work travel schedule, I may or may not be in town; however, I'm always accessible via phone or email for any questions that arise.
house_rules: REQUESTS: 1) Please treat the home with respect. 2) Please be courteous of others in building and neighbors. All socializing must be kept indoors after 9pm, and we request quiet time from 10pm-8am.  3) The only guests allowed in the unit are those on the reservation. Special events will be considered on a case-by-case basis.  4) We welcome children, but we are not child-proof. If you have specific questions/concerns, please ask before booking. CHECK IN/OUT:  Standard check-in time is 4pm (or later). Standard check-out time and is by 10am. If scheduling permits, we will work with you on alternate arrangements, so please inquire.  If unit is not vacated by check-out time or notes are not followed, additional cleaning charges may apply. For check out, I ask that you: - turn off lights/TV/AC - place used kitchen items in dishwasher and begun cycle - bag any trash and dispose in bins behind building - gather all towels in bathtub; linens may be left as is  - keys can be left inside the unit
host_about:
I began using Airbnb as a traveler in the fall of 2013, and I'm hooked! Staying in someone's home allows you to experience the area in a truly authentic way - no more hotels for me! As of May 2014, I began hosting in Chicago and have since hosted thousands of guests from around the world. I love helping others make the most of their visits. 

As a host, I am personable, responsive, and detail-oriented. I take great pride in the comfort and cleanliness of each apartment. You can trust that when staying in any one of our properties, you will feel at home.

host_about:
Hi I’m Samson!

Here’s a little about myself. I’m 38 years old, gay, born and raised in Chicago. Super friendly and helpful. Extremely easy to get along with. I’ve lived in Uptown for 10 years now (Same place as listed here on Airbnb.) I decided to open up my home to travelers looking for an amazing place to stay. The apartment is over 2,300 sq ft and I ’ve designed it for private guest use and enjoyment. When booking, I highly encourage you to feel like my place is your own home and just be yourselves. I treat all my guests like family! I do have an extensive background in hospitality and I truly enjoy being a Superhost. My goal is to always provide the most clean and comfortable accommodations for your stay. Cheers to making lasting memories and unforgettable experiences!

I grew up in the suburbs and after living on the west coast, east coast and a stint abroad I couldn't be happier to make Chicago home! 

My boyfriend Jesse and I have lived in the Ravenswood neighborhood for many years and love all the local breweries, restaurants, and ease of biking! We enjoy meeting new people and hope you will love Chicago as much as we do!

neighborhood_overview: Located in West Loop, this furnished rental invites you to explore the edges of downtown Chicago. From endless dining and bar options to art galleries and stylish shops, West Loop has emerged with so much to offer daily. During weekends, residents savor trips to the Chicago French Market and the vibrant strip of Randolph Street. The latter is known as “Restaurant Row” and is lined with some of the city’s best eateries. Fulton Market, one of the hippest and fastest-growing neighborhoods, is ideal for dinner and drinks. Union Station is only a 5 to 10 minute walk away.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions (including certain Bull Terriers and any related breeds). Wild animals and hybrids, including wolf and coyote hybrids, snakes, ferrets, rabbits, are all prohibited. Please contact us for precise breed restrictions. Please note that a one-off non refundable fee ($500) and a monthly rent ($25/mo/pet) is applicable upon reservation. Failing to notify us of any pets prior to check-in will incur a penalty, and may result in denied check-in. Supporting documents (ie. vaccinations) may be required - Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a $250 monthly fe
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

name: Eclectic, Musical Pilsen: Steps from Train/Park
summary: Our place is close to the Pink Line Station,  National Mexican Art Museum, The Barrel, Lagunitas Brewery, Harrison Park, 18th street shops, nightlife, and dining. You'll love the open feel of our unique space and the lovely backyard patio. Our place is good for couples, friends exploring Chicago, and business travelers.
space: This two bedroom classic Chicago storefront/loft on the main floor of an 1888 two-flat is close to downtown and steps from the pink line. Once a cafe, this spacious and eclectic unit features 13 foot ceilings, a white baby grand piano, and hardwood floors.
description: Our place is close to the Pink Line Station,  National Mexican Art Museum, The Barrel, Lagunitas Brewery, Harrison Park, 18th street shops, nightlife, and dining. You'll love the open feel of our unique space and the lovely backyard patio. Our place is good for couples, friends exploring Chicago, and business travelers. This two bedroom classic Chicago storefront/loft on the main floor of an 1888 two-flat is close to downtown and steps from the pink line. Once a cafe, this spacious and eclectic unit features 13 foot ceilings, a white baby grand piano, and hardwood floors. We're here for you as needed. Pilsen is one of Chicago's most historically rich neighborhoods. Starting out as an Eastern European immigrant stronghold in the early 1900's, it's become known for its Mexican culture in the last 30 years. It's artsy, diverse, and friendly. We've lived here for 7 years and it keeps getting better. Steps from the unit is the pink line el train station where downtown awaits in a brisk 10-1
neighborhood_overview: Pilsen is one of Chicago's most historically rich neighborhoods. Starting out as an Eastern European immigrant stronghold in the early 1900's, it's become known for its Mexican culture in the last 30 years. It's artsy, diverse, and friendly. notes: We live onsite, and are here to make things easy and comfortable. We're both professional musicians, feel free to explore the instruments about during reasonable hours ;)
transit: Steps from the unit is the pink line el train station where downtown awaits in a brisk 10-15 minutes. For truly authentic Mexican cuisine and culture, Pilsen’s historic 18th street is in walking distance. The Pilsen Arts District on Halsted street is in close proximity as well, with many amazing art galleries to explore.
interaction: We're here for you as needed.
house_rules: Please No smoking inside the apartment/building. You’re welcome to enjoy the outside patio for smoking/coffee/drinks etc. That is the only space shared with us.  (Weather permitting or when available)  Absolutely no more than 5 guests please. Children count as guests. Please dispose of any opened food in the refrigerator or pantry.  Kitchen door is for emergency exit only. This purpose is for your privacy and ours.  The cats live in our apartment above you. They do not share any personal space with you, unless you'd like to meet Mr. Meowsy and Pushpa of course!
host_about: World traveling musician, wife, mom, Cat mom, food and film lover.

name: Sunny spacious space in Roscoe Village
summary: Our space is in Roscoe Village just a mile and half west of Wrigleyville. You'll have your own bedroom with access to the living room, kitchen, back deck, and yard, and free laundry. The Addison Brown Line train is a 10 minute walk away, and nearby are all the bars and restaurants of Roscoe Village and North Center. It's a great place to stay if you're in town for a Cubs game or just to explore the city and the neighborhoods.
space: Our space is a two-bedroom apartment in the heart of Roscoe Village, close to all the action yet in a quiet and chill neighborhood! Your bedroom has a full size bed for two and a closet with hangers. The living room has a couch for a third or fourth person and a large tv with surround sound. The TV has Netflix, Amazon Prime, Hulu, Spotify, and Chromecast. Wifi is available throughout the apartment. There's a (Hidden by Airbnb) Home and an Amazon Echo for use for music. Feel free to make use of our kitchen and fridge. I have a full set of plates, silverware, pots & pans, etc. A coffee machine is available for use. I just ask that you clean up whatever items you may use. Adjacent to the kitchen is a private back deck with patio furniture and a backyard. Free laundry is available next to the kitchen as well, which is fairly rare in Chicago.

neighborhood_overview: Roscoe Village is a fun quirky area just 1 1/2 miles west of Wrigleyville. Roscoe St. just south of here has tons of great brunch spots, bars, shopping, etc. My personal favorites: Coffee Joint for coffee, Orange for brunch, Bartoli’s for deep dish pizza, The Region for burgers, John’s Place for dinner, Yindee for Thai, Roscoe Village Pub or Village Tap for drinks. Just north of here is North Center which is also a hidden gem. Great restaurants as well along with a farmers market, music venues, improv theater, and two awesome breweries, Begyle and Dovetail. Happy exploring!
transit: The Addison Brown Line stop is a 10 minute walk east. The 152 bus which goes east and west on Addison is just out the door, and there's a Divvy station across the street if you're into biking around the city.
access: You'll have access to the bedroom, bathroom, kitchen, living room, the back patio, and laundry.
interaction: Feel free to message me or my co-host Sarah through the app or text if you have any questions! If the space is listed as "private room", that means we'll be home at some point during your stay.
host_about: Cleveland -> Chicago. Avid explorer, lover of local history, music, and adventures.

name: Guest Suite an Easy Swing From Wrigley Field
summary: Sleep steps away from Wrigley Field in a retro brass bedstead with high-thread-count linen. The private bathroom has a tub, while the shared living room features a fireplace and recliner chair, set under tall ceilings. For quiet time, head for the backyard patio. When you are ready to explore Chicago the 2 block proximity to Red Line CTA stations and DIVVY bike-sharing make exploring the city easy.  *Please note: Household has two friendly dogs that are kept out of guests' way*
space: The guest room and guest bath give a good deal of privacy, as both are located on the lower level of the town home. Guests will also have access to a shared living room, kitchen, and outdoor patio to enjoy during the summer months.

neighborhood_overview: The setting is between the Wrigleyville and Boystown neighborhoods of Lakeview, a single block from the iconic Wrigley Field, and also near Lake Michigan and parks. Choose from plenty of restaurants and bars on Clark, Addison, and Sheffield Avenues.
transit: The condo is located just two blocks away from the Addison and Sheridan Red Line CTA stations. It takes approximately 20 minutes to ride to the Loop. "DIVVY" bike-sharing stations are located just one block south. Residential parking permits  are available to guests with advanced notice.
access: Hosts will meet guests upon arrival. For access after initial greeting, guests will be given a personal key code for the main entrance.
interaction: Hosts are generally available in the morning or evenings to answer any of our guest's questions or concerns.
host_about:
My husband (Jason) and I are from San Diego, California but we are huge fans of our new home-- Chicago.  I'm all about the arts and culture, while Jason is the big sports and craft beer fan. We keep busy exploring our neighborhood of Wrigleyville and all the great sites Chicago has to offer.  Meanwhile our spoiled dogs, Blue and Emmy, are thoroughly enjoying their lakefront runs on Lake Michigan.

We are looking forward to sharing our new city with our guests.

neighborhood_overview: Old Town is a neighborhood that oozes with history, including former speakeasies and ornate churches.  Tree-lined Wells Street features the revered Second City and Zanies comedy clubs, old-school pubs, charming eateries and artisanal coffee shops, as well as quirky boutiques. St. Michael’s Church is one of the few structures in Chicago to survive the Great Fire of 1871. Nearby Goose Island (the namesake of one of the city's best breweries) is the only island in the Chicago River, a product of the city's industrial past that is now poised for a great urban revival. Explore the restaurants, bars/nightlife, and attractions that fill each area with out guide to the North Side neighborhoods.
notes: Please check the house manual and check-in instructions after booking to get the apartment instructions. Parking instructions are in house manual. Thanks :)
transit: No more than a 10 minute walk to Sedgwick “El” stop which will take you to all downtown attractions in 5-10 minutes.  The most convenient public transportation is Uber or Lyft. If you want to explore Old Town, you have many places walking distance. Taxi's are also always available as another means of transportation. We think you'll find that plenty of activities are right outside your doorstep and accessible by foot :) Use my promo code for Uber and get a FREE UBER RIDE CREDIT up to $20: UBER: shdzu
interaction: I'm available 24/7. I'm looking forward to hosting you soon! If you have any questions, please let me know :)
house_rules: Please start dishwasher before leaving if using dishes.  - Please no glitter! - No local guests - $500 smoking fine, $1000 party fine - It should shut by itself, but please keep the laundry room door shut
host_about:
Wendy and Matt are experienced hosts/partners who take pride in making sure guests enjoy their stay. Wendy comes from the beautiful Alicante, Spain, and Matt was raised just outside of Madison, Wisconsin. We have hosted now over 1,000 stays, and we enjoy doing so! Making guests happy, makes us happy:)
We want our guests to get the full Chicago experience while having them come back to a safe, yet immaculate spot. Therefore, all our places are in very safe and well-known areas and the beds are very high-quality along with the other furniture. That’s why the one thing we ask is to please respect our places. When you book with us, please don’t hesitate to ask for recommendations or any questions you or your group may have. We look forward to hosting you:)

Hipster neighborhoods, Wicker Park and Bucktown, is a short subway ride on the way downtown.  LGBTQ-friendly Andersonville is direct on the Foster bus route.  Concert venues Aragon Ballroom and Riveria is direct on the Lawrence bus route. Metra stops directly at Arlington Park for thoroughbred racing throughout the summer.  Quick and direct access to O'Hare Airport. Perfect if your flight is delayed, bumped or grounded.
notes: Sit and enjoy the front porch and backyard.  Play guitar? Ask nicely, I might share my Martin. There is a friendly house dog. Sometimes he talks. Please be sure all doors and gates are securily closed or latched. Thank you. Please respect our neighbors and community.  All are welcome. Stay length of 2 night minimum during festival summer weekends at owner discretion. We are thrilled that you chose us!
transit: Public transportation is a short walk away. The Blue Line is the ONLY subway line that runs 24 hours. There, you may find Zipcar, taxis. Uber & Lyft. Divvy bike rentals are coming...
interaction: Host lives onsite and works in creative technology. Loves to travel, arts, music...
house_rules: This is a non smoking space. Please, no outside visitors without advance notice to hosts. No non-paying overnight guests.  Check out by 11 am, please, or by arrangement. Later check out WILL be billed an additional half day unless ok'd by host. This is to ensure adequate cleaning for new cycle of guests. Thank you.
host_about:
I love Chicago. Love the architecture & culture, food, goofy pockets, it's endless possibilities.

Our 1896 home-- small, clean, contemporary-- is less than a 12 minute stroll and 30 minute subway ride to the world via O'Hare Airport. 

We are located in a safe, clean, quiet neighborhood with mature trees and free street parking should you have a car (but you don't really need one).

A stay is designed for the budget traveler: private room with one queen-size, super awesome comfy air-mattress. 

The room is cozy -- rooms built in 1896 were-- best suited for a couple. 
Private bathroom, continental breakfast, wifi access. 
At this time, no private tv but why would you want it when there's so much else to do?

House dog will enthusiastically welcome you. 
This is a nonsmoking space.

GLBT friendly. 
Easy walk to Blue Line subway, bus terminal and Metra train.

name: Captivating Stay Alfred in The Gold Coast
summary: Classy vacation rental with top-notch amenities in Chicago's buzzy Gold Coast neighborhood.
space: Among the shops, restaurants, and attractions of Chicago's exciting Gold Coast district, these elegant travel apartments offer style and sophistication everywhere you look. From the tall ceilings to the gorgeous dark-wood cabinets in each unit to the expansive rooftop terrace and barbecue stations, there's no better place to relax and recharge on a whirlwind trip to Chi-Town. The building's common areas are anything but common - including a cozy game room and a state-of-the-art gym - and the fireplaces in the lobby offer an ideal place to cozy up in the middle of a chilly Chicago winter.

Should you need us, we're here 24/7 with our guest services team and local folks on the ground. And if you don't need us, we'll stay out of
notes: Ready to experience the best of Chi-Town? The vibrant Gold Coast neighborhood is the perfect home base for any Windy City adventure: Whether you want to take your Chicago vacation to new heights at the 94th-floor 360 Chicago observation deck or down closer to sea level on the scenic coast of Lake Michigan, you're in the middle of it all. The neighborhood is home to Armani, Barney's,Chanel, Jimmy Choo and Tom Ford, and steps away from more great shopping, including the high-end 900 North Michigan Shops and the huge Water Tower Place. Cultural landmarks like the Museum of Contemporary Art and Loyola University's Museum of Art are also close at hand. We furnish all of our properties to a uniform standard, but individual units may differ slightly from the pictures shown.
interaction: We believe in personal space. Prior to your arrival, your unit will be professionally cleaned and your self guided check in process ensures easy arrival with no long lines. Should you need us, we're here 24/7 with our guest services team and local folks on the ground. And if you don't need us, we'll stay out of your way. After all, this is your place in the city.
house_rules: 1. You're living like a local, be respectful of the other locals. We mean, c'mon, how would you feel if your neighbor wasn't super awesome?  2. All of our Rental Units are smoke-free environments. Even on the balcony, if you have one. We're super sorry if this is a bummer, but it's our policy. Hopefully we told you about it ahead of time and you aren't super surprised that we still mean it.  3. Pets are super awesome, but they aren't allowed in our Rental Units. However, if your fur kiddo is a service animal then give us a call and we will make reasonable efforts to accommodate your needs, as required by law.   4. Your trip details should already be complete. If they aren't, give us a call ASAP so we can rectify that! What's a little information between friends?   5. Your friend, your responsibility. Pretty simple, if you invite them to your Rental Unit, you're responsible for their actions.   6. While watching a million people get out of a clown car is hilarious, there are occupancy r

name: +Two Queen Beds, Patio, Safe Area, Friendly Dog +
summary: Large Bedroom with 2 queen beds available in home with friendly dog, in the safest neighborhood in Chicago. Access to whole house including laundry and back yard.  Walking distance to restaurants, grocery, forest preserve, community pool... 10 min drive to O'Hare Airport, Rivers Casino, Stephens Convention Center, Allstate Arena, Fashion Outlets, Rosemont Theater & more. 20 min drive to Downtown Chicago & Lakefront. Additional bedrooms with king bed or full size bed available upon request.
space: Large Bedroom with 2 queen beds, Smart TV, Wifi access, desk, 2 closets, mirror. Additional bedrooms with double bed or king bed available upon request for additional charge. You might have a private bathroom if there are no other guests booked in adjacent rooms. If you need a private bathroom, you may want to consider our other listing: www.airbnb.com/rooms/ (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)
