neighborhood_overview: Walking distance to restaurants, grocery, drug stores, forest preserve, community pool, and more. 10 minute drive to O'Hare Airport, Rivers Casino, Donald E. Stephens Convention Center, Allstate Arena, Fashion Outlets of Chicago, Rosemont Theater, Zanies Comedy Club, iFly Indoor Skydiving, King Bowling and Billiards and other entertainment. 20 minute drive to downtown Chicago and Lakefront
notes: You are welcome to make use of the kitchen / stove / refrigerator for light cooking. This is a vegetarian household... you can order in meat dishes, but please no cooking meat, fish, or heavy frying in the kitchen. Please observe quiet hours after 10:00 PM.
transit: There is free parking on the street in front of the house. No permit required. Uber and Lyft are the best way to get around if you do not have a car. There are buses nearby that can take you anywhere in the city. The blue line (CTA Train) is a short bus ride away. Get a Ventra card (from vending machine at train station & airport) if you plan to travel by public transportation.
access: Access to whole house: living room, kitchen, dining room, 1.5 bathrooms, laundry room, and back yard.
interaction: I am a very casual, hands-off guy, and my dog Ebony is very friendly. I work from home, so I will be around. You are welcome to make yourself at home.
house_rules: 1. NO PARTIES OR EVENTS at the house without prior host approval. All guests must be approved before having them. Additional overnight guests may incur an extra charge. The violation of this rule may lead to the removal of all guests without refund. 2. Please observe quiet hours on the property after 10:00 PM. The house is shared with Joey and Ebony, and we have neighbors close by. 2. NO smoking in the house or in front of the house. If you need to smoke, please do so in the backyard or in the alley and dispose of cigarettes in the trash properly. Any damages from smoking, or the lingering smell of smoke, will be taken from the security deposit for cleaning, defumigation, or replacement. 3. You may come and go as you please. If you come in late, please be aware that Ebony will wake up and start barking. That is normal and okay... it's her job. Please come in quietly if it is late. 4. You are welcome to cook on the stove in the kitchen. (No oven at this time.) We have some breakfast ite
host_about:
Hi, my name is Joey, and the black beauty next to me is Ebony. We love to walk through the forest preserve every day and enjoy life.

I am a real estate investor, working from home. After 45 years in the business, I have turned my attention to helping others succeed in real estate also.

I am a vegan and love to live a healthy lifestyle.

I love my home... it is my paradise!

host_about:
Hello! My name is Natalia, and I would like to welcome you to Chicago. I host with my sister, Marina, and we are originally from Saint Petersburg, Russia, but we spent our teenage years in Aix-en-Provence, France and therefore speak English, Russian and French fluently :) I work as an investment banker in the loop. 

Hotels can get very expensive, so we do our best to help tourists out. I really hope to host you! :)

name: 3BD, 2BA Hotel Suite -Fireplace
summary: Live like a local in one of Chicago's best neighborhoods at a top-rated TripAdvisor property! Located in the vibrant and historic Andersonville, our spacious suites are ideal for family reunions, bridal parties, and milestone celebrations.
space: The large, fully equipped gourmet kitchen and dining area make this unit ideal for hosting a family gathering for the holidays, or just a weekend getaway with the girlfriends.  The unit is spacious enough to accommodate up to 6 people.    Club Room and Library suitable for events, contact for rates and pricing.
description: Live like a local in one of Chicago's best neighborhoods at a top-rated TripAdvisor property! Located in the vibrant and historic Andersonville, our spacious suites are ideal for family reunions, bridal parties, and milestone celebrations. The large, fully equipped gourmet kitchen and dining area make this unit ideal for hosting a family gathering for the holidays, or just a weekend getaway with the girlfriends.  The unit is spacious enough to accommodate up to 6 people.    Club Room and Library suitable for events, contact for rates and pricing. Entire unit is all yours. 24 Hour Front Desk. Our location puts us at the border of three vibrant Chicago neighborhoods - Andersonville, Uptown and Lincoln Square.  These neighborhoods each have their own distinctive feel, and are full of eclectic restaurants, independently-owned small businesses and other attractions.  We are within walking distance to famous Chicago destinations including the Green Mill, Aragon Ballroom, Riviera Theater.  Wr
neighborhood_overview: Our location puts us at the border of three vibrant Chicago neighborhoods - Andersonville, Uptown and Lincoln Square.  These neighborhoods each have their own distinctive feel, and are full of eclectic restaurants, independently-owned small businesses and other attractions.  We are within walking distance to famous Chicago destinations including the Green Mill, Aragon Ballroom, Riviera Theater.  Wrigley Field is a short bus ride away, and the popular beaches of Lake Michigan are within a mile from our doors.
notes: Afternoon tea available by Vanille Patisserie. Contact us for details.
transit: The nearest CTA Red line train station (Lawrence stop) is less than a 10 minute walk away, and we are located on the route of several bus lines, including the Clark 22 bus route.  Taxis are easily hailed along Clark Street.
access: Entire unit is all yours.
interaction: 24 Hour Front Desk.
house_rules: Front Desk available 24 hours/day to get keys. Check In: 4:00pm - 11:30pm Check Out: 10:00 am Garage parking available: $24+tax per vehicle Valid Photo ID required to pick up keys. Please provide name of all guests upon check-in. No smoking in the room, on the balcony or anywhere on the premises Quiet Hours (9:00pm-9:00am) to respect our guests.
host_about: I'm an avid traveler who loves Chicago. Great food and people make the experience and Chicago has both and then some. I have a background in hospitality to ensure you'll have a great experience in my city.

name: Bright Spacious 2 BR
summary: Beautiful hardwood floors throughout this bright 2 nd floor apartment on the northwest side of Chicago. Updated modern kitchen and bath with all conveniences including laundry. Easy access to airport and highways. Parking on quiet tree lined street.
space: This space has a bright and open floor plan and has recently been completely remodeled!  Stocked with all the kitchen gadgets you may need including a Keurig coffee maker, spices and olive oil.
description: Beautiful hardwood floors throughout this bright 2 nd floor apartment on the northwest side of Chicago. Updated modern kitchen and bath with all conveniences including laundry. Easy access to airport and highways. Parking on quiet tree lined street. This space has a bright and open floor plan and has recently been completely remodeled!  Stocked with all the kitchen gadgets you may need including a Keurig coffee maker, spices and olive oil.   Guests have a private entrance and small back deck.  Guests are welcome to share communal space in the back yard and enjoy the garden. My husband and I live on the first floor and are usually available when questions or concerns arise.  We enjoy chatting and learning more about you if we all have time. We are conveniently located near the main highways that access the downtown and the suburbs.  We are close to the airport as well. There are several parks nearby and a wonderful forest preserve path for walking or biking within walking distance (Cald
neighborhood_overview: We are conveniently located near the main highways that access the downtown and the suburbs.  We are close to the airport as well. There are several parks nearby and a wonderful forest preserve path for walking or biking within walking distance (Caldwell Woods).  If traveling in the summer months, there is also Whelan Aquatic Park within walking distance.  A great day of fun for kids!
notes: When we are able, we enjoy meeting our guests and introducing them to the space.  This isn't always possible with our schedules so check in arrangements will be given before your arrival to ensure you have access to the unit.
transit: We are a quick 2 mile drive to a Metra train for easy access into the downtown or to travel to neighboring suburbs.  We are very close to the Milwaukee PACE bus which will quickly get you to the Blue Line Jefferson Park EL transit station.  This line will take you to O'hare or directly into downtown Chicago.
access: Guests have a private entrance and small back deck.  Guests are welcome to share communal space in the back yard and enjoy the garden.
interaction: My husband and I live on the first floor and are usually available when questions or concerns arise.  We enjoy chatting and learning more about you if we all have time.
house_rules: Pets must be approved in advance.  A $50 fee will apply per animal. If your a smoker we prefer that you use the back porch instead of smoking inside. When arriving home late, we prefer that you take your shoes off and remember that a working family is right below you sleeping. Please do not entertain additional guests late night in our unit.  There are local bars and restaurants that would work well for this.
host_about:
I am a health care provider with an emphasis in alternative health.  In addition I instruct individuals and businesses in how to recycle their waste with worms!  My husband is a local caterer and all around handy guy.  We compost year round and maintain an organic garden in our back yard when weather allows.  We welcome our guests to join us in enjoying our urban garden.

We have a pet friendly apartment and enjoy three furry friends of our own; Eve ( grey cat), Emmie (calico cat), and Ms. Pickles ( wacky little dog).  

We love to travel and stay in unique accommodations.  Unfortunately our lives here in Chicago keep us busy and we don't get away often enough.  Hosting helps fill the gap!  It is always interesting to meet our unique guests and hear about where they are from.

summary: Show up and start living from day one in Chicago with this beautiful one-bedroom Blueground apartment. You’ll love coming home to this thoughtfully furnished, beautifully designed, and fully-equipped Lincoln Park home with stunning  views over the sea. (#CHI113)
space: Gorgeous furniture, fully-equipped kitchen, smart TV, and a premium wireless speaker are just a few of the amenities you’ll find inside this one-bedroom apartment. Ideally located in Chicago, you’ll find a lot to love outside as well. When you’re ready to relax, you’ll be happy to discover every Blueground bedroom comes with superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and cozy towels. We handle everything so you can simply show up and start living. neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in the neighborhood of Lincoln Park. It is full of historic churches and brick row houses. Tree-lined residential areas give way to bustling businesses. Armitage Avenue is lined with independent boutiques and high-end retailers; Clark Street is packed with casual cafes, ethnic restaurants, and sweet shops. In addition to shopping and dining, Lincoln Park is a diverse art and entertainment destination. There is a plethora of museums, top theaters, and live music clubs to pick from. Also, there is plenty of natural beauty and outdoor scenery to enjoy. The neighborhood's namesake park is a sprawling 1,208 acres of green space with a zoo, nature museum, and conservatory. Head over to the lakefront beaches, where sand and surf are set against a backdrop of downtown skyscrapers. Being a 15 minute train ride from the Loop, Lincoln Park is a very close commute to the city’s primary business district.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions (including certain Bull Terriers and any related breeds). Wild animals and hybrids, including wolf and coyote hybrids, snakes, ferrets, rabbits, are all prohibited. Please contact us for precise breed restrictions. Please note that a one-off non refundable fee ($500) and a monthly rent ($25/mo/pet) is applicable upon reservation. Failing to notify us of any pets prior to check-in will incur a penalty, and may result in denied check-in. Supporting documents (ie. vaccinations) may be required - Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a $350 monthly fe
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

name: Comfortable & artsy garden unit close to train
summary: Private, garden-level apartment near public transit & within walking distance to restaurants, bars, parks, stores & artist galleries. Two stops from the Medical District, less than 20 minutes to the Loop (downtown) and a short bus ride to McCormick Place.  We're a welcoming family. After years of traveling the world & staying in AirBnB places, we decided to host in our home's private apartment.
space: Excellent location! 7 minute walk to EL station. Less than 20 minutes to downtown (Loop), 2 stops from Medical District (Rush Medical Center, UIC, VA, etc.). 10 minutes by bus to Chinatown. 10 minutes by bus to United Center (Bulls, Blackhawks, concerts and shows). Easy access by car to I-55, I-290 and I-90/94.  The garden level apartment has been thoughtfully curated to be comfortable, convenient and creatively charming. We decorated it with some of our favorite pieces from our travels and included local touches, too. We are a family of four who live above in the main house. There is a queen size bed with accompanying bedside tables. The living area sofa folds down to a sleeper that easily fits one person (and 2 could be a tight, but possible, squeeze). Please indicate if you would need the sofa sleeper set up when booking. The kitchen is equipped with pots and pans, cooking utensils, dinnerware, flatware and glassware. We also provide a coffeemaker and complimentary coffee and tea. T

neighborhood_overview: Pilsen is continually mentioned as a hot, hip and happening neighborhood in national articles!  Excellent location!  - 7 minute walk to EL station (5 blocks/0.3 mile) - Less than 20 minutes to downtown (Loop) on EL - 2 stops by EL from Medical District (Rush Medical Center, UIC, VA, etc.).  - 10 minutes by bus to Chinatown.  - 10 minutes by bus to United Center (Bulls, Blackhawks, concerts and shows). - Easy access by car to I-55, I-290 and I-90/94.  - 2 blocks to grocery store. - 2 blocks to corner bar and grill. - 2-3 blocks to taquerias (several options for taco places). - 3 blocks to Italian restaurants. From authentic tacos to street tamales, art galleries to summertime street festivals -- our neighborhood is known for being vibrant and active. Kids and families leisurely stroll around local parks, as paleta (popsicle) vendors push their carts by them, tempting them with their exotic, fruity flavors. Corner bars fill with patrons that include everyone from sports fans to city work
notes: This is a garden unit and we live above with our little ones (as well as a couple pets). We try to be respectful of the noise level for our guests, but you may hear walking around from the unit above, as well as the expressions of toddler and baby emotions (i.e. squealing with joy, hollering with falls, having a total mental meltdown when their Lego creation breaks, etc.).
transit: This is a very walkable neighborhood and most errands can be accomplished on foot. We are a 7 minute walk from the Pink Line "EL" train to get downtown (Loop). We are also on 3 major bus lines (60-Blue Island, 50-Damen, 21-Cermak/Chinatown). We are happy to give you any directions you need. Excellent location!  - 7 minute walk to EL station (5 blocks/0.3 mile) - Less than 20 minutes to downtown (Loop) on EL - 2 stops by EL from Medical District (Rush Medical Center, UIC, VA, etc.).  - 10 minutes by bus to Chinatown.  - 10 minutes by bus to United Center (Bulls, Blackhawks, concerts and shows). - Easy access by car to I-55, I-290 and I-90/94.  - 2 blocks to grocery store. - 2 blocks to corner bar and grill. - 2 blocks to yoga studio. - 2-3 blocks to taquerias (several options for taco places). - 3 blocks to Italian restaurants.
access: Guests have full and private access to the apartment, as well as exclusive access to the small, front patio.
interaction: We live on the property and try to do the check in process in person with guests. We are accessible via the AirBnB messaging system and by text/phone for urgent matters.  That said, we are a busy little family and our guests will have plenty of privacy. We generally are available between 7am and 9pm for any needs. If you have an emergent need or a need that occurs between the above hours, please call us.
house_rules: - We never want our guests to feel they have to tip-toe around or whisper. But we do want to be transparent that we keep early hours (9pm to 7am) with our young children.  We emphasize this just so you know you may hear us up that early. :-)  - Absolutely no smoking of any kind (cigarettes, vaping, e-cigs, pot, etc.) allowed. It is a shared vent system to our house above. - Absolutely no drugs (including marijuana). - The door must be locked anytime you leave or at night. - Please wash any dishes used.
host_about:
Pediatric registered nurse and disability rights nonprofit communications manager.
World travelers - in fact we've stayed in AirBnB in every country we've traveled!
Parents to little city babies.
Home cooks. Backyard gardeners. Home brewer. Baby wearer. 
We strongly believe in kindness and hospitality.

name: Family Friendly 2BR/1BA Bucktown/Logan Sq Apt
summary: Welcome to Chicago! Our place is very close to the blue line Western stop (direct line from O'Hare) and just off I-94 for any drivers. We have great local food & coffee within walking distance (3 min for coffee!) and a family and group friendly space. Our unit has a foosball table, tv, kid toys, a pack n play, extra toddler bed and doesn't feel like a basement unit because of its high ceilings and windows.
space: This is technically our basement but has its own entrance in the back of our house (see photos). One extra quirk is that the entrance opens to the second bedroom ;) The interior door leading to the main house is an emergency exit only. We have one happy toddler and one new baby boy. Our family's waking hours are 7:30am-7:30pm, so you will probably hear kid noises during that time. Our evenings are pretty quiet as we're usually asleep early, too! We don't mind any noises coming from the unit - we just want you to enjoy your stay in Chicago!

neighborhood_overview: Walgreens is one block up the street in case you need any last minute items. Nearby parks and playgrounds include Holstein Park (with a free community pool in the summer!), Lucy Flower Park, Ehrler Park, and Goethe Elementary playground. We're a 10 minute walk from the 606 trail which is great for a long stroll.  We have a ton of local restaurants and coffee shops nearby. Some of our favorites are.... Coffee: Ipsento, Caffe Umbria, Colectivo Breakfast/Brunch: Cafe Robey and Yolk Lunch/Dinner: Irazu (Costa Rican), 90 Miles (Cuban), Silom 12 (Thai), StopAlong (burgers & pizza), Dos Urban Cantina (modern Mexican), Le Bouchon (French) and Antico (Italian).
transit: The Western Blue line stop is 5 minutes away - great access to O'Hare and directly to downtown. Parking is free street parking on Campbell (our street). There are generally spots available within a block or two of our place (which is fabulous parking in the city of Chicago!!).
house_rules: No smoking on the entire property including the back area of our home. Fines will be added if you smoke and/or leave cigarettes on the property
host_about: Originally from Michigan & Toronto, but we both moved to Chicago and met here in grad school!

name: Dream Big! Huge 2B/2B In Friendly Upscale Building
summary: Excited about all there is to do in Chicago? Skip tiny overpriced spots downtown & experience one of Chicago’s best buildings! My corner 2B/2B in the luxurious Park Heights By The Lake building has enough space for up to 6 guests (2 Queens + sofa bed), HDTV w/ streaming, large quartz/stainless kitchen, Nest thermostats, washer/dryer in the apartment, large windows & high end finishes throughout. The building includes smart gym, lounge & is walking distance to Lake Michigan! FREE PARKING! (1 car)
space: ★ Welcome to a better way to Airbnb!  Many Chicago buildings don’t want Airbnb guests, but Park Heights By The Lake is a luxury building with great amenities where Airbnb guests are welcome.  My 3rd floor 2B/2B apartment sleeps up to 6 with a Queen bed in each bedroom and a sofa bed in the living room; after parking in your FREE and dedicated parking space, you'll enter the gorgeous lobby of this architecturally exciting building.  ★ After you take the elevator upstairs, you'll enter into the apartment's foyer, with coat closet, hallway to the bedrooms & bathrooms, and doorways to the kitchen & living/dining room.  The living room includes comfortable seating and a large HDTV.  There is also a dining table, armchairs, a fireplace, and huge windows. The kitchen area includes quartz counter tops and stainless steel appliances.  Nest thermostats for individually controlled heating and cooling keep you comfortable any time of year. High quality linens and furnishings call to mind a high en
description: Excited about all there is to do in Chicago? Skip tiny overpriced spots downtown & experience one of Chicago’s best buildings! My corner 2B/2B in the luxurious Park Heights By The Lake building has enough space for up to 6 guests (2 Queens + sofa bed), HDTV w/ streaming, large quartz/stainless kitchen, Nest thermostats, washer/dryer in the apartment, large windows & high end finishes throughout. The building includes smart gym, lounge & is walking distance to Lake Michigan! FREE PARKING! (1 car) ★ Welcome to a better way to Airbnb!  Many Chicago buildings don’t want Airbnb guests, but Park Heights By The Lake is a luxury building with great amenities where Airbnb guests are welcome. neighborhood_overview: Nestled between the Jackson Park and South Shore neighborhoods, Park Heights By The Lake is within walking distance of 71st Street, which has lots of restaurants (including independent, chain and specialty options - Majani Vegan Restaurant is a favorite of meat-free and meat-loving locals alike), and is just beside Jackson Park and Lake Michigan.
notes: No smoking indoors.  A key fob to access the building's parking & amenities will be waiting in the apartment.  IF LOST, the cost to replace a key fob is $75.  If a late night lock out (lost fob) requires a maintenance call to let you in, there will be a $250 charge.  IMPORTANT NOTE:  If you lose your key fob, we cannot provide access to the building between 3am and 7am.  Check in is from 3pm to 8pm; Check out is by 11am.
transit: It’s a 15-20 minute drive to downtown Chicago, or 30-40 minutes by public transport (26 and J14 bus lines).  G oogle Maps lets you switch between driving, walking and public transit directions!  Ubers & Lyfts are also widely available.
access: My whole apartment is yours while you're here!  You'll use the key fob you'll find in the apartment to access the gym, roof deck, etc.  The building amenities like gym and roof deck are shared with other guests and residents.
interaction: I work fairly long hours but am always reachable by Airbnb Messenger! While we may not meet, I live in Chicago and can help in case of an urgent need, but my goal is to set everything up for you to be as easy as possible.  After you book, I’ll send you detailed welcome instructions and a customized list of major attractions and less well known sites and dining that you may not know about!  I want you to have all the information you need so you can focus on having fun.
house_rules: ★ There is a trash chute on each floor; please dispose of organic (food) trash before departing! ★ Check in is from 3pm to 8pm; Check out is by 11am ★ No need to strip the beds before you leave; my housekeeper will be in shortly after 11. ★ When you arrive, you'll enter the building and apartment using your unlock code.  A key fob to access the building's parking & amenities will be waiting in the apartment. ★ If LOST, the cost to replace a key fob is $75. ★ If a late night lock out (lost fob) requires a maintenance call to let you in, there will be a $250 charge. ★ IMPORTANT NOTE:  If you lose your key fob, we cannot provide access to the building between 3am and 7am. ★ Quiet Hours are 10pm to 8am to avoid disturbing neighbors who work office hours
host_about: Hi, I’m Elisha!  I work in real estate in Chicago and I’m so excited to welcome you to my apartment while you’re here!  Park Heights By The Lake is a stunning building with incredible architecture and great amenities, and building management welcomes Airbnb guests - don’t get stuck with an Airbnb where you have to sneak around, because that’s no fun.  I’m a Chicago local, so after you book, I’ll send you a list of customized welcome instructions and local recommendations (for both must-see attractions and “hidden gems” that you might not otherwise hear about!).

name: Private bath & bdrm in lovely condo
summary: The house is in a totally rehabbed, walk-up building in the trendy & hip Ukrainian Village Neighborhood. You will have your own bath wh a tub/shower & a comfy queen bed in your own bedroom, on a separate level from the other bedroom for max privacy.
space: The space is very bright and filled with plants and  eclectic decorations.  It is 2 stories, with the 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms being on separate levels.  The bedroom has a larger closet and table in it that can be used as a desk.
description: The house is in a totally rehabbed, walk-up building in the trendy & hip Ukrainian Village Neighborhood. You will have your own bath wh a tub/shower & a comfy queen bed in your own bedroom, on a separate level from the other bedroom for max privacy. The space is very bright and filled with plants and  eclectic decorations.  It is 2 stories, with the 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms being on separate levels.  The bedroom has a larger closet and table in it that can be used as a desk. The guests will have access to the fully stocked kitchen, living room with cable TV and free washer/dryer.  There is also a deck with city views and a landscaped backyard with grill and fountain to enjoy. I usually interact with guests as much or as little as they want.  I'm pretty busy but can be found in the evenings sometimes around the house.  I'm also pretty laid back, but can offer great advice about Chicago nightlife & transportation if needed. I Love living in Ukrainian Village!  It is full of cute restau
neighborhood_overview: I Love living in Ukrainian Village!  It is full of cute restaurants and bars and shops to explore.   There is a grocery store and pharmacy within walking distance.  Also, it is close to several hospitals and sporting venues if you want to catch a game.  The neighborhood itself is very central in Chicago, has several tree-lined side streets and is very SAFE.
notes: I infrequently might have a couple of friends over to make dinner, drink wine or watch a movie.  If this would bother you, then this space might not be for you.  The house is 420 friendly, but I ask that you please smoke cigarettes outside on the porch.  Also, there are 2 wonderful cats that live here as well - they are pretty chill and usually hang in my room, but you might see them around.
transit: There are 4 bus lines very close to the house that can get you just about anywhere you want to go.  There are close bike rentals and it is close to the major expressways.  The house also has ample, free, no-permit street parking all around.
access: The guests will have access to the fully stocked kitchen, living room with cable TV and free washer/dryer.  There is also a deck with city views and a landscaped backyard with grill and fountain to enjoy.
interaction: I usually interact with guests as much or as little as they want.  I'm pretty busy but can be found in the evenings sometimes around the house.  I'm also pretty laid back, but can offer great advice about Chicago nightlife & transportation if needed.
house_rules: Please just clean up after yourself and don't let the cats outside.
host_about:
I'm from Chicago, IL and I work in medical device sales.  I love music, film, animals and travel.  I'm pretty laid back and enjoy just hanging out with some wine and good friends. 
I suppose I should add that I loved using Airbnb so much, that I have put my beloved home in Chicago up for rent on this sight.  So far I have had the pleasure to meet some really nice, cool & interesting people who enjoy staying at my old home as much as I did!!  Safe travels everyone. :)

name: Private room near Downtown
space: If you're looking for a true Chicago neighborhood experience, look no further! I have a private room available in East Pilsen, a diverse neighborhood near downtown Chicago. The neighborhood is thriving with city life and the beautiful murals that bleed from its walls are a testament to its pulse. The apartment is situated just two blocks west of the arts district and a short walk from UIC, and downtown is conveniently located just 2 miles away. In addition, Chinatown, Greektown, and Little Italy are also nearby. It's fun to experience these neighborhoods on a bike ride and there is a Divvy bike station located on the next block. Access to the train or bus is undemanding. However, if you prefer to drive, a Zip Car parking space is located within 2 blocks.  The apartment has two bedrooms and a single bathroom.  Wireless internet and cable are available. For your convenience, there is also a washer and dryer in the unit. Plenty of bars, cafes, and restaurants are within walking distance.

summary: Got a big crew? Up to ten people can comfortably stay in this five-bedroom Wicker Park home. neighborhood_overview: A haven for hipsters and creatives, Wicker Park is overflowing with trendy things to eat, see, and do. Grab a bite at the umpteen hip restaurants or grab a bike and cruise the Bloomingdale Trail. Visit the thrift shops, book shops, coffee shops, boutique shops, beauty shops, donut shops, ramen shops, record shops, and brunch shops that line bike-friendly Milwaukee Avenue. There really are a lot of shops around here.
notes: For the safety and comfort of all our guests, Zencity is following CDC guidance to ensure every guest has a clean place to stay. Some of the steps we are taking include (Website hidden by Airbnb)   (Website hidden by Airbnb) Thoroughly disinfecting each suite between stays including counter tops, door knobs, faucets, light switches, among other (Website hidden by Airbnb) Stocking-up on extra supplies such as soaps and cleaning products in case you need it (yes, including toilet paper (Website hidden by Airbnb) Minimizing in-person contact with our guests whenever possible by using smart tools like our digital check-in proces (Website hidden by Airbnb)   (Website hidden by Airbnb) We are not responsible for packages if they are unable to be delivered. If anything is not to your liking, please notify us, and we will correct the situation as soon as possible.
transit: Cab/Uber service is easily available in this location and is our preferred method of transportation downtown. The unit is a short walk to the Chicago Blue Line at Damen that takes you directly to O'Hare or into the Loop and is also near several major bus routes.

name: Private Room in Bridgeport Home
summary: Take it easy in this comfortable, welcoming family home. The shared kitchen and living spaces offer everything needed for a wonderful Chicago vacation. Admire views of the downtown skyline from the porch or fire up the BBQ with friends and family.
space: 10yr old Single Family Home in Bridgeport, a safe and great diverse neighborhood that's close to Downtown Chicago as well as other major attractions. U. S. Cellular Field (we Chicagoan's know it as Comiskey Park) McCormick Place, IIT, China Town and minutes away from 31st Harbor beach.  A 10 min walk to the red line and 15 min walk to the green line or the Metra! Your own private room on the 2nd floor of the house with a queen size bed as well as private full bathroom that includes fresh clean towels and essentials. You will also have access to free wifi. Free continental breakfast will be provided each morning.( Upon request only)
description: Take it easy in this comfortable, welcoming family home. The shared kitchen and living spaces offer everything needed for a wonderful Chicago vacation. Admire views of the downtown skyline from the porch or fire up the BBQ with friends and family.
neighborhood_overview: This apartment is located in the Bridgeport neighborhood, home to a wide selection of wonderful restaurants, awesome coffee shops, and great local bars. Travel just 15 minutes to experience Downtown Chicago at its best.
notes: Free continental breakfast will be provided each morning upon request. Note: Breakfast will only be provided until 10:30 am latest.. Includes, Coffee, Toast, some sort of fruit.  P.S  AT the moment we are dog sitting a beautiful small Pomeranian dog. she's 9 yrs old and a very chill dog, who likes to just lay around and take naps.:) No worries, she's not allowed in the guest room at all. She will be with Us temporary until her Mommy gets her.:)
transit: You will definitely have no problem with getting to public transportation from Our home! 10 min walk to Red Line, 15 Min walk to Green Line and Metra! If you're driving there is free street parking right in front for your car. Just 5 miles from the loop downtown and just 6 miles from Magnificent Mile. We are literally down the street from access to all Expressways that will take you anywhere you want to go. Travel from O'Hare- 30-60 mins by taxi/uber/lyft depending on if it is rush hour (8a-10a and 4p-6p). Expect to pay approx $55-65 for taxi/uber/lyft. Most take the Blue Line Train into the city and exit on Clinton then catch uber/lyft to our house. This option will be much faster and much less expensive at approx $3/each for the Blue Line + $10 total for lyft. This option will be less than $20.  Travel from Midway- 15-20 mins by taxi/uber/lyft. Expect to pay approx $25-30.
access: Guests will have access to our full sized kitchen with stainless steel appliances and living room area if you want to relax and watch tv- cable channels included. Our front deck is a great space to relax in the evening when the weather permits. You can enjoy the fireworks in the summer from the White Sox Stadium! We also have views of the downtown skyline right from our deck!
interaction: For the most part I'm in and out of the house during the day, in the evening M-F we are home as a family with our 7yr old son, no worries he's not a Dennis the Menace kind of kid! Lol! You're definitely welcome to interact with Us or you can just relax up in your own room.  But if the weather is nice out, you will want to hang out in our deck and enjoy a drink of your preference.:)
house_rules: • Check-in time is 10AM. Very easy Rules- no other people are allowed other than you and your guest. No Smoking. You can smoke outside or on our deck. If you use the kitchen, clean after yourself.
host_about:
If you have ever wondered what it's like to meet the perfect neighbors wonder no more. We are a mid 40's married couple that enjoys evenings on our deck (weather permitting), home cooked meals/Family time, and a good laugh every opportunity we get. 

Both are gregarious and fun loving. The wife keeps our abode in excellent condition and the husband loves his backyard. A 3000 square foot home provides solace away from busy downtown which is still conveniently located 10-15 mins away. 

To sum is up, to know us is to love and appreciate us. Family oriented and our close friends are like family to us. 

You'll be pleasantly surprised at how giving we are and we are excited to open the comforts of our house to respectable, pleasant guests. 

We look forward to meeting you.

name: Lincoln Park - Vintage Master Bedroom
summary: Lincoln & Armitage in an exclusive building in an upscale safe, quiet neighborhood is a perfect location for those who want to walk or take public transportation to experience Chicago's stunning lakefront, zoo, world-class shopping and dining, or take in a Cubs game. It has a queen size bed in a spacious high ceilinged bedroom with shared kitchen and bathroom and a lovely porch off the bedroom.   Available only for longer term rentals. Require a 15 day notice of interest, please inquire.
space: Few vintage condo's are left in Lincoln Park.  Vintage means that the building is 120+ years old with some of the things that come with being so old including: charm, uniqueness, stunning woodwork as well as sometime slow plumbing and many years of use.

I am often in and out, but accessible by email/text messages or phone (if you h
neighborhood_overview: Charming quiet tree-lined street that is also close to restaurants, parks, bars, shopping, divy bikes, comedy club, zoo and transportation.  You will immediately feel at home.  Safe neighborhood for walking.
notes: There is street parking but a sticker is needed after 6PM till 6AM on most streets except Armitage. If you have a car and need stickers there is a nominal fee to buy stickers. You need to put one sticker on per night you are there. Please leave the money on the table. There are children in the 1st floor condo and the condo behind me so consideration is always important. Please do not smoke off the back deck or leave cigarette butts in the front.  The back door does open WITHOUT force -- do not just pull on doorknob. Turn bolt lock and make sure that is open. Garbage (under Kitchen sink) and recycling (in kitchen black garbage) out the back steps in the alley.
transit: Public transportation Brown Line El (connects with Orange from Midway Airport or Blue from O'Hare) or busses close by. If coming from Union Station the 151 Sheridan (comes all times and all days) and the 156 LaSalle (Weekdays) stop at Armitage. Divy bikes on the corner of Armitage and Clark as well as many other locations. Walking to many attractions.
access: Long term rentals will have access to whole space including kitchen and front room and dining room. Fully furnished with your own closet, dresser and access to washer/dryer.
interaction: I am often in and out, but accessible by email/text messages or phone (if you have an iPhone). Please call me if you have any difficulties (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN). You will have self check-in for your convenience. Please lock the Condo door when you go in and out this will ensure you don't forget your key.
house_rules: - It is a third floor walk up. I do 3:00PM check in (can leave bags earlier if negotiated) however your room may not be ready till 5:30PM - 6:00 on weekdays. - Please do your own dishes if you use the kitchen  - Long term renting clean up as you go as any roommate might.
host_about: I founded a not for profit organization Lemonaid Fund that takes me all over the world helping people to help themselves. I decided to be a host for Airbnb because of my great experiences world wide.

name: Pilsen Bungalow
summary: In the heart of Pilsen, located on 18th street (main street in this neighborhood). This space is a large one bedroom vintage apartment, with a large kitchen, two separate living spaces, and one very small bedroom - full of plants and good vibes. Steps away from the best restaurants, bars, nightlife, and public transportation. There is street parking available. 10 minute drive to downtown Chicago.
space: A very welcoming and unique large one bedroom (multiple rooms) space. The building and unit is old, native to the block. Hardwood floors throughout - expect old looking (pre-buffed out), but clean floors! The bedroom does not have a door, but you do have the entire apartment to yourself during the stay. There is no microwave. Please keep in mind that this is my home when you are not here, so please treat it with respect :)

The present day neighborhood is best known for its numerous commercial and entertainment establishments, and being a convenient place to live for downtown workers due to its proximity to public transportation and The Loop. Gentrification has made the area attractive to college-educated young adults, although it faced considerable resistance from artists, and the Polish and Puerto Rican communities it displaced. Crime has decreased and many new homes have been built as well as older homes being restored. T
neighborhood_overview: Wicker Park is known for its local hipster culture, art community, nightlife, and food scene. The present day neighborhood is best known for its numerous commercial and entertainment establishments, and being a convenient place to live for downtown workers due to its proximity to public transportation and The Loop. Gentrification has made the area attractive to college-educated young adults, although it faced considerable resistance from artists, and the Polish and Puerto Rican communities it displaced. Crime has decreased and many new homes have been built as well as older homes being restored. This has led to increased business activity, with many new restaurant-bars and stores opening to serve the young high income lifestyles. The neighborhood is extremely trendy known for hosting emerging bands, high fashion boutiques, cutting-edge gourmet restaurants and bakeries, European-style cafes, upscale independent grocers, and artsy businesses that come and go due to increasing retail rent
access: The entire 2 bedroom unit.
interaction: Text messages and email.
house_rules: Parties are not allowed! Parties are strictly prohibited in the apartment!  If I get a complaint about the party or noise, your reservation will be cancelled immediately and you will be charged $200 Smoking is strictly prohibited in the building, you will be charged $200

name: A Sunny 2BR Suite - Private Entrance & Bathroom!
summary: This is a two-bedroom suite located in the heart of Wicker Park. Steps away from trendy shops, restaurants, and bars! We’re around the corner from the Damen “L” train Blue Line stop, so getting to and from O’Hare and downtown couldn’t be easier.  Trove guests have exclusive FREE access to The Metropolitan, a members-only club located on the 66th and 67th floors of the Willis Tower. Check "Exclusive Trove Perks" in the listing description for details.
space: Thanks so much for your interest in staying at my place! My friends at Trove take care of your guest experience. I ask that you read through the entire listing to make sure that we're the right hosts for you. This stylishly-decorated two-bedroom suite is the perfect home base for you to stay in while you explore Chicago. Live like a local in this beautifully preserved 19th-century building. THIS TROVE HAS ✔ Private Fully equipped kitchen ✔ Private bathroom ✔ Coffee maker ✔ High-speed internet ✔ 44" Smart TV w/ Netflix (no cable TV) --and more! EXCLUSIVE TROVE PERKS During your stay as a Trove guest, you receive a free membership to The Metropolitan, a members-only club located on the 66th and 67th floors of the Willis Tower.  Included with your membership: ✔ Upscale co-working space, dining, and bars ✔ Stunning views of Chicago and Lake Michigan ✔ Discounted express tickets to the Willis Tower Skydeck Metropolitan Club Hours: Monday–Friday: 7am – 10pm Saturday: 5pm – 10pm Sunday: Close

THIS TROVE HAS ✔ Private Fully equipped kitchen ✔ Private bathroom ✔ Coffee maker ✔ High-speed internet ✔ 44" Smart TV w/ Netflix (no cable TV) --and m
neighborhood_overview: We’re located on the north side of Chicago in Wicker Park, one of Chicago’s trendiest and safest neighborhoods. Our neighborhood is a wonderful mix of bustling streets packed with local restaurants and shops, as well as quiet tree-lined streets full of historic buildings. We’re also minutes away from many of Chicago’s most popular spots.
notes: FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS 1. “How do I get to ‘x’ from the apartment?/How far is the apartment from ‘x’?” Excellent public transit directions from our apartment to any point in the city are available via web search. Our building is just a short walk from the Damen “L” train station. Search for “Damen blue line station” in Maps, click the “Directions” button, then enter your point of interest. 2. “Is there parking nearby?” We have a parking spot behind the building that you can reserve separately through a service called SpotHero. We'll send you info on how to reserve it when you confirm your reservation. 3. When is check-in/check-out? Check-in is 3pm or later but you're welcome to stop by anytime after 11:30am to drop off your bags in the living room (just note that our staff will have your room ready by 3pm). Check-out is at 11am. Our cleaning staff will need access to the apartment at 11am, but you’re welcome to leave your bags in the living room and pick them up by 2:30pm at the la
transit: Because of our central location, we recommend leaving your car at home. Any point of interest in Chicago can easily be reached by walking, public transit, or Uber. ￫ The Damen Blue Line 'L' train station is a 3-minute walk away. ￫ O'Hare is 40 minutes away via public transit and 25-40 minutes away via Uber. ￫ Midway is 65 minutes away via public transit and 25-40minutes away via Uber.
interaction: WHY STAY WITH TROVE? ⭐ Fast Communication We’re always on call to answer your questions, typically within 30 minutes. ⭐ Experienced Hosts We’ve hosted thousands of guests over five years. ⭐ Exclusive Perks Trove Guests have access to the Metropolitan Club, located in the Willis Tower. ⭐ Central Location You’ll never be far from local spots to check out, sights to see, and public transit.
house_rules: 1) Only the reservation holder and guests added to the reservation via Airbnb may stay overnight.   2) As a courtesy to your neighbors, please keep noise to a minimum, especially between 9 pm - 9 am. 3) This is a non-smoking apartment. If smoke is detected, a cleaning fee of $150 will be charged. 4) No late check-outs. Check-out is at 11 am.  In order to compensate our cleaning assistants for lost time, additional charges will be sent if they're unable to begin their job at 11 am. One hour or less - $25 Each additional hour - $40 5) Damaged/stained/missing towels, bedding, and/or furnishings will incur additional fees. The per-item fees are as follows: Bedsheet- $12 Towel - $12 Pillow - $30 Pillowcase: $10 Comforter - $50 Clothes hangers - $3 Furnishings - Dependant on item

name: The Wrigley Flats | Chicago Vacation Rental
summary: The Wrigley Flats are unique Chicago vacation rentals located 4 blocks south of Wrigley Field in city’s most sought after north side neighborhood---Wrigleyville! We have 2 flats---each with 3 bedroom | 1 bath that can be rented for a weekend getaway, a week long vacation or an extended stay. Because of our close proximity to Chicago’s lakefront, the vibrant nightlife, the eclectic dining scene & of course Wrigley Field; it’s no wonder visitors flock here to get a taste of something amazing!

What makes Wrigleyville most unique is that it is home to our beloved Chicago Cubs and historic Wrigley Field. The 2nd oldest ballpark in the America is situated right smack dab in the middle of our neighborhood! One minute you’re strolling down beautiful tree-lines streets surrounded by historic Greystone homes and then you turn the corner to come face to face with the iconic red Wrigley Field marquee; it’s really quite the sight!  Where Miracle Happen and Dreams Really Do Come True! Since having w
neighborhood_overview: What makes Wrigleyville most unique is that it is home to our beloved Chicago Cubs and historic Wrigley Field. The 2nd oldest ballpark in the America is situated right smack dab in the middle of our neighborhood! One minute you’re strolling down beautiful tree-lines streets surrounded by historic Greystone homes and then you turn the corner to come face to face with the iconic red Wrigley Field marquee; it’s really quite the sight!  Where Miracle Happen and Dreams Really Do Come True! Since having won the 2016 world series Wrigley Field has exploded; a flurry of new shops, restaurants, a park and so much more! The block of Addison to Waveland, Clark to Sheffield had become our neighborhood’s town square of sort. A gathering place for neighbors, families, baseball fans and visitors from all over the world.

All Guest will be required to agree to the stipulation/terms of this rental agreement (SAMPLE BELOW) prior to your stay. It will be emailed to you for signature through Docusign®. Please review CAREFULLY so as not to have any misunderstandings. In the event you as the signer of this rental agreement feel you cannot vouch for ALL MEMBERS of YOUR party (support as being true, certain, reliable); I would suggest you consider alternative accommodations. These are multi-unit buildings, I do my BEST to make sure the buildings are booked with groups having ‘LIKE DYNAMICS’---families with children with other families with children. Single 30-40 something adults with other single adults, seniors with other seniors, etc. This policy helps to better insure that everyone staying in the home will have a positive enjoyable experience. neighborhood_overview: The Hyde Park unit borders the historic Kenwood neighborhood (Chicago home of President Obama and Muhammed Ali). The walkable green and tree-lined neighborhood has it all: restaurants, bars, parks, playgrounds, retail, and proximity to Lake Michigan and downtown.
notes: No parties (no more than 10 people in the unit at anytime), no smoking, no pets. Quiet hours are from 10PM-8AM.
transit: Bus stops for the following bus lines are seconds from front door: #2 (commuter express bus to downtown), #172 (direct bus to University of Chicago), #15 bus to CTA Green and Red line trains.  Bus stop for #6 bus to downtown and Metra trains to downtown Millenium station, Museum Campus, and McCormick Place are 0.5 mile walk away.  Uber and Lyft are never more than a five minute wait in Hyde Park.  Zipcar is also readily available in the neighborhood.
interaction: Host lives in the neighborhood and will greet guests depending on check-in time, but otherwise will leave guests alone. Host will occasionally come by during daytime to drop off and replenish supplies. Host is a long time Hyde Park resident and is happy to provide suggestions for entertainment, transportation and resources for families.

The second bedroom walks out to the back deck, with access to the rooftop deck, and includes a comfortable full/twin bunk bed.

neighborhood_overview: Lincoln Park is one of Chicago's most notable and famed residential neighborhoods. Packed to the brim with nightlife, dining, and shopping, this area of the neighborhood also offers particularly convenient access to the lakefront, park, and zoo. DePaul University is just a short walk from the condo.
transit: This is a very walkable area, but mass transit options are plentiful if you plan to visit other areas of the city. The Fullerton el station (Red/Brown/Purple) is a 5-10 minute walk from the condo, and two busses (36/151) stop within a 3-6 minute walk. Either option will conveniently get you to River North, the Gold Coast, and the Loop.
access: The entire apartment is available for guest access, as is a rooftop deck with views of the Chicago skyline.
interaction: Host will not be on site, however an on site point of contact will be available at most times.
house_rules: Respect the neighbors and take care of the space. No parties. No smoking in the apartment. Check-in and check-out times are flexible based on occupancy and will be resolved with each guest individually. In general, a 3pm check-in and noon check-out are the standard.
host_about: Casual traveler, not a big fan of hotels.

summary: This private queen sized bedroom and en suite  bathroom are located in a rehabilitated Victorian style mansion three bedroom guest unit. Just steps away from the Damen blue line stop, we designed this one of a kind space with your ultimate comfort in mind. Attached to a large centralized shared space that features a kitchen, pantry, laundry room and loft, this room is perfect for couples, small families, and jet setters alike here on a quiet street in Chicago's hottest neighborhood!
space: In addition to the other amenities listed, this bedroom comes equipped with its own Apple TV, Netflix, Amazon Echo Dot, luggage rack, mini-fridge, electric tea kettle, white noise machine, humidifier, iron, and ironing board. The closet space is ample enough for a queen size air mattress and a pack and play, or two.

neighborhood_overview: There's no neighborhood quite like ours where Wicker Park and Bucktown meet. Incredibly walkable, our location is steps from historic beer baron mansions, the stunning Robey and Flat Iron buildings, all the shopping, eating, and night life fun of North, Damen, and Milwaukee avenues, and public parks like Wicker Park and the 606: the Bloomingdale Trail.
transit: Public transportation couldn't be easier. The Blue Line train runs right by our house and is often the best way to get to and from O'Hare Airport. The Damen Blue Line stop can be seen from our backyard, and is only a five minute ride to the heart of downtown and access to the rest of Chicago. Three bus lines all intersect at the Wicker Park Bucktown six corners and make getting anywhere in the city a breeze. For a more scenic experience, rent a Divvy bike from the station fifty feet away!
interaction: As this is our home, we'll be around during your stay on the first and second floor, but completely out of your way and respectful of your privacy. Need anything? Contact me and I will do my best to help!
house_rules: Please be respectful to us and other guests. Please keep noise to a minimum after 10pm and before 8am. Please ask before inviting a non resident over. Please remove make up with the dark towels or cotton pads. Please do your best not to track in mud or wet shoes and do not leave shoes on the entrance mat. There's a mat in your room for wet shoes.
host_about:
I'm an actor and creative professional living with my partner, Tyler, in the city. We're easy going and social guys, and enjoy hosting our friends and family so much that we want to extend an invitation to share our space to you!

My epitaph will read: Always leave them wanting more.

house_rules: We created Kasa to be your home on the road. We’re committed to being great neighbors, and we strictly enforce these rules to ensure the comfort and safety of our community. •NO Smoking: Smoking of any kind (including tobacco, marijuana, e-cigarettes, vape pens, and hookahs) is never allowed at this property.  This applies to the entire apartment, including the balcony or patio, as well as all common and outdoor areas of the building. Kasa apartments may be monitored with marijuana and tobacco sensors. •Noise: At all times, Kasa guests may not disturb their neighbors’ quiet enjoyment.  In addition, guests must observe quiet hours from 9 p.m. to 8 a.m. Parties and large gatherings are prohibited. Kasa apartments are proactively monitored with decibel sensors for compliance with this noise policy. •Occupancy: Each Kasa has a maximum occupancy limit.  There can be no more than the specified number of guests on the premises at any given time. Large gatherings are not permitted. •Lost and F
host_about: We are the team behind Kasa Living, a national flexible living brand that offers a dependable, high-quality living experience at a great value. We manage Kasas in modern buildings with the amenities and comforts that you want out of your own home. We aim to unleash the potential of livable space by giving you access to places that feel like your home on the road. Kasa Living is available in cities across the United States, with new locations opening frequently. We hope you enjoy your stay with us, and know that Kasa is your home on the road!

name: Large 2 BR Apt in the Lincoln Park
summary: This is a two bedrooms one bathroom home right between Lincoln Park and Lakeview. The shared back deck is great for having a couple drinks. The over sized living room has large windows which catches tons of sun light. This apartment is one of the biggest 2 bedrooms apartments in the neighborhood and is great value opposed to getting multiple hotel rooms for 2-8 people.  Our home is a short walk from many food & drinks spots, Starbucks, shopping, groceries, Wrigley Field, and the lake.
space: Second floor walkup of a three story building with businesses on first floor. Two bedrooms, each with queen beds. The smaller bedroom also has a door leading out to large shared back deck. One wall of the living room is exposed brick with a fireplace (nonfunctional but pleasing to the eyes).  The large TV has cable, netflix, Hulu, and HBO. High speed wifi, of course. As an FYI  we do have a dog that won’t be onsite while you are staying here, but just in case you have allergies you can plan accordingly.

The apartment is also a 15 minute  walk from Wrigley Field for those that would like to catch a Cubs game.
notes: we generally keep additional beds (pullout and air mattress) away for parties of 4
transit: The bus stops and the Diversey Brown line stop are both very close but the easiest way to get around is just grabbing an Uber which are pretty reasonable to anywhere you need to go in the city.
access: Full access to everything. We have a large shared back deck that you are more than welcome to use.
house_rules: If you would like to smoke please do so outside on the deck. Other than that just treat our home like it was your own please!

neighborhood_overview: Discover Rogers Park, named the New York Times most diverse community in the USA.   Easily access the downtown tourist sites or wander just three blocks to the beach. Great coffee, food, and fun is all within arm's reach.
notes: Our area has free street parking, which is readily available during the day.  However, it fills up in the evening.  Driving guests usually park the car and take public transportation to see the sites, as parking can be expensive downtown.  We also have a free spot in our garage for guests (subject to availability).
transit: The Morse Red Line train station is 3 blocks away and the Loyola Red Line station is 5 blocks away, which gets you downtown in 30 minutes, Northwestern in 20 minutes, Wrigley Field in 15 minutes.  Besides the train, there is an express bus 2 blocks away (#147), which takes you downtown via beautiful Lake Shore Drive.
access: Feel free to check with us regarding use of the common spaces, both indoor and outdoor.  Please note:  access to this 3rd floor apartment is through the main house.
interaction: We're around to help with anything you may need.
house_rules: ** Please don't smoke indoors or feed the dog. ** Try to leave things the way you found them, especially in the kitchen and     bathrooms, out of respect for others.. ** Keep your bedroom door closed, for the sake of everyone's privacy. ** Lock house front door whenever you are coming and going.
host_about:
Hi there!  We're Lois and Eduardo! She's from Kansas, I'm from Argentina, we met in Spain, and now we live in Chicago!  (¡Hablamos español, por supuesto!)  We've been Chicagoans for over 35 years, love the city, and love our home. Our kids Evan and Gina, our kids-in-law Lindsey and Mark, and our gorgeous grandkids, Enzo and Uma, are around often, and our Labradoodle, Leo, is a sweetie. (He is hypo-allergenic, doesn't shed, and loves people.)

You will note that our kitchen is the focal point of our daily lives, both for conversation and for enjoying Eduardo's delicious, Italian-inspired home cooking.  You might say that our philosophy of life is to work hard, play hard, and enjoy the people around us all the time. One of our favorite things has always been to host our diverse friends and family in our home - sometimes for a day, sometimes for a year.  Now, with AirBnB, we're making it official!  We're happy to say our home feels like an urban oasis and we look forward to hosting you!

neighborhood_overview: Just north of downtown Chicago, and nestled against the Lake Michigan shoreline, is the Gold Coast. As the name would imply, the area is one of the country's most affluent neighborhoods. With streets that are lined with historic mansions and specialty boutiques, the Gold Coast is an intensely popular area for residents and visitors. Branching off of The Magnificent Mile is Oak Street, an upscale shopper's dream. The retail revelry includes internationally recognized stores, swanky boutiques and rare, designer fashions. If carrying around loaded shopping bags makes you hungry, you can stop at one of the district's many celebrated restaurants, including Michelin-starred winners and classic Chicago steakhouses. A day of shopping becomes a night of revelry on the neighborhood's fabled Rush Street. Amongst the prestigious hotels and celebrated eateries, you will find a trove of booming nightlife hot spots and high-energy events. Treat yourself to the Gold Coast, you deserve it.
transit: Also, Chicago has a number of transportation options. You can easily Uber, cab, bus, or train your way around the city. There's also a divvy station around the corner.
house_rules: Check-in is anytime after 3PM Check-out is anytime before 11AM Quiet hours after 10PM

name: Private Lincoln Square Garden Apt
summary: Clean and comfortable one-bedroom garden apartment with kitchenette in a vintage brick building. Sleeps 2-4 comfortably (queen bed and futon or air mattress). Pleasant and lively neighborhood and a short walk to the train.
space: Garden apartment with private entry, one bedroom, bathroom, and kitchenette (microwave, coffee maker, toaster, fridge, but no stove). Very fun and walkable neighborhood. Old Town School of Folk Music, Lincoln Square shopping/restaurants, grocery store, nearby train and bike sharing stations, parks, and more.   There is no central air conditioning, but it generally stays comfortable even in warm months; however, we do provide a portable air conditioner for the hot months.  Of interest to families with youngsters, there is a little play area and toys under the stairs (Kids love it), a fun tree swing out front in the parkway, tree house, a little free library, and a couple of nearby playgrounds. Full disclosure/Heads up!: Garden apartment = basement. It is has windows and good natural light in all rooms, but windows are glass block w/ small windows to open for fresh air. Also, the ceiling height is about 7.5', but there is a center beam that puts it as low as 6'1", so taller folks beware.

Full disclosure/Heads up!: Garden apartment = basement. It is has windows a
neighborhood_overview: In our humble opinion, this is one of the best neighborhoods in Chicago. It's lively, fun and one of the safest in the city. The shootings in Chicago are concentrated in the south and west side neighborhoods; it can and does happen in all neighborhoods, but victims are almost always gang-involved. Within three blocks we have: independent coffee shop,  an L station with cool crossing signals, two bike share stations, two restaurants with excellent patio areas, award-winning Goosefoot (Website hidden by Airbnb) Harvestime (eclectic, independent grocery store), bike/walking path along Chicago River, Bloom Yoga studio. Within 6-8 blocks: River Park w/ public pool, Waters School (w/natural prairie and community gardens), Chicago Printmakers Collaborative (open on Saturdays) and tons of stuff in Lincoln Square. There's almost always something happening in Lincoln Square; check out the Chamber of Commerce events calendar: (Website hidden by Airbnb)
notes: There is no stove for cooking. The buzzer for the apartment does not work, so be advised if you're having visitors or food delivered. Also the shower door needs a bit of lift to close properly.  Safety: The apartment has a CO detector (on shelf above kitchen sink) and first aid kit (in bathroom medicine cabinet)
transit: Downtown/Loop is 45 minutes on the brown line el, (we are very close to the Rockwell stop). Parking is on-street and free. It is usually easy to find a spot, but does get trickier in the evening after 6:00p.m. CTA brown line is a great way to get downtown and to many neighborhoods in between.  Uber/Lyft/taxi are good options during non-rush hours.
access: All amenities in the apartment, including wi-fi. The front yard/bench/picnic table. We also have a pack-n-play and a booster seat for little ones. Washer/dryer by arrangement only. Periodic cleaning service upon request (for longer stays). The laundry/work/storage area is shared with our neighbors so this area is private access or with permission only.
interaction: Not much interaction. I try to meet guests when they first arrive and chat a bit, but I pretty much stay out of the way. Guests can usually check themselves in, when arranged in advance. I always like bumping into guests outside the apartment in or in the neighborhood, but prefer not to interrupt their stay.
house_rules: For the comfort of future guests, absolutely no smoking or pets. Be good neighbors! Our upstairs neighbors (Bruce and Sarah) are very courteous; please try not to make much noise. Let me know if you need anything or if you have any questions. Check in is after 5:00  Check out is before 11:00 a.m. (Just lock the door and drop the key through the mail slot.)
host_about: My family of four lives in the top unit of the two-flat. We spend a lot of time walking or biking around in our neighborhood (we happily have no car). You can often find us out front, sitting on the bench, swinging  from the tree, or just chatting with neighbors. We love visiting other cities where we can stay in interesting neighborhoods without the hassle of needing a car. We think our place is well-suited for others  who appreciate urban neighborhoods.

neighborhood_overview: Tucked on Chicago's North Side between North Center and Lakeview, the sleepy little pocket that is Roscoe Village is a collection of laid-back taverns, destination brunch restaurants and cozy cafes that perk up during the warm-weather months with pretty sidewalk patios and friendly beer gardens. Dining ranges from traditional comfort food to Turkish, burgers to bakeries, Cuban to creamy custards — all serving up casual hospitality.
notes: There is no higher priority for us than the health and safety of our guests, staff and co-hosts. During this unique time in travel Open House Hospitality is taking extra precautions to prevent the spread of the Covid 19 virus. We want you to feel confident when inhabiting one of our properties. As a result, we have enhanced some of our cleaning procedures in the interest of everyone's health and safety. In conjunction with the director of our cleaning team we've come up with the following additional measures beyond our standard cleaning to help ensure the safety of everyone who enters our properties. All surfaces are being wiped down with disinfectant after each guest with special attention being paid to door handles, pulls, remote controls and other often touched surfaces, all linens and towels are being washed with both detergent and bleach and we are misting the entire home with Lysol disinfecting spray in between each group of guests to help mitigate any airborne pathogens. Even wi
transit: Just two blocks from the Damen and Belmont buses. About a 15 minute walk to the Paulina brown line 'L' stop. Check out our guide book for more things to do in the area! Parking on our street and surrounding side streets is all free, non-permitted.  Just pay attention to the street cleaning signs.  Street cleaning is once a month, April-November.
access: Complete and private access to our home, backyard with patio furniture and grill.
interaction: We live offsite but are available by phone, text or email.
house_rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.  House Rules:   1.	Check in is at 4 p.m. Check out is at 11 a.m. Early check in or late check out may be available upon request. Guests who stay beyond their designated check out time or delay our housekeeping staff are liable for any associated costs and expenses. 2.	Guests are not allowed to make a reservation in their city of residence. Please contact us if you are booking within your city.  3.	Smoking and vaping are not allowed inside the unit or on the property, including on balconies and in shared spaces. Smoking violations are subject to a $250 fine plus the cost to clean, deodorize, and repair damages. 4.	Parties and excessive noise are strictly prohibited.   5.	Quiet hours are 10:00 p.m. to 8:00 a.m. daily. Please be respectful of our neighbors and be
host_about:
Thanks for checking out our home! My husband drew and I are both Chicago natives. We love this city and have lived downtown for the past 10+ years. So many great restaurants, shops, museums, etc... We hope you enjoy our place as much as we have the last six years. Please don't hesitate to reach out with any questions or concerns! 


The Boland Fam

name: Cozy Bedroom in Spacious Duplex Apt
summary: You will love your cozy bedroom in our spacious Duplex apartment. During your visit, take a nice stroll in beautiful Humboldt Park, go shopping in artsy Wicker Park or take a quick L ride to sight see Downtown or North side Chicago.
space: Our spacious duplex apartment is one of the most unique spaces in Chicago.  Before this was an apartment, it was a community center for the neighborhood! The upstairs (where your bedroom is located) is a spacious two- bedroom apartment with an open floor plan. Some features include a dramatic vintage built in mirror, comfy sectional couch, formal dining room and very high ceilings. Your cozy bedroom is at the back of the apartment and comfortably fits two guests. You are located right next to the kitchen, bathroom and washer and dryer.  Downstairs is an artist's studio with an open floor plan with a bathroom and an office.  We use this space for performances, parties, events and rehearsals.

Please note your room is on the small s
neighborhood_overview: HUMBOLDT PARK - OUR HOME Our neighborhood is called Humboldt Park which is an up and coming area.  Recently named the "WOW District", the real estate is booming and businesses are popping up like wildfire.  Artists and young professionals are moving in and opening up art galleries and vintage inspired stores.   The main street closest to our house is called "North Ave." There is a grocery store, several vintage shops for men and women, furniture stores, a coffee shop and art galleries.  We also live down the street from 2 of the coolest parks in Chicago.  Humboldt Park is the most gorgeous place where you will see a boathouse from the late 1800s, wild life like ducks and geese and a nature preserve.  It is one of our favorite parts of our neighborhood.  We also live down the street from the 606, an elevated park that used to be a railroad! It's a super rad park that you can walk, bike or run east or west that has entrances and exits throughout.   We welcome guests who are open to stayi
notes: *We have a sweet little dog named Buddy.  He's a small/medium (28 pound)  rat terrier/mini Australian Shepard mix. He is very mild mannered, smart and friendly. You will love him as much as we do. (Some of our guests have wanted to take him back home with them.) Your bedroom is pet free.   *If you are interested in staying with us, but need a different check in or check out time, there is room for flexibility given our availability.  *We sometimes have theater rehearsals in our living room or events downstairs.   If we are having an event we will tell you before you book so you know what to expect.  All guests are invited to events and rehearsals! Thanks for checking us out!  -Laura and Joel
transit: STUFF TO DO -5 minute uber to Logan Square and Wicker Park -25 minutes downtown to Loop or Magnificent Mile via bus + train/ 15 minutes via Uber -30 minutes to Northside, Wrigleyville stadium via bus + train /15 minutes Uber -20 minutes to Lake Michigan for swimming, bike riding or walking via North Ave Bus -45 minutes to all Museums on Museum campus via bus + train -45 minutes to Sox Stadium via bus + train  -1 hour to Museum of Science and Industry via bus +train TRAINS/BUSES -15 minute walk to Blue Line, "Western"  or "Damen" stop/ 5 minute bus ride -8 minute walk to Western #49 bus  -2 minute walk to North Ave #72 bus  AIRPORTS -O'Hare Airport: 40 minutes via Blue Line + North #72 Bus  *If you are flying out of O'Hare: Please note that we live 15 minutes walking distance from the train stop.  If you are traveling with heavy luggage, get off at the "Damen" blue line and wait for the #72 bus or take a cab/uber to our place.  -Midway Airport: 1 hour 30 minutes via Orange Line and tran
access: YOUR BEDROOM  Private room. Please note your room is on the small side (11'x8') big enough for a full size bed, bench with storage, small closet and nightstand.  If you have huge luggage, we have storage outside your room to maximize comfort. This room is an ideal size for 1 or 2 travelers who are out all day and are looking for a cozy, comfy room to sleep in at night.   SHARED SPACES -Shared living room, kitchen and formal dining room. (Make yourself at home. Since your bedroom is on the small side, you are welcome to use the kitchen table for meals and the comfy couch in the living room to lounge. We might be home when you are - don't mind us!)  -Shared bathroom (Although we do use this bathroom,  we also have a bathroom downstairs that we use often to give our guests more privacy) ACCOMMODATIONS -Free street parking  -Complimentary coffee, tea and fruit in the morning -Smoke free environment  -Iron and board, blowdryer -Fresh linens and towels  -In unit washer and dryer -Free wifi
interaction: We are super fun, social and flexible hosts who welcome diversity and all kinds of lifestyles.  We truly embrace the Air Bnb experience - we love getting to know new people from all over the world!  We've been known to hang out with our guests and we are still friends with many. We are also sensitive to guests who like privacy and are looking to keep to themselves.  We are happy to be your guide to Chicago and welcome any questions!  Monday through Friday, we both work early mornings till 1pm and we are home between the hours of 1pm and 5pm.  We are gone most nights.  On weekends we're usually out and about but we've been known to stay in all day. We always make sure to share our schedules with each guest when they stay with us.   When we are home, you will most likely see us in the kitchen (right next to your bedroom) cooking or hanging out in the living room watching some Netflix.  Our bedroom is located on the opposite side of the apartment so you will have lots of privacy and space
house_rules: Please take your shoes off before you enter the house. Please don't feed Buddy anything other than the treats that we have available for you to give him.  Please don't allow Buddy in your bedroom. It is a pet free zone.  Absolutely no smoking inside the apartment. We have a lovely front stoop and backyard area that you are welcome to use instead.   If you are a guest wishing to use our kitchen for your own cooking, please clean up after yourselves.  Please be aware that the kitchen is a shared space.  We have an alarm system for the apartment. Every guest who books with us must use this! Please arm and disarm system upon entering and exiting. When you book with us we will give you the code and teach you how to use it. It is very easy.  Please turn off the lights when you leave the room.  You must lock all DOORS and close all WINDOWS when exiting.  If you have a lot of luggage and need extra space outside of you room, please let me or Joel know and we would be happy to accommodate you.
host_about:
Hi! We're Laura and Joel! Laura is from Miami, Florida and Joel is from Lansing, Michigan.  We are both in our late 20s and moved to Chicago to be actors.  We are always in a play or auditioning for our next gig. We met in school at Columbia College Chicago and got our degrees in Acting.  We got married in September, 2015. 

Laura owns her own business, she is an event planner and plans parties for people! Joel is a licensed tour boat captain. 

We are super friendly, fun and outgoing. We're social butterflies and we absolutely love hosting!  We really enjoy meeting new people and helping them experience our beautiful city.  As actors we are really open-minded people and love being around a diverse crowd. Chicago is an exciting city to be an artist! We have a wonderfully supportive and talented community of friends. When we aren't hosting Air Bnb guests, we love to invite friends over to rehearse some theater or join us for a dinner party or BBQ! 

We are year long bike riders, we love listening to Radiohead, we enjoy cooking yummy vegan meals, and we love a good movie.

summary: Shore Estate is a contemporary, newly remodeled home that offers an open airy space.  The modern decor is classic and timeless.  The interior feels cozy, cool, and comfortable.
space: Shore Estate has three (3) bedrooms, two (2) full bathrooms, two (2) car garage (street parking as well), a backyard with a deck; a full kitchen with stainless steel appliances, stainless cookware, and dishes. A family room and two (2) bedrooms has a smart TV and cable; washer/dryer for guest that stay at least one week. Free WiFi.  Smart Lock for stress free check in.
