name: D2-Room Located Between O’hare & Downtown Chicago
summary: Welcome to this Vintage, safe Multicultural Neighborhood where you can find some of the Irish culture but also Polish and Eastern Europe. This is the perfect spot  conveniently located to those who go to or from O’hare Airport because the train close by is the one that takes you inside the Airport in about 25min. Also, straight Downtown Chicago in about 25min.We offer Wifi,coffee maker,microwave,iron, hair dryer,pretty much everything you might need. We have cameras in common areas and keypads!
space: You will have a comfortable Full Size Bed in a private room! We want you feel very safe so your room is going to have its own padlock and there are cameras in common areas.  This is a private room in a shared place with other Airbnb guests and because of that we expect to keep the house  very quiet, specially after 9pm. There are free parking on the street easy to find before 5pm, plenty paid parking around the house.  *I only accept payments through Airbnb platform*

neighborhood_overview: This place is conveniently located becase it’s between O’hare Airport and Downtown Chicago and we use the blue line train which is close to the house (7 min by walk or 2 min by bus) that will take you straightforwardly both places ! We have a Home Dpt Store just 1 block away and a Family D in case you need to buy any emergency cloth or amenities or food!
notes: The room is private but you will share common areas ( kitchen , living room, and the bathroom/s) with other Airbnb guests. Usually none of this get crowd because most of Airbnb guests are most of the time outside the house knowing the city, in concerts, interviews, etc, and they don’t spend much time in the house. A private small apartment in the area usually cost over 120$ p/night plus taxes and fees which is in total almost 200$ p/night ! If you want save some money and being conveniently located, surrounding great public transportation and with free street parking this could be a great option for you!  The room has one full size bed. If you want to add 3 guests in the reservation I could add 1 extra air mattress with no extra fee if the reservation is set for 3. If the reservation is for 2 and you’d like to have an extra air mattress we charge $15p/night and we provide air mattress and linens for it. The room will become smaller for luggage becase you will have two beds on it. This
transit: There are few free street parking by kimball usually easy to find before 5pm. 152 bus is just 1/2 block away. Addison Blue Line is 8min walk or 5min by bus. 82 bus is 1 block away. . McCormick Place is 20min far by car/Uber . United Center is 17 min far by car. Illinois Medical District is 17min by car. Grant Park is 21min by car/35min by public transportation. The Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium and the Planetarium is 23min far by car. Private Uber / Lyft or Via are around 20$ to those places!
access: You can use the kitchen (please turn on the kitchen fan once you use it), oven, pan, pots, plates, coffee maker, etc! You can use living room, hair dryer, iron. You will have WiFi, clean towels (1 p/p) , sheets, comforter, Shampoo (2in1), hand’s soap, body’s soap, toilet paper.
interaction: If you text Alejandra she will be there for you most of the time she is going to give you quick responses! If you are a tourist she will love to share some places you can’t miss!

Checkout from your room is by 10am and our checkout is firm becase our team schedule. Checkout from your room after this time will end in extra 30$. Checkout after 11am will end in extra 60$. Checkout after 12pm will end in an open  file in airbnb plus 60$ fee (2 hours paid for management team) and your belongings would have to be removed since another guest will be checking in. 6. house_rules: No shoes in the house. No dirty dishes, please. Light cooking only - no oily, splashy, smoky, smelly, or fried cooking. guest agrees to clean up cooking area right after use.
host_about:
Hi! I am a friendly and easy-going host. My background is in graphic design,  interior design, and computer programming. My goal is make sure you enjoy the stay as much as i can. We are courteous, well-organized, responsive to your requests, and clean.  

Originally from Thailand but have lived in Chicago for over 20 years. In my free time, i enjoy gardening, biking, hiking, and exploring new restaurants. It is always my pleasure to recommend my local-favorite spots that are not in travel guide books, or to provide info on transportations, shopping, etc.  

I travel often. I usually pick up new tips from other airbnb hosts to enhance my guest experiences. I greatly appreciate your support. You may expect that i will go extra miles to ensure that you enjoy your stay.

name: Beautifully Renovated, Spacious Urban Getaway
summary: This conveniently located and newly renovated townhouse in Edgewater features tons of sunlight and plenty of room for large families or groups. Near the lakefront, Loyola, Northwestern, and Depaul Universities, Andersonville, and tons of great restaurants and bars. In close proximity to the Red line "El" train, the city bus (22 Clark) and just four (4) miles from Evanston.
space: My place is great for families with children, business travelers and groups, couples, or visiting parents/grandparents. Enjoy the entire two-story townhouse situated on a tree-lined, residential street. The home includes a finished basement. There are three-bedrooms upstairs (1 queen-size bed, 2 full-size beds, and 2 twin beds). Fully appointed eat-in kitchen includes two-person breakfast bar, granite counter tops, new appliances, oven with gas range, microwave, dishwasher, coffee machine, and blender. Fast WIFI internet and Roku TVs in both the living room and family room. One off-street parking space and additional, easy street parking. New windows and air and heat for cool summers and toasty winters. Large family table in dining room is perfect for a group meal or reading a book in the sunlight. Snuggle up on the couch for a movie or an evening lounging with friends. I have many items for families with children such as a pack n' play, high chair, and toys for various ages. (Games fo

neighborhood_overview: Welcome to Edgewater, one of the City of Chicago’s 77 neighborhoods. Edgewater hugs beautiful Lake Michigan on Chicago’s lively and convenient North Side, It is seven miles north of the Loop and has multiple options for public transportation. Our location is walking distance, as well, to Loyola University’s lakeside campus. Edgewater is bounded by Foster Avenue on the south, Devon Avenue on the north, Ravenswood Avenue on the west, and Lake Michigan on the east. Edgewater has several public beaches for our lucky visitors to enjoy. This community offers a full spectrum of memorable restaurants, famous bars, and a lot of history. Great restaurants are within walking distance or a short Lyft or Uber ride. If you’re more adventurous, public transportation works, too! In nearby Andersonville, you might like the the new and hip Octavio Cantina and kitchen, great mexican food and fabulous margaritas. There’s an Irish bar and restaurant called Lady Gregory‘s. Stop by the Swedish American Museu
transit: Public transportation is always a great option. The 22 Clark bus is just two blocks away at Clark and Thome. The El train is about 6.5 blocks away at Granville and Broadway. There are also Divvy Bikes at that corner too. It’s always a great option to take an Lyft or Uber too. If you’re driving in the city make sure to download the app spot hero, it will usually save you 50% on parking.  There is one off the street parking spot at my house, and you can park your other vehicles on the street in the neighborhood. It’s usually not a problem to find street parking.
interaction: I live nearby and will be available to help with any questions, issues, or recommendations via text, airbnb message, or phone.
house_rules: No smoking in the house
host_about: I am a native Chicagoan.  I love this city and all it has to offer and look forward to sharing it with visitors!  I am a foodie, wine enthusiast and a fitness guru.   I am also a die hard Cubs fan, love traveling, and enjoy meeting new people!  I am very excited to host any and all guests to Chicago!!

name: The Woodlawn Grey  - Large 3bd/3ba Apt by UChicago
summary: Enjoy a spacious 3 bed/3 bath apartment on a quiet block, steps away from the beautiful University of Chicago campus. Less than 10 minutes from the Museum of Science and Industry, the lakefront bike and jogging path, and future site of the Presidential Obama Library, it is also 2 blocks away from several transportation lines that connect to Mccormick place and downtown in no time. The unit occupies the 1st floor of a 2 unit Greystone, with a private entrance, and access to ample street parking.
space: I like to think my place has an inviting and comfortable feel. It's been newly painted, has new carpeting, and hardwood floors in all common areas. Recessed lighting, ceiling fans, and lamps provide ample lighting throughout. The unit accommodates 8-10 people with a Queen size bed, 2 double beds, and space for 2 air mattresses. The living room features a 4k Smart Tv with wifi access, to catch up on your favorite Netflix shows after a day of enjoying the city. There are 2 dining areas, one in the living room and another in the kitchen, each seating 4 people. Three bathrooms ensure there'll be no waiting in line. :-) The kitchen is complete with cooking supplies, basic appliances, a microwave, toaster, and coffee/tea.  Central air and heating for your comfort, and an in-unit front-loading washer and dryer for your convenience.

neighborhood_overview: Keep up with The Grey and cool things happening in the neighborhood by following on (Hidden by Airbnb) @the_woodlawn_grey I've been living in the area and working at UChicago for over a decade. 53rd street is a major hub buzzing with great local eats, boutiques, and even a movie theatre (there are menus/maps in the unit). If you have an LA Fitness or Orange Theory membership, locations are close-by. Whole Foods, Target, Treasure Island, Walgreens, CVS, Binny's and other Wine and Spirit Shops are super close, and Robust Coffee Lounge (right down the street) is hailed as one of Chicago's best.
notes: A few things to note: Other items include an ironing board/iron, cleaning supplies (if needed), a fire extinguisher (hopefully not needed). This is a no smoking building, no smoking is allowed within 15ft of entrances. Smoking is allowed in a designated smoking area behind the property.
access: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy. Take advantage of the high speed wi-fi and there's also a desk, in case you require space for any business needs. Have cell phones & tablets? The charging station charges up to 6 devices at once, so you don't have to draw straws.
interaction: If you have any questions or concerns, I will be nearby, so please do not hesitate to contact me.
house_rules: -Smoking, of any kind, is prohibited anywhere on the property, both indoors and outdoors. There is a designated smoking area behind the property, notated by a sign. If you or anyone in your party is found to be smoking in the building or on the property outside the designated area, you will be charged a $150 fee & risk being removed from the unit without a refund. -No skating/skateboarding in apartment -No illicit drug use allowed - Quiet hours are from 10:00pm-8:00am Mon-Thu, 11:30pm-8am Fri-Sat - Security Deposit - if you cause damages to the home, the amount will be charged to your security deposit. - Please by mindful of neighbors and other tenants. Excessive noise is not allowed - Please state correct number of guests when booking. A charge of $25/person over stated guest count will be added to daily rate (unless agreed upon with host before booking - just don't say 6 people and arrive with 11). Extra fee doesn't apply to infants and kids 3 & under.
host_about: I'm a born and raised Chicagoan. I love traveling, exploring new places, and meeting new people.

name: A Chic & Sunny Apt - Minutes to DePaul & Downtown
summary: Elegantly decorated and spacious 1-bedroom/1 bathroom apartment in Lincoln Park. ✔ Close to transit, dining, bars, shops, groceries, & Wrigley Field. ✔ Free access to members-only club in the Willis Tower (details below). ✔ Stream away! Disney+, ESPN+, Netflix, & Hulu included. ✔ Experienced hosts with 2,000+ reviews on-call to answer your questions. ✔ Safe & vibrant neighborhood with convenient parking options nearby. ✔ 12-min train ride to downtown via the adjacent Armitage 'L' train stop.
space: APARTMENT HIGHLIGHTS ✔ High-speed internet ✔ Fully-equipped kitchen ✔ Keyless entry ✔ Furnishings from West Elm & CB2 ✔ 50" Smart TV w/ Netflix (no cable TV) ✔ Coffee maker ️LOCATION️ Because of our central location, we recommend leaving your car at home. Any point of interest in Chicago can easily be reached by walking, public transit, or Uber. ￫ The Armitage Brown/Purple Line 'L' train station is next door. ￫ O'Hare is 50 minutes away via public transit and 30-45 minutes away via Uber. ￫ Midway is 55 minutes away via public transit and 35-50minutes away via Uber. neighborhood_overview: We’re located on the north side of Chicago in Lincoln Park, one of Chicago’s trendiest and safest neighborhoods. Our neighborhood is a wonderful mix of bustling streets packed with local restaurants and shops, as well as quiet tree-lined streets full of historic buildings. We’re also minutes away from many of Chicago’s most popular spots.
notes: ❓FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS❓ 1. “How do I get to ‘x’ from the apartment?/How far is the apartment from ‘x’?” Excellent public transit directions from our apartment to any point in the city are available via web search. Our building is located next to the Armitage Brown Line “L” train station. Search for “Armitage brown line station” in Maps, click the “Directions” button, then enter your point of interest. 2. “Is there parking nearby?” Parking in Chicago is always difficult, especially in the evening and during special events. We highly recommend using an app called SpotHero to reserve a nearby paid parking spot. We love SpotHero because it allows you to reserve a parking spot in advance so that you don’t have to worry about finding one when you arrive. 3. "When is check-in/check-out?" Check-in: Your reservation and access to the apartment both begin at 3 p.m. As a courtesy, you can stop by anytime after 11:30 a.m. to drop off your bags in the living room. Check-out: Your reservation a
transit: Because of our central location, we recommend leaving your car at home. Any point of interest in Chicago can easily be reached by walking, public transit, or Uber. ￫ The Armitage Brown/Purple Line 'L' train station is next door. ￫ O'Hare is 55 minutes away via public transit and 30-45 minutes away via Uber. ￫ Midway is 55 minutes away via public transit and 35-50minutes away via Uber.
access: The entire apartment is yours to use during your stay. The apartment includes: ✔ One bedroom with queen-size bed. ✔ One full bathroom. ✔ Sunny and spacious living room with smart TV (no cable). ✔ Fully-equipped kitchen with breakfast table.
interaction: Need more towels? Deep dish pizza recommendations? We're always on call to answer your questions.
host_about: We're excited to join the Airbnb community! Our children have been using it for years and we recently started hosting.  I'm an attorney and my wife Patricia is an accountant. We love cooking, grilling in the summer, and spending time with our children and grandchildren.

name: Stylish River West Home w/ Parking & Room for 12!
summary: You'll love staying here! Our professionally-designed 4 bedroom townhouse is right in the middle of it all! 2 beds are on the lower level, in a spacious & private room; 3 more are on the top level, where one has an ensuite bath. And there's garage parking, too! In a car, it's only about 10 minutes to the Loop, or 5 to all of the restaurants on Randolph. This neighborhood has a lot to offer: galleries, cafes, & 2 Blue Line stops.
space: The lower floor has a spacious bedroom with 2 beds and a television. On the main floor, defined but open spaces for the living room, dining area, and kitchen will immediately make you feel at home. Off the dining area, there's a private patio. There's a half-bath on this floor as well. Upstairs, we have 3 bedrooms: 2 with Queen-sized beds that share a common bath, and another Master, with a Queen-sized bed and ensuite bath.

You'll have full access to my 4 bedroom, 2.5 bath home, the private patio, and the garage, which fits (1) car, and an additional car outsid
neighborhood_overview: Once a thriving market area, River West still boasts many charming traditional family-owned restaurants, bakeries, and flower and produce stands. Now you might expect new art galleries and restaurants to pop up on a weekly basis - though thankfully those family-owned places aren't going anywhere, either!
notes: In addition to easy access to and from O'Hare, we're also close to the Mag Mile - including the MCA, Water Tower Place, and Hancock Tower, and conveniently located near River North's exciting club and restaurant scene. It's a 10 minute drive northwest to Wicker Park, or south to UIC and Rush. We're also an easy commute to (Hidden by Airbnb) and McDonald's campuses in the West Loop. And, since we're so close to Chicago's infamous Restaurant Row, the neighborhood is full of new and established restaurants alike - including some family-owned Italian grocers dating back generations.
transit: The Grand Blue Line stop is about a quarter-mile / 5 minute walk southeast. Also easily accessible are the 56/Milwaukee bus, and 65/Grand bus (which brings you right to Northwestern Hospital!), so it's easy to get around here without a car. If you do bring a car, there's a garage that fits (1) car, and another car can park in front of the garage.
access: You'll have full access to my 4 bedroom, 2.5 bath home, the private patio, and the garage, which fits (1) car, and an additional car outside, blocking the garage.
house_rules: House Rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.   1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable.  2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee.  3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance.  4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily.  5.) Pets are not allowed at the property.  6.) Lockouts will result in a $150 fee per occurrence. Additionally, lost keys will incur a $50 per ke
host_about:
I am a lifelong Chicago resident.  I am married with kids and  live and work in downtown Chicago. I am passionate about travel, having been abroad nearly a dozen times throughout my studies and traveling with my wife Jenny.  I have been all over Europe, both working, studying and exploring. I have also visited South America, Japan and Australia. 

No matter how many places I have seen, Chicago tops them all. This amazing metropolis is vibrant, beautiful, diverse, eclectic and genuine. 

My "must see and do" Chicago things are: the Architecture Boat Tours, A bike ride along the Lake Front Path, Spending a day at the beach, Wrigley Field, Drinks at the 95th floor Hancock Bar, Shopping on Michigan avenue, and enjoying a steak at one of the legendary steakhouses.

house_rules: We created Kasa to be your home on the road. We’re committed to being great neighbors, and we strictly enforce these rules to ensure the comfort and safety of our community. •NO Smoking: Smoking of any kind (including tobacco, marijuana, e-cigarettes, vape pens, and hookahs) is never allowed at this property.  This applies to the entire apartment, including the balcony or patio, as well as all common and outdoor areas of the building. Kasa apartments may be monitored with marijuana and tobacco sensors. •Noise: At all times, Kasa guests may not disturb their neighbors’ quiet enjoyment.  In addition, guests must observe quiet hours from 9 p.m. to 8 a.m. Parties and large gatherings are prohibited. Kasa apartments are proactively monitored with decibel sensors for compliance with this noise policy. •Occupancy: Each Kasa has a maximum occupancy limit.  There can be no more than the specified number of guests on the premises at any given time. Large gatherings are not permitted. •Lost and F
host_about: We are the team behind Kasa Living, a national flexible living brand that offers a dependable, high-quality living experience at a great value. We manage Kasas in modern buildings with the amenities and comforts that you want out of your own home. We aim to unleash the potential of livable space by giving you access to places that feel like your home on the road. Kasa Living is available in cities across the United States, with new locations opening frequently. We hope you enjoy your stay with us, and know that Kasa is your home on the road!

name: Classic Edgewater 3-BR/1-BA (w parking!)
summary: You'll love this classic, Chicago-style vintage architecture. Come relax in this spacious, 1450 sq ft unit on a lovely tree-lined residential block. Very close to public transit, stores/restaurants, and Hollywood beach! Includes one parking spot directly behind the building. Only 7 stops / 12 min to Wrigley on the red line. **To read more, EXPAND the below section**
space: Enjoy this spacious unit as you explore Chicago! Hardwood floors and crown molding throughout the space. Beautifully decorated with high-quality furniture. 1GB mesh network wifi and Roku TV! Living Room: 12.5' x 13.5' with a 8.5' x 6.5' sun room bump-out, TV has Roku TV (guests log into their own Netflix, cable, etc accounts) and 1GB wifi, couches (non-pull-out); radiator Dining Room: 15' x 14' dining table with 6 chairs; window AC unit May - Oct / radiator Kitchen: 19' x 9.75', includes cookware and dining ware plus paper towels, kitchen towels, dishwasher detergent, dish soap, and hand soap. Radiator. Bedroom 1: king bed, 11.75' x 10', closet, 2 nightstands, radiator and window AC (June - Oct) Bedroom 2: queen bed, 11' x 11', closet, dresser, radiator and window AC (June - Oct) Bedroom 3: king bed, 12.5' x 11', closet, radiator and window AC (June - Oct) Full Bath: Tub, sink, toilet; includes shampoo, conditioner, body wash, hand soap, toilet paper, hand towel, and hair dryer PARKING

neighborhood_overview: This multi-unit building is right near the lake, with easy access to Hollywood Beach and the lakefront trail & parks for running/biking. Restaurants of all cuisines, lively bars, and unique stores abound in the Edgewater neighborhood.
notes: STAIRS This is a 1st floor unit. There are 7 steps up from the outside to enter the unit, then no steps within the unit. PACK N PLAY Pack N Play may be rented for $5/night. It will be inside the unit waiting for you in its carrying case, and we request you fold it up back into its carrying case prior to departure. Note that linens are not included for the crib. RADIATORS The building has a steam furnace / radiator system. It is one system, so the temperature settings are centrally-controlled to keep all floors comfortable (around 68-71 F). Each room’s radiator air flow may be opened/closed via a knob. We also provide small space heaters for bedrooms in case guests would like additional warmth. 30+ DAY STAYS The unit will be fully cleaned and stocked with paper / bathroom products for your arrival. After these initial products, monthly guests are responsible for providing their own bathroom products and paper products. For 30+ day stays, we also include a monthly complimentary cleaning.
transit: Public transportation is an easy and convenient way to get around the city. It's .2 mi to the Thorndale red-line stop. In addition, there are multiple bus options, including the 146 express bus and 151. I am happy to provide additional detail about our public transit system, as well as directions. The bus is $2/person, while the train is $2.25/person; there are also unlimited 3-day passes for $21 and 7-day passes for $28. One parking spot behind the building is included with this rental. If you have additional cars, there is free street parking in the area (no permit required).
access: KEYS You will be given a custom key pad code for entry at your leisure anytime from 4pm on. Inside the unit, there will also be 3 sets of keys. If keys are lost, there is a $15 replacement fee. SPACE You will have full use of the space to yourselves - dining room, living room, 3 bedrooms, 1 full bathroom, and kitchen. This unit also includes the use of one parking spot.  Two of the bedrooms have king beds, and one bedroom has a queen bed. Each has dressers, closets, window AC and a radiator. There is also a twin air mattress available that can be placed in the living room.  LINENS, ETC Beds have clean linens, comforters, and pillows. We provide 2 towels / 2 face cloths per bedroom as well as for the living room in guests guests are sleeping there. Should you like your towels refreshed during your stay, you may use the laundry room at no cost. PUBLIC TRANSIT Public transportation is an easy and convenient way to get around the city. It's .2 mi to the Thorndale red-line stop. In addition
interaction: Our goal is to ensure you have the most enjoyable and comfortable stay in Chicago. We're more than happy to offer suggestions before or during your trip to help you maximize your time in the city. Depending on our work travel schedule, we may or may not be in town; however, we're always accessible via phone or email for any questions that arise.
house_rules: REQUESTS: 1) Please treat the unit with care.  Please be courteous of others in building; we request quiet hours from 9pm - 8am. 2) We welcome infants and children, but please note that the unit is not "child-proofed." If you have specific questions/concerns, please ask before booking. 3) Only those on the reservation are permitted in the unit. Special events will be considered on a case-by-case basis. 4) No smoking inside - violations may result in a $500 smoke removal fee CHECK IN/OUT:  Standard check-in time is 4pm (or later). You will be given a custom keypad code. Standard check-out time and is by 10am. If scheduling permits, we will work with you on alternate arrangements, so please inquire.  If unit is not vacated by check-out time or notes are not followed, additional charges may apply. For check out, we ask that you: - turn off lights/TV/AC - place used kitchen items in dishwasher and begun cycle - bag any trash and dispose in bins behind building - gather towels in bath tub
host_about:
I began using Airbnb as a traveler in the fall of 2013, and I'm hooked! Staying in someone's home allows you to experience the area in a truly authentic way - no more hotels for me! As of May 2014, I began hosting in Chicago and have since hosted thousands of guests from around the world. I love helping others make the most of their visits. 

As a host, I am personable, responsive, and detail-oriented. I take great pride in the comfort and cleanliness of each apartment. You can trust that when staying in any one of our properties, you will feel at home.

name: Amazing 2-BR Apt in Old Town! Eat,Drink,Beach&Shop
summary: Conveniently located on a quiet street in Old Town, this apartment is just a short walk to countless restaurants and bars on Wells St. You can take a relaxing stroll to North Ave Beach or spend the day shopping on Clybourn and see a movie at New City Mall. The apartment also has a garaged parking spot for one car if you are driving in from out of town!

name: Lofted 2nd Floor Apartment with Spiral Staircase
summary: My place is close to the Blue Line, the highway, Downtown, Logan Square, Wicker Park, Humbolt Park, Lincoln Park, and Bucktown. You’ll love my place because of the central location, free parking, delicious local restaurants, and easy commute to anywhere in the city. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and families (with kids).
space: Hello Travelers! Welcome to our brand new loft in the city. This is a 1 bedroom, 1 bathroom space with an attic loft. There is a queen bed in the bedroom (new mattress bought in February 2020), three twin beds in the loft, and a futon in the common area that can sleep one. Note: the foosball table has been replaced by a dining table.  This is a second floor unit located on Western Ave., so there is noise from the street, especially with the windows open. But if you're looking for a city apartment that's minutes from it all, this is the one!  There is free street parking on Western Ave. The Blue Line Western stop is just a few blocks south. This is the train that runs from O'hare Airport all the way downtown. If you're driving, Kennedy Expressway 94 is just 2 blocks north, off the Fullerton exit.  There is a secure lock box with 2 keys for easy check in.  We have exterior security cameras for additional security. This also means we can see how many people come in and out of the apartmen

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located right between Logan Square and Bucktown. Avondale, Wicker Park, Humbolt Park, and Lincoln Park are just a few blocks away! There is a local grocery store called Fresh Market a couple blocks down Western Ave. There you can get fresh produce, local liquors, and they have a really good cafeteria with affordable plates.
notes: The apartment is on Western Ave., which is a bustling street and can get noisy, especially with the windows open. It does quiet down at night. The unit sits on top of a storefront that we are restoring. The building was built in 1887 and used to be a Mexican Fruit and Meat store. Last fun fact; Western Ave is the longest continuous street in Chicago, running 23.5 miles north and south.
transit: The Blue line Western stop is about 4 blocks south (10 minute walk). This train will get you downtown in 10 minutes and also to O'hare Airport in 40 minutes. A stop before and after Western will get you in central Logan Square or Wicker Park. Lots of shopping and nightlife in either places.  If driving, the Kennedy Expressway 94 is just a couple blocks in the other direction, and without traffic will get you downtown in 5 minutes.  Ridesharing is also very popular and readily available.  The two major bus lines are the Western line and the Fullerton line.  There is a Divvy Bike Station a couple blocks down where you can rent bicycles. You can take the bikes on the 606 trail which runs east and west. Or if you're ambitious, you can ride it to Lincoln Park Zoo or the lakefront: 3 miles and around 25 minutes one way.
access: Guests will have access to the entire second floor apartment.
interaction: We live only 20 minutes away so feel free to let us know of any maintenance issues.
house_rules: No shoes inside due to our white flooring.  No parties. No outside guests without approval. Outside guests should leave by 10pm. Please do not attempt to go on the roof. Booking must be made for accurate number of guests. If additional unapproved guests are found to have entered the unit after 10pm, the additional guest fee of $15 a person a night will be charged.
host_about: My name is Margaret, and I am a Chinese American based in Chicago. My hobbies include thrifting (a.k.a. treasure hunting), hiking with my dogs, and exploring new places. My husband and I bought a couple properties and are renovating them in our free time. Hopefully you will like staying in our first fixer upper. We welcome you to our home and to Chicago, one of the best cities in the world!

name: Extra bedroom in Lakeview
summary: The guests stay in a spacious bedroom with generous closet space, adjacent bath and guest living room (both shared). Guests may also make use of the second bathroom, kitchen and laundry room which are downstairs.
space: Our home is on a quiet tree-lined street in Chicago's Lakeview neighborhood where you will find dozens of restaurants within a short walk, offering food from many lands. The area is popular among young adults with its numerous comedy and other clubs as well as theaters and cinema. The Briar Street theater, home of Blue Man Group, is a 5-minute walk from our front door.

neighborhood_overview: Wide variety of restaurants (Swedish-American, Italian, Korean, Mexican, Middle Eastern, etc.) 1 block from Briar Street Theater (Blue Man Group), 8 minute jog to lakefront park with 20 miles of running and biking trails.
transit: The CTA Rapid Transit ('El') station is less than 4 minutes walk away and it gets you to the center of town in about 15 minutes. There are also three major bus routes that pass within 2 blocks of our front door. If you prefer a ride-hailing service, the neighborhood is crawling with Ubers and Lyfts.
access: Your bedroom is private, the upstairs bath and guest living room ("library") are shared with other guests, if present, and the 2nd bathroom, kitchen and laundry room downstairs are shared with hosts and guests.
interaction: We are always pleased to meet guests when we are in town, but we travel a fair amount. We can always be reached by email or phone. Also, our co-host, Professor Taye, lives in the 4th bedroom and can solve most any problem that might arise.
host_about: I am a pediatrician in my 70s, as is my wife. We are both retired recently and often travel together.  None of our adult sons live in Chicago now. We both enjoy physical activity, cooking, going to (and in her case, writing) plays. We speak a few languages between us, although not too well. I work in Xi'an China a few weeks each year, teaching in a  NICU there. (My Mandarin is still pretty rudimentary.) We generally prefer interesting and unusual things to expensive things. Hence, airbnb,

name: Scots Thistle - Duplex w/ Terrace by Short Stay
summary: Welcome to SCOTS THISTLE ! All the amenities of a luxury hotel with as much space as a single-family home! Enjoy this unique newly constructed duplex 3 bed unit featuring a private terrace, in-unit washer/dryer, and open floor plan living space . Whether it's for business or pleasure, this home is your perfect home away from home. Hang at the coffee shop, bike rental, fitness facility, pool tables, a stylish rooftop deck lounge complete with fire pits, grills, and breath taking city views.
space: Sleeping Arrangements  Master Bedroom - Queen Bed  Bedroom 2 - Queen Bed  Bedroom 3 - Queen Bed  Living Room - pull out sleeper sofa (queen) + 2 cots (twin)* *Please not that cots are available upon request only and need to be requested at the time of booking. We cannot accommodate last minute requests.  Kitchen   The kitchen is fully equipped with pots, pants, utensils, silverware, plates, bowls, cups, knives, a cutting board, salt and pepper, a coffee maker, and cream and sugar – for however you take it.     Cleaning Supplies   You’re supplied with dish soap, a sponge, dish detergent and paper towels. Washer/Dryer  There is a washer/dryer in unit. We provide you with detergent for your stay! TV The Roku guide is posted next to the TV. There is also a digital antenna for local channels. Please remember to sign out of any of any Roku apps you’ve utilize duringyour stay.  Non-Smoking  The home and entire building is designated as a smoke-free community. There will be a $500 fee imposed

neighborhood_overview: The perfect location for a weekend getaway or business trip. River North is a stylish urban neighborhood that borders the Magnificent Mile and is just across the bridge from the Loop, Millennium Park, and the downtown theater district. It is the go-to neighborhood for those who appreciate fine art and design, but is also a little quieter than being right in the middle of downtown. For those who appreciate fine dining and drinks, you can find everything from knockout noodles and Spanish small plates to high-end steakhouses and famed pizzerias. Just about every type of cuisine is covered in this mix of award-winning restaurants and local favorites. And for a fun evening out, slip into any of the sleek new clubs, upscale wine bars and craft cocktail lounges, many of which are walking distance from the home.
notes: Check In / Check Out Check in starts at 4 PM CT Check out time is 11 AM CT We do not offer early Check In or late Check Out.  Luggage Hold  If your travel arrangements have you arriving earlier or leaving later than our designated check in / check out times, we recommend using Wait Here Chicago. We have a partnership with them and can offer you discounted rates on their luggage hold options throughout the city. Pets There is a $25/pet per booking fee.  We know that all dogs are good dogs but the building's breed restrictions are listed below. There are no weight restrictions, but if your buddy falls under one of these categories unfortunately we wouldn't be able to host them: Pit Bull, American Pit Bull Terrier, American Staffordshire Terrier, Shaffordshire Bull Terrier, Rottweiler, Doberman Pinscher, Chow Chow, Akita, Presa Canario and /or Wolf Hybrids. While we trust that your pet plays well with others, we know that accidents happen. In the event of an issue involving your pet, you
transit: There is no dedicated parking space for the home. We recommend using apps like SpotHero to locate discounted street or garage spots nearby.  The home is a short walk from the CTA brown line train at the "Chicago" stop. This train line will take you all over the city, including into the neighborhoods further north and south for exploring or down into the loop to catch a show or transfer to another train line.
access: The entire home as well as all building amenities are for you to enjoy!
interaction: We are off-site but available when needed. The best way to reach us is by emailing (Email hidden by Airbnb)  In case of maintenance emergency, the in-unit home guide will detail phone numbers of who to call immediately.
house_rules: General Rules -Please treat the home as if it is your own. -Please respect our guest limit capacity of 8 people. -Do not engage in illegal activities anywhere on the property. -If you accidentally damage anything during your stay, please contact the host for your safety and the future safety of the next guest. -We pride ourselves on being green and would appreciate you turning off the TV and lights when you check-out. -Please remember to sign out of any ROKU apps you utilized via your personal accounts before departing. Quiet Hours Quiet hours are between 10p-8a. This is a residential building and ask that for the respect of permanent tenants basic courtesies of being mindful of your noise levels and not congregating in hallways outside of the unit be observed. Please be advised that this home is equipped with NoiseAware. NoiseAware works like a smoke detector, but for noise. The sensor tracks the decibel levels in this home, evaluates other risk factors and will send an alert if there
host_about: Hello! Thanks for checking out our homes in beautiful Chicago! Livly Short Stay has a few hosts that will be communicating with you and we can’t wait to get to know you and welcome you to the city. Hosting as a team makes communicating with us even faster and we're looking forward to taking care of curating a perfect stay for you. Talk to you soon!

name: North Park Bungalow
summary: A sweet bungalow centrally located on the northwest side of Chicago.   Walking distance to parks, restaurants and public transportation - a quick ride downtown or an easy bus ride to the beaches.  Our home is located just a few blocks down from the North Park Nature Center - the best way to get into nature in the city.   Looking to go to Wrigley Field or Evanston?  We're a quick 15 minute car ride away without traffic.  We hope you'll feel welcome in our family home!
space: We have to little cats - Astrid and Pearl.  We ask that you feed them, clean their litter and make sure they don't run out the door.  One thing to note, the cat referenced in Hanna's review passed away.  Our cats are quiet. :)

name: Cozy private guest suite in Avondale
summary: Private guest suite with 2 bedrooms, a full bathroom, a small kitchenette and a living room. We supply all the essentials, and even some non-essentials (snacks, games, coffee and more). Conveniently located between the Addison and Belmont stops on the CTA Blue Line. It’s only a 30 min train ride from O'Hare and another 30 minutes to the loop. We’re NOT the Ritz Carlton. We are in the city of Chicago but we’re NOT downtown. If you’re expecting either of these things, please keep searching!
space: The unit is a newly finished attic, with a separate entrance and all the essentials needed for a group of friends or family to stay when visiting the many Chicago activities and attractions.  We have better amenities and it is much nicer than a stuffy hotel room!
description: Private guest suite with 2 bedrooms, a full bathroom, a small kitchenette and a living room. We supply all the essentials, and even some non-essentials (snacks, games, coffee and more). Conveniently located between the Addison and Belmont stops on the CTA Blue Line. It’s only a 30 min train ride from O'Hare and another 30 minutes to the loop. We’re NOT the Ritz Carlton. We are in the city of Chicago but we’re NOT downtown. If you’re expecting either of these things, please keep searching! The unit is a newly finished attic, with a separate entrance and all the essentials needed for a group of friends or family to stay when visiting the many Chicago activities and attractions.  We have better amenities and it is much nicer than a stuffy hotel room! You will have private access to the full attic unit, as well as the shared backyard. We live in the unit below, so we're a call, a text or a knock away; but we give our guests their space and the unit has a private entrance. Avondale is an up
neighborhood_overview: Avondale is an up and coming neighborhood on the north side of Chicago. There are great restaurants/bars and grocery stores within walking distance, and the very popular Logan Square is only one stop away on the Blue Line!
notes: We don't have a full kitchen in the unit, but provide all the essentials to cook a meal if necessary! The kitchenette includes a mini fridge, toaster oven, microwave and a hot plate.
transit: The Blue Line and buses are both quick access public transportation that will get you just about anywhere you want to go in the city.  We'd recommend Lyft for transportation downtown as opposed to driving. But if you do drive, we offer daily guest passes to the permit parking on our street for free!
access: You will have private access to the full attic unit, as well as the shared backyard.
interaction: We live in the unit below, so we're a call, a text or a knock away; but we give our guests their space and the unit has a private entrance.
house_rules: - Please recycle! There is a recycle bin separate from trash for plastic, glass and metal containers, cans and bottles. - There are two very friendly dogs who live in the building and love their backyard, so don’t be afraid if they bark a “hello” when you arrive. They will be in and out so let us know if you have any issues with dogs, though we’re typically outside when they are. - No major cleaning is required upon checkout as long as you’re respectful (ie. please don’t trash the place!). No need to make beds, do dishes or sweep.
host_about: I’m 34 years old and I am a Sr. Manager at a large eCommerce company. My husband and I own a 2.5-flat in the Avondale neighborhood of Chicago, and we spend a lot of our free time at home relaxing in the backyard or doing some project around the house. We also have a large 4-year old pup named Newton who is our whole world. He’s a Lab/Great Pyrenees mix and is just the sweetest dog in the world.

name: Revisit your youth in (2) cozy bunkbeds (K3)
summary: One of four spacious bedrooms that is available every other weekend. My boys sleep in these bunk beds when they are staying with me.
space: It's cozy and affordable and only available every other weekend. A pair of rustic twin sized bunk beds, are all yours in this spacious 3rd floor walk up (no elevator) in a huge, sunny 4 bedroom apartment with 1.5 bath. Totally gut-rehabbed in 2014.  You will have the front  bedroom. You are welcome to use the fully equipped kitchen; just clean up after yourself. You will enjoy super fast Wi-Fi internet, premium cable TV/Netflix/Amazon and a 50 inch smart TV. Please check the map before you book. This is great access to freeway and close to O'Hare and short drive to hot spots downtown, even closer to Bucktown, Wicker Park, really close to Logan Square but NOT walking distance to much.

Premium on-demand cable tv, Amazon Prime & Netflix Fully appointed kitchen with dish washer & washer/dryer Super fast Wi-Fi Guests have full access to the kitchen and living
neighborhood_overview: It's green and shaded. Located down the street from a 2.5 acre park—Mayfair. And it's really quiet with friendly neighbors. Beautiful tree lined streets with lots of kids and people walking their pets.  Many of our neighbors have lived here for over 30 years and now their children are moving back. You will see bungalows being remodeled with a second story addition, and tear-downs getting replaced with big houses. Within a few blocks there are an amazing and diverse number of churches, temples and mosques. Plenty of groceries, pharmacies, restaurants and entertainment half a mile or so away, but this is more of a residential neighborhood, not the kinetic pace of the urban/mixed use neighborhoods closer in. Four blocks from Mayfair Park.  Nearby are Independence Park (accessible on the Blue Line at Irving Park) and Portage Park (2 miles west and south from here and also on Irving Park Boulevard),  both of which run great farmer's markets on several Sundays through October. There is a gre
notes: We got a Labrador puppy last year. Cassius. He’s 1 year now in 2019. Super friendly. Horrible guard dog. Loves all people. Sleeps in the way back porch. Never in anyone’s room, unless you invite him.  $250 fee if you don’t return the keys
transit: Blue line: Montrose stop (6 blocks away) Bus: 78 Montrose (2 blocks south) Brown Line (over a mile away). Really easy actually. It's about a 10  minute walk, with luggage,  to the Blue Line which goes to the Loop in 25 min or outbound to O'Hare in about 20.  The Montrose bus is two blocks away and a 25 min ride to the beachfront at Lake Michigan or to the Brown Line.  The Lawrence Ave bus is a few blocks north and travels east about a mile to the Brown Line (or all the way to the lakefront, too). Brown Line goes to the Loop and stops a couple of blocks from Michigan Avenue as well, with stops along the way at DePaul or Lincoln Park or Old Town. You can transfer to the Red Line from the Brown Line at Belmont or Fullerton and go to the Apple Store Lincoln Park or keep going  and get off at Grand to walk over to North Michigan Avenue or on to State Street and all that provides. If you are traveling by car, your GPS will find us easily.
access: Premium on-demand cable tv, Amazon Prime & Netflix Fully appointed kitchen with dish washer & washer/dryer Super fast Wi-Fi Guests have full access to the kitchen and living areas.   But you do not have access to the 4th bedroom/back office. I work there, on weekdays, and I will generally be gone from the rest of the flat at other times. This listing is for the front Bunkbed bedroom.  However, the apartment is fully furnished for a large family, with a twin daybed in one room, queen bed in another for when my kids come to stay. If you want the whole place we can make it available in between their visits. It is listed on AirBnB as "Mayfair 3BR" If you want a completely separate space, I have a 2 bedroom, 1 bath garden apartment in the same building listed on AirBnb as "Mayfair 2 BR I94/90/BlueLine"
interaction: Not often in person but constantly vie text & mobile You can call or text me pretty much any time if you have any questions or need anything at all.  I work from home, and I live in the unit.  You will have access to the living and dining area, and both full and half bathrooms, along with the kitchen, but not to the fourth bedroom/office at the very back of the building, where I will work on weekdays, and where I may sleep. I'm often gone in evenings overnight. I won't get in your way, and am rarely around when guests stay, but close by if you need me.  I am happy to act as a host and provide tips on where to go and what to see, or to just leave you on your own.
house_rules: We completely renovated the nearly 100 year old building in 2014. All new plumbing, water service, mechanicals, floors, new bath rooms with huge walk in shower and fully appointed kitchen with new appliances, Kuerig coffee maker (a wide selection of k coup coffee and tea bags), toaster (we provide the bread and muffins)  etc. So everything works.   Regarding our old building: You will hear the tenants downstairs moving around and they will hear you if you have the TV or music turned up or if you have loud voices or stomp around. Please moderate your sound, including your footsteps, so that we minimize disturbing the neighbors, especially after 10pm. We welcome families with children, however we do not rent to individuals or groups under the age of 21.   No drugs, no smoking.  If you smoke, there is a $500 cleaning fee. If you do drugs? We will ask you to leave.  Pets may be allowed if we discuss it beforehand.  If you bring a pet, we require a $250 security deposit for the pet, in addi
host_about:
I am a divorced father of four. That's my three youngest kids in the scooter sidecar with me. My oldest is all grown up and just graduated from law school in Texas. 
I worked for Apple. I currently consult with companies about technology/internet/social media/marketing/branding. We own the entire building and I work and live (some of the time) on the third floor with tenants on first floor. We use AirBnB for the Garden Apartment (totally private), the second floor is a hostel style AirBnB, and upstairs on the 3rd floor we have up to three bedrooms that are available most days and every other weekend (when my kids are not staying with me).
I enjoy going on bike rides to the beach with my kids, and my girlfriend and her kids. I love to read and I am a tech geek. I am a coffee OR tea drinker and after drinking both black for almost forty years, I have started using cream in them — a habit I picked up in Nairobi, Kenya a couple years ago when I was doing some missionary work (plus my girlfriend uses cream and so I have no choice). 
If I had to pick some things I can't live without: my girlfriend (and her boys); my kids; my technology; my morning coffee; my fellowship; and my friends. And I love to watch movies. Old. New. Comedy. Mystery. Action. It doesn't matter. I like them all. 
I enjoy working out — lifting weights and riding a bike, plus I am a life-long swimmer. I also just started playing hockey! At age 52! Crazy. 
We have been hosting guests for three years now. We have over 141 reviews. We are a SuperHost. We love this. And we are really good at it.
I am a pretty laid back guy. I like things to be neat and tidy, but it's hard to do without motivation. AirBnB has been the motivation to get our place all tricked out and we are very proud of it. We hope you will enjoy staying here. All of our units are in a great neighborhood—in a great city. We have lots of suggestions for fun stuff to do, not the typical touristy stuff, but cool Chicago things that Chicagoans like to do/see.

name: Charming 3 Bedroom Apartment in Tri-Taylor!
summary: This 3BR apartment was decorated by travelers with fellow travelers in mind. The space is comfortable & near downtown. You will find plenty to enjoy when you stay here. 3 blocks from the "L" (blue line).
space: Approx. 1,000 sq. feet (93 sq. meter). Top floor apartment in 1890s Row House. Three small cozy bedrooms with large open communal spaces encourages interaction among guests.
description: This 3BR apartment was decorated by travelers with fellow travelers in mind. The space is comfortable & near downtown. You will find plenty to enjoy when you stay here. 3 blocks from the "L" (blue line). Approx. 1,000 sq. feet (93 sq. meter). Top floor apartment in 1890s Row House. Three small cozy bedrooms with large open communal spaces encourages interaction among guests. Guests can access the Apartment, back deck, back yard and laundry room. The Apartment is not wheelchair or ADA accessible. There is zoned street parking directly in front of the Apartment. We can provide parking passes for stays of 5 nights or less free of charge, and for a small fee for longer stays.  There is free 24-hour parking one block north of the Apartment on Flournoy. We love international travel. We will be happy to welcome people from all over the world to stay in our home. Just let us know what interests you and we will be happy to help. We will provide as much interaction with guests as we can, if that
neighborhood_overview: This property is located in Chicago's Near West Side Community Area in the Tri-Taylor neighborhood. Tri-Taylor is an extension of the Little Italy neighborhood directly to its east. It is one of the most diverse neighborhoods in Chicago. It is largely a residential area for students from the University of Illinois at Chicago and students and employees from the nearby Illinois Medical District.
transit: This property is very convenient to public transportation. The CTA Blue Line is 3 blocks to the northwest and offers access to the Loop within 10 minutes. The apartment is also right near the Western and Harrison Avenue CTA bus lines. The Eisenhower Expressway is also only a few blocks away, which offers easy access to the Loop and the entire Chicagoland area.
access: Guests can access the Apartment, back deck, back yard and laundry room. The Apartment is not wheelchair or ADA accessible. There is zoned street parking directly in front of the Apartment. We can provide parking passes for stays of 5 nights or less free of charge, and for a small fee for longer stays.  There is free 24-hour parking one block north of the Apartment on Flournoy.
interaction: We love international travel. We will be happy to welcome people from all over the world to stay in our home. Just let us know what interests you and we will be happy to help. We will provide as much interaction with guests as we can, if that is what you desire.
house_rules: This is our home and we expect you to treat the space with the same respect you treat your own home. No cigarette smoking allowed inside. This unit is on the top floor of a residential 3-flat and people live below this unit, so please be mindful of that during your stay.
host_about: We love to travel, especially internationally! Enjoy seeing new places and meeting interesting people.

neighborhood_overview: Logan Square is a trendy neighborhood located on the Northwest side of the city. The area is characterized by the prominent historical boulevards, stately greystones and large bungalow-style homes. Logan Square is just three CTA stops from Wicker Park. You can also access Chicago's downtown (also called the Loop) via a 20 minute subway ride.
transit: The Logan Square Blue Line CTA Station is two blocks away. There are also several bus routes nearby. If driving, the 90/94 interstate off ramp is about a 5 minute drive from the apartment. Street parking is available.
interaction: With input from you about your preferences, I am happy to offer suggestions about things to do and places to eat in the area.

neighborhood_overview: Wicker Park is famous for live music and nightlife, chef-driven restaurants and countless art galleries — many housed within the Flat Iron Arts Building. If you have an acute knowledge of craft cocktails or an affinity for coffee, plus want to sift through records or thrifted threads, there's no better area to sip and shop in the country. The area has become a prevailing influence on Chicago's Michelin-rated, James Beard Award-winning dining scene, boasting some of the city's most sought after tables. Wicker Park and Bucktown are also known for their palate pleasing nightcaps, like renowned brewery Piece and mixology tour de force The Violet Hour. Along North, Division, Milwaukee and Damen Avenues, you will find an unbelievable blend of vintage shops amid independently-owned boutiques touting fashions for both men and women, and luxury home goods and beauty products. On the same blocks are nationally-recognized names in fashion, and a mix of major retail chains that have also set up sh
notes: Unfortunately, the apartment is not handicap accessible.
transit: The apartment is located just 0.4 mile from the Blue Line Damen Station (connecting to O’Hare airport) which travels through much of the city. The “9” Ashland Street Bus Stop is one block away - running north and south. Additionally, six blocks away is the Kennedy Expressway Division Street Exit. It is only three miles to downtown Chicago (10 minute Uber ride).
access: Your bedroom, bathroom, living room, dining room and kitchen are available for your stay.
interaction: I, or my co-host, Nat, am/is available throughout your stay to answer questions that you may have; or recommend local attractions, dining, or nightlife.

host_about: I'm a Chicagoan who enjoys the outdoors (biking, swimming, jogging, etc.), and who knows the city (well-known highlights and off-the-beaten-path) pretty well. I’ve done a fair amount of traveling in the Continental & Territorial Untied States, as well as Europe & Mexico; along with some varied international destinations. I’m always looking for another adventure...

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood, known as Northcenter, is on the North Side of Chicago, Illinois.  Northcenter is considered a vibrant neighborhood with an eclectic mix of retailers, restaurants, live music, live theater, and service-oriented businesses. North Center was voted one of Chicago's best neighborhoods by the Chicago Magazine in 2014.  Northcenter’s history is deeply rooted in European cultural influences, from German, Polish, Czech, Romanian, Serbian, Greek, Croatian, French making the majority and that history can be seen in the architectural charm of the homes and buildings from the late 19th and early 20th centuries. The neighborhood continues to grow and become more culturally diverse. The neighborhood includes bowling alleys, three city parks - including an indoor ice arena, a nearby library, a nearby movie theater complex, and North Center Town Square. The North Center Chamber of Commerce hosts many free family and community events throughout the year. Northcenter Town Square is also
notes: Lupin, the grey kitty, much prefers guests to look rather than touch him. Which is fun, because he's always sporting seasonal clothing!

name: COMPACT, CENTRAL WEST LOOP ROOM WITH PARKING
summary: Centrally located private room with FREE PARKING. You will have your own door code and may arrive at ANY time you would like starting 3 p.m. and as late as you wish, no-hassle check-in guaranteed. I provide FREE PARKING. I allow LUGGAGE DROP OFF! You can store your luggage in the closet before check-in and after check-out times, you can drop it off and pick it up as early and as late as you would like.  The neighborhood is extremely safe even at night :)
space: Restaurants and bars are right round the corner, both upscale and casual. This room is 6 minutes away by car or uber to Chicago's famous Willis (Sears) tower. Uber costs about $7. If you are arriving by car, I am providing free resident parking passes for anywhere in the area. (Yes, that means you can drive a few blocks and still park anywhere you want!) The room will be ONLY yours for the time you'll stay in my Windy City. transit: "UIC Halsted" blue line is the closest blue line train (metro) station, only 5 minutes away (walking).  Downtown/Loop: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and get off at "LaSalle, Jackson, or Monroe," depending on where you are going :) FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC Halsted" About 5 minutes to downtown. O'Hare Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare. O'Hare is the final stop. FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC Halsted." About 40 minutes to O’Hare. Midway Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and transfer to orange line at "Clark/Lake," then take orange line to towards Midway airport. Midway is the final stop! FROM - take orange line towards Adams/Wabash; then, transfer to blue line at "Clark/Lake." Take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC Halsted." About 45 minutes to Midway. Union Station/Amtrak: Only 20 minutes away (walking), taxi or uber will take you to the apartment in less than 5 minutes for about
access: You will have access to the following: > Free WiFi, central air conditioning & heating. > Private room includes: single-sized bed, night stand, fresh bed linens, fresh towels, closet with hangers, iron & ironing board, hair dryer, lock on the door with a key. > Kitchen includes: refrigerator, table, microwave, stove, fridge, dishes, and pots. > Living room includes: Sofas, chairs, coffee tables. > Bathroom includes: bathtub/shower, shampoo, conditioner, body wash, hand soap, toilet paper > Closet to store your baggage before your check-in and after your check-out
host_about:
Hello! My name is Marina, and I would like to welcome you to Chicago. I host with my sister, and we are originally from Saint Petersburg, Russia, but we spent our teenage years in Aix-en-Provence, France and therefore speak English, Russian and French fluently :) I work as an auditor downtown.  

Hotels can get very expensive, so we do our best to help tourists out. I really hope to host you! :)

neighborhood_overview: Hyde Park, home to the prestigious University of Chicago and the Museum of Science and Industry, is a culturally rich neighborhood full of eclectic shops, restaurants, and small businesses. Enjoy a stroll in one of the area’s many parks—or explore Chicago by bike when you hop on the Lakefront Trail and cruise for miles.
notes: For the safety and comfort of all our guests, Zencity is following CDC guidance to ensure every guest has a clean place to stay. Some of the steps we are taking include (Website hidden by Airbnb)   (Website hidden by Airbnb) Thoroughly disinfecting each suite between stays including counter tops, door knobs, faucets, light switches, among other (Website hidden by Airbnb) Stocking-up on extra supplies such as soaps and cleaning products in case you need it (yes, including toilet paper (Website hidden by Airbnb) Minimizing in-person contact with our guests whenever possible by using smart tools like our digital check-in proces (Website hidden by Airbnb)   (Website hidden by Airbnb) We are not responsible for packages if they are unable to be delivered. If anything is not to your liking, please notify us, and we will correct the situation as soon as possible.
transit: Cab/Uber service is readily available in this location and is our preferred method of transportation downtown. The unit is close to the Metra that takes you directly to the Loop and is also near several major bus routes.
access: Access is available to the entire apartment.
interaction: We will be available throughout your stay to recommend local attractions, dining, nightlife, or any other concierge services that interest you.

Lost or misplaced keys will be charged at cost (up to $100) 6. We are not responsible for packages if they are unable to be delivered We look forward to hosting you!  If you are unable to abide by house rules, please consider another listing as we reserve the right to end your stay early for serious violations.  We take pride in our home and are excited to welcome you, but please respect the space and others who live in the building.
host_about: Modern travel means you deserve the most out of your stay – complete with amenities that matter to you. Zencity offers every guest convenient locations, kitchen essentials, and several great entertainment options for you to enjoy. All coupled with insider knowledge and access to the best the city has to offer.

summary: Your own bedroom/bathroom in Wrigleyville/Boystown upscale, modern, sparkling clean condo.  Parking is included at no extra cost.  Short walk to Wrigley Field, train to downtown, Lake Michigan, Vic Theater, Divvy Bikes and a bus stop right at the corner. Perfect location for your Chicago visit to obtain a true Chicago neighborhood feel.  The elevator opens right into the condo.  Views of Chicago skyline from balcony & rooftop deck.
space: Everything is up-to-date and modern.  Hardwood floors and quartz counter tops throughout the condo.  The elevator opens up into the unit on the fourth floor.  There is a view of downtown Chicago from the living room and an amazing 360 degree view of Chicago from the rooftop deck. Parking is included at no extra fee.

neighborhood_overview: East Lakeview is known for its colorful, lively & inviting atmosphere.  It includes some of Chicago's off-Loop theater, Wrigley Field (home of the Chicago Cubs), Boystown, specialty restaurants, trendy fashion outlets, wine boutiques, chain stores and independent ships,  greystone and brownstone walk-up buildings and other historic architecture.  My condo is in the center of it all... you will enjoy your stay and safe surroundings!
notes: This is a safe, solid, secure, brick, quiet building.  Please let me know if you have any questions.  Thank you.
transit: Only a five-minute walk to the red, brown and purple line trains that will take you all around Chicago.  There is a CTA bus stop at the corner of my block.  I will give you a free parking permit for street parking.  Public transportation and Uber/Lyft are the best way to get around Chicago.  When the weather is nice walking and bikes are a perfect way to explore the neighborhoods.
access: The condo is 1,800 sq. ft.  You'll have access to your private room, private bathroom, living room, balcony, kitchen and rooftop deck.
interaction: I will be available if you have any questions, need directions or recommendations for entertainment/dining options.  You'll have my phone number so you have access to me at anytime.
house_rules: Please be respectful as I will be respectful of you.  No smoking inside and no pets please.
host_about: Hello! I'm originally from Fairbanks, Alaska and lived in Anchorage, Alaska before moving to Chicago in 2011 where I own a spacious condo in East Lakeview.   I look forward to meeting you and helping you enjoy your Chicago experience.  I’m impeccably clean, friendly and responsible.  My goal is to make you feel right at home... in your home away from home.

neighborhood_overview: Located in West Loop, this furnished rental invites you to explore the edges of downtown Chicago. From endless dining and bar options to art galleries and stylish shops, West Loop has emerged with so much to offer daily. During weekends, residents savor trips to the Chicago French Market and the vibrant strip of Randolph Street. The latter is known as “Restaurant Row” and is lined with some of the city’s best eateries. Fulton Market, one of the hippest and fastest-growing neighborhoods, is ideal for dinner and drinks. Union Station is only a 5 to 10 minute walk away.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions (including certain Bull Terriers and any related breeds). Wild animals and hybrids, including wolf and coyote hybrids, snakes, ferrets, rabbits, are all prohibited. Please contact us for precise breed restrictions. Please note that a one-off non refundable fee ($500) and a monthly rent ($25/mo/pet) is applicable upon reservation. Failing to notify us of any pets prior to check-in will incur a penalty, and may result in denied check-in. host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

name: Queen Bed in Stylish Flat
summary: A private bedroom in a two bedroom apartment located in Chicago's Marshall Square/Pilsen/Douglas Park neighborhood.
space: The apartment was completely renovated during the past year and is located on the first floor of a three story century old vintage brick building, locally known as a three flat. Redone in the style of a "soft loft" the unit has 10 foot ceilings, spiral duct work, newly refinished hardwood maple floors and an exposed brick wall in the kitchen. This bedroom is one of two in the apartment and has a queen size bed and  a large walk in closet. The apartment is shared- at a maximum - with one other person. Each guest has their own bedroom. Each bedroom door has a keyed lock.
description: A private bedroom in a two bedroom apartment located in Chicago's Marshall Square/Pilsen/Douglas Park neighborhood. The apartment was completely renovated during the past year and is located on the first floor of a three story century old vintage brick building, locally known as a three flat. Redone in the style of a "soft loft" the unit has 10 foot ceilings, spiral duct work, newly refinished hardwood maple floors and an exposed brick wall in the kitchen. This bedroom is one of two in the apartment and has a queen size bed and  a large walk in closet. The apartment is shared- at a maximum - with one other person. Each guest has their own bedroom. Each bedroom door has a keyed lock. I am always available by text, email or phone. Marshall Square, adjacent to the better known Pilsen area, was settled and built largely by Czechs in the later part of the 19th  and early 20th century. Buildings are almost exclusively brick with attractive facades and are separated by narrow "gangways". Whil
neighborhood_overview: Marshall Square, adjacent to the better known Pilsen area, was settled and built largely by Czechs in the later part of the 19th  and early 20th century. Buildings are almost exclusively brick with attractive facades and are separated by narrow "gangways". While not one of Chicago's trendier areas, transportation links into the Loop are excellent, with a train station at the end of the block and less than a 20 minute ride to the Loop. The neighborhood is predominately Mexican now, with many excellent and inexpensive restaurants. Laguinitas Brewery and Pub is just a few blocks away as is Cinespace Movie Studio, where several network and cable tv shows are filmed.
notes: For medical students completing a clinical rotation: St. Anthony's Hospital is around the corner, Mt. Sinai Hospital is six blocks away, and the Illinois Medical District (Rush, University of Illinois, Stroger and Jesse Brown Hospitals) are just 4 stops away (8 minutes)   on the Pink line El .
transit: The apartment is located less than a block from the California Pink Line elevated stop which is 20 minutes from the Loop. There are two grocery stores, a Walmart, a Planet Fitness, three laundromats and many restaurants within a short walking distance from the building.
interaction: I am always available by text, email or phone.
host_about: I've always had a passion for travel and have been lucky enough to visit about 40 countries, most recently Vietnam, Cambodia and Taiwan. Closer to home, funky, big city neighborhoods are among my favorite places to explore.

name: 3 Bedroom Apartment in Historic Wicker Park Home
summary: This spacious 3-bedroom apartment is on the main level of a historic home just blocks away from popular restaurants, bars, shops and cafes.  The apartment features a full kitchen, dining room, private bathroom, and laundry.  Perfect for a group getaway!
space: Our spacious 3-bedroom apartment includes a full kitchen, dining room, private bathroom, washer/dryer and dish washer.  Enjoy staying in a premier neighborhood just blocks away from all the action!  We're also just minutes away from downtown, United Center and Wrigley Field.
description: This spacious 3-bedroom apartment is on the main level of a historic home just blocks away from popular restaurants, bars, shops and cafes.  The apartment features a full kitchen, dining room, private bathroom, and laundry.  Perfect for a group getaway! Our spacious 3-bedroom apartment includes a full kitchen, dining room, private bathroom, washer/dryer and dish washer.  Enjoy staying in a premier neighborhood just blocks away from all the action!  We're also just minutes away from downtown, United Center and Wrigley Field. This spacious apartment has a separate entrance and the whole apartment is private. We are a fully staffed Bed & Breakfast. Our office is open 7am - 9pm, Mon - Fri and 8am - 8pm, Sat & Sun. Wicker Park is a thriving community full of restaurants, bars, shops, and cafes along with beautiful historic and newly-remodeled homes on quiet tree-lined streets.  Just minutes away from downtown, guests can easily experience Chicago attractions or catch a game at Wrigley Field
neighborhood_overview: Wicker Park is a thriving community full of restaurants, bars, shops, and cafes along with beautiful historic and newly-remodeled homes on quiet tree-lined streets.  Just minutes away from downtown, guests can easily experience Chicago attractions or catch a game at Wrigley Field or a show at the United Center.  The apartment is centrally located and close to many popular spots in Chicago.  Come stay and live like a local!
notes: We offer secure parking and a full breakfast each morning at the B&B. Ask about adding these amenities to your reservation for an additional fee.
transit: We are blocks away from the nearest train station and a block from the Milwaukee Ave bus.  Both take you directly into downtown.  You can also rent a Divvy bike or electric scooter or request an Uber, Lyft or hail a cab.  A car is not needed to get around town.
access: This spacious apartment has a separate entrance and the whole apartment is private.
interaction: We are a fully staffed Bed & Breakfast. Our office is open 7am - 9pm, Mon - Fri and 8am - 8pm, Sat & Sun.
house_rules: Since we are in a residential area, we ask our guests to to respect our neighbors and other guests.  We kindly request that quiet hours be observed between the hours of 9:00pm and 6:00am.
host_about:
Thank you for your interest in the Wicker Park Inn!  We've enjoyed hosting many guests from all over the world, and we're always excited to share our wonderful city and neighborhood with new visitors.  We are honored to be considered a second home for many visiting family and friends in the neighborhood.

I've lived in the Wicker Park/Bucktown neighborhood over 15 years and have seen a lot of amazing changes.  There is always a new restaurant opening while old favorites just get better with time.

I grew up in Chicago and returned home in 1996 after earning an Urban Studies degree from Brown University.  I started running the Wicker Park Inn in 2004.  Over the years, we've updated and expanded the Wicker Park Inn which now includes four guestrooms and three apartments.  We are staffed with amazing innkeepers, Robin and Emily, and our impeccable cleaning staff.

We look forward to hosting your stay!

name: CLEAN BEAUTIFUL DOWNTOWN APARTMENT & FREE PARKING!
summary: Very clean, private, professionally designed room in the heart of Chicago with FREE PARKING & an early check-in (1 pm). You will have your own door code and may arrive as late as you wish, EASY self check-in guaranteed.  I allow LUGGAGE DROP OFF! You can store your luggage in the closet before check-in and after check-out times, you can drop it off and pick it up as early and as late as you would like.  The neighborhood is extremely safe even at night :)
space: Restaurants and bars are right round the corner, both upscale and casual. This room is 6 minutes away by car or uber to Chicago's famous Willis (Sears) tower. Uber costs about $7. If you are arriving by car, I am providing free resident parking passes for anywhere in the area. (Yes, that means you can drive a few blocks and still park anywhere you want!) The room will be ONLY yours for the time you'll stay in my Windy City.
