notes: I will also be providing a binder full of local recommendations to eat and go out, you will find the binder on the bed in your room.
transit: "UIC Halsted" is the closest blue line train (metro) station, only 5 minutes away (walking).  -Downtown/Loop: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and get off at "LaSalle, Jackson, or Monroe," depending on where you are going :) FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC Halsted." About 5 minutes to downtown. -O’Hare Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare. O'Hare is the final stop. FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC Halsted." About 40 minutes to O’Hare. -Midway Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and transfer to orange line at "Clark/Lake," then take orange line to towards Midway airport. Midway is the final stop! FROM - take orange line towards Adams/Wabash; then, transfer to blue line at "Clark/Lake." Take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC-Halsted." About 45 minutes to Midway. -Union Station/Amtrak: Only 20 minutes away (walking), taxi or uber will take you to the apartment in less than 5 minutes for about $6 :)
house_rules: Please read your check-in instructions carefully Please no overstaying past your checkout time
host_about:
Hello! My name is Natalia, and I would like to welcome you to Chicago. I host with my sister, Marina, and we are originally from Saint Petersburg, Russia, but we spent our teenage years in Aix-en-Provence, France and therefore speak English, Russian and French fluently :) I work as an investment banker in the loop. 

Hotels can get very expensive, so we do our best to help tourists out. I really hope to host you! :)

name: Convenient & Relaxing 2BR / 1 BA in Pilsen
summary: Welcome home! You will love my 2 bedroom, 1 bathroom condo that can host up to 4 guests. Located just west of McCormick Center, south of the Illinois Medical District and close to the Pink Line 'L' for quick access to downtown. Book now >>>
description: Welcome home! You will love my 2 bedroom, 1 bathroom condo that can host up to 4 guests. Located just west of McCormick Center, south of the Illinois Medical District and close to the Pink Line 'L' for quick access to downtown. Book now >>> You will have complete and private access to my condo. Lower West Side is a community area on the West Side of Chicago, Illinois, United States. It is three miles southwest of the Chicago Loop and its main neighborhood is Pilsen.  Culture thrives in Pilsen and invites you to explore the treasures that wait around every corner. Here bold murals have blossomed in the most unexpected places — on the fronts of homes, along railway overpasses, and wrapped around train platforms. The artful vibe continues within storefront galleries and studios, as well as in the colorful collections of the National Museum of Mexican Art, a highly-regarded cultural institution.

house_rules: - House Rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.   1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable.  2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee.  3.) host_about:
I was born in Russia and moved to the states when I was 10. I've lived and grew up in beautiful Western Michigan and lived in Chicago for the past 8 years. 

I am an avid traveler and have a short list of about 32 countries and counting! Some of my favorite travels include India- where I spent 4 months studying and traveling and South Africa (most recently!). 

I've hosted many visitors from all over the world and can recommend the hit list of must things to do: Sunset cocktails at the Signature room (96th floor) Burgers at Au Cheval (sneak a seat at the bar for two of ya) and of course the neighborhood fests happening every weekend during the summer in Chicago.

name: Luxurious Urban Oasis
summary: Please add us to your Wishlist. Great Logan Square location. Quiet street away from city noise but close enough to public transportation. 1 bedroom 1 bathroom with pullout couch apartment has a full kitchen, granite countertops, keyless entry, and shared front patio. 10+ Restaurants and Bars within a 5 minute walk. Easy access to O'Hare airport and the downtown Loop from the CTA Blue Line Train. Bikers/runners/walkers can be uninterrupted from street traffic on the  "606 Trail" 1 block away.
space: Great sunlight through slide open windows to see neighborhood views (blinds are provided). Quiet building in friendly neighborhood. Free street parking. Amazing location for public transportation. Easy access to 2 CTA Blue Line stops (California or Western). It’s a 15 min walk at 3 mph (0.7 of a mi) to California stop OR walk about 5 houses down to the corner and take the 73 Armitage  bus ride 10 min to Western Blue Line stop. Bus runs 7 days/week 4:38 am until 9:38 pm. Other notable stops on the 73 bus include shopping in Lincoln Park, visiting the free Lincoln Park Zoo, North Ave Beach (famously known for Castaways during the summer), and multiple bars/restaurants in Logan Square, Wicker Park, Bucktown, and Lincoln Park.

neighborhood_overview: About Logan Square Beautiful prominent park-like boulevards, new parks, and the Bloomingdale/606 Trail.  The Square is beautiful.  Two large boulevards, Logan Blvd. and Kedzie Blvd. run right through it and meet at Palmer Square, just blocks from the apartment, which is the large roundabout in the middle that marks "The Square" of Logan Square.
notes: Restaurants bars & clubs: One of the US’s best breweries right here Revolution Brewing, a great place to stop in for a drink any night of the week.  some of the hottest bars & clubs on the west side including slippery slope 2 level nightclub with frequent live music, The East room nightclub/Lounge cash only 2nd floor with exposed brick & dance floor frequent live music, Parson’s Chicken & Fish with its trendy interior & fabulous patio Scofflaw—a hip bar with beautiful fireplace, exposed brick, and reclaimed wood. Logan Bar & Grill microbrewed beers, sports bar and fantastic menu, the hip vegan Chicago Diner, Great pizza at the Boiler Room,  Get breakfast after a night out at Cozy Corner Diner—opens at 5am.  Hang out in great Cafes – Moustache Cafe & Bang Bang Cafe.  Just a few of our favorite neighborhood places.

summary: Want to hang with the locals in Chicago and be in foodie heaven? Here's where it's at in vibrant Humboldt Park. You’ll love my place it's immaculately kept,  beautifully decorated, and tons of natural light pours in. Minutes to the 606 trail that gives you direct access to the equally vibrant Logan Square corridor of hot spots.  Experience the best of both areas here.  Walk 1 block to CTA, short ride to Metra.  My place is good for couples with kids, solo adventurers, and business travelers.
space: This unit is located on the 2nd floor of an intimate 2 Unit Building. 1 garage parking space is included. Street parking is available with permit stickers, which I provide.

neighborhood_overview: Humboldt Park offers kayaking, paddle boating and beach. Weegee's Lounge is a popular bar just an 15 min walk from our home. Also a 20 minute walk to Rosa's Jazz and Blues Lounge which host some of the industry's hottest names. Don't miss dessert at Xurro - Churro Factory for made to order churros, ice cream and coffee just a 13 minute walk (to name a few places).
transit: Walkable to everything via the 606 trail which is about a 12-minute walk. If you are looking to venture a bit further into different neighborhoods or even downtown, we are just a 3 min walk to the North avenue bus (72) that will get you to Wicker Park and the Damen blue line stop. The North Ave bus takes you directly to the red line. If you take the North bus to the end, you will be dropped off at North Ave beach and the lake front.  If you are looking to head to some hot restaurants in Logan Square we are an 10 min walk to the Armitage bus (73). This bus will also take you directly to the Lincoln Park Zoo.  We have free street parking available on Wabansia. If you bring a car your options are endless and convenient.  Uber/Lyft is also a great option and very accessible.

APRIL - $2200  MAY - $2800 Heading to a baseball game or planning a fun-filled Windy City getaway? space: Just one short block from Wrigley Field, this charming 1-bedroom apartment is ideal of any visit to the Windy City, whether traveling on business or for a fun-filled vacation. The location is perfect for Cubs games (just a 3-minute walk!) and entertainment, with the Metro concert venue and the Music Box Theatre also a short walk away. But exploring Chicago is only part of the fun, because our sunny apartment is also sure to be a highlight of your time in town. neighborhood_overview: If a Chicago Cubs game at Wrigley Field is on your bucket list, this neighborhood is ideal. Our place is just one block from Wrigley Field, so you can skip the crowded metro or overpriced Uber and get to the game in mere minutes. But Wrigley isn’t the only highlight of our charming, residential neighborhood. Dozens of local restaurants, shops, entertainment venues, and parks - plus easy access to public transit - make it a great home base for any Chicago adventure. You’ll find all the essentials within close walking distance, including grocery stores like Whole Foods Market and Jewel-Osco, a CVS Pharmacy and a Walgreens, Orangetheory and Quads Gym, and a Bank of America and a Chase Bank. You’ll also never be hungry here since there are a plethora of mouthwatering restaurants within blocks. Some of our favorites include Coalfire (thin-crust pizza), Tango Sur (Argentinian steakhouse), Earth's Kitchen (Japanese), Cozy Noodles n' Rice (Thai noodles and curries). If you’re searching for a r
notes: -There are many units inside this building. -All guests need to be attentive to the house rules during their stay, as there are other tenants at the property. -Bath towels are provided per number of guest not per number of stay -Washcloths are not provided during your stay. You may send me a message though if you need them and I'll try my best to accommodate your request. -We have duvet covers on our bedding (no top sheets). -Security Deposit maybe required on the following bookings: 1) Last minute bookings 2) Short weekend stays 3) Large groups  4) Guests with no reviews 5) Guests with incomplete profile 6) Instant Bookings  7) Some properties may not allow locals for short term reservations. -Please be aware that if you lose the key and/or entry fob which is your access to the unit, it cannot be replaced for you immediately and you may lose access to the apartment and all amenities until another one can be made. There is a $200 fee for lost keys. -If there's an issue during your stay
transit: Unless you’re really into overpriced meters or parallel parking, we recommend using public transportation to explore the Chicago area. Our place is just a 7-minute walk to Sheridan Station, where you can catch the Red Line. The Red Line runs straight into Downtown Chicago, and it turns into the Purple Line heading north to Loyola and Evanston. For the Magnificent Mile, get off at Chicago Station (13-minute ride from Sheridan), or continue on to Lake Station or Monroe Station (20-minute ride from Sheridan) for highlights like Grant Park, the Bean, and the Art Institute of Chicago.
access: No need to be shy about making yourself at home in this swanky Chi-Town apartment; our place is yours and only yours during your stay. We do ask that you respect our neighbors by keeping noise to a reasonable level.
interaction: We’re all about giving you plenty of privacy and personal space, so we’ll be available by phone (call or text) during your stay.

We are a young couple, both seniors at DePaul University and we love traveling around the world.

We very much enjoy meeting new people and making friends as we travel and love helping guests get the most out of their stay as we have been on our own travels.

Our apartments are very special homes that offer comfort and convenient locations. 

We hope to welcome you here!

name: Magnificent Mile!! Downtown Chicago views!!
summary: If you’re looking for a nice place to stay in Chicago, look no further! My beautiful apartment sits on Chicago’s famous magnificent mile and is the perfect option for any vacation or business needs. This 2 bedroom apt comes with a fully stocked kitchen, modern appliances, and TVs in each room. I guarantee you will not find a nicer place to stay downtown, so book with me today! name: Lincoln Park Comfort Suite
summary: You'll love this private floor which offers a large bedroom, full bath and spacious family room with screen TV and sofa bed.  Our home is located just north of Chicago's city center with easy access to Lake Michigan, the Lincoln Park Zoo and public transportation.  The space is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and families (with kids).  The space is located within a three level condominium and has a common entrance.
space: In addition to a private floor, guest are provided with the Internet, a screen TV stocked with a full menu of Direct TV channels and a mini fridge.
description: You'll love this private floor which offers a large bedroom, full bath and spacious family room with screen TV and sofa bed.  Our home is located just north of Chicago's city center with easy access to Lake Michigan, the Lincoln Park Zoo and public transportation.  The space is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and families (with kids).  The space is located within a three level condominium and has a common entrance. In addition to a private floor, guest are provided with the Internet, a screen TV stocked with a full menu of Direct TV channels and a mini fridge. Your reservation will provide you with exclusive access to the garden floor which includes a master bedroom, full bath and family room (with sofa bed).  If needed, you will also have access to the first floor kitchen. I, Malia and my daughter Avery will be here to check you in and out (when possible) and answer any questions you may have about the space or Chicago.  Please let us know the level of autonomy

notes: Locking the door: Please only use the blue key (from the lock box)  to lock the top bolt as we don't have a key for the handle lock.
transit: Chicago’s CTA Train or “El”: To access, walk north (or left out front door) one block to Diversey.  Turn left on Diversey and walk five blocks west to the train entrance.  The Diversey station offers access to both the Brown and Purple lines. Chicago’s CTA Bus Line: Can be accessed one block east of our home on Clark Street (22 Line) and two blocks west of our home on Halsted (8 Line)
access: Your reservation will provide you with exclusive access to the garden floor which includes a master bedroom, full bath and family room (with sofa bed).  If needed, you will also have access to the first floor kitchen.

house_rules: We ask that guests remove their shoes at the front door as the walkway has berries that are easily transferred to the carpeting.  This observance is greatly appreciated.
host_about: My name is Malia Huff.  I am a Chicago native and fundraising professional who loves meeting new people.  Other than volunteerism, my passions include motherhood, triathlons, baking and spending time with friends and family.  We welcome the opportunity to host you and share our knowledge of the city to maximize your Chicago visit.

name: 2 Bedrooms + Free Parking = Best Chicago Stay Ever
summary: It's been a long day of work, touring or who knows what, and all you want to do is sink into a cozy bed in a clean room. Plus it'd be great if it was filled with anything and everything you may have accidentally left behind. Major plus if it's minutes away from grocery stores (yes! Jewel, Target, Best Buy), restaurants, synagogues, parks and even across the street from public transpo (CTA 93). What about awesome water pressure? Check. Family room to lounge and relax? Check. Fridge? Check.
space: What could be missing you ask? Well...a TV. But, that's where our Wifi password comes in handy so you can access whatever your heart desires from your personal device.

summary: Official Airbnb Superhost.  Our luxurious One Bedroom/One Bathroom with Balcony apartment includes fully equipped gourmet kitchen, washer/dryer in unit, balcony with grill, and fitness center. We offer free WiFi and DirectTv cable.
space: Apartment includes master bedroom with king size bed, living room with pull-out couch, and one full bathroom.  Garage parking available for $20/night + tax.
description: Official Airbnb Superhost.  Our luxurious One Bedroom/One Bathroom with Balcony apartment includes fully equipped gourmet kitchen, washer/dryer in unit, balcony with grill, and fitness center. We offer free WiFi and DirectTv cable. Apartment includes master bedroom with king size bed, living room with pull-out couch, and one full bathroom.  Garage parking available for $20/night + tax. Guest can enjoy Club Room, Library, and Fitness Center at their leisure. Balcony with Grill, Washer/Dryer in unit, DirecTv Cable, WiFi. 24 Hour Front Desk. We are located at the border of the Andersonville, Uptown, and Wrigleyville neighborhoods. We are an easy walk from countless restaurants, shops, bars and other attractions - including The Green Mill, Riviera Theater, and Aragon Ballroom. Walking distance to Red Line and Metra stations. Clark 22 Bus at our door step. Garage parking available. Afternoon Tea offered by Vanille Patisserie.  Contact us for details.

transit: Free street parking. Blue Line CTA approx. 1 mile at Damen or Western, bus routes on Western Ave. Bike rentals are blocks away on Division & Western via DIVY! Catch World Series champs Cubs host games at Wrigley Field, catch the Bulls, pay your respects to Michael Jordan, Blackhawks, or a see a live concert at United Center, watch Da Bears and hope for a Mike Ditka sighting at the historic Soldier Field on the Museum Campus, or catch a game in the south side where the White Sox host at Guaranteed Rate Field, and more!
house_rules: -SHOES OFF AT THE DOOR!!!!! Check-in anytime after 3pm. -As an environmentally friendly home, please limit plastic bottle and bag use. We have a reverse osmosis water filter system, bring your reusable bottle! -Please use the drink coaster on your nightstand (Shared Beds). -Lock the doors at all times! Hold door shut and press the “Schlage” button to lock door from outside. Hold door until the motor sound is finished. -No smoking inside. Smoking is allowed outside in the backyard. Do not throw butts on the ground, discard properly in the garbage outside.  -Quiet hours indoors from 11pm-9am, be respectful of other guests in the house. We’re all about helping you look (and smell) your best, so we provide shampoo, conditioner, and body wash in addition to hand soap and fluffy towels. Trust us when we say there’s no better way to warm up after a Windy City walk than a hot shower! There’s ample space for guests to relax on the sofa and watch on a large flat-screen TV. Like the rest of the unit, you’ll live it up in luxury among hardwood floors and contemporary decor. The entire place has free, fast WiFi and Chicago sunshine streaming in through the windows. neighborhood_overview: Logan Square is one of the city's vibrant neighborhoods, balancing family-friendly activities and a thriving community of Chicago's aspiring artists, musicians independent spirited folks. The vintage charm of Logan Theater hosts the annual Chicago Underground Film Festival for those cinephiles. It is also the home of the historical Illinois Centennial Memorial that commemorates Illinois statehood designed by the same architect who created the Lincoln Memorial in Washington DC.restored arcade machines. Make your afternoon stroll or even a bike tour at Humboldt Park and Logan Square , as the community is graced with tree line boulevard and parks. After the strolling, satisfy your taste buds in Logan Square's top dining destinations. A ""must try"" is a visit to Dos Urban Cantina, Diana Dávila's authentic Mexican fare at Mi Tocaya Antojería to Abe Conlon's Macanese-influenced menu at Fat Rice and make that reservation ASAP at GIANT, Nightwood chef Jason Vincent's Logan Square restaurant.
notes: -There are many units inside this building. -Please be aware If you lose the key and entry fob, which is your access to the entire building, it cannot be replaced for you immediately and you may lose access to the apartment unit and all amenities until another one can be made. There is a $300 fee for losing key and entry fob. -All guests need to be attentive to the house rules during their stay, as they are other tenants at the property. -Neighbors have called and will call the police for any guests who do any illegal activities, including smoking Marijuana on the premise. -Any guests caught smoking inside the unit will have their reservation canceled as well as be fined $200 for damages for cleaning and restoring the unit. -We have STRICT rules against noise, music, and/or partying and have canceled reservations due to complaints in the past.
transit: You can use Uber / Lyft to travel around the city.
access: No need to be shy about making yourself at home in this apartment; our place is yours and only yours during your stay. We do ask that you respect our neighbors by keeping noise to a reasonable level.
interaction: We’re all about giving you plenty of privacy and personal space, so we’ll be available by phone (call or text) during your stay.
house_rules: HOUSE RULES Please review and adhere to the following to avoid penalties and/or cancellation of booking: -No Drugs; Do not engage in any ILLEGAL activities anywhere on the property; ONLY guests included on the reservation are permitted on the premises. Fines will be issued for breaking these rules (Fine $100-$250). -If you break or damage something, please let me know and arrange for its replacement or repair. - The cleaning fee outlined in the profile is included to clean the place after your stay, however, if you leave the place excessively dirty, we may charge up to $100 additionally for the extra work incurred. -Quiet hours must be observed between 10pm-8am. -Lost key fee - $300 -Unsalvageable stained linens - $15/pc. -Unsalvageable stained towels - $10/pc. -Smoking - $300 -Unauthorized bringing of pets - $300 **-No pets, except dogs & cats. If you have a dog or a cat, an extra $50 pet cleaning fee will be added to your reservation.
host_about:
My name is Joan and I love to meet people and travel the world. During my free time, I spend it taking photos and writing blogs or eating out with the best restaurants in the area.

I am also fond of interior designing that is why I make the best of each apartment to make it beautiful and give the best experience to my guests.

I love Chicago and all the city has to offer. Can't wait to share the experience with you! Hoping you will make good memories during your stay in our beautiful apartment.

neighborhood_overview: A century ago, Chicago had a robust Swedish population whose epicenter was Andersonville. the Swedish influence remains, dotting the stroll-friendly commercial areas with Swedish businesses and restaurants. Lakefront community Edgewater is a liberal, pretty paradise and features Chicago's gay beach at Hollywood. Chicago's largest park, Lincoln Park, stretches south from Edgewater for seven miles along the waterfront, almost to downtown.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is situated in the most dynamic and convenient place to live in Chicago, The Loop. With its endless shopping, fine dining, stunning park, river and lake views, and entertainment opportunities, everything is possible at a moment’s notice. The area is a cultural getaway for professionals and students, who can combine work with pleasure. Discover landmark buildings like the Willis Tower and The Art Institute of Chicago. Millenium Park, near Lake Michigan, is always worth a visit. The Loop is within reach of accessible transportation, offering non-stop public transit, buses, and taxis. Union Station is approximately a 10 minute train ride.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions (including certain Bull Terriers and any related breeds). Wild animals and hybrids, including wolf and coyote hybrids, snakes, ferrets, rabbits, are all prohibited. Please contact us for precise breed restrictions. Please note that a one-off non refundable fee ($500) and a monthly rent ($25/mo/pet) is applicable upon reservation. Failing to notify us of any pets prior to check-in will incur a penalty, and may result in denied check-in. Supporting documents (ie. vaccinations) may be required - Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a $300 monthly fe
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

summary: Live like a local, live with a local. This is my beautiful, colorful, charming abode.  Irving Park is a quiet city neighborhood that offers large walkways lined with big trees with new eateries popping up. You'll be staying with me, a pretty laid back individual that likes to cook and chill out at home.  Chicago is a BIG city and the neighborhoods are its gems. This place is central to trendy areas Logan Square, Lincoln Square and Wrigleyville just a 15-20min bus ride away, Downtown 45min.
space: Twin size bed. Cozy reading chair by the window. 24" monitor w/ speakers - plug in your laptop or phone for a movie or music. Tree eye view, so the unit requires you to take a few flight of stairs.  (Heavy luggage warning)

neighborhood_overview: Irving Park is a residential neighborhood set with large trees and very narrow streets. It is located conveniently by the 90/94 expressway. Easy driving to/from the city and suburbs.  Street parking is available, but will get increasingly difficult to find a nearby spot after 8pm. Meters are free 10pm-8am and Sundays.
notes: I prefers to keep my home clean and orderly. Hopefully, you will find it a tranquil and calming place to rest from all your travels. Please have a completed and verified profile ready along with an an intro in your booking request.
transit: Public Transit: Get a Ventra card and ride CTA buses/trains for under $2.50 to get anywhere in the city.  Outbound from O'Hare airport blue line station is $5. Time to downtown from my place: 45 minutes - 1 hour. Nearest bus stops are 2-5 min walk. Commuter Rail: Metra Pacific Northwest Line (Irving Park). My Uber code: kqaz8 (Free Ride for new users)
access: Just ask first.
interaction: Hi I'm Jackie and I'm a born and raised Chicagoan so I know my way around the city. Feel free to join me in coffee or wine and share with me your travel plans and stories!
house_rules: No outside shoes in the condo.  It's not needed, but my personal travel tip is flip-flops!! Cheap, lite, pack flat and keeps your foot clean.  Clean up after yourself like shower drain, bathroom sink by properly removing and disposing debris in to trash can (not drain).  Please do not bring unregistered guests. Quiet hours after 9:30pm on weekdays - my work day starts at 6am, please be respectful of the hours the night before. I'm mostly likely in bed around 10pm, so I ask my guests to be mindful when booking. Thanks for reading and with your cooperation, I make a good effort as the homeowner to make it comfortable so we both can share a positive and peaceful experience.
host_about:
Food enthusiast: Street food to Michelin 3, if food falls into the delicious, unique or interesting category, I will give it a go.

Avid traveler: I've been all over the US (45 states) and world (+30 countries). I am a Airbnb user as both host and guest.  I enjoy meeting folks from all parts of the world, whether they come to my place or I stay at their's. The comforts of home and friends is something I seek wherever I go. 

My day job is working in automotive infotainment - translation, I make all the fun stuff in the car that works with a phone.

name: Your Peaceful Getaway: Top Floor 1-BR
summary: You’ll love this peaceful 1-bedroom apartment, complete with living room, dining room, kitchen, bedroom, and bathroom. Feel right at home on lovely tree-lined residential block. Very close to public transit, stores/restaurants, and Hollywood beach! Only 7 stops / 12 min to Wrigley on the red line, which is a 3 min walk from the apartment. **To read more, EXPAND the below section**

neighborhood_overview: This multi-unit building is right near the lake, with easy access to Hollywood Beach and the lakefront trail & parks for running/biking. Restaurants of all cuisines, lively bars, and unique stores abound in the Edgewater neighborhood. Only 10-min walk to Andersonville neighborhood with more cute stores and restaurants.
notes: CHECK-IN Check-in is at 4pm or later. You will be sent detailed entry info for self check-in.  Luggage storage may be available from 10:30am-4pm if arranged in advance. PARKING Please note that the free parking is street parking, so you will need to look for a spot once you arrive. The free street parking is first-come, first-served and distance from unit cannot be guaranteed.   STAIRS Please note this is a 3rd floor unit, and this building does NOT have an elevator. COURTESY Please note this unit is on a quiet residential street. We respect our neighbors and keep quiet hours from 10pm-8am. Therefore, if your group is looking for more of a party environment, please allow us  to recommend another unit that would be better suited for that noise level. CHECK-OUT  Check-out is by 10am.  If you check out late or do not follow the check-out steps, you may be charged an additional cleaning fee. Luggage storage may be available from 10am-3pm if arranged in advance. - Dirty linens can be left a
transit: lf you have a car, there is free street parking in the area (no permit required). Public transportation is an easy and convenient way to get around the city. It's .2 mi to the Thorndale red-line stop. In addition, there are multiple bus options, including the 146 express bus and 151. I am happy to provide additional detail about our public transit system, as well as directions. The bus is $2/person, while the train is $2.25/person; there are also unlimited 3-day passes for $21 and 7-day passes for $28.
access: KEYS We will provide 2 sets of keys for your stay. In case keys are lost, there is a $15 replacement fee.  HEAT/AC The unit has central heat plus window AC in the living room and bedroom. WASHER/DRYER Coin-operated washers and dryers are located in the building’s basement and shared with other apartments. Detergent is available in the kitchen for your use. CRIB Pack-and-play crib may be rented for $5/day with 2+ day advance arrangements. Please mention this during booking, and it will be inside unit waiting for you. Note that you must supply your own sheets and blankets for the crib.
interaction: Our team is available to answer your questions and make your stay pleasant. We are just a phone call away.
house_rules: - - REQUESTS:  1) Please treat the home with respect.   2) Please be courteous of others in building and neighbors. All socializing must be kept indoors after 9pm, and we request quiet time indoors from 9pm-8am.   3) The only guests allowed in the building are those on the reservation.   4) $500 fine for smoking inside the apt.  CHECK IN/OUT: Standard check-in time is 4pm (or later). Standard check-out time is by 10am. If unit is not vacated by check-out time or notes are not followed, additional cleaning charges may apply.
host_about:
I began using Airbnb as a traveler in the fall of 2013, and I'm hooked! Staying in someone's home allows you to experience the area in a truly authentic way - no more hotels for me! As of May 2014, I began hosting in Chicago and have since hosted thousands of guests from around the world. I love helping others make the most of their visits. 

As a host, I am personable, responsive, and detail-oriented. I take great pride in the comfort and cleanliness of each apartment. You can trust that when staying in any one of our properties, you will feel at home.

name: Charming Top Floor Apt - 20 minutes to Downtown!
summary: Our modern apartment is in the heart of Humboldt Park, and has all the comforts of home on a quiet parkside street. It's within walking distance to the Wicker Park & Logan Square neighborhoods - minutes away from iconic Chicago nightlife! - and 20 mins by car/taxi from the Loop. Plus, right around the corner from the historic park and all it has to offer - book today!
space: You'll walk into a gated yard, and then into a shared foyer. Once you walk up the stairs and to our unit, you'll be in a spacious, open living room / dining room / kitchen that overlooks the street. Off the living room is the bedroom with a Queen-sized bed. At the rear of the apartment is the bathroom with a dual-vanity sink, and shower/tub.

It's within walking distance to the Wicker Park & Logan Square neighborhoods - minutes away from iconic Chicago nightlife! - and 20 mins by car/taxi from the Loop. Plus, right around the corner from the historic park and all it has to offer - book today! You'll walk into a gated yard, and then into a shared foyer. Once you walk up the stairs and to our unit, you'll be in a spacious, open living room / dining room / kitchen that overlooks the street. Off the living room is the bedroom with a Queen-sized bed. At the rear of the apartment is the bathroom with a dual-vanity sink, and shower/tub. Built around one of Chicago's best parks, Humboldt Park is home to great bars, restaurants, shops and more. Known for its large Puerto Rican population and the lovely green space from which its name is derived, Humboldt Park is a West Side neighborhood with no shortage of attractions
neighborhood_overview: Built around one of Chicago's best parks, Humboldt Park is home to great bars, restaurants, shops and more. Known for its large Puerto Rican population and the lovely green space from which its name is derived, Humboldt Park is a West Side neighborhood with no shortage of attractions - including streets that are decorated in vibrant murals and air that smells of carne guisada.
transit: The Damen Blue Line stop is about a mile and a half east - easily accessible on the 72/North Ave bus, which has a stop just a couple blocks north! The 82/Homan Ave bus is nearby too, so it's easy to get around here without a car. If you do bring a car, however, there's plenty of street parking in the neighborhood.
house_rules: House Rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.   1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable.  2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee.  3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance.  4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily.  5.) Pets are not allowed at the property.
host_about:
Hello, Thanks for your interest in my Airbnb.

My wife and I are both young professionals who recently moved to chicago because we love the city and everything it has to offer. We travel all the time, and are always on the road, so Airbnb was a good way for us to share our space with fellow travelers. I try to offer a space that has all the modern conveniences you would expect from a big chain hotel stay (i.e. toiletries, fresh linens, etc.) but with the look and feel of being at home. If you want to experience Chicago living this is the way to do it. My home is close to all the things Chicago locals enjoy, such as night life, music, festivals, and food. We hope you enjoy our space as much as we do.

name: Large 2BR2BA by Millenium Park & State St Shopping
summary: Spacious, beautifully furnished apt that is perfectly equipped for business & vacation trips. It is centrally located in one of Chicago’s famous historical landmarks steps away from Millennium Park, Theatre District, MagMile, State St shopping, Navy Pier as well as some great restaurants and dining areas. Visit Chicago Cultural Center, across the street, for an update on current city events. Discover CTA transportation conveniently located next to the building for Loop tours & airport rides.
space: Modern, large 2BR/ 2BA apartment with high ceilings that create airy and bright space. Apartment easily accommodates up to 10 guests at once and is an ideal for a large group of people whether it’s a family, colleagues or friends sharing the place. Open concept kitchen and living room make for perfect gathering spot. Each bedroom provides two queen size beds along with a sofa bed and a rollaway bed in the living room. Home office is also available and is essential for those who are on a business trip, so enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi working in the office spot equipped with the computer desk and a chair. This place is everything you are looking for- Location! Comfort! Cleanliness!  	- Discounted overnight parking 	- Fully equipped kitchenette 	- Hotel quality housekeeping  Master Bedroom: 2 queen size beds, 2 built in closets, beauty console with a mirror, office area (computer desk and chair), iron & ironing board, 4 pillows, 2 comforters Second Bedroom: 2 queen size beds, 2 built in closets

name: The Treehouse Apt in Logan Square
summary: Situated in Logan Square, this top floor apartment is easily accessible to the many great restaurants, bars and coffee shops in one of Chicago's hippest neighborhoods.  Located five minutes from the Blue Line, Fullerton and/or Milwaukee Bus.  Renamed The Treehouse, the space offers a cozy atmosphere located on the 2nd floor of our home. Whether you're a couple or solo adventurer or business traveler seeking to immerse yourself in the local flavor of the neighborhood, this is for you.
space: Renamed The Treehouse, the space offers a cozy atmosphere located on the 2nd floor of our home. We also have an outdoor patio which is available for you to enjoy during your visit. Whether you're a couple or solo adventurer or business traveler seeking to immerse yourself in the local flavor of the neighborhood, this is for you.

Guests will have the entire top floor apartment to themselves. We will be more than happy to help you find your way around the neighborhood and offer suggestions of our favorite pl
neighborhood_overview: Cheap eats and bike-friendly streets. Gourmet coffee, scruffy dive bars and artisanal cocktail lounges. Some may say it's a recipe for a hipster haven but there's a proud, working-class sensibility that keeps this Northwest Side neighborhood grounded. In Logan Square, the strong neighborly connection is evident all around, from active preservation groups to community gardens and a locally-run farmers market. "Local" being the key word when describing many aspects of the scene: ingredients are sourced locally at their buzz-worthy restaurants; corner taps tout local, craft brews; galleries showcase local artists; and concerts and street fests promote local, upstart bands. At the heart of this community is the actual "square" in Logan Square. It comes together at the intersection of Kedzie and Logan Boulevard, where a circle interchange meets with Milwaukee Avenue. The boulevards themselves are widened thoroughfares that are set apart by grassy, landscaped medians and tall, stately trees
transit: Walking distance to the convenience of the Blue Line El, Fullerton and Milwaukee bus. Or a quick Uber ride to local neighborhoods of Bucktown and Wicker Park.
access: Guests will have the entire top floor apartment to themselves.
interaction: We will be more than happy to help you find your way around the neighborhood and offer suggestions of our favorite places and activities, just ask! If not, we will leave you to enjoy and explore on your own.

summary: Charming, lovely two bedroom apartment on the first floor of a three story walkup is within 15 minute walking distance of two great neighborhoods, Andersonville and Lincoln Square, and across the street from Winnemac Park. The apartment is fully furnished and has a friendly resident cat, Abbies. The bedroom has a full-sized bed, dresser, walk-in closet, and attached sunroom. We have a deck, yard, and grill in the back! Get off the train at the Jefferson Park Transit Center. Take the 92 Foster bus to the Foster & Damen stop! This trip can take between 45-75 minutes. From Midway (MDW): At Midway take the Orange Line towards the Loop. Get off at Roosevelt to take the Red Line towards Howard and switch to the Brown Line at Fullerton or Belmont towards Kimball. neighborhood_overview: Come visit one of Chicago's most vibrant neighborhoods! Wicker Park has some of Chicago's best dining, nightlife, and shopping all in a compact and fun neighborhood. Feel safe and at home while exploring all that this fantastic neighborhood has to offer or use it as a jumping off point to explore some of Chicago's other great neighborhoods!  Downtown and Logan Square are both only a few stops away on the Blue line!
notes: While we love pets and are happy to hosts groups with pets we do charge an additional fee of $25 per night per pet, just like our people guests! Other things to note with regards to our non human guests... Please do consider our neighbors when bringing your furry friends, our space is not great for pets that bark or otherwise make noise when our guests are out and about.  We also recommend that guests bring crates when possible and crate their pets when they are out of the space as sometimes animals get nervous in new surroundings when their humans aren't around.
transit: Super close to the Damen avenue Blue line stop, plentiful ubers/lyfts/cabs and one of the most walkable neighborhoods in the city make this a fantastic place to call home base.

host_about: My name is Andrijana Borkovic. Together with my husband, we travel the world due to our work commitments. I am involved in sports, fashion, healthy life style and different aspects of business. Very passionate about trying new things in life and meeting new people.

description: This tiny home is shared with me. Anyone who comes to this cozy home feels at home :) Enjoy the close convenience of O’Hare, Blue Line CTA, Kennedy (I 90) Highway, convenience stores all around, plenty of places to eat, malls and so much more! Plenty of free parking Clean Home  Entry of coming in and out is open to whatever guests desire Kitchen Bathroom Living Room My availability is flexible. I enjoy being a host and love to brag about how beautiful and awesome Chicago is. I know the city pretty well, and can give plenty of ideas for guests to choose from doing in the Windy City. Oriole Park is around the corner (it’s huge, indoor and outdoor basketball court, outdoor tennis court, two different playgrounds for kids) Library around the corner  Plenty of places to eat are at walking distance  Rosemont is a 5-8 minute drive depending on traffic. This suburb is great for tourists looking for close fine dining, bars, bowling, concerts (Allstate Arena) etc.  Edison Park 5 minute drive has a couple of blocks full of delicious affordable diverse cuisine (Irish, French, Mexican, Italian, American and much more)
notes: There might be a dog(s) present sometimes. All friendly :)

name: SPACIOUS and VERY BRIGHT 2BDR LOFT near DOWNTOWN
summary: SPACIOUS 2 BDR (6ppl) apartment within 10 minutes of popular landmarks, UIC, Medical District, McCormick Place & Downtown Chicago! The apartment is fully furnished with all appliances and has hardwood floors with plenty of light!  No Smoking please!
space: My loft is very spacious and it has a lot of light! Hardwood floors, marble countertops, large windows make it very pleasant to be home! Laundry is inside the apartment - please put small-medium loads! All appliances are from Whirlpool! Dishwasher in the kitchen is convenient if you are hosting a dinner party! Garbage disposal is in front of the building across the street. The living room can get a bit noisy for some when train passes by - some guests that slept in the living room asked me to add this detail. I got used to it - it's not too bad if windows are closed.  Use the back of the building to enter the apartment! The bedrooms: One bedroom has a king size bed and one has a queen size bed. Both have closets and large windows. There is a queen size air mattress available for 2 additional guests. Each bedroom can easily accommodate 2 people, the two couches in the living room can be transformed in single beds. neighborhood_overview: I live in a very racially mixed neighborhood, that is VERY safe and very CLOSE to everything! Only 10 minutes driving from downtown (on Lake street, all the way to Michigan Avenue). Only 3 stops on the Green Line and 4 stops on the Blue Line from Downtown Chicago! A few minutes or less than 2 miles from Wicker Park, Humbolt Park and Bucktown or DOWNTOWN! A large healthy grocery store with lots of organic options, fresh squeezed juices, fruits and vegetables, hot bar, coffee bar and sitting area is two blocks away. (Pete's Supermarket)
notes: Please clean up after yourself and try to leave the house how you found it! Thank you!
transit: Parking on the street is ALWAYS available for ANY size cars! Blue, Green Line, Metra, Madison Bus
access: Please read the house manual regarding gate and building access. Code is given within the week of arrival.
interaction: I usually respond within minutes...but definitely within 3-4 hours max, if before 11pm!
house_rules: Have fun and enjoy Chicago! Here's a few things I ask you to politely respect: No shoes in the house please. No smoking inside the house. Please NO smoking even with the windows open. No pets please! If you bring a pet, there's an additional cleaning $100 fee. Contact me with any questions/issues!

name: 2 BDR DePaul Apartment - Parking Included
summary: Welcome to our first floor, 2 bedroom apartment located in the vibrant DePaul neighborhood! The apartment comfortably sleeps four guests and comes with one parking space in a shared garage. The location is within walking distance of the neighborhood restaurants, bars, and shops located on Ashland and Lincoln Avenues. The neighborhood is quieter and more residential and the apartment is a great option for small groups of friends and families visiting Chicago.
space: This 2 bedroom, 1 bathroom apartment is located on the first floor and it can accommodate up to six guests. Both bedrooms are similar and have queen beds and closets. The bathroom has a shower/tub and is located off of the hallway and is easy to access from anywhere is the apartment. The kitchen is a little older, but it is full stocked and has all of the essentials needed to prepare a meal at home. There is a kitchen table with seating for 4 and a washer/dryer in the kitchen as well. The family room is a great space for guests to spend time and it has plenty of furniture, a mounted smart TV, and a daybed with a trundle bed. Lastly, this apartment includes one parking space in a shared garage.

neighborhood_overview: Chicago's DePaul neighborhood is situated halfway between downtown and Wrigley Field. Chicago's Vic Theatre, which is a great place to catch a concert, is just a few stops away on the train! You can go just 15 minutes to the east and see Lincoln Park Conservatory and Zoo and North Ave beach.
notes: There is parking available for one car only. Please provide an accurate guest count prior to booking. Rates vary throughout the week and season and by number of guests. It's important that your guest count is accurate so we can be sure the home is adequately prepared and stocked for your stay.
transit: The closest L stop is the Diversey stop, which has access to the Purple and Brown trains. The station is 0.6 miles away from the apartment and it takes roughly 13 minutes to walk there. You can access the best Chicago has to offer on the L transit system and it is a very efficient way to travel around the city. The apartment has one parking space in a shared garage. There are plenty of Uber/Lyfts and taxis throughout the neighborhood as well.
access: Guests will have full access to the entire apartment and will receive detailed check-in instructions a few days before their arrival through the booking platforms app or email. Guests will have access to one parking space in the shared garage.
interaction: If you have any questions please contact via the app or platform!

name: Unique Lincoln Park Duplex Apt
summary: Unique apartment duplex in the heart of Lincoln Park on a quiet residential street; jus a few blocks away from Lincoln Park Zoo and DePaul University, walking distance to the lakefront and easily accessible public transportation.
space: Ideal for couples and business travelers seeking both short and long terms stays. A newly rehabbed private duplex apartment with small outdoor seating.  The living room features a comfortable sitting area adjoining a sit-in eating area by the kitchen. Staircase leads to the bedroom, floor-heated bathroom and closet. The bedroom features a queen size bed with deluxe bedding and high quality mattress. The kitchen is fully equipped for meal preparations.  Washer and dryer are inside the unit.  Please note there is a minimum stay of two nights over the weekend.

summary: Multi-level unit with private entrance, designed with comfort and style in mind, this designer Chicago Coach House is perfect for Artists, Musicians, Professionals and Families.
space: This space is newly renovated to suit an artist loft, and includes full kitchen, dining room, king size bed, 1 and half baths, in-unit washer + dryer, living room - equipped with 9ft projector perfect for movie night, screenings, or even play video games and if that wasn’t enough, there's also a music/ hang room upstairs where guests can jam on the guitar, play the keyboard, do some yoga, read or meditate. There's just one possible issue…We have 2 handsome cats that abide in the home as well but if you don’t mind cats then you’ve just found your airbnb!  **Bookings after March 15th- We also offer use of our private music recording studio for anyone interested.

neighborhood_overview: We are located in the West Belmont Area-Czech, Polish, and Italian with an Hispanic seasoning. Excellent transportation and local restaurants including the Cafe Prague and Forno Russo
notes: Residential street parking is free. Ours is a non-smoking pet-free home that allows both privacy and community.  Regrettably we cannot accommodate a wheelchair bound guest  Please contact me if you have an interest or any further questions or concerns.
transit: A full grocery store and multiple bakeries are 3 blocks from our home as is a Walgreen's pharmacy. Shabbona Park is also 3-blocks away with a fitness center, gym and indoor swimming pool We are 2 minutes from the 152 Bus on Addison and 15 minutes from the Blue Line (local train service) and 35 min from Downtown Chicago called the Loop. Additionally we are close to most Teaching Hospitals and Northeastern Illinois University..
access: Complete kitchen that accommodates all whether you are a  carnivore or vegetarian or temporarian.  WiFi throughout. Enjoy the living and dining rooms and if you play, the Baby Grand piano beckons.. interaction: I am a live-in host who has accommodated students and travelers from the all corners of the globe: England, Germany, France, Spain, Columbia, Guatemala, India, East Timor, Russia, China, New Zealand, Australia and South Africa. Your presence will enrich our home.  I respect privacy as well as lively conversation. The option is yours.
house_rules: We are a home of non-smokers.  Our housekeeper will enter your room to vacuum and empty waste-bins  You are responsible for your own personal property insurance.  Nothing is to be taped or nailed onto the walls.  Laundry Facilities are included at no cost on any day except Wednesday You have full use of the kitchen. A personal food storage area is provided. Return all food and dishes to the kitchen after use. We have a ‘no dishes in the sink’ attitude.  You have full use of the yard.  All guests are welcomed and are to be introduced  High-Speed WiFi is provided  Consideration and courtesy to others is anticipated.
host_about: Since I am in the creative industry, most of my 'guests' are in Chicago on temporary assignments from either New York or LA from the advertising or film industries. Additionally, I am known in the consular world, so guests come from Paris, Rome and London who are posted to Chicago for short periods of time.  Additionally, I develop sports programming for those with physical disabilities and  reach out to graduate students in the field who are also seeking short term housing. It is indeed a mix.

name: Distinctive 2 Bedroom Bucktown Loft
summary: **32+ night stays** My 2 bedroom Bucktown loft is in a converted warehouse, and its past life as an industrial space comes through - despite updated appliances and finishes - thanks to brick walls and timber framing. The two bedrooms are on opposite sides of the condo, which makes it ideal for all types of travelers, and my place is perfectly located whether you're trying to get a feel for the neighborhood before taking the plunge on moving nearby, or here for work in the Loop - book today!
space: The open living/kitchen/dining space separates the two queen sized bedrooms, and the entire condo features exposed duct work and brick walls. Windows overlook a lively Bucktown street and let in plenty of natural light.
description: **32+ night stays** My 2 bedroom Bucktown loft is in a converted warehouse, and its past life as an industrial space comes through - despite updated appliances and finishes - thanks to brick walls and timber framing. One of Chicago's creative epicenters lies just outside downtown Chicago in Wicker Park and Bucktown. These synonymous neighborhoods are famous for live music and nightlife, chef-driven restaurants and countless art galleries — ma
neighborhood_overview: One of Chicago's creative epicenters lies just outside downtown Chicago in Wicker Park and Bucktown. These synonymous neighborhoods are famous for live music and nightlife, chef-driven restaurants and countless art galleries — many housed within the Flat Iron Arts Building. If you have an acute knowledge of craft cocktails or an affinity for coffee, plus want to sift through records or thrifted threads, there's no better area to sip and shop in the country.
transit: We're just steps to the Damen and Fullerton buses, and a 15 minute walk to the Clybourn Metra station - you won't have any trouble getting around town without a car from here! If you do bring your car, however, there's plenty of street parking in the neighborhood.
access: You'll have full access to my 2 bedroom, 1 bath condo.
house_rules: - House Rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.   1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable.  2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee.  3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance.  4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily.  5.) Pets are not allowed at the property. 6.) Lockouts will result in a $150 fee per occurrence. Additionally, lost keys will incur a $50 per k
host_about:
I'm a Chicago native with a passion for travel, sports, and live music.

When I'm not finding new places to explore, I'm either riding my bike between breweries or onto the next seemingly endless supply of tasty restaurants all over the city.

Can't live without: Spotify and a strong cup of coffee.

name: The Evergreen House
summary: Relax and feel at home on the first floor apartment (completely private) of my Chicago 2-Flat.  This home away from home is well stocked with anything that you might need whether you are staying for 2 nights or 2 months.  There are 3 televisions with Wifi and Netflix throughout the apartment.  There is a nice backyard that you are welcome to use and garage parking is available for a fee or street parking is free.  Washer and Dryer available in the basement. The highways and bus are also nearby.
space: I work in interior styling and have enjoyed decorating a comfortable and stylish space for my guests to relax in after exploring the city, attending conferences or whatever brings you to Chicago. The name of my Airbnb "Evergreen House" is quite obvious when you step into the backyard.  I love Evergreens and I have planted them all around the property.  I also grow many varieties of Evergreens from Seedlings and they are about 2 years old I transplant them to a larger area where they will live.

neighborhood_overview: Portage Park is a very nice and quiet neighborhood with several parks and many restaurants scattered around and still convenient to access all areas of the city.
notes: Due to the Covid-19 pandemic I have altered my cleaning procedures to make sure to provide the cleanest space possible.   I am disinfecting every surface and every item in the Airbnb.  All bedding (linens, duvet inserts, pillow protective covers, pillow inserts and even the mattress pad) is removed and replaced with items that have been washed in hot water with bleach and detergent and dried on high heat.  All throw pillow covers, inserts and throw blankets are also laundered on the highest temperatures after each stay.  All dishes and utensils are washed in hot water with bleach water.  All fabric furniture pieces are sprayed with an upholstery disinfectant.  All door knobs, remotes, hangers, keys, light switches, cabinet pulls are all disinfected.  If you have any other concerns, please message me.
transit: The Addison bus is 3 blocks away and there is free street parking all around the area.
access: The Airbnb is a private dwelling inside my 2-unit building.  There are laundry machines in the basement that guests are allowed to use.  You are also welcome to use the backyard up until 10pm.

Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check out/lost key penalty  3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any entrance.  4.) name: Hotel Quality Meets Local Living King Room 3C
summary: Quaint & cozy rooms. Our Overnight Guest Rooms offer honest to goodness pillow top mattresses with 500 thread count linens. Comfortable and clean, additional features include: Private glass showers, comfy chair, custom woodworking and molding abound. Hardwood floors, oriental rug, natural light, modern décor/furnishings, CD player, high speed internet access, down comforters, thirsty towels, spa robes and slippers.
space: "Best in the City" - Chicago Magazine. Ruby Room Inn & Spa is one of Chicago's most unique overnight destinations. Just 8 minutes from downtown, in the heart of historic Wicker Park's restaurant, shopping and nightlife scene. Modeled in the European tradition, Ruby Room is neither a hotel nor a traditional B&B. Our concept is an urban inn. By design, we do not offer telephones or televisions. We do not offer 24 hour reception or bellman services. We make a practice of not entering your room during your stay, unless requested. Ruby Room is a historic property and does not offer an elevator. Please keep this in mind, if you or any of your guests have a challenge with mobility. What we do offer are outrageously comfortable pillow top mattresses with hi thread count linens, large marble & glass showers, commercial steam units in 4 our deluxe rooms, complimentary Malin + Goetz products, crown molding and fine woodworking throughout. Modern furniture peppered with antiques, community kitchen

name: Relax in a Custom, Creative, Artsy, Unique Apartment in West Town
summary: Relax in the hammock or have drinks with friends in the shared backyard surrounded by beautiful ivy, Japanese maples, and hastas. Afterwards, head inside to enjoy the warm heated floors and check out this home's amazing craftsmanship and artwork.
space: Fully furnished one bedroom with custom made built-in king size bed. Large kitchen, butcher block and claw foot tub in bathroom. Accommodates 4 people, two on king, one on couch and one on cot. Note couch and cot are together in living room. Shared backyard with beautiful ivy, Japanese maples, hastas and more  Beautiful Island in the kitchen, clawfoot tub and fantastic built in bed! Backyard, grill and smoker.
description: Relax in the hammock or have drinks with friends in the shared backyard surrounded by beautiful ivy, Japanese maples, and hastas. Afterwards, head inside to enjoy the warm heated floors and check out this home's amazing craftsmanship and artwork.
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in West Town—voted one of the 10 best neighborhoods in the United States. The area boasts a wide range of new restaurants and neighborhood favorites, along with cocktail bars and music venues.
notes: Free Street Parking Right Out Front!
transit: Metra, Cta {buses and trains} close by. Metra: Western & Hubbard CTA: 65 bus Chicago Ave: Oakley & Chicago {water tower, hanncock, navy pier & and tons of shopping} 66 bus Grand Ave: Oakley & Grand {downtown, navy pier & movie theatre} 49 bus Western Ave: north blue line & movie theatre
access: Keyless Entry. Come and go as you please. We will send personal keycode and instructions on how to access the apartment a week prior to check in date. Private entrance. Full access to backyard with grill and smoker! Feel free to lounge in the hammock under the pergola.
interaction: We love interacting with our guests. Feel free to come to the backyard and have a cocktail with us.
house_rules: Absolutely NO Smoking and NO candles in any of our apartments!!! CLEANING FEE The cleaning fee is for linens and switch outs, NOT to do your DISHES! That attracts bugs + rodents so you are responsible for leaving the house clean and respectful. If you leave the house dirty/filthy you will be charged an extra fee. HOUSE RULES No Smoking or candles in any of our apartments. Quiet after 11pm weeknights and 12am weekends. No broken or damaged items. Only use the front entrance to enter the house. Side gate to get to the backyard. DO NOT use center stairwell and side door to backyard. Other than that, we are very chill landlords.
host_about:
Mindy // College Professor. Currently teach Animation + Motion Graphics {after effects}, Computer Graphics, Creative Collaboration & Materials and Resources. My husband and I love art, fashion, music and food.

Tony // Carpenter + Artist for many years. I have rebuilt, remodeled and out lot's of love into the iKlektik House. Camping and biking is my thing.

notes: We don't have any pets, and unfortunately, we can't allow any pets in the house either... unless you have a ferret, then we can talk.

Travel time varies depending on time of day, but as of right now (9pm),  here are the times:  CAR/TAXI/UBER - 14 minutes PUBLIC TRANSIT (Blue line on the CTA) - 37 minutes WALKING - 1 hour 15 minutes  BIKING - 26 minutes    + FROM O'HARE INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT O'hare is about 18 miles from our house so walking and biking are a bit unrealistic, but we're very close to the blue line which connects to the airport so getting here is easy! name: Brand new stylish apt- with all the cozy comforts!
space: We have just finished a complete gut rehab on this gorgeous little spot. With its chic aesthetic, but still warm and inviting, its sure to be a crowd pleaser! Come check out this brand new beauty for yourself!
description: We have just finished a complete gut rehab on this gorgeous little spot. With its chic aesthetic, but still warm and inviting, its sure to be a crowd pleaser! Come check out this brand new beauty for yourself! The whole apt is all yours to enjoy- we have laundry available, although it is shared with the neighbors upstairs so we will need to give you access. Just reach out and let us know when you'd like to use the laundry facilities. We love for our guests to have complete autonomy in our apartment- but are fully reachable thru AirBnb messages or text! The leafy streets of Logan Square are lined with bungalows and regal greystone buildings. North Milwaukee ave is the main commercial strip and features cool restaurants, cocktail bars and craft beer taverns. There are also quirky coffee shops and delis, as well as art galleries and music venues.  We are also 3 blocks from one of the most beautiful parks in the city- Humboldt park. With miles of jogging/biking paths, 2 historic park build
neighborhood_overview: The leafy streets of Logan Square are lined with bungalows and regal greystone buildings. North Milwaukee ave is the main commercial strip and features cool restaurants, cocktail bars and craft beer taverns. There are also quirky coffee shops and delis, as well as art galleries and music venues.  We are also 3 blocks from one of the most beautiful parks in the city- Humboldt park. With miles of jogging/biking paths, 2 historic park buildings, a small beach, and 2 large lagoons- its a must see for anyone staying on this area! Dont forget to stop at one of the many food trucks to enjoy many authentic Puerto Rican dishes!
transit: Logan Square is so fun to explore- highly suggest walking to bars/restaurants along Armitage. Ride your Divvy bike along the 606 to explore some further neighborhoods. Armitage bus takes you right to the Blue line to downtown- you can buy hour Venture card or CTA weekend pass online. And Uber/Lyft always is a great option to get anywhere you need to go!
access: The whole apt is all yours to enjoy- we have laundry available, although it is shared with the neighbors upstairs so we will need to give you access. Just reach out and let us know when you'd like to use the laundry facilities.
interaction: We love for our guests to have complete autonomy in our apartment- but are fully reachable thru AirBnb messages or text!
house_rules: Upon your departure, please leave our space as you found it. -please load the dishwasher with any dirty dishes -please throw away any perishable food items -please strip used linens from beds and towels and leave by the back door to be laundered  -there is a large trash bin at the side of the garage for all of your garbage -please be aware of noise- especially 9pm-7am. There are neighbors living upstairs.

The second and third floor units both have four bedrooms and two baths.  Each unit is completely private and has it’s own entrance doors, kitchen, baths, washer and dryer, and HVAC. description: 12 min to downtown; Lovely, huge, squeaky clean, well-appointed, apartments. The Ridgeland offers 3 completely private units that can be rented in any combination with 5+ beds and 2 full baths, lux bedding & fully supplied kitchens & baths. For more cannabis experiences, visit thesparkclubs website. Read our reservation & smoking policy before booking. The Space Choose one or all of the sunny spacious and sparkling clean units we offer.  Close to (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) sf of space in each unit.  Our first floor unit has three bedrooms and two baths.  The second and third floor units both have four bedrooms and two baths.  Each unit is completely private and has it’s own entrance doors, kitchen, baths, washer and dryer, and HVAC.  Each unit has a porch for tobacco use.  The rear garage is full and not usable.  Each unit is decorated w
neighborhood_overview: The Ridgeland is located at 6729 S. Ridgeland Aveneue, Chicago, IL  60649.  The property is located on a quiet well-lit residential street half a block from The Jackson Park Golf Course.  Lake Michigan beaches and biking trails are 3 miles away.  2 miles to the north sits Hyde Park.   Hyde Park is like a little city within the big city.  It’s bustling with a diverse array of dining/entertainment options and it’s a great place for leisurely strolling.   All in all, the area is a beautiful mix of cool people. It's just the way the world should be. My family and I love living here!   The area is re-gentrifying.  Many Guests have commented on how warm and welcoming the neighbors are.  There is another vacation rental on the block and people are becoming quite used to seeing world travelers.   Always keep in mind, Chicago is an urban environment.  Please take the normal precautions you would in any big city.  Be mindful of your surroundings, stay alert, do not bring unwanted attention to yo
notes: Cannabis Consumption Policy The Spark Clubs promotes wellness through Cannabis.  Translation: NO TOBACCO, CIGARS, CIGARETTES, BLUNTS OR CIGAR WRAPPERS due to the chemicals and carcinogens they contain.   We will keep your security deposit to pay for cleanup is this rule is not adhered to.  In order to maintain optimal air quality, we have specific areas for consumption.  Simply slide open the window in the rear and turn on the extraction fan and all cannabis smoke will extract.  It doesn’t work with tobacco because of the chemicals contained in those products.  We can always tell if there is tobacco smoke.  When booking with us, you give us the right to determine if there was a smoking violation and authorizing us to keep the security deposit for the cleanup costs. Guests can smoke tobacco outside on the rear porch.  No smoking in bedrooms or building common areas. Vaping, dab rigs, bongs, hookahs as well as regular rolling papers, are fine. Reservations Please carefully read all reser
transit: Chicago is a very bicycle friendly town.  The city has one of the most expansive bicycle sharing networks in the country with over 5,800 bikes for rental at 580 locations spread throughout the city.  In Summer of 2019, the city granted licenses to private vendors to begin renting electric scooters.  The scooter program is not yet city wide, but availability is expanding fast.  DRIVING 15 min to Downtown via Chicago's iconic Lake Shore Drive.  Uber: $15  5 min to Hyde Park, University of Chicago, Lakefront, Parks & Beach. Uber:  $8-$10 10 min to McCormick Place Convention Center, White Sox Park & IIT.  Uber: $20 15 min to Downtown, Museum Campus, Navy Pier, Northwestern & Grant Park. Uber: $15 20 min to Chicago's trendy Northside or Lincoln Park Zoo.  Uber: $20 25 min to Wrigley Field. Uber: $24 30+ min to Evanston, Northwestern Main Campus. Uber: $33 PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION Public transportation is available, but it is not recommended at this location because local service is unreliable.
access: The entire condo is for your exclusive use and enjoyment.  Before Check-In you will be provided the lock box code to get the keys. There are NO cameras inside the guest unit. However, there are HD cameras that monitor/record the building common areas (e.g. stairways, exteriors).   We are on site regularly and have staff nearby in case of any issues and WE MONITOR THE PROPERTY. Early Check-In & Late Check-Out upgrades can be purchased based upon availability.
interaction: I love to meet and greet my guests and give them a personal tour of their unit. I also have a lockbox available if I'm NOT there to meet guests. There is also security nearby to assist if needed. house_rules: •	The booking guest must be Age 25 and older      •	Cannabis smoking is allowed indoors only in designated areas + only while 2 windows are open + our hi-speed ventilation system is activated.  No exceptions •	Tobacco/cigar/blunt smoking is only allowed outdoors. Violators may be fined $200 •	Your noise level must not disturb other tenants-especially during Quiet Hours •	The booking guest is responsible for the conduct of guests and any damage they might cause to our property •	No shoes should be worn inside the house  •	For complete details on the above, read our House Manual and Rules and sign and complete the Short Term Rental agreement document
host_about:
Hello, Travelers!  Welcome to your temporary home in Chicago!  We love our location near Hyde Park, the University of Chicago, the Lake and the Parks and just over 10 minutes to downtown Chicago via the Lake.  

Our family of four takes full advantage of the walking and bike trails in the area. We also frequent nearby Hyde Park, for its distinctive and unique offerings and to hopefully, run into a friend or two.

We still love road trips but, our favorite trips are with our extended family.  Recently, 20+ family members descended upon San Pedro, Belize and again in Costa Rica.  This year less exotic Washington, DC is on the list.

Because I have Lupus and Rheumatoid Arthritis I am an licensed Illinois Medical Cannabis patient.  I live a healthy lifestyle which includes living gluten-free and I encourage others to incorporate health into their lives.

The Spark Clubs is based on a wellness concept.   We do not allow tobacco because it is a known carcinogen and the chemicals affect the air quality of everyone in the building.  The smoke smell lays on the walls and soft goods, linens and curtains.  We have to spend extra money to clean that off when folks violate our rules. That is why we have a security deposit now to encourage good behavior.

When people use cannabis alone, there tends to be significantly less smell and it does not linger. With the ventilation methods we employ, any smoke can be quickly evacuated from the room.  As a result, our rooms stay fresh.  

As far as linens are concerned, we shopped for high-quality bedding to provide you with the best sleep experience you can find.  Our beds have toppers and pads and down comforters and feather pillows and percale sheets... all designed to make your sleep experience exceptional.  In order to maintain our investment in our linens, we ask that people refrain from smoking, eating or drinking in the bedrooms.  Each bed has around $420 in linens on it, this is why we ask for a deposit.  Typically the only damage we've had is smoke and linens.

The unit smells pleasant and you will sleep on high quality, freshly laundered linens.  

We all love to read and take books with us on vacation.  Sometimes we wing it, just start driving and book from the road with a last-minute hotel app.  Sometimes we plan a year in advance.

I'm a Super Host because I love hosting!  I am so into creating a great experience for people, I am looking forward to each and every guest.  I'm very friendly and talkative, however, I intend to disappear so guests can create their own memories.

One of my many mottos:  Eat dessert first.

name: Rock & Roll Vacation
summary: On the NW-side, just off Addison Ave (CUBBIES!), just west of I-94 and a few blocks from the Blue Line train from O'Hare Airport, Starbucks within walking distance, rock bar LIVE WIRE a stones throw, tons of other fun hangouts on Milwaukee Ave., from Wicker Park to Old Irving Park. IMHO, the NW side is the real Chicago. If you're looking to shop the miracle mile, this ain't your best fit. If you're looking to mix it up old school, in the city of true neighborhoods, you're in a good spot - Dave
space: It's better than most, for the price, continentally speaking ...you can.stay in style, rough it up, leave wrecked, but I got your back. From 3 years of pals and friends staying here, and three years of ABnBing myself about the US, I think my spot is a a pretty cool chill for couples looking to get f-awayfor a weekend, even with a third wheel in tow. Cheers, Dave

name: Cute and cozy one bedroom near trains and airport
summary: Experience the beautiful city of Chicago in a quiet, residential neighborhood with plenty of street parking! This adorable little garden apartment is perfect for 3 people. Comes stocked with coffee, towels, and WiFi!  We’re a 5 minute drive or 20 minute walk from the Jefferson Park Blue Line train which will have you downtown in around 30 minutes. We’re also a 15 minute drive from O’Hare airport. There are a few bars, restaurants, and a grocery store within walking distance.
space: Enjoy the city life with a private, cozy apartment complete with fully stocked kitchen. This apartment is a one bedroom garden apartment with a twin sofa bed in the living room.  There is also coin laundry included on the same floor of the building.

neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood is quiet and residential but it’s still the city! There’s a grocery store and bank on the next block over. There’s a pretty neighborhood park on the next block too where tons of kids play.  There are a few classic Irish pubs walking distance away as well as Mexican restaurants and a Tapas restaurant less than 5 minutes away!
transit: There’s plenty of parking in the neighborhood but we’re also a 5 minute bus ride away from one of the city’s busiest train stations.
