name: Halsted St Heart of Lincoln Park
summary: This 4 bedroom 3 bath units is located just steps from the Armitage shopping district in Lincoln Park.
space: Our updated Lincoln Park apartment features: 4 bedrooms and 3 baths Sleeping for 10 in real beds Premier location near shopping, dining and parks One appointed parking space Kitchen with full appliance package Modern, comfortable furnishings WiFi and cable Linens and amenities provided *Coin operated laundry for your use in the building* With deep history, lush green space and buzzing dining and nightlife scenes, Lincoln Park is a destination in and of itself. Offering vacationers a space that matches the vibrancy of this rich neighborhood is no easy task, but our 4BR/3BA apartment holds its own. From a cheeky living space where colors play off of modern artworks to sun-filled bedrooms where guests can look out at the trees from snug beds, there’s something special about every inch of our home. And, of course, high-quality appointments – like hardwood floors, comfortable seating and new furnishings – come standard. Our professionally cleaned rental is guaranteed to look and feel fresh

name: Luxurious Private King Room with Lake View
summary: Swanky Gold Coast digs in a historic Art Deco tower, an easy stroll to the shop-lined Michigan Avenue and Lake Michigan beachfront.  This private room with a King bed will include: Free WiFi  Flat-screen TV Nespresso coffeemaker Rainfall shower Bath amenities by ROIL and Natura Bisse 24/7 room service Please note that a $20 Urban Fee will be charged upon check-in and collected by the hotel.
space: Classic 120-year-old building with its original brick and terra cotta façade, and posh reimagined interiors which offer a nod to the past while remaining fully in the present. Restful rooms treat you to city or lake views. And Somerset, the onsite restaurant, has Michelin-starred Chef Lee Wolen at the helm. Don’t miss the year-round rooftop bar and seasonal pool overlooking Lake Michigan. The space offers: Devereaux rooftop bar  Somerset Restaurant Morning coffee/tea in lobby Afternoon refreshment beverage in lobby Seasonal rooftop pool Seasonal patio Fitness center House bikes House Tesla Model X Custom pet program

name: Lincoln Park Avant Artist's Private 1891 Apartment
summary: Find inspiration in the bright lounge area of this welcoming space with a guest room. Escape to this historical home with a porch, a front garden, a colorful interior, unique decor, a private en suite bathroom, and original architectural finishes.   There is not a full kitchen but a small refrigerator, coffee maker and microwave are tucked away in the space.  In the middle of bustling Lincoln Park but quiet and intimate on the inside.  The front porch is a wonderful perch to relax weather permitting. This is the perfect space for couples or solo travelers.
space: One of the oldest home in Chicago built in the 1800's tastefully updated with a minimalistic modern flair.  This is a 2 bedroom apt. in a 2 flat.  There is no kitchen.     -Ideal for couples or small families.   -Owner lives on site and is happy to address any needs or issues that might arise during your stay.   -Late night partying is discouraged as it is a 2 flat building. -Street parking is available.  Parking is by permit so fairly easy at most times.  I have permits if you want to park.
description: Find inspiration in the bright lounge area of this welcoming space with a guest room. Escape to this historical home with a porch, a front garden, a colorful interior, unique decor, a private en suite bathroom, and original architectural finishes.   There is not a full kitchen but a small refrigerator, coffee maker and microwave are tucked away in the space.  In the middle of bustling Lincoln Park but quiet and intimate on the inside.  The front porch is a wonderful perch to relax weather permitting. This is the perfect space for couples or solo travelers.
neighborhood_overview: Lincoln Park is an upscale neighborhood centrally located near many attractions. The house is close to the lake, the zoo, Wrigley Field, and DePaul University. It is also a short walk to many music venues including Lincoln Hall and Kingston Mines.
notes: The junior apartment is located on the second floor accessed by a flight of stairs.  There is no kitchen in the space but dozens of restaurants within a short walk.  Also there is a Trader Joe's grocery store and a Target within one block if you want snacks or need basic supplies.
transit: The home is centrally located to the "EL" / "CTA" train.  It is less than a 10 minute walk to the Diversey train stop. Also a 2 minute walk to the Clark or Halsted bus, these are main street buses in Chicago that can take you basically anywhere including downtown.  The "Divy" bike sharing network also has many stations in the area if you want to rent a bike to get around town.
access: The private junior artist apartment holds 2 bedrooms in the upper half of the house.   The master guest bedroom has a queen bed and the second room for an additional guest has a sofa day bed and lounging area for guests to read/hang out in.   This apartment has a complete private bathroom for guests. Another highlight is the private entrance for guests that leads up a flight of stairs to the actual space. The front porch weather permitting is a lovely place to relax.  It overlooks a wonderful garden and is the perfect spot to enjoy a glass of wine. The apartment is thoroughly cleaned after each guest using only nontoxic green cleaning supplies.  All sheets and towels are always cleaned with nontoxic detergents as well free of any synthetic chemicals and dyes.
interaction: I live in the other half of the house so am available when needed.  Feel free to socialize or keep to your half of the building. I am always up for giving recommendations for anything from our famous restaurant scene to recommending a cool spot to grab a drink
house_rules: The building is an owner occupied two flat ideal for couples,  singles or small families.  Sound does travel throughout the building so late night partying is not appreciated.
host_about:
Art gallery owner and entrepreneur living in Chicago.  My space is clean, minimal chic, and periodically changing with discoveries of new art and furniture which I love to showcase in my space.  

I live in Lincoln Park for all the attractions and amazing location.  Walk to clubs, restaurants, music venues, shopping, the lake, lincoln park and the zoo, wrigley and much more.  A safe and stable neighborhood full of amenities.  A few miles from the downtown, the loop, gold coast as well as bucktown and wicker park.

name: Spacious Condo Steps From Lake. 15 Mins To DT
summary: 1BD Condo steps from lakefront, beaches and metra train! Plenty of public transportation around and also free street parking. 15 minute drive to downtown and also an express bus to downtown. space: Whole unit is for use. Do not touch personal belongings!

house_rules: - Quiet hours are reasonable for residential neighborhood..  A high level of consideration for others is important.  - The additional “Guests after” pricing per night posted on the listing will be added onto all guest parties. - Heavy party-type folks are not a match for this property location as it is located in a fairly residential area.  - A garage space may be available at an additional nominal cost and requires a security deposit on the remote/s. Since we have neighbors who also have interest in our garage spaces for their out of town guests and since accommodations vary in length of stay, please specify if you have interest in securing a garage space. host_about:
I help manage a private duty in home healthcare “care providing” agency here in Chicagoland.  This is for folks who want some assistance and prefer not to reside in assisted living. 

I have experience in residential property management and I enjoy meeting people as I host with Airbnb.  In addition, I have some commercial property management experience with two major commercial real estate firms based in Chicago.  Along the way, while a graduate student, I managed a duplex in Utah and also completed a three month assignment in commercial leasing in Southern California.  

My spare time is spent with family & friends, at the gym and whenever possible with various hobbies.

name: Authentic Chicago Full Apartment in Bridgeport
summary: The garden floor of our house located in the heart of the historic Bridgeport neighborhood, just a 10 minute drive to downtown Chicago and the lakefront. I hope you'll love my place because of the great value, location and full privacy. We offer a comfortable bed, great shower, petite kitchen, dining and a front room to kick back and rest your feet between sightseeing downtown or just exploring our wonderful neighborhood! Sleeps max 4: Queen bed + single bed + couch (not pull-out)
space: Welcome to our home!!! Located in the historic Bridgeport neighborhood, our block is comprised mostly of families in a tightly knit community. We live on one of the oldest blocks in Chicago, from before the city was raised so what was the first floor is now a garden apartment, 1 foot below grade. We love Chicago and all this city has to offer. Although I have many recommendations, you can pretty much take the nearby L train just 1 stop downtown and have an amazing experience no matter what you do. There's also a bus at our corner that will take you directly to the L station or stay on to go directly downtown, it's slower but gets you there with less walking. Divvy bike rental stations are also close by if you want to bike to the L station or just explore the city by bike. Food/drinks/entertainment within walking distance: Maria's Packaged Goods: community bar featuring over 40 craft beers from breweries around Chicago: goose island, 2 Brothers, Marz, Hopwell, and more are distributed h
description: The garden floor of our house located in the heart of the historic Bridgeport neighborhood, just a 10 minute drive to downtown Chicago and the lakefront. I hope you'll love my place because of the great value, location and full privacy. We offer a comfortable bed, great shower, petite kitchen, dining and a front room to kick back and rest your feet between sightseeing downtown or just exploring our wonderful neighborhood! Sleeps max 4: Queen bed + single bed + couch (not pull-out) Welcome to our home!!! Located in the historic Bridgeport neighborhood, our block is comprised mostly of families in a tightly knit community. We live on one of the oldest blocks in Chicago, from before the city was raised so what was the first floor is now a garden apartment, 1 foot below grade. We love Chicago and all this city has to offer. Although I have many recommendations, you can pretty much take the nearby L train just 1 stop downtown and have an amazing experience no matter what you do. There's als
neighborhood_overview: We are strategically located near downtown Chicago while also offering an authentic neighborhood experience! Easy public transportation to anywhere in the city. Very close to downtown "Loop" (1.5 miles) Safe neighborhood with many local restaurants and bars to enjoy within walking distance.
notes: As of January 1, 2020, Chicago will legalize the use of Marijuana and our apartment will be 420 friendly. This area of Chicago is very safe and fine to walk around and explore at night. Bridgeport is one of the safest and oldest neighborhoods in the city. This is a Garden apartment- you take one step down (below grade) inside. Some people call it a basement apartment but it was the original first floor before the city raised the streets and it still gets great light. If you aren't used to walking, be ready to use Uber/Lyft. Some guests think we are very near the train while others think it is a bit of a walk but it depends on what you are used to as the train is literally 15 minutes away by foot. I do offer rides if I am around and even pick up a lot of my guests from the train or nearby Megabus station upon arrival. The nearest bus that takes you to the heart of downtown is at our corner. If you are concerned about travel times please do look up your planned destinations and their pro
transit: 15 minute walk to/from the Orange Line L stop (Halsted). Alternatively,  walk 5 minutes to the Halsted bus or 62 bus on Archer to get to the Orange Line if you want to save your steps for exploring the city. Or take the 31st street bus from our corner to the Red Line. Nearby Divvy bike stations offer bike rentals with less than 15 minutes to the lakefront by bike. 15 minute walk to the 35th street bus which will take you to the Red or Green line in 5 minutes and right to the door of Guaranteed Rate Field. There are free transfers between all trains so most of Chicago is accessible for the price of a train ticket. $3/person. You can also purchase a day pass, week pass,  or other packages to fit your needs.
access: You have full and complete direct access to the apartment including your own private entrance. You will be able to come and go as you please at any time. Not ADA accessible at this time. WiFi is available and free for guests to use.
interaction: We live upstairs with our son and are readily available and open to socializing or giving directions. Also, if you forget something we can help! We are local people with a lot to offer so just let us know if you need anything or have any questions. We will try to accommodate any special requests and help you have the most enjoyable stay possible.
house_rules: Please upload a profile picture where we can identify you by sight. This is our only way of ensuring we let you in and not a stranger. Check-in is at 3pm, and check-out is by 11am. Arriving slightly earlier, or want that extra hour to sleep? Should be fine, but please check with us first. We have a no smoking policy (although you are welcome to smoke outside). Please dispose of butts in the ashtray and then trash can. To keep our costs down (and pass those savings on to our guests) we kindly ask that you switch off lights when not in use or leaving the house. Office and storage/utility area in entryway is off limits. For the comfort of our own pets, we do not allow any other animals in the house. If trash is full during your stay tie and remove bag and leave on the ground inside the yard. Recycling goes in the blue bins out back. We kindly ask that prior to leaving, you clean and put away any dishes or kitchenware used. Towels go in the laundry basket. This helps us get through our cle
host_about:
Growing up my mother ran a business placing students in homes around our neighborhood and I loved meeting new people that would stay with us all the time. I met people from around the world and had such a great experience I decided to go ahead and do something similar. I love meeting new people and hope to make some friends along the way!
I am a Chicago native and love this city. I love the diversity of the neighborhoods, the history and that there is always something to do.
I'm an avid reader and always have two book going, one fiction, one non-fiction-depending on my mood.
I am currently involved in a torrid affair with my Netflix account but pull myself away to go for a nice walk around the neighborhood or to a local restaurant. My goal this year is to try every Chinese restaurant within a 3 mile radius-there are a lot!
I'm an accountant but currently taking a break for family. I actually kinda miss doing taxes believe it or not. I'm the kind of person that needs to have a project or to be striving towards a goal in order to be at my best so I always have something going on, even small projects bring me peace.
I love trying new restaurants and I also love to cook. Making up my own recipes with whatever random items I have in my fridge is always fun. It usually turns out pretty good too!
This is just a scratch of the surface and I hope that it gives you an idea as to who I am. I can't wait to meet you and here about your journey.

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood you'll be staying in, known as River North is the most sought after, fastest developing neighborhoods in all of Chicago.  Multi-million dollar homes and skyscrapers galore!
interaction: We pride ourselves in customer service! Put us to the test with a question about the property.  See how fast we respond!  You can expect more of the same should you chose to stay with us!
house_rules: Absolutely no smoking ANYTHING inside or near the doorways.  Doing so results in an additional $500 cleaning fee. No parties or loud music.  There are other units in the building.  If there are complaints of loud music or a party and we cannot contact you to stop, the police will be instructed to escort you and your guests out of the property - permanently. We reserve the right to request additional documentation from you to verify your identity  at our discretion.  Pets are not authorized.  Bringing unauthorized pets onto the property can result in an additional $500 cleaning fee. We do have GREAT wifi on the property but we cannot guarantee it will be working 100% all the time.  Please contact us if it is down and we will do our best to restore it.

name: Green Room - Free Parking, Long Term, Grad Housing
summary: Located on the cozy third floor of a victorian mansion, the green room will be your retreat from the city after a long day spent out on the town. The room features a king size bed, in-room smart TV, a spacious work desk, and a chair to relax in. Easy unmetered street parking is in front of the house. Full size kitchen, multiple living/outdoor areas, and laundry machines are available for use as well. My other rooms are listed here: https://www.airbnb.com/users/22608682/listings
space: The space is in an old victorian era (c.1895) limestone/brick mansion located on Chicago's west side in the East Garfield Park neighborhood. It overlooks Washington Blvd. and is about a block from the Kedzie Green Line Train. Please note if you book, this is an old house, with over 125 years of living. This means lumps, bumps, scratches, and things in general that are less then perfect. Most people enjoy this character of a house, and it's why they book. I allow LUGGAGE DROP OFF! You can store your luggage in the closet before check-in and after check-out times, you can drop it off and pick it up as early and as late as you would like. Public transit options (train, bus, bike share) available about a block away.

neighborhood_overview: The area itself is undergoing redevelopment. This doesn't mean boutique coffee instead of national chain coffee, it means Chicago and it’s outlying neighborhoods are mixed bags, on my block you’ll have $500,000 homes next to a boarded up one.  If you are looking for a great place close to everything but with tons of room typically unknown for a city house, this is it.  The house is very close to the Garfield Park Conservatory for reference.  You'll need to order delivery or take a train for restaurants, but it's all less then 20 minutes away.
notes: I mention this in the neighborhood section of my listing as well, but it's worth repeating here.  Please do your research and know where you are booking. I've lived here for over 7 years and never had a concern for my own safety or that of the thousands of my guests. Also, please note that I don't have keyed locks on interior doors of the home. If this is a problem for you, please don't book. I trust you, the guest, with my single most valuable asset and all of my personal belongings. I have never been given a reason to doubt that trust in this community, but if you plan on breaking that trust, please don't book.
transit: The house is about 1 block from the Kedzie green line station. It’s 20 minutes from downtown and about 45 from either airport. There is ample street parking in front of the home for those arriving by car.
access: The entire home except remaining private rooms are available. This includes the kitchen, dining room, billiards room, parlor, laundry room, and of course common bathrooms.
interaction: While I live at the house, there is a chance we may never cross paths during your stay due to the size of the home.  I'm always available via messages/phone, so if anything comes up, let me know! I assume everything is going well unless it's brought to my attention. I'm happy to provide advice on where to eat, how to get around, and where to shop, just ask!
house_rules: Our goal is to make sure everyone is treated fairly and in consideration of others, so there are just a few things to be aware of so everyone has a great stay. First off, there is NO SMOKING allowed anywhere on the property. If you are found to be smoking your reservation will be cancelled and you will be evicted immediately without refund. In addition, you will be responsible for cleaning fees from a professional restoration company which will easily exceed $1000 depending on the severity of the smoke damage.  While you have a private bedroom, please keep in mind that others will want to use the common areas after you, so please don't leave them your mess. Also, if you happen to break something or something isn't working right, please let me know so I can fix it right away. Also, it's a shared kitchen, so please don't eat/drink food that isn't yours, if you need advice on where to buy food in the neighborhood, just ask.  Overall, the best way to think about how you should treat a home

summary: Enjoy use of the entire home, located walking distance to dining, gym, grocery and clothes shopping options. One exit away from McCormick Place and less than a mile to beach views, this home is ideal for groups of explorers and professionals alike. **Guest Reviews disclaimer: Most are from a time when the home was offered for individual room bookings. space: Enjoy exclusive use of this is a contemporary decorated home that offers 3 private bedrooms, each with an attached bathroom.  Enter the home into the split-level living area. Walk up six steps into the dining/kitchen area, which also has a half bathroom.   - The living area has a TV, couch, and chairs.   - The dining table seats 6 while the kitchen features stainless steel appliances (stove, oven, dishwasher, and microwave), all basic eating utensils, cooking equipment, and a Keurig with a variety of K cup flavors.  Top level:  - Bedroom#1 features a king bed, standing shower and jet tub.  - Bedroom #2 has a queen bed with a standing tub shower.   - Stacked washer and dryer with applicable detergent, fabric softener and drying sheets.   Bottom level: - Bedroom #3 is the entire lower floor just seven steps from the living room with attached bathroom and large TV. This room does not have door access.  Covered, enclosed parking garage available at additional cost and $100 security deposit

neighborhood_overview: Experience the city like a true, native Chicagoan. Close to several parks and restaurants. Only a block away from the beautiful Chicago Lakefront and Beaches! Plenty of trails for biking, walking and jogging. Enjoy water sports at the nearby harbor: - Jet skis - Kayaks - Flyboards - Paddleboards Plus spectacular views of Chicago's magnificent skyline.
transit: Nearest public transit is less than one block away, arriving every 5-10 minutes. Bike shares are available nearby. Just download Acehopper for iPhone and Android for public transit times, bike sharing availability and info for local events and attractions, including maps and tickets for purchase direct from your phone or tablet. Only the number of guests noted in the booking may stay in the home.  Do not lock bottom lock on front door when leaving. It will lock you out of house.  Thank you❤️

summary: Welcome to this spacious and beautifully finished 4 bedroom, 2.5 bathroom West Town condo, which covers the top two floors of the building. The layout is spacious and the finishes are luxurious. Upon entering the condo you will be greeted by lots of natural light, high ceilings, and beautiful wood floors. The main floor features the living room, dining room, and remodeled kitchen in an open concept layout, which is perfect for groups wanting to spend time together. The kitchen is fully stocked with everything a chef needs to prepare a meal and has stainless steel appliances, granite countertops, and a large island with three barstool seats. The kitchen table has seating for six and the living room has a comfortable sectional sofa, flat screen TV, tons of natural light from the front windows. neighborhood_overview: West Town is a quiet residential neighborhood just a few miles west of downtown Chicago. This condo is perfect for groups who want to get away from the hustle and bustle of downtown while still having quick and convenient access to everything Chicago has to offer. The house is 10 minutes away from Wicker Park, the United Center, River North, and the Loop.
notes: The balconies outside each of the bedrooms are your to use freely but please do not use the patio down the stairs in the back. That space is not ours, thank you for understanding! Please note that there is an extra guest fee of $20 per guest after 6 guests. This help cover the cost of larger groups while making our home affordable for smaller groups. Please be sure that your guest count is accurate when booking so we can be sure that the space is adequately prepared! We have equipped the home with a NoiseAware decibel monitoring system. No specific conversations will be heard or recorded, just the overall sound level. This is only to prevent any potential disturbances to neighbors, not to infringe on our guest's privacy.
transit: There's a Blue Line subway station about a 10 minute walk away, at the intersection of Milwaukee and Chicago Ave. The Blue Line runs all the way from O'Hare Airport to downtown so guests without a vehicle can rely on public transportation. If you choose to bring a vehicle with you, we're just a few minutes from the interstate. We also have a garage spot available in the rear of the building for our guests to use.
access: Guests will have full access to the condo, the private balconies, and one parking space. You will receive detailed check-in instructions a few days before your arrival through the booking platforms app or email. Please note that due to insurance liabilities, the fireplaces are not functional.
interaction: We are available as much or as little as you would like. We live nearby so we keep a pretty close eye on the property but we respect our guests' privacy.
house_rules: Please provide an accurate guest count prior to booking. Rates vary throughout the week and season and by number of guests. It's important that your guest count is accurate so we can be sure the home is adequately prepared and stocked for your stay. - Quiet hours between 10pm - 7am - Smoking Penalty: $500 + damages - Pet Penalty: $500 + damages - Late Check Out Fee: $25/half hour
host_about:
Hi, Thanks for taking a look at our special homes.

My name is Noah. A few years ago, my family and I got together to create an amazing experience for tourists and guests like you.

We are Chicagoans who love sharing our city with the world and strive to make your stay as comfortable as possible so you can enjoy the city like a local. 

We're passionate about travel. As experienced travelers, we've learned what creates a top notch experience and we're committed to sharing that experience with you. It's something we call "Sweet Home Chicago" and we hope you carry it back with you to where ever you call home! :)

You can find us hanging by the lake, catching a game at Wrigley, grabbing a drink in Wicker Park, enjoying the many concerts going on on any given night, or at any of the amazing local coffee shops across the city.

neighborhood_overview: Located in West Loop, this furnished rental invites you to explore the edges of downtown Chicago. From endless dining and bar options to art galleries and stylish shops, West Loop has emerged with so much to offer daily. During weekends, residents savor trips to the Chicago French Market and the vibrant strip of Randolph Street. The latter is known as “Restaurant Row” and is lined with some of the city’s best eateries. Fulton Market, one of the hippest and fastest-growing neighborhoods, is ideal for dinner and drinks. Union Station is only a 5 to 10 minute walk away.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions (including certain Bull Terriers and any related breeds). Wild animals and hybrids, including wolf and coyote hybrids, snakes, ferrets, rabbits, are all prohibited. Please contact us for precise breed restrictions. Please note that a one-off non refundable fee ($500) and a monthly rent ($25/mo/pet) is applicable upon reservation. Failing to notify us of any pets prior to check-in will incur a penalty, and may result in denied check-in. Supporting documents (ie. vaccinations) may be required - Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a $250 monthly fe
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about: Blueground is a real estate tech company that wants to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. The company offers beautifully furnished and thoughtfully equipped apartments for a month, a year, or even longer that are designed to help people simply show up and start living. Motivated by its mission to create a tech powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work, Blueground has grown quickly, surpassing 3,200 apartments and 500 team members in twelve cities; New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens. Blueground plans to have a presence in 50 cities around the world and a portfolio of more than 50,000 apartments by 2023.

name: The Historic Florsheim Mansion
summary: Enjoy Chicago's Gold Coast in the famous Florsheim Mansion. One of the most architecturally significant homes in Chicago, the Mansion is a perfect destination for families or groups with 5 bedrooms and 5 bathrooms; sleeps up to 12.     Please contact us at the Florsheimmansion web/site for a special discount code of 30% savings on any booking.
space: Important notice: We require a $3000 security deposit after an AirBnB booking is confirmed to be held in an escrow account.  Bookings are not confirmed until the reservation is accepted by AirBnB, and then the security deposit is received separately in the escrow account.   Enjoy Chicago as “patrons of the arts” in the famous Florsheim Mansion for the Arts B&B in Chicago's Gold Coast at 1328 N. State Parkway. One of the most architecturally significant homes in Chicago, the Florsheim Mansion for the Arts is a perfect destination for families or groups. The legendary residence was built by famous architect, Andrew Rebori in 1938 and was home to shoe heiress and sculptor, Lillian Florsheim, who purchased the place in 1946.  The famed house has been called one of the "sexiest homes in Chicago" by Chicago Magazine.  It is a significant landmark of the city.  Oozing with architectural brilliance, the home is 4500 square feet and is in the ideal gold coast location with 2 living rooms, a hug

access: By the Numbers: 1938: The year the house was built by architect Andrew Rebori 1968: The year the floating galley kitchen was built by architect Bertrand Goldberg $2.3 million: The amount the current owners paid for the home in (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN): The amount invested so far in our ongoing restoration efforts 5: Number of bedrooms  5: Number of bathrooms $3000: refundable security deposit 1: Number of turtles living in the garden pond (his name is Wilbur, please feed him) Yes: whether or not we rent the space for weddings and events. house_rules: Disclaimer: please be aware that you are renting a historic 1930s home, not the Four Seasons.  Like all old homes, it has many "charms" and quirks.  Constantly renovating the home is a challenge, yet a passion, and this home is never at any given time in a "perfect, luxurious condition."  For example, the charming kitchen has 3 sinks, but 1 of them doesn't work and, so far, it has proven simply too cost-prohibitive to fix so you'll have to make do with only 2 working kitchens.  The kitchen has other charms, such as almost 75 cabinets and drawers, all from the 60s (and therefore, many of them tend to stick!)  Also, some of the bathrooms have a habit of leaking.  It seems that, we fix one, and then another starts to leak.  Moreover, given that we are a popular, almost constantly rented B&B, we are almost always in need of a "paint job."  No sooner do we complete a $5000 re-paint that it is in need of another one, so we can't guarantee a brand new paint condition; the walls and light swit
host_about: The owner has lived in Chicago's Gold Coast for 20+ years.  A graduate of Northwestern University and the University of Chicago, he is passionate about the neighborhood and will serve as your guide to the best restaurants, outdoor events and, especially, live music!

neighborhood_overview: Irving Park is located 7 miles from downtown, (30-45 min by public transit) and 3.5 miles from Wrigley field (20-45 min by bus). A 12 min walk to the CTA blue line (Addison station) & 1 block to the Addison bus (152).  A family & pet-friendly neighborhood that has local fare (from fast food to Michelin star rated restaurant) & a grocery store within walking distance. Tara & Jay's home is located in Chicago, Illinois, United States. What makes our neighborhood great? Tree lined streets, friendly neighbors, and easy access to all the things you need. Only three miles directly east of us is the famous Wrigley Field, home of the 2016 World Series winners! Go Cubs Go! It takes only 15 minutes on the bus to get to Wrigley. Directly around us: We are only a couple blocks from the Addison Mall, which contains stores like Target (with Starbucks on the 2nd floor), Carters, Dollar Tree, Famous Footwear, etc. Within a 10-minute walk, you can get to a 24 hour grocery store (Jewel), to several banks
notes: - Please make sure you review the house rules before you decide to book the apartment - The rear door should be used only in the case of an emergency.  The light switch for the rear porch is to the left of the door.  It leads to the enclosed rear porch.
transit: We are less than a mile from the I-90/94, so it takes only 5 minutes from the highway to get to your apartment. When traffic is light, you can get to O'Hare in under 20 minutes! Our neighborhood is serviced by two major bus lines (Addison #152 and Irving Park #80) and we are less than a mile from the Blue line (L train). If you take either of the buses east, you can hop on the Brown line or Red line to access more parts of the city. We have free street parking on our street and the surrounding ones. Most things you need are within a short walk!
access: A key code system allows you come and go as you please and does not require us to physically meet you in order to gain entry. Arrival anytime after our posted check in time is fine by us! See house rules for more details.
interaction: The apartment is completely private and is intended to be your private home in the city during your stay. We currently live onsite and are always available by phone and email in case of emergencies or if you have general questions. We are not overbearing hosts, but we’d love to help with restaurant and bar recommendations, ideas about what to see and do while you’re here, or any general questions that you have about your stay. Welcome—and have a great stay!
house_rules: As a Superhost, we aim to make your stay as comfortable as it can possibly be! Our mission is to help our guests create beautiful memories in our charming Airbnb.  For us to do so, we would truly appreciate it if you review and follow these house rules.  Thank you in advance and we truly appreciate your cooperation! 1.	All guests 18 years of age and older must have valid government issued photo ID.  We reserve the right to review photo ID of all guests that are 18 years of age and older. 2.	The booking guest must be present at check-in and must have valid government issued photo ID matching the name and picture shown on the reservation.  We reserve the right to cancel your reservation without reimbursement if valid ID is not provided after check-in upon request. 3.	Absolutely NO SMOKING and NO DRUGS in the apartment or on the property, including the front porch, back porch, side walk, gangway and back yard. 4.	Guests will be charged a $300 cleaning fee for smoking ANYTHING in the apart

summary: Very clean, private, professionally designed room in the heart of Chicago with FREE PARKING & a LATE check-out (3 PM!). You will have your own door code and may arrive as late as you wish, EASY check-in guaranteed.  I allow LUGGAGE DROP OFF! You can store your luggage in the closet before check-in and after check-out times, you can drop it off and pick it up as early and as late as you would like.  The neighborhood is very QUIET & SAFE, even at night :)
space: Restaurants and bars are right round the corner, both upscale and casual. This room is 5 minutes away by car or uber to Chicago's famous Willis (Sears) tower. Uber costs about $7. If you are arriving by car, I am providing free resident parking passes for anywhere in the area. (Yes, that means you can drive a few blocks and still park anywhere you want!) The room will be ONLY yours for the time you'll stay in my Windy City. You will have a key to lock the door.  > Cleanliness is most important here! > 7 MIN TO WILLIS TOWER > LATE CHECK-OUT! transit: "Racine" blue line is the closest blue line train (metro) station, only 5 minutes away (walking).  -Downtown/Loop: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and get off at "LaSalle, Jackson, or Monroe," depending on where you are going :) FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "Racine" About 5 minutes to downtown. -O'Hare Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare. O'Hare is the final stop. FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "Racine" About 40 minutes to O’Hare. -Midway Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and transfer to orange line at "Clark/Lake," then take orange line to towards Midway airport. Midway is the final stop! FROM - take orange line towards Adams/Wabash; then, transfer to blue line at "Clark/Lake." Take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "Racine" About 45 minutes to Midway. -Union Station/Amtrak: Only 20 minutes away (walking), taxi or uber will take you to the apartment in less than 5 minutes for about $6 :)

host_about:
Hello! My name is Natalia, and I would like to welcome you to Chicago. I host with my sister, Marina, and we are originally from Saint Petersburg, Russia, but we spent our teenage years in Aix-en-Provence, France and therefore speak English, Russian and French fluently :) I work as an investment banker in the loop. 

Hotels can get very expensive, so we do our best to help tourists out. I really hope to host you! :)

summary: Our homey space includes full bath, kitchenette, living area and super comfy Queen bed.  Direct access to unit from the exterior rear door makes coming and going easy. Located on University Ave. just a minutes walk to U. Chicago campus, easy access to public transportation taking you downtown in just over half an hour. *Note*This is in the basement of our home. Interior stair door locks from basement side to ensure guest privacy. You will hear us upstairs at times.
space: Almost 600 sq. ft of living space can comfortably accommodate a couple or family of three with a child. Breakfast bar serves as both dining and work area. Sitting area includes two chairs and small Ikea sofa sleeper and is set against the original exposed brick walls of our 1903 built home. Shelving constructed of original beams -the space is modern and convenient but has flavor! Steps away from public transportation and the U. Chicago, it's hard to find a more convenient location in Hyde Park. Welcome!

neighborhood_overview: Parks galore in Hyde Park! Walk 15 minutes east and you hit the Lake Shore trail which can make for a very relaxing morning. Stroll over to historic Jackson Park, home of the 1896 World's Fair. There are also numerous coffee shops and a wide variety of restaurants. Enjoy close proximity to the University of Chicago and all of its unique cultural offerings including the Oriental Institute Museum, the Smart Museum of Art, the Renaissance Museum, and of course, the beautiful architecture in and around campus. Also within walking distance are the Museum of Science and Industry and the Dusables Museum of African American History.  Hyde Park is a great place for those who want to explore the city but step away from the chaos at night and see one of the few remaining diverse neighborhoods of Chicago.
notes: Our homey space includes full bath, kitchenette, living area and super comfy Queen bed.  Direct access to unit from the exterior rear door makes coming and going easy. transit: There is plenty of free parking in front of our house, so if you are renting a car or driving your own, our place is very convenient.  Walk to all U Chicago buildings and hospital in less than 15 minutes. TO/FROM AIRPORTS:  From Midway Airport: Take the 55 bus straight west to University stop. From there, walk about 2 minutes north and you have arrived!  From O'Hare: Take the Blue Line to Jackson and transfer to the Red Line. Take Red Line south to the Garfield stop. Cross the street and catch the 55 bus eastbound. Get off at University Ave. Walk 2 minutes north and you are here!  OPTIONS FOR GETTING DOWNTOWN: 1) Walk 10 minutes east on 55th St. to catch the 6 express bus which will take you up to Michigan Avenue and Millenium Park, Art Museum, etc. 2) Walk 15 minutes to 53rd and Lake Park to catch the METRA running north to the Museum campus that includes the Aquarium, Planetarium, and Field Museum. GETTING TO FAR NORTH SIDE: Take 55th St. bus west to the Red Line to catch the Red Lin
access: This space includes basement only. Access is through the exterior rear basement door.   Laundry room - Located on the 2nd floor of the house, guests may access but only after asking first Outdoor Patio - Feel free to sit out and enjoy some peace and tranquility in the city.
interaction: We live in the upper two floors of the rowhouse and have two children aged 6 and 4. There are times you will hear us above.  We try to give our guests their space but are happy to chat or try to answer any questions you may have.
house_rules: Shoes off in entry way please.
host_about:
This is now our eighth year living in Chicago and we love it! My wife, Jolin and I originally met when I was living in Taiwan and now we are a family of four. I teach Mandarin Chinese in the Chicago Public Schools and my wife has the more daunting task of managing her own private tutoring along with raising our little ones, Baea and Kylin (6 years old and  3 years old respectfully). When we are able, we love to travel and have had the most wonderful experiences here on Airbnb. Can't wait to meet you!

We look forward to meeting you!

name: Skyline View -"The Fitzgerald " in West Loop
summary: A fabulous high-rise suite in Chicago's bustling West-Loop, by Cloud9. This 2-bed 2-bath features an incredible skyline view that you can admire on your own private balcony. This unit features Mid-Century Modern style with premium accessories like Sonos sound, Le Creuset, and in-suite washer/dryer. Delight in a leisurely swim in the building's expansive outdoor pool. Inside, take advantage of all the other wonderful amenities this building has to offer: like a yoga studio, and a theater!  Enjoy!

house_rules: Cloud9 House Rules  1. IDs:: All adult Guests (18 and older) must provide ID verification: license, state ID, or passport before Check-in.   2. Security Deposit:: All bookings require a security/damage deposit of $750 or more. This deposit will not be charged in advance. *For last-minute bookings or local stays, damage/security deposit may be held in advance by Cloud9*  3. Cancellations:: Full refund for cancellations made within 48 hours of booking, if Check-in date is at least 14 days away. 50% refund for cancellations made at least 7 days before Check-in. *No refunds for cancellations made within 7 days of Check-in*  4. Check-in:: any time after 4 PM.  Check-out:: any time before 11 AM.  *If an earlier Check-in or later Check-out time is desired, please send a request. We can only confirm 24 hours in advance. No guarantee*  *If an unauthorized late Check-out delays cleaning of the unit, Guests will be charged $100. Any Guest still in the unit after 1 PM will be charged another night

name: The Quiet Big City Getaway
summary: Come to your Big City Getaway in East Lakeview, one of Chicago's safest neighborhoods.  A perfectly located space where there is a lot to do, but quiet enough to sleep and prep for the next day of adventure. Three full bedrooms and baths where you will be able to enjoy your stay with family and friends.  The common area has a sectional couch and TV to relax after a fun day exploring. Take in a weekend series or a show - theatrical or Rock N Roll.
space: 3 full bedrooms and baths where you will be able to enjoy your stay with family and friends. Plenty of room in common areas to congregate with everyone. The amount of space will surprise you.

name: 2RF Attached Priv Bath/Priv Room Steps from S Loop
summary: Please make sure to review "Getting Around" details within the "Neighborhood" section. Nearest building intersection is 28th Place & Canal St to map transit options Newly remodeled private room with attached private bath with modern finishes, smart tech & security, in a hip, central neighborhood minutes from downtown Chicago and steps from all that trendy Bridgeport has to offer   Per the City of Chicago ordinances, 31 night minimum on all stays
space: There is free street parking (unmetered) that is generally very available directly outside the building on 28th Pl and for all 2 blocks west on the same street, all of which is residential and not zoned/metered on both sides of the street :)  Additionally, the nearest intersecting street Canal St. has very available parking as there are no properties on the East side of that street (and is also not zoned/metered on both sides of the street.)  We’ve very reliably found a spot within a 1 minute walk during different times of day/evening/weekdays/weekends, and almost always have been able to secure parking directly outside the building. The majority of neighboring streets are also not zoned/metered in the off chance that you can't find a parking space on the same block as the building :) Close to public transportation as well if you are not bringing a vehicle, please see "Getting Around" section. -Private suite with private attached bath -Zinus 8" plush memory foam mattress and memory foa

neighborhood_overview: Bridgeport is the quintessential Chicago neighborhood.  Widely considered among the safest of Chicago neighborhoods with a close proximity to downtown, it features popular dining options, culture, Chicago sports and other points of interest just steps away.  Downtown is minutes away via public transportation as well as numerous business districts, hospital systems, & universities.
notes: Please note that the entire reservation amount is NOT due at the time of booking :) One month's rent is charged, and then the rest is charged by Airbnb in monthly installments. https://www.airbnb.com/help/article/245/how-do-i-pay-for-my-long-term-reservation The owners of this apartment building invested a significant amount of time, money, and resources into a complete renovation in the summer of 2019. That said, the building is over 90 years old and, though greatly cared for, shows its age in some places. Expect to find some loving wear, quaint aging and minor quirks that you might not find in a brand new high-rise :) We are a monthly stay company only and thus we do not apply a monthly discount on our Airbnb listings: our "nightly" rate reflects the pricing for 30 days or more. Any further discounts to our listed rate need to be approved by owners, and factors that they value include but aren't limited to: -potential stays longer than 3 months -potential guests with 2 or more positi

We are happy to help with questions regarding proximity to your work/school in communications prior to booking however please note that we too use likely the same online map search that you would use as well :) in order to make sure we are describing it accurately. 4 minute walk to the CTA 44 bus 4 minute walk to Divvy (city-wide bike sharing) 8 minute walk to the CTA 24 bus 9 minute walk to the CTA 8 bus 15 minute walk to the CTA Train (Halsted station, Orange Line) 18 minute walk to the CTA Train (35th station, Red Line) 12 minute walk to grocery store Cermak Fresh Market 13 minute walk to CVS pharmacy 21 minute walk to Mercy Hospital & Medical Center 12 minute drive/uber to Rush/Cook County/UIC Hospital systems 14 minute drive/uber to Mt. Last load can be put in the washer before 8:15pm. - Please remove shoes at door and do not wear in the apartment. - No more than 1 overnight guest for over 7 days in any 30 day period - 2 or more simultaneous overnight guests not allowed unless previously authorized

As a physical therapist and associate with a global logistics firm, we've experienced and understand the needs of traveling professionals & students and seek to minimize the worries that oftentimes accompany out of town stays.

name: Spacious 1B/1B on Lake Michigan
summary: Spacious 1 bed/1 bath w/private balcony on lakefront in Uptown. Bus stop to downtown is right outside, Wrigley field is 6 blocks away, Boystown is 4 blocks away, short walk to lakefront trail and Lake Michigan. The red line into downtown is only 5 blocks away. Lots of restaurants, nightlife, and shopping close by.
space: Very spacious apartment with great views of Lake Michigan. You can see the Navy Pier fireworks from my apartment (Wednesday and Saturday nights in the summer). Huge private balcony to enjoy the view. Large kitchen available with access to all cooking supplies. Very relaxing and inviting space but very close to public transportation and all the fun Chicago has to offer.
description: Spacious 1 bed/1 bath w/private balcony on lakefront in Uptown. Bus stop to downtown is right outside, Wrigley field is 6 blocks away, Boystown is 4 blocks away, short walk to lakefront trail and Lake Michigan. The red line into downtown is only 5 blocks away. Lots of restaurants, nightlife, and shopping close by. Very spacious apartment with great views of Lake Michigan. You can see the Navy Pier fireworks from my apartment (Wednesday and Saturday nights in the summer). Huge private balcony to enjoy the view. Large kitchen available with access to all cooking supplies. Very relaxing and inviting space but very close to public transportation and all the fun Chicago has to offer. There is a gym, open rooftop, and laundry facilities in the building. I am available any time by phone or email should there be any questions or concerns during your stay. I do allow children to stay in my place, however, it is not child-proofed. So, if you are ok with that, children are more than welcome.

The building is no smoking, so please do not smoke on the balcony. There is a smoking section out front. Please, no large/loud parties. When you leave, please take all sheets and pillow cases off of the bed and leave them in a pile on the mattress or bedroom floor. No pets allowed.
host_about:
I have seen too little of the world and I want to explore new cities, countries, and cultures! While traveling, I love to eat great food, relax in outdoor spaces, listen to music, and see as much as I can without wearing myself out completely. 

When I travel, I am mostly only in the room to sleep and get ready, but if there is a kitchen available, I love to cook too.

name: ~ BEST OF CHICAGO ~ FREE PARKING
summary: Built in 1911, this elegant residence in Chicago’s historic Albany Park Neighborhood has plenty of carefully preserved period details to go along with some more recent updates.
space: The house has been given a major overhaul by its current owner, designer and general contractor. Updates include new roof, electric, plumbing, bathrooms, appliances and two contemporary-style kitchens with black sparkling countertops and white cabinets. Plenty of original features remain, like exposed brick walls and a handsome master staircase leading to the second floor. The house has seven bedrooms and four bathrooms spread across 4,000 sqft of living space.

host_about: I've lived in Chicago for most of my life. I love to travel, especially to remote, non-cliché parts of the world. Places that are rich in cultures and histories that shape our globalized world. One of my most memorable trips has been to the country of Myanmar (formerly known as Burma). Welcome to my home. I hope you have a wonderful stay.

name: Greystone Haven in Logan Square
summary: Top-floor boutique apartment on a quiet street in Chicago's uber happening Logan square!  Flooded light & thoughtful finishes decorate this high end rental.  Professional cleaners. Landlord on site.
space: A private entry leads up a historic staircase. At the top, you'll find our apartment flush with light & 10 foot high ceilings.  Everything in the entire home is brand new as of fall 2017; high end HVAC system, beautifully tiled bathrooms & an Oceania soaking tub with strong water pressure throughout.  Unique for a two flat, the immaculate kitchen & combined spacious living area is completed with Samsung stainless steel appliances & all you'll need to cook a meal & enjoy a few drinks. Don't forget the french press coffee pot to start the day while lounging in the comfortable couch enjoying the morning sun as it floods through the enormous picture windows. This is the perfect weekend retreat to enjoy the city while having the comfort of an amazing space to return home to after an adventure on the town. Likewise it is perfectly suited for business trips (high speed internet, work areas, laundry in unit, etc). Whatever your reason, we know you'll have a great time in our beautiful home.

This is the perfect weekend retreat to enjoy the city while having the comfort of an amazing space to return home to after an adventure on
neighborhood_overview: Logan Square is the place to be in Chicago! Some of our favorite highlights below!  - the latest & greatest in the restaurant scene surrounds us in every direction - the hottest farmers market in the city is a short 10 min walk away & open spring through fall; - the house is a 10 min walk to the blue line station which will take you directly into the heart of the city in less than 30 minutes.  Likewise it can get you to O'hare quicker than any uber or taxi.  -coffee anyone? some of the best & most cozy roasters and brewers in the city are located in our hood -prefer something with a bit of a kick?  Breweries & distilleries abound both in logan & the surrounding neighborhoods.
notes: The apartment was built to the latest sound dampening building codes. We are a young professional couple with no kids or pets so there is not much noise, but you may hear footsteps or muffled noise from time to time.  Early check-ins and late check-outs are accommodated on a case by case basis for $20. Absolutely no smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises.  Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any entrance and we ask you respect that as well. We are located on a quiet residential street and love our neighbors. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily.  Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid. Very simply, please respect our home and neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.
transit: Ubers, Lyft, & Taxis abound.  we are a 10 minute walk to the Chicago's blue line two main city buses (Kimball & fullerton) run continuously and are less than a 2 minute walk from the house. the house is located on a residential street close to several Divvy Stations (rental bicycles) a private parking pad is available if you have a vehicle.
interaction: We live on site, & are here to provide you with any guidance you need; whether its the hottest restaurants, a great gym or yoga studio within walking distance, or the best parks in the area. Miriam is a Chicago native & knows all areas of the city in & out, and while Carl wasn't born here, if you have any questions about the architecture or city history, he'll be your guy!
house_rules: -absolutely NO SMOKING,  NO DRUGS of any kind in the house or on the property. -please remove shoes upon entrance, we aim to keep the home extra clean both for you & our next guests -quiet hours between 10pm - 8am (keep tv/music/conversations/footfalls soft)
host_about:
Miriam is a Chicagoan born & raised, while Carl hails from Sweden; the land of Vikings & Volvos, & the all-famous Abba.  We met while working abroad & recently relocated to Chicago to be closer to family & enjoy this fantastic city.

In 2016 we bought this 130+ year old historic greystone home.  We spent 18 months meticulously taking it apart one wooden beam at a time. After overhauling the heating, plumbing, & electric with the most efficient systems we could find, we then put it all back together - preserving as much of the original hardwood, bricks & beautiful finishes we possibly could. We found there is indeed truth to the phrase 'labor of love', and we couldn't be more proud of the work we've accomplished.  

Our professional careers revolve around sustainability & we try to lead our lives as close to our environmentally friendly values as we can while still leading modern, robust lives. We love spending as much outdoors time as the weather allows us;  hiking, gardening, skiing - we love it all.  When indoors, we make use of an extensive tool collection (we have an entire storage area dedicated to it), & tinker on home improvements .. most often while sipping either a craft beer or glass of dynamic wine.

name: Drop-dead fab on the Lake  2bd/2bth
summary: Over-the-top fabulous in the heart of Chicago's hopping East Lakeview/Boystown neighborhood, right on Lake Shore Drive. 2000 square feet on a single floor, grand rooms, vintage detailing, premier Beaux Arts building. Promise, it's all good.
space: Over-the-top fabulous in the heart of Chicago's hopping East Lakeview/Boystown neighborhood, right on Lake Shore Drive. 2000 square feet on a single floor, grand rooms, vintage detailing, premier Beaux Arts rental building with 24-hour door staff, ginormous windows that look out onto the lake, harbor and park from every room. Whip-up breakfast in a yarn-wrapped kitchen under a disco ball, and then settle down to eat on a rosewood table under a turn of the century chandelier. Super swank pad of electric blues, chocolate brown, and an orange so vibrant it almost pulsates. Because the universe is kind, we're a show-house for the Jennifer Norback gallery, so brace yourself for some insanely cool art. The place has a good vibe.  The kid's room has one twin bed. My room has a totally dreamy king-size pillow top bed, the same kind they use at the Four Seasons. Both bedrooms have full bathrooms.  Our pad is walking distance to the Lincoln Park Zoo, Wrigley Field, museums, and tons of great pla
description: Over-the-top fabulous in the heart of Chicago's hopping East Lakeview/Boystown neighborhood, right on Lake Shore Drive. 2000 square feet on a single floor, grand rooms, vintage detailing, premier Beaux Arts building. neighborhood_overview: East Lakeview/Boystown is eclectic neighborhood is a vibrant mix of hipsters, families, socialites, buskers, orthodox Jews, and gays, with just enough heart and grit to make you feel good about living in the city. Plus, we have the best gelato, cupcakes, falafel and fried Korean chicken in Chicago, hands-down.
notes: There's a Divvy bike station right outside my building. If the weather's nice, grab a bike and ride downtown along the lake or explore any of Chicago's great neighborhoods.
transit: Hop a five minute cab or the 146 express buss to downtown and the loop right out our front door. The Belmont stop El train (brown/red line) is a ten minute walk away. Hail a cab right out front in minutes. Parking is a big drag in my neighborhood, so skip the rental car. I don't own a car and happily get around on foot, cab, or bus. If you are driving, there's street parking and  a public lot just a block away (Broadway and Roscoe).
interaction: Sometimes will be staying nearby, sometimes not. If we're in town, we're happy to share a meal, leave you alone, or point you in the right direction.
house_rules: No pets, no smoking.  As much as we love fun and games, no parties or extra guests who are not listed in the original booking. --no shoes in the house --please refrain from wearing strong perfumes and colognes  --use place mats on the dining room table, especially for water glasses --Before leaving, please change the sheets and towels and empty the garbage. Be nice.
host_about: author + artist + social entrepreneur + community activist.

host_about:
Southern belle quality of life with city experience who loves Chicago for its art, rich history, fine cuisines and many things to do. Although this is not a commercial hotel, my guests have described this charming unit as gorgeous, inviting, warm and comparable to a vacation property. In all fairness to me, this is not a lavish hotel. I don't have the latitude or riches of the Hilton or Ritz Carlton  :-)    It is my well kept home that I share with travelers. 
I try to make you feel at home and satisfied. Many have said their stay was like staying with hospitable family members and I have been affectionately nicknamed "Auntie Cass". You are welcomed to book your stay at Cass' Place. If you want to sample home cooked meals, I will prepare meals and even offer shuttle at a cost upon request. I strive to create a 5☆star experience at an affordable price.  I'm interested in knowing what you are looking for in your stay. My goal is to make sure every guest has a great experience !!! I look forward to meeting you!!!
Cass ("Auntie Cass")

summary: Located in Chicago’s iconic Logan Square is within walking distance from the CTA bus stop, bike rental shop, and movie theater. And if you get bored there is a wide variety of bars and restaurants nearby to suit any palette. This cozy first floor private guest room with a Queen bed offers free parking (certain hour restrictions), shared kitchen, central AC/Heat, and free WiFi.

Logan Square is one of the city's trendiest neighborhoods, balancing family-friendly amen
neighborhood_overview: The iconic Logan Square neighborhood is about 6.5 miles from downtown Chicago. It's known for its wide boulevards, historic mansions and churches, spacious parks including the 606, community activism and a very vibrant food scene. Logan Square is one of the city's trendiest neighborhoods, balancing family-friendly amenities with a thriving nightlife. Walk along Milwaukee Avenue and you'll find cocktail bars and gastropubs as well as dive bars and late night eateries, all packed with young crowds watching local bands or playing vintage arcade games.
transit: It is minutes away from CTA Blue Line which is 24hrs and has a bus stop just few steps from the apartment. This is convenient for the weary O'Hare traveler or perfect for a private getaway from the hustle of Chicago. We’re just minutes away from downtown Chicago, where you can enjoy popular Chicago attractions such as the Magnificent Mile, Museum Campus, Millennium Park, Navy Pier, and Chicago Theaters.
interaction: If we are not at home because we are working you will be able to reach us out through texts in any moment of your stay.

transit: There is free parking on the street in front of the house. No permit required. Uber and Lyft are the best way to get around if you do not have a car. There are buses nearby that can take you anywhere in the city. The blue line (CTA Train) is a 7-minute bus ride away. Be sure to get a Ventra card (from vending machine at train station & airport) if you plan to travel by public transportation.
access: Guests have access to whole house: living room, kitchen, dining room, 1.5 bathrooms, laundry room, back yard.
interaction: I am a very casual, hands-off guy, and my dog Ebony is very friendly. I work from home, so I will be around. You are welcome to make yourself at home.
house_rules: 1. NO PARTIES OR EVENTS at the house without prior host approval. All guests must be approved before having them. Additional overnight guests may incur an extra charge. The violation of this rule may lead to the removal of all guests without refund. 2. Please observe quiet hours on the property after 10:00 PM. The house is shared with Joey and Ebony, and we have neighbors close by. 2. NO smoking in the house or in front of the house. If you need to smoke, please do so in the backyard or in the alley and dispose of cigarettes in the trash properly. Any damages from smoking, or the lingering smell of smoke, will be taken from the security deposit for cleaning, defumigation, or replacement. 3. You may come and go as you please. If you come in late, please be aware that Ebony will wake up and start barking. That is normal and okay... it's her job. Please come in quietly if it is late. 4. You are welcome to cook on the stove in the kitchen. (No oven at this time.) We have some breakfast ite
host_about:
Hi, my name is Joey, and the black beauty next to me is Ebony. We love to walk through the forest preserve every day and enjoy life.

I am a real estate investor, working from home. After 45 years in the business, I have turned my attention to helping others succeed in real estate also.

I am a vegan and love to live a healthy lifestyle.

I love my home... it is my paradise!

summary: Horror stories often happen when I accept reservations from guests who already live here. (Drug use, underage drinking, $10k robbery) Unless there's a good reason for the booking I won't accept the request if you live in Chicagoland. I'm Airbnbing a bedroom in my new construction, modern aesthetic apartment. It has a queen bed and a fancy white and glass bathroom. You can use the WD too! *Scroll down to map to intersection! G00g1e maps public transit for distances to the sights.
space: There's a private bath and bedroom across the hall. It's on the ground level, so it's handicap accessible as well as so convenient. Not a single step to enter the apartment!

I do travel occasionally, so if I'm not home and you need info on how to get to the house or how to enter,
neighborhood_overview: There's a strong Latino presence here so you can get really amazing tacos as well as this thing I discovered called "coctel de frutas". It's just a fruit salad, but with chili lime powder on top.  You wouldn't think it'd be that amazing from the description, but trust me, it's to DIE for! In addition, the neighborhood is historically Polish, so there are still many remaining Polish businesses including some really scrumptious restaurants just a few block down the road.
notes: The neighborhood is incredibly quiet and peaceful. You'll sleep like a baby.
transit: The Milwaukee bus picks up right outside the door and the Belmont and Addison Blue Line stops are about 3/4 of a mile from here.
access: There's a dishwasher, W/D, high speed wifi, and unlimited free street parking.
interaction: I will usually be around to help you get in and make sure you get settled and happy. I work from home, so I'll be here to make sure you have what you need.  I do travel occasionally, so if I'm not home and you need info on how to get to the house or how to enter, check out the house manual section that will be available to view after you book.
house_rules: PUBLIC SERVICE ANNOUNCEMENT: For the love of all that is good and holy, please take off makeup using tissue, not using white embroidered hand towels. Thank you! Pets and smoking aren't allowed in the building. No outside guests. Please don't steal my food or my anything else. You should generally just behave how you'd like a guest in your house to behave. I work from home, so I prefer if guests don't make a huge amount of noise in the common area from 9-5. Also, I never thought I'd need to say this, but I have had people go through my drawers looking for things or just exploring.  If you'd like something, please just ask! I'd be happy to find it for you if I have it.

name: Saint Ruby's Flats A - 20 minutes to  Loop by El
summary: A private bedroom for one person only in a three bedroom apartment located in Chicago's Marshall Square/Pilsen/Douglas Park neighborhood. Perfect for clinical rotations at St. Anthony's (around the corner), Mt. Sinai or in the Illinois Medical District. Please contact me before making a booking request.
space: The apartment was completely renovated recently and is located on the second floor of a three story century old vintage brick building, locally known as a three flat. Redone in the style of a "soft loft" the unit has 10 foot ceilings, spiral duct work, newly refinished hardwood maple floors and an exposed brick wall in the kitchen. This bedroom is one of three in the apartment and has a extra long twin bed with a memory foam mattress with a coil base, a desk, a closet  and additional storage in a small dresser. The apartment is shared- at a maximum - with two others. Each guest has their own bedroom. Each bedroom door has a keyed lock. The bedrooms are small but the apartment is large, open and bright. The storage in the bedroom is not cluttered with other people's belongings. It's empty and entirely available for your use.
description: A private bedroom for one person only in a three bedroom apartment located in Chicago's Marshall Square/Pilsen/Douglas Park neighborhood. Perfect for clinical rotations at St. Anthony's (around the corner), Mt. Sinai or in the Illinois Medical District. Please contact me before making a booking request. The apartment was completely renovated recently and is located on the second floor of a three story century old vintage brick building, locally known as a three flat. Redone in the style of a "soft loft" the unit has 10 foot ceilings, spiral duct work, newly refinished hardwood maple floors and an exposed brick wall in the kitchen. The apartment is shared- at a maximum - with two others. Each guest has their own bedroom. Each bedroom door has a keyed lock. The bedrooms are small but the apartment is large,
notes: For medical students completing a clinical rotation: St. Anthony's Hospital is around the corner, Mt. Sinai Hospital is six blocks away, and the Illinois Medical District (Rush, University of Illinois, Stroger and Jesse Brown Hospitals) are just 4 stops away (8 minutes)   on the Pink line El . The apartment is located  a block from the California Pink Line elevated stop which is less than 20 minutes from the Loop. There is a new large grocery stores (3 blocks away), a Walmart, a Planet Fitness,  and many restaurants within a short walking distance from the building.
transit: The apartment is located  a block from the California Pink Line elevated stop which is less than 20 minutes from the Loop. There are two grocery stores, a Walmart, a Planet Fitness,  and many restaurants within a short walking distance from the building.
access: Guests have full access to the apartment living room, the bathroom and kitchen. The kitchen is fully furnished with all new appliances (range, refrigerator, microwave and dishwasher) pots, pans, dishes, eating utensils, rice cooker and electric kettle.
interaction: I am always available, either at the building or can be reached by text, email or phone.
house_rules: The apartment is available to individuals visiting Chicago for a month or longer for professional reasons, whether that be business and job related, an internship, clinical rotation or school. A quiet, respectful, professional environment must be maintained at all times. Absolutely no smoking or partying is allowed.
host_about: I've always had a passion for travel and have been lucky enough to visit about 40 countries, most recently Vietnam, Cambodia and Taiwan. Closer to home, funky, big city neighborhoods are among my favorite places to explore.
