name: Bedrm/Bath - Swanky Northside Condo.
summary: A combination of home-style generosity and orderly AirBnB protocols will welcome you to the Far North Side with Michael and Rox.
space: Attractively appointed ground-floor bedroom and bathroom are all yours in a large new condo owned and occupied by a playful couple -- a freelance professional (journalist/professor/former concierge) and her well-read husband Michael.  FREE wifi, satellite TV (in room), laundry in unit, street parking.  Great for persons using a car or those willing to take a bus a few minutes' walk from the house to get to a variety of trains/buses, or walk one mile to numerous transport lines going south to downtown or north to the North Shore suburbs. Use of kitchen and great room would be shared with hosts.   Central a/c and heat. Target store with full grocery 1/2 block away. Richly cultural Pakistani/Indian commercial strip a short walk away on Devon Avenue.  The place is actually NOT in Rogers Park technically and definitely not "West Rogers Park" as the auto-fill says.  It's a neighborhood of apartment buildings, homes, and tree-lined streets. ............................................ Roxane
description: A combination of home-style generosity and orderly AirBnB protocols will welcome you to the Far North Side with Michael and Rox. Attractively appointed ground-floor bedroom and bathroom are all yours in a large new condo owned and occupied by a playful couple -- a freelance professional (journalist/professor/former concierge) and her well-read husband Michael.  FREE wifi, satellite TV (in room), laundry in unit, street parking.  Great for persons using a car or those willing to take a bus a few minutes' walk from the house to get to a variety of trains/buses, or walk one mile to numerous transport lines going south to downtown or north to the North Shore suburbs. Use of kitchen and great room would be shared with hosts.   Central a/c and heat. Target store with full grocery 1/2 block away. Richly cultural Pakistani/Indian commercial strip a short walk away on Devon Avenue.  The place is actually NOT in Rogers Park technically and definitely not "West Rogers Park" as the auto-fill says.
neighborhood_overview: This sleepy tree-lined area near Lake Michigan is 1/2 block from Target (with Starbuck's within).  Another mile puts you in trendy Andersonville, Edgewater and Rogers Park, or even closer to the north, Devon Avenue for Pakistani/Indian fare and shopping.  Due east is Lake Michigan with the CTA Red Line running constantly to downtown through many fun areas along the way: Uptown, Boystown, Wrigleyville, Lakeview and Lincoln Park.  It's a 10-minute bus or taxi ride through a mostly residential area to the Red Line station in bustling Edgewater.  You can also pick up a Divvy bike at the Target 1/2 block from the house and ride to the nearest CTA Red Line station (Bryn Mawr) docking the bike near there.  Walking to the Red Line takes about 20 minutes.  Suburban Chicago is a short drive away -- Lincolnwood and Skokie to the west and Evanston to the north.
notes: **ID will be required at check-in for each individual who will be staying in the lodging, regardless of who booked the space.**.............LONG STAYS and GUESTS JUST BEGINNING TO STRIKE OUT ON THEIR OWN IN LIFE: A conversation about how the kitchen functions smoothly for sharing should happen when concentration is good and details are absorbed with sincerity.  Rule of thumb about clean-up: Leave nothing but the smell.  Cookware should be washed by hand and put back in place.  Dishes in dishwasher.  Stovetop and microwave as you found them.  Sinks, counters, cutting boards cleaned, sanitizing every surface touched by chicken or liquids from chicken packaging. If you drip oil, sauce, batter, milk, water on the floor or down the front of the cabinets, clean it. ..........................................Ask for specifics about what goods are free to use up and what you should replace.  Guests are asked to let us know when something runs out, not just discard the empty container...........
transit: This sleepy tree-lined area near Lake Michigan is 1/2 block from Target (with Starbuck's within).  Another mile puts you in trendy Andersonville, Edgewater and Rogers Park, or even closer to the north, Devon Avenue for Pakistani/Indian fare and shopping.  Due east is Lake Michigan with the CTA Red Line running constantly to downtown through many fun areas along the way: Uptown, Boystown, Wrigleyville, Lakeview and Lincoln Park.  It's a 10-minute bus or taxi ride through a mostly residential area to the Red Line station in bustling Edgewater.  You can also pick up a Divvy bike at the Target 1/2 block from the house and ride to the nearest CTA Red Line station (Bryn Mawr) docking the bike near there.  Walking to the Red Line takes about 20 minutes.  Suburban Chicago is a short drive away -- Lincolnwood and Skokie to the west and Evanston to the north.
access: The master suite, study and storage areas are off-limits to guests except where accommodations have been pointed out specifically (such as a drawer and portion of the clothes closet in the guest room).
interaction: The guest accommodation is very much in the flow of the household, so we expect to interact with guests in passing, sometimes engaging in longer exchanges about the guest's Chicago experience or even further into topical discussions.  We have a history of socializing with guests who happen to enjoy our company as new friends, but basic pleasantries would be all that's expected.  Guests are free to greet and go, but it becomes less amiable if the home is treated like a hotel or commercial guesthouse.  While Roxane has worked in hotels and could see a more transactional experience as possible, Michael regards people staying as house guests and responds to Rox's hospitality cues by being genuinely open, warm and welcoming.  He is naturally curious and is exuberant when hosting, eager to hear of your Chicago experiences day by day as well as your work or creative life back home.
house_rules: No smoking; no drugs; no overnight guests; no use of owner's personal properties, amenities or consumables not mentioned in the agreement or obviously set aside for guest use; No animals. KITCHEN: We like to offer guests a spotless kitchen to feel free messing up.  We want to enter the kitchen with the same luxury greeting us.   Clean-up is 100% the guest's responsibility when using countertops, appliances, cookware, cutting boards, dining table.  That includes interiors of appliances that get spattered.  Surface cleaner, sponge, dishwashing liquid, abrasive powder and paper towels are on display for ease of use.   See detailed explanation elsewhere in this profile, or just forego using the kitchen at all.  If helpful, take a picture of the stovetop before use and model that level of clean. Host will clean kitchen sink before and after each guest stay, and host also empties dishwasher.  Guests load their own dishes into the dishwasher unless there's a clean load inside.  When dishes in
host_about: Performer/Professor/Journalist/Former Chicago Concierge from New Orleans living in Chicago for 30 years.  Lived in France and the Middle East.  (Tried several different profile pictures that weren't uploading, then discovered they ALL uploaded. Now there's an album in there! And I look like I live with a drink in my hand!  I do have fun.  But can't drink much!) Husband Michael is a legal analyst.

name: Boutique Design Condo with Rooftop Terrace
summary: Take in the sights of the Chicago skyline from this bright, inviting condo. Recharge in a modern apartment with a sprawling open-plan living area, an array of eclectic furnishings, and a private balcony walkout. Safe and secure home away from home.
space: Everything is up-to-date and modern. Hardwood floors and granite counter tops in your bathroom and kitchen. The elevator opens up into the unit on the fourth floor. There is a view of downtown Chicago from the living room and an amazing 360 degree view of Chicago from the rooftop deck.
description: Take in the sights of the Chicago skyline from this bright, inviting condo. Recharge in a modern apartment with a sprawling open-plan living area, an array of eclectic furnishings, and a private balcony walkout. Safe and secure home away from home.
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is in a lively and inviting area surrounded by iconic Chicago greystone and brownstone architectural homes, Wrigley Field, Boystown, restaurants, fashion outlets, Chicago's off-Loop theaters, wine boutiques, and independent shops.
notes: This is a solid, secure, brick, quiet building. Please let me know if you have any questions.
transit: Only a five-minute walk to the red-line train that will take you downtown or to neighborhoods up-town. Also there is a bus stop right at the corner. Street parking is available.
access: The condo is 1,800 sq. ft. You'll have access to All bedrooms, bathrooms, living room, balcony, kitchen and rooftop deck.  You'll love the rooftop deck!
interaction: I will be a phone call or text away from anything you need.
house_rules: No smoking.  No parties.  Only the people who are on the reservation are allowed in the house. Please be respectful of my place as I am trusting you with my home.  I do everything possible to make sure you have a quality place to stay while in Chicago.  If you are looking for a place to host a party there are many other options in Chicago.  Thank you.
host_about: Hello! I'm originally from Fairbanks, Alaska and lived in Anchorage, Alaska before moving to Chicago in 2011 where I own a spacious condo in East Lakeview.   I look forward to meeting you and helping you enjoy your Chicago experience.  I’m impeccably clean, friendly and responsible.  My goal is to make you feel right at home... in your home away from home.

host_about:
My dad will tell you that I get along with everybody. My mom will say “Jide makes people feel comfortable”. My older sister will tell you that I am cautious and I am a romantic. "She is my best friend but boy, is she cra-z-y”. My older brother will tell you that I am his confidant and that my fashion sense has improved overtime. My younger brother will say that I am too laid back, yet surprisingly entrepreneur minded. My younger sister will tell you that I always need an excuse to laugh. My friends will say that Jide is ambitious, funny, outgoing & addicted to personal growth. My coworkers perceive me as a team player, innocent, efficient; they call me hustle B. I would say.. I LOVE , LOVE SALSA dancing... AND potlucks!


Books: The Four agreements, Think & Grow Rich, Calling in the One, Rich Dad Poor dad, A New Earth, The Power of the Subconscious Mind, A Return to Love, Angels & Demons, 21 Irrefutable laws of leadership, Never Eat Alone ............The greatest networker in the world. TEDTalks

Authors: John Assaraf, Robert Kiyosaki, Katherine Woodard Thomas & Claire Zammit, T.Harv Eker, Tony Robbins, Deepak Chopra........ Marie Forleo

Music: I love, love to dance. Anything with a beat to it. I Love Salsa, free style, hip hop, reggae.

Shows; I don't watch much TV but if I were to pick, I'll say 24 with Jack Bauer, Scandal, Prison break, Brothers & Sisters, cooking channel

Sports: basketball_Bulls/OKC, American Football, World Football/Soccer, 

Movies: Bad boys II, A Beautiful mind, Invictus. The Secret, Down the rabbit hole, Shawshank redemption, Save the last dance, OWN channel ...

Food: Rice, beans & plantains, Chicken Makhani, Mango lassi, Thai dishes, anything with BASIL, Greek yogurt...

name: 3 BR - 2.5 BA Brick & Timber Loft with Roof Deck
summary: Our unique three-bedroom in Lakeview has expansive common areas and cozy bedrooms that make it a delight for groups or families traveling together.  The massive patio provides even more area for socializing, and it's easily accessible to everything that Lakeview offers. Our place is a short 20 minutes to the Loop. We hope you'll love it - book today!
space: You walk up a private set of stairs with an open entrance to the living, dining, and kitchen space. The entire condo has 20 ft timber ceilings and exposed ductwork. You'll love our comfortable couch and vintage dining set! Just past the living and dining room are the floor-to-ceiling sliding glass doors to the patio. Opposite that is the galley kitchen, and beyond the kitchen is a hallway that leads to the bedrooms. Total square footage of living space is 1,975 sqft with a 1,000 sqft deck.

neighborhood_overview: Lakeview is a lively neighborhood full of old Chicago charm. This apartment is perfect for groups who want to get away from the hustle and bustle of downtown while still having quick and convenient access to everything Chicago has to offer. The apartment is walking distance to the shops, restaurants and bars in the neighborhood. Guests can also easily explore the Roscoe Village and Lincoln Park neighborhoods.  In general, Chicagoans are super nice, talkative, and helpful. Chicago is home, and you’ll feel always like one of our own. Lakeview is the perfect location in Chicago. So enjoy!
transit: 5 minute walk from the nearest bus stop then to the subway that will take you all over the city (downtown and Wrigley). Otherwise, you’re a 10-15 minute Uber ride to downtown and a 21 minute Uber to O’Hare airport (no traffic). Everything is near you: Bucktown, WrigleyVille, Downtown, BoysTown, River North, etc.
access: You will have complete and private access to my apartment.
house_rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.  1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable. 2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to the designated location by the agreed upon check-out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out penalty  3.) Absolutely no smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises.  Smoking will result in a $500 fine and may result in the cancellation of your reservation. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any entrance.  4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily.  5.) Pets are not allowed at the property un
host_about:
My wife and I have lived in Chicago since 2006 (with a 4 year pit stop in NYC). We love that Chicago is a true city with a neighborhood feeling wherever you go. 

Visitors should make sure to take an architectural boat tour, grab a bite at Roister, and a drink at Violet Hour.

host_about:
I am middle age Polish-American and I live with my cousin on the 2d floor of the small house . First floor has guest bedroom and bathroom.
In the summer I like to travel to Europe and in winter anywhere south: Florida, California Mexico. ..I love good books, good movies,old movies, good theatre which we have a lot in Chicago. I like to dance and I am into healthy food and explore it all from vegan to paleo. 
I am quiet and like  my guests to feel comfortable, welcome and safe.
Always let me know if you have any questions.

summary: This cozy 1br/1ba loft is equipped with everything you need for a family vacation, work trip or a weekend getaway. It’s conveniently located in the heart of the safe yet busy south loop neighborhood. Walking distance to many Chicago attractions like Field Museum, Aquarium, Soldier Field, Grant Park, McCormick place and the lake. Easy street parking is available for your convenience should you decide to travel by car and a local metro stop is just short walk away!

space: Wilton House is a Victorian house from before 1897, decorated in a classical way but with all the conveniences of a modern house. Our house is ideal for families visiting Chicago.

name: The Wonders of Wrigley: Beautiful 3 Bed/2 Bath
summary: Welcome to the Friendly Confines of Lakeview and Wrigleyville.  Enjoy the comforts of home in this brand new renovated 3 bed/2 bath home, located in the heart of Wrigleyville neighborhood. The unit has everything you need for a wonderful and comfortable visit. It's in a prime location with easy access to Wrigley, Boystown, Red Line CTA (aka The "L"), Southport Corridor, and beautiful Lake Michigan.   The area is loaded with restaurants, bars, theaters, nightlife, and culture.
space: Located in the HEART of Wrigleyville/Lakeview, our  condo is spacious and great for vacation travel, families,  and business travel. Includes: • Central air/heat • 1800+ Square Feet.  Huge open living space with 3 bedrooms (no shared walls between bedrooms. • HDTV, cable w/ movie channels,  • Fast Wifi for streaming video • Top Floor Unit with tons of natural light. • Large Updated Kitchen and Formal Dining Room. • Plenty of clean towels, hair dryer, iron/ironing board • In-Unit Laundry (free!)

You will have acces
notes: Bedroom 1 has a queen bed. Bedroom 2 has a queen bed. Bedroom 3 has a full size bed.
transit: AMAZING access to public transportation, Ubers and taxis.  - 5 minute walk to the Red Line Addison CTA train - 8 minute walk to Belmont Red Line, Purple Line and Brown Line trains (can also get to the Belmont stop by taking the Red Line and transferring one stop at Belmont - Trains will take you directly downtown to Millennium Park, Willis Tower, Shedd Aquarium, Art Institute of Chicago, etc. - Plenty of Ubers/Lyft and taxis
access: You will have access to the entire apartment.
interaction: We are available to meet or chat with you via text or phone any time. Want to live like a local? There's so much to do in the neighborhood and we'll help guide you to all the hidden gems to make sure you have an awesome experience!
house_rules: For parties of  2  bedroom#3  will be locked and unavailable. For  parties of  1   bedroom #1 and #3 will be locked and unavailable. For parties of 3 or more all bedrooms will be available.- Be respectful of our neighbors. Please keep noise down in shared hallway and noise to a minimum after 10pm. - No access to back porch - No parties. Additional guests may not be in the apartment without prior approval. Subject to fine of $200 per person if more people are seen entering the apartment than on the reservation. Security cameras are in the stairway. - Smoking is not permitted anywhere in the building or within 15 ft of the building. Subject to $500 deep cleaning fee if there are any traces of smoking in the apartment. - If there is any damage, please let us know. - Treat the apartment like your own home. We appreciate your help making this easier!
host_about: We have lived and worked in this area for thirty-five years. We ran a Pan Asian noodle shop for twenty five years. We sold our business two years ago and have spent the last few years with a month in Thailand (winter)and a month in Greece (summer). We love Chicago, so if you need any tips please let us know.

transit: The Pink line CTA train station is 6 blocks away, super walkable distance. The Damen bus is a block away if you landed in Midway, this is the bus for you. If you're coming from Ohare I suggest an UBER/LYFT or the blue line transfer to pink and then walk down Damen.
access: Guest have access to a shared bathroom, kitchen and balcony.
interaction: Ill be at the house whenever im not working, hanging out with my girlfriend or bicycle riding through the city, expect to see me around. Im aware some people like to interact and others want their space.
house_rules: Return the key the day before you check out of the apartment.  $5 fee for key if it isn't returned upon check out. No additional unexpected guests, unless they are accounted for in the booking, ex. 2+ guest or you have talked about it with me. Please no outside shoes in the shower, bring flip flops if you wish or use plastic covers, but I disinfect the bathtub before guests arrive. You are welcome to throw out the trash as if you were in your house. It keeps the apartment smelling fresh (: If you cook, open a window. From time to time if it is a busy weekend, you may encounter other guest staying in the other available bedroom.
host_about:
There are always chill vibes in my place. You will feel right at home, I am a graphic designer by profession, I spend my night waiting tables. I do consider myself very social and comprehensive.

I also live here, so please make your reservations with the correct amount of people, because I cannot accommodate sometimes.

name: Lincoln Park/De Paul area.
summary: This classy old house, built in 1895, is totally remodeled & owner occupied. It sits in a residential neighborhood with tree-lined streets & is surrounded by coffee shops. Located 1 1/2 miles from Lake Michigan and Wrigley Field, and walking distance from the bus to Downtown and Millennium Park.
space: Large luxurious, private bedroom suite with queen sized bed and roomy sitting area that includes a queen sized futon.Included is a large private bathroom with a double sink vanity, a shower ,plenty towels bathrobe and slippers.Shampoo and shower gel , hairdryer,toothpaste etc. This suite is very cozy with its own fireplace, has a large closet, and can sleep 4 people. Accommodations are located on their own floor away from the private quarters, with a back entrance. Your also welcome to use the on-site washer & dryer ,iron and iron board.There is a microwave and refrigerator, coffee maker and dishes.

For long period of time the pricing will be adjusted, thos
neighborhood_overview: My neighborhood is on one site residential and the other site (website hidden) has lots of little places to eat ,an unique coffee/bicycle place were people take there (website hidden) is close to Lincoln Park conservatory and the Zoo .You can walk to Wrigley Field ,the John Hancock, and  theaters are down the street.
notes: This use to be a German neighborhood and you can still see that by the church ,St Alphonsus, and some of the buildings.
transit: My house is one block from the bus station to take you east to the Brown Line ,CTA,or you can walk there in 10 min.You can be in 25 min down town or to the airport.,very good location.
access: Guests will have a private entrance . For long period of time the pricing will be adjusted, those guest can make use of the kitchen.
interaction: I have lived in my home and this area for 30+ years and enjoy traveling, dining, and partaking in all the culture and activities that Chicago offers. I am a native Dutch speaker and can also speak German.  I am looking forward to sharing my home with you.
house_rules: I don't take dogs or cats . Don't be loud after 12 am because most people are sleeping.  No smoking. Leave dirty dishes in plastic tub.
host_about:
I am from the Netherlands,lived in Germany and Switzerland before I came here.I have three daughters and five grandchildren,my husband was from Greece. I still have family in Athens and we had one of the girls baptized there and an other one got married there.When my middle daughter studied in Florence ,Italy we  went many times to see her.I enjoy art and good food.I like to read love a good book,enjoy the movies and have a subscription to the Lyric Opera and try to go to as many concerts as I can .
We are not far from Wrigley Field and if i can't go to a baseball game there I will see it on the t.v. I like sports,golf ,tennis ,soccer.The little kids here play soccer and I go to their games.
I love Chicago and I have lived here now for over 50 years which was not my intention but this place is very international and very welcoming and I stayed.

name: Pup Friendly, Tropically Inspired, Back Yard!!
summary: Cute 2.5 bedroom apartment in North Avondale that is pup friendly! Nice back yard to lounge in and a fun, tropical setting to relax in at the end of day after exploring Chicago. Close to Addison bus line and 20 min walk to the Addison blue line. Close to the highway with a beautiful park block away. Walking distance to really great eateries including Cuban, Thai and American/Bars! *please note - this is MY HOME, not an extra unit I’m renting. I do actually live here when there are no guests!*
space: Dog friendly - bowls and crates available for use if needed! There is an installed pet gate for pets comfort and safety and can be moved to block certain areas if needed. Beds and blankets available as well upon request. Big back yard and plenty of balls to throw around! There is only one TV in one of the bedrooms as I do not watch TV and believe that life is made up of experiences, not sitting behind a screen. Feel free to move it to fit your needs but I do hope people who are coming to visit Chicago enjoy the city and all it has to offer! ❤️ All rooms are pictured - please take note of that! There is also a back porch that has seating for 3-4 people. Feel free to bring inside metal chairs outside to use at mosaic red table. My neighbors broke my outdoor chairs so therefore keep my chairs inside now and bring them out when ready to use!

Feel free to move it to fit your needs but I do hope people who are coming to visit Chi
neighborhood_overview: Very close to an AMAZING Cuban cafe. I’m Cuban and it’s legit. Only 1 block and easy to walk to. I usually walk down, grab a coffee and take a stroll around our really nice park! One of the best Thai restaurants in the city is also a block away and definitely worth checking out. A great coffee (with amazing donuts!!) is a very enjoyable 20 min walk. The path leads through one of the nicest and most beautiful neighborhoods in Chicago!
notes: I have lots of great info on things to do for free or cheap in Chicago because my motto is - if it's free, it's for me!
transit: Bus stop is one block away, L is an approximate 15 min walk and Grayland Metra is a 5 min walk. I am also just a few minutes off the highway! I would estimate I’m a $20-25 Lyft/Uber ride from Ohare!
access: Washer and dryer is one floor below in basement and belongs to just me (M-F and shared with upstairs tenant on weekend). Big back yard!
interaction: I'll be in and out of town with my own dog so you might see us or some of friends to help you check in! I'm accessible pretty much 24/7 via text/email as I work in the ER. I travel a lot for volunteer projects and therefore I rent out my apartment to help supplement that. This is my HOME, an actual living residence for my dogs and I. Please understand that this is not an extra property I own to make money but that I do in fact actually live here. I recently had a guest who thought they were renting a boutique hotel type home and that is not the case - just an FYI :)
house_rules: - Front half of unit is over a garden unit apartment so please no running, stomping or loud noises, especially after 10 pm :) I like my neighbors and they like me!

name: Luxurious & Newly Designed Studio $1750 MAY
summary: A fully furnished home for your longer stay, complete with WiFi and everything you need to live. AFFORDABLE MONTHLY RATES ARE AVAILABLE!!! MAY - $1750 Welcome to Chicago, home of the World Series Champs, the Cubs. Our Studio condo is a perfect place to stay on any Chicago getaway, whether business or vacation. It is professionally designed with a full kitchen, living room, and modern decor.
space: In the heart of trendy Boystown Chicago, our sophisticated studio apartment is the perfect launchpad for Windy City adventures or clinching that important business deal. Whatever brings you to town, you’ll rest easy in our charming, quiet neighborhood with easy access to the Red Line train to take you south to Downtown or north to Loyola and Evanston. Illuminated by sunny natural light, our studio features Queen-size bed, premium linens, and plenty of closet space so you can unpack and forget about your suitcase for a while. Enjoy the privacy of your own room, with doors that close and independently controlled air-conditioning units. The apartment includes one full bathroom, with a shower, sink, and toilet. We’re all about helping you look (and smell) your best, so we provide shampoo, conditioner, and body wash in addition to hand soap and fluffy towels. Trust us when we say there’s no better way to warm up after a Windy City walk than a hot shower! There’s ample space for guests to re

neighborhood_overview: What’s better than staying in the heart of Downtown Chicago? How about an apartment that gives you the best of both worlds: minutes from the most exciting attractions of the Magnificent Mile and Navy Pier, but far enough away that you can get a taste of authentic Chi-Town life like a local. Our place is a 10-minute walk from the Wellington L Station which can take you straight into Downtown. Our neighborhood itself, though, is best explored foot, so you can meander through the quaint boutiques and tasty eateries while enjoying the lush trees that line the streets. Walk just 10 minutes east and you’ll stumble upon the spectacular Lakefront Trail, which offers panoramic views of Lake Michigan and is a fantastic place to run, walk, and people watch. You’ll never go hungry in this ‘hood. Some of our favorite places to eat include Crisp, known for Korean-style fried chicken, Chilam Balam for Mexican small plates, and the delicious Mediterranean fare at Troy. When you’re craving something sw
notes: -There are many units inside this building. -All guest need to be attentive with the house rules during their stay as there are other tenants at the property. -Bath towels are provided per number of guest not per number of stay -Washcloths are not provided during your stay. You may send me a message though if you need them and I'll try my best to accommodate your request. -We have duvet covers on our bedding  (no top sheets). -Security Deposit maybe required on the following bookings: 1) Last minute bookings 2) Short weekend stays 3) Large groups  4) Guests with no reviews 5) Guests with incomplete profile 6) Instant Bookings  7) Some properties may not allow locals for short term reservations. -Please be aware that if you lose the key and/or entry fob which is your access to the unit, it cannot be replaced for you immediately and you may lose access to the apartment and all amenities until another one can be made. There is a $200 fee for lost keys. -If there's an issue during your sta
transit: Why break the bank with a pricey rental car when you can take advantage of Chicago’s top-notch public transportation system? Our place is just a 10-minute walk from Wellington Station, where you can catch the Brown Line and the Purple/Red Line. Any line will take you to Downtown Chicago in just about 15 minutes, or you can head north to Uptown or Evanston on the Red Line, which later turns into the Purple Line. Flying into Chicago? We’re a 25-minute drive from O’Hare when there is no traffic, but if there is traffic you may be better off taking public transit (and saving some $$ on the taxi or Uber fare). Take the Blue Line from O’Hare to Clark/Lake, then transfer to the Brown Line to Wellington Station. Or, transfer from the Blue Line to the bus, depending on what time of day you’re traveling. In addition to public transit, ridesharing (Uber or Lyft) is also a great way to get around the Chicago metro. When you’re heading out with a group or want that extra little bit of luxury, just
access: Ever dreamed about jetting off to your own Chicago apartment? Well, now’s your chance to bring that fantasy to life. During your stay, the whole apartment is yours and only yours.
interaction: We’re all about giving you plenty of privacy and personal space, so we’ll be available by phone (call or text) during your stay.
house_rules: HOUSE RULES Please review and adhere to the following to avoid penalties and/or cancellation of booking: -No Drugs; Do not engage in any ILLEGAL activities anywhere on the property; ONLY guests included on the reservation are permitted on the premises. Fines will be issued for breaking these rules (Fine $100-$250). -If you break or damage something, please let me know and arrange for its replacement or repair. - The cleaning fee outlined in the profile is included to clean the place after your stay, however, if you leave the place excessively dirty, we may charge up to $100 additionally for the extra work incurred. -Quiet hours must be observed between 10pm-8am. -Lost key fee - $300 -Unsalvageable stained linens - $15/pc. -Unsalvageable stained towels - $10/pc. -Smoking - $300 -Unauthorized bringing of pets - $300 Only cats are allowed in the building with corresponding pet fee
host_about:
Hostly was established in 2017 to help hosts and property owners navigate the wonderful world of Airbnb and vacation rentals. 

Our team of expert hosts are here to ensure your guests’ — and your — experience is awesome, and take the hassle out of your Airbnb or other short-term property rental management.

The team at Hostly is made up of talented local and international staff with extensive property management and hosting experience and will create a customized plan that incorporates your objectives, goals, and budget with utmost  transparency and clarity to grow a mutual partnership.

As metro Chicago's premier property management company with its strong local connections, Hostly offers a full line of services to create the best vacation rental experience.

Our services include: marketing, booking and payments, guest vetting, enhanced pricing model, guest support, on-site staffing coordination, cleaning service, and key delivery and checking in and out. We also offer value add-ons such as design and staging, creating your listing, and basically sharing our industry knowledge with you.

Today, Hostly stands out in the crowded property management field as the boutique vacation rental and BnB super hosts because of our consistent track record, our team and our focus on impeccable service as reflected in its online reputation and reviews.

If your looking for the city’s bright lights and lively energy downtown is only 30 min away. Park and fly now available please inquire for more details. If you would like to use your own product just have to make sure they are meant for high efficiency machines.

If you prefer to walk to orange line takes about 30-40 minutes to train station  Brochure available for bus/train lines   Easy 3 minute walk to 63rd bus line to take toward midway airport. Russell

name: ROWULA HOUSE - WARM AFRICAN HOSPITALITY IN CHICAGO
summary: Rowula House has two bedrooms in the upper level apartment, both are for rent to guests. Guests rooms are private, but will share living room and dining area, furnished exclusively for their use. There is an exercise bike, an exercise ball, and an exercise swing walker on the veranda for guests' use. neighborhood_overview: Rowula House is a short distance from the historic Jackson Park, the soon to become home of the former President Barack Obama's presidential library, with it's state of the art habor station, long beach front, a birds sanctuary, and a golf course right next to the South Shore Cultural Center.  The University of Chicago campus and hospitals in the neighboring Hyde Park neighborhood is just a few miles away. And the new extension of Lake Shore Drive, which next to Rowula House, snakes along the entire length of Lake Michigan's beautiful sand beaches with bicycle tracks that makes the run every cyclist's dream.
notes: Guests should expect a very warm welcome from a host whose experience working in the Guest Services department  of a hotel qualifies him to provide exceptional hospitality. As a public chauffer, his customer service experience has also prepared him to meet, greet, and comfortably interact with guests from many social and cultural backgrounds.
transit: A Metra Station is just around the corner from Rowula House. Metra trains run from Chicago's downtown Union Station to all corners of the Windy City and the surrounding Suburds. Next to the homes are also located several CTA bus and train stops. Additionally, Omar, a public chauffer, is able to pick-up and drop off guests from and to airports and local tourists attractions.
access: Except for the private rooms, which have locks, guests will have access to most other areas of the home.
interaction: Omar, the owner, works in the hospitality industry and sometimes stays in the basement apartment with it's separate bedroom, bathroom and amenities. Guests, while guaranteed privacy in their apartment, could reach the host by phone for assistance when he is around.

neighborhood_overview: For a feel of the youthful, creative energy on Chicago's northwest side, make your way to the eclectic cross-sections of West Town, Ukrainian Village and East Village. You'll pass colorful galleries and museums, independent theater companies, small-scale music venues and retail boutiques touting lines from local designers. Mixed in are historic churches, brick cottages, quaint coffee shops and a booming restaurant and bar scene. Day and night, these communities offer a multitude of things to do, all with a low-key vibe and within an easy stroll. Whether you are looking for a brunch spot, antique furniture or vintage accessories — or you want to seek out traces of the area's humble immigrant history — wander block by block along the main arteries Division, Chicago and Grand Avenue.
notes: In addition to easy access to and from O'Hare Airport, we're also close to [sightseeing], and conveniently located near the Empty Bottle and Subterranean music venues. It's a 5 minute walk each to St Mary and St Elizabeth Hospital campuses, and a 10 minute drive to Lincoln Park, Logan Square, and a 20 minute drive to the Loop. And, since we're so close to Ukrainian Village, you'll find plenty of Ukrainian cultural monuments, including the Ukrainian Institute of Modern Art, several churches, and countless restaurants.
transit: The Western Blue Line stop is about a mile / 15 minute walk north - easily accessible on the 49/Western bus, which has a stop just across Western Ave! The Damen Blue Line stop is a mile northeast as well, though not as easily accessible via bus line, and the 70/Division bus is nearby too, so it's easy to get around here without a car. If you do bring a car, however, there's plenty of street parking in the neighborhood.
access: You'll have full access to my 2 bedroom, 1 bath apartment.
house_rules: House Rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.   1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable.  2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee.  3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance.  4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily.  5.) Pets are not allowed at the property.

name: Modern luxurious apartment in hip Logan Square
summary: Experience Chicago from this brand new, spacious apartment in the heart of Logan Square. This is the best location you could hope for. A short walk to the "California Blue line" train station provides easy access to all Chicago has to offer. Walk to famous Logan Square nightlife, restaurants, and parks. For drivers, parking is free and plentiful & 90/94 expressway is blocks away. I personally have 10 other listings on Airbnbs but this apartment is my actual home.
space: This is brand new construction completed in the summer of 2019.  Everything is brand new.  Convenient keypad entry and self check-in.   The bedroom is absolutely gigantic by Chicago standards.  You get your own bathroom located right outside your bedroom door.  For anyone allergic to cats or dogs, no pets have ever lived here!

neighborhood_overview: Logan Square is one of the hottest neighborhoods in the entire country let alone Chicago! It is exactly where you want to be when visiting Chicago. Two Chicago neighborhoods—Wicker Park and Logan Square—were recently singled-out in a list of the nation’s 25 coolest neighborhoods. Published by HotSpot Rentals, the rundown considered factors such as transit, affordability, restaurants, and weather while drawing its information from popular websites Yelp, Trip Advisor, TimeOut, Walk Score, and Apartment List. Wicker Park and Logan Square respectively ranked 22nd and 19th and scored well with regards to walkability, transportation, and budget. LOGAN SQUARE — Described as the "Midwest headquarters of hip," Logan Square has been named one of the 15 "hottest urban retail markets across North America." RESTAURANTS: - Revolution Brewing (lively, chef-driven pub fair) -Boiler Room (hippest pizza place in town with lots of craft beer, and a great beer garden) -Lula Cafe (Inventive, market-driven
transit: Walk to the Blue line "el" train which can take you straight to O'hare Airport or Downtown. It is the only train that connects O'hare and Downtown without any transfers! Super easy! The "el" can take you to all the top tourist destinations: - Millenium Park ("The Bean") - Shedd Aquarium, Field Museum & Planetarium - The Willis/Sears Tower Skydeck - Art Institute - Mag Mile -Wrigley Field (with one transfer) -Soldier Field -Downtown The free Lincoln Park zoo & beach is straight down the street.  There's a bus stop that takes you there right outside the building.
interaction: I'm 100% available to answer all of your questions and make recommendations but I will mostly stay out of your way.

neighborhood_overview: Tucked on Chicago's North Side between North Center and Lakeview, Roscoe Village is a collection of laid-back taverns, destination brunch restaurants that all seem to have pretty sidewalk patios and friendly beer gardens during the warm-weather months and cozy fireplaces and nooks during the colder ones. Dining ranges from traditional comfort food to Turkish, burgers to bakeries, Cuban to creamy custards — all serving up casual hospitality.
transit: We're just steps to the Damen and Belmont buses - you won't have any trouble getting around town without a car from here! If you do bring your car, however, there's plenty of street parking in the neighborhood.

name: Spacious, private entry and disinfected!
summary: 750 square ft  1 bedroom space tastefully decorated and well equipped. Sleeps 4, 5 with a extra twin mattress. Queen bed in private bedroom, full size futon in Living room.  Located in "a walkers paradise" in vibrant Lincoln Square.  Steps to the Rockwell brown line el station, restaurants, a bagel shop, and yoga studio.  A few blocks away are shops, restaurants and a movie theater!  Easy street parking with free permit provided.
space: A perfect home base for your Chicago stay; whether its a family visit,  summer concerts, or just a memorable city escape!  My guests often comment on how comfortable and inviting the space is.  A 50 inch TV in LR with cable including HBO.  I am happy to host children, who will love the reading nook!   For the little ones  I offer a portable crib, stroller, and high chair. We have wonderful parks and playgrounds nearby.  Lincoln Square is exceptionally family friendly!

neighborhood_overview: My house is a certified historic Chicago bungalow  located in a lovely enclave of single family homes known as Ravenswood Gardens, a planned community from 1910, on the east bank of the Chicago River.  It is a sweet spot in the universe, you will be glad you discovered it!
notes: This is a quiet residential area. Out of respect for my neighbors, loud parties are not permitted.  Small summer gatherings on the patio are welcome, as long as they end at a reasonable hour.
transit: The CTA brown line el is literally around the corner, with frequent trains to downtown (about 40 mins) and to Wrigley Field (even closer), and other places of interest. Bus lines within a few blocks will get you anywhere you want to go. The divvy shared bike station is steps away.  The best way to get around--walking!
access: Full size washer and dryer in kitchenette available for your use, no extra charge. Refrigerator is an under the counter stainless, and brand new. It has a small freezer compartment. No stove, but I do provide a coffeemaker, electric tea pot, microwave, slow cooker and electric skillet for preparing meals. I do not allow guests to bring in and use other appliances.  You have great access to restaurants for take out too!  I share with guests the use of my delightful patio for grilling and dining, just ask! Easy street parking with a resident permit which I can provide. However, you really don't need a car!
interaction: I live upstairs and like to meet my guests at check in if possible, but self check-in is available. I am available via cell if you have questions, but otherwise I will respect your privacy.  I am a former architectural docent and am happy to share my knowledge and love of Chicago and my wonderful neighborhood. If you need help with planning your visit, just ask!
house_rules: Primary guest must be over the age of 25 Guests who stay more than 1 week must give me access to do laundry at a mutually convenient time.

name: West Loop Modern Urban Retreat
summary: Explore all Chicago has to offer from this centrally located getaway located in the heart of the West Loop Fulton Market meat packing district!
space: You will have your own private entrance in the back of the building with your very own parking space for those of you driving or renting a car. The 3rd floor will be your own private living space that includes the bedroom, tv lounge area, office, wallk-in closet and private bathroom with a washer and dryer.  All fresh linens, towels, shampoo/conditioner & toothpaste are included with your stay.  I also include a complimentary  sampling of products for you to enjoy from my skin boutique that is separately located on the second floor in the front of the building.    Downstairs is the living room and dining area with  access to the back porch with seating, tables and a grill to use at your leisure.   The kitchen is fully stocked with anything and all you might have in your very own kitchen.  Unlimited coffee and snacks are yours for the taking.

The kitchen is fully stocked with anything and all you might have in your very own kitchen.  Unlimited coffee and snacks are yours for the taking. Yo
neighborhood_overview: I love my neighborhood!  You'll see why when you stay here!
notes: I have owned a small facial boutique in Chicago for 14 years. It is open 5 days a week with the opening hours between 10pm-8pm and is by appointment only.  The boutique is a privately divided area on the 2nd floor with a separate private entrance. The kitchen is shared during business hours basically to fix lunch make an espresso or grab a cleaning supply. The vibe is very chill and cozy.  I enjoy the communal setting where everyone is able to enjoy the space yet do their own thing.  No one lives in the space so you will have complete privacy in the mornings, early afternoon and in the evenings.   The bonus? You can book a facial or massage during your stay.  True VIP hook up!
transit: Location Location Location!!! You couldn't stay at a more conveniently located place! Literally steps from the Green Line station. Three stops from the loop. Two stops from the METRO. Blocks away from the expressway. Cabs  all the time It doesn't get any more accessible than this!  You will be staying right down the street from some of the best restaurants in town: NEXT, Roister, Aviary, La Sirena. Down the street from the Publican. And only 2 blocks away from Randolph Street eatery row: Girl and the Goat, Au Cheval, Black Bird etc.  If you need groceries, Jewel, Whole Foods and Marianos close by.  If your coming into town for one of the many awesome festivals Chicago hosts you'll be in the right spot.  A quick 8 block walk or one L station away from Union Park where Pitchfork and Northcoast Fests are held. 5 stations away (10 min) from Lollapalooza, Blues and Jazz Fest.
access: You'll have access to basically everything.
interaction: I enjoy meeting new guests and sharing experiences and places I frequent in this fabulous city, wether it be main attractions or off the beaten path hidden gems, I'll help you see it all.  I also host along with my boyfriend Jeff a private room in our loft just located around the corner on Fulton Mkt Street so, we are always available to assist and help in any way.  My experience with Airbnb has been top notch and the people I've met along with their experience traveling here always makes me truly appreciate this amazing city I live in!
house_rules: There will be a handful of requests.  Take off shoes before going upstairs.  Turn off the lights when you leave and when you retire at night.  You know nothing out of the ordinary.  The same things you probably do in your own home.
host_about: We know all the "spots" to eat, drink, see, shop and experience. And what better place to chill after a fun day than at the Loft. We might even make you a drink!

name: The Paris Room in Logan Square
summary: FREE PRIVATE PARKING INCLUDED!! Welcome to the Paris Room located in Logan Square, one of Chicago's most popular neighborhoods! Your private bedroom and bathroom is located in one of the most convenient parts of town. Access downtown Chicago in minutes as well as enjoy some of the finest restaurants, bars, and coffee shops that Illinois has to offer. Logan Square is considered one of the most artistic Chicago neighborhoods and is sure to be a great destination for any visitor.
space: Your room is one bedroom of four total bedrooms in the apartment. There will be two other bedrooms being rented in tandem with this bedroom as well as your hosts bedroom. The Paris bedroom is the only rented bedroom located on the basement level and has plenty of privacy including it's own private bathroom and semi-private entrance.  Guests are welcome to shared use of the entire apartment including the kitchen, living room, fitness area, balcony, and laundry room (laundry use is free). FREE PRIVATE PARKING INCLUDED

neighborhood_overview: Logan Square is one of the friendliest and booming neighborhoods in Chicago with plenty of nightlife options on every corner. The Brown Room is within a few blocks of Revolution Brewery, Logan Bar, Cole's, The Boiler Room, Las Estrellas Negros and a host of other hot spots (and for mornings - 3 blocks south is the much loved Cozy Corner Diner for pancakes, skillets, bacon and eggs). Vegetarians & Vegans will enjoy the highlylauded Chicago Diner, right around the corner from the house. I'm just a few blocks from The Logan Theater, a restored vintage movie theater and comedy showcase room with it's own bar , and on the corner from the theater there's no "banker with a motorcar", but you will see an actual barber shop called Penny Lane : ) Also just a block away is the local cannabis dispensary.
notes: Please note that this is a private bedroom and bathroom only in a shared apartment. It is possible there will be other guests also staying at this apartment during your visit. All rooms all completely private and have interior locks for your peace of mind and security.
transit: Public trans (Blue Line train and street buses) are within two blocks. You can get downtown within 20 minutes and the blue line train will get you out to O'Hare International Airport within 35 minutes.
access: Guests will have a private bedroom and private bathroom as well as 2 off-street parking spots to use for either two small cars or one large car.  Please note that this is a private bedroom and bathroom only in a shared apartment. It is possible there will be other guests also staying at this apartment during your visit. All rooms all completely private and have interior locks for your peace of mind and security.
interaction: As a host, I will generally be around to answer any questions or assist in any way. I also stay at this residence in one of the basement rooms and will be the point of contact throughout your stay.
house_rules: No parties or guests allowed other than guests disclosed in reservation request Clean up after oneself, clean any used dishes etc. 420 friendly and smoking permitted on outside balcony only.  Smoking is not permitted within the unit.

neighborhood_overview: It's quiet and safe for a Chicago neighborhood.  My guest have never had any problems in the neighborhood and they walk to the train.  I would advise ladies to take Uber after midnight. My neighborhood is not close to downtown, but it is easy and quick to get downtown via public transportation.  If you are a very light sleeper there is a freight train that comes occasionally behind my house, only very light sleepers are bothered by it.
notes: Please see pictures and room description for Quiet Room also in my home for more information and pictures about my home.
transit: Public transportation is right at my corner for the #3 King Drive bus.  The Red Line train is within walking distance.  I can also give you a link to Uber or Lyft!
access: Shared bathroom, shared TV room, and kitchen.
interaction: We greet our guest and are open to answer any questions you may have.
house_rules: No shoes worn upstairs, at any time.  No smoking in the house.  No suitcases on the bed.  Clean up all common areas after yourself.
host_about: I am an outgoing person who loves to travel and have fun.  When I am home, I am quiet and cool, usually reading, grading papers or watching TV.  I am easy to get along with because I love people, especially children.  I love to dance, workout, and entertain guest in my backyard (in the summer). I love sharing my home with visitors because I enjoy meeting new people!  The other person in the picture is Alden my house manager!  If I’m not around, he’ll be there to take excellent care of you.

name: 3 Bedroom / 2 Bathroom - Downtown Grand park
summary: This incredibly spacious 3Bdr 3 Bath apartment has incredible floor to ceiling windows that you can gaze out of to see the beautiful city of Chicago. You can even see Chicago's famous Grant Park outside of the windows. We are just a few blocks away from the park. Minutes away from this apartment are Chicago's CTA lines allowing for quick and easy transportation around our amazing city. And for our out of state guests. the CTA lines also conveniently take you to Chicago O'Hare Airport.
space: This is a super spacious 3 BR apartment where you will have 3 private rooms with a queen size bed in each, and 1 fold away sofa and 1 roll away bed in the common area. Cooking in this modern kitchen is a pure pleasure if you want to save some money on restaurants. This place has everything you need. Quiet yet located in the center of everything, luxurious yet affordable. Inside the apartment you will see hardwood floors, large walk in closets, and 10ft ceilings. This building features a 24/7 concierge service to help you anytime that you need. We have amenities such as a large full size gym, a large contemporary kitchen, Restaurant / Bar located conveniently inside the building, and an on site market.

neighborhood_overview: Loop architecture has been dominated by skyscrapers and high-rises since early in its history. Notable buildings include the Home Insurance Building, considered the world's first skyscraper (demolished in 1931); the Chicago Board of Trade Building, a National Historic Landmark; and Willis Tower, the world's tallest building for nearly 25 years. Some of the historic buildings in this district were instrumental in the development of towers. Chicago's street numbering system – dividing addresses into North, South, East, and West quadrants originates in the Loop at the intersection of State Street and Madison Street. This area abounds in shopping opportunities, including the Loop Retail Historic District, although it competes with the more upscale Magnificent Mile area to the north. It includes Chicago's former Marshall Field's department store location in the Marshall Field and Company Building; the original Sullivan Center Carson Pirie Scott store location (closed February 21, 2007). Chi

name: Graffiti Garden Room Bed & Bath
summary: Finished basement in single family home: Queen bed- memory foam, Queen air bed & Ikea Friheten Queen size Sofa Bed. Room sleeps total 6 people. Private bathroom newly remodeled March 2018! Private entrance exit included. Free, no hassle parking. Safe to walk at night. Relaxed, quiet environment near midway airport, public park, CTA & race track.  LGBTQ  welcomed in our home! PET FEE 4 fur babies. READ ALL HOUSE RULES! Budget private room in same house, see other listing  LAVENDER RM LUSH BED
space: Very traditional for the area in this type of home a Chicago basement room. The Graffiti on the walls created by local Chicago graffiti artist. Most artwork, canvas paintings and photography by personal friends or family. If you are offended by artwork that displays nudity, violence, urban decay, sex , drugs, rock & roll or just plain can't stand the sight of a skull, please do not book here.  There is no TV, electronics or stereo in the room at the moment.  There is a Queen size bed that fits two people, a Queen size sofa bed that fits two more people and a Queen size air mattress is available for a two additional people. Please realize that it will be a tight fit, as all the beds will be in same room. The floor of bedroom is vinyl tile. Bathroom and kitchen are ceramic tile. The home is supplied with central heat and air conditioning, because this is a basement room, it does tend to be cooler than the rest of the home. neighborhood_overview: Very safe residential area, we are in Chicago but have a suburb feel.  Quiet, clean, working- middle class family oriented neighborhood near public skate park, midway airport, CTA, race track and free abundant parking! You will feel comfortable walking home alone during late nights if need be.  Garfield Ridge/ Vittum park neighborhood located 10 miles from downtown. Just 2 miles from Chicago Midway Airport and 1 mile from I -55/ Stevenson expressway. There is Vittum Chicago public park  2 blocks away with a tennis court, basketball court , children's playground and skating ramp. This is a residential location with ample free parking, perfect if you rent a car. We are down the street from Our Lady of Snows Elementary school and church. I have very active and friendly neighbors, please feel free to say hello and let the neighbor  know that you are a guest of mine should they seemed alarmed about a new face on the block. There are a few locally owned bars and fast food places walking dist
notes: Although we are avid music lovers, this is a quiet , low volume home due to our busy days, we highly value coming home to a peaceful and relaxing atmosphere, perfect if you want to study or get some work done, guest are encouraged to keep entertainment noise contained to their perspective room, with volume low or use headphones, in particular during the weekdays! The room is down a flight of stairs and separated from the rest of the house by a curtain.  There is no door, only this curtain. Additional privacy can be added by a room divider that is set up for you at the foot of staircase/ entrance to the room. You will have privacy but no sound barrier, meaning if we are on the main floor/ kitchen you will hear us and we will hear you. This might be an issue if you are a light sleeper or extremely value a sound barrier. There maybe two or three people living in the home at the time of your stay. Weekdays, we get up around 630am and will be busy in the kitchen making some noise with break
transit: There are four bus routes just a 10 min walk / half a mile away. #62 bus- Travels East,  takes you straight into Chinatown and  Downtown, stops at Orange line on the way #62H bus -travels East and West takes you to midway airport/ Orange line #47 st bus- travels mostly directly east, all the way to Lakefront , stops at red line on way, short trip West to Orange line/Midway airport at some non peak hours  #54B Cicero Bus- Travels North and South, takes you to pink line and Orange LINE The nearest Metra stop is the BNSF Railway in Cicero, Il. Just about 3 miles away.
access: Please feel free to use the kitchen and front room on the main floor.  If weather permits, feel free to hang out in the backyard.  You may enter and exit through the front or back door, most people use the front door because it is easier.  There is an home alarm, will set up a code for you to use before you arrive.   Do not come upstairs to the 2nd floor, this is our bedroom area which may include another guest, we value our privacy as much as you value yours. The only guest allowed on 2nd floor is guest who is renting a bedroom on that floor. If you need something do not come upstairs to look for it, please give a shout, call, text or email and I will gladly try and help you get what you need.
interaction: We work and go to school during the weekdays. More flexible with our time on the weekends. Up for a chat, give suggestions for your trip and be available for you, should you have questions but depending on the time and days you will be here, we might hardly see each other.  As much privacy as you desire will be respected and provided. PREFERRED MODE OF CONTACT IS AIRBNB MESSENGER SYSTEM. Text and phone calls are acceptable but please try and use the Airbnb messenger system as main mode of communication.
house_rules: Please READ ALL THE RULES before booking, this helps to ensure both a happy guest and host!! Happy people are awesome!!  -If you need an odd hour early check-in,  late check-out or luggage storage, I am flexible with times but let's discuss before completing reservation and there will be a $25 dollar charge to your reservation for early check -in this includes luggage storage. Your room may still be in use by previous guest and I need time to make it clean and ready for you so early check-in is not always available! IF YOU CHECK OUT LATE AND ITS NOT PREARRANGED at least 24 hrs before check-out,  YOU WILL BE CHARGED $25 every 15 minutes past CHECK OUT TIME, this charge starts 1 minute after the check out time and this is not a joke, holding up cleaning the room for another guest or for whatever reason I desire, is quite rude and I expect that you leave at the scheduled time. This includes luggage storage which is $25.  Dear Instant book guest and SAME DAY BOOKERS, if you make your reser
host_about:
I am professional in the Women's health field. I have both an undergrad and  graduate degree from the College of Nursing at UIC.  I work in a local Healthcare Center.
I am fluent in Spanish. Chicago Native. 
I enjoy Bikram yoga, jogging, photography, traveling, art walks, and I am a complete MUSIC NERD, listening to records, love live music, will travel long distance even out of country for a show or favorite musician..... 

Before the airbnb era, I often house swapped, couch surfed, traded room& board for a service, used other popular websites to find room rentals, etc! 

Favorite quote “What would life be if we had no courage to attempt anything?”
― Vincent van Gogh

I have traveled extensively, having been to several countries outside of North America, I most often prefer the comfort of a home when away, rather than a posh hotel. For both economical and sustainable reasons, most of these travels have been on a budget, in which I prefer to defer the big tourist hot spots, and spend my money in local communities.  Live like a local is our travel motto!!

So far I have hosted a very diverse array of guests: medical & nursing students, people here for internships, work projects, railroad engineers, vacationers, last minute get-away trips, road trip pit stops, stranded at the airport, music festival junkies, the list goes on, feel free to add yourself to the list!!  Our longest airbnb reservation was for an international graduate student  who stayed 8 months as she awaited her work visa to be approved,  while working as an accountant at a manufacturing company a few miles away from our home. Our shortest airbnb reservations are one nighters who sometimes just want a few hours of sleep or rest while stranded or waiting on a flight from midway airport, but even o'hare airport has provided us some lovely guest as well!

name: HyggeHideout: Cozy 1BR, Free Parking in WickerPark
summary: Charming 1BR in the heart of Wicker Park with all the amenities. Great for 1 to 4 guests. Around the corner from the hottest bars, restaurants, and shopping in the city. 10-minute walk to the Damen Blue Line. Free parking (but you'll need a permit sticker, which we provide). This is the bottom unit of a family duplex. The owners & their 2 children live in the unit above. It is quiet & comfortable, but you may hear walking—standard for city living. NOTE: All guests must be listed when booking.
space: You'll be enjoying the lower apartment of a beautiful brick duplex on a tree-lined street in Wicker Park. The space has a separate entry, private bathroom, and room for two guests in a queen-sized bed and two on a sofa pullout in the living room. The apartment is a well-insulated garden unit and naturally stays very cool, even during the hottest days of summer. However, if you need some extra air flow, there are fans in the bedroom closet. It's just a 10-minute walk from the Damen Avenue Blue Line stop. You'll get great rest in a quiet area, and the best spots to eat and drink will still be right around the corner.

neighborhood_overview: Wicker Park is one of the hottest neighborhoods in Chicago, with tons of activities and restaurants nearby and easy access to the Blue Line. From the Damen Ave Blue Line, you can easily get to Logan Square (another hot spot) or the West Loop, which is the home of Restaurant Row with the best bars and restaurants in the city. The 1990s saw a wave of artists, and the neighborhood remains a diverse mix of families and singles with lots of growing infrastructure.
transit: PLEASE READ CAREFULLY (so you don't get an expensive parking ticket): Parking *is available,* but our street is on the permit system. All you need to do is fill out a parking sticker (instructions are on the house guide) and stick it inside your windshield. Please make sure you're replacing your sticker daily — parking is strictly enforced on our street, and we're not responsible if you run afoul of the meter maid. - The easiest way to get around is via public transportation. - The Blue Line is an easy 10-minute walk right around the corner. - And major buses run every few minutes on Division (bus 70) and Damen (bus 50). - Pick up a Ventra card at the Damen Ave Blue Line station, which works on both trains and buses ($2.25 for the first ride, and $0.25 for transfers.)
access: - Queen-sized bed with comfortable mattress and new, high-thread-count bedding. - HD television with Sling and Netflix. - Fully outfitted kitchen with coffee for the morning. - Spacious bathroom with new fixtures, fresh towels, and bath products. - Blowdryer, iron, and ironing board. - In-unit heat. The apartment stays very cool in the summer, but if you need extra airflow there are fans in the bedroom closet.
interaction: You'll have the entire place to yourself, but if you need anything, we're right around the corner. Just call or text and we'll be happy to help address whatever you may need! I work as a magazine journalist in the lifestyle beat and have put together a detailed neighborhood guide with tons of ideas of what to eat, drink and do. If you're looking for a specific recommendation, just shout.
host_about: I’m a dad of 2 crazy little boys and a husband to the most incredible woman I know. I love traveling, coffee that tastes like chocolate, robust porters, and fruit forward (not hazy) IPAs. Also, I recall a thing called sleep that I’m always trying to find.

neighborhood_overview: We LOVE our neighborhood, bordering Pilsen and Heart of Chicago, mixed with family homes, up and coming entrepreneurs, college students, artists, performers, and the like. We have record and book stores, gift and clothing shops, artist work spaces, and creative restaurants that have opened in Pilsen, all between our home and eastward to Halstead.  To our near West lie the Laganitas Brewing Company, the Cinespace, Chicago's film studio Thalia Hall has some great musical and comedic performers coming through. Some nearby eats: Parkview Diner on Damen & 19th St., they have the best Gorditas! Jumping Bean Coffee at the Damen Pink Line Stop brews a tasty cup and serves up tasty soups and sandwiches.  18th St. Bistro is budget friendly for breakfast and lunch. La Casa del Pueblo is our favorite grocery, they carry a lot of healthy items similar to what you can find in Whole Foods.   There is also a Costco and Jewel-Osco just north of us near Ashland&Roosevelt.
notes: There are about 6 stairs down and up to the sidewalk to enter the space.
transit: Just a 5 minute walk to Pink Line-South on Damen Ave. There is a Metra stop on Western Avenue, 5 blocks west of us. From O'hare Airport: take Blue Line to Damen, transfer to#50 bus to 18th Street stop. Walk west on 18th Street. From Midway Airport: take Orange Line to Archer, transfer to Bus #50, get out at 18th Street.  Walk west on 18th Street. From Union Station Amtrak, Megabus, or Greyhound Station, walk to the Blue Line Station on Clinton, transfer to the #50 Bus Bus #18 on 18th St. and Damen Ave. will take you downtown to transfer to the Red Line on State and Roosevelt.  The bus also goes out to the Museum Campus. Divvy Bikes are located all around the city, and there is an app to help you locate them.  There is a bike rental station on Cullerton.  on way to the train and also on 18th and Paulina near the train station.   Not too many taxis come by in the area, though they do have apps now like Curb.   If you are a first time user of Lyft or Uber, we have codes for free rides! PA
access: Private entrance.   TV with HDMI and USB  DvD player and VCR Roku with Netflix Kitchen Cookware Linens  Towels  Toiletries  Soaps
interaction: Feel free to contact us through the Airbnb messaging system.   In case of emergency, call or text phone number provided with itinerary.
house_rules: All persons must be included on reservation at time of booking.  We are registered with the city and want to make sure all guests are in the itinerary and accounted for. Let us know ahead of time what your ETA will be for CheckIn and for CheckOut.   No other guests for any length of time on the property. Turn off lights and unplug any unnecessary chargers when leaving. No smoking in the space or on the property.  We like to keep it smelling fresh for everyone
host_about: We have been hosts in the Pilsen neighborhood for over 5 years and enjoy everything about offering part of our home to give space for others' travels.  We live near the medical campus, museums, UIC campus, and are close to the Loop and McCormick conference center.

name: Walk2Wrigley/L trains from your luxury loft! (q5)
summary: Quiet, modern, industrial styled luxury loft with the best location in Wrigleyville! 1 block from the red line in the most sought-after neighborhood for young people to live. Wrigleyville is known for its overabundance of restaurants, bars, boutiques, and coffee shops abounding on every corner. Street festivals, theatres, concert halls, and comedy clubs are never far. This is the mythical neighborhood experience everyone on Airbnb talks about.
space: Flooded with natural light and ceilings that soar, the feeling is airy, spacious industrial luxury. This is a brand new building from the ground up!  Want advice? Looking for that local knowledge? We've got a guidebook telling you all the secrets! We're from Chicago. We live here. We know the place, and we have an opinion! GET READY! Freshen up in your brightly lit bathroom, featuring: - glass walled shower - amazing high-pressure shower-head - towels, body wash, shampoo, and conditioner provided for all guests GET COFFEE! Kick the morning into overdrive with a caffeine kick!  Choose from a wealth of coffee options and equipment:  - French press and drip machine - Ground AND whole bean coffee - sweeteners and half/half are all provided - Starbucks is also across the street! GET WORKING with smoking fast WiFi!  - Two dedicated signals per apartment!  - 100MBPS Service with a 1750MPBS Router.  - No more wimpy hotel WiFi! GET COOKING in your full kitchen!  All the amenities you'd expect f

neighborhood_overview: Clark and Belmont: the intersection of convenience and incredible city life!  The Chicago Cubs play in the heart of this residential neighborhood, bringing a vibrancy far beyond the tourist/business district downtown.. Chicago’s North Side is the most prosperous with the most things to do, and this neighborhood is it's beating heart. Wrigleyville might look like it’s off center from downtown, but it’s really in the middle of everything.  - Four blocks from Wrigley FIeld and the Chicago Cubs! Avoid game-day traffic and walk it - or take the train just one L stop!  - Around the corner from Boystown, Chicago's famed LGBTQ neighborhood! Ask us for suggestions, don't be shy! - Directly above Target - grocery runs couldn't be quicker - Leisurely walk to Lake Michigan and the beautiful Lakeshore Path Stay smack in the middle of the best bar scene on the north side! Sports bars, nightclubs, dance parties, karaoke - anything you want, Lakeview's got it. Perfect for a quick drink or last call.
notes: Unit may be accessed by maintenance for repairs during stays. We do not accept instant bookings from residents of the Chicago metropolitan area as identified by profile city or phone number area code. If you live near Chicago and would like to book a stay, please send us a message with a little more information about your plans. Immediately after booking, we will send you a few questions about your arrival time, contact info, number of guests/visitors, and to name our favorite restaurant, which is listed at the bottom of the house rules. Guests will not be allowed to check in without providing complete answers
transit: There's no need for a car here!  - Two minute walk from the single most convenient public transit spot in Chicago - the Belmont Red Line L station!  Front door to downtown in 18 minutes flat! Front door to Evanston in 20 minutes! (rush / express hours) - INSTANTLY get an Uber or Lyft! This neighborhood has no waiting. Take the CTA and go from front door to Chicago's...  FRIENDLY CONFINES - Cubs baseball, Wrigley Field: 6 min bus or L train,  or 11 min walk!  Just 1 L stop, 4 bus stops, or a half-mile walk through Wrigleyville! SELFIE SPOTS - Millennium Park, the Bean (Cloud Gate), Maggie Daley Park: 22 min - Sears Tower / Willis Tower (Skydeck Chicago): 25 min - Magnificent Mile / Michigan Avenue shopping, Hancock Center (360 Chicago), Water Tower: 22 min - Riverwalk: 18 min - Lake Michigan, Belmont Harbor: 12 min WORLD-CLASS CULTURAL INSTITUTIONS - Grant Park, Buckingham Fountain, Chicago Marathon start: 25 min - Art Institute of Chicago: 22 min - Museum Campus, Field Museum, Shedd Aq
access: The entire apartment is yours during your stay!  Book for one person or five, it doesn't matter - you WILL NOT share this apartment with anyone outside of your own group!  The roof deck, gym, and lobby are shared spaces - please be respectful of that.
interaction: We love our guests! We are available to our guests!  We text our guests most of what they need!  ...WE NEED A NUMBER TO REACH YOU AT!  Please confirm your phone number and email address upon booking. IF YOU WILL NOT HAVE A US PHONE NUMBER, please download the (Hidden by Airbnb) phone texting app! We also have (Hidden by Airbnb) - please provide your ID!
house_rules: 1) The entire property is smoke and vapor free. We have marijuana and tobacco chemical sensors on the property. They know it's not cooking smoke, They react to airborne particulate, not the smell on your clothes. The PolySens® technology works, so exit the building if you want to smoke/vape or you'll be fined $1000 and asked to leave. 2) Your reservation has paid for a specific number of guests on it. Anyone over this number, whether visiting or sleeping, you must have written permission from us. We have a hallway camera to verify. We're going to be totally fine with 95% of requests, but we do require you to clear it with us first. 3) Quiet hours are 10PM-8AM. Noise should not be heard coming from your apartment. This is a quiet residential building. 95% of our guests have no issues, and never hear from us. We will be sure to send you at least 2 warnings prior to asking anyone to leave, but one way or another, the apartment must be quiet. 4) Parties, events, and commercial activity are
host_about:
Rent Local Homes.  Real Homes; made for living with great kitchens, big living rooms, in awesome neighborhoods! We are Chicago locals with a passion for elevating the guest experience.

Everything you need is already stocked.  Cream and sweeteners for your coffee,  body wash and shampoo for the shower, and the right type of detergent for dishwashers and washing machines; we think of and stock ahead of time everything you need so you don’t have to.

A team of professionals are at your service before, during, and after your stay; we are always here if you have any questions.  Read our reviews.   Browse our photos.  Rent a local home with us.
