neighborhood_overview: Searching for that funky Uptown vibe? Just north of Downtown Chicago, the hip, tree-lined, brick building-filled Uptown neighborhood is where you go if you want a break from the craziness of the city. It’s located right on the water, and it’s just a 5-minute train ride to Wrigley Field (Go Cubs!).  If you’ll be heading Downtown during your stay, you’re only a 10-minute walk from the Wilson CTA station, which will get you into the city in 30 minutes. You’ll find cozy coffee shops, trendy restaurants, and even a Walgreens nearby. Need a little caffeine boost to start your Windy City morning? Everybody’s Coffee is a cheery neighborhood coffeehouse known for their sustainable crop-to-cup creations, tasty pastries, and staff smiles - and it’s just a 5-minute walk from our place. And don’t just take our word for it; this java joint was voted one of the five places to go in Chicago by The New York Times, received a shoutout from Conde Nast Traveler as one of the 14 best coffee shops in Chicag
notes: -Access to the unit is through an elevator to the 4th floor. -There are many units inside this building. -Please be aware If you lose the key and entry fob, which is your access to the entire building, it can not be replaced for you immediately and you may lose access to the apartment unit and all amenities until another one can be made.  There is a $300 fee for losing key and entry fob. There is limited street parking. I recommend using "spot hero" app and claim parking near by for your stay. You can access the whole city through the CTA train near by. -All guest need to be attentive with the house rules during their stay as there are other tenants at the property. -Bath towels are provided per number of guest not per number of stay -Washcloths are not provided during your stay. You may send me a message though if you need them and I'll try my best to accommodate your request. -We have duvet covers on our bedding  (no top sheets). -Security Deposit maybe required on the following book
transit: Walking, taking the train, and using rideshare services (Uber and Lyft) are our recommended modes of transport. Unless you like paying for overpriced parking garages! Wilson CTA train station is a nice 10-minute walk from our place. The train can then take you directly into downtown in just 30 minutes, which gives you plenty of time to browse the morning news while sipping on your latte. Or give your friends back home a serious case of FOMO by sharing some scenic Windy City shots. Limited street parking is available, but not reliable, so we don’t recommend renting a car. However, Uber and Lyft are always an option for those looking to ride in style and venture a little further around town.
access: Condo Access is through the front entrance or side door entrances. Guests will access to the condominium amenities such as fitness center, lobby, laundry, and court yard patio.
interaction: We are available by phone throughout your stay. You can simply call or text if you have any questions.
house_rules: HOUSE RULES Please review and adhere to the following to avoid penalties and/or cancellation of booking: -No Drugs; Do not engage in any ILLEGAL activities anywhere on the property; ONLY guests included on the reservation are permitted on the premises. Fines will be issued for breaking these rules (Fine $100-$250). -If you break or damage something, please let me know and arrange for its replacement or repair. - The cleaning fee outlined in the profile is included to clean the place after your stay, however, if you leave the place excessively dirty, we may charge up to $100 additionally for the extra work incurred. -Quiet hours must be observed between 10pm-8am. -Lost key fee - $300 -Unsalvageable stained linens - $15/pc. -Unsalvageable stained towels - $10/pc. -Smoking - $300 -Unauthorized bringing of pets - $300 **-No pets, except dogs & cats. If you have a dog or a cat,  an extra $50 pet cleaning fee will be added to your reservation.
host_about: Sonia & Syed are Chicago Natives. We can give you recommendations for food and fun! Mother to my beautiful baby Sofia

name: iKlektik House // Cardinal
summary: Fully furnished one bedroom in Ukrainian Village/West Town. Voted best top ten neighborhood in the United States. Close to Wicker Park, Ukrainian Village and Bucktown. The space is amazing...just read the reviews! There is FREE street parking.
space: This amazing space right in the heart of Ukrainian Village + West Town not far from Wicker Park. Large Kitchen with island, dishwasher, oven, microwave and all the kitchen stuff you need! The bathroom is large with a clawfoot tub. The bedroom has large french doors that separate rooms. The bed is a brand new memory foam mattress. There is also a trundle bed to accompany more guests. In the backyard are amazing japanese maples, a grill, and smoker. This is a common area for all guests. The neighborhood is very safe and close to shopping and tons of restaurants. This area is considered the most hip and trendy in Chicago. The metra is only 3 blocks away {8 minutes to downtown} and you can hop on the CTA Bus {Chicago and Grand} and go straight downtown. Divvy bikes on the corner of Chicago and Damen & Grand and Damen. Our place isn't called iKlektik House for nothing! We decorate with our artwork along with co-workers and friends. Definitely has a style of it's own.

notes: Free Street Parking out front!
transit: Metra, CTA {buses and trains} close by. Also, we love to Divvy bike it everywhere!
access: Keyless entry. We will send personal keycode and instructions on how to access the apartment a week prior to check in date. Private entrance. Full access to backyard with grill and smoker! Feel free to lounge in the hammock under the pergola.
interaction: We love interacting with our guests. Feel free to come to the backyard and have a drink with us!
house_rules: CLEANING FEE The cleaning fee is for linens and switch outs, NOT to do your DISHES! That attracts bugs + rodents so you are responsible for leaving the house clean and respectful. If you leave the house dirty/filthy you will be charged an extra fee. HOUSE RULES No Smoking or candles in any of our apartments. Quiet after 11pm weeknights and 12am weekends. No broken or damaged items. Only use the front entrance to enter the house. Side gate to get to the backyard. DO NOT use center stairwell and side door to backyard. Other than that, we are very chill landlords.
host_about:
Mindy // College Professor. Currently teach Animation + Motion Graphics {after effects}, Computer Graphics, Creative Collaboration & Materials and Resources. My husband and I love art, fashion, music and food.

Tony // Carpenter + Artist for many years. I have rebuilt, remodeled and out lot's of love into the iKlektik House. Camping and biking is my thing.

summary: Check in/out flexible, self check-in, luggage drop-off. Cleaned per CDC standards. 1st Responders welcome. Entire 800 sq ft apartment flat. Outdoor smoking on covered porch. space: You’ll let yourself in and have the entire apartment to yourself. We do not use the front entrance to our building at all while guests are present.  You can book up to 6 people. Our base rate is for single travelers only. Please be sure to input the correct number guests in the search tool, in order to populate an accurate nightly rate.  Contact us to request accommodations for a larger group, keeping in mind there is only one bathroom. The apartment and front entry are cleaned between guests following CDC protocol. Linens are washed with 7th generation detergent & bleach (double rinsed) in hot water, and dried on the sterilize setting. If you'll be booking through Airbnb as a 1st Responder, but your stay is NOT covered OR reimbursed by your employer or non-profit/gov agency, please contact us for a possible additional discount. neighborhood_overview: Classic Chicago residential neighborhood, situated in the heart of the north side, smack in-between O'Hare & Downtown. Stores and restaurants within walking distance are open late. Just 3 miles west of Wrigley Field and Boystown.
notes: CHECK-IN/OUT — Self check-in at/or after 3pm & check-out at/or before 11am. We'll try our best to accommodate your schedule, keeping in mind we are following a strict rule of 72 hours between guests. LUGGAGE DROP OFF — Please contact us in advance if you’d like to make arrangements to drop off your luggage early, or if you’ll like to leave it here for a few hours after check-out.  PARKING — If you’re parking when everyone’s home for the night, you may have to walk a couple blocks. Some of the surrounding blocks do require a neighborhood parking pass, be sure to check for signs. Keep in mind, Chicago side streets do have potholes and speed bumps, and they aren’t real easy to see at night. NOISE DISCLOSURE — For the most part, it’s pretty quiet here. However upon your arrival, our keeper of the house will bark loudly at the window near the front door, to let us know we have visitors. Rowan will stop barking once you make your way upstairs, out the door, or once you’ve settled on the porc
transit: — 3 blocks from I90/94 Kennedy/Edens Expressway at Addison.   — 6 minute walk to the Addison Blue Line Station (runs 24/7).  — 1.5 blks to Addison bus 152 (runs through 11pm) for access to Red & Brown trains — 2.5 blks to Irving Park 80 (runs 24/7) for access to Red & Brown trains. — 15 minute drive (during non-rush hour) to O'Hare or Downtown — 20 min Blue Line train (barring delays) to O'Hare or Downtown.  — (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) min to Wrigleyville & Lakeview, straight shot via Addison or Irving bus. — 6 min drive to free Cubs park & ride shuttle bus for evening & weekend games — 20 min drive non-rush hour or 20 min Blue Line train to Rosemont, barring delays. — Uber & Lyft are plentiful  — Free street parking Drivers should know that Chicago is loaded with speed traps and red-light camera's that are over sensitive. Do not speed down Irving Park Rd. Do not even let your bumper get within 12 inches of the white line. Once you stop at a light, do not let your car move even o
access: ACCESS AREAS — You will have access to your apartment, front entryway hall & staircase, covered front porch.
interaction: We occupy the downstairs & attic apartments. Due to COVID-19, we use the back entrance exclusively, while our guests use the front entryway. Don’t hesitate to message us if you need help with anything or navigating the city.
house_rules: -Due to COVID-19, prior to check-out, all guests must strip the bedding they used and place it, along with their used towels, in the provided bags with cord synced tight. This is a step we are taking in order to safely sterilize our linens. Failure to do so will result in an additional $100 cleaning fee. -Parties: No parties, high decibel music, and/or extreme partying allowed. Ticketed and/or public events are not allowed and will result in immediate cancellation without refund. -Noise: We are pretty laid back, we book groups so we don't expect complete silence. You can come and go at any time of the night or day, you can play music at a reasonable level, doesn't bother us. However, this is a multi-unit in a residential neighborhood with only a few feet between properties. Please respect our neighbors and take it down a notch after 10 pm, especially out on the porch. -Groups: Whoever places the booking should ensure everyone in his/her party reads the rules and house manual.  -Minors:
host_about: I'm a native Chicagoan, retired Fire Department Paramedic. I live with my two young adult daughters, who are students.

name: ENTIRE BUILDING - Walk to Wrigley - SLEEPS 26!
summary: We are the only short term rental in Chicago that can offer accommodations for up to 26!  When renting this building, you will get 3 separate apartments all in 1 building!  That means, 3 full kitchens, 3 laundry rooms, 5 bedrooms AND 5 Baths! This place was FULLY remodeled in 2016 for one purpose - to host AirBnb guests like yourself!  It is designed with you in mind!  We don't just rent our place out when it's convenient.
space: We know Chicago and we know what you want!  Location was the #1 factor in our decision to purchase this property  so that we could provide our guests the best experience possible! We knocked down and redesigned the kitchen with granite counter tops, stainless steel appliances, brand new cookware, dishes, silverware etc.  We also gut rehabbed both bathrooms, installing high end granite and tile surround in the tub/showers.  We left nothing un-turned. BRAND NEW beds and mattress's (and of course linens) BRAND NEW leather couches (pull out queen size sofa sleepers), kitchen table, TV etc.  You name it, it's new! neighborhood_overview: You will be staying in the famous Lincoln Park neighborhood which is the hottest neighborhood in Chicago right now and for good reason.   It's bustling with business which means there are literally over 100 bars, restaurants, breakfast spots, coffee shops, pizza joints (Chicago knows it's pizza) and late night places to grub all RIGHT OUTSIDE YOUR DOOR!   Want to catch a Cubs game or checkout famous Wrigleyville?  We're less than 1 mile away! Lake Michigan and the famous Lincoln Park Zoo (which is FREE) are less than 1 mile away!
notes: FREE STREET PARKING.  Your stay will be a true Chicago experience at Lincoln Park Living.  The condo is filled with information about Chicago to ensure you get the most out of your stay.  The Chicago decor makes this rental perfect for that true Chicago experience. We also rent the apartments out individually if you need less room.  Ask us for details. Questions?  Contact us!  We pride ourselves with our response time!
transit: You'll have access to all of Chicago with the Brown Line EL (train system) stop less than 1 block away and it only costs $2.25! If Uber is your thing, you're not far from anything in the city so most rides are less than $10.
interaction: We have a full time property manager who will be available to help answer any questions you may have during your stay!
house_rules: 1. Checkout is 11 am 2. Check in is 4 pm 3. NO SMOKING MARIJUANA. NO SMOKING CIGARETTES. NO SMOKING PERIOD! If there is a smell of any kind of smoke in the property, deodorizing fees START at $500 and will be charged back to the guest. If you smoke, go outside. WE ARE VERY SERIOUS ABOUT THIS 4. If we receive a noise complaint we will warn you once then call the police 5. The Nest thermostats are locked so that they cannot be adjusted outside the range of 68 – 78 degrees in the Summer and 60 – 72 degrees in the Winter. To adjust the temperature in these ranges, simply turn the thermostat to the left or right to find your desired temperature. The locked screen will only appear if you happen to push on any portion of the face of the thermostat. 6. There may be candles in the suite but they are for decoration only. Do not light them. 7. Maximum occupancy is the number of guests you indicated on your reservation. If it is found that there are more guests than indicated on the reservation, y

name: Garden Apartment in Nice Neighborhood
summary: This is a cozy space in the truly great, fun, friendly, relaxed Lincoln Square neighborhood. Many cafes, vast assortment of restaurants and shops in walking distance. Downtown is just a train ride away on the Montrose stop of the brown line El. Two miles from Lake Michigan. Free and generally easy street parking.
space: Our goal was to create a cozy, inviting space for our guests. Michelle is a fine artist and has lots of fun decorating this apartment. She is always on the lookout for more items to add. The vintage bedroom set was gifted to us from her mother. She used that as a starting point in decorating the bedroom and added one of her own large industrial photographs to give an Old Chicago industrial feeling. Likewise the cowboy corner started with the wagon wheel bed that Thomas had as a child (note* both beds have new mattresses!*) We continually work on the Chicago-themed art in the kitchen and living room area.

Guests may use key or lock box with code for apartment access. Private en
neighborhood_overview: So many things are walking distance from us! Shops, groceries, public transportation, parks, a public pool, Divvy bike rental, car rental, a library, amazing and diverse restaurants. Even a movie theater. There are always new businesses opening up in the neighborhood, check with us for the latest hot spots.
notes: This is a friendly, quiet neighborhood full of families and fun stuff to do. Parking is almost always available right in front of the house. We'd love to have you as our guest!
transit: There are 3 brown line El stops nearby. All are about a 5-10 minute walk away (depends how fast you walk!) These are the nearby stops: Western, Montrose, Irving Park. There are several Divvy bicycle rental stations very close by. Also, Enterprise and Zip Cars. But if you love to walk, this neighborhood is a good fit for you!
access: Guests may use key or lock box with code for apartment access. Private entrance. You do not have to go through our living space to access this apartment.
interaction: We are a family living above the garden apartment, you WILL hear us living our lives above you during your stay. We have lived in the neighborhood for more than 20 years and will be more than happy to help with directions and sight-seeing recommendations!  We screen guests out of respect to our neighbors and because *we live here*. Please don’t be offended if we ask a few questions before approving your request.  We do not accept 2nd party reservations. You have to book your own reservation, no exceptions, please.
house_rules: No pets. No smoking. No parties. No additional overnight guests without approval.

name: The Biddle House (#2)
summary: The Biddle House is located in Historic Old Town on a lovely tree-lined street, walking distance to many wonderful restaurants, shops and the lakefront.  Features one queen bed in each bedroom and twin sleeper sofa, plus a single jacuzzi hot tub and shower.
space: The Biddle House is located in historic Old Town on a quiet tree-lined street, walking distance to wonderful restaurants, shops and the lakefront.  Public transportation is a breeze from here - get downtown in 10 minutes on Chicago's famous El train (brown line)! You'll be a short walk from the Sedgwick Brown Line stop.  The second floor apartment has two bedrooms, one bathroom, a fully equipped kitchen, dining room and living room. Continental breakfast fixings are provided. The units here get great natural light as well!  The apartment includes high-speed internet (wi-fi), cable tv, private phone lines, and complimentary washer and dryer in the building. Apartment features one queen size bed in each bedroom and a twin size sleeper sofa in the living room. There is a single Jacuzzi tub and shower in the bathroom.  Max occupancy is 5. Closest major intersection is North Avenue and Sedgwick Street. You'll be a short walk from the Lincoln Park Zoo, Chicago History Museum, world-famous Se

Apartment features one queen size bed in each bedroom and a twin size sleeper
neighborhood_overview: Old Town is the Historic District of Chicago. The neighborhood is beyond charming, located just north of the Gold Coast, filled with countless restaurants and boutiques, walking distance to the History Museum, Michigan Ave (15 min walk), DePaul University, Armitage Street and the Lincoln Park Zoo! A wonderful location to experience Chicago!
notes: 2-4 Night Minimum based on Season. License # (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) Parking permits provided to park on street for free - must request in advance, prior to arrival.
transit: The Brown Line "L" is just 3 blocks away and takes you downtown in 10-15 minutes! Several Bus stops are near by as well.
host_about:
Hi, we're Bob and Liz Biddle, long time Chicagoans and your hosts. We started At Home Inn Chicago in 2000 as a reservation service for bed and breakfasts in Chicago, and have since evolved into one of the city's most-respected sources for vacation rentals, corporate housing, and weekend getaways. 

We provide fully furnished vacation rentals and corporate housing throughout the city in or near Old Town and Lincoln Park.

We are here to answer all of your questions about Chicago, whether you need a restaurant recommendation, public transit tips, or insider tips on how to experience the Chicago that locals know and love. 

We love this city, especially getting ribs at Twin Anchors in Old Town before a show at Second City.  Topo Gigio is a great local Italian Restaurant and The Gemini Bistro is an excellent choice for fine dining. And Velvet Taco, casual with its own unique style on Lincoln is fabulous!

The free concerts at Pritzker Pavilion in Millenium Park can't be matched by any city in the world. 

We'd love to help you experience all of this with us and so much more!

name: Petit Sleeping Nook 10 min walk from Wrigley
summary: Come, drop off your bag and explore Chicago! We have a small sleeping nook that we'd like for you to enjoy. It's off the family room just enough for a futon that sleeps two (fair warning, the nook does not have a door). We're located in the Lakeview/Wrigleyville neighborhood so you can walk anywhere ( Wrigely Field, Lake Michigan, Boystown) or take the super close Belmont (red/brown lines) train, it's literally across the street, meaning you're downtown in 15 mins.
space: The cozy nook sleeps two on a comfy futon. The space does not have a door and is off of the family room, which of course you'll have access to. We'll respect your privacy while you're here and avoid the family room. The apartment is located just near the Belmont red and brown lines, meaning you can get to where you need to go in jiffy, BUT you will hear the train pass by, so if you are a light sleeper, this may not be the place for you.

You'll be sharing the apartment with my husband and I who are very sociable and outgoing.
neighborhood_overview: (Website hidden by Airbnb)
notes: Street parking is generally available (first come, first serve), and free with our guest pass (renewable 24 hour pass). Just let us know before hand if you need one! To re-emphasize:  the nook has room for a bed and a night stand and does not have a door. Also, the train tracks are across the street so there is noise 24/7. If you are a light sleeper, this is NOT the place for you.
transit: Street parking is generally available, and free with our guest pass (renewable 24 hour pass). Just let us know before hand if you need one!
access: You'll be sharing the apartment with my husband and I who are very sociable and outgoing. We moved to Chicago from Paris, France in 2016 and miss meeting travelers! We have a small sleeping space that we'd love to rent out to explorers coming to enjoy Chicago. Our space is ideal for short stays, a backpacker wanting to store his/her luggage or for that weekend trip to the city so that you can catch a Cubs game or concert at Wrigley (10 mins walk!!). You'll have access to the bathroom, family room, dining room and kitchen all of which will be shared with my husband.
interaction: We'll do our best to provide you with necessary information to optimize your stay. Feel free to ask all the questions you have.
house_rules: Should not bring any additional guests other than those listed on reservation
host_about:
Hi! 

Formally known as Parisians, we are back to my Midwestern roots in Chicago. We loved our time as Air BNB stayers and would like to share our space with those wishing to explore the windy city. Come see how awesome Chicago is!

See you soon,

Mehdi and Jackie

space: Chicago Registration: PendingPlease note that we do not allow bookings from residents of Chicago. neighborhood_overview: Lincoln Park is the most beautiful neighborhood in Chicago! You will absolutely LOVE the amount of green surrounding you. And you are never far away from the Loop either!  The bar scene nearby is cheap and fun as well! The lake is a very short walk away!  7/11 and Dunkin Donuts are a 30 second walk from my doorstep.  Rental bikes are a super short walk away too.
notes: Please let me know beforehand when you’d like to check in
transit: There is available free street parking on Fullerton and Lincoln which are both very, very nearby.  There’s also a bus that runs on Clark St that will take you north and south quickly and easily!
interaction: I’m available quickly by text, call and oftentimes I’m nearby! :)
house_rules: Most important rule: turn off AC or heat when you check out. Save energy, save the environment please :)  Also, do not go into the closet or cabinets. I live here and those are my personal belongings. Thanks! Late check out is a fee of $40.  Luggage holding is $20. If you do not put the keys in the lockbox it is a fee of $50!!!
host_about:
I am a photographer!
I love traveling and use airbnb very often
